title: HIGH COURT IN JERSEY CURBS RACIAL QUOTAS
description: TRENTON, Nov.30 The New Jersey Supreme Court ruled today that the state and local governments were not obliged to overcome past racial discrimination by setting up racial quotas in hiring.

title: Wilma Lord Perkins Dead at 79; Editor of Cookbook for 45 Years
description: ROCHESTER, Nov. 30Wilma Lord Perkins, former editor of the Fannie Farmer Cookbook for 45 y ears, died here yesterday at the age of 79.

title: Federal Loans Totaling $3.4 Million Are Granted To 4 New York City Concerns Affected by Imports
description: Federal loans totaling $3.48 million to four New York City manufacturers who have been hurt by imports were announced yesterday by Mayor Beanie and by John Eden, Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Economic Development.

title: for Food Lovers
description: FEW Christmas gifts bear so personal and generous a message as food; few say so directly that the donor strives to provide pleasure and delight for the recipient. That old Victorian sentiment Love the giver, expressed traditionally on the tiny, porcelain Battersea boxes, is perhaps even better stated with a delectable morsel meant solely to delight the receiver. To express such sentiment, the food given must be the best available. which does not necessarily mean an astronomical price tag.

title: Leader of Carter's Budget Team Called Brilliant in Varying Ways
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 Ask different people who have known him to describe W. Bowman Cutter and the word brilliant appears in every answer: Brilliant and charming, brilliant and likable, brilliant and very, very, smooth, brilliant and cocky, brilliant and a little too much of the young  man  in  a  hurry are typical replies.

title: Music: Plucking Strings
description: Hear America First opened its 197677 season in the chapel of the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church on Monday night with a program entitled The Plucked String. The strings that were plucked during the evening were those of piano, harpsichord, harp, guitar and banjo.

title: Wine Talk
description: This is the silly season in the wine world, the time of the beaujolais nouveau. This is bland new wine, wine of the 1976 vintage, only partly fermented and packed off to the winedrinking capitals of the world within hours of the deadline imposed by the French Government for its releasemidnight, Nov. 15.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: Approval of a $600 million ethylene plant at Corpus Christi. Tex., was announced yesterday by the Union Pacific Corporation, Imperial Chemical Industries of Britain and Solvay of Belgium.

title: Indonesian Sates With Pepper Relish
description: (Place in electric blender at medium speed until finally chopped.)

title: Train Derails in West Virginia
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP) An Amtrak passenger train bound for Chicago derailed at Seweil. W. Va., early today, but there were no serious injuries, an Amtrak represcntztive said. One of the 84 passengers suffered a minor injury as all si:: cars of the train. No. 51. the .1nmes Whitcomb Riley. from Washington. left the rails, but remained upright. she said.

title: No Shift in Chinese Foreign Policy Is Seen as a Result of Peking Purge
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 30Analysts here do not believe that the reported political difficulties of China's Foreign Minister, Chiao Kuanhua, and the recall of six ambassadors in the last few days portend significant changes in foreign policy.

title: Prof. Martha Wolf enstein Is Dead; A Specialist in Child Psychology
description: Dr Martha Wolfenstein, a professor of psychiatry at the Yeshiva University Albert Einstein College of Medicine and a specialist in child psychology, died yesterday at Mount Sinai Hospital. She was 65 years old and lived at 333 Central Park West.

title: F.E.A. OPPOSES EXPORTING OF ALASKAN OIL TO JAPAN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30The Federal Energy Administration suggested today that exporting to Japan crude oil produced on the North Slope of Alaska might increase the likelihood of politically motivated production cutbacks by Arab oil states, cutbacks aimed at the United States.

title: A SENIOR KOREAN SPY DEFECTS AND ASSISTS IN FEDERAL INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30A senior officer of the Korean Central Intelligence Agency here has defied orders to return home and is voluntarily cooperating with a Federal investigation into alleged Korean bribery of members of Congress, Government investigators said today.

title: TV: Passel of Comedy
description: THE MUSICALVARIETY special has grown noticeably tired in recent years, but occasionally an hour comes along to revitalize the format for at least another season. CBS has that kind of hour at 10 o'clock this evening. Starring an 80yearold master of every trick in show business, it is called The George Burns Special.

title: . . . The Federal Role
description: New York's latest fiscal crisis could not have struck at a less opportune time. Immobilization in Washington caused by the change in Administrations compels the city to fall back on its own overburdened resources to meet an unforeseen $1 billion obligation that would be staggering in the best of times.

title: Klein to Head Times Magazine
description: The appointment of Edward Klein as editor of The New York Times Magazine was announced yesterday by A. M. Rosenthal, managing editor. Mr. Klein, an assistant managing editor of Newsweek magazine, will join The Times around the beginning of the year.

title: Angry Steel Buyer Says Prices Ae Going Upina Weak Market
description: PITTSBURGH. Nov. 30The market has never been worse and they're raising prices! The angry comment of a large steel buyer referred to the steel industry's 6 percent price increase on flat roll products effective tomorrow.

title: Dividends
description: Pe$tk. of Pay

title: Theater: Werzr Salutes Zionist
description: THE STORY of Theodor Herzl, the father of Zionism, is one of the most inspiring of its time. Here was a man fighting against incredible opposition to create a Jewish state. A play on this remarkable man opened at the Palace Theater last night. Called simply Herzl. It is by Dore Schary and Amos Elon, and is based on the latter's splendid and moving biography of this modern Moses.

title: Top Eastern Ranking Goes To Seewagen
description: Butch Seewagen, the 30yearold Columbia coach who stays in competition despite a potentially crippling hip ailment, and Lindsey Beaven, a Priton who found a new home here, have been ranked No. 1 for 1977 by the Eastern Tennis Association.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Six men were arrested yesterday by Federal authorities who seized $5 million in counterfeit bills in what officials said was the largest such seizure in the state's history. The defendants Were identified as Andrew Belotti, 28, a West New York policeman; Joseph Cioppi, 53, a private detective from Union City; John Provitera, 42, of Little Ferry; his brother, Henry, of Fairview Joseph E. Evans Jr., 53, of Garfield, and Lynn. R. Ferraro, 25, of West Mliford.

title: F.P.C. Approves Rise In Natural Gas Price
description: The Federal Power Commission announced late yesterday that higher natural gas prices, tentatively approved more than a month ago, could go into effect today. The F.P.C. delayed its final decision until it was convinced by filings by gas producers that the increases would stay within estimates.

title: CANADIAN DOLLAR DECLINES SHARPLY
description: OTTAWA. Nov. 30  Americans in Canada, accustomed to losing a few cents cry dollar exchanged for Canadian money, or used for purchases in a Canadian shop, are now getting some of the money hack at bank windows when they cash checks on accounts at home.

title: Secret Funds for Beame Campaign Reported Tied to Promise of Favor
description: A prominent realestate developer was promised a lucrative building project in exchange for secret contributions to the 1973 mayoral campaign of Abraham D. Beame, according to sources close to the participants in the matter.

title: Woman,85,Attacked In Midtown Hotel; Youth Is Arrested
description: The attempted rape and robbery of an 85yearold woman in her midtown hotel room last night resulted in the arrest of a 20yearold man who was seized by the police in a Times Square bar about an hour after the attack.

title: Treasury's 4Year 1Month Notes Carry 5.91% Rate
description: The Treasury sold $2.5 billion of fouryear onemonth notes yesterday at an average interest rate of 5.91 percent, the lowest rate it has paid on such securities since it began offering them to investors on a regular quarterly basis in July 1975. At the end of September, by contrast, fouryear notes were sold at a rate of 6.93 percent and in June at 7.63 percent. The decline in the Treasury's borrowing cost reflected the strong advance in the credit markets during October and November an advance that pushed most bond prices to their highest levels and interest rates to their lowest levels in several years.

title: How to Help Victims Of the Turkish Quake
description: Three agencies have appealed for relief supplies and funds to help the homeless survivors of the recent Turkish earthquake.

title: Card of Thanks
description: FODORYour kind exoression of sympathy was deeply appreciated and ?? greetfully acknowledged by the family of George T. Fodor.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Festive Chinatown Is a Place of Terror To the Merchants Who Offend Gangs
description: They said, One of our brothers is in jail. Would you like to make a donation towards his bail? I  gave them $25.

title: CASEWORKER, 46, IS SLAIN, APPARENTLY BY ROBBERS
description: A 46yearold caseworker for the Department of Social Services was found shot to death in his West Side apartment yesterday morning. according to the police, who said the victim had apparently been slain during a robbery of the apartment, which had been ransacked.

title: Cubs Dismiss Lockman From 2 Executive Posts
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 30 (AP) Whitey Lockman was relieved of all his duties today as vice president and director of player development by the Chicago Cubs.

title: What It's All About: Money
description: It didn't take the New York Yankees long to pierce the strangest myth on the longgreen sports scenethat, given their choice, ballplayers would not necessarily rush toward the money.

title: Columbia Routs C.C.N.Y. With Sophomores, 10075
description: A fuzzycheeked Columbia team that features seven sophomores made good on some of its promises to pull the Lions out of their recent basketball adversity with a 10075 triumph over City College last night at the winners Levien Gym.

title: NBC Halts Serial, Quiz Shows
description: NBCTV has canceled the longrunning daytime serial, Somerset, and will replace it on Jan. 3 with a new soap opera, Lovers and Friends. Somerset went on the air in 1970 as a spinoff of another NBC daytime drama. Another World.

title: Officer Indicted on Murder Charge In Shooting of a Brooklyn Boy, 15
description: A police officer who had never fired his gun on duty in eight years on the force and who officials said had shown no behavioral problems was indicted yesterday on a seconddegree murder charge : in the shooting of a 15yearold Brooklyn boy on Thanksgiving night.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Pound and Gold Gain
description: LONDON, Nov. 30 (AP)  The pound gained slightly against the dollar today. It closed at $1.6532 against yesterday's L losing price of $1.6477. Elsewhere in Europe the dollar had a mixed day.

title: Complaints About Unheated Homes May Go Unheeded
description: New York City housing officials warned yesterday that in any sustained cold spell this winter the city would be even less able than in past years to respond effectively to tenant complaints of lack of heat or other housing emergencies.

title: Music: Kupferman's Friends
description: The indefatigable Meyer Kupferman, a clarinetist who teaches at Sarah Lawrence College and who gives annual recitals, here, took on an even more marathon task than usual Monday night in Carnegie Recital Hall.

title: Article 1  No Title
Private Lives
description: SHE IS 10 years old. She has just asked: What do you want for Christmas? What you want for Christmas, of course, is that she remain 10 years old, forever, with her skin the color of clean sand and her fierce willthe ticking of the blue vein at her temple as though the brain were an alarm clock; her avidity and her perfect assurance that the people in the next room, the tall strangers, will find her of compelling interest; her sense of justice and the way she opens cans of soup. Or, if she insists on growing up, you want her to be a marine biologist or President of the United States.

title: Article 3  No Title
Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Yanks Buy Wynn, RightHanded Slugger
description: For the third time in the last two weeks. the Yankees reaffirmed their belief in the freeenterprise system yesterday. this time by purchasing Jim Wyna fron, the Atlanta Braves for about $110000.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Reactions to Rabin's Proposal on Talks Cheer Israel
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 30A number of Israeli officials are surprised and pleased by the impact and publicity accorded Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin's recent proposal for a Geneva conference on the Middle East since, in their view, hr was not breaking any new ground in the ArabIsraeli impasse. Their pleasure derives from the fact that Mr. Rabin was able simultaneously to appear statesmanlike and to score a few points for Israel in the new round of moves initiated by the Arabs aimed at convincing the international community that they are softening their opposition to Israel in eagerness to renew negotiations for a settlement.

title: OSCAR GAST
description: Oscar Gast, a retired Long Island hanker, died Monday at Fort Lauderdale (Fla.) Hospital. He was 76 years old and A resident of Pompano Beach. Fla.

title: Best Buys Lawrence Van Gelder
description: PALATES sated with turkey might be revived this week with a gambol in lamb by market investors who can accept the theory of relativity in bargains.

title: Spain's Expatriates Are Having a Voice In Key Referendum
description: MADRID, Nov. 30Spaniard n began voting yesterdayin Rome, Brussels, Liverpool, Paris and Fernando Po, among other places. The polls open today in New York and Washington, D.C.

title: Farm Products Fall
description: Prices for raw farm products fell 3 percent in the month ended Nov. 15, indicating that retail food prices will be stable this winter, according to the Agriculture Department. Page D11.

title: BIG MANUFACTURERS CUT APPROPRIATIONS ON CAPITAL OUTLAYS
description: Capital appropriations by the nation's 1,000 largest manufacturers fell sharply in the third quarter from the previous three months, according to a survey by The Conference Board.

title: Gilmore Wins Plea for Execution; Pardons Board Orders Date Set
description: DRAPER, Utah, Nov. 30The Utah Board of Pardons today granted Gary Mark Gilmore's plea that he be executed.

title: Article 2  No Title
Chow Gai Kow; (StirFried Chicken With Chinese Vegetables)
description: Eileen YinFei Lo teaches Chinese cooking in her home in Montclair, N. J., and often writes on the subject. Here are two recipes from her class, which demonstrate the versatility of the wok as both a fryer and a steamer. The first, Chow Gai Kow, stirfried chicken with Chinese vegetables, is unusual because the chicken must be scored, in order that it curl up upon cooking. Thus its name, Chow Gai Kow, which means literally stirfried chicken balls. The second, for steamed striped bass, is unusual tor its lastminute addition of boiled peanut oil as a traditional Chinese gesture of welcome and to give the cooked fish an unusually fine aroma. Boiling the oil changes its texture and aroma.

title: Talks on 6% Rise AskedEconomists Will Brief Georgian Tomorrow
description: PLAINS, Ga., Nov. 30 (AP)The president of a major steel company proposed toaay that industry leaders meet with Presidentelect Jimmy Carter to discuss recent steel price increases.

title: SovietChinese Talk On Border Resuming
Notes on People
description: ANATHANIEL HAWTHORNE scholar at Brown University is the proud custodian of a prime piece of Hawthornianathe writer's earliestknown manuscript notebook, lost for more than 100 years  after publication of excepts from it in 1866. Professor Hyatt H. Waggoner recently authenticated what he calls The Lost Notebook, 1835 to 1841, for Barbara Mouffe, of Boulder, Colo.

title: About Real Estate
description: The only undeveloped land in New York City owned by the Starrett Housing Corporation is a parking lot that occupies the entire west blockfront on Eighth Avenue between 53d and 54th Streets.

title: Yuk See Jing Far Ban (Steamed Striped Bass)
description: 2pound whole striped bass, intestines and extra fat removed. washed inside and out and dried well

title: Visit to China's Forces: Big but Poor in New Arms
description: PEKINGThe infantry trotted to their positions chanting Be on the alert and Defend the motherland. They loosed rounds from their recoilless rifles and mortars at targets on the bleak hillside.

title: Adm. Armin Zimmermann, Chief Of Bonn's Forces, Is Dead at 58
description: BONN, Nov. 30 (AP)Adm. Armin Zimmermann, commander of the West German armed forces, died in a Bonn hospital today after a long illness, the Defense Ministry announced.

title: Suspect Guilty in Scuffling
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 30 (AP)A recording technician who scuffled with Secret Service agents guarding Betty Ford here last Oct. 20 has pleaded guilty to a charge of interfering with a Federal officer. United States District Court Judge William P. Gray .sentenced Steven Barker, 26 years;old, to 10 days probation yesterday on the misdemeanor charge.

title: Article 5  No Title
D'Amboise Crusades to Drive Sissy Stigma From Ballet
description: Penknives and battered bookbags are stowed on top of the piano. A teenage drummer beats an experimental flourish on the snare drums. And lined up against the wall, seven young men and their ebullient adult leader crouch poised for action like runners before a sprint. Suddenly they're off. weaving. strutting and jumping through an intricate jazz dance routin. Another opening salvo has been fired in Jacques d'Amboise's oneman baffle to bring dance to boys.

title: 3 Armed Youths Shot By RecordStore Owner In North Bronx Holdup
description: Three armed Manhattan youths tried to rob a record store in the northern Bronx last night but were shot by the owner of the store, the police reported. One of the youths, an 18yearold, was critically wounded.

title: Loudspeakers Create a Hubbub As Japanese Election Nears
description: TOKUSHIMA, JapanThis city is full of noises these days. There is the rhythmic cadence of group calisthenics in the park at dawn. There is the friendly toot of passenger trains leaving the station every few minutes. And there is the soft rustle of brightly colored leaves blowing across the sandy sidewalks on some brisk Pacific breeze.

title: St. John's 58, Davidson 57
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Nov. 30 (AP) Cecil Rellford scored 19 points and got 18point help from Glen Williams tonight as St. John's beat Davidson, 5857, the Redmen's third victory in three games. Davidson suffered its first loss in two starts.

title: Around the Nation
description: LOS ANGELES. Nov. 30 (UPI)Three cousins of Howard R Hughes want a judge to declare two reputed adopted children of the late billionaire's uncle ineligible to inherit any of his $2.5 billion estate

title: Csonka Already Missed by Teammates
description: PLEASANTVILLE,N.Y., Nov. 30Larry Csonka wasn't at the Giants training camp today. He was down in Manhattan at the Hospital for Special Surgery, wishing Dr. John Marshall good luck and fix her up good, will you, before undergoing an operation on his left knee. Dr. Marshall, the team physician and director of sports medicine at the hospital, said the operation was a technically excellent repair to Csonka's medial collateral and anterior cruciate ligaments, which were torn in Sunday's 2816 victory over the Seattle Seahawks.

title: December
description: The arrival of December means the definite end to autumn. Even the leafrustle of the November wind whisking October's brilliance along the country road is muted as the leaves settle down. The early clamor of crows no longer starts the day, and the jays go about their business for the most part in blue silence. The chickadee is the most vocal bird in the dooryard, and his brief song is interrupted by the taptaptap of his beak as he cracks a sunflower seed. In the country house, the flybuzz and waspflutter in the attic have quieted down, the insects dead or dormant.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Federal judge in Brooklyn reserved decision after a hearing on charges that traud had been so pervasive in the Nov. 2 Presidential election in New York State that a new election should be held. But Jacob Mishler indicated strongly that the plaintiffs would have to prove that fraud involved more than 280,000 voles, the margin by which Jimmy Carter defeated President Ford in the state. In answering the complaint, Edward R. Patrick. counsel for the State Board of Elections, said that even if there had been fraud, it had not been so widespread as to have affected the outcome. The court action was brought by the United States Labor Party. the Rockland County Conservative Party and several individual Ford supporters.

title: Public Affairs Groups, Now on the Outside, Expect Access to Power Under Carter
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 The Presidency of Jimmy Carter is expected to present new opportunities as well as potential problems for the public affairs lobbies, law firms and research groups that are dedicated to countering the influence on the Government of the established special interests.

title: United Parcel Strike Besets Shoppers, Stores and Post Office
description: At a formerly empty pier at Houston Street and the Hudson River, hundreds of temporary postal employees are pushing hand trucks amid an avalanche of packages that has descended on the Postal Service because of the 10.weekold strike against United Parcel Service in 15 states.

title: A Guide to Becoming WokWise
description: The Chinese have been cooking with it for at least a thousand years, but it's never been what could be classified as a fad over there. It hasn't been in America nearly that long but already it's a passion.

title: My Style In Food
description: IHOPE the above heading does not catch the eye of any intimate friends of mine, because they won't be able to focus on this opening sentence for the simple reason they will be shaking with laughter. It will be like chancing upon a magazine piece headed My Sex Style, by John Knox.

title: A Student, Arrested in Yonkers, Faces Rape and Sodomy Charges
description: YONKERS, Nov. 30 Alexander Verrone. a 27yearold student of nursing, Was charged by the Yonkers police tonight with rape and sodomy in connection with a series of sexual assaults on young girls that had caused great alarm among Westchester parents.

title: BREZHNEV APPEALS TO CARTER TO PUSH STALLED ARMS PACT
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 30 Leonid I. Brezhnev today publicly called on the incoming Carter Administration to join in pushing through the stalled SovietAmerican strategic arms accord.

title: Amid Bounty, Longing
description: My father, like most Armenian survivors of the Turkish genocide, was a man who never wanted to leave home. Until he was forced to flee, he loved the place where he had been born and brought up. It was a milieu alien to the American mentality, and as a result my father never really adapted to the customs of this country. As I look back upon his memory, more in sadness than in the anger I used to feel flaring so often in his presence, I think that his life was about the damage done to the human spirit by exile.

title: Music: Phoebe Snow's Rapport
description: Phoebe Snow's artistry, as it was projected in her concert at Carnegie Hall on Monday evening, was not just a matter of the songs she sang and the way she sang them. Many of the songs were from her latest album, It Looks Like Phoebe Snow, most of them written by Miss Snow. Others came from such sources as Billie Holiday. Memphis Minnie and the Beatles.

title: Market Place
description: Despite the stock market's uneven course most of this year, there are a lot of happy faces in Wall Street and among investors.

title: Game: Glorious Without Being Gamey
description: Game, be it winged or fourlegged, furred or feathered, certainly ranks high (no pun or puns intended) on the list of the most coveted dishes of the late autumn and winter table. It is in league with fresh oysters, fresh foie gras and new beaujolaissomething to titillate and glorify the palate.

title: PROF. JONAH BLUSTAIN
description: Dr. Jonah Blustain, professor of socialstudies education at New York University, died Sunday at the Veterans Administration Hospital, in Manhattan. He was 58 years old and lived at 100 Bleecker Street.

title: Three Adults and Two Children Perish In Three Fires in Brooklyn and Queens
description: There adults and two children died yesterday in three fires in Brooklyn and ?? two of which were believed to ???? of suspicious origin.

title: Spain's Foreign Debt Rise Is Worrying Businessmen
description: MADRID, Nov. 30Spain's foreign debt is growing at a worrisome rate, with businessmen and bankers convinced that the situation will not markedly improve until, on present schedule, a Popularly elected government takes office next summer.

title: UNESCO Meetings End With Tributes To Quiet Progress
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Nov. 30The five., week UNESCO conference ended today with repeated hymns to the amity and accord that a succession of speakers referred to as the spirit of Nairobi.

title: Sunshine Boys May Be TV Series
description: The Sunshine Boys, Neil Simon's stage play that became a hit movie in which George Burns won an Academy Award as the best supporting actor in I975is being developed as a possible NBC television comedy series.

title: Technology
description: Four advanced types of batteries, designed for longer life, greater efficiency and more juice to the ounce, are thrusting themselves alongside traditional batteries using electrodes of lead and acid for potential employment in electric cars or electric power systems.

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: ALEXANDER H. COHEN gave a party the other night. Mr. Cohen does not need much provocation to give a party, and when it is the opening night of a play he has just produced he does not need any provocation at all. In this case, the play was Comedians, and toward the end of the party the Pinkerton man at the door said he had counted 397 people who ha dcome to celebrate. I really don't know why we have parties. Mr. Cohen said thoughtfully then. The reviews will be the same whether we have a party or not.

title: A Highly Personal Creme de la Creme
description: It is always pleasant, satisfying, rewarding if you will, to discover that somebody likes what you like. Which is why Arthur Hettich's rather admirable book of food is so filling.

title: PRICES DECLINE BY 3% FOR FARM PRODUCTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov 30 (UPI)Prices for raw farm products dropped 3 percent during the month ended Nov. 15, an indication that retail food prices will be stable through this winter. the Agriculture Department said today.

title: NEW $819 MILLION BILL IS FACED BY NEW YORK
description: Lawyers for New York City's banks and employee pension funds have raised a new, $819million problem for municipal officials who are still trying to put together $1 billion to pay off holders of shortterm notes because of the state Court of appeals decision last month that invalidated the city's yearold moratorium on repayment of the notes.

title: VICTOR ALESSANDRO, 61;; SAN ANTONIO CONDUCTOR
description: A funeral service was held on Monday in San Antonio for Victor Alessandro, conductor of the San Antonio Symphony Orchestra for 25 years. He died Saturday of emphysema on his 61st birthday.

title: Legacy for Mr. Lopez
description: When he takes the oath as President of Mexico today, Jose Lopez Portillo may reflect on the maxim: I can defend myself against my enemies; but God protect me from my friends. Retiring President Luis Echeverria Alvarez surprised everyone last year by picking Mr. Lpez to be his successor; but he has bequeathed his lifelong friend staggering problems: political unrest, 20 percent inflation, 30 percent unemployment, huge budget and trade deficits and the country's worst financial crisis in 65 years.

title: Laver Signs With Friars
description: SAN DIEGO. Nov. 30 (AP)  Rod Laver, who entered World Team Tennis a year ago at the age of 37 and  became rookie of the year, signed again with the San Diego Friars today. The terms were no: announced.

title: Kennecott Sets Terms for Sale Of Peabody Unit
description: Kennecott Copper Corporation disclosed yesterday the terms of the sale of its Peabody Coal subsidiary to a consortium of the Newmount Mining Corporation, the Williams Companies, the Bechtel Corporation, the Fluor Corporation and the Equitable Life

title: Elderly Are Seeking Changes in Law on Federal Aid Programs
description: EDISON, NOV. 30 Representatives of groups of the elderly called today for changes in state and Federal programs dealing with the indigent elderly and those receiving Supplemental Security Income payments so that they would receive more equitable income.

title: Syrians in Lebanon Warn on Guns
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 30Syria has threatened to use military force if necessary to remove heavy weapons from Palestinian guerrillas and Lebanese militia forces, now generally observing a ceasefire after more than a year and a half or civil war.

title: Jersey Prisoner Found Hanged
description: NORTH BERGEN, N.J., Nov. 30 (AP) Dennis Niosi, 30 years old, of Jersey City, was found hanged in a jail cell about five hours after he was arrested on charges of assulting a security guard and attempting to use a stolen credit card at a department store. Police Chief George Lehman said the man apparently had hanged himself with his Tshirt tied to a bar in the cell. His body was found early yesterday.

title: Farrell Wins Relay
description: Msgr. Farrell High School won a Catholic High School's Athletic Association 6,000meter relay event yesterday in 17 minutes 15 seconds at the Farrell track on Staten Island. Scanion's Bob Higgins had the fastest individual time, 4:05.5 for 1,500 meters.

title: Symphony Playing:
description: The symphony orchestra concert, apparently the most hearty of American musical institutions, is suffering from a pernicious overdose of success. What was once a cultural ritual has become a routine event, diffuse in meaning and, in scme respects, less than significant.

title: Murtaugh in Hospital After Having Stroke
description: CHESTER. Pa.. Nov. 30 (AP) Danny Murtaugh, who retired recently as manager of the Pittsburgh Pirates, was admitted to CrozierChester Hospital's intensive care unit. today after suffering a stroke.

title: People and Business
description: Denis Healey, Chancellor of the Exchequer, told the House of Commons yesterday that the International Monetary Fund was not seeking to force a fundamental change in direction in present government policy as a condition for a big loan.

title: Oh, for a Candy Store Malted
description: One symbol seems to personify the years when New York was less troubledthe malted.

title: Du Pont Increasing Fibers Prices; Aluminum Lifted by Reynolds Also
description: E. I. Du Pont de Nemours & Company announced yesterday that it was increasing the price of the manmade fibers it produces by as much as 10 percent. effective Jan. 1.

title: Dorsett Heisman Winner
description: Tony Dorsett, the University of Pittsburgh tailback who set more collegiate rushing records than any other player in the 108year history of football, was named winner of the 1976 Heisman Trophy yesterday as the outstanding college player in the nation.

title: Commission Named to Devise Plan For Monitoring Reactions to Drugs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30The estab lishment of an independent commission on prescription drug use, sponsored by Senator Edward M. Kennedy and financed largely by the Pharmaceutical Manufacturers Assocation. was announced today.

title: Farm Commodity Futures Close Mostly on Upside; Iced Broilers Are Steady
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 30 (AP)Farm commodity futures moved within a fairly narrow range on the Chicago Board of Trade Itoday and closed mostly higher.

title: A SENIOR KOREAN SPY DEFECTS AND ASSISTS IN FEDERAL INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 A senior officer of the Korean Central Intelligence Agency here has defied orders to return home and is voluntarily cooperating with a Federal investigation into alleged Korean bribery of members of Congress, Government investigators said today.

title: Child's World
description: THE calendars produced for I977's children are so clever that the illustrations become everything, while the days of the week are mere supernumeraries, hanging around in case anyone actually wants to know the date.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Discussion Is Set on Ways to Reverse Decline of Region's Economy
description: President  elect Jimmy Carter has agreed to meet with seven Governors from Northeastern states to discuss ways of reversing the economic decline of the Northeast region.

title: Louisville Schools Are Closed by Strike by Teachers
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov.30 (AP) Jefferson County's teachers went on strike today, closing the nation's 18th biggest school system and giving an unexpected holiday to more than 110,000 students. The strike was called after negotiators, assisted by a Federal mediator, failed to reach an agreement on a contract covering 5.600 teachers.

title: MURDER TRIAL ENDS IN INSANITY FINDING
description: A 37yearold former convict and drifter who, while on a weekend pass from a mental hosptial, allegedly mutilated and slashed to death a 7yearold boy, has been found not guilty of murder by reason of insanity and has been returned to a state mental institution.

title: Advertising
description: Needham, Harper & Steers, the country's 17th largest advertising agency. is the latest to become disenchanted with its publicly held status. Yesterday it announced plans to go private.

title: Oldest Cardinal Is Dead at 96; Portugal's Jose de Costa Nunez
description: ROME, Nov. 30 (Reuters)The Roman Catholic Church's oldest cardinal, Jost da Costa Nunez of Portugal, died yesterday at the age of 96, the Vatican said today.

title: EDMUND S. DELONG, 76; FORMER PRINCETON AIDE
description: Mr. DeLong, who graduated from Princeton in 1922, covered the transAtlantic flight of Charles A. Lindbergh and j the Lindbergh kidnapping trial during his 16year career at The Sun. He had j also served on the Sunday staff of The Kansas City Star and the city desk of United Press in New York before joining The Sun.

title: Lawyer of Suspect in Deaths Is Reprted in Conflict
description: HACKENSACK, NOV. 30 The Bergen County Prosecutor's office raised today a conflictofinterest issue against the attorney representing Harry De La Roche Jr., the 18yearold man charged with murdering his parents and two brothers.

title: Dow Average Off 2.83 on Concern Over Effects of Metal Price Rises
description: The stock market fell moderately yesterday amid growing investor concern over the inflationary impact on the eronomy of recent price rises in steel and aluminum.

title: Maryland 86, Ball State 70
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Nov. 30 (AP)  Larry Gibson scored 19 of his 21 points in the second half tonight, helping Maryland to an 8670 victory over Ball State.

title: A Lockheed Panel in Italy To Inquire Into Activities Of Rumor, an ExPremier
description: ROME, Nov. 30 (Reuters)An Italian parliamentary commission decided tonight to open an inquiry Into the activities of the former Prime Minister, Mariano Rumor, in connection with alleged bribes by the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation to insure sales of planes to Italy.

title: Opera: Troyanos Sings Amneris
description: When Tatiana Troyanos made her much admired Metropolitan Opera debut last March it was in a role tailormade for her, Octavian in Strauss's Der Rosenkavalier. On Monday night, she appeared in her second role with the company, one of a completely different nature, Amneris in Verdi's Aida. It was a part that she had learned only recently and had sung only once before.

title: Mortgage Loans by Savings Bant:s Equal Record $777 Million in Month
description: Savngs banks in New York State made $777 million in mortgage loans in October. equaling the rccord high for a month set back in December 1972. the New York Savings Banks Association reported yesterday.

title: 8 New York City Employees Are Given TaxFree $5,000 Awards for Public Service
description: Eight New York City employees, chosen as representative of the best in the municipal ranks, were honored yesterday by the Fund for the City of New York in its fourth annual program of awards for public service.

title: Betty Ford Lays Stone At Cape Cod Hospital
description: HYANNIS, Mass., Nov. 30 (AP)Betty Ford laid the cornerstone today for a new wing to Cape Cod Hospital and called it a very proud day for the resort community. About 400 people stood in sunny but freezing weather to watch the ceremony.

title: Roundabout Gets Denishawn Dances for TwoWeek Run
description: The Spirit of Denishawn, which became a hit of the dance season at the Riverside Theater Dance Festival last month, will return for a twoweek_ run starting tonight at the Roundabout Theater, 333 West 23d Street. The program, a revival of dances by Ruth St. Denis and Ted Shawn from the World War I period through the 1920's, has been staged by Klarna Pinska and is presented by the Joyce Trisler Danscompany. The engagement will last through Dec. 12.

title: Offices in New York Busy
description: A spokesman at the Spanish Consulate in New York said this week that she had received many calls from Spaniards visiting or resident here seeking information. about the forthcoming voting.

title: Court Rules Against Policeman Who Shot 3 Men in Ohio Brawl
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP)The supreme Court today ruled against an Ohio policeman who had been ordered by a jury to pay $831,000 to the families of two men he shot and killed and to a third man who wa paralyzed by his bullet.

title: Testimony on Clothing Read in Rubin Carter Trial
description: PATERSON, N.J., Nov. 30 Vincent J. DeSimone Jr., who headed the investigation of the Lafayette Grill triple murders in 1966, told a grand jury, 12 days after the shootings, that the clothing worn by Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis on the night in question did not fit the descriptions of the killers clothing he hd received from witnesses.

title: F.D.A. MOVES TO WIDEN CURB ON CHLOROFORM
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (UPI)The Food and Drug Administration proposed today an end to the use of chloroform in animal drugs, such as liniments, five months after it ordered the suspected cause of cancer removed from human drugs and cosmetics.

title: BREZHNEV APPEALS TO CARTER TO PUSH STALLED ARMS PACT
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 30Leonid I. Brezhnev today publicly called on the incoming Carter Administration to join in pushing through the stalled SovietAmerican strategic arms accord.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: THOSE Las Vegas Nites authorized in last month's election for the benefit of religious and philanthropic organizations won't become legal until Feb, 1 at the earliest, but You would never know it from the action all over the city.

title: Back to the Brink? . .
description: Just when things were beginning to look up for this fiscally overextended citywith mandated economies in the budget largely on target and cash flow exceeding expectationsNew York again faces the prospect of being driven to the brink of bankruptcyand beyond.

title: O'Dwyer's Concept of His Position Under Charter Assailed at Hearing
description: City Council President Paul O'Dwyer's concept of his role as ombudsman under the new City Charter was sharply challenged yesterday by members of the State Charter Revision Commission.

title: Bridge:
description: Success in major tournaments is not always an unmixed blessing, as Eddie Kantar, Bill Eisenberg and Paul Soloway, all of Los Angeles, discovered Sunday night in Pittsburgh when they won the Reisinger boardamatch team chamnionship.

title: Rangers Play 22 Deadlock With Flames
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 30John Davidson, the Ranger goalie, ?? a 16shot effort by the Atlanta Flames during a scoreless third period tonight and preserved a 22 tic with the team New York must pass to latch onto third place and an eventual playoff berth in the Patrick Division. Davidson faced a total of 44 shots in the National Hockey league game.

title: Factory Layoff Rate Up 3d Month
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 30 (AP)The layoff rate of the nation's factories increased in October for the third consecutive month, the Labor Department reported today, indicating a worsening employment problem.

title: 60 Minute Gourmet
description: AQUICKLY made meal and dinner with style are by no means mutually exclusive. and one of the most concrete expressions of that proposition is the menu with recipes outlined below. The heart of this meal is one of America's choicest and most elegant cuts of meat a tender. succulent rack of lamb.

title: Florida and Texas CasesEnsnarl Court's Rulings on Death Penalty
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30The Supreme Court became further embroiled today in the tangled aftermath of its July 2 rulings on the death penalty and, for the second day in a row, the Court itself added to the confusion.

title: MiniskirtsSurprise, Surprise
description: Kenzo's miniskirts are turning up in New York, but even the women who wear them don't think they're going to take over the fashion scene.

title: Views on Price Rises Differ
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30  Leading spokesmen for the Democratic and Republican viewpoints on the economy took markedly different views today of the meaning of the latest series of price. increases on important industrial products.

title: Top College Football Accelerator
description: Last spring Tony Dorsett phoned his mother and told her he wanted to skip his senior year at the University of Pittsburgh and sign a lucrative contract to play pro football in Canada. You know you're not leaving school with one more year left, a concerned Myrtle Dorsett told her son that day. Why not? Tony wondered. If they pay me the money they say they will, I'll leave.

title: Personal Health
description: MICHAEL is known by his fellow first graders as the baddest boy in the class. Always talking out of turn, jumping around, disobeying or ignoring the teacher and picking fights with his classmates, Michael continually disrupts classroom activities and. although of normal intelligence, fails to keep up with the class.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: NO COMMITMENTS MADE AT TALKS ON AID TO BURMA
description: TOKYO. Nov. 30Seven nations and four international organizations held a meeting here today on ways to help Burtha's economic development. But no specific commitments were made.

title: In Mideast, the Talk Now Is of Peace but Some Fear That the Mood May Dissipate
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 30Peace talk coming from Washington. Cairo and Jerusalem in recent weeks has created new expectations that a major diplomatic effort for a Middle East settlement will be undertaken next year. Although Secretary of State Henry A. kisinger and his aides assert that the Carter Administration will inherit an unprecendented opportunity for negotiating an agreement. they concede that no clear way is apparent for overcoming obstacles that have blocked an overall Middle East peace settlement for nearly a decade.

title: Blacks Reject Rhodesia Proposals
description: GENEVA, Nov. 30  Proposals that Rhodesian whites be allowed to control the army and the police during the transition to black majority rule were rejected here today by two black nationalist leaders.

title: Roast Mickey a la Brooklyn, Served au Naturel
description: Somewhere in the recorded wisdom of mankind there is a maxim that stolen fruit is sweeter. For a boy growing up in Brooklyn in the early 1920's there was a paraphrase: Stolen potatoes taste better. It was the stolen potato, snitched (a New York word) from the sidewalk stand of a neighborhood grocery store, that materialized into what we called the roast mickey.

title: EUROPE EMPHASIZES U.S. ECONOMIC ROLE
description: THE HAGUE, Nov.30  Admitting gloomur prospects than they foresaw last summer, Common Market leaders ended their conference today with the flat statement that hopes for European unity could not progress without economic recovery. They also made it clear that they considered United States intentions crucial to their plans.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Nov. 30  Insurance agents criticized today the State Department of Insurance .as inflexible for hewing to a priorapproval system of rate setting instead of allowing New Jersey's automobile insurance industry to compete in an openrating system.

title: UglyDuckling Recliner: It's a Swan Now
description: Guess what's making everybody sit tip and take notice?

title: Careers
description: Our business is running about 50 percent ahead of just a year ago, Richard Clarke said in an interview last week. We're one of the first barometers of business conditions.

title: News Summary
description: The Kremlin appealed to the incoming Carter Administration to join in pushing through the stalled SovietAmerican accord on strategic arms. Addressing a visiting American delegation at a dinner in Moscow, Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, said it was high time to end a freeze imposed by Washington almost a year ago and asked the new Administration to act in the same spirit. [Page Al, Column 6.]

title: Midtown People Call Car Lots Outdoor Bordellos
description: Irate midtown residents complained bitterly yesterday of what they said was a growing practicethe use of parking lots, deserted after hours, as openair bordellos.

title: Judy Collins, Survivor of the 60's, Flourishes in the 70's
description: The young man with the long red hair and a large orange cat purring on his shoulder, sitting on an orange velvet couch, brought to mind faint recollections of a record jacket one had seen somewhere before. He is 17 years oldjust a few years younger than his mother was when she started playing her guitar and singing folk songs in Chicago coffee houses, back in the 1960's.

title: British Offer a Bill For Some SelfRule By Scots and Welsh
description: LONDON, Nov. 30 With all the enthusiasm of a soldier being prodded into uncertain battle, the Labor Government today published a bill it did not want to offer in an effort to deal with an issue it hoped would go away.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: Light to Wear, Light in Price

title: EXOFFICIAL INDICTED IN TEAMSTERS LOAN
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 30A former official of the teamster union's principal pension fund was indicted here today on a charge of receiving a $200,000 bribe Two years ago.

title: Ferment in the Warsaw Pact
description: Leonid I. Brezhnev's state visits to Belgrade and Bucharest in recent weeks suggest that the Kremlin is preoccupied with Eastern European problems these days. Now the communiqu of the Political Consultative Session of the Warsaw Treaty Organization provides some clues to the nature of Soviet concern in this area.

title: Carter's Ad Agency Wins Bank Business
description: Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's ad agency will soon be doing advertising for the bank. Mr. Carter uses.

title: Books of The Times
description: SO THERE'LL be no misunderstanding, let me say at once that I think October Light quite marvelous  John Gardner's most touching and accessible novel to date. It's about two old Vermonters, a feuding brother and sister who are trying to reconcile the past and the present. (He sees the past as noble and mythic, the present as trashy; sne sees the past as straitening, the present as liherating.) And these two old VermontersJames L. Page, who in a rage at television's leering glitteringtoothed monsters of ceremony has blown out his sister's set with his 12gauge shotgun and with a fireplace log chased her upstairs and locked her into her bedroom; and Sally Page Abbott, who has decided she won't come out of that bedroom, not for anything, until her rights as a human being and a woman are duly respectedthese two old crotchety Vermonters are the most vivid and interesting characters that Mr. Gardner has yet created. Indeed the only Gardner characters who rival James and Sally in palpability are the other citizens of Bennington who wander in and out of October Light.

title: British Offer a Bill For Some SelfRule By Scots and Welsh
description: LONDON. Nov. 30With all the enthusiasm of a soldier being prodded into uncertain battle, the Labor Government today published a bill it did not want to offer in an effort to deal with an issue it hoped would go away.

title: Met to Play Bazaar Role
description: The Metropolitan Opera House will be filled with memorabilia, food, Christmas gifts for opera buffs and a chance to meet the company's artists when the Metropolitan Opera stages a benefit bazaar and raffle on Sunday.

title: Young Man Slain in Jersey
description: EWING, N.J., Nov. 30 (UPI)A young man was killed and stuffed in the trunk of his mother's car on a deadend street, the, police said. The body of 18yearold Michael Mayo of Ewing Township, was found early today by two policemen who noticed blood stains on the car bumper The police said the car belonged to Mr. Mayo's mother, Jacqueline. a widow who works as a supervisor with the State Labor Industry Department in Trenton. They said they had no suspect, motive. or weapon in the slaying.

title: Visit to China's Forces: Big but Poor in New Arms
description: PEKINGThe infantry trotted to their positions chanting Be on the alert and Defend the motherland. They loosed: rounds from their recoilless rifles and mortars at targets on the bleak hillside.

title: All Democrats Now
description: PARISThe return to Peking of Moscow's chief negotiator on SinoSoviet affairs is the most significant sign of a new Kremlin diplomatic offensive whose ultimate meaning remains impossible to discern.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HANDS ACROSS THE SEA Two new Off Off Broadway productions sound different enough to warrant investigation. The Well, running through Dec. 18 at the Joseph Jefferson Theater (6797174), at 11 East 29th Street, is an EastWest venture, written and directed by AmericansSeymour Reiter, Julianne Boydwith a Japanese composer, Mitsuo Kitamura, and choreographer, Kazuko Hirabayashi.

title: British Cabinet Ministers Warned Against Disclosure to Journalists
description: An inquiry ordered by the then Yrline Minister, Sir Harold Wilson, last July recommended stricter rules on the copying and guarding of Cabinet documents and urged that they not be kept longer than necessary.

title: G.A.O. Says Ford Plutonium View Perils Future of Breeder Reactor
2 Killed in Car Crash
description: CANTON, Conn., Nov. 30 (AP) The 18yearold brother of an Olympic goldmedal winner, Bruce Jenner, and a companion died today in an auto accident, police said. They said Harold Burton Jenner, died at Hartford Hospital following the 9:51 A.M. crash, in which the car went off Old Canton Road and struck a utility pole. The other victim was identified as Judith A. Hutchings, also of Canton.

title: HULDAH E. MACARTHY
description: Huldah E. Macarthy, a retired nurse,died Sunday at Muhlenberg Hospital, North Plainfield, NJ. She was 88 years old and lived at 66 West 88th Street in New York City.

title: 2,000 Mourn Randolph Evans at Emotional Funeral
description: The eulogies and the hymns in the First Baptist bchurch in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn yesterday were often pun????ed by sounds of sobbing, and among the mourners who had gathered to pay tribute to 15yearold Randolph Evant there were some who fainted, some who broke down in tears and some who screamed in aneuish. For these friends, relatives, neighbors, classmates, and even men and women who had not heard of the boy until his violent death last week at the hands of a police officer, the memory of the youth was evoked by speakers. About 2,000 persons had packed into two large chapels of the church, and hundreds snore waited outside.

title: People in Sports
description: Marvin Barnes of the Detroit Pistons was ordered yesterday to serve a oneyear sentence for violating probation by carrying a concealed weapon at an airport. However, Judge Anthony A. Giannini said in Superior Court in Providence, R.I., that he would delay imposing the sentence for two weeks to give Barnes's attorney time to appeal the ruling to the Rhode Island Supreme Court.

title: Personal Finance: Con Edison, The Bank
description: CONSUMER groups crusading against utilityrate increases have for years been painting the Consolidated Edison Company as a bank with a generator front, and now the stereotype has finally come true.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of an editing error, an article in The Times on Monday incorrectly referred to the Emerson Electric Company. The subject of the story, a former Emerson Television and Radio plant in Jersey City, was never a part of Emergon Electric.

title: U,N. COUNCIL EXTENDS GOLAN PEACE FORCE
Officers and Civilians Are Cited in Lye Attack
description: Mayor Beame and Police Commissioner Michael J. Codd last night presented certificates of appreciation to members of the force and to civilians in connection with an incident in Harlem last July 31 in which police officers were injured in a lyethrowing attack.

title: Henry C. Pitz Dies; Leading Illustrator, Painter and Author;
description: Henry C. Paz, a leading book and magazine illustrator. died Friday at his home in the Chestnut Hill section of Philadelphia. He was 81 years old.

title: Mrs. Carter in Mexico for Inaugural
description: MEXICO CITY. Nov. 30 (UPI)Rosalynn Carter arrived here today for the inauguration of Mexico's Presidentelect. Jos Lpez Portillo tomorrow.

title: Agriculture Department Approves Sales to Jordan and Poland
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (UPI)The Agriculture Department announced today approval of new export financing deals covering sales of $57 million worth of wheat, tobacco and soy protein to Poland and $5.5 million worth of wheat to Jordan.

title: Living Abroad:Hong Kong
description: AFAVORITE pastime in Hong Kong is shopping. But with the vast improvement in the standard of living that resulted from the successful industrial development of the last few years, along with worldwide inflation and the decline of the United States dollar, shopping is no longer the bargain that it once was.

title: PRISON MEDICAL CARE ASSAYED BY JUSTICES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30The Supreme Court ruled today that deliberate indifference by prison officials to serious medical needs of an inmate violates the Eighth Amendment ban against cruel and unusual punishment and gives the inmate ground to sue the officials in Federal court.

title: Judith Lowry Dies; Movie Actress, 86, In Phyllis on TV
description: Judith Lowry, who played feisty Mother Dexter in the television series Phyllis, and whose acting career dated back to 1913, died Monday night of a heart attack, while walking with her son, Semmes, in the Greenwich Village area. She was 86 years old.

title: YOUTH SAYS IMPERIALE STRUCK HIM WITH A GUN
description: BELLEVILLE, N.J., Nov, 30 (UPI)A Newark youth charged that Anthony Imperiale, New Jersey State Senator of Essex, hit him on the head with a pistol while trying to eject him from Mr. Im.periale's sporting goods store here.

title: Miss Kirby Wins Pace For Women Jockeys
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Nov. 30  Cindy Kirby, who flew from Calder Race Course in Florida earlier in the day, easily won the Silver Cup Pace for women jockeys tonight at freezing Meadowlands. Ten women competed in the nonbetting race beween the fourth and fifth events on the program.

title: GORDON M. BOOTH
description: Gordon M. Booth, a candy manufacturer, died Monday at Overlook Hospital in Summit, N.J. He was 53 years old and lived in North Plainfield. N.J.

title: Two Alabama Linemen To Play in Shrine Game
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 30 (AP) David Gerasimchuk, an offensive lineman, and Bob Baumhower, defensive lineman, were named today to play in the Shrine EastWest game Jan. 2 at Stanford Stadium. They are the first Alabama players in the game since 1944.

title: Caviar for Hard Times
description: Call it British pluck. Call it courage under fire. In the face of the highest unemployment in Britain since the Depression and in the shadow of the 45 percent depreciation of the pound in the last five years, a caviar bar has opened in London.

title: World News Briefs
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Nov. 30 (AP)Bangladesh's military strongman, MajGen. Ziaur Rahman, has assumed full powers to run the nation as chief martial law administrator and has arrested at least 11 prominent politicians, an official source said today.

title: List of Companies and Their Earnings Reports
description: COMPANY REPORTS For Periods ended Oct. 31 unless otherwise indicated. (N) Indicates stock traded on the New York Stock Exchange (A) American Stock Exchange and (O) over the counter.

title: Wimbledon Gives Women Bigger Purse
description: WIMBLEDON, England, Nov. 30 (AP) The AllEngland Tennis Club announced today a large increase in prize money for the 1977 Wimbledon tournament and settled its quarrel with the women stars.

title: Police Leaflets Urging Prostitutes: Leave Pimps and Get Out of Game
description: In an effort to fight prostitution in midtown Manhattan, the Police Department is distributing circulars urging prostitutes; to break away from their pimps.

title: Abitibi and Reed Cited
description: The Ontario Ministry of the Environment charged that the Abitibi Paper of Reed Ltd. with discharging contaminants that could impair the quality of the natural environment. The ministry lodged a total of 32 charges against Abitibi and Reed.

title: New Cosmetics Bottlesand the Same High Hopes
description: At 12:45, the Este Lauder counter at Lord & Taylor was a scene of controlled pandemonium. Women jostled one another to brush eye shadow or blusher on their faces, to smear lipstick on their hands and to get the attention of the six whitecoated young women behind the counter. Similar scenes were being carried out at other counters in the store's sparkling new cosmetics department, recently enlarged and moved up front to catch the customer's eye.

title: MEXICO'S NEW CHIEF INHERITING A CRISIS
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 30Jos Lpez Portillo, who begins a sixyear term as President of Mexico tomorrow, will inherit an economic and political crisis that demands his immediate attention but has its roots in almost insoluble social problems.

title: RICHARD M. CAREY
description: Dr. Richard M. Carey, an internist, died yesterday at his Manhattan home. He was 71 years old and lived at 549 West 123d Street.

title: Drexel Burnham to Add Chas. E. Quincy &
description: The Drexel Burnham Lambert Group Inc. said that it would acquire the firm of Chas. E. Quincy & Co., which specializes in the trading and distribution of United States Government and Federal Agency obligations. The price was not disclosed.

title: About Education
description: Is college worth the time, the money and the effort? This question is being asked more and more these days, and the answer is not always in the affirmative.

title: Sweets And Meat Make Not A Treat
description: Long ago, in the days when there were cooks to hire and fire, I employed briefly a wellrecommended Finnish cook. I told her my tastes and preferences and left her to match them to her talents. A roast of prime beef was and is the supreme favorite in my house. I told the cook that I always carved at table and wished no garnish on the platter.

title: Spain's Opposition to Get TV Time
description: MADRID, Nov, 30 (AP)The government television monopoly announced today that it would give equal time to Spanish political parties and leaders campaigning against the natiosal referendum on parliamentary elections.

title: Carter and Japan
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  On Dec. 5, Japanese voters will elect a new Diet. This will be followed by a Liberal Democratic Party convention when Diet members will decide on a Prime Minister, and he in turn the cabinet. The leaders chosen may well be as important as any leaders that Jimmy Carter will deal with.

title: Decision. Purses Held Up in Title Bou
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 30 (AP) Alfredo Escalera of Puerto Rico retained the World Boxing Council junior lightweight title tonight with a split decision over Tyrone Everett in a 15round bout that ended in confusion.

title: Chess:
description: The seventh chess Olympiad for women in Haifa, Israel, was won decisively by the Israeli team, Alla Kushnir, Luba Kristol, Olga Podrajanskaya and Lea Nudelman, who scored 174 in the eightteam roundrobin championship finals.

title: NEW YORK STATE JOBLESS AT HIGH LEVEL IN OCTOBER
description: Unemployment in New York State remained at high levels in October. virtually unchanged from September, the State Labor Department reported yesterday.

title: Potvin Hurt As Islanders Lose, 4 to 2
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Nov. 30 Suffering their third straight loss at home, the fourth in their last five games, plus the possible loss of Denis Potvin with a sprained neck, the slumping Islanders saw their troubles accelerate tonight at Nassau Coliseum.

title: More Dough for Play
description: A couple of weeks ago we published a recipe for play dough. It elicited an impassioned response from Susan Leff of New Haven, who writes: I can't bear your publicizing only the easy recipe for play dough when there is another, only a little more complicated, that makes a very much more satisfactory product. It feels nicer. Here's Mrs. Leff s contribution:

title: All About: Plants To Fertilize or Not
description: WHEN the edges of a spider plant's leaves turn brown or when the geranium on the windowsill fails to bloom, the solution is fertilizer, right? Wrong.

title: F.E.A. Begins Energy Series For Industry
description: SADDLE BROOK, Nov. 30 Engineers and managers for 24 chemical plants around the state gathered today in the first of 660 workshops and conferences to be held by the Federal Energy Administration throughout the country in the next year under a $3 million educational program to cut into the waste of energy in industrial and commercial operations.

title: Probable Lineups for Conference Playoffs in N.F.L. Are Taking Shape
description: A probable lineup can now be attempted for the National Football League playoffs leading to Super Bowl XI scheduled for the Rose Bowl at Pasadena, Calif., on Jan. 9. Remember that the divisional winners in each conference, American and National, which finish the season on Dec. 12 with thebest records are rewarded by having playoff games on their home fields. That privilege carries over to the conference championship. If the two teams with the best records manage to win their divisional playoffs then they will be the home teams for the conference title games. The projected pairings follow with current wonlosttied records in parentheses, plus starting times and local television outlets.

title: High Court Saves Crane Habitat
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (UPI) The Suprema Court has come to the aid of the world's 40 remaining Mississippi sandhill cranes.

title: Audits and More Audits
description: NEW ORLEANSSince 1973, the Internal Revenue Service has audited, more than fifty civil rights leaders and black politicians in the Southa situation that the national press has all but ignored.

title: Waste of Resources Imperils Man, World Wildlife Conference Is Told
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 30Headed, at least in protocol, by King Carl XVI Gustaf of Sweden, some 800 people from 35 nations are assembled here nominally to discuss protection of endangered species of animals and plants.

title: The U.N. Today
description: SECURITY COUNCIL

title: Military Service Extended
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 30 (UPI), Defence Minister Reginald Cowper announced today that soldiers ending 18 months active duty in the next few months would have their service extended for periods up to three months. Mr. Nkomo and Mr. Mugabe, who have formed an alliance called the patriotic front, also called on Britain to recognize its responsibility to decolonize"; Rhodesia by appointing a resident commissioner to make sure that any accord on transfer of rule reached here would be full carried out

title: The Carter Transition Team
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 Despite various public pledges to bring fresh faces into the Government, Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's transition task force represents a fusion of his trusted political :entourage from Georgia with a surprising number of specialists with Washington Government backgrounds. Their youth has given them a somewhat exaggerated reputation for liberal activism. But in general they have a decidedly more pragmatic, less visionary idealism than the young Democrats who flocked to Washington in 1960 for President Kennedy's inaugural.

title: Plan for Building Jewish Cultural Center In Lincoln Center Area Hailed by Beame
description: Mayor Beame yesterday hailed plans for the construction of a $4.5 million Jewish cultural complex in the Lincoln Center area on West 67th Street between Broadway and Amsterdam Avenue.

title: Major Peking Unit Meets First Time In Year and a Half
description: HONG KONG, Wednesday, Dec. 1The Standing Committee of the National People's Congress, China's nominal legislature. met yesterday for the first time in a year and a half to discuss appointments and removals, the Chinese press agency, Hsinhua, said.

title: Grigory Arzumanyan Dies at 57; Was Premier of Soviet Armenia
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 30 (AP)  Grigory Arzumanyan, Premier of the Soviet Republic of Armenia, is dead after a serious illness at the age of 57, the official press agency Tass reported today.

title: THE BRONFNIAN TRIAL HAS ANEW RECESS
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 30 The sixweekold Bronfman kidnapping trial reussed two hours early today for lack of evidence to present to the jury,and it appears to be drawing to a close with more of the peculiar twists that have marked the case.

title: Interest Conflict Charged in Comptroller Bank Leases
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 30A House subCommittee charged today that a serious conflict of interest exists in the leasing by the Comptroller of the Currency of office space in buildings owned by'institutions he supervises.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP Money rates for Tuesday.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of an editing error, an article in The Times on Monday incorrectly referred to the Emerson Electric Company, The subject of the story, a former Emerson Television and Radio plant in Jersey City, was never a part of Emerson Electric.

title: 4 Surrender in Gambling Inquiry
description: CAMDEN, N.J., Nov. 30 (UPI)  A Camden police officer and three other persons have surrendered to authorities investigating a $1 millionayear illegal gambling ring in Philadelphia and three southern New Jersey counties. Patrolman WiIliam Frampton, 35 years old, of Camden, was charged with bookmaking, conspiracy and misconduct. The other suspects were identified as Donald Raggio. 31, of Blackwood; Arthur Canzanese, 57. of Delanco, and Frank Nickporuk, 54, of Cinnaminson.

title: Dole Urges Republican Governors To Build Party Not a Candidate
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas said today that Republican leaders, in choosing a new party chairman, should not concern themselves with building a candidate but with building the party.

title: Jenner's Brother Killed

Clennon King, the black minister whose application for membership resulted in the dropping of the 11yearold ban on attendance and membership by blacks at Jimmy Carter's Baptist church in Plains, Ga., said today that he had no intention of returning to the church until the question of his membership had been resolved.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30Leaders of the House ethics committee have asked Prescient Ford for Justice. Department aid in undertaking a Congressional investigation of South Korean Influencepeddling on Capitol Hill.

description: NEWARK, Dec. 1Three major retailers in NewarkTwo Guys, Bamberger's and Hahne'swill challenge on Friday in Municipal Court here New Jersey's blue law forbidding Sunday sales of certain items.
