title: Murshal Yakubovsky Is Dead at 64; Commanded Warsaw Pact Forces
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 1 Marshal Ivan I. Yakubovsky of the Soviet Union, the Commander in Chief of the Warsaw Pact forces, died yesterday, it was announced here today. He was 64 years old. Western military sources said he had been sufferinn from cancer.

title: Charles Bragg, Utility Official, Killed in Connecticut Accident
description: ESSEX, Conn., Dec. 1  Charles R. Bragg, 49 years old, vice president of the Northeast Utilities Service Company, was killed in an auto accident Monday night on Route 9 in Haddam, Conn.

title: Defense Rests in the Bronfman Trial After Calling an Unsure Witness
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 1 The defense in the Bronfman kidnapping trial rested today after a witness testified that he thought he saw Samuel Bronfman 2d going into the apartment of one of the two defendants a month before his alleged abduction on Aug. 8, 1975.

title: Rodino in Haiti on Immigrant Issue
description: PORT AU PRINCE. Haiti. Dec. 1 (UPI) Representative Peter W. Rodino Jr. opened a weeklong factfinding mission in this Caribbean nation today, aimed at solving the problems posed by the roughly 100,000 Haitians living illegally in the United States. Mr. Rodino, a New Jersey Democrat, is visiting Haiti in his capacity as chairman of the House Judiciary Committee.

title: Lawyer Will Try to Probate Unsigned Hughes Will
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 1Top executives of the Summa Corporation, the late Howard Hughes's holding company, have been told by Chester C. Davis, the concern's chief counsel, that he plans to try to probate an unsigned Hughes will that would change the present direction of the company's control.

title: George Earnshaw Dies
description: George Earnshaw, star Philadelphia Athletics righthander in the late 20's and early 30's, died yesterday at the ago of 70 in Little flock. Obituary, ??.

title: Heart Attack Linked to Foul Ball
description: RANCHO PALOS VERDES, Calif., Dec. 1 (UPI)A 17yearold boy was killed yesterday by a heart attack triggered by being hit by a baseball, sheriff's deputies said. William Harrison Zimmerman was hitting balls propelled by a mechanical pitching device at Miraleste High School, deputies said. A foul ball struck the ground immediately in front of him and bounced back into his kneecap, inflicting such pain that his heart stopped, doctors said.

title: Rockies Frigid Slopes Get Cold Shoulder
description: GEORGETOWN, Colo., Dec. 1 Eastemn ski operators who for years have been complaining that proWestern devotees keep referring to New England's resorts as Iceboxes compared to those in the Rockies should now have reason to feel it ain't necessarily so. This highmountain country has been invaded by a sustamed cold spell that is causing skiers to desert lilt lines for the warm confines of base lodges with unusual frequency. Last Sunday, ski resorts bordering on the Continental Divide were reporting morning temperatures ranging from O to 22 degrees below zero.

title: A Galaxy of of Top Stars Glitters At Cuba's 5th World Ballet Fete
description: HAVANA  The conentratF:n cf stars at Cuba's Fifth International FestivaL of Ballet is impressive. with 25 countries and five continents represented.

title: Tillinghast to Join White Weld As Officer After Leaving T.W.A.
description: Charles C. Tillinghast Jr., chairman of Trans World Airlines and its chief operating officer since 1961, said yesterday that he would join the investment banking firm of White Weld & Company after his retirement Dec. 31.

title: PHYSICIANS IN JERSEY WILL BE SELFINSURED
description: TRINTON. Dec. 1Members of the Medical Society of New Jersey voted ?? today to set up a physicianowned company to provide medical ?? insurance to doctors across the state

title: Ford Asks $137,000 For Virginia Home
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP)President Ford put his Alexandria, Va., home up for sale today, with an asking price of $137,000. He paid $34,000 for it in 1955.

title: Congressional Study of Finances Tends to Support Carter on Plan to Balance Budget
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Congressional Budget Office published today longrange projections of Federal Government spending and revenues that tend to support the campaign position of Jimmy Carter that he can balance the budget by the fiscal year 1981 even with the addition of some $60 billiul in new or expanded spending programs.

title: 'Bim,' a Film About Life in Colonial Trinidad
description: By no conventional standards is "Bim" very good, but it's still vastly more interesting than lots of other movies you're likely to stumble on.The film, which opened yesterday at the Quad Cinema, is an ambitious attempt by its director-producer, Hugh A. Robertson, to dramatize some aspects of life in Trinidad shortly before the island gained independence.Mr. Robertson, an American director ("Melinda"), worked with a largely Trinidadian crew and an entirely Trinidadian cast to shape a film that is intended primarily to speak to Trinidadians and to other Caribbean people, and only incidentally to others, who, when they watch it, are in the position of eavesdroppers.The film spins a long, rambling tale that is almost Dickensian in its dependence on coincidences and in its habit of jumping from one narrative climax to the next without fooling around with structural niceties. It's the story of Bim (Ralph Maharaj), a young Triradadian of East Indian descent whose father was the autocratic leader of the sugar workers union.After his father is murdered by rivals. Bim is sent off to live in Port of Spain, where he experiences the prejudice of black Trinidadians for the first time and turns to a life of petty crime. Eventually, in about five minutes of film time, Bim succeeds his father as a union power. It becomes something of an anti-climax after all this, then, when Bim's undoing results not from crime, politics, ambition, black rivalries or independence. Once he gets to the top, Bim starts to drink, neither well nor wisely.Too much technology goes into the production of a film for it ever to qualify as truly primitive. There is no movie equivalent to finger-painting, but "Bim" comes close.Its power is not the result of sophisticated choice, but in the accumulation of the raw, accurate details of the Trinidadian experience. The actors are overwrought, the continuity is dim and a lot of the dialogue unintelligible to an car not accustomed to West Indian speech rhythms. Yet it's not dull, and it regards Trinidad's racial problems and political aspirations in a way that is unsentimental to the point of being merciless.

title: Calder Service Set for Monday
description: A memorial service for Alexander calder, the sculptor, who died in New York on Nov. 11, will take place Monday evening at the Whitney Museum of American Art, on Madison Avenue at 75th Street. The service will begin at 9 P.M.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: A.T .&T . Bond Yield Set at 3Year Low
description: A bond isue sold by a subsidiary of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company was priced yesterday to give investors a rate of return of 7.90 percent. the lowest yield on a Bell System bond issue in more than three years. The bond sale, another important indication of the sharp decline in interest rates recently,1 took place as the credit markets shrugged off their earlyintheweek hesitancy and began to surge upward once again. 1Ln the milestone bond sale, Mountain States Telephone and Telegraph awarded $150 million of 40year debentures to an underwriting group led. by Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith. The winning bid resulted in a borrowing cost to the company of 7.95 percent, also a threeyear low.

title: Devaluation of Peso Leaves the Streets of Laredo Deserted
description: LAREDO, Tex., Nov. 29 Vicente Garza's cluttered general store next to the Mexican border bridge used to sell more Tide detergent, Pet milk and KoolAid than any other store in the United States.

title: AIRLINES SEEK AID IN QUIETING PLANES
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 1  Aviationindustryr officials told the Administration today that airline service could suffer severe setbacks if new rules for quieting planes were not supplemented by a system for helping carriers finance the costs.

title: About New York
description: It cost her $5,000 to kidnap her own daughter, but when the mother spotted her outside Saks, chanting and dancing with the Hare Krishnas amid the flow of pedestrians, the investment seemed worth it.

title: The Battle for the Environment
description: The environmental cause is neither amorphous nor elitist; it is a combination of pragmatism and ethics. It is summed up in the practical conviction that man cannot survive as a civilized being unless he reaches an accommodation with his natural surroundings; and in the ethical view that if he fails to do so, his survival in such a world will be worthless.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: A MAN TO REMEMBER The illustrious musicaltheater career of Kurt Weill, ever an interesting subject, will be discussed tonight at 7:30 by an authoritative panel of the late composer's colleagues in a roundtable program at the auditorium of Lincoln Center's Library and Museum of the Perfoeming Arts. Those who plan to attend the free event might look in earlier on the current exhibit of Kurt WeillLotte Lenya memorabilia under the same roof.

title: G.O.P. County Leaders Challenge Rockefeller's Domination of Party
description: For the first time in nearly two decades, Vice President Rockefeller's domination of the New York State Republican Party is being openly challenged by once docile Republican county leaders. This uprising follows the G.O.P. loss of the Presidency and a United States Senate seat here and the party's failure to recoup postWatergate losses in the state's Congressional and legislative delegations.

title: F.D.A. Tells About Corrections Being Made in Defibrillators
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP)The Food and Drug Administration announced today that nearly 300 defibrillators used to revive heart patients were undergoing corrections for a potentially serious malfunction. The defibrillators. Models MSD and ISD23, made by Electronics for Medicine of White Plains, are in medical facilities in 29 states and the District of Columbia.

title: Britain Limiting Taiwanese Visas
description: LONDON. Dc. 1 (Reuters)Britain will not grant visas to cultural or entertainment groups from Taiwan that claim to represent China, the Foreign Office said today. It added that while it did not wish to discourage all visits from Taiwan, it considered it helpful to set guideliines since difficulties might arise if the visitors claimed to represent China.

title: Holtz Still Pondering on Quarterback
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Dec. 1  After virtually a full season. t he coach of the Jets still does not know how his rookie quarterback performs under pressure.

title: GOTBAUM INSISTS CITY GET U.S. FISCAL HELP OR FORGO UNIONS AID
description: Victor Gotbaum, the head of the largest publicemployee union in New York City, said yesterday that the municipal unions would participate in an overall solution to the city's latest fiscal crisis only if it included Federal help now.

title: ExSchool Committeeman Gets 2 Years in Boston Larceny Case
description: BOSTON, Dec. 1(AP)A former Boston School Committeeman, Paul J. Ellison, was sentenced today to two years in the Norfolk County House of Correction.

title: Brooke Begins Cyprus Visit
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Dec. I (Reuters) Senator Edward W. Brooke, Republican of Massachusetts, arrived here today for R threeday visit during which he said he would try to find a solution to the tragic problems facing Cyprus, the official Cypriot news agency reported. Mr. Brooke, a member of the Senate Committee on Appropriations, will meet President Makarios tomorrow.

title: Gas Price Rises Begin for Users; More Due Jan.1
description: Consumers across the nation began paying an average of 6.5 percent more for their gas yesterday as a result of a Federal Power Commission decision in October to sharply increase the price gas producers may charge.

title: POLICE KILL 2 BLACKS IN CAPE TOWN RIOTING
description: CAPE TOWN, Dec. 1 (Reuters)Policed men killed two blacks tonight in Cape Town's Guguletu township after a third straight day of unrest, a senior police officer said.

Paul Hecht plays the title role in a cast that includes Lester Rawlins, Mitchell Jason, Louis Zoric:h, Judith Light and John Michalski. Directed by 3. ReneIli, the Day was produced by Mr. Schary.

description: A New York State Supreme Court justice yesterday dismissed a 12count perjury indictment against former Justice Joseph A. Brust and, in a scathing review of the methods used to obtain the indictment, criticized prosecutors generally for being overzealous.

description: CAMP PENDLETON, Calif., Dec. 1We don't have any jets or bombers or tanks, but we do have all the weapons we need; we're all armed, and we're very capable of using our weapons; if the blacks start anything, we'll be ready.

description: NEW BRITAIN, Conn., Dec. 1 (AP)The Connecticut Public Utilities Control Authority today ordered the Hartford Electric Light Company and the Connecticut Light and Power Company to cut their gas and electricity rates to 1974 levels.

description: PRINCETON, Dec. 1The Federal Office of Management and Budget approved yesterday a $90 million budget authorization for the Tokamak fusion test reactor at Princeton University, according to Washington sources familiar with the Project.

title: Murder Charged in Child's Death
description: ASBURY PARK, N.J., Dec. 1 (UPI)Eddie Thomas, a 31yearold Newark truck driver, has been charged with murder in the beating death of the baby of his friend. The child, 22monthold Troy Singleton of Asbury Park, died a week after the alleged beating at his mother's home on Nov. 22. Mr. Thomas and the mother, Shirley Singleton. 18, had been arrested and held on childabuse charges before the baby's death.

title: Grain and Soybean Prices Uneven
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 1 (AP)Grain and soybeans futures traded in mostly higher ranges early on the Chicago Board of Trade today, but late profit taking produced generally uneven price closes.

description: Despite unremitting tension on world currency markets, which among other developments brought a further increase in shortterm borrowing by the British Government to support the ailing pound, United States monetary authorities continued to sit on the sidelines between August and October.

title: The Right Fielder
description: Mr. R. M. Jackson has decided to work in New York starting next spring. Sometime before choosing to accept employment with this city's American League ball club, Mr. Jackson was quoted as saying, If I played in New York, they'd name a candy bar after me. On another occasion, he said. If I played for the Yankees, they wouldn't see a lefthanded pitcher until after the Fourth of July. Neither assertion is strictly true; but together they give a fairly accurate measure of both the man and the ballplayer.

description: Anita O'Day, who has heen through a glamourgown period, a white glove period and a crisply tailored period, now seems to be entering a Dolly Parton period. Her blond hair may not be quite as bouffant as Miss Parton's. but she can match the country star charm for charm.

title: Distant Land, $13, Takes Aqueduct Feature by Head
description: Robert J. Kleberg, the late master of the sprawling Kin,, Ranch in Texas, had visions of grandeur for Distant Land when the colt was growing up. Distant Land never quite lived up to his promise. But Distant Land finally came into his own with a At the big stretch run that won the 854,350 Stuyvesant Race Handicap by a head yesterTracks day before 11,824 congealed onlookers at Aqueduct. The Ranch 4yearold gave backers a frint before posting his first career stakes victory. Aaron V. Jones's Blue Times, coupled with Excepto who wound up seventh, finished powerfully from the outside to make it close. But the King Ranch colorbearer held him safe. He returned $13 For $2 to win. Heliodoro Gustines, Distant Land's rider, apparently anticipated what his colt would do in the late stretch going. I tried to time my move late because my colt has a tendency to pull himself up when he is in front, he said.

title: Freighter Sinks in Gulf of Mexico
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 1 (UPI)A 311foot freighter loaded with 4,000 tons of aluminum ore sprang a leak and sank in 12,000 feet of water in the Gulf of Mexico today. All 25 crewmen aboard were rescued.

The increases amount to $195 on the 1977 Fox twodoor model, making it now $5.295, and $200 on the 100LS model, raising it to $7,150.

description: Leonid M. Tichvinsky, who retired in 1966 as director of the University of California's Student Center at Gttingen, West Germany, died of pneumonia yesterday In St. Mary's Health Center, St. Louis, His age was 79.

title: Bridge:
description: Some of the most difficult hands to play are the notrump misfits in which both hands have trick potential but communications are lacking. One such deal caused trouble to many declarers in the blue ribbon pair championship in Pittsburgh last week. It also gave Dave Berkowitz of New York the chance for a brilliant defensive stroke, and helped him to finish second in the event with Jim Jacoby of Richardson. Tex.

title: Westchester Sex Crime Programs Are Continuing Despite an Arrest
description: YONKERS, Dec, 1Parents and school officials in Westchester County expressed relief today at the capture of a man suspected of having raped several young girls, but said they would continue to take measures to protect children.

title: Ring Dealing in Bogus $20 Bills Is Reported Broken in Europe
description: MARSEILLES, France, Dec. 1 (UPI)French, Spanish and West German police officers have broken a large counterfeiting ring seizing an estimated $14 million in bogus American $20 bills and arresting four persons, the French police said today.

title: Consultant Finds Artist Colony For Manhattan Plaza Unfeasible
description: The real estate consultant hired by the Broadway Association, a group of midtown property owners, has completed a study of the city's proposal to turn Manhattan Plaza into a Federally subsidized project primarily for performing artists, and his conclusions are almost entirely negative.

title: Wallace Assures Scottsboro Survivor Alabama Is One of the Best States
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 1  Gov. George C. Wallace met today with Clarence (Willie) Norris, last known survivor of the Scottsboro boys, and the Governor assured the 64yearold black man who had spent 15 years in Alabama prisons that this state was one of the best in the country for white cr black neonle.

title: Weak Earth Tremor Felt in Peking
description: TOKYO. Thursday, Dec. 2 (AP)A weak earthquake shook Peking this morning. Japan's Kyndo news service reported from the Chinese capital. The Japanese report said that the tremor had barely been felt and that there were no reports of damage.

title: Buffalo Names Treasurer
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 1 (AP)Jessica Johnson, acting chairman of the Democratic State Committee, was appointed City Treasurer today by Mayor Stanley M. Makowski of Buffalo. The Democratic Mayor's choice of Mrs. Johnson for the $21,100ayear position must be approved by the allDemocrat Common Council. Mrs. Johnson would replace Lucy A. Curley, who retired.

title: Article 4  No Title
Jersey Delays Limit on Claims
description: TRENTON, Dec. I (UPI) The state has decided to delay new limits on clam harvesting and increased fees for fishermen. David J. Bardin, State Environmental Protection Commissioner, announced the delay yesterday. saying the state would hold public hearings before imposing the regulations.

title: MONSANTO TEXTILES LIFTS NYLON PRICE
description: The Monsanto Textiles Company, a subsidiary of the Monsanto Company, announced yesterday a 6 percent increase in price for its nylon yarns of 210 denier and higher, effective Jan. 1. These are the yarns that are used in tire cord and for industrial textiles.

title: Seven Die in Tenement Fire
description: MARYVILLE, Tenn., Dec. 1 (UPI) Seven persons suffocated in a house fire today when an electric heater apparently set an artificial Christmas tree ablaze and the victims were unable to escape through narrow casement windows. The fire erupted in the living room at the home of Larry Mereidieth.

title: Rematch for Title Fight Is Sought After Dispute

title: Court in Susan Saxe Murder Trial Extends Deadline to File Motions
description: BOSTON, Dec. 1 (AP)Lawyers for Susan E. Saxe have been given until Dec. 10 to file pretrial motions in the murderbank robbery case against the former Brandeis University honor student.

description: The steel industry's decision to increase prices of flatrolled steel products by an average of 6 percent in the waning days of the Ford Administration, quickly followed by Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's expression of concern, raises the issue of whether a confrontation is looming between the coming Carter Administration and the steel industryand, possibly, business in general.

title: Scholarship and the Supernatural Mix at a Fairleigh Dickinson Fair
Presidential Privilege

title: Replacing Holzman With Reed Weighed by Garden's Officials
description: Willis Reed is scheduled to be the next Knick coach. The only question is: When will Reed, the most popular player in Knick history, replace Red Holzman, the current coach?

title: Friedgood Witness Holds To Story Backing Doctor Despite Hard Questioning
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Dec. 1A defense witness who testified yesterday that she had spoken to Sophie Frieclgood several hours after the prosecution asserts she had been murdered by her husband remained steadfast today under a blistering crossexamination.

title: Black Panther Party Sues U.S. Officials
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI)  The Black Panther Party today filed a $100 million class action suit against nearly two dozen high Federal officals. charging them with trying since 1967 to destroy the party and its members.

title: G.M. Recalls 175,000 Chevettes
description: DETROIT, Dec 1 (Reuters)  The General Motors Corporation said today it was recalling about 175,000 of its 1976 model Chevettes because the fuel tank cap on the small car might not seat properly. The company said that there might he excesive solder on the internal threads of the fuel tank filler neck.

title: Helping Women Make the Leap From Kitchen to Office
description: More than a million American women have been added to the nation's labor foroe this year. For many the transition from kitchen to job has brought not only additional money to the household but new satisfaction from life as well.

title: City College Student Newspaper Suspended
description: The City College student senate last night voted to suspend The Campus, the 69yearold student newspaper, for the i rest of the academic year after finding 1 the editors of the weekly guilty of five charges, including distorting the truth and fiscal irresponsibility.

title: PANEL CALLED HUCKSTER FOR NUCLEAR PROGRAMS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI) The Joint Congressional Committee on Atomic Energy serves as a huckster for the nuclear power industry and should be abolished for that and several other reasons, Common Cause, a public affairs lobbying organization, said today.

title: Carter Stresses Bases in Turkey And Vows Objectivity on Cyprus
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1Presidentelect Jimmy Carter believes that Turkish military bases are important to the United States, intends to pursue an objective policy on the Cyprus issue and feels that celebrations in Greece over his election were perhaps unwarranted.

title: Three Nets Are Ejected In 10696 Loss to Suns
Two Basketball Coaches On the Spot This Year
description: A funny thing happened to the two best high school basketball teams in the city last season, they won their league titles and lost their coaches. That occurrence puts Jerry Perlmutter of Canarsie and Brother Thomas Jensen of Power Memorial, the two new coaches, on the spot. When Mark Reiner left Canarsie in Brooklyn for an assistant coach's job at Kansas State, his team had just completed an unbeaten season, winning all 24 games and the Public Schools Athletic League title. As if that wasn't enough, the Chiefs were pronounced the No. I schoolboy team in the country. But all five starters graduated and, as Perlmutter says; It's not the No. I team anymore.

title: Chain Stores 14.7% Sales Rise in October Is the Third Highest for 19761
Laos Reds, Noting a Year in Power, Accuse U.S. of Continued Hostility
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 1The governing Communist Party convened a special meeting today, the eve of the first anniversary of its seizure of power, and in the presence of the American charg d'affaires, accused the United States of continued hostility toward Laos.

title: LEO SAYER'S TENOR VOICE FILLS THE BOTTOM LINE
description: Every time one encounters the voice of Leo Sayer, on records or ?? in performance, one is once again struck by its beauty. Mr. Sayer, the English poprocker who opened a threenight run at the Bottom Line on Tuesday. has one of the finest voices in all of popular musica strong, full tenor with plenty of energy for uptempo material that can still sustain the long lines of a ballad.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 1The Mobil Corporation today raised its allcash offer for the Irvine Company, a California land developer, to $33 a share, a total of $277.7 million.

title: Leading Indicators Leave Economy's Future Cloudy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 The Government's composite index of leading indicators of the economy was flat in October after declining in the two preceding months, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Rhodesians Meet but Reject Plans
description: GENEVA, Dec. 1Rhodesian white and black representatives met today for their first joint discussion of what sort of government should be formed for a transition to black majority rule, and each side rejected the other's proposal.

title: The U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Judge Rejects the Citizenship Claim of aLost American of Rio Rico
description: SAN ANTONIO. Tex., Dec. 1, (UPI) The residents of Rio Rico say they are citizens a the United Statesa little misplaced, perhapsbut United States citizens nevertheless,

title: MORGENTHAU OBTAINS RECORDS ON BOOMIS
description: Arnold E. Kagan, a key figure in the alleged secret contributions by Christopher Boomis, the developer: to Abraham D. Beame's 1973 campaign for Mayor, has surrendered records related to the contributions to the office of District Attorney Robert M. Morgenthau of Manhattan, according to sources close to Mr. Kagan.

title: Libya Buys 10% Of Fiat Company For $415 Million
description: ROME, Dec. 1Libya has purchased 10 percent of Fiat, the giant automobile manufacturer, in the first major Arab investment in Italy.

title: People in Sports
Bronx Fire Kills Girl, 4, and Hurts Two Other Children Left Alone
description: A 4yearold girl died and two other children were injured yesterday in a Bronx tenement fire after being left alone by their mother.

title: 95 Candidates for the Legislature Fined for Violating Election Law
description: Ninetyfive candidates in the Sta?? Senate and Assembly elections last Nov. 2 who failed to file campaign financial statements on time were each fined $100 yesterday by a special term of the State Supreme Court in Albany.

title: Business Records
description: Petition filed by:

title: GEORGE EARNSHAW, A'S PITCHING STAR
description: LITTLE ROCK, Dec. 1 (AP)  George Earnshaw, a 20game winner for the Philadelphia Athletics for three straight years, died today at a Little Rock hospital at the age of 76. He had lived in, Hot Springs, Ark., since 1952.

title: Associated Press
ENERGY AGENCY EXTENDS PRICE FREEZE ON CRUDE
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 1 The Federal Energy Administration extended today through Dec. 31 a freeze on crude oil prices that prevailed since July.

title: Market Place
description: After weeks of suspense, the heavy purchaser of shares of Leeds & Northrup Company, a leading manufacturer of control devices for utilities and for the steel industry, has finally surfaced.

title: New Rules Proposed For Money Managers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 The Securities and Exchange Commission proposed today amending its rules to require mutual funds and other investment managers to disclose annually in registration statements and proxy material how they select brokers, the size of commissions, what they receive from brokers, the method of evaluating the reasonableness of commissions and whether any are paid to affiliates.

title: MEXICO'S NEW CHIEF, SWORN IN, APPEALS FOR END TO CONFLICT
Lopez Portillo and His Wife Pay Special Attention to Mrs. Carter
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 1Although not part of the official United States delegation to today's inauguration ceremonies, which was headed by Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger, Rosalynn Carter was treated with special deference by Mexico's new President, Jose Lopez Portillo, and his v;ife, Carmen Romano de Lopez Portillo. who had sent her a private invitation to witness the change of government.

title: CORRECTION
description: In a news analysis on Jimmy Carter's transition team that appeared in The Times yesterday, the Center for Law and Social Policy was erroneously identified as a Ralph Nader affiliate. The center, a publicinterest law firm, has foundation funding and is not affiliated with Mr. Nader.

title: Washington &
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The people who are paid to look after the interests of the nation's business in this city will regretfully hid farewell to President Ford, an old, trusted and usually helpful friend.

title: Gas Price Rises Begin for Users; More Due Jan. 1
description: Consumers across the nation began paying an average of 6.5 percent more for their gas yesterday as a result of a Federal Power Commission decision in October to sharply increase the price gas producers may charge.

title: Fiat, as Run by the Agnellis, Is Progressive and Paternal
description: Fiat. the fifth biggest auto manufacturer in the world and Italy's largest private company, combines tradition and innovation with a dash of dramatic flair.

title: A Splinter Conservative Party in Japan Is Making Headway as Politics There Shows a New Fluidity
description: OHATANO, Japan, Dec. 1This weekend, for the first time in almost a quarter of a century, some Japanese can vote for a conservative alternative to the conservative Government.

title: Max Schneider Dies; Retired Banker, 90, Was Textile Official
description: Max. J. Schneider, a retired banker who was prominent in Jewish affairs in New York City, died yesterday at his Manhattan home. He was 90 years old.

title: MENTAL HOSPITAL SHIFT IS ANNOUNCED BY BROWN
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif.. Dec. 1 (UPI) In connection with an investigation of suspicious patient deaths, Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. announced today a major shakeup of state mental hospital administrators.

title: TV: An Extraordinary Drama on Public Visions Series Tonight
description: Public television's Visions series has contracted with the Trinity Square Repertory Company of Providence, R. I., for an original television drama, and the result is extraordinary.

title: Connors Skips Cup Play With Mexico
description: Jimmy Connors was among the missing yesterday when the United States squad was announced for the 1977 North American Davis Cup match against Mexico Dec. 17 through 19 in Tucaon, Ariz.

title: Intruder Rams White House Gate to Wake Up Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI)A man tried to ram a pickup truck through the front gates of the White House and he shouted that he wanted to to wake up President Ford before he kills us all.

title: NBC SAYS BREZHNEV SENT CARTER ASSURING MESSAGE
description: NBC News reported last night that the. Soviet leader, Leonid 1. Brezhnev, had sent a message to Presidentelect Jimmy Carter, through a member of President. Ford's Cabinet, that he would not create a crisis to test the will of the incoming administration,

title: Angola:
description: On Nov. 11, the Government formed by the Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola observed the first anniversary of that strifetorn country's independence from Portugal. A civil war still sputtered on. Marxistoriented Government, using Sovietarmed troops, was trying to eliminate guerrilla remnants of a proWestern movement.

title: The Visible Hand
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 1 The Government does too much, and it does too little. It is loath to harm particular interests, and it ends up harming all. Its processes are hemmed in by rules to prevent abuse of power, and the result is to increase centralized decisionmaking.

title: Elin T. Holmberg Married to Brian R. Cordon
description: Elin Thompson Holmberg, daughter of Dorothy McCollum Holmberg ot White Plains and Albert William Holmberg Jr. of Chattanooga, Tenn., was married in Warwick. Bermuda, yesterday to Brian Rosswell Cordon, son ot Mr. and Mrs. Frank Roderick Cordon of Rockford, Ill. The Rev. George Buchanan performed the ceremony in christ Church (Presbyterian).

title: CAIRO BIDS U.S. AND SOVIET MOVE FOR CONFERENCE
description: CAIRO, Thursday, Dec. 2 (AP)Foreign Minister Ismail Fahmy called today on the United States and the Soviet Union to initiate a definite invitation for; reconvening in the first quarter of 1977 the stalled Geneva conference on the Middle East.

title: POLES PLAN CUTBACK IN ECONOMIC GROWTH
description: WARSAW, Dec. 1 (Reuters)Poland announced today that it. was forced to cut back on investment for economic development as a result of expenditures on food imports.

title: G.O.P. County Leaders Challenge Rockefeller's Domination of Party
description: For the first time in nearly two decades, Vice President Rockefeller's domination of the New York State Republican Party is being openly challenged by once docile Republican county leaders. This uprising follows the G.O.P. loss of the Presidency and a United States Senate seat here and the party's failure to recoup postWatergate losses in the state's Congressional and legislative delegations.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: MORGENTHAU OBTAINS RECORDS ON BOOMIS
description: Arnold E. Kagan, a key figure in the alleged secret contributions by Christopher Boomis, the developer, to Abraham D. Beame's 1973 campaign for Mayor, has surrendered records related to the contributions to the office of District Attorney Robert M. Morgenthau of Manhattan, according to sources close to Mr. Kagan.

title: Fordham Beats Yale, 6560, on Frankoski's Free Throws
description: Fordham University scored its second basketball victory in two outings this season with a 6560 triumph over Yale last night at the Rams Rose Hill Gym.

title: Qaddafi to Visit Moscow
description: MOSCOW. Dec. 1 (AP) Col. Muammar elQaddafi will make an official visit to the Soviet Union in the first half of December, the Soviet press agency lass announced today. SovietLibyan relation:I have been improving recently. Soviet press commentaries have backed Libya's position in its disputes with Egypt. which once was Moscow's main Arab ally.

title: U.S. Is Said to Bar New STOL Plane
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Defense Department, as part of a reduction in its research budget, has decided to stop Air Force development of a new military transport, industry sources reported today.

title: Utah Judge Sets Gilmore Execution by Firing Squad for Dawn Monday
description: PROVO. Utah. Dec. 1 Gary Mark Gilmoi e. the convicted murderer who has been seeking to be executed by a state firing squad here, was scheduled today to he executed by a firing squad at sunrise on Monday.

title: Italy's Inflation Worst In Common Market
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 1 (Reuters)Italy suffered the worst inflation of the nine Common Market countries during the last year with a 20.1 percent increase in consumer prices, according to statistics published today.

title: Notes on People
description: William F. Rickenbacker, son of the late World War 1 flying ace Eddie Rickenbacker, was injured yesterday when the singleengine Cessna 210 he was piloting crashed on takeoff at Westchester County Airport in White Plains. The 48yearold son of the hero of World Wais 1 and 11 was taken to Northern Westchester Hospital in Mount Kisco, where he was reported in fair condition with several broken ribs, back burns, and facial lacerations.

title: Sewing Machines 3246
description: OUT OF PAWN 300 SEW MACHINEs Top Brands. Singer, Necchl, Platt, etc. As low as $29.00! All guaranteed Unredeemed, 64 3d Av (11th) OR 4116111

title: CRUISE MISSILE ISSUE HEADS FOR DECISION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 Navy and Detense Department research officials are pressing for a decision early next month on the controversial cruise missile program that could cause complications for the Unrier Administration in future strategic arms talks with the Soviet Union.

title: Carter Is Pessimistic After Seeing Economic Advisers
description: PLAINS, Ga., Dec. 1  Presidentelect Jimmy Carter discussed economic policy and the state of the economy with a panel of advisers today and said that what he had heard left him with a pessimistic outlook for the immediate future.

title: Mailman Is Burned As 4 Letter Bombs Explode in Midtown
description: A postal service mailman was slightly injured yesterday when a small incendiary device ignited at a mailbox across from Grand Central Terminal. It was one of four such letter bombs discovered in midtown Manhattan during the day.

title: PRESSURE ON CARTER OVER KOREA IS SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1Highranking State Department officials said today that the continuing revelations about South Korea's questionable lobbying practices made it more likely that the Carter Administration would be under early pressure to withdraw the 42,000 American troops in that country.

title: Stanley Babin Gives Piano Recital
description: Strange careers abound in this world. hut some are stranger than others. Take the case of Stanley Babin. who stands as a warning to all young prizewinners who think the world is theirs after an early competition victory.

title: REV. JOHN F. GILSON, 74, PROFESSOR AT FORDHAM
description: The Rev. John F. Gilson, professor of education at the Fordham University Graduate School of Education for 26 years, died Monday of a heart attack at St. Francis Hospital in Poughkeepsie, N.Y. He was 74 years old.

title: Deaths
description: ANSALONEDr. John B.Beloved husband of Anni, devoted father of Carla Salanitro. Reposing at Zaccardo Funeral Home Inc., 4021 White Plains Rd., Bram. Mass of the Resurrection Saturday, 10:30 A.M. Holy Name of Jesus Church, Valhalia. N.Y. Intermit Gate of Heaven Cemetery. BAUMLilly, suddenly, Nov. 26, 1976, in Vienna, Austria. Survived by brother, Leo Steiner, and nephew's and nieces, Fred GeldhIrtch,. Henry Goldhirsch, Trudy Schwartz, Doris Balin Bianchi, Herbert M. Balln. Interment Nov. 30, Vienna, Austria.

title: Angol Is Admitted as 146th Member of United Nations, With the United States Abstaining
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 1Angola was admitted today as the 146th member of the United Nations.

title: GOTBAUM INSISTS CITY GET U.S. FISCAL HELP OR FORGO UNIONS AID
description: Victor Gotbaum, the head of the largest publicemployee union in New York City, said yesterday that the municipal unions would participate in an overall solution to the city's latest fiscal crisis only if it included Federal help now.

title: HOUSING OFFICIAL SUBMITS RESIGNATION ON REQUEST
description: Lawrence Dempsey, New York City's Housing and Development Administration inspector general, has submitted his resignation at the request of Thomas Appleby, the new H.D.A. administrator.

title: State Senator's Assistant Accused Of Getting Bribe to Obtain Parole
description: MINEOLA, LI., Dec. 1 A woman legislative assistant to State Senator Karen S. Burstein was arrested today on a charge of receiving a bribe in exchange for offering to get a state prison inmate paroled. The assigned task of the assistant was to counsel prison inmates in efforts to rehabilitate them.

title: Court Says Female Workers Needn't Pay for Living Longer
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 1 (AP) Women may live longer and collect more retirement benefits than men, but female workers cannot be forced to pay more into retirement plans for that reason alone, the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit. ruled yesterday.

title: Night Hearings Scored
description: Rosemary Pooler, the executive director of the New York State Consumer Protection Board, yesterday announced her vehement objection to the Public Service Commission's scheduled night hearings on New York Telephone's proposed $393 million rate increase. Mrs. Pooler, who in the past has demanded that night hearings be held to give working people an opportunity to express their opposition, objected that the hearings will be held on the Monday and Tuesday before Christmas.

title: Prostitution Inquiry Tactics Scored As Too Disgusting for Grand Jury
description: The Manhattan District Attorney's office has declined to investigate evidence of prostitution gathered by private investigators for the midtown cleanup task force, stating that the testimony of the investigators and the practice of using such agents would repel and disgust a grand jury.

title: Favorable View Of Mixed Signs Lifts Dow 2.16
description: The stock market rose slightly yesterday as investors took a favorable view of some mixed economic indicators.

title: Musica Aeterna Gives Colgrass Mozart Letter
description: Composers these days are looking hack. Michael Co!grass in his Letter From Mozart, which had its world premiere last night at Alice Tully Hall, looks way bacK. For a while, anyway. Presumably he intended this 16minute work as a tribute to Mozart, his favorite composer. But this is not rococo Mozart, in the manner of.... Rather it is a collage of Nlozartean ideas filtered through the clever mind of Mr. Colgrass in a very modern manner.

title: In the Name of the Plume
description: Henry Sutton, that exhibitionistic writer of sexy novels, revealed himself in fullpage advertisements some time ago to be a poet named David Slavitt. Similarly. John Le Carr of frigid spy fame has come in out of the cold to point at himself as a fellow named David Cornwall, and Adam Smith of the money games turns out to be none other than George Goodman.

title: Robert Hale Dead; Represented Maine In House, 194359
description: PORTLAND, Mo., Dec. 1 Former Representative Robert Hale died yesterday after he was stricken while on his way to his law office in Washington. Mr. Hale was 87 years old, and had practiced law in Washington since 1959.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The soprano making a debut at the Juilliard Theater looked familiar. In fact, she not only looked like Elisabeth Schwarzkopf but also sounded like that paragon of a lieder and opera singer: the same imperial presence, the same distinctive vocal timbre.

title: News Summary
description: Mexico's new President, Jos Lpez Portillo, asked an end to panicstricken activity in his inaugural address, with political unity and economic austerity to enable the country to overcome its crisis. Among the guests were Secretary of State Kissinger, Rosalynn Carter, wife of the Presidentelect, Jack Ford, son of the President, Lady Bird Johnson and Senator Mike Mansfield. [Page 1, Column 6.]

title: 4 Bandits in Brussels Kill Child, Wound 5 , Flee With $ 175 ,000
description: BRUSSELS. Dec, 1 (UPI)Four bandits stole $175,000 in cash intended for unemployment benefits today and sprayed submachinegun fire across a crowded city square, killing a 4yearold boy and wounding five persons.

title: Surgeon Group Proposes Reforms To Reduce Malpractice Disputes
description: A group of surgeons has urged broad reforms in the malpractice system to cut the $2 billion that such lawsuits cost Americans each year.

title: Stock Exchange, Dogdom Are Streicher's 2 Worlds
description: Five days a week Judson L. Streicher is busy on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange, a specialist handling Walt Disney Productions and 41 other securities. The 53yearold resident of Scarsdale. N.Y., is a member of the elite corps that wears the Buttonwood badge for having had a seat on the Exchange at least 20 years. Weekends the Wall Streeter is hitting a golf ball (he has an 8 handicap), fishing (he's landed big ones off Florida, Mexico and India, and 70pound Nile perch in Kenya's Lake Rudolph) or judging obedience classes at dog shows.

title: Postponement Is Sought In the Paris Conference Of Rich and Poor Nations
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. Dec. 1The cochairmen of economic discussions in Paris between developed and thirdworld countries agreed today to attempt to postpone a final ministerial meeting this month until after the Carter administration takes Office.

title: Grant Is Received To Buy Parklands
description: New Jersey will receive a $1.96 million Federal matching grant to acquire 2,300 acres of land in Bergen and Passaic Counties to be known as Ramapo Mountain State Forest.

title: Key RutgersColgate Call Conceded to Be Mistake
description: The key clipping penalty assessed against Colgate in the third period of last Thursday night's 179 loss to Rutgers was a mistake, according to G. Arthur Hyland, supervisor of Eastern College Athletic Conference football officials. Robert M. (S cot t y) Whitelaw, t h e E. C. A. C. Commissioner, agreed with Hyland yesterday in a rare admission of a bad call by a game official.

title: Toledo Breaks Winning Streak Of Indiana at 33
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Dec. 1 (AP) Toledo University's Rockets, led by Stan Joplin's 21 point. and a tenacious team dceense, edged Indiana University, 5957, in basketball tonight.

title: Theater: Gaelic
description: Eamon Kelly is an Irish storyteller who heard stories from those old lads, his father and his father's friends sitting around a peat fire in Ireland. Now he passes them on to us in a oneman show entitled In My Father's Time. This night of storytelling opened last night at the Lepercq Space at the Brooklyn Academy of Music as the second installment in the current visit to America by the Abbey Theater of Dublin.

title: Chinese Military Regards Manpower as No. 1 Asset
description: NANKING"The role played by the soldier is decisive. The man who knows why he fights and for what he fights will be victorious.

title: Mrs. Ford Asks Drive for Cancer Diagnosis
description: Betty Ford yesterday urged a continuous and vigorous campaign to get American women to take precautions to detect and avert cancer.

title: Agnew's ExPartner Admits He Falsified Tax Return for 1969
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. I (AP) Walter I J. Dilbeck, a onetime business partner of former Vice President Spiro T. Agnew, pleaded guilty to charges of filing a false income tax return, Federal officials said today.

title: Syrian Foreign Minister Wounded
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Dec. 1 (AP)Unidentified assailants shot and wounded Abdel Halim Khaddam, the Syrian Foreign Minister and Deputy Prime Minister, near Damascus today, the official Syrian press agency reported.

title: Despondent Pilot Harasses Town
description: SEAL BEACH, Calif., Dec. 1 (AP)A student pilot, despondent over a broker engagement, stole a twinengine air. plane, buzzed buildings, nearly rammed a police helicopter and threatened to commit suicide before landirq yesterday at a munitions dump and surrendering. the police said.

title: 20 Injured in Delaware Explosion At Crowded FastFood Restaurant
description: NEWARK, Del.. Dec. 1 (AP)At least 20 persons were injured today in an explosion, apparently caused by leaking gas, at a crowded fastfood ?? here, the police said.

title: MEXICO'S NEW CHIEF, SWORN IN, APPEALS FOR END TO CONFLICT
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 1Jos Lpez Portillo was sworn in today as the 60th President of Mexico. He immediately appealed for political unity and economic austerity to enable the country to overcome its present crisis.

title: Carter Job Aim Seen Spurring High Inflation
description: The leading spokesman for the nation's purchasing agents said yesterday that Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's goal of a rate of unemployment of slightly more than 6 percent by the end of 1977 was unattainable without serious inflation.

title: Two Japanese Are Killed in Blaze At Dormitory of American Embassy
description: TOKYO, Dec.1 (AP)A fastspreadingTOKYO, Dec. 1 (AP)A fastspreading at the United States Embassy's apartment compound today, killing two Japanese women, embassy officials reported.

title: Emeralds Cast Their Glow on a Night of Oriental Splendor
description: After going through the receiving line, one of the women guests turned to her companion and asked: Who was the woman with the green?

title: Beanie Rules Out Award Dinner Because Host Is Under a Cloud
description: Mayor Beame yesterday canceled a dinner appearance he had earlier agreed to make, after learning that its sponsor had been a target of harsh Congressional: criticism and was under Federal investigation for its handling of the summer freefood program for children.

title: Percy Sutton Says South Africa Promised, Then Denied a Visa
description: MASERU, Lesotho, Dec. 1 (AP)Percy E. Sutton, the Manhattan Borough President, said today that he was denied a visa to South Africa after one had been promised two days ago.

title: LEONARD MILLMAN, 73, NEWSPAPERMAN ON COAST
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 1 (AP) Leonard Milliman, a West Coast newspaperman, died of cancer yesterday in Merritt Hospital. He was 73 years old.

title: A Carter Ally Sees Move to Federalize Costs for Welfare
description: DENVER, Dec. 1 Jimmy Carter will move early in his administration toward federalization of welfare costs, which could save New York City S500 million a year, a member of Congress who is closely allied with the Presidentelect told city officials here today.

title: THE BOOMIS EMPIRE HAS TUMBLED DOWN
description: Like a sleek new tower rising on quicksand, Christopher Boomis's budding realestate empire has come tumbling down. And in the ruins lie not only a tangle of financial and other troubles for Mr. Boomis and his backers, but an investigation by the Manhattan District Attorney into secret contributions to Abraham D. Beame's 1973 mayoral campaign, allegedly in exchange for help in getting a lucrative building project.

title: Mozambique, Its Economy Waning, Intensifies Drive to Alter Society
description: MAPUTO. Mozambique, Nov. 25When a foreigner here lingered over his lunch at a restaurant the other day, eavesdropping as cooks and waiters sat down to a compulsory session of Marxist indoctrination, he was asked to leave by a polite young man wearing bellbottom jeans and a Tshirt emblazoned Bruce Lee Lives.

title: Chinese Military Considers Manpower Decisive Asset
description: NANKING"The role played by the soldier is decisive. The man who knows why he fights and for what he fights will be victorious.

title: Mexico at a Glance
description: GeographyMexico covers 760,000 square milesan area about onefifth the size of the United Statesof mostly mountainous or high plateau terrain. A coastal plain extends along the Gulf of Mexico from Texas to the Yucatan Peninsula. About half of the country lies below the Tropic of Cancer and most areas are deficient in rainfall for at least part of the year.

title: The New Urbanists
description: It took 189 years for the Federal Government to recognize the existence of cities with the creation of the Department of Housing and Urban Development in 1965. At that time the urban crisis seemed to have particular urgency; it had not yet become a clich or been announced out of existence by a later Administration.

title: A New President of Mexico With a DowntoEarth Manner
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 1During the endless roundtable sessions in the campaign for the Mexican presidency, Jose Lopez Portillo would often ask how many speakers remained to be heard. Nine, sir, he might be told. Well, one more is enough. he would reply. Impatient with verbosity and mere rhetoric. the 56yearold Mr. Lpez Portillo. who began a sixyear term as President today, is expected to bring a downtoearth style of government to a country where words often seem as important as deeds.

title: Premier of Turkey Calls U.S. Embargo Threat to Strength
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Dec. 1 (AP)Prime Minister Suleyman Demirel of Turkey sairt today that the United States arms embargo was threatening to make Turkey a weak friend on the border with the Soviet Union and that he lacked spare parts for Americansupplied military equpment.

title: Priest Denies Sexual Charge
description: WINCHESTER, Tenn., Dec. 1 (UPI) The Rev. Claudias I. Vermilye Jr., a 47yearold Episcopal priest charged with operating a pornographic homosexual ring, pleaded not guilty to all 16 counts lodged against hint. Mr. Vermilye is charged with staging homosexual orgies for the young boys living at his farm for wayward teens.

title: Article 1  No Title
Carter Aide Finds InterestConflict Rules Hard to Draw
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1A close adviser to Presidentelect Jimmy Carter said today that it was more difficult than had been expected to draft ironclad guidelines for avoiding all conflicts of interests for prospective high officials in the Carter administration.

title: SCIENTIST IS HOPEFUL ON WORLD RESOURCES
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 1M. King Hubbert is one of those unusual figures of history who made himself unpopular by being right.

title: News Conference on Rise in Steel Called Off by Ford Administration
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 The Administration's price monitors were all set this morning to focus a disapproving spotlight on the steel price increases that went into effect today.

title: Curbing Conventional Arms
description: While world attention has been focused on the SovietAmerican competition in strategic nuclear armsand Leonid Brezhnev only this week called for progress on SALT negotiationsa far more expensive and perhaps more dangerous arms race in conventional weapons has been getting under way.

title: Insurer Who Held Sole Contract With Suffolk County Is Indicted
description: George P. Tobler, who until recently held the exclusive insurance contract with Suffolk County. was indicted yesterday for allegedly diverting $200,000 from a trust ?? for county and other employees to his personal use.

title: B. BERNARD WOLSON
description: B. Bernard Wolson, a lawyer in Toledo, Ohio, for 40 years, died there of a heart attack on Tuesday at Mercy Hospital. He was 64 years old. Mr. Wolson, a graduate of Ohio State University, was president of the Economic Lawyers Association in 1959. He was a former editor of the Commercial Law League Journal of America. Two daughters, Alexa Forman and Rita Nachtrab, survive.

title: Exchange's Access Moves Drawing Bitter Oppositon
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Dec. 1 Dissatisfaction among floor members with the moves now under way by the New York Stock Exchange to provide greater access to its facilities, which publicly erupted three weeks ago at a stormy membership meeting, is continuing to fester among floor brokers, traders and specialists.

title: A 210Foot Antenna in Australia Is Again Receiving Signals From Viking Spacecraft
description: TIDBINBILLA, Australia, Nov. 29For Thelast two days the giant 210foot dish antenna here has again been receiving signals from the Viking spacecraft that is in orbit around Mars. The resumption of signals came after a threeday intermission while Mars went behind the South Pole region of the sun.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP)Arittrak announced today that it would raise:passenger fares on many of its eastern routes on Dec. 15 and on most western routes on Feb. 1.

title: Jersey Physicians To Be SelfInsured
description: TRENTON, Dec. 1Members of the Medical Society of New Jersey voted overwhelmingly today to set up a physicianowned company to provide medical malpractice insurance to doctors across the state.

title: In Memoriam
description: DENTONJulius (Jules) died Dec. 1964. You are still missed by your many friends and myself.

title: World News Briefs
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 1 (Reuters)Four hundred American businessmen and Soviet industrial and trade officials called today for an end to United States legislation that bars credits and tariff concessions to the Soviet Union unless it eases its emigration rules.

title: Rubin Carter Calm At Time of Arrest, Policemen Testify
description: PATERSON, N. J., Dec. 1 lne police officers who apprehended Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis testified today at their second murder trial that neither man acted in any way nervous or as if they had done something wrong that he would have to hide.

title: Feldman Case Is Debated
description: The case of Matthew Feldman, the State Senate president who pleaded guilty this week to paying a bribe to a restaurant official to obtain business for his liquor company, has evoked a wide range of reaction, Because not even the law views what he did as heinous the maximum Federal penalty is a $6,000 fine, and state law treats it as violation of fairtrade regu

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: A Step Beyond Flamenco
description: There is Spanish dance and Spanish dance. For too many people, it is synonymous with flamenco. And yet flamenco, the heelstamping passion of the Andalusian gypsies, is only one part of Spain's dance heritage.

For Children
description: Films

title: Taxpayer Revolt Closes Schools In Putnam, Conn.
description: PUTNAM, Conn., Dec. 2 Four children were iceskating today on a pond. Two more were in Pat's General Store, buying bubblegum. A small boy was with his mother in her classes at the University of Connecticut.

title: Theater: Grim Times At the American Place
description: FIRST for the good news. From now onward the American Place Theater will no longer be an exclusive club, but will accept regular boxoffice bookings for its

title: Rubicon for Devolution
description: For better or worse, Britain's Labor Government has crossed the Rubicon on devolution for the United Kingdom. It has presented to Parliament a bill 116 pages long, providing for establishment of legislative assemblies for Scotland and Wales and the surrender by Westminster of extensive powers to both. In all probability there can be no turning back from the most important constitutional change proposed for Britain in this centurv.

title: Vast Arrays of AirRaid Shelters Tunnel Under China's MainCities
description: DAIREN, China  With a confident smile the hotel manager pushed a button. The wooden floor of the rather dingy room slid aside, revealing an entrance to the tunnels of Dairen, which are more than 60,000 yards long and can shelter 50,000 people from air attacks.

title: Soviet Wartime Posters in Columbia Display
description: A collection of 17 World War II posters from the Soviet Union will go on display at the Russian Institute of Columbia University today. The posters are from the private collection of Louis G. Cowan, a lecturer at the school's graduate school of journalism.

title: CAREY TURNED DOWN IN BID TO FILL POST
description: Mario M. Cuomo, the New York Secretary of State, has turned down Governor Carey's request that he succeed Patrick S. Cunningham as Democratic state chairman, sources close to the Governor reported yesterday. The rejection by Mr. Cuomo was viewed oy Carey advisers as not only embarrassng to the Governor but also to his next choice for the state chairmanship, who will obviously be a second choice.

title: Miss Giordani of Italy Triumphs In Giant Slalom at World Series
description: BORMIO, Italy, Dec. 2 (AP) Claudia Giordani of Italy foiled a strong shoWing by the American team and won the women'.; giant slalom at skiing's World Series todaN.

title: Independence Parade in Bangui
description: NDJAMENA, Chad, Dec. 2 (Agence FrancePresse) The eCntral African Republic's armed forces staged a parade in Bangui today at the opening of independence celebrations. According to the Bangui radio. The parade included majorettes in miniskirts and members of  national womens organizations.

title: GOLDWATER ENTERS RACE TO LEAD PARTY IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP) In a surprise move. Senator Barry Goldwater entered the race for Senate Republican leader yesterday.

title: Egypt Bids U.N. Set Geneva Talks
description: UNITED NATIONS. N.Y., Dec. 2 Egypt officially asked the General Assembly today to start preparations for convening a comprehensive Geneva peace conferrenece for the Middle Last early next year.

title: ANACONDA JOINS OTHERS IN CUTTING COPPER PRICE
description: The Anaconda Company yesterday joined Asarco Inc. and the Phelps Dodge Corporation in cutting copper prices by 5 centS a pound. The Kennecott Copper Corporation, the leading domestic producer has so far resisted the move.

title: Businessman Once Close to Carter Is Subject of Wide Fraud Inquiry
description: ATLANTA, Dec, 2 An unconventional businessman who was a close friend and supporter of Presidentelect Jimmy Carter is the focal point of a wideranging Federal investigation into alleged business fraud and accusations that money from organized crime was funneled into the business community here.

title: Bobick to Fight in Garden, But Opponent Is Question
description: Under conditions that are as changeable as the weather and Muhammad Ali's intentions, Madison Square Garden has set up a news conference for Monday. The Garden is expected to announce that unbeaten Duane Bobick will fight Ken Norton sometime in February at the Garden. but between now and Monday it is possible that Ali may decide not to retire after all.

title: BOND DEALERS TORN BY A NEW QUESTION
description: BOCA RATON, Dec. 2 Brokerdealers in municipal bonds are being pulled apart by a pressing question: whether to join with commercial banks that underwrite such bonds in a new autonomous organization called the Public Finance Association.

title: CARTER GETS PLEDGE BRENNEV WILL SHUN CRISIS TO TEST HIM
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 Presidentelect Jimmy Carter has been advised by Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist Party leader, that the Soviet Union will go out of its way to avoid any, crisis with the United States early in the new administration, a Carter spokesman said today.

title: Verity of Armco Says Increase Is Justified by Costs and Demand
WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: Friday

title: EXPREMIER RUMOR LINKED TO LOCKHEED
description: ROME. Dec. 2 A committee of Parliament today accused a former Italian Prime Minister, Mariano Rumor, and two former Defense Ministers of corruption and fraud in bribery scandals involving the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation. The committee, which has been conducting an inquiry for nine months, directed the charges against Mr. Rumor and Luigi Gui and Mario Tanassi, former Defense Ministers.

title: Irish Defense Minister Demoted After Criticism of His President
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 2 (Reuters) Defense Minister Patrick Donegan, who called President Cearbhall 0 Dalaigh a thundering disgrace six weeks ago, was transferred to the lesser post of Lands Minister today.

title: Candidates for Next Cabinet
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 2 The group ca economists and business executives who met with Presidentelect Jimmy Carter in Plains, Ga., yesterday from whose ranks he is said to be ready to pick a number of his Cabinetlevel advisers  includes some conservatives along with the many mod. erate liberals. Even the conservatives, however, with couple of notable exceptions, are advocates activism in the effort to bring the pool and discriminatedagainst into the mainstream of the economy.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: GIFT BOOKS. They seemed fewer but better this year, so tougher to winnow. If some of the following selections, which are ranked more or less from cheap to expensive, seem more lavish in visual appearance than in verbal content, why then so much the better. When it comes to gifts, you always judge a book by its cover.

title: FreeWheeling Governor of Louisiana Is Showing Strain
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 2 Louisiana's freewheeling Cajun Governor, Edwin W. Edwards, is becoming uncharacteristically flappable. There is speculation that he is tiring of politics.

title: Bridge:
Article 8 No Title
Topless in a Cake, She Upsets the Party
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Dec. 2 (AP)  A party given by Conservative lawmakers that featured a woman who popped topless from a cake has sullied the dignity of Parliament, opposition Laborites declared today. They demanded that action be taken against those responsible.

title: HalfFare Plan for Pupils Starts on Dec. 15
description: Mayor Beame's office announced last night that the Transit Authority would initiate a halffare program Dec. 15 on a twomonth trial basis for as many as 177,000 schoolchildren who used public buses to and from school.

title: Soybeans Futures Up for Fourth Day; Oats Also Advance
description: CHICAGO Dec. 2 (AP) Soyhean futures advanced today for the fourth straight session in most months on the Chicago Board of Trade, porting a gain of 6 cents a bushol.

title: CARTER FAILED IN BID ON STEEL PRICE RISES
description: AMERICUS, Ga., Dec. 2 Jimmy Carter's official spokesman in effect conceded today that the Presidentelect's attempt to dissuade the steel industry from rasing prices had been a failure and strongly indicated that Mr. Carter would make no further efforts to do so until after his inauguration Jan. 20.

title: Theater: Gauguin in Tahiti, A Touch of the South Seas
description: In keeping with the principles of the Theater of the Open Eye, Jean Erdman's Gauguin in Tahiti is an attempt at total theater at combining elements of dance, drama, music and the visual arts. Some of those elements are more effective than others. Starring Kevin O'Connor as Gauguin. the play opened last night in the Open Eye's theater on East 88th Street.

title: At the Movies
description: LOTTE LENYA is Clara Pelf, the originator of a muscular therapy called pelfing, and she pelfs Burt Reynolds. I mean she really pelfs him, said Walter Bernstein, who wrote the screenplay for Michael Ritchie's SemiTough, a .David Merrick production that will begin shooting next month in Dallas, with a cast that includes Kris Kristofferson, Jill Clayburgh and Robert Preston. Presumably, the film will bear no more than a subliminal similarity to Dan Jenkins's bestselling lark about a pair of lusty, boozing football buddies. It's a romantic triangle now, Mr. Bernstein reports. In a way, it's like one of those old Philip Barry comedies, only updated and set in a football background. Mr. Bernstein, who is 57 and says he is going on 30, is as busy as a filmschool graduate determined to set Hollywood afire with his talent. This spring, The Betsy, his adaptation of Harold Robbins's picaresque potboiler in which Laurence Olivier will portray an automotive titan patterned after Henry Ford, will shift into gear, and he is now writing The Electric Horseman for the producer Ray Stark.

title: How Offices and Plants Will Treat Christmas Eve
description: With Christmas falling on a Saturday this year, do companies plan to treat Christmas Eve as a holiday?

title: People and Business
description: President Valery Giscard d'Estaing of France. after a visit with President Giovanni Leone and Premier Giulio Andreotti of Italy, called for a meeting of all industrialized nations some time in the first half of 1977.

title: 12 House Democrats Ask Inquiry Into Alleged Bribery by Koreans
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 Twelve Democratic Representatives urged the House ethics committee today to investigate allegations that South Korean lobbyists bribed and otherwise corrupted American Congressmen.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A realty clerk for the United States Department of Housing and Urban Development was indicted in Newark on charges of soliciting bribes from five people who wanted to buy or repair homes. The clerk, Victor Smiley, 28 years old, of Newark, was charged with soliciting bribes ranging from $150 to $300 from four people to influence their applications to buy homes from the department or to repair homes purchased from the Federal Government. Mr. Smiley worked at the department's Newark office.

title: Events and Openings
description: Friday

title: Article 1 No Title
Safety on Ski Lifts Being Upgraded
description: BOULDER, Colo., Dec. 2=Ever since New Hampshire instituted compulsory state government lift inspections more than 15 years ago, the movement to provide greater uphill ride safety for skiers has broadened. Lift inspections by state experts are now compulsory almost Lver3,.where. Nevertheless, occasional breakdowns in lift systems occur. Only last Friday night, more than 100 skiers were stranded for about 90 minutes on a chair lift at the Lake Eldora resort, which is situated at this city's back door. It was almost midnight before they all were brought to safety.

title: From Russia With Soul, He Sings Gypsy Songs
description: One of the durables of the Soviet stage is the Moscow Gypsy Theater, where, to the unutterable boredom of overflow audiences, the actors perform plays on the theme of Soviet Gypsies giving up their flighty ways for the joys of collective farming. But wait. For some reason that bears no relation to the plot, there is a wedding, the whole kolkhoz breaks into songs of wild Gypsy gaiety, and the audience beams.

title: U.S. Plans Deep Drilling in Spring For Nuclear Waste Burial Areas
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 Seeking a final resting place for uncelear power plant waste, the United States Energy Research and Development Administration plans to start deep drilling next spring in at least several of a list of 13 states, including New York, officials said here today.

title: Art People
description: THE FUR IS FLYING again in the Mark Rothko case, a year after the momentous decision made in Surrogate's Court to oust the executors of the late artist's estate for mismanagement. The case itself is on appeal to the New York Supreme Court, but a new charge has been made involving the multimilliondollar Mark Rothko Foundation, set up by the artist for charitable purposes, and slated to get half the income of the estate.

title: A CADET IS INDICTED IN ALLEGED HAZING
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Dec. 2 James Savino. a 21yearold Reserve Officer Training Cadet, was indicted today in the killing of a fellow cadet in what the grand jury called a hazing.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: New York City has applied for Federal rent subsidies covering 4,000 units under a Federal project aimed at reducing housing rehabilitation expenses through special labormanagement agreements to lower labor costs. Mayor Beame said the program involved agreements between employers associations and building trades unions providing for a lower wage scale for major rehabilitation projects. Under the Federal Housing and Urban Development Department project, the city must agree to a 25 percent reduction in wage scales for the projects.

title: The U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Mexican Leader's Rallying Call at Inauguration Gets a Mixed Reaction
description: MEXICO CITY, DEC. 2 The new Mexican {resident's call for economic austerity, political unity and an end to panictricken and frantic activity was applauded today by many Mexican businessmen and foreign bankers. But some leftist groups expressed fears that the austerity would primarily hurt peasants and workers.

title: RUMOR,EXPREMIER, LINKED TO LOCKHEED
description: ROME. Dec. 2 A committee of Parliament today accused a former Italian Prime Minister, Mariano Rumor, and two former Defense Ministers of corruption and fraud in bribery scandals involving the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation.

title: RADIO
description: Music

title: Oakland Airport Closed Briefly
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 2 (UPI) Oakland International Airport was shut down overnight after a fire swept through a restaurant under the control tower, causing an estimated $250,000 damage. There were no injuries, but, until dawn, planes were diverted to San Francisco Airport, across the bay, while firemen put out the blaze and workmen cleaned up the burned area, on the secondfloor observation deck.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Legislators Split Over Estimates Of State Revenue
description: As Governor Carey begins the process of huddling with aides on the 197778 state budget, some Democrats in the Legislature are hinting that revenues will run nearly $600 million short of what. is absolutely needed, while Republicans are suggesting that the Governor will have up to $600 million to play with after mandated programs and automatic increases are budgeted.

title: Japanese Team Leads U.S. By Stroke in Tournament
description: HARIMA. Japan. Dec. 2 (AP) Haruo Yasuda, former World Cup player, shot a fiveunderpar 67 today and led the Japanese team to a onestroke lead over the United States in the $100.000 United StatesJapan professional golf tournament.

title: Why Anita O'Day Is Japan's Sweetheart
description: Anita O'Day, fresh from what has become an annual tour of Japan, is now making what has become an annual appearance at Michael's Pub, 211 East 55th Street, where she will be singing until the first of the year. Tanned and freckled, Miss O'Day celebrated her 57th birthday on Oct. 15 in Japan, where she was given a party in, of all places, a Chinese restaurant.

title: TV WEEKEND
description: THE MOST ramming th;s weekend is Chinatown which has nothing to do with the Roman Polanski film o; the same name. Unlike the movie, however. this documentary is actually about Chinatown, in this case New York's wellellknown tourist attraction. The hourlong documentary, produced by the Downtown Community Television Center, which is based in Chinatown, will be followed on Channel 13 by a 30minute panel discussion. Both presentations will be simultaneously broadcast in Cantonese on radio station WBAIFM. It is estimated that the metropolitan area contains mere than 100.000 Chinese residents who do not peak English.

title: Ellinghaus to Axelson
description: When William M. Eliinghau. sepped down from the Emergency Financial Control Board yesterday after having served in several capacities since the beginning of the New York City fiscal crisis, Governor Carey correctly described the telephone company 0::ecutive as a model of the most desirable blend of government/private sector expertise \orking together for the common good.

title: 2 MEN MEET AT PLAINS TODAY
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 2  Cyrus R. Vance, former Deputy Secretary of Defense under President Johnson, is virtually certain to be named by Presidentelect Jimmy Carter as his Secretary of State, according to sources in contact with Mr. Carter, Vice Presidentelect Walter F. Mondale and their aides.

title: Antiques
description: THERE IS FAR MORE than highstyle Wei, Tang, Sung and Ming in the artistic development of China and its neighbors, as scholars, collectors and museums are now demonstrating. Some convincing evidence is now on view in two superb exhibitions in East Side galleries that focus on unconventional ceramics and the robust traditions of Asian peoples.

title: Public Service Gets License to Run First Unit of Huge Nuclear Plant
description: HANCOCKS BRIDGE, Dec. 2 The Public Service Electric and Gas Company announced today that it had received a license to operate the first unit of its Salem generating station here. The unit is the first of four in a nuclear facility that is to become one of the largest in the wnriri

title: Restaurants
description: SNUG INTIMATE surroundings, an open fireplace, sepiatone photoniurals of forest scenes and very good food make dinner at the La Fortis on East 60th Street a most rewarding experience. Add to that a pleasant bar, moderate prices and courteous, unpretentious service, and you have the winner that this twomonthold restaurant certainly promises to be.

title: Broadway
description: THERE WERE SOURPUSSES who did not like Jacques Demy's movie The Umbrellas Cherbourg, calling it sentimental. They said that Bambi was more provocative and Blossoms in the Dust had more class. Still, Umbrellas won five Oscar nominations; it got the grand prize at Cannes in 1964; it enhanced Catherine Deneuve's career, and it left behind it the song I Will Wait for You. Various producers have flirted with the idea of doing it on Broadway, and now a man who has never been on Broadway before says he will. He is Kobi Jaeger, who has produced for movies and television here and in Europe, and who is, he says. a Cherboure freak.

title: Reps McFall's Tie to Seoul Lobby Draws Attention to Slush Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 Representative John J. McFall's involvement with the South Korean lobby has turned the spotlight on a subject many members of Congress would prefer remained in the shadows: the office account.

title: F.T.C. Rejects Heublein's Plan In Antitrust Suit
description: The Federal Trade Commission yesterday rejected a proposal of Heuhlein Inc. for clearing itself of antitrust charges growing out of Heublein's acquisition of United Vintners Inc. of San Francisco. The F.T.C. has now expanded the cornplaint, which originally was issued in 1972, and again charged that the acquisition of United Vintners, then one of the two dominant wineries in the United States, was anticompetitive. Heublein, based in Farmington, Conn., is a leading marketer of alcoholic beverages. It paid $33 million for an 82 percent interest in United Vintners in 1969.

title: Radical Palestinians Said to Flee Lebanon and Take Refuge in Iraq
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Dec. 2 (AP) Radical Palestinians, many escaping on rusty freighters to Cyprus from Syrianoccupied territory in Lebanon, have gathered in Iraq to mount a terrorist campaign against moderate Arab governments, diplomatic sources say.

title: Suspension of City College Paper Reversed
description: Dr. Robert E. Marshak, the City College president, yesterday reversed a decision by the StuCent Senate to suspend The Campus, the 69yearold student newspaper, on the ground that the senate had violated Board of Higher Education guidelines by denying the weekly its right to due process.

title: Commodity Price Index Declines 0.9 From the WeekEarlier Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials fell to 197.3 from 198.2 last week.

title: Where Do the Yankees Get It?
description: How come you didn't buy anybody today? an impertinent visitor asked Gabe Paul, and the president of the New York Yankees twinkled a little and said: We're in a slumn.

title: Rep. Howe Wants Verdict Upset
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 2 (UPI)Representative Allan T. Howe, convicted of a minor sex offense that ruined his political career, today asked the Federal District Court to set aside the guilty verdict. Mr. Howe, a freshman Democrat deteated Nov. 2 after his conviction for soliciting sex from two police decoy prostitutes, filed an amended petition for a writ of habeas corpus.

title: Copland Joins Bridgeport Arts Event
