description: MARSEILLES, France. Dec. 3 (UPI) Gratien Tonna, French middleweight boxing champion, defeated Bob Payton of the United States today, The referee halted their scheduled 10round fight in the seventh round.

title: Mom and Pop Groceries Dying Under Competition
description: For 23 years, Albert Rainaldi and his wife, Pasqualini, have owned and operated a small corner grocery few miles east of downtown Pittsburgh. After all tne years, they have come to regard their regular customers almost as part of the family.

title: Patents
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 Industry is increasingly storing information in computer memories and would like to get it in clearly spoken words. The head of the acoustics research department at Bell Telephone Laboratories, Murray Hill, N.J., has been working to help computers clarify their speech.

title: Golden Quits City Council to Seek Borough Presidency in Brooklyn
description: Howard Golden resigned from the New York City Council today to devote all of my efforts to win the Democratic nomination next year for a full fouryear term as Borough President of Brooklvn.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: JAMES POLITIS, 55, FLUTIST WITH METROPOLITAN OPERA
description: James D. Politis, who played first flute with the Metropolitan Opera orchestra for the last 25 years, died of cancer Thursday at Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 55 years old and. lived at 1 Lincoln Plaza.

title: Issel and Thompson Spark Nuggets
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Dec. 3 Tiny Archibald was not the game's high scorer tonight, but who could ask for anything more? He poured in 26 points, and collected a New York Nets teamrecord 16 assists and beat the 1976 deadline for bestactor nomination by faking an injury, so that the Nets could get an extra timeout with three seconds to play.

title: Nutcracker, Like Santa, Defies Time
description: So little Marie has overeaten again at the Christmas party and visions of sugarplums are dancing in her head. The Nutcracker is back.

title: A FAMILY QUARREL IS FATAL FOR YOUTH
description: GARFIELD, Dec. 3A 15yearold youth, shot two days ago by his ailing, 64yearold father during a family quarrel, died today in St. Mary's Hospital in nearby Passaic.

title: CARTER, IN REACTION TO BREDINEV, VOWS ARMS CURB ACTION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3Presidentelect Jimmy Carter responded today to an appeal by Leonid I. Brezhnev and promised that he would move aggressively to get deadlocked negotiations for a new treaty curbing strategic arms off dead center.

title: Agriculture's Folly
description: Earl Butz may be gone from the Department of Agriculture, but his spirit lingers on. During Mr. Butz's tenure there was an unending series of bureaucratic efforts to chip away at the effectiveness of food programs designed to help lowincome people. The decision of the Administration to drop a special sample of 5,000 lowincome families from the nationwide Household Food Consumption Survey next April is a continuation of that ignoble tradition.

title: They Laughed When the Professor Gave the Pork Chop a Pineapple Juice Injection
description: If Nicholas Kurti opened a restaurant, one of his desserts would be vacuum meringue.

title: U.S. Yields on State Mining Rules
description: CHEYENNE, Wyo., Dec. 3 (AP) In move hailed by Interior Secretary Thomas S. Kleppe as a states rights landmark, the Federal Government consented yesterday to an agreement giving state reclamation standards for coal mining on Federal lands precedence over conflicting Federal standards.

title: Yukobovsky Is Buried in Moscow; Soviet Leaders Honor Marshal
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 3 (UPI) The Soviet Union gave a hero's burial today to Marshal Ivan J. Yakubovsky, commander of Warsaw Pact forces.

title: U.S. to Give Manila $1 Billion in Aid To Keep Right to Use Military Bases
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 The United States has reached a tentative agreement with the Philippines to give Manila $1 billion in economic and military aid over the next five years in return for continued use of Philippine military bases, State Department officials said tonight.

title: IDLED POLICE ANGRY OVER REHIRING OFFER; Most at Boisterous Meeting Reject New York City Corrections Posts as Others Delay Decision
description: About 200 New York City police officers, angry and boisterous at times, yesterday turned down, or delayed their response to, offers from the city to rehire them as Correction Department officers.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Monsanto Company of St. Louis announced yesterday plans to close next month the polyester plant of its wholly owned Olympia Industries subsidiary in Tuscaloosa, Ala.

title: Center's Troubles Began When City Cut Off Funds
description: The crisis at Our Children's Center began last January when the city decided that it had to slash its daycare allocations by $15 million and stopped providing funds to 2S centers.

title: Arts Fund in Westchester Is Termed a Success
description: PURCHASE, N. Y., Dec. 3 Kitty Carlisle Hart, the new chairman of the New York State Council on the Arts, likened the arts to Blanche DuBois in A Streetcar Named Desire as having always relied on the kindness of strangers.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Friday.

title: Leigh Danenberg Is Dead at 83; Retired Connecticut Publisher
description: Leigh Danenberg, a retired newspaper publisher, died yesterday at his Westport, Conn., home. He was 83 years old.

title: For Francis Plimpton, A City Greeter's Job Can Be Labor of Love
description: A black Cadillac limousine pulled up in front of City Hall at 3:15 P.M. yesterday, and a tall, lean, distinguishedlooking man wearing silver  wirerimmed spectacles emerged. He climbed the steps, walked into the Mayor's office, took off his coat and waitedfor the Mayor of Vienna to arrive.

title: Will Leave Pitt Day After Sugar BowlBlackman Is Top Candidate for Cornell
description: Johnny Majors, the 41yearold coach who took the University of Pittsburgh football program to the top in just four years, has responded to the lure of his homeland and accepted the job as head coach and assistant athletic director at the University of Tennessee, his alma mater.

title: U.N, Unit Votes to Ban Environmental Manipulation
description: UNITED NATIONS N..Y, Dec. 3A draft treaty that would seek to outlaw munipulatien of the environment for military or hostile purposes, was approved today by the General Assembly's Political Committee.

title: CHARLES D. COXE
description: Charles D. Coxe, a metallurgical engineer, died Ithursday at his Fairneld, Conn., name. He was 66 years old.

title: HIGH COURT PUTS OFF GILMORE EXECUTION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 The Supreme Court indefinitely postponed today the execution of Gary Mark Gilmore to give itself more time to consider his case. Mr. Gilmore was to have died before a firing squad in Utah at sunrise on Monday.

title: Bridge:
description: During the last deal of the last event in last week's fall nationals in Pittsburgh, one table suddenly became highly conspicuous. For reasons that were obscure to staring players from surrounding tables, Gail Moss of New York and Jeff Hand, an American now living in Panama City, Panama, were leaning back in their chairs and laughing uncontrollably.

title: 170,000 Transformers For Phones Recalled
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (UPI) The American Telephone and Telegraph Company announced today the recall of 170,000 transformers used to light the dials of Princess and Trimline telephones because they might overheat and catch fire.

title: Giscard to Seek Summit Talks Among Industrialized Nations
description: PISA, Italy, Dec. 3 (UPI)President Valery Giscard d'Estaing of France says that he will propose a new meeting of the leaders of Western industrialized nations and Japan in the first half of next year.

title: Financially Straitened New York Awaiting the Inauguration of Carter
description: A lot of subway trains in New York City are still carrying those car cards with Jimmy Carter saying, I guarantee that if I go to the White House, I'll never tell the people of the greatest city on earth to drop dead.

title: Overtures of Reassurance
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 With his first two Cabinetlevel appointments, Presidentelect Jimmy Carter has offered reassurance to the worlds of business and diplomacy and signaled to politicians that he will dominate policymaking in the crucial areas of foreign affairs and the budget. He has underscored the urgency he feels to move quickly in both figs by announcing ahead of all other Cabinet appointments his choice of Cyrus R. Vance as Secretary of State and Bert Lance as director of the Office of Management and Budget.

title: Warfare Corrodes Almost Every Aspect of Life in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland  A smartly dressed young man recently walked into the Slevins pub in the center of Belfast and casually sallied up to the bar to order his pint.

title: For Francis Plimpton, A City Greeter's Job Can Be Labor of Love
description: A black Cadillac limousine pilled up in front of City Hall at 3:15 P.M. yesterday, and a tall, lean, distinguishedlooking man wearing silver wirerimmed spectacles emerged. He climbed the steps, walked into the Mayor's office, took off his coat and waitedfor the Mayor of Vrenna to arrive.

title: U. S.  to Give Manila $ 1 Billion in Aid To Keep Right to Use Military Bases
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The United States has reached a tentative agreement with the Philippines to give Manila $1 billion in economic and military aid over the next five years in return for continued use of Philippine military bases, State Department officials said tonight.

title: Dance: A Warm Sophie Maslow
description: The playful serenity of Sophie Maslow's choreography today gives no clue to the Sturm und Drang of her early experiences as a dancer. Her company presented a program of three works Thursday at the Theater of Riverside Church that were youthful in outlook with scarcely a hint of the darker forces that course through our experience.

title: Youth Indicted in Knife Slaying
description: A 16yearold youth from Levittown, L.I., was indicted by a Nassau County grand jury on a charge of seconddegree murder in the knife slaying of George Fodor, 18, on Thanksgiving night. The suspect, Barry Caputo, pleaded not guilty in County Court in Mineola, L.I., and ball was set at $20.000. if convicted, he could receive a prison term of from 25 years to life.

title: Around the Nation
description: TOLEDO, Ohio. Dec. 3 (AP)loledo's public schools closed for the year today for lack of money, sending 56,000 children home on early vacation until Jan. 3.

title: Casino TeachIn Arranged for Tonight to Herald Atlantic City's Future
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Dec. 3Casinos are not supposed to arrive for a year or more, but Reese Palley, the flamboyant art dealer, wants to be ready. Tomorrow night, he will stage a formal dress casino teachin at the Howard Jonnson Regency for 1,000 selected guests. Mr. Palley, who in 1972 chartered a pair of 747's to fly his customerguests to Paris to celebrate his 50th birthday, is spending $100,000 for roulette wheels, craps and card tables. It will be like the real thing in every respect, with one differenceplay money with Mr. Palley's picture on the bills will be used. Each gambler will have $10,000.

title: ... Lance for Budget
description: Unlike Mr. Vance, the Presidentelect's choice for director of the Office of Management and Budget is an unknown quantity to most of the nation, a selfstyled country banker from GeorgiaThomas Bertram Lance.

title: InnerCity Housing Drive Planned
description: TRENTON, Dec. 3After two years of working with private programs, housing officials here believe they have developed the programs that will bring together the concerted efforts of state and local governments, as well as the private sector, to help end the decay of housing in innercity neighborhoods.

title: Kennecott Leads Cut In the Price of Copper
description: The Kennecott Copper Corporation, the largest domestic copper producer, led the parade yesterday in joining its competitors in cutting prices for electrolytic copper cathodes by 5 cents to 65 cents a pound.

title: Puetz to be Married
description: Garry Puetz, the Jets right tackle, and Cindy Weeks of La Plata, Md., will be married next Friday. Miss Weeks is the sisterinlaw of Joe Fields, who plays center a few feet away from Puetz. The prospective bride and groom met at Fields's wedding last February.

title: U.S. Banks Lead Lebanon Return; National of Chicago Opens Monday
description: LONDON, Dec. 3 (Reuters) Big American banks are leading a return to Lebanon by the international banking community. As hopes rise of permanent peace there after 19 months of civil war, the bankers have decided it is safe to go back to Beirut, set up business again and count the costs.

title: Cepeda's Sentencing Delayed
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Dec. 3 (AP) The sentencing of Orlando Cepeda, former major league baseball star who was convicted on two drug charges, was postponed today until Dec. 16 in United States District Court here. Cepeda was found guilty of possessing and importing 170 pounds of marijuana to Puerto Rico from Colombia. He faces a maximum of 10 years in jail and $30,000 in fines.

title: RAYMOND GERMAIN,EDITOR; FOUNDED LAS VEGAS SUN
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 3 (UPI) Raymond Germain, founder of The Las Vegas Sun and the University of NevadaLas Vegas, died at a convalescent hospital yesterday. He was 68 years old

title: Great South Bay Patrols Pursue the Clam Pirates
description: BABYLON, L.I.With clam prices expected to rise after their usual autumn slump, the clam pirates of the Great South Bay are coming out in force.

title: Israel Asks U.S. to Approve Eventual Sale of 250 F16's
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3Israel has asked the United States to approve formally the sale of 250 F16 fighter planes in coming years, Administration officials said.

title: JOBLESS RATE IS 8.1%, HIGHEST OF THE YEAR
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 The national unemployment rate rose from 7.9 percent to 8.1 percent in November, its highest level this year, despite an apparent strong gain in the number :f persons with jobs, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Bee Gees Perform With Focus on Disco
description: The Bee Gee's lush string arrangements, sweet harmony vocals and lyrics devoted to teenage love were anomalies in the late 1960's, when the group began making hit records. Now that the middle of the road has lost some of its 60's stigma, the group is back, and although its newer records sound more like disco than like adolescent pop, the teen appeal remains intact.

title: Boston Combat Zone Becomes Target of Police Crackdown
description: BOSTON, Dec. 3 An adult entertainment district established by city officials here two years ago has become the object of heated controversy and the subject of a sudden, swift police crackdown.

title: A Toy Is Recalled From the Market
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP)Some imported shioments of an inexpensive blowup toy trailed Blobo BubbALoons have been found to contain a hazardous chemical and will be remoted from the United States market.

title: Vance Is Selected By Carter to Run StateDepartment
description: PLAINS, Ga., Dec. 3Presidentelect Jimmy Carter announced today that he had chosen Cyrus R. Vance to be Secretary of State and an old Georgia political ally, Bert Lance, to be director of the Office of Management and Budget.

title: Met Radio Broadcasts to Resume With Kollo in Lohengrin Today
description: This afternoon at 1 o'clock, a phrase that has sent thrills of anticipation through millions of listeners since 1940 will be heard again over a vast radio network reaching to all corners of the United States and Canada. Consisting of just five words, the phrase delivers a mighty message: Texaco Presents the Metropolitan Opera.

title: Article 3  No Title
Jets Piccone Poses Threat For Redskins
description: Offensive linemen are supposed to be the most sensible football players. So it was logical that an offensive line coach was given this twopart problem yesterday:

title: Ulster Catholic Sees British Ready to Leave
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 3A leading Roman Catholic politician and former Government minister said today that Britain had made an irreversible decision to pull out of Northern Ireland, despite protests to the contrary.

title: Judge Rules Woman CanDie With Dignity
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 3 (AP) Circuit Judge John Cox ruled today that a 26yearold Jacksonville woman being sustained by lifesupport systems. should be allowed death with dignity.

title: MARKET ADVANCES OVER BROAD FRONT, OUTPACING THE DOW
description: A firm tone, reflecting a new sense of optimism in Wall Street, prevailed in the stock market yesterday as the broad list of issues performed better than the popular Dow Jones industrial average.

title: Article 4  No Title
Sports Today
description: AUTO RACING

title: BANKER AND BUSINESSMAN BAR JOBS UNDER CARTER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 A. W. Clausen and Irving S. Shapiro, who had been reported to be the two leading candidates for Secretary of the Treasury under Presidentelect Jimmy Carter, have asked that their names be withdrawn from consideration.

title: CARTER, IN REACTION TO BREZHNEV, VOWS ARMS CURB ACTION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 Presidentelect Jimmy Carter responded today to an appeal by Leonid I. Brezhnev and promised that he would move aggressively to get deadlocked negotiations for a new treaty curbing strategic arms off dead center.

title: Companies Report on Sales and Earnings
A Skilled and Realistic Negotiator
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3  It seemed inevitable to the foreign policy world that Presidentelect Carter would select Cyrus Roberts Vance to be his Secretary of State. Among those who were consulted, everyone respected him and no one opposed mm. What Mr. Carter and his aides heard about the tall, slender and graying Mr. Vance when they telephoned around the country was that he was solid, a healer, a liberalmoderate Democrat who strongly favored dtente with the Soviet Union and arms control, a skilled negotiator who used no gimmicks, cautious and selfeffacing, a realist who worked within a consensus but who had streak of moral idealism.

title: Many Problems Affect Jamaican Economy
description: KINGSTON, JamaicaRegardless of which party wins the forthcoming general election on Dec. 15, The Daily Gleaner commented editorially the other day, the state of the economy is such that it will he many months, or years, before there is recovery.

title: World News Briefs
description: CAPE TOWN, Dec. 3 (AP)  The police arrested 120 people today in sweeps though the Guguletu and Nyanga black townships outside Cape Town, bringing to nearly 300 the number jailed after two nights of riots and arson.

title: Dorothy Ainsworth, 82, Authority On Physical Education for Women
description: Dorothy Sears Ainsworth, an internationally known authority on physical education for women, died Thursday at Moline, Ill., nursing home. She was 82 years old and until recently was a resident of Northampton. Mass.

title: Lance Says He'll Sell Bank Stock To Avoid Any Conflict of Interest
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3Bert Lance, Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's nominee for director of the Office of Management and Budget, said today that he would sell his $3.5 million interest in the National Bank of Georgia to avoid a conflict of interest with his duties in the Carter administration.

title: Speer Says Steel Rise Will Have A Very Minor Effect on Economy
description: Edgar B. Speer, chairman of the United States Steel Corporation, said yesterday that only the marketplace would determine if the $6aton increase on sheet and strip steel would hold.

title: Town Meeting for the Elderly Is Scheduled for Fort Greene
description: A town meeting dealing with such problems for the elderly as neighborhood crime, housing needs, health care and social recreational prbgrams will be held Dec. 13 under the sponsorship of the Central Brooklyn/Fort Greene Ad Hoc Senior Citizens Coalition.

title: STAMPS
description: Philately is not only concerned with stamp collecting; it also gets involved in the realm of art, the realm of history and in all the many realms of man's culture and achievement. This is brilliantly and lovingly reaffirmed in a just published book that turns out to be this year's book to give a philatelist for Christmas. Or for a philatelist to give to himself or herself.

title: Six Football Players and a Coach Who Cared
description: A few years back, In an agonizing sexoffense case at the University of Notre Dame, Ara Parseghian emerged as one of those coaches you read about in inspirational sports novels. Fortunately for six of the Fighting Irish, he was based on a reallife characterhimself.

title: A Bel Canto Baritone Named Bing Crosby
description: It's easy to say, it has often been said, and it's true, that there is not a popular singer today who does not owe something to Bing Crosby. Not a popular singer over 30, anyway. Younger singers owe more to Elvis Presley and the black blues, rhythmandblues and gospel singers of the 50's and 60's.

title: Some Long Island Wells Suspected of Containing Carcinogenic Chemicals
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec, 4Organic chemicals, some of which are suspected of causing cancer in laboratory animals, have been found in some public water wells in the Bethpage, Hicksville and Levittown areas, Federal, state and local officials said after a meeting this week.

title: The Races Are Gentlemanly and the Promises Are Unreliable
description: WASHINGTONSenator Russell B. Long of Louisiana tells a story on himself that illustrates the particular perils in running for election when the electoral process is secret ballot by one's colleagues.

title: D. A. Gardner Fiance Of Lynn Shostacsk
description: Glenna Lynn Shostack, a vice president of Citibank, and David Alan Gardner. senior vice president of Oppenheimer Properties Inc., an affiliate of Oppenheimer & Company, investment bankers, plan to be married Jan. 7.

title: Rabbi Calls Smoking Breach of the Law
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 4 (AP)A Tel Aviv rabbi says smoking is had not only for your health but for your soul.

title: Oregon Towns Find School Money
description: EAGLE POINT, Ore., Dec. 4Schools in this southern Oregon city are to reopen Monday after being closed for 33 days for lack of money.

title: Births
description: Ceresney

title: Rasmussen Looks With Hope to '77 Jets
description: Some very old football players will play some very young ones today when the Washington Redskins face the Jets at Shea Stadium.

title: How to have an artfull weekend
description: Don't miss the art news, reviews, criticism and advertising every Friday in the separate Weekend section of The New York Times, and every Sunday in the Arts and Leisure section.

title: Deborah J. Danziger And John W. Britten, Broker, Are Married
description: In St. Bartholomew's Episcopal Church yesterday afternoon, Deborah Jean Danziger, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frederick Skinner Danziger of Flint, Mich., became the bride of John Willard Britten, son of Mrs. H. Nelson Hartstone of Marion, Mass., and Manalapan, Fla., and the late Col. John Willard Britten, U.S.A.

title: Hawley Wins 2 Races To Reach 3,000 Mark
description: TORONTO, Dec. 4 (AP)Sandy Hawley became the youngest jockey to reach the 3,000 mark in career victories when he won the fourth race at Greenwood Race Track today. Hawley, 27 years old, entered the day with 2,998 winners and came within one with a victory in the third race.

title: Nassau's BudgetMakers Get a Warning
description: MINEOLA

title: 66 Whooping Cranes Set Record
description: ARANSAS PASS, Tex., Dec. 4 (UPI)Biologists have counted a record 66 whooping cranes that made the 2,500mile trip to the Aransas National Wildlife Refuge from Canada this year. The count this year showed 54 adult birds with 12 young, Last year there were 57 birds wintering in Texas.

title: Adelphi: The Sound of Culture
description: WEST MILFORD

title: Tobacco Is a Dirty WeedThey Loved It
description: If people want to smoke, it's their business, says Jacquelyn Rogers, president and founder of SmokEnders Inc. But if they want to quit, she continues. then it's our business.

title: Roberta, Ga., Exemplifies Integration Gains
description: ROBERTA, Ga.Back in 1964, if you lived in or around a little central Georgia farm town like Roberta and were black, as Danny Harris is, you started the first grade at something called the Crawford County Training School.

title: In Summary
description: New York City's Failing Search For That Billion

title: LEONARD BICK WIT, 78, DIES; AN INTERNATIONAL LAWYER
description: Leonard Bickwit, an International lawyer, died Friday on a golf course In Hillsboro Beach, Fla. He was 78 years old end had lived In Hillsboro Beach for the last seven years, after moving from New York City.

title: In Sri LankaPenny Paradise
description: In the year 1293, Marco Polo sailed homeward bound from China, pausing at Ceylon along the way. He wrote: On leaving the island of Andaman and steering for 1,000 miles a little South of West, the traveler reaches the island of Ceylon. This, for its actual size, is better circumstanced than any other island in the world.

title: Commuters Lose Honor System
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Dec. 4An increasing incidence of theft brought to an end this week an honor system here under which commuters tossed coins into an unattended sealed cash box and picked up their morning newspapers.

title: A European Proposal
description: BRUSSELSIn Europe, insurance companies and others are intensely studying a new directive on product liability recently proposed by the Euro. peen Commission, the executive arm of the European Economic Community. The proposed directive, which could become law in all nine Common Market countries within three years, would inipose on manufacturers a large degree of responsibility for the safety of their products and result in far higher product liability insurance premiums. Eventually, it could make it difficult for some companies to obtain coverage at all.

title: BIG MUNICIPAL STAFF VEXING WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Mayor Walter E. Washington, the outwardly unflappable administrator who has headed the District of Columbia municipal government through all of its nine years of semiindependence from Congress, is in the most serious trouble of his long bureaucratic career.

title: Gallagher Is Reported Subpoenaed In Inquiry on South Korea Bribery
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The Department of Justice has issued a subpoena for the testimony and records of former Representative Cornelius E. Gallagher, Democrat of New Jersey, in its investigation of alleged South Korean influencepeddling and bribery, Government and legal sources said today.

title: Music: Death
description: In a preperformance speech at the New York Philharmonic's concert on Friday night, Leonard Bernstein described Shostakovich's Symphony No. 14, which he was about to conduct, as a towering masterpiece. One does not necessarily have to agree with his judgment to find the work very striking and special and to be grateful to Mr. Bernstein for programming it.

title: JOSEPH ROTHENBERG, 75; BERGDORF EXTREASURER
description: Joseph Rothenberg, the former vice president and treasurer of Bergdorf Goodman Inc., died Friday at Lenox Hill Hospital following a brief illness. He was 75 years old and lived at 100 West 57th street.

title: Survey of the Incoming Congress Finds Lawyers Are Biggest Group
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP)A typical member of the House cf Representatives in the next Congress will be five years younger than his Senate counterpart, slightly less educated, somewhat less certain to be a white male, and more than twice as likely to be a Roman Catholic.

title: Oil Price Rise ...
description: The possibility of a sharp rise10 to 15 percent is the consensus expectation in industrial and financial circlesin the price of oil produced by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries starting Jan. 1 is being viewed with alarm by government officials, businessmen and economists around the world.

title: Black Nationalists Differ
description: GENEVA. Dec.4The white Government delegation remained an interested but passive spectator today as balck nationalists at the conference on Rhodesia clashed over how to establish an interim biracial regime to prepare for formal independence from Britain under black rule.

title: Dessoff Choirs Presents Works By Mozart and Motets by Bach
description: The 52yearold Dessoff Choirs, which, despite the name, is one chorus, went through drastic reorganization last spring. A series of reauditions of the then 97 members resulted in the retention of only 53. To this number were added 12 rigorously auditioned new members, and the resultant ensemble now numbers 65. It is by choice, therefore, the smallest of our major amateur choruses.

title: Christina Chrysler French Wed On L.I. to Grant Aubrey Porter
description: St. John's of Lattingtown Episcopal Church in Locust Valley, L.I., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Christina Chrysler French a greatgranddaughter of Walter P. Chrysler, the automobile manufacturer, to Grant Aubrey Porter, a greatgrandson of the 13th Earl of Huntingdon.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
The Old Barbershop: A New Classic
description: When Margie O'Connor took over the faltering, 25yearold barbershop at 1099 First Avenue with the idea of turning it into a unisex hair salon, she was faced with a problem: How to decorate the small shop in the slick, contemporary fashion that is the unisex look while, at the same time, preserving the charm that was the classic barbershop.

title: Wild Burros a Legal Problem
description: ROSWELL, N.M., Nov. 27In February 1974, 19 unbranded and unclaimed wild burros were rounded up near here after a rancher complained that they were bothering his cattle.

title: Second Sunday Concerts in Leonia
description: LEONIA

title: Cooking
description: But novelty is the universal crynovelty by hook or by crook, wrote Escoffier in 1907. It is an exceedingly common mania among people of inordinate wealth to exact incessantly new or socalled new dishes and to seek new sensations for blase palates, he continued with an observation that is equally true today. And it is probably that mania that accounts for the unending annual flow of cookbooks, each claiming to offer new sensations.

title: CAMERA VIEW
description: Compared to blackandwhite pictures, color photographs are relatively new  there are many blackandwhite negatives and prints in existence that are more than a century old, but few color photographs are more than 50 years old. The first color plates were put on the market in 1907 by Lumiere of France. and both Alfred Stieglitz and Edward Steichen exhibited their work with the Lumiere Autocnrome piates m New York in Nov., 1907 (manufacture of Autochrome plates was stopped in 1932).

title: Dr. Elizabeth Wood Married to Colleague
description: Dr. Elizabeth Bridget Wood of Boston and Dr. Terrance Murphy of Brookline, Mass., were married yesterday by Msgr. Charles McCarthy, head chaplain of St. Elizabeth's Hospital of Boston, in St. Gabriel's Roman Catholic Church in Brighton, Mass.

title: Some Fear the Teenage Unemployed Are a Time Bomb
description: Of all the gloomy statistics in the monthly reports on national unemployment, the most somber always are those dealing with joblessness among teenagers. The November report, issued last week by the Federal Bureau of Labor Statistics, was no exception. It showed 1.7 million youths between 16 and 19 looking for work they could not find.

title: Revisiting the Southern mind
description: H. Brandt Ayers of Anniston, Ala., one of the last newspaper owners in the United States who cart write, set to thinking last summer. In anticipation of Jimmy Carter's election to the Presidency, he reasoned that all Southerners should be admitted to the Carter White House without question, through the back door like home Folks. But Northerners, he figured, should have to pass a test to get in. He devised the Yankee Literacy Test

title: Serious World Food Gap Is Seen Over the Long Term by Experts
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 3  The world food situation, currently favorable as a result of good weather in most growing areas, remains precarious for the near future and potentially disastrous over a longer term, in the view of specialists who addressed a meeting here.

title: DINING OUT
description: THE LIBRARY is informal and unpretentious but it has real style. The walls are lined to the ceiling with Salvation Army selections and discards from the Port Washington Public Library. Orderly rows of green glass library lampshades, hanging low over the tables, punctuate the dimness with attractive circles of light. Green and white check tablecloths and dark green banquettes blend in perfectly. The food is wellprepared, nicely served and reasonably priced. Dinner isn't big production. I am enthusiastic about restaurants like this.

title: Will Congress Reform Its Own Campaigning?
description: WASHINGTONThe shapers of political change, more often carpenters than architects, have learned a number of lessons from the great experiment of 1976 that will most certainly guide their hand in reconstructing the campaign law for 1980. or even earlier.

title: Diagnosing Pilgrim State
description: WEST BRENTWOOD

title: ShortChanging the Residents of Nursing Homes
description: IN a misguided attempt to alleviate severe financial problems, the State Health Department is endangering the welfare of the elderly and infirm. Prompted in part by revelations of financial scandals, this department has refused to recognize the legitimate increases in costs for the last two years. Nursing homes on the Island and throughout the state choose whether to close up or reduce the quality of care they provide. Either alternative will cause too much unacceptable human suffering.

title: Fire in Tokyo Bar Kills 6
description: TOKYO, Dec. 4 (UPI)A fire in a bar on the top floor of a threestory building here early today killed six persons, authorities said. The police said that the six victims, four men and two women, were employees of the bar, which had closed for the night before the fire started.

title: A $1,000Lunchbox Made of Ostrich Leather
description: Nobody is quite sure what David Rockefeller carries in his old, weathered, brown and bulging attach case, but it's fairly clear that the Chase Manhattan Bank chairman has grown attached to itor else he would have traded it in by now for a newer model in better condition.

title: REMEMBER THE NEEDIEST!
Mexican Nationals In U.S. Jails Hope For Repatriation
description: LEAVENWORTH, Kan., Dec. 4 (AP)Mexican nationals imprisoned here complain of discrimination, language barriers, cultural differences and homesickness and hope for ratification of a treaty that would allow them to serve out their terms in Mexico.

title: Joanna Simon, Mezzo, Wed
description: Joanna Simon, the concert and opera singer, and Gerald Walker, novelist and arts editor of The New York Times Magazine, were married yesterday afternoon in a civil ceremony at the home of the bride's mother, Andrea L. Simon, in Riverdale, the Bronx. The ceremony was performed by Justice Sidney H. Asch of the New York State Supreme Court.

title: Arabs Protest at Hotel As Jewish Group Begins A Conference in Madrid
description: MADRID. Dec. 4 (AP)Jewish leaders from 17 European nations met in Madrid today for what they said was the first legal meeting of Jews in Spain, other than religious services, since the Inquisition.

title: Crafts
description: You can laugh if you want to, but of the 47 books on crafts and related subjects currently blocking access from my desk to anywhere else in the house, the one that brings the warmest rush of emotion to my heart is something called THE INTERNATIONAL BOOK OF WOOD, edited by Martin Bramwell, foreword by Hugh

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: CETTING a dog in New Jersey is like coming of age in Samoa. Sooner or later, it happens to everyone in the vicinity. Companion animals will be listed for the first time in the United States Census or 1980, so I can only offer a rough esOrnate of 1,428,571.2 dogs in the state; however, there is no doubt that they hold a position of importance.

title: The Father Christmas Letters
description: The first letter I ever wrote went not to a friend but to a stranger who, I was told, dropped down people's chimneys on Christmas eve and left presents like an eccentric millionaire. As foretold by my parents, the presents I asked for arrived. But what I really wanted, and sever got, was an answer from the mysterious giver.

title: RESPIRATOR SHUTOFF SEEN AS TRIAL ISSUE
description: A 17yearold Islip, L.I. schoolgirl who suffered extensive brain damage in an apparent mugging, was pronounced dead on Thursday while she was being sustained with the aid of a respirator. The death certificate was signed, with the consent of her parents, by the family doctor and by the head of the Suffolk County Medical Society.

title: Around the Nation
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 4 (UPAmalgamated Transit Union officials said that they will recommend to 2000, striking Port Authority Transit employees that they comply with a court order and return to work.

title: JOHN C. DILLON JR.
description: John C. Dillon Jr., founder of the J. C. Dillon Company Inc., a printing concern at 100 Avenue of the Alnericas, died last Tuesday in the New Jersey Medical Center. Neptune, N.J. His age was 81.

title: Ouster of Korean C.I.A. Chief Believed Linked to Defection of Agent in Washington
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 4 (AP)President Park Chung Hee today dismissed the head of the Korean Central Intelligence Agency, apparently in connection with the defection of a top Korean agent in Washington, and dismissed or reassigned five Cabinet ministers.

title: The Super Bowl Jets: What They Remember And Where They Went
description: The moment was golden, and he never has to work at remembering it. There is always something there to remind him of the 1969 Super Bowl. His Super Bowl. It is gilt by association. May be he'll be watching a football game, or listening to his car radio and a song like Stoned Soul Picnic or Wichita Lineman will come on; they were big that year. And suddenly, without even trying, Joe Namath finds himself laughing, laughing out loud, getting a tingling feeling up and down his body.

title: Measles Epidemic Kills 78
description: MANILA, Dec. 4 (AP)An epidemic of measles has killed 78 persons in a village near Davao City, 600 miles south of Manila, The Philippine Evening Press reported today. The newspaper quoted Lieut. Col. Manuel Magbutay, head of a military branch dealing with rural problems, as having said that the rest of the population in the village, Dalag, was being inoculated.

title: Fashion
description: Jewelry  crafted of precious metals, set with precious stones  makes a beautiful gift and, like a fine wine, becomes more valuable with age. The jewelry shown on these pages is both old and new: There are contemporary classics made of gold, which is becoming popular again after being eclipsed by silver, authentic Art Deco pieces and Victorian antiques.

title: Nuclear Realignment
description: When the fact of the atomic bomb and the awesome implications of nuclear energy first became known more than 30 years ago, Congress responded by creating the Atomic Energy Commission and establishing its own Joint Committee on Atomic Energy. Both these institutions did much good work, but in the last decade it gradually became apparent that together they had became an intellectual cartel, closed to outside ideas and hostile to anything that might impede the promotion of nuclear energy.

title: Is a Leaning Tree A Property Liability?
description: Damage resulting from ice and galeforce windstorms cause some homeowners to worry about leaning trees. If the storm knocked down a limb or a large portion of the tree, will the whole tree come down?

title: Art
description: To hear some people talk, you'd think that the writing, publishing, distributing and selling of art books was a desperate business. What does the author get after five years hard work? Two lines in a Christmas roundup here and there and a royalty of 1.7 percent. What can the publisher expect? Nothing but trouble with artists, trouble with color, trouble with reproduction rights. What does the distributor get?

title: Learning to live with dying
description: Orville Kelly sat up late one night recently in the upstairs office of his home in Burlington, Iowa, reading his mail, which mostly consists of letters from cancer patients or their relatives. his window looked out over the town to the dark Mississippi beyond, and train whistles echoed below it. Framed newspaper clippings covered the walls of the room. Listen to a Dying Man. read the headline on one that was turning yellow.

title: Who Collects How Much
Education House of Cards?
description: EDUCATION has fallen upon difficult. days. And rightfully so. For we both collectively and individually, have not been as forceful as we should have been in the defense and support of high academic standards. We thus undermined the very foundations of education. We have permitted the overpoliticization of our campuses. We have permitted a widespread decline of academic stndards. We have permitted grade inflation.

title: C.A.B. to Study Air Route Shift
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP)The Civil Aeronautics Board will investigate whether Trans World Airlines should he allowed to turn over to Southern Airways its authority to fly between Nashville and the cities of St. Louis, Atlanta, Miami, Fort Lauderdale and Tampa, the hoard announced yesterday. The two airlines had asked the baud In approve the plans, which they had worked out previously.

title: DECLINING BIRTH RATE IS TROUBLING FRENCH
description: PARIS, Dec. 4Throughout 1976 France has been debating what to do about its ?? birth rate

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: WASHINGTONA loud wail is emanating from the corporate boardrooms of America, beating upon the ears of insurance executives, Federal bureaucrats and members of Congress and the judicial system.

title: Oakland U. to Levy Athletic Tax
description: ROCHESTER, Mich., Dec. 4 (AP)The trustees of Oakland University have voted to levy an athletic fee on the 10,500 university undergraduates next September to defray costs of athletic programs. The fee will be $5 a term for undergraduates taking at least 12 credit hours and $3.50 for those taking less than 12. Graduate students will not be taxed, the trustees decided Tuesday.

title: Memorial Services
description: BEVANFrank. A memorial service will be held on Saturday. Dec. 11, at 3 P.M., In Dwight Chapel on yale CAMPUS In New Haven, Conn.

title: Carey Forms Task Force to Help In Shaping Regional Water Policy
description: Governor Carey has announced the formation of a task force to help develop policies for a regional water supply system in New York's populous southeastern section.

title: Future Events
description: Throw a Snow Ball

title: BRITAIN SAID TO PLAN CUT IN BUDGET FOR I.M.F. LOAN
description: Britain's Labor Government has agreed reluctantly to trim $5.8 billion from its anticipated budget deficit in the coming two years for a loan from the International Monetary Fund. Time Magazine reports in its current issue.

title: Experimental Music Takes a Trip to the Art World
description: The November calendar of the Center for New Music listed 35 events devoted exclusively to new music. The curious thing about these experimental events is that, while they comprise about a third of the new music activity, they have little to do with the official music world. In almost every case these programs did not take place in concert halls, were not sanctioned by the musicians union, were not booked by concert agencies, were not Supported by private music foundations, did not involve conductors, were not licensed by music publishers, and were not reviewed by the music magazines. Some of these events took place in gallery spaces, some received financial support through intermedia and video sources, and it is safe to say that they all drew a significant percentage of their audience from the SoHo art crowd.

title: French Designers Boutiques Show Up in Unlikely Places
description: PARISFavorite French designers are opening new boutiques in the most unexpected places.

title: Treasure in an Auto Junkyard
description: RONKONKOMA

title: Wine
description: Grapes and wine booksthey have mom in common than one might think. They both seem to ripen and come to market at the same time. Just as the last grapes are being plucked from the vine and the juice is beginning to hiss and boil in the fermentation tanks, the first of the newest batch of redwiththemeatandwhitewiththefish books appears on the shelves.

title: Kiernan H. D. O'Sullivan To Wed Judith L. McNatt
description: Judith Lee McMatt and Kiernan H. D. O'Sullivan plan to be married on Feb. 26. Mr. and Mrs. Eugene M. McNatt of Bronxville. N. Y., have announced the engagement of Mr. McNatt's daughter, to the son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Daniel O'Sullivan of New York.

title: CenturyOld Engine Pumps Hearts
description: RICHLAND. Wash., Dec. 4 (UPI)With an eye to the future, scientists have reached into the past and refined a 100yearold engine design that they hope may someday be the core of the first artificial heart implanted in a human being.

title: Title for Ridgefield Park
description: Tom Dougherty's placement following a 1yard touchdown burst by Tom Franco gave Ridgefield Park a 76 victory over previously undefeated Northern Highlands in the North Jersey Group 4 championship game yesterday at Giants Stadium in East Rutherford before 7,000 fans.

title: Dressing Up to the Executive Suite
description: There's a Harvard M.B.A. in Citibank's World Corporation Group who is tall and slim and wears threepiece suits. Lots of men do. But the banker thus described happens to be Sarah Kinsman. As one knowledgeable observer has noted, All the women on Wall Street wear threeniece suits.

title: In Memoriam
description: BERGMANNHans. In loving memory of our dearest husband and father who passed AWAY Dec. 7, 1975.

title: Judith V. Berry Is Married to John Ingraham
description: Judith Vinson Berry, daughter of Mrs. Donald Brawner of Tulsa, Okla., and Robert Webster Berry, also of Tulsa, was married yesterday afternoon to John Winthrop Ingraham, son of Mr. and Mrs. David Ingraham of Cold Spring Harbor, L.I., and Lyme, N.H.

title: Stiff OilPrice Rise Is Expected To Finance OPEC's Development
description: The Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries will be unable to keep oilprice increases down to the level of inflation and still generate enough income for internal economic development, according to an article in the winter issue of Foreign Policy magazine.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: THIS is the season when those New Jersey homeowners who are fortunate enough to have a fireplace normally look forward to cozy winter evenings with family and friends.

title: Home Clinic
description: Q: One of the 12x12 wooden sills in our old house (which dates from 1830) cellar foundation developed a pocket of rot about the size of a football due to rundown fern a leaky gutter. The gutter has been repaired and we gouged out the rot and packed mortar into the cavity. Once the rotted wood has been removed and dryness is restored will rot of this kind cease for good, or is there a chance it will continue to spread inside the sill?F.A.M., Albany, N.Y.

title: Nature
description: A few weeks ago a woman fell off a cruise ship into the last true wilderness left, the ocean. Lucky for the woman that the ship, on all the vast, limitless face of the ocean, was able to retrace its precise path and find her three hours later. The navigational method was most interesting: The captain merely followed the line of garbage and trash the ship had cast in its wake.

title: Letters: A Protest On Passport Profits
description: To the Editor:

title: LETTERS TO THE LONG ISLAND EDITOR
description: Patchogue's Pride And Satisfaction

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Eleven men and four women were arrested and $6,000 in cash seized when the police raided the East Wind Club, a gambling establishment at 345 East 80th Street off First Avenue early yesterday morning. About 200 smartly dressed customers were in the club when the police broke in.

title: Ricky's Message and Where It Went
description: WATER is something that people like to throw things into. There is an irresistibility about an aqueous void that almost commands people to toss things into it. The Island, having been itself cast into the water eons ago, is one of those places where people are always finding or throwing things in the waters around it.

title: Casting Around: Who Else Could Play Pinter?
description: The first role was created by Sir John

title: InsectEating Plants Will Thrive in Terrariums
description: Charles Darwin called them the most wonderful plants in the world. Others called them death traps and man eaters and said they had dangerous and evil powers. Admired or feared, carnivorous plants are, without a doubt, one of the most fascinating plant forms.

title: Woman in Wheelchair, 75, Defeating Despair
description: The way Mary L. tells it, suicide seemed like the logical thing to do.

title: BIDS TO BE PROCESSED FOR SUMMER FOOD PLAN
description: ALBANY, Dec. 4In a series of meetings across New York State, the State Education Department will begin processing applications from providers who wish to participate in next summer's foodservice program.

title: A Correction
description: In the issue of Nov. 14, an article on apartment security (Locked Up: The Safe Life 1 incorrectly stated that only one gate was authorized for a window on a fire escape under the state's Multiple Dwelling Law. Actually, a second onethe NoLock gate manufactured by Albert Udin Inc. is also authorized.

title: Flames 1, Blues 0
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 4 (AP)Curt Bennett's shorthanded goal in the first period supported the 13th career shutout by Dan Bouchard as the Atlanta Flames tonight stymied the St. Louis Blues, 10.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Portugal's Municipal Elections Dec. 12 Are Expected to Have Wide Repercussions
description: LISBON, Dec. 4Par the third time this year Portugal is in the throes of a national election campaign, with posters and political slogans everywhere and series of rallies and debates in public squares and parks and at farm associations, cooperatives and sports clubs.

title: Drivers Facing License Revisions
description: IT WOULD be more difficult to get a driver's license in New Jersey and harder to keep one under proposed new laws up for debate in the State Assembly tomorrow. The hills already have passed the Senate and have widespread support in the Assembly.

title: Olympic Training Centers Pushed
description: In the most serious attempt to keep America's amateur athletes competitive with statesupported rivals in the Soviet Union and East Germany, the United States Olympic Committee will vote today whether to approve the establishment of yearround national tiaining centers.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: The idea of a convention or show devoted completely to nonU.S. numismatic material was a relative novelty among collectors as well as dealers when the first New York International Numismatic Convention was held in 1972. Foreign coin and paper money collecting was then still regarded as a specialty. It is no longer. The immediate acceptance and continued popularity of the New York show and the success of others like it throughout the country have proved beyond doubt that foreign collecting has been domesticated.

title: In Castile Town The Referendum Is a Sure Thing
description: CUENCA, Spain, Dec. 3The blue and white posters have blossomed on the meandering walls of this backwater town, as they have elsewhere in Spain: Your voice is your vote. Vote, people. Inform yourself well, and vote.

title: ITALIAN WONEN OPEN DRIVE TO CURB RAPES
description: ROME, Dec. 4Thousands of Italian women, upset by rising violence in Rome, including a recent series of rapes, have started a campaign of protest.

title: Fletcher Retires From Reporting on Dog Show World
description: In 1927, the year that Charles Lindbergh piloted the Spirit of St. Louis across the Atlantic in his epochal flight, I arrived at The New York Times. Just as aviation has changed radically in the halfcentury, so has the dogshow world. In 1927, there were 290 allbreed and specialty events. Now there are 1,653. People often ask how I started to write about dogs and it's a rather prosaic story. One day, the sports editor asked me if I'd ever covered a dog show, When I replied, no, he said, Well, you are doing your first tomorrow. It was Queensboro and it was at the old Aqueduct race track.

title: Cardinals Score 2417 Victory Over Colts And Preserve Chance for Playoff Berth
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 4The St. Louis Cardinals tightened up the battle for playoff positions in the National Football League by a few more notches today when they defeated the Baltimore Colts, 2417. Two of the key plays were defensive ones by the St. Louis team, better known for its offensive skills.

title: The Barrens: A Million Acres to Save
description: THE New Jersey Pine Barrens constitutes nearly a million acres of reasonably authentic wilderness in America's most densely populated state and lies within 30 miles of Philadelphia and 50 miles of New York City. But that is only a small part of the reason for saving it.

title: New York City Enters Throes Of Budget Time
description: As winter darkness falls, lights start to go out throughout the Municipal Building and quiet settles in, except on the 12th floor. On the door of Room 1214, a sign says the big room, and the lights there stay on these days and nights and weekends and holidays.

title: Mets Will Begin at Home Against Cards on April 12
description: The New York Mets officially set the date yesterdayTuesday afternoon. April 12to open the 1977 home season in Shea Stadium against the St. Louis Cardinals. They also conceded the end of an experiment with 4:05 P.M. starting times, reducing the number of such games from nine to one because the experiment didn't prove too much.

title: DINING OUT
description: WERNER'S LAKE EDGE is the kind of place everyone remembers good restaurants used to be like: fresh food, good service and a friendly  gemutlich  ambiance. This is the kind of atmosphere that the bigger, more plastic places along nearby Route 22 fail at trying to capture. After dining in a succession of imitation 1890's or 1920's steak houses serving portioncontrolled food right out of the microwave oven, it is a genuine pleasure to come to a restaurant such as Werner's Lake Edge.

title: The FreeAgent Story: Intricate and Lucrative
description: Reggie Jackson, to no one's surprise, snared the most lucrative deal among baseball's first family of free agents, but Gary Matthews and Wayne Garland pulled off the biggest Coups.

title: In Panama A Languid Isle
description: After a 17minute flight from Panama City over clear blue water, the 20seat twinengine prop plane of Aerolinas Islas des Perlas circles over our destination: Contadora Island. The tiny bowtieshaped isle, known to Panamanians as a weekend retreat for the welltodo, is undergoing a face lifting.

title: Miss Stove Gains Final InAustralia
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 4 (AP)Martina Navratilova and Betty Stove, who normally combine to play doubles, will be on opposite sides of the court tomorrow as the singles finalists chasing the $22,000 first prize in the $100,000 Sydney women's international tennis tournament.

title: Schoolboy Halfback Breaks New Jersey Scoring Record
description: Ted Blackwell in the first half became the leading oneseason football scorer in New Jersey high school history, then added a sensational 60yard punt return for a touchdown with only 4 minutes 38 seconds left in the game to give New Providence a 2017 victory over Butler yesterday. The triumph, before 6,800 fans in New Providence, gave Blackwell's undefeated team the championship in North Jersey's Section 2, Group 2.

title: Ethics Guidelines Set for Attorneys Leaving U.S. Jobs
description: With hundreds of lawyers poised to leave Government service in Washington for private practice, a committee of the New York City bar association has published guidelines on just what cases these lawyers and their colleagues can accept.

title: Robin Blaine Is Married To Jeffrey E. Livingston
description: Ruth Robb Blaine, a candidate for a Ph.D. in English literature at Columbia University, was married last evening to Jeffrey Evan Livingston, a lawyer with the New York law firm of Dewey, Ballantine, Bushby, Palmer & Wood.

title: Ideas &Trends
description: Despite progress in recent years toward eliminating sex bias, the gap between the earnings of men and women was greater in 1974, the last statistically complete year, than in 1963, when Betty Friedan launched the women's movement by writing The Feminine Mystique. The disparity is apparently less the result of unequal pay for equal work than of a variety of social factors, including such subtle forms of bias as sex stereotyping, the rigid attribution of certain roles and characteristics to each sex.

title: Wedding
description: ShankinBegonia

title: Once More, The Economy
description: Another set of disturbing statistics has been published, appearing to confirm that Jimmy Carter's first order of business Jan. 20 will be the same as Gerald Ford's preoccupation during his two years in office: a faltering economy, reflected in both unemployment and inflation.

title: Wise Philip $45 Winner At Aqueduct
description: When you run a stakes race in New York at a time of year when the infield ponds are covered with ice, anything can happen.

title: Thomas Charles Cooper 3d, Maine 77, To Wed Kathryn Johnson in February
description: Mrs. Hugh Johnson Jr. of WinstonSalem, N.C., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Kathryn Anne Johnson, to Thomas Charles Cooper 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Cooper Jr. of Greenwich, Conn. A wedding next February in WinstonSalem is planned.

title: Sunday Observer
description: Notes from the popmusic world: Arfie Melina of Ten Cent Coffee, in London to promote Coffee's new album, took off on the British press last week for asking dumb gurstions about her onagain off again relationship with Lips Luscombe. Arfie threat ened to stuff cucumber sandwiches in The Daily Express's presses, then struck the Times man with her pet boa (constrictor) when he asked if Lips had split because he couldn't stand the triple taradiddle in the backup on Arfie's last single (Toothache of My Mind) on the Hohokus label. Lips, playing it cool, turned up at the Baltimore Festival of Rock (3 killed. 28 injured, 118 mugged), playing alto electric saw for Queen's Indian Declined. Lips's agent denied he planned to undergo sexchange surgery at Johns Hopkins after the concert, or any time this month.

title: St. Peter's Five Bows
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y., Dec. 4Mike Hanley outscored the entire St. Peter's starting front line with a 17point effort tonight as Niagara University won, 6961. Ken Slappy and Steve Richardson scored 21 and 16 points, respectively, for the Peacocks, but Bob Fazio was held to 10.

title: Long Island/This Week
description: BALDWIN  The Tales of Hoffmann presented by the Long Island Opera Company; Saturday 8:15 P.M.; Baldwin Junior High School, Pershing Blvd. Tickets $3, the elderly $1.50 and children under 18. $1. 8689794.

title: A Philippine Judge Sentences American Serviceman to Death
description: MANILA, Dec. 4 (UPI)A local judge has sentenced an American serviceman stationed at Subic Bay Naval Base to death for the murder of a nightclub entertainer, a Manila newspaper reported today.

title: 3 Killed in L. I. Car Crash
description: EAST PATCHOGUE, L.I., Dec. 4 (AP) A headon collision on Sunrise Highway today killed three persons and critically injured three others. The Suffolk County police said the accident occurred after Irene Cordano, 24 years old, of Mastic Beach L.I., drove on the wrong side of the divided highway just north of Brookhaven Memorial Hospital. She was killed, along with the driver of the other car, 2Iyearold Nelson Rodriguez, and one of his passengers. Evelyn Munoz, both of Brenwood L.I. Carlos Santiago and Azalea Gonzalez, 20, both of Brentwood, passengers in the Rodriguez car, and Irene Nappo 35, a passenger in the Cordano car, were admitted to Brookhaven Hospital.

title: The Koreans in the U.S. Have Become a Highly Visible Example
description: WASHINGTONIn August 1973, Korean Central Intelligence agents in Tokyo, under personal orders from President Park Chung Hee, kidnapped a Korean opposition leader called Kim Dae Jung and took him back home. The Japanese were furious. Contending that their national sovereignty had been violated, they demanded that Mr. Kim be returned. President Park's Government, correctly sensing that the Japanese Government would feel there was nothing they could do about it, stood fast, and eventually mumbled an apology about overzealous agents. Mr. Kim Is in prison in Seoul today.

title: Tigers Of a Different Stripe
description: IN the glen behind Princeton's Von Neumann Hall, where the university's traditional serenity was broken by one of the largest protest demonstrations of the turbulent 60's, professors now conduct research undisturbed by boisterous picketers.

title: REPUBLICANS IN SOUTH WILL LOSE DELEGATES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  Southern Republican leaders, who successfully blocked reformers attempts to make state representation at the party's national convention more evenhanded, now find that the formula they defended will reduce their delegate strength at the 1980 convention by nearly 25 percent.

title: Bill Offers New
description: SPECIAL treatment for many of New Jersey's 400,000 or so alcoholics may emerge from a bill that is winding its way through the State Legislature. But if it passes, according to the Blue Cross insurance company, the cost of hospital insurance in New Jersey is certain to go up.

title: NEGLIGENCE ON ART TROVE IS LAID TO GREEK BISHOPS
description: ATHENS, Dec. 4 (Reuters)A Government minister has accused Greek bishops of negligence in protecting art treasures and he said he would introduce strong penalties for theft.

title: Ellen M. Rader Is Affianced
description: Mr. and Mrs. George Rader of Livingston, N. J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Ellen Marcia Rader, to Roger Joseph Brick, son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Brick of Westbury, L.I. A January wedding is planned.

title: 8Domed Home Built to Resist Coast Quakes
description: HILLSBOROUGH, Calif., Dec, 4 (AP) Rising from the earth like a cluster of giant warts, an eightdomed home has motorists rubber necking and switchboards in this San Francisco peninsula community buzzing with calls from the curious.

title: Hospitals Pool Purchasing Power
description: WITH costs of medical services rising at an astronomical rate, a group of 16 hospitals in Central and South Jersey have banded together to pool their purchasing power in an effort to reduce expenses and keep their collective nonprofit corporate heads above water.

title: Hundreds Arrested In Norfolk Raids
description: NORFOLK, Va., Dec. 4 (UPI)The police swept through this coastal city in a series of raids last night and made hundreds of arrests on charges of gambling, prostitution and selling illegal whisky.

title: Four Die in Baltimore Fires
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 4 (UPI)Four persons were killed and five others injured, including three firemen, in three fires last night in Baltimore row houses. The dead were identified as Kathleen McNeil, 42 years old; George Carter, 50; Evelyn Ross, 45; and Emmitt Roosier, 59, a paralyzed man who died in a fire at his . home when he accidently set himself aflame while smoking.

title: FRANCE CRACKS DOWN ON EVASION OF TAXES
description: PARIS, Dec. 4The French, who used to consider tax evasion a national pastime and birthright, are feeling increasingly harassed by the Government's determination to collect.

title: Two Planes Collide Over the Hudson River Near the Tappan Zee Bridge, Killing Five
description: GRAND VIEW, N. Y., Dec. 4  Two light planes collided in the air over the Hudson River just south of the Tappan Zee Bridge shortly after noon today, killing at least five persons, authorities said.

title: Nuptials Held On Long Island For Martha Zec
description: St. Stephens Episcopal Church in Port Washington, L. I., was the setting yesterday for the marriage of Martha Zec, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Branko Zec of Beverly Hills, Calif., to Charles Cary Rumsey Jr. of New York and Meeteetse, Wyo. The bridegroom is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Rumsey of Sands Point, L. I., and a greatgrandson of E. H. Harriman, the financier and railroad pioneer. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Frederick W. Rapp and was followed by a reception at the Rumsey home.

title: St. John's Beats Vanderbilt On Williams Baskets, 6353
description: Sometimes basketball players, despite their shooting skills, just can't seem to hit the basket. That's the way it was last night in the first half of the St. John'sVanderbilt game at the Redmen's Alumni Hall. The Commodores shot 25 percent, and the Redmen 35 pereent.

description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 4 (UPOPresident Ford says he has had a lifelong ambition to be a professional baseball player but nobody would hire me.

title: U.S. COURT PERMITS COMPLETION OF I88
description: ALBANYAfter three years of delay, the State Department of Transportation has won a decision In Federal court permitting it to complete a controversial highway between Binghamton and Schenectady, one of the last links In the interstate system in upstate New York.

title: Eating on the Turnpike
description: EATING one's way along the New Jersey Turnpike is fast and inexpensive, but it is hardly a gourmet's delight. There are 13 service areas, roughly al 15mile intervals, that punctuate the stretches between exits on the highway.

title: Claire Fisher Bride Of Stephen Sordoni
description: Claire Robin Fisher, daughter of Mrs. Robert I. Williams of New York and Donald E. Fisher Jr. of Houston, was married yesterday afternoon to Stephen Sordoni of Forty Fort. Pa., san of Mrs. Robert English of Jaffrey, N. H., and the late Andrew Sordoni Jr. of Forty Fort.

title: A Reporter's Notebook: In China, Roads Tell of a Changing Society
description: PEKINGThe teeming roads of China provide a visitor with what may be as clear a view of the progress of this vast society as he is likely to get in a day's talk with officials. Traffic on the roads of Manchuria and eastern China reflects a country grasping eagerly for the new, but not yet far enough along to shuck off the old.

description: The following public hearings were scheduled by New York City Council committees for this week:
