title: Hughes Deal for Home Reported
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 4, (AP)The Houston Post said today it had learned that Howard Hughes was negotiating the purchase of a multimillion dollar home in Houston about two months before his death In April.

title: Janet Mauriello And John Simon To Wed in June
description: Janet Claire Mauriello and John Peter Simon, June 1975 graduates of Lafayette College, plan to be married next June.

title: MEXICANAMERICANS FACE LOSS OF SCHOOL
description: MOUNT ANGEL, Ore., Dec. 4Four years ago, Carlos Manriquez was working in what he considered an unpromising job in an eastern Oregon mill that manufactured wooden moldings. Today, the 43yearold MexicanAmerican is one of 65 fulltime students at Colegio Cesar Chavez, the only Chicano college in the country.

title: MINOAN PORT TOWN EMERGING IN CRETE
description: KOMMOS, Crete, Nov. 30In 1924, Sir Arthur John Evans came to this sandy spot on the south shore of Crete and identified it as the site of a prehistoric town. But the British archeologist, who had previously discovered the palace of King Minos at Knossos, never got the chance to dig here.

title: 40 Prominent Persons Are Named To Help Plan Carter Inauguration
John Warner Weds Elizabeth Taylor
description: Elizabeth Taylor and John Warner, former Navy Secretary, were married yesterday at Mr. Warner's farm outside Middleburg, Va., a spokesman for the couple said.

title: Elizabeth Dubben Bride Of Richard Livingston
description: Elizabeth Dubben, an associate editor at Reader's Digest, and Richard H. Hansford Burroughs Livingston, a project manager in New York for Oivind Lorentzen Inc., the Norwegian shipping company, were married yesterday in Bridgehampton, L.I. The Rev. Leroy Zavadil performed the ceremony in St. Ann's Episcopal Church.

title: It Often Depends on Which Economist Is Reading Them
description: Economic forecasters have at least two things in common with meteorologists. Every year they have more and more data from all over the world on which to base their predictions; and people remember their mistakes. The great recession of 197475, from under which the nation is still struggling to dig itself out, was the economists equivalent of a 15Inch snowfall that followed a prediction of clearer and warmer. So was the great inflation that began in 1973.

title: In Summary
description: Korean Defector Is Helping in Korean Probe

title: Sports
description: This season's sports book draft is one of the richest and most diverse I've seen in years. The following 24 (culled from more than 60) fall, more or less, into three categories: ASerious attempts to approach sports as an aspect of our culture; BFan books on specific personalities, teams or sports; CExpensive textandpicture packages that seem to have been manufactured for expense account giving.

title: Roosevelt
description: (0TB payoffs subject to 5% State tax.)

title: Two New National Dailies Planned in France Could Play a Crucial Role in 78 Elections
description: PARIS, Dec. 4Preparations are under way for the publication here next year of two new national dailiesone appealing to the supporters of the SocialistCommunist opposition, the other to the political center. which backs President Valry Giscard d'Estaing.

title: Conditions at Lincoln Hospital Described as Worse Than on Battlefield
description: The president of the house staff at Lincoln Hospital told the national Joint Commission on Accreditation of Hospitals yesterday that medical and surgical conditions at the new municipal hospital in the South Bronx often were worse than those found at Army field hospitals in battlefield situations.

title: Margo Field Fiancee Of Scott A. Rogers 3d, A Business Student
description: Mr. and Mrs. Laurence Field of Weston and Annisquam, Mass., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Margo Moore Field, to Scott Arthur Rogers 3d, son of Mrs. and Mrs. Rogers of Westport, Conn., and Shaker Heights, Ohio. The couple plan to be married in May.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: HARIMA, Japan, Dec. 4 (AP)Tom Watson of the United States posted a fiveunderpar 67 for a sevenstroke lead in the individual competition today but he and his teammates fell two strokes behind Japan in the team competition at the sixth annual United StatesJapan professional golf match. Nine strokes behind after the second round yesterday, the Japanese carded a 17underpar 559 for a threeround total of 1,702 to 1,704 for the United States team on the 7,I40yard, par72 Harima Country Club course.

title: Brookings Institution Elects a New President
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Bruce K. MacLaury, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis and a former executive of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, has been elected president of the Brookings Institution. He succeeds Kermit Gordon, who died last June. He will assume his duties here Feb. I.

title: Cars
description: To be a car nut, and a Democrat, and not rich, and a salivator after Duesenbergs, and a foe of pollutionto applaud safety regulations and mass transit and the forcing of corporations to be socially responsible, while getting blearyeyed over the passing of the motor age and the great individual marques (come back, Buaatti! Wnere are you now, Invicta?)is to ccurt a certain inconsistency of mind. It's all very well to say one has one's passions, but my passion for cars runs embarrassingly counter these days to a great deal else I care about. Grow up, I command, but this part of me will not. So I tend to keep it private; Road & Track is my monthly pornographic fix.

title: How atoms for peace became bombs for sale
description: The bomb is back. Not the hydrogen bomb of the 1950's, which could turn islands into firmament, or the tactical nuclear weapon of the 1960's, which fell out of favor when it couldn't be used on a Vietcong platoon. The atomic bomb in today's news is a very oldfashioned model, made with a few pounds of plutonium and engineering techniques nearly three decades old. It might be no more devastating than the Little Boy canister that killed 100,000 in Hiroshima and left an equal number to die of burns and radiation sickness. The only thing new about this kind of bomb is who could get it. and how.

title: Fitch High Wraps Up Crown in Connecticut
description: Fitch High School of Groton, led by Joe Addison, defeated Trumbull, 297, yesterday in the first Connecticut Class II football state championship.

title: The Warning
description: Now that the New York Yankees appear to have purchased the World Series by signing Reggie Jackson and Don Gullett for nearly $5 million, remember that the Washington Redskins thought they had purchased the Super Bowl by signing John Riggins, Calvin Hill, Jean Fugett and two other free agents for about $2.5 milion. This, the Redskins owner, Edward Bennett Williams, proclaimed last summer, is the best Redskin team ever. But as the best Redskin team ever awaits today's game with the New York Jets at Shea Stadium, it still has not qualified for the playoffs. And the Redskins most outstanding player is their most underpaid player Mike Thomas, a running back with 1,003 yards and a $30,000 salary.

title: Keeping Score in Adland
description: The ad agency executive who thinks he's left his report card days back on the campus had better think again. Some of the largest advertisers in the nation are making Miss Grundy look like sweetness and light. Now Elsie the Cow is in on the act.

title: Mayor Isn't Target of Investigation On Contributions, Morgenthau Says
description: District Attorney Robert M. Morgenthau of Manhattan said Friday that Mayor Beame was not a target of the investigation his office is conducting into secret contributions allegedly made by Christopher Boomis, the developer, to the Mayor's 1973 campaign.

title: 4 OFFICIALS IN LOUISIANA ARE GUILTY IN KICKBACKS
description: NEW ORLEANS, La., Dec. 4A tourmember majority of the governing body of nearby St. Charles Parish (county) have been convicted here for conspiring to extort kickbacks from architects, engineers and others doing business in the rural and industrial community.

title: Knicks Snap Loss String
description: The Knicks, who had found varioikr ways to lose games in the final quartet over the last two weeks, put together a strong finish last night and defeated the Seattle SuperSonics, 10396, before a Madison Square Garden crowd of 13,964. The victory snapped a fivegame .losing streak. New York staged one of its best defensive shows in the final 12 minutes of playing time. In limiting the Sonics to 12 points, the Knicks pressured Seattle into seven turnovers, blocked four shots, forced the Sonics into a poor selection of shots, controlled both backboards and scored 25 points.

title: Article 1  No Title
Common Market and Third World End Economic Meeting in Togo
description: LOME, TOGO, Dec. 4 (Agence FrancePresse)A threeday meeting of the nine West European Economic Community countries and their thirdworld partners in the 38nation Lome Convention ended here last night after reviewing cooperation since the convention was signed 21 months no.

title: TV VIEW
description: Even in its rare excursions into more demanding material, beyond the pat formats of situation comedy and melodramatic violence, commercial television cannot resist being the great exploiter. NBC recently sent a correction to TV editors advising that the network's A Tribute to American Theater series is now officially entitled Laurence Olivier Presents a Tribute to American Theater. The Olivier name adds to the enterprise a touch of class and a possible ratings booster, especially given the actor's prominence in the film Marathon Man. a current boxoffice hit.

title: THE 65TH APPEAL
description: The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund was established in 1912 by the late Adolph S. Ochs, then publisher of The Times. That year, 117 contributors donated a total of $3,630.88 to be distributed .among three private socialservice aqencies.

title: China Has Worries to the East, Too
description: Stretching from the Pacific to the grasslands of Central Asia, China is the most important military entity in the Orient. But it is troubled, looking anxiously north to the long, vulnerable frontier with the Soviet Union, east to the American security systern in South Korea and Japan and south to the potentially turbulent states that run eastward from Vietnam through Laos, Thailand, Burma and India to Pakistan.

title: News of Realty
description: ELF Petroleum Corporation, a member of the French group of companies known as ELF/Acquitaine, has leased 10,500 square feet of office space on the 37th floor at 9 West 57th Street for 10 years at an aggregate rent of about S1.45 million.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: Fun and Games Along A Crowded Highway

title: FILM VIEW
description: In his new film, Carrie, a selfstyled horror movie, Brian De Palma is having his revenge on a public that hasn't, until now, sufficiently appreciated him by making a lot of us critics look as if we'd become totally unhinged.I don't believe critics are allpowerful, but when we btcome lightheaded, audiences get the hangovers. De Palma has dazzled one of my colleagues to the point of describing Carrie as trash in admiration, not meaning to call it rubbish. In an effort to pin down qualities the film may or may not have, critics have made associations between Carrie and more than two dozen other films, including Jaws, The Wizard of Oz, The Exorcist, Alice Adams, The Last Laugh, Psycho, Marathon Man, Taxi Driver, Splendor in The Grass, Zabriskie Point, Great Expectations, American Graffiti, as well as De Palma's own earlier films, Greetings, Hi, Mom, Get To Know Your Rabbit, Sisters, The Phantom of The Paradise and Obsession. To my knowledge no one has yet brought up Ray's Apu Trilogy.

title: ARCHITECTURE VIEW
description: The mutilation of Fifth Avenuelong the quintessential shopping street of elegant grand luxeis a continuing event. At 37th Street, there is a Burger King in what is left of McKim, Mead and White's old Tiffany Building (Palazzo Vendramini above, Pop plastic shingles below). Recently the government of the Philippines totally obliterated one of the Avenue's best older buildings at 46th Street, originally the home of Knoedler Galleries and subsequently a genteel Schrafft'sa rich stone structure with intricate vermiform rustication and generous classical details. The building promotes tourism now, slipcovered in precast panels with ethnic hut details that suggest reservations for outrigger canoes rather than airline tickets.

title: BRIDGE
description: It has often been said that defense is the hardest part of the game. One can expect to see good bidding quite often, good dummyplay occasionally, and good defense very rarely indeed.

title: Proposed Change in Taylor Law Is Opposed by Police and Firemen
description: ALBANY, Dec. 3Donald H. Wollett, the director of the State Office of Employee Relations, recommended today that arbitration awards in contract disputes involving policemen and firemen be subject to review by the legislative body of the city or town involved.

title: Joseph McMahon Fiance Of Kathryn Sowerwine
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Orvis Sowerwine of Summit, N.J., of the engagement of their daughter, Kathryn Evans Sowerwine, to Joseph Donald McMahon, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas McMahon of Jamaica Estates, Queens.

title: Of Special Interest
description: The major exhibit of the moment at the Hayden Planetarium is its recently opened Hall of the Sun. An entire wing on the second floor has been outfitted with a body of equipment to tell us more about the nature ot the sun: a lighted model of the sun, clocks telling comparative times on planets in the solar system, a laser beam tracing the scaled distance from the sun to the earth, and even a glass model of a raindrop through which a rainbow may be observed. The Facts of the Sun, which are outlined in a Planetarium brochure introducing the new hall, read nearly like a long haiku poem: The sun is as big as a million earths./The sun is an average star./Sunsine powers the wind./Coal is frozen sunshine./A tree is a sunshine trap./All of us are solarpowered. (See Art)

title: TIMES SQUARE BLOCK TO GET FACE LIFTING
description: Once the block was at the lively heart of Times Square. Then it fell on hard times. Then it seemed to revive as the prospective site of a spectacular hotel. And then that plan fell through.

title: Getting To Newark Airport
description: IF the airlines and the Port Authority made even a token attempt at improving accessibility to Newark Airport there could be and probably would be a most dramatic change in use of the airport's facilities.

title: Rhodesian Tourism Hurt By Strife and Depression; Total Shows 50% Decline
description: KARIBA, Rhodesia, Dec. 4 (Reuters)Rhodesia, one of Africa's most beautiful countries, is attracting fewer foreign tourists than at any time since the white minority declared independence from Britain 11 years ago.

title: FarOff Ozone Emissions Imperil Grape Crop in Western New York
description: DUNKIRK, N.Y., Dec. 4 (AP)The grape industry in western New York may choke to death on the ozone emissions of a thousand factories and a million cars in Gary, Ind., Cleveland and other upwind Points.

title: The Amateur and the Pro: Does Any Distinction Between Them Still Exist?
description: 'Still more objectionable than all this was the class of oarsmen they had to compete with, including, as it did, in the elastic terms amateursas understood in Americacoalwhippers, glassblowers, hewers of wood, drawers of water, working mechanics and other handicraftsmen....

title: Tokyo Party Faces Severest Test of Two Decadesin Voting Today
description: TOKYO, Sunday, Dec. 5The campaign loudspeakers were silenced here last night as Japanese voters prepared for an important election today to chose 511 members of the lower house of Parliamembers of the lower house of Parliament. The polls opened today in generaly sunny weather.

title: INVESTING
description: If you want to share in Wall Street's current energy play, you buy a coal stock, an oil stock or a natural gas stock. Right?

title: Halona Wexton Is the Bride Of Joshua Balgley of Queens
description: Halona Wexton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Wexton of Manhattan and Shrub Oak, N. Y., was married last night to Joshua Balgley, son of Mr. and Mrs. Morris S. Balgley of Little Neck, Queens.

title: Scientists Take Issue With the Methods Used By Predictor of Quakes
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 4 (AP)Although he says he has predicted the latest in a worldwide series of strong earthquakes, Henry Minturn will stop issuing forecasts through the press and seek what he calls a more scientific approach. Other scientists, however, are skeptical of his methods.

title: The Artist As Midas
description: IT'S only fair for art to pay for art. Alfonso Ossorio was explaining why he had been selling his collection of valuable modern paintings, most recently Jackson Pollock's Lavender Mist to the National Gallery of Art In Washington for an amount reported to be $2 million. It's fitting that art should support art.

title: Isaac Saufer, Law Student, Fiance of Debra E. Goldberg
description: Rabbi and Mrs. Jacob Goldberg of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Debra Edith Goldberg, to Isaac Aaron Saufer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Solomon Saufer of Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Moscow, on Carter
description: MOSCOWIt is obvious from all authoritative statements and views expressed in Moscow before and after the United States Presidential elections that the Soviet side thinks the consistency of the United States Government in solving international problems is of paramount importance. This is the criterion by which the Soviet Union has, and always will, assess the foreign policy of any American administration, including the one which is emerging now under the Presidentelect, Jimmy Carter.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: I once spent an evening with a celebrated comedian who was in what is called a state of high dudgeon. Seriously. Something had happened to him that had offended himmore than that, humiliated himdeeply, and his sense of injury filled the air for a good 40 minutes. The next night I saw him doing a guest spot on television. He was saying all of the things he'd said the night before, nearly word for word. The routine was hilarious. In a brief 24 hours he'd stepped back from himself, measured his anger, discovered its disproportions and acknowledged its absurdity. Now he was acting his outrage, mocking the fool he'd made of himself in caring about the silly business at all. He had, in recordbreaking time, created comedy out of his hurt.

title: Bob Marley, Reggae Singer, Is Hurt
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, Dec. 4 (Reuters) Bob Marley, Jamaica's leading reggae musician, left a hospital with his wife. Rita, today after treatment for bullet wounds they received in a shooting incident at their home here last night.

title: PEOPLE
description: Later this month, four historians will present a longrange perspective on the importance of the Battles of Trenton and Princeton to the independence of the United States. These two battles duting the cold winter of 200 years ago are being credited with having been the turning point of the Revolutionary War, and a commemorative program will be held, in the Assembly chamber of the State Capitol on Dec. 27, begining at noon Speakers will include J. Duana Squires, chaarrnan or the New Hampshire Bicentennial Commission; Charles E. Lee of the South Carolina Department of Archives and History Jhns T. Cunningham, chairman of the New Jersey Historical Commission, and Richard P. McCormick, dean of Rutgers College. At 2 P.M. on Dec. 26, Gordon Myers, a music professor at Trenton State College, will lead the Bicentennial singers from that school in their 226th and final performance of Yankee Doodle Fought Here. They will perform in the State Museum auditorium.

title: 2 Nazi Hunters Ousted From Munich Rally at Site of Hitler Putsch
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Dec. 4 (AP)Serge and Beate Klarsfeld. who have demanded more severe punishment for war criminals, were evicted from a rally of rightists tonight at the beer hall where Hitler launched the abortive putsch of 1923.

description: MONTCLAIR

title: Canadiens 3. Penguins 1
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 4 (AP)Doug Jarvis scored his sixth goal of the season with 8 minutes 48 seconds remaining in the third period tonight to clinch a 31 victory for the Montreal Canadiens over the Pittsburgh Penguins.

title: LifeSupport Ended, a Woman Dies
description: JACKSONVILLE. Fla., Dec. 4 (AP)A 26yearold woman whose vital functions were controlled by machines for two stepped breathing today 13 ?? after he was disconnected from the devices on the order of a judge.

title: The Tennis Clinic
description: Some average tennis players spurn the lob because they consider it a sissy stroke, a feeble riposte that is somehow a confession of weakness. But intelligent use of the lob isn't sissy tennis. It's smart tennis.

title: Endpaper
description: Although there are a number of worthwhile hooks on cinema, there are many more that are not. A large proportion of these appear at this time of year when impulsebuying virtu:111v becomes the American Way, Gifthunters are advised to exercise discretion in approaching the following titles, described verbatim from their publishers calalogues:

title: Colleges Teach Ways to Cut Campus Crime and Effort Is Succeeding
description: NEW HAVENThe nation's colleges and universities, which experienced a sudden increase in crime in recent years, have begun to fight back and are apparently making progress.

title: Illegal Aliens Linked to Drain
description: ONE of the major problems with the New Jersey economy may be illegal aliens. According to latest official estimates, they usually work for less and now hold 200,000 to 210,000 jobs in the state. They send an estimated total of $250 million or more a year to some other country, in most instances they do not pay state income tax, and they are said to hold so many jobs that freeing those positions would do away with twothirds of New Jersey's unemployment problem.

title: Earth's Orbit Influenced The Ice Ages
description: Changes in the orbital motion of the earth around the sun have been identified as the fundamental cause of the earth's succession of ice ages.

title: Dilemma of a Knick (and AntiCeltic) Fan
description: The child is the father to the man, said Wordsworth, thus demonstrating this romantic poet's keen insight into the deepest soul of the contemporary American sports fanat least, this contemporary American sports fan.

title: KOREAN CRITICS SEEK ANOTHER DEFECTION
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 4Critics of President Park Chung Hee say they are desperately trying to persuade the station chief of the Korean Central Intelligence Agency here, Maj. Gen. Kim Yung Hwan, to defect to the United States and to cooperate with the Federal investigation into alleged Korean bribery of American Congressmen and other alleged illegalities.

title: George Faison's Gazelle Danced by Ailey Troupe
description: The Alvin Ailey Dance Theater's newest program on Friday night at the City Center 55th Street Theater offered the company's premiere of Gazelle by George Faison. Time flies.

title: Athens to Pay Niarchos $12 Million For Full Control of Oil Refinery
description: ATHENS, Dec. 4 (UPI)The Government has agreed to pay Stavros Niarchos $12.3 million in return for full control of the Aspropyrgos refinery near Athens, a Government spokesman said today.

title: Miss Patterson Plans Marriage
description: Peggy Elizabeth Patterson, an administrative assistant with the trust department of the First National Bank of Boston, and Edward Van Volkenburgh Sands Jr., an assistant vice president of the Connecticut Bank and Trust Company in Hartford, will be married next February.

title: FOUR SOUGHT IN FLORIDA IN 75 SLAYING OF EXILE
description: MIAMI, Dec. 4Four Cubans, indicted in the 1975 murder of an exile leader who had advocated a United States dialogue with Cuba, are being actively sought in this area by the local police.

title: In Florida Party Boating
description: My Miami friends had an offer they were sure I couldn't refuse: a morning's fishing on an outriggerequipped, flyingbridgecrowned charter boat they'd booked. But refuse I could, and did. I had my eye on something very different, a democratic fishing institution called the party boat.

title: Star Is Replacing Tempest As Olympic Yachting Class
description: The Stars are an Olympic class yacht again, replacing the Tempest. The International Yacht Racing Union made the switch at its annual meeting in London recently. adhering to the policy that at least one but not more than two classes must be changed for each Olympic Games. The same policy was in effect when the Stars were dropped as an Olympic class in 1969.

title: ice Fishing: It Feels Good When You Quit
description: Consider the pleasures of ice fishing. Pleasures is an incongruous word to describe the pursuits of those lonely figures standing motionless on frozen, windswept ponds. Yet thousands of men, women and children sally forth from city apartments and suburban homes on bitter cold weekends to try their luck on dozens of lakes and reservoirs within an hour or so of New York.

title: Millions of Dollars in Snow
description: RUSSELL. III., Dec. 4 (AP)Four per sons were injured and millions of dollars in cash went flying into the snow when a Brink's truck overturned and cracked, open on icy I94 yesterday. Another: Brink's truck was sent to collect the cash, which the state police said could total as high as $7 million.

title: Majors's Move Won't Hurt Pitt in Bowl, 2 Players Say
description: The University of Pittsburgh football team will not be bothered by the impending departure of its head coach, Johnny Majors, when the Panthers play Georgia in the Sugar Bowl on Jan. 1 with the national championship at stake. That is the feeling of Matt Cavanaugh, the quarterback, and Jim Corbett, the senior tight end who has spent four seasons blocking at the corner for Tony Dorsett's wide runs.

title: Rhodesia's Prime Minister Says He Will Return to Geneva Conference Within a Few Days
description: SALISBURY. Rhodesia, Dec. 4 (Reuters) Prime Minister Ian D. Smith said tonight that he would return to the Ceneva conference on Rhodesia's future in the next few days.

title: A Delightful (and Fattening) Anachronism
description: MEMORY LANE is lined with icecream parlors and candy stores. Double dips of silken homemade vanilla and bright peach soothe the soul pining for the past. Oldfashioned handdipped chocolates melt the heart.

title: An Artist's Crafts for Christmas
description: Merry Christmas is being said with a difference this year at the Museum of Contemporary Crafts. As a holiday offering, the zany, brightly painted wooden figures of William Accorsi, which combine madcap whimsy with touches of nostalgia, are being shown and offered for sale in the second floor gallery.

title: Housing Rules Adopted on Coast to Aid Salamanders
description: SAN FRANCISCOThe manbitesdog definition of news may need updating to encompass a new development of the environmental era: man changes life style to accommodate salamanders.

title: Deserved Promotion
description: The elevation of Huang Hua, China's Ambassador to the United Nations, to the post of Chinese foreign minister, will be welcomed in Washington and other Western capitals.

title: Karen Fine to Be Bride
description: Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence A. Fine of Newton, Mass., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Karen Emily Fine, to John Franklin Coburn, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frederick R. Coburn of Weston, Mass. Miss Fine and her fianc graduated from Radcliffe and Harvard Colleges in June. They plan to be married in May.

title: Two Stars of RockJazz Join Forces
description: Stanley Clarke, the bassist, and John McLaughlin, the guitarist, belong to the aristocracy of jazzrock. Both are widely admired for their instrumental skills, and both have achieved substantial followings playing heavily amplified music, Mr. Clarke with Return to Forever and Mr. McLaughlin as leader of the Mahavishnu Orchestra. Mr. McLaughlin has appeared as a guest on two of Mr. Clarke's solo albums, so a joint appearance was to be expected as part of their double bill at the Palladium on Friday.

title: Safety Experts Widen Inquiry Over Pesticide
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 4Federal officials have widened their investigation into sip. parent pesticide poisoning at a suburban chemical plant here because of mounting reports of disabling nervous disorders among former employees.

title: A Trip to Acapulco in Your Christmas Stocking
description: For many people in the business world, the arrival of the holidays means yearend bonuses (an old Wall Street custom) and profitsharing programs, which often involve payments in December or January. But cash isn't always the reward for a job well done. There's another type of incentive that's widely used. and it's called a premium.

title: Two Roads To Continuity
description: When John Kennedy was narrowly elected President in 1960, the first Catholic stud one of the youngest men ever to serve in the ofrice, virtually his first official act was the reappointment of J. Edgar Hoover as director of the F.B.I. and of Allen Dulles as director of thp C.I.A.

title: From Forest to Rivers to Dams to Drilling, Documents Must Assess the Damage to Nature
description: When the Regents of the University of California sat down the other day, to discuss building two new dormitories, they had before them an environmental impact statement that ran to 950 pages. Such copious environmental documentation is not extraordinary. An Interior Department environmental impact statement on an offshore oil sale will run to several thousand pages. The environmental impact assessments on the Alaska pipeline made a 10foot high stack and cost $9 million to compile. Altogether, Federal agencies now produce over 1,000 such statements a yearfour per working day.

title: The Versatile Router
description: The portable electric router is probably one of the most versatile of all woodworking power tools, yet it is also one that a majority of home carpenters and workshop enthusiasts either 40 not own, or are not even familiar with (one of these tools. would make an excellent gift for anyone who does woodworking).

title: 5th Ave. to Become Shopping Mall For Pedestrians Next Two Sundays
description: Fifth Avenue will become a pedestrian mall for the next two Sundays during the height of the Christmas shopping season.

title: O'NEILL DISCLOSES HE'S WORTH $125,000
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 4Representative Thomas P. O'Neill Jr., who is expected to be elected Speaker of the House of Representatives on Monday, disclosed today his financial assets, which indicate that he is not one of the chamber's wealthiest men.

title: Use of Minor by Police Backed
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 4 (UFI)The police may use minors as decoys in drug cases, according to the California Court of Appeal. The Appellate Court ordered San Mateo County Superior Court on Thursday to set aside an order that changed a complaint in a marijuana case by striking out the words sale to a minor. The case stemmed from an investigation by the San Mateo police into drug usage at high schools in the county The court said a former student, 17 years old, had helped the police gather infor mation.

title: Program for Youthful Offenders Helps Them Avoid Return to Crimo.
description: When Luis Valasquez was 15 years old he shot somebody. The shooting, which Luis is reluctant to discuss, was the culmination of a way of life that he described as consisting mainly of hanginn out in the streets.

title: Parties in the Japanese Election
description: LiberalDemocratic Party: The majority party since 1955, it had 265 seats in the last sess'on. Headed by Prime Minister Takeo Miki. it has close ties with big business, it is actually a coalition of conservative political factions constantly jockeying Internally for power. The party advocates friendly relations with all nations, particularly the United States.

title: Petrovic in Net Final
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Dec. 4 (AP)Vladimir Petrovic, the defending champion, defeated Whitney Reed in the semifinals of the national senior hardcourt tennis championships today, 64, 62. Russel Seymour beat Jerry De.

title: Letters: Reaction to Plan to Lure Middle Class Back to City
description: To the Editor:

title: What's Doing in NEWPORT
description: PORT FOR ALL SEASONSNewport, on art island in the state of Rhode Island, made its reputation as one of America's celebrated summering places in the 1890's, when wealthy families took over the city's oceanfront and built opulent cottages complete with ballrooms and stables. But Newport has always been a port for all seasons. General Rochambeau, on his way to aid Washington at Yorktown, wintered here in 1780, and from all accounts his troops fared well. Newport was even then a town with the social graces to satisfy the French. And the graces have endured. Behind the cottages, or mansions, some of which are now open to tourists the year round, is an old town of about 35,000 people with beautiful churches, the oldest synagogue in America. fine old homes and interesting shops that attract visitors in winter as well as summer. Christmas is a high point, celebrated with a monthlong festival.

title: Sheriff, on Job At 90, Recalls Busting Stills
description: PIKEVILLE, Ky., Dec. 4 (AP)Albert Potter speaks with more than 70 years of experience when he says being a deputy sheriff can be a right smart headache.

title: Winter Takes Toll On the Poor And Lonely
description: The cold season strikes hardest at those who have no means to fight when the heat goes off. The cold is hardest on those who live on welfare and must face hunger, too, if the check doesn't arrive.

title: Nuptials Jan. 29 For Leslie Scott, Samson Ashamu
description: Leslie Kristin Scott and Samson C. O. Ashamu plan to be married Jan. 29 at St. Paul's Memorial Episcopal Church in Charlottesville, Va. Their engagement has been announced by the prospective bride's parents, Prof. and Mrs. Nathan A. Scott Jr. of Charlottesville

title: POLICE OPEN INQUIRY IN DEATH OF INFANT
description: FARMINGTON, Conn., Dec. 4The police here are conducting an investigation into the death of an infant boy whose body was discovered last Nov.15 In Miss Porter's School, one of the most exclusive girls prep schools in the country.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: She Dined With Kings But Never Put on Airs
description: Two years ago Rosalind Russell was appearing in a onewoman show at Ford's Theater in Washington, D. C. During the early part of the program. clips from Russell movies were projected; later, Miss Russell came onstage and fielded questions from the audience, and afterward, backstage, she welcomed fans who wanted to ask about her arthritis, and tell about theirs.

title: Town to Test a Windmill Generator
description: CLAYTON, N.M., Dec. 4This ranching community in windswept northeastern New Mexico has been selected by the Federal Energy Research and Development Administration as the site for the installation and testing of the agency's first windmill designed to generate electricity as an alternative source of power for municipal utilities.

title: LETTERS
description: Wharton, Alas

title: Luterans Establish a New Body, Vowing to Seek Christian Unity
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 4The nation's newest Protestant denomination was constituted here this weekend amid pledges to seek eventual Christian unity as well as a more immediate Lutheran unity and amid fervent denials that the new group had fomented schism in American Lutheranism.

title: Benjamin Britten,63, is Dead in England
description: ALDEBURGH, England, Dec. 4Benjamin Britten, one of the 20th century's leading composers, died at his country home here early today, friends announced. He was 63 years old.

title: ART
description: ONE would think from the title of the current exhibition at the Montclair Art Museum that the show is one of those ballyhoo displays for gimmickry. Why choose eight artists rather than seven or 10 or even 15, and why must they all be under 35 years old, which we are told by a used in the selection process.

title: A Fondness for Music, A Feeling for Rhyme. . .
description: More than once Ira Gershwin has declared that, A song writer never feels old. Not many months ago the famous lyricist of the stage and screen clarified that remark: If you're ever lucky enough to turn out a good song and then hear it years later, you're young again. That's the real reward. Take The Man I Love. It was written in 1924 ... just yesterday!

title: A POET EXILED IN US. WINS SPANISH AWARD
description: Jorge Guilln, the Spanish poet who has lived in the United States in voluntary exile since the Spanish Civil War, has been named the recipient of the Cervantes Prize, the highest literary award of the world's Spanishspeaking nations.

title: The State of the State
description: OUR capacity to tolerate hoktun was demonstrated again recently by a study by two professors in Ohio who minimized the economic plight of the Northeastern states. They disputed the conventional wisdom of any important outmigration of people and industries.

title: He Makes Them Laugh Until They Squirm
description: The lines of his profile seem to have been laid down by a draftsman who's been tippling. His speech, deliberate and precise, cuts a crease in thin air. He is tall and skeletal, a collection of cusps and angles which portray awkwardness at one moment, agility the next. He is so intense that he stalks an audience into submission. He is Broadway's newest star.

title: See How They Run
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 4Time again for the annual winter gathering of the baseball clans, and it couldn't have come at a worse time.

title: CORRECTION
description: Several inaccuracies appeared in the article Christmas in That Other Town of Bethlehem (Travel Section Nov. 21). The correct information follows:

title: Workers in Rare Demonstration
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 4 (Reuters)Swedishtrade unionists today staged their first demonstration against employers since the 1930's with a march through central Stockholm. About 6.000 demonstrators protested a call by the chairman of the Swedish Employers Federation for cuts in sick pay, a longer work week in boom periods and cancellation of two public holidays.

title: Novices Work With Scholars On Earthwatch Field Trips
description: A bell chimes, with the pilot's invitation to unbvckle my seat belt and relax. I suddenly thinkwhat have I let myself in for? What is this middleaged (scratch that), middleclass school teacher doing on a plane to San Antonioleaving behind four children (all of whom have repeatedly assured her that she is no longer needed anyway) and a husband who, one hour before flight time, suddenly asks, Who's going to wash my underwear?

title: ART VIEW
description: One of the most majestic pictorial achievements of the second half of this century, in this country or anywhere else, is the'Ocean Park series of paintings by Richard Diebenkorn. This was begun in California nearly 10 years ago and is still in progress, with number 95 as the latest arrival. The series has a unity of scale, a unity of ambition and a unity of achievement; and it is one of the many merits of the Diebenkorn retrospective, on view at the AlbrightKnox Art Gallery in Buffalo through Jan. 9, that it includes no fewer than 32 Ocean Park paintings.

title: Design
description: As Europeans have long known and as Americans are discovering, precious metals are good investments. But while bullion sits in a bank vault, silverin the form of handcrafted household objects.can be a source of daily pleasure. Crystalalso designated a metal, though not a precious onemay make a beautiful heirloom, whether it's handblown into the fluid shape of a modern decanter or cut with facets to make more traditional stemware. The treasures on these pages range from stocking goodies to gifts worth a king's ransom.

title: Letters
description: Setting an example

title: McVay's Job at Stake as Season Wanes
description: Tom Mullen, in his hospital bed, his face reflecting the pain in his right knee and his closing eyes reflecting the drugs administered to relieve that pain, wanted to know one thing:

title: Reflections on a Vintage Year
description: FOR the Democratic members of the Suffolk County Legislature, 1976 has been a satisfying year. Since they took control of the Legislature, they have fundamentally altered its relationship with the County Executive, pushed through a controversial farmlandpreservation program, provided local salestax guarantees for sewerdistrict bonds, adopted conciliatory resolutions favoring a large municipal union, and established a sophisticated review system for the county's finances.

title: CopperExporting Countries Reject Unilateral Fixing of World Price
description: SANTIAGO, Chile. Dec. 4 (Reuters)The world's major copperexporting countries hare rejected the possibility of their unilaterally fixing prices for the metal.

title: Authors Authors
description: The Book Review asked a number of authors, ranging from Vladimir Nabokov to John Dean, to tell us the three books they most enjoyed this Year and to say, in a sentence or two, why.

title: Fuel Costs Ease; The Next Move Is Oil Producers
description: When it comes to energy, the lot of the beleaguered homeowner appears to be improving somewhat. Last year, the cost of electricity, gas and fuel oil posted the smallest rise since the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries sent the price of oil skyrocketing. And in a few cases, albeit isolated ones, some rates even declined.

title: 10,033 Welfare Cases Reported Cut By 3d New York City Mail Survey
description: The third mail survey of New York City's welfare caseload was reported yesterday to have caused the closing of 10,033 cases, representing about 30,000 people with likely savings of $34 million a year to the city, state and Federal Governments combined.

title: Women Lawyers
description: IN an effort to educate attorneys and the community on how current laws affect women, 13 female members of the Bergen County Bar Association have formed a Women's Rights Committee.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The bond market was the stellar sector of Wall Street last week as prices soared and yields dropped. In the background, the Federal Reserve was pushing shortterm rates lower and the basic money supply was downthus providing key ingredients for the ebullient bond market.

title: But Home Rule Is Sacred
description: HOME rule is a sacred cow on the Island. Those who fail to praise it daily are threatened with instant excommunication from the body politic and society in general. And the most prized weapon in the arsenal of the homerule cult is zoning power.

title: Last Execution in Jersey Took Life of Murderer Who Didn't Want to Live
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Dec. 4 (AP)Ralph James Hudson, the last man executed in New Jersey, was in favor of capital punishment. He wanted to die, recalled the Atlantic City attorney. Roy Baylinson, who defended Mr. Hudson, who was convicted of the 1960 stabbing murder of his wife, Myrtle.

title: If Ford Had Agreed...
description: In the peculiar politics of 1976, with attention riveted on the unexpected ferocity of the contest for the Republican Presidential nomination, the rinal outcome of the race for the White House may well hinge on the choice of the Republican VicePresidential nominee.

title: FollowUp on the News
description: It is a kingly estate17.1 acres with It private beach on the Atlantic, a ninehole golf course and a 50room villa, built of three shiploads of Doria stone from Italy, two shiploads of pink roofing tile from Cuba and 36,000 antique tiles from Spain, among other opulent

title: The Election in Japan Is a Domestic Matter
description: Japan's Liberal Democratic Party, in power for more than two decades, today faces an electoral test it is not expected to lose basically. While the margin of victory may presage a change in party leadership, beyond the smokefilled tearooms of Japanese politics, the turnover would likely mean only changes in nuance for the outside world.

title: Arafat Is Said to Agree to Yield Heavy Arms in Lebanon to Syrians
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Dec. 4 (AP)Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian guerrilla leader, has premised that Palestinian forces in Lebanon will surrender their heavy weapons to Syrians in return for protection and diplomatic help, Arab sources said today.

title: Lefkowitz Joins County Chairmen In Backing Duryea for Governor
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz, the highestranking Republican state official and a longtime close associate of Vice President Rockefeller, has joined his party's county leaders in touting the Assembly minority leader, Perry B. Duryea, for the gubernatorial nomination in 1978, even though Mr. Rockefeller has not been a Duryea fan in recent years. One of the outstanding candidates, if not the outstanding, said Mr. Lefkowitz last week of Mr. Duryea after it was reported that Republican county leaders were challenging Mr. Rockefeller's longtime domination of the party and in many cases lining up behind Mr. Duryea for Governor. Mr. Lefkowitz cited Mr. Duryea's knowledge of state government, his effective campaign ability and his general popularity with the Republican organization.

title: Feminists Seek
description: HEMPSTEAD

title: Dana de Friedberg to Marry
description: Mr. and Mrs. Henry de Friedberg of Spring Lake, N. J., have announced the engagement of their daughter. Dana de Friedberg, to Charles J. Walsh of New York and Washington.

title: GARDENING
description: CHRISTMAS cactus plants owned by New Jersey's knowledgeable indoor gardeners are well studded with plump little buds by this date. There is still confusion, though, in the minds of many gardeners about what is a Christmas cactus and what is a Thanksgiving cactus.

title: Summer Bridal For Lucy Stone, Jeffrey A. Moore
description: The engagement of Lucy Goodsell Stone to Jeffrey A. Moore has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Robert G. Stone Jr. of Greenwich, Conn., parents of the future bride. Her fianc is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert B. Moore of Englewood Colo.

title: Hebron Blast Kills 3 Arabs
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 4 (AP)Three young Arabs were killed today in an explosion in the occupied West Bank town of Hebron, a military spokesman reported. He said they had apparently been assembling a bomb. The explosion was in a room above a barbershop. Since last spring. the West Bank has been the scene of widespread rioting and violence directed against the Israeli occupation of the territory, seized in the 1967 war.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Army Women Impressive in Debut
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Dec. 1They are not the Lady Statesmen or the Mighty Macs, but the Army's first women's basketball team is nevertheless, spectacular. The players are members of the class of 1980, which in cludes the first 95 women to attend the United States Military Academy. In addition to adjusting to the rigors of life as cadets, these vivacious and determined young woman have formed an Impressive basketball squad.

title: Baldwin Honors Its Past
description: BALDWIN

title: Article 4  No Title
ALABAMA IS RESUMING ACCEPTING PRISONERS
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 2  The Alabama prison system took in new prisoners yesterday for the first time since two Federal judges ruled 15 months ago that the system violated United States constitutional prohibitions against cruel and unusual punishment.

title: Proposed Oil Refinery in Maine Debated at Environment Hearing
description: EASTPORT, Me., Dec. 4  A 10hour public hearing was held yesterday on the proposed oil refinery for Eastport to allow public comment on a draft of new environmental studies. These are required before three Federal Agencies can grant permits to the Pittston Company, the New York based conglomerate that plans the $500 million installation.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: THIS is the season when homeowners who are fortunate enough to have a fireplace normally look forward to cozy winter evenings with a warm, crackling fire blazing away for friends and family gather around to stare dreamily into the flames. However, a surprisingly large number of these fireplaces never get used at all, simply because all too often the frustrated homeowner has found that it takes him an hour or more to get the first startedor that after he does get it started, he suddenly finds smoke pouring out into the room instead of up the chimney as it should.

title: MONCTON MICROCOSM OF DIVIDED CANADA
description: MONCTON, New Brunswick, Dec. 1Late one night last summer while most of this divided town slept, a plaque in French marking the opening of the new City Hall was put up in the lobby of the building, five years after it was inaugurated. The delay tells something about the tensions between the Englishspeaking majority and the Frenchspeaking minority in a town that many see as a microcosm of both the Province of New Brunswick and Canada as a whole.

title: A Special Gift
description: News of the numbers of unemployed becomes too easily submerged in a vast sea of statistics. Discussion of welfare tends to turn into a matter of politics and budgets. The desperation of hungry children is overlooked unless it erupts in delinquency. The plight of the old and the poor is easily put out of sight and mind; except for occasional reports of outrageous violence or shameful exploitation in which the elderly have been helpless victims.

title: Rights Group Calls Mentally Retarded Capable of Growth
description: While about two million Amer??cans are technically mentally retarded at any given time, a new American Civil Liberties Union handbuok released yesterday asserts that almost all persons so classified are capable of learning and growth.

title: Synthesizing Science and Sport
description: UPTON

title: Suffolk Prepares To Battle a Bottle
description: HAUPPAUGE

title: Hughes Depicted as Prisoner of Own System
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 4The late Howard Hughes lived his last years virtually a prisoner of the security system that he constructed to protect himself from a world lie feared, according to sources familiar with the last days of the reclusive, mysterious industrialist.

title: Fern Matzkin, Leslie Getto Have Bridal in New Rochelle
description: Fern M. Matzkin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Matzkin of Eastchester, N.Y., was married in New Rochelle, N.Y., last evening to Leslie Getto, son of Mr. and Mvs. Bernard Getto of East Meadow, L.I. Cantor Henry Herman performed the ceremony at the Fountainhead.

title: World News Briefs
description: PEKING, Dec. 4 (Reuters)The Chinese Communist Party newspaper Jenmin Jib Pao said today that more than 12,000 troops were mobilized in Fukien Province to counter sabotage and factionalism by followers of the purged gang of four who it said had plotted to seize power there.

title: Sandra Emerson Fiancee Of Peter Hoguet Helmer
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Fred It. Emerson of Short Hills, N. J., of the engagement of Mr. Emerson's daughter, Sandra Leigh Emerson, to Peter Hoguet Helmer, son of Mr. and Mrs. George A. Helmer of San Francisco. A May wedding is planned.

title: Anthony, Miss Morris Win Grand Prix Bowling Titles
description: ALLEN PARK, Mich., Dec. 4 (AP)  Earl Anthony and Betty Morris won the championships in the $100,000 AMF Grand Prix of Bowling today, with Anthony setting a record and tying another.

title: Texas Is Victor in Coaching Finales
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 4 (AP)Raymond Clayborn's two 46yard punt returns and Russell Erxleben's three field goals propelled Texas to a 2912 Southwest Conference victory over Arkansas tonight in the coaching finales for Texas Darrell Royal and Arkansas Frank Broyles.

title: Cold Can Be Cozy, Too, EconomyMinded Find
description: On a cold winter night, a young suburban mother turns on her selfcleaning oven and basks in the warmth, the only time she allows the temperature in her kitchen to rise above 65 degrees.

title: DR. IRVING INNERFIELD, RESEARCHER, IS DEAD
description: Dr. Irving Innerfield, research professor of medicine at New York Medical College and a pioneer in the medical field of inflammation, died yesterday at Englewood Hospital in Englewood, N. J. He was 64 years old.

title: SHIP STORAGE KEEPS COAST SAILORS BUSY
description: BREMERTON. Wash., Dec. 4 (AP)The principal foes of sailors at the Puget Sound Naval Shipyard are barnacles.

title: Gambling on a Film About the Great Depression
description: Los ANGELES

title: Australian Fire Destroys 6 Planes
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Sunday, Dec. 5 (Reuters)Six antisubmarine aircraft were destroyed and three others were badly damaged today by a fire that swept through a hangar at a naval base 100 miles south of here, a Navy spokesman said. The cause of the blaze was not immediately known.

title: ART
description: GARDEN CITY

title: A Talk with Saul Bellow
description: Joseph Epstein: Noel, Nobel. The New York Times Book Review has asked me to interview you for its special Christmas Books issue. The mood is supposed to be celebratory, both of the season and, more important, of your having won the Nobel Prize for Literature. But I thought the occasion might be better used to ask you to formulate answers to some questions I have about your literary career and the Nobel Prize. Saul Bellow: Well, you are not Eckermann. I am not Goethe, and this, our City of Chicago, is most distinctly not Weimar. But let's go ahead anyway. Shoot.

title: Proposal to Tax Faculty Members For Free Tuition Draws Criticism
description: A proposal by the Internal Revenue Service to begin taxing faculty members for the free tuition given their children has drawn strong criticism from officials of private schools and colleges.

title: Donna Kasperek Is Engaged To Ronald Christopher Budny
description: Mr. and Mrs. Donald J. Kasperek of East Brunswick, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter. Donna Marie Kasperek, to Ronald Christopher Budny, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Budny of Brooklyn.

title: ...And Still U. S. Energy Alternatives Are Weak
description: WASHINGTONIn 1973, when the Arab oil embargo made Washington start talking about energy independence, oil accounted for 46.8 percent of the energy consumed In the United States. Three years later the ratio is virtually unchangedit was 46.7 percent for the first eight months of 1976, according to the Federal Energy Administration.

description: To the Sports Editor:
