description: As an alternative to exchanging Christmas cards with fellow employees, Alan D. Pando of the Doyle Dane Bernbach advertising agency sent a $25 check to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Standings of Parties In Japanese House
description: TOKYO, Dec. 6 The showing of the parties in the general election to the 511seat lower house of Parrament yesterday is as follows. The figures in parentheses reflect the makeup of the old house, which originally had 491 seats.

title: Atlanta's Garbage Collections Cut In Half in Dispute on Pay Increase
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 6 (UPI)Garbage collections were cut in half today and the Sanitation Department's work force was reduced by 60 percent as members of the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees called on city laborers to stay off the job because of A pay dispute.

title: Bergen Begins Free Bus Shuttle
description: PARAMUS. Dec. 6Golina Goffredo got a free ride today from the Paramus Park Mall to the Garden State Plaza shopping center on Bergen County's new shoppers Shuttle

title: Witness in CarterArtis Trial Says He Heard No One Talk of Revenge
description: PATERSON, N.J., Dec. 6A prosecution witness in the triplemurder trial of Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis testified today that he heard no one talk about revenge during the hours between the murder of a black man and the slaying of three whites at the Lafayette Grill here 10 years ago.

title: ExPolice Official Backs Beame Son On Boomis Meeting
description: A former highranking police official who served in Mayor Beame's 1973 election campaign last night supported the contention of the Mayor's son, Bernard Beame. that the younger Beame never promised Christopher Boomis a lucrative building project in exchange for secret campaign contributions during an October 1973 meeting.

title: Coleman Puts Off AirBag Ruling; Proposes a Limited Voluntary Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 The outgoing Transportation Secretary, William T. Coleman Jr., urged the nation's automobile makers today to take part in a limited program to demonstrate air bags for autos but put Off once again the longdelayed final decision on whether to require the safety device on all automobiles.

title: A Magical Abracadabra Quartet
description: When the Cantilena Chamber Players asked Meyer Kupferman to compose something for performance at the Jewish Museum, he set to work by considering the players and the site. Then he thought of a trip to Prague last year, during which he was deeply moved by various Judaic places, and o his father, who taught him that Jews were endowed with a special sense of magic. The result was the Abracadabra Quartet, duly given its premiere Sunday afternoon by the Cantilena ensemble at the 92d Street museum.

title: Cartier Charges Retailers Sold Imitation Watches
description: Cartier Inc., the Fifth Avenue jewelry retail chain, filed a suit yesterday in District Court against 34 small, mostly discounttype retailers in New York for allegedly selling imitation Cartier tank watches that bear the Cartier name, trademark and counterfeit Cartier guarantees.

title: Ohio Electrical Workers Strike
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 16 (UPI)The National Electrical Coil Company was struck by about 550 electrical workers at midnight yesterday when negotiators failed to reach a new contract. The workers, members of the International Union of Electrical Workers,

title: HomeField Advantage Proves Genuine
description: There is much talk this week in pro football circles about the home field advantage for the upcoming playoff !!games. The N.F.L. playoff system allocates the site of the playoff games to the four teams which had the best regularseason records and that alleged advantage is what supposedly motivated Pro the Oakland Raiders last Football night against Cincinnati and what will keep the Baltimore Colts on the ball this Sunday in their finale against Buffalo. If the Colts should lose to the Bills while New England defeats Tampa Bay. Baltimore would also lose both the division title (East, American Conference) and the home field site for the first playoff game to the Patriots. The wonlost records would be 113 for New England. 104 for Baltimore.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Federal Government signed an agreement yesterday for a 20year lease on a new $45 million headquarters in Pomona for its national aviation test center. The new headquarters of the National Aviation Facilities Experimental Center will be built and leased by the Atlantic County Improvement Authority. The complex will replace 36 obsolete World War II buildings now used at the 5,000acre airport site, 12 miles northwest of Atlantic City.

title: JACK BACKER
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., Dec. 6 (UPI)Jack Backer, publisher of Indiana University's student newspaper, The Indiana Daily Student, died of abdominal cancer last night at Bloomington Hospital. He was 42 years old.

title: ELECTORAL SETBACK OF GOVERNING PARTY STARTLES JAPANESE
description: TOKYO, Dec. 6The LiberalDemocratic Party's remarkable setback in the general election yesterday touched off waves of shock, disappointment and jubilation today and led to the expectation that a new political era was about to begin in Japan.

title: CAREY SEES A BUDGET WITH $1 BILLION GAP; LOCAL AID TO SUFFER
description: ALBANY, Dec. 6Governor Carey anflounced today that New York State faced a budget deficit next year of $I billion, which he said he would seek to close by drastic restructuring of the formulas that channel aid to localities, including New York City.

description: Joanne Beretta has been leading a double life for 16 years.

title: A GrassRoots Hockey League Grows in Brooklyn Who Needs the Ice?
description: The other day, when the Flyers played the Bruins, there were 50 fans who came to watch, counting the baby girl in the carriage and the big black dog. The league commissioner was called upon to break up a fight, and during the rest periods, some of the players sat on the cold ground, smoking cigarettes. Because two of the Flyers wore No. 10 on their jerseys, you couldn't tell the players even with a scorecardbut, that isn't a problem because in the Bensonhurst Hockey League, there aren't any programs.

title: Lance Backs 1Year Tax Rebate; G.E. Chief Asks a Permanent Cut
description: Bert Lance, the directordesignate of the Office of Management and Budget, said yesterday that he believed a tax rebate enacted for just one year, after which the Administration could consider its effectivness. would be preferable to a permanent tax cut.

title: Fruehbeck of Montreal Symphony Quits in Dispute With Musicians
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 6A few casual cocktailparty comments on the quality of some of its musicians has created a crisis in the Montreal Symphony Orchestra, which is now looking for a new music director.

title: A Dream Fulfilled, Janowicz Says Of Induction Into a Football Shrine
description: For ?? Jonowicz, who will h. nducted into the National Football Hall of Fame today, the next step up for me will he heaven.

title: 2 Kidnapping Suspects Held in Bail
description: Two alleged kidnappers whoce supposed victim is still missing and may be alive or may be dead were held in high hail yesterday in Federal Court in Manhattan on the complaint of an agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Gunman on Skyscraper Tells of Cigarette Peril
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 6 (UPI)A 21yearold gunman who wanted to tell the world about the danger of cigarette smoking took a hostage atop the nation's tallest skyscraper west of Chicago today and threatened to jump unless his warning against tobacco was broadcast by radio stations.

title: Billy Carter Loses
description: PLAINS, Ga., Dec. 6 The potent political prowess that enabled Jimmy Carter to turn an incumbent President out of office failed his brother, Billy, today.

title: BobickNorton Fight Set For Garden Early in 77
description: Duane Bubick of Bowlus, Minn., and Ken Norton of San Diego, two of box. log's leading heavyweight challengers. will meet in a I2round fight at Madison Square Garden in late February or early March.

title: A.C.L.U PICKS DORSEN AS ITS NEV CHAIRMAN
description: Norman Dorsen, a professor of law at New York University and a longtime advocate of the rights of minorities, has been elected chairman of the American Civil Liberties Union, succeeding Edward J. Ennis as head of the 275,000member organization.

title: Ford Staff Finds Job Hunt Is Difficult Despite Help
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. bRunning the United States of America is challenging, stimulating, satisfying and even reasonably well paying. But the job experience is not necessarily transferrable.

title: Copper Producers Reduce Prices In Face of Growing Inventories
description: While the steel and aluminum industries were creating a stir last week with a round of price increases despite talk of slack demand, the copper industry, faced with huge worldwide inventories, was busy cutting prices.

title: Cadillac Fairview Makes New Offer To Buy Irvine Co.
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 6Offering a new bid calculated to woo minority stockholders, the Cadillac Fairview Corporation of Toronto appeared to move into the lead today in its race with the Mobil Corporation to buy the Irvine Company. The Canadian company, which is owned 35 percent by the Bronfman family, bid $286.2 million for the land development concern. The offer consisted of $166.2 million in cash, and $120 million in 10ear notes.

title: Flo and Eddie Satirize Rock
description: Rock music needs Howard KayIan and Mark Volma.n, who perform as Flo and Eddie. Mr. Kaylan and Mr. Volman take delight in puncturing the posturing and pomposity that sometimes pass for substance in the rock world. They may not be popular with other performers, some of whom they rib unmercifully, but they can drive an audience to the brink of hysteria, as they did at the Bottom Line on Sunday.

title: EDWARD D. BECKER
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 6 (AP)Edward D. Becker, retired general vice president of Hearst Consolidated Publications, died yesterday after a long illness. He was 75 years old.

title: Kuhn Warns Owners On HighPrice War
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 6Professional bageball opened its winter convention today with an unusual report by Commissioner Bowie Kuhn that said the cost of signing free agents had been higher than we expected warned that the rich teams seemed to be getting even richer.

title: DOW RISES BY 11.22 IN HEAVY TRADING; TAX OUTLOOK A SPUR
description: The increasing likelihood of a tax reduction sent the Dow Jones industrial average up 11.22 points to 961.77 yesterday in heavy trading.

title: McFall, Victim of Korean Scandal, Will Also Lose Job as House Whip
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The South Korean influencepeddling scandal claimed its first victim in Congress today when Representative John J. McFall was decisively defeated in the contest for House majority leader, thus assuring that he will also lose his post as House Democratic whip.

title: ERNEST SHIFTAN, 73, DIES; SPECIALIZED IN PERFUMES
description: Ernest Shiftan. a cosmetic chemist and senior vice president of International Flavors and Fragrances Inc.. died Friday at White Plains Hospital. He was 73 years old and a resident of Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: Young Lawyer Helped Carter Get Past Many Shoals
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6Stuart Eizenstat is a disillusioned liberal in the words of one admirer. a conservative liberal to another. He calls himself a pragmatic progressive, a man who is strongly committed to traditional social liberalism but who has learned the lesson that more government programs do not necessarily translate into more help for people.

title: Guy Klucevsek Finds Warmth in Accordion
description: The accordion, a standard instrument in Acadian dance bands and polka groups, has never enjoyed much of a reputation in jazz, and in classical music it has generally been considered anathema. William Schimmel has been attempting to revive it, but most of his Work on the instrument has consisted of ironic parodies of popular and cafe music. Guy Klucevsek, who performed four original compositions for the accordion at the Kitchen on Sunday, is up to something very different.

title: Putnam Told by Court To Reopen Its Schools
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 6The Putnam Board of Education this morning was ordered to reopen its schools tomorrow.

title: Broadcasting Industry Is Wary Over Carter's Choice as Chairman of the F.C.C., Succeeding Wiley
description: Leaders of publicinterest organizations concerned with radio and television are as optimistic as broadcasters are apprehensive about the changes that are likely to occur when Presidentelect Jimmy Carter selects a successor to Richard E. Wiley as chairman of the Federal Communications Commission.

title: Plans to Sell The Oakland Tribune Cause Split in Knowland Family
description: OAKLAND, Calf., Dec. 6 A family fight over the impending sale of The oakland Tribune was disclosed in Superior Court records here today.

title: Books of The Times
description: I discovered a long time ago that writing of the small things of the day, the trivial matters of the heart, the inconsequential but near things of this living, was the only kind of creative work which I could accomplish with any sincerity or grace.

title: M'Adoo Deal Seems Near; Knicks Bid
description: The Buffalo Braves placed Bob McAdoo, the National Basketball Association's most prolific scorer the last three seasons, on the trading block yesterday, and the Knicks made a strong bid to bring, him to New York. Mike Burxe, president of the Knicks. said in an interview:

title: ... New Leadership
description: In voting for a new majority leader yesterday, it is tronic that the House Democrats failed to reward Representative Richard Bolling of Missouri, the intellectual father of these reforms. Instead, Mr. Bolling was eliminated by a margin of two votes on the second ballot in a hardfought contest. Representative James Wright of Texas won by one vote on the third ballot.

title: Vance Pays First Call on Kissinger
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 Cyrus R. Vance today paid his first call on the State Department since being named as Jimmy Carter's Secretary of Statedesignate. With the current holder of the office standing next to him, Mr. Vance said that he would not hesitate to use Henry A. Kissinger's great, great talents when needed.

title: Guessing Game
description: WASHINGTONPicking Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's Cabinet is this city's favorite guessing game. Hard information is lacking but some ground rules are reasonably clear.

title: Bing Crosby Back on the Road to Broadway
Steelworker Files Election Charge
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 6 (UPI)The National Labor Relations Board will look into charges that the Republic Steel Corporation has interfered in the election of the United Steelworkers of America by harassing supporters of Ed Sadlowski, a candidate for union president. James Lyons, a Sadlowski supporter, filed charges with the board Friday alleging that Republic's South Chicago Works denied Sadlowski backers access to areas where supporters of his opponent, Lloyd McBride, were permitted to campaign.

title: Baseball Pays Its Homage To Murtaugh at Funeral
description: CHESTER, Pa., Dec. 6 (AP)Danny Murtaugh was buried today after prayers by a priest who was his pinochle partner and recollections of the quick wit of the fourtime manager of the Pittsburgh Pirates.

title: Ford Heads Golf Event
description: PINEHURST, N.C., Dec. 6 (UPI)President Ford has agreed to serve as honorary chairman of the ColgateHall of Fame golf tournament after he leaves office, tournament officials said today. The President dedicated the World Golf Hall of Fame when it opened in 1974. The tournament is Aug. 25.

title: O'NEILL IS SPEAKER; REP. WRIGHT OF TEXAS WINS MAJORITY POST
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 Democrats in the House of Representatives today elected Thomas P. O'Neill Jr. of Massachusetts to be Speaker of the House in the next Congress and Jim Wright of Texas to be majority leader.

title: About New York
description: There it was again, the magnificent smile of Dominic P. Byrne, greeting everyone in the White Plains courtroom with such an infectious aura that one would have thought it was the finale of Finian's Rainbow rather than of the Bronfman kidnapping trial.

title: Recount of Vote That Gave Ford Narrow Oregon Victory Ordered
description: SALEM, Ore., Dec. 6 (UPI)A recount of the votes that gave President Ford a narrow victory over Jimmy Carter in Oregon Nov. 2 was ordered today by Clay Myers, the Secretary of State.

title: Taxes &
description: DURHAM, N.C.To what extent do stock prices themselves, through one littleunderstood mechanism or another, generate the information that investors need in choosing stocks?

title: Election Results Certified By New York State Board Despite Court Challenge
description: ALBANY, Dec. 6A total of 6,668,262 persons in New York State voted in the Nov. 2 Presidential election, the State Board of Canvassers said today, a lower voter turnout than in the four previous Presidential contests.

title: Survivor Tells of Rhodesia Ambush
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec. 6 (AP) Troops and policemen searched a bush area of western Rhodesia today for a black gunman who killed three Roman Catholic missionaries yesterday and wounded a fourth.

title: Arab Pressure on Spain Is Hinted As Jews Cancel Talks With King
description: MADRID, Dec. 6The first international Jewish meeting ever held in Spain ended today on an inconclusive note as local Jewish leaders withdrew a request for a meeting with King Juan Carlos that had threatened to become controversial.

title: Holtz: To Be Or Not to Be Jets Coach
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Dee. 6The question Lou Holtz posed today was this simle:

title: How to Be a Playboy at 68
description: ENGLEWOOD, N.J., Dec. 6Racquet met ball with a solidsounding POCK, and a limecolored blur headed toward the man in the hornrimmed glasses.

title: Tennessee Player Tells of Coach Battle's Plight
description: Mike Mauk, who was a free safety on the Tennessee football team under Coach Bill Battle for the last four seasons, described yesterday a scene of mounting pressure on the players and coaches during the 1976 season as everyone realized Battle was College going through his final campaign with the Vols. Battle Sports was forced to resign Nov. Notes 20. Tennessee hired Johnny Majors, the Pittsburgh coach, to replace Battle starting on Jan. 2.

title: Holding Securities In Street Names Backed by S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The Securities and Exchange Commission has concluded that the practice by investors of holding their securities in the names of nominees, or street names, has prevented them from receiving sonic corporate news but that overall the present system was operating effectively.

title: Dibbs, Fibak Triumph at Masters Net
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 6 (AP)Wojtek Fibak of Poland, playing in his first Grand Prix Masters singles tournament, upset Manuel Orantes of Spain tonight, 75, 76.

title: Arthur E. Braun, 100, Banker And Philanthropist in Pittsburgh
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 6  Arthur E. Braun, a banker, newspaper publisher and philanthropist, died yesterday at his home here. He was 100 years old on Nov. 23.

title: Millsenblum Is Heard In Comedy and Songs
description: Millsenblum is an oddly named duo that will be appearing at Tramp's, 125 East 15th Street, for two more weeks. It consists of Galen Blum (who was reportedly coming down with an illness last weekend, when this reporter saw her, that has forced her to cancel all shows through tonight) and David Mills, who plays the guitar and grins with irrepressible adoration at Miss Blum.

title: AIR FORCE IS PINNING BIG HOPES ON F16'S
description: The first fullscale development version of the F16, the United States multinational fighter, will be flown this week.

title: Stage: Enquist Scans Strindberg
description: PRINCETON, NJ.The cool madness and hot sanity of August Strindberg have inspired a most unusual play that has just been given its American premiere at the McCarter Theater here. The play is The Night of the Tribades, and it is written by the young Swedish writer Per Olov Enquist.

title: OUTPUT OF STEEL ROSE BY 0.3% FOR THE WEEK
description: Steel production for the week ended Dec. 4 edged ahead of the shortened Thanksgiving week but still wound up as the secondlowest production week of the year, according to figures released yesterday by the American Iron and Steel Institute.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: New York Transit System Facing Necessity for Further Cutbacks
description: The rollercoaster financial fortunes of the New York City transit systemas narrated by David L. Yunichhave lurched into a new dip, requiring immediate plans for further large cutbacks in service.

title: New Quebec Officials Say Election Is a Mandate for Independence
description: OTTAWA. Dec. 6 Leaders of Quebec's governing separatist movement declared here today that they considered their victory in the recent. elections a mandate to proceed toward independence for their Frenchspeaking province.

title: Joao oulart, Former President Of Brazil, Is Dead in Exile at 58
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec. 6Joao Goulart, the last civilian President of Brazil, died today at his ranch in northern Argentina, where he was in exile. He was 58 years old.

title: Article 4  No Title
Market Place
description: Recently published reports that the Xerox Corporation's 51percentowned subsidiary, Rank Xerox, had lost all but 15 percent of the new copier market for units in Britain have made investors here uneasy.

title: Cordero Goes Ahead in'76 Earnings
description: Secret Lanvin won the $30,000 Sabette Handicap for fillies and mares yesterday at Aqueduct and Angel Cordero Jr. took over the national lead in money winnings by jockeys.

title: Red SoxDeal Cooper For Scott and Carbo
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 6The American League, which dominated the action in the freeagent market when players changed teams voluntarily, carried the load again today as players began changing clubs involuntarily.

title: Music: Violinist
description: The best thing about Sunday's Symphony of the New World concert at Carnegie Hall was the playing of Erick Friedman, the violin soloist. Mr. Friedman's regularly scheduled offering was Prokofiev's Violin Concerto No. 2, and then he came back for an encore with the orchestra, Sarasate's Zigeunerweisen.

title: Columbia Pictures Moves To Take Over D. Gottlieb
description: Columbia Pictures Industries, signaling its possible entry into the home entertainment market, said yesterday that it had entered into an agreement to acquire D. Gottlieb & Company, a privately owned pinball machine maker, for $47 million.

title: New House Speaker and Majority Leader for the Incoming 95th Congress
description: WASHINGTON Dec. 5In an institution that has undergone great changes in recent years with an influx of new and young members, the next Speaker of the House of Representatives, Thomas P. O'Neill Jr., would seem to be a caricature of the past. At a time when it has not been fashionable to be identified with what is regarded as the Establishment or oldfashioned politics, the 63yearold Mr. O'Neill has not hesitated to describe himself as an Establishment Liberal. Others have called him, without derision, the ultimate Boston Irish politician.

title: RudyPerpich: From the Dumps to Governor
description: HIBBING, Minn.The dream of poor immigrants from Eastern Europe who worked the ore mines in Minnesota's Iron Range was that their sons be spared the hard life of the dumps, as they called the mines.

title: McGill Honored for His Aid to City As Columbia University's President
description: Bill McGill. a selfdescribed Irish gut fighter from the Bronx, who made his way from Fordham Road to an Ivy League presidency, was honored last night at the Plaza Hotel by 750 New Yorkers whose ancestors were here before General Washington became president.

title: Quebec Election Touches a Nerve For 4 Neighbors
description: HALIFAX, Nova Scotia, Dec. 2 The leaders of Canada's four Atlantic provinces are trying to avoid panic over the possibility of Quebec's separation from Canada, but more than just winter winds are giving them a chill.

title: Carter Starts Right
description: Imagine for a moment that you are on the way to being big in the new Administration and cutting a dashing figure in Washington, a cool confident talker about Treasury and Pentagon, unlisted phone number, good at talking about goobers, mentioned for something really good in the E.O.B. or ?? the columnists dropping those parenthetical descriptive phrases about your brilliance, and all the rest of it.

title: Supreme Court Action on Cases
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 6  The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: SMALL DROP SHOWN FOR PRICES OF BONDS
description: Prices of fixedincome securities slipped yesterday morning and then partially recovered in the afternoon to end the day slightly lower, but the moves both ways were modest and resulted largely from trading by dealers themselves and not by their customers. The Federal Reserve took no acand the Federal funds ratetion in the money market, remained stable at 4 11/16 percent. Nevertheless, the Treasury sold $5.7 billion of bills, again at the lowest rates since August. 1972, in the first of three bill sales this week that will total $11 billion, including $2 billion to raise additional funds. Two corporate bond issues were priced for sale today and a third was postponed until next week.

title: AMERICAN EDUCATORS BAR SOVIET TRIP OVER A VISA
description: A trip to the Soviet Union by eight American educators has been postponed at the last minute, and may be called off entirely, because of the apparent refusal of a visa to Dr. Joshua Fishman, a Yeshiva University linguist.

title: Stanray and IC Industries Agree on Merger Terms
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 6 (UPI)Tentative agreement for the merger of the Stanray Corporation and IC Industries, two Chicagobased companies, was announced today.

title: Noise Leads to 2 Deaths
description: ASHIYA, Japan, Dec. 5 (Reuters)Angered by noise from a supermarket construction site, a bar proprietor, Yotsuo Seo, 49, shot dead the sister of the market owner, wounded two other people and then committed suicide by biting his tongue, the police said.

title: Article 1  No Title
Tedd Joseph, ExMarketing Head Of Times Edition in Paris, Dies
description: Todd Joseph, former director of marketing for the onetime New York Times International Edition in Paris, who since 1965 had headed his own multinational consultancy, Tedcl Joseph International, died Friday after a heart attack in St. Petersburg, Fla., where he lived, He was 62 years old.

title: Debt Rise Biggest in 3 Years
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (UPI)Consumers increased their debts in October by $1.56 billion, the largest jump in three years, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: Spacecraft Maps Structure of Sun's Magnetic Field
description: The structure of the sun's magnetic field has been determined for the first time from data returned by the Pioneer 11 spacecraft, scientists reported yesterday.

title: Jersey Bars Auto Insurance Rise
description: TRENTON, Dec. 6 James J. Sheeran, New Jersey's Insurance Commissioner, rejected today all auto insurance rateincrease applications pending since July and said the companies would probably have to wait at least six months more for any rate increases.

title: Chamber Society and Perlman
description: The Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center gave its subscribers an exceptionally highdensity program to chew on Sunday afternoon in Alice Tully Hall  the Trio Sonata from Bath's Musical Offering, Bartk's Second Violin Sonata and Schubert's Octet. All three works in their very different ways are packed with important musical information and they make unusual demands on performers and listeners alike.

title: CARTER SHYING AWAY FROM DIRECT CITY AID
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6Presidentelect Jimmy Carter is thinking less of providing direct aid to extricate New York City from its fiscal crisis and more of helping the city through welfare changes, categorical grants and other measures that would help all urban areas, two Carter aides indicated today.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Monday.

title: Nursing Patient Kills 2 Others, Then Himself
description: PUYALLUP, Wash. Dec. 6 (Ap) He was 94 years old short seemingly in good physical condition with a sparse remainder of gray hair. A couple of years ago he and his wife left their home in Sumner, a few miles east, and moved into a nursing home. She died within the last year.

title: Gaullists See a Political Motive In French National News Walkout
description: PARTS, Dec. 6French newspapers were closed by strike today, and Gaullist leaders accused the Government of having provoked the walkout to block publicity for the latest Gaullist challenge to President Valry Giscard d'Estaing.

title: Heating Oil Spills in Schuylkill
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 6 (AP)About 10,000 gallons of industrial heating oil spilled into the Schuylkill today when a pipeline ruptured at the Royal Petroleum Corporation's facility in southwest Philadelphia, according to the Coast Guard.

title: Israeli Plan for a Mideast Parley is Promptly Amended in the U .N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 6 Countering an Egyptian diplomatic initiative, Israel today offered a resolution in the General Assembly calling for a Middle East conference on its own terms.

title: An ExPrice Controller's View of Controls
description: DALLASEver since he left Washington early in 1973, after 15 months as the highly visible chairman of the United States Price Commission during Phase 2 of the controls program. C. Jackson Grayson Jr. has taken a low public profile back here at his old stamping grounds at the School of Business Administration of Southern Methodist University. Behind the scenes, however, he has been following a schedule almost as active as his frenetic days in Washington.

title: Republicans Appear to Be Leaning to Political Technician as Chairman
Dr. Julian Morgenstern Dies at 95, Was Biblical Scholar and Educator
description: Dr. Julian Morgenstern, a biblical scholar and president emeritus of Hebrew Union CollegeJewish Institute of Religion, died Saturday in a Macon, Ga., nursing home. He was 95 years old and a resident of Macon.

title: Birds, Not Concrete
description: Thanks to the United States Supreme Court, a vanishing bird may not altogether disappear. The Mississippi sandhill crane, a subspecies now down to forty birds, is concentrated in an area through which Federal highway officials were all set to close a gap in Interstate 10, a major road crossing the South from Florida to California.

title: Soybean Futures Continue Advance; Wheat Also Climbs
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 6 (AP)Soybean futures advanced 18 cents a bushel on the Chicago Board of Trade today, continuing a forceful gain now in its second week.

title: ALFRED M. ROSIER
description: Dr. Alfred M. Rosier, a general practitioner in Lynbrook, LI., for 51 years, died Sunday at South Nassau Community Hospital, Oceanside, L.I. He was 75 years old and a resident of Lynbrook.

title: Negotiations With Meat Exporters On Share of U.S. Market Open
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (Reuters).The United States opened negotiations with 13 meatexporting nations here today to determine what share of the $800 millionayear United States market they will be allotted in 1977.

title: Mexican Squatters Begin To Leave Northwest Area They've Occupied a Week
description: CULIACAN, Mexico, Dec. 5 (UPI) Militant peasants have begun leaving more than 100,000 acres of agricultural land that they have occupied in northwesterns Mexico since last week and plan to meet with Mexican federal authorities to seek a solution to the dispute, a state official here said today.

title: Liquor Union Tells Salesmen to Swear They Gave No Gifts
description: Twelve hundred unionized liquor salesman across New York State are being cailed upon by their union, starting with the Christmas season, to sign monthly a??fidavits swearing that they did not give any rebate, discount, kickback, gift or any other inducement to customers except to the extent permitted by law.

title: Japan's Electoral ShakeUp
description: Genuine political democracies have shrunk to such a small fraction of the world's states that the most important thing about last weekend's parliamentary election in Japan may have been simply that it was held, that the governing party of a major nation risked its hold on power in free and open struggle against vigorous opponents. In an increasingly totalitarian Asia, this demonstration of democracy's continued vitality in a prosperous Japan does much to refute the strident authoritarian claims that truly selfgoverning nations no longer have a place in that part of the world.

title: A GrassRoots Hockey League Grows in Brooklyn Who Needs the Ice?
description: The other day, when the Flyers played the Bruins, there were 50 fans who came to watch, counting the baby girl in the carriage and the big black dog. The league commissioner was called upon to break up a fight, and during the rest periods, some of the players sat on the cold ground, smoking cigarettes. Because two of the Flyers wore No. 10 on their jerseys, you couldn't tell the players even with a scorecardbut that isn't a problem because in the Bensonhurst Hockey League, there aren't any Programs.

title: New York Transit System Facing Necessity for Further Cutbacks
description: The rollercoaster financial fortunes of the New York City transit systemas narrated by David L. Yunichhave lurched into a new dip, requiring immediate plans for further large cutbacks in service.

title: Assembly Backs Mandated Terms In Crackdown on Violent Crimes
description: TRENTON, Dec. 6The New Jersey State Assembly tonight struck what was called a blow for the freedom of the streets, and voted to require threeyear minimum prison sentences for almost every act of violence.

title: POLICE CRACK DOWN ON DRUGS IN HARLEM
description: The police have begun a new crackdown against narcotics sellers in Harlem, acting after Mayor Beame secretly observed open street sales of illegal drugs on upper Eighth Avenue.

title: Mandel's Lawyers Renew Demands for Mistrial;Judge Defers Decision
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 6 Defense lawyers in the 13week political corruption trial of Gov. Marvin Mandel of Maryland and four codefendants renewed today their demands for a mistrial because of repeated attempts to illegally influence the jury. Federal District Judge John H. Pratt, indicating at first that he would make a quick decision, deferred a ruling until tomorrow.

title: Metropolitan Toasts a Dazzling Russia of Old
description: The Russian costume exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art is a dazzler.

title: Kerouac by Duberman Limns One Side of the Beat Generation
description: Jack Kerouac was a tremendously liberating force in American literature and life. In the 50's, he, Ailen Ginsberg and the other creators of the Beat Generation, challenged convention: Theirs was an act of ventilation. Martin Duberinan, a professor of history and author of In White America, has written a play about Kerouac, called Visions of Kerouac. Originally commissioned by the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, but withdrawn, the work is having its premiere engagement at the Off Off Broadway Lion Theater Compay.

title: Arthur M. Gates, 60, Cartoonist; Drawings Ran in 280 Newspapers
description: Arthur M. Gates, widely syndicated newspaper cartoonist, died Saturday at Florida Keys Memorial Hospital, Key West. He was 60 years old and a resident of Key West.

title: Purge of Chiang Ching and Three Other Chinese Leaders Being Extended to the Culture and Sports Agencies
description: HONG KONG. Dec. C The campaign against Chiang Ching and three other disgraced members of the Chinese Politburo appeared to have expanded into the Ministry of Culture and the Sports Commission today with the publication of articles attacking their activities in those two government agencies.

description: International

title: Supreme Court Rules Employers May Refuse Pregnancy Sick Pay
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  ln a major setback to the women's rights movement, the Supreme Court ruled today, 6 to 3, that private employers who have programs temporarily compensating outofwork employees for a broad range of disabilities may refuse to compensate women for absences caused by pregnancy.

title: Readers Remember The Roast Mickey
description: An article in The Living Section last Wednesday reminiscing about the roast mickeythe potato cooked in the embers of a wood fire or in embers placed in a discarded tin cantouched a responsive chord among readers. Following are excerpts from some of the many letters received.

Notes on People
description: IN THE 34 years she has spent in Washington as a reporter, press secretary, and confidante of the famous. Liz Carpenter picked up so many friends that when it came time for her to bid the capital adieu, Ford's Theater had to be booked to accommodate all who wanted to pay her tribute.

title: Carter Meets With Woman and 4 Men on Major Administration Posts
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 7  Presidentelect Jimmy Carter met here today with four men and a woman who appeared to be under consideration for major posts in his administration, including three men experienced and expert in national security affairs.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: O.K. Let's get to it. There is no point postponing your Christmas shopping any longer. Christmas Day is not postponable, and there are an awful lot or stockings, trees and expectant hands and faces waiting. The suggestions that follow were compiled in the hope that they might make shopping slightly less complicated and life in the immediate future slightly more bearable. There may be something for everyone on your listand even for youand then again, there may not. But heaven knows, we tried.

title: Article 2  No Title
Duke Maas, ExYank, Dies at 47; Pitched in Two World Series
description: UTICA, Mich., Dec. 7 (AP)  Duane (Duke) Maas, who pitched in two World Series for the New York Yankees, died today after a long illness. Maas, who was 7 years old, was suffering from arthritis.

title: Peking Says Mao Told His Wife He Didn't Want to See Her Again
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 7More than two years ago, Mao Tsetung told his wife, Chiang Ching, that he did not want to see her any more, the official Chinese Communist party newspaper, Jenmin Jih Pao, said today, printing a previously undisclosed quotation by the late party chairman.

title: Mandel Judge Declares a Mistrial Over Reports of Jury Tampering
description: BALTIMORE. Dec. 7  A mistrial was declared today in the 13week political corruption trial of Gov. Marvin Mandel and four codefendants because other members of the jury learned of alleged attempts to bribe one of them to prevent: a conviction.

description: The world loves Gary Graffman for his Rachmaninoff: his friends love him for his tangerine vodka.

Mary MacD. Stanton Is Wed To Douglas Warren Keeble
description: Mary MacDonald Stanton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edwin MacDonald Stanton of Schenectady. N. Y., was married there yesterday to Douglas Warren Keeble, son Of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert William Keeble of Delmar, N. Y. The Rev. Qr. Arthur R. Melius performed the ceremony in the First United Methodist Church.

description: It was Thursday, shortly after high noon, and Gunter Kraftner was drinking pea soup in the kitchen with his visitors.

description: NEW YORK (AP) Money rates for Tuesday.

title: Visions of Sugarplums From Faraway Lands
description: Golden goose, regal boar's head and, chestnutstuffed turkey nowtwithstanding, the most enticing and symbolic foods of the Christmas season are the sweets. Just about every country that celebrates this holiday does so with special cakes, cookies. candies and desserts that enliven not only the 12 days of Christmas but the entire sixweek period beginning on Advent Sunday and continuing through Jan. 6. the day equally wellknown as Three Kings Day. Epiphany or Twelfth Night.

title: Mrs. Boomis Gave $5,000 After Return of Beame Gift
description: Within five months of Abraham D. Beame's order to return $6,000 in campaign contributions from Christopher Boomis. the real estate developer, because of what the then mayoral candidate perceived as a possible conflict of interest, one of Mr. Beame's campaign committees accepted a new $5,000 contribution from Mr. Boomis's wife.

title: Dutch Jail Nurse in 5 Deaths
description: MAASTRICT, the Netherlands. Dec. 7 (AP)A male nurse was sentenced today to 13 years in prison for the murder of five elderly patients with overdoses of insulin. Frans Hooijmaijers. 41 years old. was first charged in the deaths of nine patients at a psychiatric clinic, but a court ruled that murder charges had not been proved in the deaths of four.

title: All About: Smoke And Home Detectors
description: WHERE there might be smoke, there ought to be a smoke detectorespecially in the home.

title: Islanders Overcome Blues, 42

Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 27yearold drifter and exconvict was arraigned in Criminal Court in Riverhead, L.I., for the murder of Karen Pomroy, opening a case that some law enforcement officials believe may turn on questions of whether the victim died from the assault on her or because doctors, pronouncing her clinically dead. removed her from lifesupport systems that had kept her heart beating.

title: CHARGES OF RACISM ARISE AT CITY COUNCIL
description: Charges of racism growing out of the recent slaying of a 15yearold black youth by a white police officer arose yesterday in the New York City Council, which elected the lawyer representing the officer to fill a vacant Council seat.

title: U. S. Urges New Textile Pact
description: GENEVA, Dec. 7 The United States urged today early agreement among importing and exporting nations to renew a pact now regulating the international flow of textiles.

title: S.E.C. Expanding Charges of Fraud By White &
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 The Securities and Exchange Commission has expanded charges that White & Case, one of the nation's leading law firms, participated in fraudulent acquisitions by a client that failed to disclose significant changes in its client's financial position.

title: British Voice Hope Of Sterling Support
description: LONDON, Dec. 7 (Reuters)  The Chancellor of the Exchequer, Denis Healey, said today that he hoped to announce agreement in principle on international backing for sterling balances held by foreigners when he presented his crisis package of austerity measures next week.

title: Dr. Waldheim Renamed
description: It is no derogation of Kurt Waldheim to observe that he is now assured of another five years as Secretary General of the United Nations because no member government had anything against him. In particular, Dr. Waldheim had managed during his first term to avoid giving lasting offense to any of the five permanent members of the Security Council, whose recommendation is binding on the General Assembly.

title: Advertising
description: Many agency media people consider the singlecopy sales of a magazine to he an important measure of the magazine's vitality.

title: Utah Disputes Right Of Gilmore's Mother To Intervene in Case
description: WASHINGTON Dec.7 (AP)Utah officials (old the Supreme Court today that the mother of Gary Mark Gilmore, a condemned murderer, had no right to prevent her son's execution.

title: F.P.C. Staff Backs Mackenzie Pipeline
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 The staff of the Federal Power Commission recommended emphatically today that natural gas from Alaska's north slope be delivered to American markets by a pipeline that runs through Canada's Mackenzie River Valley, if the Canadian Government will agree.

title: Kissinger to Give NATO U.S. Pledge
Youths Plead No Defense in Killing
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Dec. 7 (UPI)Two Plainfield youths have pleaded no defense to murder charges in the stabbing death of a man during a burglary at his home. The youths, Glenn Simmons, 18 years old, and Jerry Powell, 16, admitted yesterday that they had taken part in the burglary at the home of Benjamin G. Southwick last July 30.

title: College's Program For Aged Is Target Of 3 Investigations;
description: Hundreds of elderly persons, including some who cannot read or write English. have been enrolled in questionable programs at Touro College that, state investigators assert, appear to have been established chiefly to obtain state and Federal tuition grants.

title: ITALY'S PRIME MINISTER MEETS WITH MONDALE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP)Prime Minister Giulio Andreotti of Italy met today with Vice Presidentelect Walter F. Mondale and three top economic officials in the Ford Administration.

title: Justice at Last
description: They waited more than 20 years for the rule of law to undo the wrong they had suffered since the shameful years when McCarthyism was superceding justice. Nine of ten teachers who had been dismissed from the city system in the 1950's for refusing to answer questions about their political beliefs listened solemnly last week as the Board of Education voted to reinstate them. The tenth had died before attaining final vindication.

title: College's Program For Aged Is Target Of 3 Investigations
description: Hundreds of elderly persons, including sonic who cannot read or write English, have been enrolled in questionable programs at Touro College that, state investigators assert, appear to have been established chiefly to obtain state and Federal widen grants.

title: Personal Health
description: IN THE midst of an afterluncheon speech to a large group of his constituents, a New England politician in his forties developed a crushing pain in the middle of his chest and became lightheaded and short of breath. He continued talking and the pain seemed to settle in his throat. Thinking a fish bone from lunch might have lodged there, he visited an ear, nose and throat specialist, after the speech. but the doctor found no bone.

title: STATE WARNED BY U. S. ON DUMPING OF SLUDGE
description: Gerald M. Hansler, regional administrator of the, Federal Environmental Protection Agency, said yesterday the Government will not tolerate any failure by New York and New Jersey to meet a 1981 deadline for halting the dumping of sewage sludge in the ocean.

title: New Peking Administration Buys 750,000 Tons of Canadian Wheat
description: China has bought 750,000 long tons of wheat from Canada, the first grain purchase by the twomonthold Peking administration, The Canadian Wheat Board said yesterday.

title: Decision Is Put Off On Matthews Pact
Ford Staff Loses Sense of Mission
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Jerry Jones, deputy assistant to President Ford, was walking down a White House driveway on his way home early one evening few days after the election when the magnitude of what had happened finally sank in.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

title: PARTY LED BY YADIN INTERESTING ISRAELIS
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 7For more than five months Yigael Yadin, the archaeologist, has engaged in a type of digging quite different from the work on the Dead Sea scrolls that earned him an international reputation.

title: CRAIG WYLIE, 68, EDITOR; WITH HOUGHTON MIFFLIN
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 7 (UPI) Craig Wylie, retired managing and executive editor of the Houghton Mifflin Company, died yesterday at his home. He was 68 years old.

title: How the Steelers Conned the Raiders
description: OAKLAND. Calif., Dec. 7  Ever since Al Davis took command of the Oakland Raiders organization, their motto has been pride and poise. Add propriety. Throughout the National Football League in recent weeks, cynics. including some employed by the Pittsburgh Steelers. had wondered about the Raiders propriety. The theory was that the Raiders, perhaps subconsciously, would surrender to the temptation of eliminating the Steelers, their recent postseason executioners, from the American Conference playoffs by losing to the Cincinnati Bengals last night. Not even the District Attorney would have been alarmed, because the Raiders have a history of losing enough big games on merit to be above suspicion. Only once have the Raiders qualified for the Super Bowl game, and they lost. Since then they also have lost the A.F.C. championship game six times, twice the Steelers in the last two years. No grand jury could possibly indict the Raiders for losing a big game.,

title: 8 Cosmos Satellites Launched
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 7 (AP)The Soviet Union launched into orbit today eight Cosmos satellites from one rocket, one of the periodic cluster shots in the secret Cosmos series. The Tass press agency said the satellites were carrying instruments to continue the exploration of space.

title: Discarded Players Helping Patriots Clean Up
description: For years, the directors of the New England Patriots, the only publicly owned team in the National Football League, behaved more offensively at their board meetings than the losing Patriot teams did on the field. This year much has turned around for the New England club in such dramatic fashion as to give hope even to Giants and Jets fans. It is possible within the N.F.I.. for a team milling !n mediocrity to find direction because two years ago the Patriots were rudderless.

title: Critic's Notebook: Comments, Not About Broadway, Mr. Papp and the Irish
description: THIS IS NOT a complaint, merely a comment. Why cannot Broadway musicals be as imaginatively staged and designed as the Metropolitan Opera's new Esclarmonde"? The scenery and costumes by Beni Montresorit was staged first in this version in San Francisco in 1974 are fanciful, imaginative and totally beguiling. They mix delicacy with fantasy. Now why do we never see musicals designeck with such wit and feeling, such a sense for the stage, for light and for theatrical magic? Monlresor uses lighting and gauzes, scrims and drapes in a modern way. Broadway is still, for the Most part, scenically locked into the 1930's.

title: Dow Eases 1.08 in Active Trading; Deseret Up 6 on Merger Report
description: Stock prices leveled off in active trading yesterday to consolidate their sharp gains of Monday. The star issue of the sessionand its most active stockwas Deseret Pharmaceutical, rising VA points to 37 on merger plans.

title: Soweto Student, in City, Predicts Race War in South Africa
description: A 19yearold South African youth who helped direct an uprising last June in Soweto, a black suburb of Johannesburg, said yesterday in New York that he expected racial conflict to erupt in South Africa within five years.

title: Firestone Quarter Net Off 72.5%
description: Farnings of the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company plunged 72.5 percent its fourth fiscal quarter because of ?? 131day strike and its aftereffects, ?? company's report disclosed yesterday

title: Chilean Junta Under Fire as Economy Stagnates
Bulls 89, Lakers 81
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 7 (AP)  Hom Van Liar and Scott May combined for 17 fourthquarter points tonight while Chicago held Los Angeles to 11 points in registering an 8981 triumph over the Lakers.

title: ATTACK ON PEARL HARBOR RECALLED BY SURVIVORS
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 7  George R. Ariyoshi of Hawaii, America's only state Governor of Japanese ancestry, urged survivors of the 1941 attack upon Pearl Harbor today to replace the bitterness of war's bitter residue and end international discord.

title: Three Rescued as Ship Sinks
Heavy Rainfall Mars Mild December Day
description: Nearly an inch of rain fell on New York City yesterday, but temperatures in the low to middle 50's prevented puddles from turning into ice.

title: Body of ExPresident Goulart Is Returned to Brazil for Burial
description: RIO DE JANEIRO. Dec. 7 (AP) The body of former President Joo Goulart. was returned today to his childhood home in southern Brazil for burial. Mr. Goulart, a wealthy 58yearold rancher, died of a heart attack yesterday in northern Argentina, where he had been living in exile;

title: Wholesale Absolution Signals a New Catholic Debate
description: The 14member Board of the nation's largest organization of divorced and separated Roman Catholics was meeting last Sunday in Cleveland when startling news arrived.

title: Careers
description: While the stock market may still be in the doldrums, the career outlook for women in the financial world is bright, ??cording to a study financed by the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Wives Who Allege Beatings Suing Police and Court
description: Twelve married women who say they have been repeatedly beaten by their husbands filed suit yesterday in Manhattan Supreme Court against the New York City Police Department and the administrative arm of the city's Family Court.

title: People and Business
description: The chairman of the American Motors Corporation, Roy D. Chapin Jr.,  says that the auto company will he close to the breakeven point in the current quarter after record losses in the preceding three months.

title: Three Youths Call Mugging the Elderly Profitable and Safe
description: Three youthful offenders, wearing ski masks and hooded jackets to conceal their identities, told members of the New York State Select Committee on Crime yesterday that assault and robbery against the elderly were among the most profitable crimes they could commit.

title: Many Banks Asking to Join 2 Big Credit Card Systems
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 7 A policy change by National BankAmericard Inc. last May allowing its members to issue the competing Master Charge card has set off a rush for dual membership in both systems by banks across the country. Banking experts say this could radically change the credit card industry.

title: Best Buys
description: Neither the chicken nor the pig is renowned for its speed. but when it comes to the question of best buys this week, it's a close race between the two.

title: Cuisinart's New Rival: Good But Not as Good
description: The most significant and discussed kitchen item since the electric blender has been, of course, the Cuisinart food processor, a gadget that first whirled into the public consciousness about two and a half years ago.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: TONES AND STONES Some 40 years ago, two young brothers found a guitar in a Brazilian rain forest near their tribal Indian village. This afternoon at 5:45, the same pair, who have since won an international reputation for scholarly string ,expertise under the name Los Indios Tabajaras, bring their guitar music to the Interlude series at Town Hall, 123 West 43d Street. Tickets are $3.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON Dec. 7 (AP)A Federal advisory panel voiced strong opposition today to any system of national identity cards for Americans.

title: Kissinger Entourage Loses a Key Source
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 7 (UPI)The famed senior American official, an institution in American journalism and diplomacy during the tenure of Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger, today quietly passed into history.

title: SUPREME COURT SIDESTEPS MISSISSIPPI TEACHER CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP)The Supreme Court today sidestepped a decision on whether public school teachers may be dismissed for sending their own children to racially segregated private schools.

title: Living Abroad: West Germany
description: IT'S SKI season again and between now and Easter millions of West Germans will be heading south to the Alp, of Bavaria. Switzerland and Austriabut skiing Is only part of the attraction.

title: Pick of the Disks: Rock, Jazz and Pop
description: Any consideration of popular music in the mid1970's proceeds from the assumption of rampant diversity, and any list of recent recommendable pop records reflects that diversity.

title: Cambridge Beats Oxford For Fifth Time in a Row
description: LONDON, Dec. 7 (UP)Cambridge, overwhelming favorite, defeated Ox150. today in their 95th varsity by Union match and became the side to post five consecutive victorious since the series began in 1871.

title: Gold
description: Selected world gold prices Tuesday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 100 Arrested by Bangladesh in Week
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Dec. 7 (AP)Ziaur Rahman, the military strongman of Bangladesh, has arrested more than 100 persons, including some prominent politicians, since he took over the country in name as well as fact last week. He also appears to be gaining political strength as the result of a good harvest.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: PASSING THROUGH: A floating dock, said to be the largest such structure ever built, being towed down the Hudson from Newburgh, NY., where it was built, around Manhattan en route to Groton, Conn. The vessel, measuring 500 by 100 feet, almost the size of two football fields, will be used by the Electric Boat Division of the General Dynamics Corporation during construction of Trident nuclearpowered submarines.

title: WALDHEIM IS BACKED BY SECURITY COUNCIL FOR FIVE YEARS MORE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 7Kurt Waldheim of Austria won Security Council approval todaytantamount to reelectionfor a second fiveyear term as Secretary General.

title: Kenya's Wildlife Loss
description: In sad contrast to the belated efforts to save America's wildlife heritage, shocking reports from Kenya indicate that the great animal parks of that country are deteriorating so rapidly that the total extinction of its magnificent wildlife in five years is predictedunless stern measures are taken immediately.

title: Columbia Edges UConn On Free's Basket, 7271
description: A layup by Ricky Free with 3 sec onds remaining gave Columbia a 7271 victory over Connecticut last night in Levien Gym.

title: Bidding on Bases
description: It is fortunate for the country that a new agreement for United States use of air and naval bases in the Philippines in return for largescale military and economic aid to the Government of President Ferdinand E. Marcos will be delayed until the Carter Administration can take a fresh look. It was most unwise, in our view, for Secretary of State Kissinger to have tried, barely six weeks before leaving office, to push through a pact calling for a billion dollars of American aid to the increasingly repressive regime in Manila.

title: East Side Murder: A Painstaking Police Hunt for Clues
description: There is a blowup of an apartment floor plan on the door of the squad commander's room in the headquarters of Manhattan's Fourth Homicide Zone. The poster says, The White House, but it is not a rendering of the interior of the President's home in Washington. Rather, the drawing depicts a fiveroom apartment at 201 East 66th Street, the adress of a tall, luxury building with a white facade.

title: Blazers Keep New Yorkers Off Target
description: The Knicks put on a show of shooting last night that would have embarrassed most schoolyard teams as they lost to the Portland Trail Blazezrs, 11194. at Madison Square Garden.

title: Code Proposed at U. of California May Curb Research by Its Faculty
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Dec. 7 The possibility that professors at the University of California can be forbidden to assign their own texts for classroom use or propose research grants from which they could derive financial benefits has arisen here as an outgrowth of a twoyearold Watergateinsoired state law.

title: Democrats Limit Ethics Panel Term
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 7The House Democratic Causes moved today toward an eventual restructuring of the House ethics committee by forbidding Democratic to serve more than two terms on the committee.

title: P. L. O. SAID TO WEIGH JOINING OTHER ARABS IN PEACE DELEGATION
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 7  Palestinian leaders are moving toward acceptance of an Egyptian proposal for their inclusion in a single Arab delegation to a reconvened Geneva conference on the Middle East, informed Arab diplomats said today.

title: Carter Campaign Outlay Exceeded The Legal Limit by About $185,000
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 7Jimmy Carter has formally reported to the Federal Election Commission campaign spending in the 1976 general election that exceeded the legal limit by about $185,000, potentially subjecting the Presidentelect to fine and jail sentence.

title: Simon Reported Planning Return ToSalomonBros.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 William E. Simon, the Secretary of the Treasury, is planning to return to Salomon Brothers, the New York investment banking firm he left in January 1973 to join the Nixon government, friends of Mr. Simon within the Administration said today.

title: Heath Fights Party on Home Rule
description: LONDON, Dec. 7Edward Heath, the former Prime Minister and still a popular figure with British voters, has broken with his party's leadership over a controversial bill that would give a measure of selfgovernment to the people of Scotland and Wales.

title: It's Fashionable Again to Be Fashionable
New York Welfare System Taxed By Rising Cases on Lower Budget
description: The elderly woman had been sitting in the drab offices in East Harlem while a young man with Project Access, a voluntary agency, made many telephone calls, trying vainly to find someone in the vast bureaucracy of New York City's Human Resources Administration who could handle her problem. As he began dialing again, she murmured, almost to herself:

title: SOVIET'S TRADE DEFICIT WITH WEST CLIMBS 13.5%
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 7 (UPI) The Soviet Union's trade deficit with Western industrialized nations rose 13.5 percent from the second to the third quarter of this year and passed the S3 billion mark, according to official statistics made public today.

title: Deer Hunt at Great Swamp Refuge Gets Under Way
description: BASKING RIDGE, Dec. 7Starting at 7 o'clock this morning, hunters began braving the steady downpour, the blustery winds and the angry looks of Humane Society volunteers to check in at the Great Swamp National Wildlife center here and then trudge off into the woods as the special deer hunt began.

title: New Comedy by Albee Well Received in London
description: LONDON. Dec. 7 (Reuters)Edward Albee's new work, Counting the Ways, was well received at its world premiere at the National Theater last night.

title: Friends of Calder Honor Him As Loving, Happy Bear of a Man
description: Four friends of the sculptor Alexander Calder. who died on Nov. 11 at the age of 78. paid warm and lively tribute to him in a setting of his works at the Whitney Museum.

title: Fed's Regulation Q Oppo4ed by Partee
description: J. Charles Partee, a member of the Federal Reserve Board, fired an opening salvo yesterday in the Congressional struggle building up over the renewal next March of the Fed's Regulation Q, which limits the interest paid to small depositors in banks and thrift institutions.

title: Meminger Gets Tryout
description: BOSTON, Dec. 7 (AP)Dean Meminger, the former Knick who played out his option with the Atlanta Hawks last season, has reported to the Boston Celtics for a tryout.

title: Supreme Court Rules Employers May Refuse Pregnancy Sick Pay
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7In a major setback to the women's rights movement, the Supreme Court ruled today, 6 to 3, that private employers who have programs temporarily compensating outofwork employees for a broad range of disabilities may refuse to compensate women for absences caused by pregnancy.

title: THE BRONFMAN CASE IS SENT TO THE JURY
Gilmore Talked to 2 Newsmen
description: DENVER, Dec. 7 (UPI)Despite orders barring reporters from interviewing Mr. Gilmore in the Utah penitentiary, two newsmen have already been allowed to see him and his former attorney is planning to write a book about the case, affidavits filed with the United States Court of Appeals for the 10th Circuit said today.

title: Active Selling Cuts Most Futures Prices; Soybeans Lose Pace
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 7 (AP) Active selling turned most commodity futures prices downward on the Chicago Board of Trade today.

title: Chess:
description: While a bishop will prove superior to a knight nine times out of 10 on an open board where there arcno obstructing center pawns, it is useful to know about the exceptional 10th time, when the knight comes into its own.

title: VIRGINIA ANN HALLAM
description: Virginia Ann Hallam. .the first woman lo head St. John's University's department of English, died Saturday at the National Cancer Institute in Bethesda, Md. She was 46 years old and a resident of Staten Island

title: Paris Printers Unions End Strike That Halted Papers for 2 Days
description: PARIS, Dec. 7 (UPI)Leftwing printer's unions called their striking members back to work today as negotiations began under government auspices to resolve the disputes that had halted publication of most French newspapers for 48 hours.

title: Ann Haenen's Skillful Voix
description: Poulenc's onecharacter opera La Voix Humaine is a craftily tailored tour de force drawn from Jean Cocteau's monodrama portraying a woman's last desperate telephone conversation with her exlover. To make its full effect, the role requires a soprano with magnetic stage presence and the vocal abilities of an accomplished diseuseone false move and the piece can degenerate into a bathetic embarrassment.

title: Pan Am Helicopters Get 3Year Approval
description: The City Planning Commission has voted to approve resumption of helicopter service by New York Airways from the roof of the Pan Am Building for a threeyear period.

title: DESERET BID STARTED BY WARNERLAMBERT
description: The WarnerLambert Company announced yesterday that through a subsidiary, WL Inc., it was commencing a cash tender offer to buy any and all shares of the common stock outstanding of the Deseret Pharmaceutical Company at $38 a share. If all of Deseret's 2.9 million common stock are tendered the transaction would amount to $110.3 million. The stock of Deseret soared 6 points to 37 and was the most actively traded on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday on a turnover of 390,900 shares. The issue was last traded last Tuesday when it rose 3 to 30. Officials of the company then hinted that a takeover announcementpresumably friendly was to be made soon. WarnerLambert, which is also traded on the Big Board, rose yesterday  to 29.

title: SeasonTicket Rebates Offered to Nets Fans
description: Fans of the New York Nets who had purchased .season tickets in the belief that Julius Erving would be a member of the team received some relief from the State of New York yesterday.

description: Music

title: U.S. Still Insists Sludge Dumping Will End in 1981
description: Gerald M. Hansler, regional administrator of the Federal Environmental Protection Agency, said yesterday the Government will not tolerate any failure by New York and New Jersey to meet a last deadline for halting the dumping, of sewage sludge in the ocean.

title: NUCLEAR RISKS RATED FOR A JERSEY UTILITY
description: TRENTON. Dec. 7A preliminary study made for the State Department of Environmental Protection concludes that there is one chance in a hundred that within the next 30 years the Jersey Central Power and Light Company's Oyster Creek nuclear plant in Ocean County might melt and release fatal radioactivity.

title: Hugh Fraser's Empire Shaken by His Gaming
description: LONDON, Dec.7 At 39, Sir Hugh Fraser seemed at the pinnacle of his career. His family held a fortune, and Sir Hugh retained control of more than 100 department stores across Britain, including Harrod's. He was a politician, a flamboyant socialite, a sleek and dapper businessman, a blunt, likable and unpompous Scot.

description: DENVER, Dec. 7 (UPI) A switch was closed today, permanently connecting or the first time power grids feeding electricity to the eastern and western areas of the United States and lessening chances of power outages in the Great Plains.

description: The sleeping giant of the Ivy League is awake. Look out!

title: Ford Staff Loses Sense of Mission
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  Jerry Jones, deputy assistant to President Ford, was walking down a White House driveway on his way home early one evening few days after the election when the magnitude of what had happened finally sank in.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Dec. 7Six persons, including three employees of the State Department of Labor and Industry, were arrested today on charges of defauding the Unemployment Compensation Fund of more than $17.000.

Johannesburg Restaurant Bombed

description: BEDMINSTER TOWNSHIP, Dec. 7What was promoted as the largest public history took place here today in a rainsoaked horse stable.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE BUCK DOESN'T STOP here any more. To use the fad word, nobody is accountable for what has gone wrong, or can be required to set it right. The observation is not new, but it can hardly have received so devastating a documentation as it does in this book.

title: CORRECTION
description: Identifications of two watches pictured in Tuesday's editions of The Times, one a genuine Carder and the other an imitation, were inadvertently switched.

title: DONAL C. O'BRIEN, 75, BANKING EXECUTIVE
description: Donal C. O'Brien. a retired banker and a civic leader, died yesterday in New Canaan, Conn. He was 75 years old and lived in New Canaan.

title: 20's Roar Back Into Town
description: After all the camp interpretations of the music of the 1920's that have proliferated in cabarets in recent years, Cathy Chamberlain's joyously affectionate projection of the image of the Jazz Age comes as a refreshing change. Miss Chamberlain, whose Rag n Roll Revue will be at Reno Sweeney for the next four weeks, manages to suggest a John Held Jr. flapper and Texas Guinan, a wampus starlet and a Rolf Armstrong cover girl for College Humor. Her torch songs sometimes have the sultry growl of Libby Holman or, at other times, the nasal lilt of Ruth Etting.

title: Britten Buried Near Home
U.S. Soccer Team Flies To Haiti
description: The United States national soccer team left for Surinam and the Netherlands Antilles yesterday to prepare for its World Cup match against Canada in Haiti.

title: In NATO Corridors: Theory and Practice
description: BRUSSELSThe change in world force relationships since the North Atlantic Treaty was first signed in 1949 has produced some interesting new assessments during the customary yearend meetings among allied ministers here.

description: Identifications of two watches pictured in Tuesday's editions of The Times, one a genuine Cartier and the other an imitation, were inadvertently switched.

title: CARTER MAY SEEK NOTICE IN ADVANCE OF PRICE INCREASES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP) After reding out wage and price controls. Presidentelect Jimmy Carter is considering asking some corporations to give advance notice of price increases as a means of combating inflation, his advisers say. Such notice would be designed to give the Government an opportunity to bring pressure to force a reversal of price increases it considers unjustified.

description: BASKETBALL

title: College Graduates List Most Useful Courses
description: Taking a look back, a group of 4,100 college graduates who graduated in the mid 1960's reported that courses in English, psychology, and business administration proved most useful in their jobs.

description: HAVANA, Dec. 7 (Reuters)Cuba and Angola have signed a new series of agreements specifying tasks to be performed by Cuban civilians in the former Portuguese territory, according to the Havana paper Juventud Rebelde.

description: TOKYO, Dec, 7Prime Minister Takeo Miki today told the members of his Cabinet, three of whom were defeated in their own local reelection bids on Sunday, that they were only caretakers and would resign, as required by law, when a special session of Parliament is convened later this month to choose a prime minister.

description: For those searchig for C?? gifts for bridgeplaying friends, a wide variety of items can be suggested.
