description: Two children were killed last night when fire swept through a house in the St. Albans section of Queens. Fire Department officials said the blaze broke out just before 8 o'clock in the ground floor of the house, at 12108 236th Street, and rapidly spread to the second floor.

title: Legislators to Submit Bills on Youth Crime
description: Reacting to the increasing number of violent crimes committed against the elderly and the resulting public outcry. Assembly Speaker Stanley Steingut and three other legislators announced yesterday that they would submit legislation that would require, among other things, a mandatory prison sentence for those who committed crimes against the elderly.

title: Rhode Island 72, Wash. State 65
description: KINGSTON, R.I., Dec. 9 (AP) Unbeaten. Rhode Island, led by Sly Williams, opened a 12%point lead in the first half and went ont to send Washington State to its first loss, 7265, tonight.

title: $2.5 Million in Drugs Seized
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 9 (UPI) Police and Federal drug agents arrested five persons and seized more than six pounds of heroin and cocaine valued at $2.5 million in raids on four locations in suburban Cicero and Oak Lawn last night, the authorities reported today.

title: CARTER GETS 2 PLANS FOR TAX REDUCTIONS AND CREATION OF JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 The chief executives of 15 major corporations and members of Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's transition staff presented him today with what turned out to be strikingly similar proposals for ending the economic slowdown.

title: Around the Nation
description: San Francisco to Bar Pistol Sale Permits

title: Aleen Schacht, a Vice President Of Hadassah on National Board
description: Aleen Ginsberg Schacht, a national vice president of Hadassah, died at her home in South Orange, N. J., yesterday after a long illness. She was 65 years old.

title: Washington Star President Quits
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP) Richard S. Stakes, president and chief executive officer of The Washington Star, resigned today for personal reasons, the publisher, Joe L. Allbritton, announced. Mr. Allbritton said it was with deep regret that he accepted Mr. Stakes's resignation.

title: The Lady Bing Tourney?
description: SAN DIEGO. Dec. 9 (AP)Plans for a new women's professional golf tournament named for Bing Crosby's wife, Kathryn, and paying a $65,000 purse were announced today. The tournament, sponsored by American Honda Motor Company of Los Angeles, will be held March 23 through 27 at Whispering Palms Country Club north of San Diego, near Del Mar. The director is Don Ross.

title: Mahopac Farm Playhouse Performing Godspell
description: As its first winter production, the Mahopac Farm Playhouse in Baldwin Place, N. Y., is presenting Godspell. The rock musical will be performed tonight and tomorrow night at 8 o'clock. Tickets are $5.50 tonight and 66.50 tomorrow night. Reservations may be made by calling (914) 6281189.

title: Nagasaki Protests U.S. ABlast
description: NAGASAKI, Japan, Dec. 9 (AP) The city of Nagasaki, destroyed by an American atomic bomb in 1945, sent a telegram today to the United States Ambassador, James D. Hodgson, protesting an underground nuclear test in Nevada. It was the 25th protest telegram sent by the city this year to nuclear nations.

title: Ecological Agencies Survive New York Fiscal Crisis
FRIEDGOOD CASE RESTS WITHOUT HIS TESTIFYING
description: MINEOLA, LI., Dec. 9 (UPD) The defense rested it case this morning without calling Dr. Charles E. Friedgood to testify at his trial for the alleged murder of his wife, Sophie.

title: Jerseyan on Trial With Another Confesses in Court to Murder
description: NEWARK, Dec. 9 (AP)A West Gaidwell, N.J. man, accused with a codefendant of murdering their childhood. friend. confessed during their trial that he had committed the murder.

title: CABINET IN BRITAIN IN ACCORD ON CUTS TO GET I. M. F. LOAN
description: LONDON, Dec. 9The British Cabinet ended more than two weeks of meetings today in apparent agreement over the austerity measures that this country is to take to satisfy the International Monetary Fund. Britain has asked the fund for a loan of $3.9 billion, partly to make up for its deficit in the balance of payments.

title: Ford Urged to End EuropeanJapanese Steel Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (UPI) The steel industry today urged President Ford to intercede in seeking an end of the steel trade agreement between the European Common Market and Japan.

title: TAXI FLEETS ACTING TO SPUR PACT TALKS
description: Gerald Cunningham, president of the Metropolitan Taxicab Board of Trade, said yesterday that the fleet owners would begin on Monday to charge each driver 5 cents for each gallon of gasoline used during his shift, unless settlement of a contract dispute was achieved or seemed to be near.

title: Basques Are Exhorted to Boycott Vote Next Week on Reform Bill
description: BILBAO, Spain, Dec. 8 Don't vote! Without amnesty, let someone else vote! Vote just a little!

title: ASSASSINATION STUDY REQUESTS $13 MILLION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 Richard A. Sprague, chief counsel of the House Select Committee on Assassinations, told Congress today that the reinvestigation of the deaths of President Kennedy and the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. would cost more than $13 million.

title: A Free, and Easy, Place For Music
description: I am exactly as I am/and not the way you'd like for me to be, sang the Fiction Brothers bluegrass quintet at the Free Music Store on a recent Saturday evening.

title: World News Briefs
description: Japanese Military Favors F15 as Next Basic Plane

title: Article 1 No Title
Car Insurance Companies Urged To Sit Down and Discuss Rates
description: TRENTON, Dec. 9State Assemblyman James W. Bornheimer, the chairman of the Assembly Committee on Insurance and Banking, said today that it was time for the state and automobile insurance companies to sit down and talk before the situation got out of hand.

title: PARCEL SERVICE VOTE ENDS 12WEEK STRIKE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (UPI) Some 18,000 employees of the United Parcel Service voted by a substantial majority today to end a 12week walkout that has delayed delivery of many Christmas packages in the East.

title: Rubin Carter Jury Hears Investigator Deny Bribe Offers
description: PATERSON, N.J., Dec. 9 An investigator for the State Public Defender's office testified today that no bribes or inducements had been offered to two men who had testified against Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis in their first trial in 1967 to recant their testimony seven years later.

title: Al's 80Acre Retreat In Michigan Is for Sale
description: BERRIEN SPRINGS, Mich., Dec. 9 (UPI)The 80acre retreat Muhammed All used as a training camp for his heavyweight title defense against Ken Norton Sept. 28 went on the selling block today fur nearly $1.5 million.

title: Youth With Long Record Admits Killing Man While Out on Parole
description: An 18yearold youth with an extensive criminal record pleaded guilty yesterday to killing a 75yearold man last March while out on parole on robbery charges.

title: Weekend Gardening: A Christmas Bulb Lights the Season
description: Tis the season to be giving and receiving amaryllis. And with a little care the amaryllis season can last for years and years.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Reynolds Metals Company of Richmond, Va., and Alcoa of Australia will head a consortium that will build a $675 million alumina refinery in the southwestern part of Western Australia, according to an announcement yesterday in Perth by the Australian state's premier, Sir Charles Court.

title: TESTS AT PLANT SHOW NO EMISSION OF MIREX
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y., Dec. 9 CAP)  Water samples taken from the drainage system of the Hooker Chemicals and Plastics Corporation here show that the plant is no longer discharging even residual amounts of the toxic chemical Mirex, it was reported today.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP) Money rates for Thursday:

title: Samuel Baron, Flutist, With Queens Symphony
description: Samuel Baron, flutist, will be soloist in a suite for flute by Telemann and Mozart's Flute Concerto No. 1 in G (K.313) with the Queens Symphony Chamber Orchestra in concerts tomorrow and Sunday. David Katz, the orchestra's music director, will conduct.

title: Money Supply Rises in Week, Wiping Out Decline
description: The Federal Reserve increased the nation's money supply in the week ended Dec. 1, wiping out the surprising decline that had occurred in the previous week.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: Sometimes the people who might look as though they'd make the best parents because they're so full of educated knowhow are the saddest after the baby is born. They come down with the disturbing baby blues, and the melancholy quiet is onry broken by the baby's crying or the mother's.

title: Implantable Eye Lenses Recalled
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP) The Food and Drug Administration announced yesterday the nationwide recall of about 500 implantable eye lenses following reports that nine cataract surgery patients had suffered serious infections. The manufacturer, Copeland Intra Lenses Inc., of New York City, is recalling the intraocular iris plane lenses because of possible nonsterility, the F.D.A. said. The recall involves all or part of lot numbers 76281, 76285, 76296, 76304 and 76310.

title: New Majority Whip of the House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 As the new majority whip in the House of Representatives, Stephen John Brademas is primarily responsible for keeping tabs on how the 298 Democrats in the chamber are likely to vote. noticing those who are wavering, recognizing then feeding those members the kind of information that would attract them to the side of the leadership. The role requires some subtle political maneuvers, and Me. Brademas has quietly established himself as a man with the cleverness to convince people on opposing sides of an issue that he is working for their interests.

title: At This Star Show, the Museum Is in the Heavens
description: For those accustomed to craning their necks to see the stars, galaxies and constellations on the dome of a planetarium, there is an alternativethe sky.

title: Forgettable Names, Familiar Film Faces
description: You can see him this weekend as the messiah of supranational business in Network and as the tubby, vulgar salesman in Silver Streak. You may have seen him earlier as the Miami district attorney in All The President's Men and as the hustling promotor in Nashville He's one of the busiest actors iii movies today. You know his face yet you probably don't know his name, which is Ned Beatty.

title: Edward Tang Hsu Is Dead at 76; Was Leading Nationalist Banker
description: Edward Tang Hsu, acting chairman of the Shanghai Commercial Bank of Hong Kong and chairman of the Shanghai Commercial and Savings Bank of Taipei, Taiwan, died Wednesday in Hong Kong after a brief illness. He was 76 years old.

title: Caterpillar to Expand
description: The Caterpillar Tractor Company of Peoria, Ill., said it planned to add 291000 feet of manufacturing space to its Davenport, Iowa, plant. It said most of the addition would be used for producing noncurrent parts. Construction is expected to begin next April and be completed in 1979. The cost was not disclosed.

title: For Children
description: Birthday Parties

title: Where to Go to Cut Your Own Tree for Christmas
description: The first snow of the winter has fallen, adding a touch of Currier & Ives to the landscape on the Christmastree farms to the north, now awaiting the annual influx of visitors from the metropolitan area who come to pick and cut their own trees for the holidays.

title: MORE JOBS EXPECTED FOR 77 GRADUATES
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 9Most of the country's large corporations appear to be planning to offer more jobs to college graduates next year than they did last June.

title: Truth in Business News
description: I have been trying to develop a better understanding of what is wrong between business and the press, with the hope of discovering what first steps we might take to set it right. That understanding has not been easy to come by.

title: NATO BARS REDS BID TO BAN ATOM STRIKE
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 9The foreign ministers of the North Atlantic countries agreed today to reject a Warsaw Pact proposal for a mutual ban on the first use of nuclear weapons and for a freeze on membership in their opposing military alliances.

title: The Screen: Cultural Intrusion
description: CHICK STRAND is a fine photographer and takes goodlooking pictures, but. her films are so heavy in judgment that they fall out of the screen.

title: Braves Trade 5 Players For Rangers Burroughs
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 9One telephone call made George Scott happy late last night and another made Jeff Burroughs unhappy early today. The call to Burroughs made him an Atlanta Brave; the one to Scott secured his future as a member of the Boston Red Sox.

title: Theater: Brilliant Fragments of Beckett
description: THE BLEAK pain of Samuel Beckett, his quiet agony, his stoic acceptance, and his minimal, but haunting poetry, are back with us again, this time at the Arena Stage's Kreeger Theater in Washington. Wednesday night the Arena offered the American premiere of th etwo latest Beckett fragments, That Time and Footballs.

title: Kissinger Is Keeping His Humor Dry as He Conducts His Last Official Mission Abroad
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 9 As photographers hovered around them, Henry A. Kissinger said to Sir Christopher Soames: You see, they take pictures of me like I'm a corpse. It was the kind of bittersweet joke that Mr. Kissinger has been making since he began his final mission overseas as Secretary of State. for nobody is more aware of Mr. Kissinger's loss of political potency than Mr. Kissinger himself.

title: A Dance of Time and the Rivers
description: After several years as a choreographerd rector on Broadway, Donald McKayle is back on the New York dance scene this weekend with Blood Memories, a major new dance work for the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater.

title: FORD SEES CONNALLY, REAGAN, ROCKEFELLER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9President Ford met at the White House today with his old rival, Ronald Reagan, and with Vice President Rockefeller and John B. Connally. The four Republican leaders called for the creation of a national coordinating committee to help rebuild their party.

title: Volvo Postpones Opening Of Assembly Plant in U.S.
description: DETROIT, Dec. 9 Volvo, citing lagging sales, announced today that it had delayed for at least a year plans to open an assembly plant in the United States.

title: Vote Recount on Grenada Shows Prime Minister Is Still in Power
description: ST. GEORGES, Grenada, Dec. 9 (AP) Prime Minister Eric Gairy and his ruling party were declared still in power in this Caribbean island republic today after election recounts that delayed the official announcement for two days.

title: California Gets Death Penalty Bill
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 9 (UPI)  The first of probably many bills seeking to reinstate the death penalty in California was introduced in the legislature yesterday, a day after the State Supreme Court struck down the previous law as unconstitutional. The court unanimously overturned the 1963 law on grounds that it made execution mandatory for certain crimes and did not allow for consideration of mitigating circumstances.

title: Journalism Chair Is Endowed at Columbia
description: The CBS Foundation has made a $1 million grant to the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism to establish a chair in international journalism.

title: SOUTH AFRICAN COURT VOIDS EDITOR'S TERM
description: JOHANNESBURG, Dec. 9 An appeals court quashed a sixmonth jail sentence today on Donald Woods, a white, who is one of South Africa's foremost editors, ruling that nis trial for refusing to identify a witness to an alleged crime had been improperly conducted.

title: Greenwich Academy in 150th Year
description: GREENWICH, Conn. On the highest ground of Greenwich Academy's 24 semiwooded acres here, the driveway leads to the whitepillared veranda of the former William A. Rockefeller mansion. Inside, amid a sea of red carpeting, an Irish setter named Crispin sleeps in front of a huge fireplace. A gracious staircase curves upward from a In education and interpersonal relationships.

title: Agnew Is Reported to Have Lost His Bid for Pardon From Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (UPI) Former VicePresident Spiro T. Agnew, who pleaded no contest to one count of income tax evasion in 1973, recently unsuccessfully to get a pardon from President Ford, Jack Anderson, the newspaper columnist, reported today.

title: First Live Telecast of a Met Opera Made Possible by $200,000 Grant
description: After seeking an active presence on television for 26 years, the Metropolitan Opera Company announced yesterday that next March, for the first time, would broadcast live on televison the complete regular performance of an opera.

title: Greenwich Academy in 150th Year
description: GREENWICH, Conn.On the highest ground of Greenwich Academy's 24 semiwooded acres here, the driveway leads to the whitepillared veranda of the former William A. Rockefeller mansion. Inside, amid a sea of red carpeting, an Irish setter named Crispin sleeps in front of a huge fireplace. A gracious staircase curves upward from a in education and interpersonal relatonships.

title: DEMOCRATS IN HOUSE ASK INQUIRY ON KOREA
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 House Democrats urged the chamber's ethics committee, today to undertake a major investigation of South Korean influencepeddling on Capitol Hill.

title: Bay State Indians Win Back Land
description: GAY HEAD, Mass., Dec. 9 (UPI) Faced with a Federal court suit, residents of Gay Head on the resort island of Martha's Vineyard agreed tonight to turn over 200 acres of common land to the Wampanoag indian tribe free of charge.

title: Gold Is Up 50 Cents In Cautious Trading After Gain at I.M.F.
description: Speculators in gold bullion futures were surprisingly cautious yesterday after the strong rise in bids at the latest International Monetary Fund's auction of the metal the day before.

title: The U. N. Today
description: Meets at 3 P.M. on the Law of the Sea Conference and committee reports.

title: Paris Exchange Closed by Strike
description: PARIS. Dec. 9 (AP) The Paris Stock Exchange was closed today by a oneday strike of employees protesting planned layoffs in several departments. The bourse has been closed several times in past years by such oneday strikes over employee grievances.

title: LITTLE AID EXPECTED FROM CITY'S SURPLUS
description: New York City officials cautioned yesterday that a newly anticipated $320 million cash surplus for the current fiscal year could not be used to ease future spending cuts, because very little of the cash represented actual revenue for the budget.

title: Spooks vs. Zilch
description: The shadowy powers of the socalled intelligence community are attempting to run their first big bluff on Presidentelect Carter. If he's a government manager half as tough as he's billed himself, he'll crack down on them instead.

title: Faithful Gather to Recall a Dinosaur: C.S. Lewis (18981963)
description: C. S. Lewis (18981963) was an academic who sought delight in myth, a skeptic who found joy in faith, a writer who gave pleasure with deft word and sprightly image.

title: CORRECTION
description: Visiting hours at the NewYork Historical Society were incorrectly listed in yesterday's Times. They are 1 to 5 P.M. Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Thursdays, Fridays and Sundays; 10 AM. to 5 P.M. Saturdays; closed Mondays.

title: STATE DEPT. REJECTS 2D PROTEST BY SEOUL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 The Department of State rejected today another South Korean ultimatum, the second in two days, and publicly told the Government in Seoul that its demanding statements were not helpful.

title: Inaugurating A Messiah Season
description: COLIN DAVIS and the Boston Symphony Orchestra formally began the 1976 Christmas Messiah season Wednesday night with an invigorating performance at Carnegie Hall that was repeated last night.

title: Army Is Said to Plan Transfer of General From West Point Job
description: The Army is planning quietly to transfer Brig. Gen. Walter F. Ulmer, the Commandant of Cadets at the United States Military Academy during its recent cheating scandal, sources in the Pentagon said last night.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Dec. 9The state judiciary announced today a research project to establish guidelines for judges to impose more uniform criminal sentences.

title: Anxieties About NATO
description: A senior United States military attachl returning to his post in Western Europe confided to a friend that, after extensive Pentagon briefings on Soviet deployments, I'm frightened, and I've never been frightened before. His anxiety is shared by general officers in the North Atlantic Treaty Organization countries. The concern is based first, the officers say, on the increased strength of Soviet tactical nuclear weapons in Europe along with a new emphasis in Russian military writing on the importance of surprise and the inevitability of nuclear war once the first shot of a conventional war has been fired.

title: Gov. Grasso Weighs Action in Reilly Case
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 9 (AP) Gov. Ella T. Grasso, saying the Peter Reilly murder case raises doubts about 'our systern of justice, agreed today to consider the naming of a special prosecutor to investigate the Reilly case as well as similar cases.

title: Chicago Police Warned Of Further Hiring Quotas If Discrimination Persists
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 9 An angry Federal judge has threatened to reimpose strict racial quotas on the Chicago Police Department because of its failure to adhere to a hiring plan agreed upon in September.

title: Participant Tells of C.I.A. Ruses to Hide Glomar Project
description: The Central Intelligence Agency used secret stairways, fake offices, hideaway apartments and even set up a spurious marine engineering concern in Los Angeles as part of an effort to maintain the secrecy of its 1974 attempt to salvage a sunken Soviet submarine, according to a participant in the project.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Nursing Strike Put Off

title: Rail Freight Traffic Rises 3.1%
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 15.4 billion tonmiles, up 3.1 percent from the yearearlier level. Carloading,s in the same period totaled 441,150 cars, off 3 percent from last year. The American Trucking Associations Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage rose 7.4 percent from last year.

title: SINGER IS DROPPING MORE BUSINESSES
description: rhe Singer Company announced yesterday that it had decided to get but of the mailing equipment, knitting, luting, venturecapital and trafficcontrol businesses. Provisions totaling $52.3 million were established for expenses and possible were established for actions.

title: U.N.'s AntiHostage Attempt Gains
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 9 Arab and Western countries reached a compromise today on a proposal for an international treaty against the taking of hostages. The agreement virtually assures unanimous adoption of the resolution by the General Assembly's Legal Committee.

title: Advertising
description: It makes a particularly clever advertising agency to come up with the idea of promoting the avocado seed as an inpack premium.

title: Levitt Mail Survey of Car Registration For 30 Days Uncovers 241 Not on File
description: A winnowing of results of a mail survey of motor vehicle registrations over a 30day test period found 241 renewals of which there were no records on file in the State Motor Vehicle Department and 229 of these were on, Staten Island.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Desireto Do Right Thing Prompted Holtz Decision
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Dec. 9He was smiling when he picked up the telephone; the worst was over. His fingers found the right buttons easily, and he waited for his wife to answer. She was in East Liverpool, Ohio, attending her father, who had suffered a stroke. He was in his office, attending to the business of resigning.

title: Scotland Leads in World Cup Golf
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif. Dec. 9 (UPI)Brian Barnes of Scotland shot a twounderpar 79 and his partner, Sam Torrance, posted a 73 today to give their country a firstround lead over the United States and Taiwan in the 24th World Cup golf championship.

title: Winds of the Renaissance to Blow From Tully Hall
description: Heard any good crumhorns lately? How about shawms, sackbuts and cornettos? These winds of change from medieval to Renaissance musical styles, along with viols, lutes, recorders and an assortment of percussion instruments, will be a happy feature of tomorrow night's Alice Tully Hall concert by the Waverly Consart.

title: SoHo: Figures At an Exhibition
description: ONE OF THE MOST STRIKING developments in the New York art scene in recent years has been the increased sense of community among painters and sculptors working in the figurative tradition. and the increased spirit of militancy with which they campaign for a figurative esthetic.

title: Auction Pullout Set By Cadillac Fairview
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 9 The Cadillac Fairview Corporation of Toronto, one of the two major suitors for the Irvine Company, announced today that it would withdraw from an auction battle for the company, but said it was willing to submit a new higher sealed bid.

title: An Industrial Innovation Crisis Is Decried at M.I.T. Symposium
description: American industrial managers have spent too much effort on setting up corporate research centers and not enough on translating the ideas of scientists into marketable products, a symposium on the management of innovation was told yesterday.

title: A Softening of Some Issues
description: TRENTON, Dec. 9 Governor Byrne, who is still testing his ship of state to see if he can navigate it for a new fouryear term, tossed some unwanted ballasts over the side yesterday. The Governor dropped his support for a plan to force suburban and rural communities to accept more low and moderateincome families, a controversial proposal at best, and one that a candidate with Mr. Byrne's political problems can ill afford to champion.

title: U.S. SALES TEAM ALLOWED TO APPROACH INDIA ON JET
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP) The State Department has given the McDonnellDouglas Aircraft Corporation permission to make a sales presentation to India on A4 jet fighters, Administration sources said today.

title: Priority for Panama
description: The 73d anniversary of the signing of the Panama Canal treaty last month passed without notice in the United States but not in Panama. There, students and others staged ceremonial burnings of the treaty, which gave the United States control of the tenmilewide Canal Zone in perpetuity. Foreign Minister Aquilino Boyd attended one such demonstration in Panama City.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Couple Killed in Their Midtown Chinese Restaurant
description: The man and wife who owned the Szechuan D'Or, a Chinese restaurant at 242 East 40th Street, were found shot to death yesterday just inside their restaurant's doorway shortly before it was to open for lunch.

title: Further Discord Surfaces on Access to Big Board
description: A minority report to the board of directors of the New York Stock Exchange yesterday added to indications of strong dissatisfaction among floor members to proposals to broaden access to membership.

title: Management
description: For executives accustomed to running a corporation or financial institution, the prospeet of government service can be somewhat unsettling. After all, government at all levels moves slowly, and the pressures are multifaceted.

title: Open Interest
Carter Says He Favors Northeast Development Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 Presidentelect Jimmy Carter told eight Governors from the Northeast today that he was favorably disposed toward the setting up of a. vast development agency for the region.

title: Archbishop T. J. Toolen Eulogized By Sheen at Funeral In Alabama
description: Archbishop Thomas J. Toolen, retired spiritual leader of the Roman Catholic Diocese of MobileBirmingham, was eulogized yesterday by Archbishop Fulton J. Sheen as a dedicated churchman who worked in behalf of minorities years befor the 1960's civil rights movement in Alabama.

title: Trudeau Puts ExAide in Senate
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 9 Jean Marchand, a oncepowerful Cabinet minister who was recently defeated in the Quebec electoral sweep of a separatist party, was named to the Senate today by Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau. Members of the Senate. which has less power than its American counterpart, are appointed by the Prime Minister.

title: 2 Giants Work Out At New Positions
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Dec. 9 Two members of the Giants offensive squad worked at defensive positions today at Giants Stadium as injuries continue to deplete the National Football League team. Ron Mikolajczyk, an offensive lineman, practiced at defensive tackle, where the Giants have only one ablebodied reserve, Rick Dvorak.

title: The Jets Owners Should Sell
description: Perhaps now the Jets owners will realize that they are the real problemnot the coach, not the players. Perhaps now the Jets owners will do what they should have done years agosell the club to owners who will create a winning organization. Usually the owners discharge a coach, but yesterday Lou Holtz in effect discharged the owners. He decided that he would rather coach college football, probably at the University of Arkansas, than pro footballan embarrassing kick in the shins for the owners of a National Football League team. With the Jets, losing isn't everything, it's the only thing. Some people will accuse Lou Holtz of not honoring his commitment to the Jets, meaning the remaining four seasons of his fiveyear contract. But if his heart were not in it, his commitment would not have been worth much. His heart apparently is in college coaching. That can be a noble occupation. Don't complain about Lou Holtz not honoring his commitment. The essence of his resignation is that the Jets owners have not honored their commitment to the pro football public and to pro football itself.

title: Atlantic Richfield: Bold and Imaginative
description: LOS ANGELES In terms of its sales of $8 billion annually, the Atlantic Richfield Company ranks only eighth among the nation's oil giants, but has been stirring up controversy in many areas with some bold and imaginative actions in the last decade, particularly this year. The company, which has headquarters here, is now awaiting a decision from an Eastern court proceeding to see whether it can pursue one of its most ambitious goals  its merger with the Anaconda Company.

title: Restaurants
description: SEA FARE OF THE AEGEAN, that high, wide and glowingly handsome restaurant on 56th Street between Fifth and Sixth Avenues, has been the best seafood house in this city for so long we tend to take it and its proprietor for granted when, in fact, both deserve singling out.

title: Tips on Tickets
description: Tickets to Visions of Kerouac, at the Lion Theater Company tonight and tomorrow at 8 o'clock and Sunday at 3 P.M., are $3.50. Phone reservations accepted. 9474224.

title: Esmark Quarter Profits Up 3.5%; Earnings for the Year Rise 3.6%
description: Esmark Inc., which operates Swift & Company, the world's largest meat packers. reported yesterday profit increases of 3.5 percent for the fourth fiscal quarter. Annual revenues exceeded the $5 billion mark for the first time.

title: Gold Prices Lifted by I.M.F. Sale; Pound Is Steady After Early Gain
description: LONDON, Dec. 9 (AP)The price of gold surged ahead on European exchanger today following the International Monetary Fund's fifth bullion auction. An ounce of gold sold for $137 in London at the close, up from $135.625 the day before. It closed in Zurich at $136.50, up from $135.75.

title: A RagRock Star to Watch
description: Cathy Chamberlain, who has studied opera, engineering and fashion design, has been a gogo dancer and who has mastered two musical instrumentsthe jug and the concertinahas finally found a mission in life. She wants to pay homage to the American music heritage.

title: TV WEEKEND
description: IN 1955, NBC presented the stage musical of Peter Pan starring Mary Martin to 65 million viewers, the largest television audience recorded until that time. This Sunday at 7:30 P.M., the network has a completely new musical adaptation of the James M. Barrie play, this one featuring Mia Farrow as Peter, the boy who flies from adventure to adventure, refusing to grow up. With comparisons obviously unavoidable, the new production loses points in certain areas and gains some in others.

title: Lebanese Organize An Interim Cabinet To Rebuild Country
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon. Dec. 9 An interim Lebanese Cabinet was formed here today tinder a decree issued by Prime Minister Selim alHoss.

title: Measles Cases Are Up 64% Over 75 Pace, With Rise Linked to Swine Flu Drive
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 9 (AP) Measles cases are up 64 percent so far this year, and a Federal health official said yesterday that he was concerned that next year may be worse at least partly because of the national swine flu immunization program.

title: Byrne and Merlino to Discuss Blocked Nomination
description: State Senator Joseph P. Merlin, who has blccked a Senate vote on the nomination of Eileen P. Thornton as director. of the State Division on Women since September, will meet today with Governor Byrne in Trenton to discuss the matter.

title: Art: Her Own Way
description: Artists are often accused of following trends and joining bandwagons, and many do, of course. It is certainly one way to get noticed. But there are always serious artists who, regardless of the fashions of the moment, go their own wayeven when it is a lonely way to goto satisfy the inner compulsions of their own vision.

title: Article 2 No Title
Rutgers, Kansas Fives Triumph at Garden
description: Rutgers and Kansas both came back from firsthalf deficits and scored impressive victories last night as Madison Square Garden opened ats 434 season of college basketball before a crowd of 7,678.

title: Utica Mayor Suspends Police Chief and 4 Others
description: Richard A. Hanna, the controversial populist mayor of Utica, N. Y., suspended the city's Chief of Police and four other police officers yesterday when the chief ordered the Mayor and a locksmith arrested for picking the lock of the chief's office at police headquarters.

title: Heart Facility Provides Care For Needy Ill
description: What does a man with a wife and seven children do when he desperately needs heart surgery, but knows the bill will be so staggering that he might have to spend the rest of his life paying it?

title: Highs and Lows
description: NEW HIGHS 169

title: Baseball Giving OrioleGamesinWashington Plan Another Time at Bat
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 9A vague Promise to try to arrange some baseball games by the Baltimore Orioles in Washington in 1978 was the substance of a muchheralded plan introduced today to solve baseball's Washington problem.

title: Sex Bias Is Charged At JobRule Hearings
description: In testimony presented in four days of hearings that concluded in New York City yesterday, women's and civil rights organizations protested proposed changes in Equal Employment Opportunity regulations for Federal contractors.

title: Strains in Carter Transition
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 In just the first month of Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's transition to the White House, that original blush of innocence in the Carter entourage has begun to fade. Like others who have taken over the Government before them, the Carter people are finding it more difficult to exercise power than to seek it harder to keep peace among themselves, to satisfy their various constituencies, to maintain their sense of momentum, or to stick to the letter of campaign promises to set a new style and tone without falling into traditional ways of conducting the nation's business.

title: 5 of N.F.L.'s Best Teams Are on TV This Weekend
description: There will be almost 15 pro football on television this weekend. with three games tomorrow and two Sunday. Each will have one playoff contender favored to win from an opponent with a losing record. Tomorrow brings Minnesota a Miami (Channel 2, 1 P.M. Pittsburgh at Housion (Channel 4, 4 P.M.) aud Los Angeles at Detroit (Channel 7, 9 P.M.) On Sunday, Channel 2 Will televise the GiantsSt. Louis game at the Meadowlands at 1 P.M., rather than Washington at Dallas at 4 P.M., and Channel 4 will have Buffalo at Baltimore, 2 P.M. The regular season ends on Sunday so there will be no Monday night game. Previews of all games follow with wonlosttied records in parentheses.

title: MORE JOBS EXPECTED FOR 77 GRADUATES
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 9 Most of the country's large corporations appear to be planning to offer more jobs to college graduates next year than they did last June.

title: Bridge
description: The World Team Olympiad in Monte Carlo last May highlighted a problem that has plagued serious players for more than hall a century.

title: CARTER GETS 2 PLANS FOR TAX REDUCTIONS AND CREATION OF JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The chief executives of 15 major corporations and members of Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's transition staff presented him today with what turned out to be strikingly similar proposals for ending the economic slowdown.

title: A Building Is Salvaged
description: One example of efforts to rehabilitate the New York City park system is the newly refurbished recreation building in Flushing Memorial Park, Queens.

title: Pop Life
description: SYNTHESIZED versions of classical music fall into the classical category when the trade magazines assemble their sales charts. But by any generous definition of popular musicmusic that is popularthe most commercially successful of these ventures qualify as pop.

title: Seagram Aides To Appeal Today On Suspension
description: Officials of Joseph E. Seagram & Sons Inc., the nation's largest distiller, are scheduled to appear today before a Government agency that has ordered a nineday suspension of the company's Federal operating license. The suspension has not yet gone into effect.

title: Art People
description: FIFTYSEVENTH STREET, which over the years has had its ups and downs as a contemporary art scene, is making a thunderous comeback. To be sure, it's never lacked for contemporary dealersBetty Parsons, Pierre Matisse, Sidney Janis, Midtown, Marlborough, Pace and Emmerich, among otherswho've held the line amid a welter of antique, haute couture and hairdressing establishments. But within the last two years, enough new starts have been made on 57th Street by galleries debuting or moving from other locations to assume the proportions of a trend.

title: Betty Stove Advances With Mrs. Court at Net
description: MELBOURNE, Australia Dec. 9 (AP) Betty Stove ousted Janet Newberry, 62, 61, today and advanced to a semifinal encounter with Margaret Court in the Toyota women's tennis tourney.

title: Books of The Times
description: AN INSUFFICIENT talent is the cruelest of all temptations, George Moore said. It is perhaps the most painful form of unrequited love, consuming the spirit instead of replenishing it. For some, it is like a religion that can never be wholly understood, that consists only of catechism, trial and penance. Such is the talent of Clem Stevens in James Hanley's new novel, A Dream Journey.

title: Deposit inflow by Savings Banks In November Largest in 8 Months
description: New York State savings banks recorded a S3I0 million net inflow of deposits in November, the largest inflow in eight months, the Savings Banks Association of Nev York State reported yesterday. The deposit inflow was S261 million in October and S287 million in November 1975.

title: Payment to Braves Is Said to Total $2.5 Million
description: The Knicks acquired Bob McAdoo after all yesterday.

title: At the Movies
description: GIANCARLO GIANNINI, the cinema's most ingratiatingly unregenerate male chauvinist, will soon cast his powerful macho spell on an American female. Candice Bergen, the liberated actress and photojournalist, will join Mr. Giannini in Calabria. Italy, on Jan. 3 for the shooting of A Night Full of Rain, the storY of a lovely, vulnerable photojournalist who clicks her shutter and goes faint at the sight of an egotistical peacock of an Italian Communist. The director and writer of the film is Lina Wertmuller, the whirlwind who whipped Mr. Giannini through his bravura course in Love and Anarchy. The Seduction of Mimi, Swept Away and Seven Beauties. This time, however, the frenzied tour will be conducted in English.

title: 2 Convicted of Heroin Smuggling in Ring Described as Major Source
description: Francois Chiappe, a 56yearold Corsican who was one of the leaders of a major narcotics ring that spanned three continents and brought six tons of heroin into the United States, was convicted yesterday by a Federal jury in Brooklyn on a charge of conspiracy to import and distribute heroin.

title: A Louis Icart Revival That Can't Be Ignored
description: A revival of interest in Louis Icart, the French commercial artist popular between World War I and II, can no longer be ignored.

title: Only U.S. and Israel Are Opposed As U.N. Approves Geneva Talks
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 9 Unwilling to commit the Carter administration to a specific negotiating procedure, the United States reluctantly voted against an Egyptian proposal today to convene the Geneva conference on the Middle East by March 1.

title: Venezuela and Soviet Reach an Agreement on Oil
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 Venezuela has given details of an accord with the Soviet Union to exchange petroleum markets for a volume of 20,000 barrels a day, thereby effecting a considerable saving on transportation costs, according to Venezuelan officials.

title: Dunne Will Oppose Caso in a Primary For Executive Post
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Dec. 9 State Senator john R. Dunne announced today his candidacy for the Republican nomination for Nassau County Executive in 1977, thus making formal a primary fight within the county Republican organization that has been simmering for the last month.

title: Herald Buys 5.46 Million Shards Of Booth Newspapers at $47 Each
description: The Herald Company, purchasing representative of S. I. Newhouse, the newspaper chain owner, announced that it had purchased a total of 5.46 million shares of common stock of Booth Newspapers Inc. at $47 a share, for a total outlay of about $256.6 million.

title: Stage: Theater Songs By Maltby and Shire
description: THEATER SONGS by Maltby and Shire in the cabaret at the Manhattan Theater Club could have been entitled Special Material. Richard Maltby, as lyricist, and David Shire, as composer, have written songs for, among others, Barbra Streisand, Pearl Bailey, Andy Williams, Roberta Flack, Shirley Bassey and Robert Goulet.

title: Norfolk &
description: The Norfolk. and Western Railway Company and Great Lakes and European Lines, a steamship company. have joined to offer shippers a single rate between the United States Midwest and Europe.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: Friday

title: Dr. Simon J. Molnar, 58, Is Dead; Athletic Director at State U., Potsdam
description: POTSDAM, N.Y., Dec. 9 Dr. Simon J. Molnar, 58 years old, director of athletics at the State University College here, died late last night, apparently or a heart attack.

title: DONOR IS GRATEFUL IN HELPING NEEDIEST
description: A quotation from the writings of Ralph Waldo Emerson is included in a letter that contained a check for $175 to the 65th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: U.S., BRITAIN TO TALK ON RHODESIA TODAY
description: GENEVA, Dec. 9 The deadlocked confernence on Rhodesia stood in abeyance today while Britain, the chairman, consulted. with the United States.

title: Article 4 No Title
A Guide To
description: New York

title: Publishing: More Black Boy
description: RICHARD WRIGHT'S Black Boy is generally considered one of the classic autobiographical accounts of the black experience in the South during the first quarter of this centurythe South of Jim Crow instead of Jimmy Carter. Its final paragraph went:

title: A Rehired Fireman Dies After Blaze
description: A 30yearold New York City fireman who had been laid off and then rehired, collapsed and died early yesterday after fighting three fires.

title: Opera: An Admirable Aida
description: Though Gilda CruzRomo, who renlaced the indisposed Martina Arroyo in Aida on Wednesday night at the Metropolitan Opera, is no stranger to the title role in Verdi's popular opera, her previous appearaces in the current John Dexter production had all been on tour, rather than in New York.

title: Waldo Waterman, 82, Dies; Was Pioneer in Aviation And Son of a Governor
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 9 (AP) Waldo Waterman, an aviation pioneer who was a son of a California governor and once general manager of the old Los Angeles Metropolitan Airport, died in a hospital yesterday. He was 82 years old.

title: British Free 2 Uganda Officers Seized on Suspicion of a Plot
description: LONDON, Dec. 9 (Reuters) Two Uganda Army officers, detained at Heathrow airport last night because one had a woman's passport in his pocket, have been given permission to stay in Britain for a week.

title: SHIPMENTS OF ALUMINUM THROUGH SEPTEMBER RISE
description: Aluminum shipments through September reached 9.69 billion pounds, a gain of 35 percent over the like 1975 period, the Aluminum Association reported yesterday. By contrast shipments for all of last year totaled just 9.93 billion pounds.

title: Oddball Properties End Up at F.D.I.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (UPI) The Government agency responsible for insuring 14,000 of the nation's banks has acquired a financial interest in some unusual assets lately: fleets of tuna boats and taxis, an Xrated movie, a bawdy house and a highpriced copy of the Koran. The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation also has purchased 47 wind machines at a cost of $427,000 to protect its citrus crops from freezing.

title: P.L.O., Set Back in Lebanon, Told by Allies to Compromise
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 9The Palestine Liberation Organization, which was born in the refugee camps 13 years ago, aurtured into a military power, then devastated by defeats in Jordan in 1971 and in Lebanon this year, is now under severe pressure from Arab allies to scale down its political objectives.

title: Miss Fisher Takes 2d in Giant Slalom
ISAAC GERSHMAN
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 9 (AP) Isaac Gershman, who trained two generations of reporters during 33 years as general manager of the City News Bureau of Chicago, died yesterday in Miami Beach. He was 82 years old.

title: CORRECTION
description: Visiting hours at the NewYork Hietorical Society were incorrectly listed in yesterday's Times. They are 1 to 5 P.M. Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Thursdays, Fridays and Sundays; 10 A.M. to 5 P.M. Saturdays; closed Mondays.

title: Paris Conference of Rich and Poor Countries Is Put Off Till After Carter Inaugural
description: PARIS, Dec. 9 The northsouth conference of rich and poor countries, scheduled to open here next week to continue negotiations toward a new world economic order, has been postponed, it was announced today.

title: Strains in Carter Transition
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 In just the first month of Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's transition to the White House, that original blush of innocence in the Carter entourage has begun to fade. Like others who have taken over the Government before them, the Carter people are finding it more difficult to exercise power than to seek it harder to keep peace among themselves, to satisfy their various constituencies, to maintain their sense oi momentum, or to stick to the letter of campaign promises to set a new style and tone without falling into traditional ways of conducting the nation's business.

title: Democrats in House Urge Korea Inquiry By the Ethics Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9House Democrats urged the chamber's ethics committee today to undertake a major investigation of South Korean influencepeddling on Capitol Hill.

title: Greek Voices, Bloody Battles
description: Harry Mark Petrakls, a respected noveiist (A Dream of Kings, among others) and short story writer ("Pericles on 31st Street, a collection) who often writes of GreekAmericans in a contemporary setting, turns in his new novel to 19thcentury Greece and the 10year war for independence against Turkish suzerainty. The Hour of the Bell covers the first year of the war, 1821, and culminates in the siege of Tripolitza, a Greek victory that quickly degenerated into looting and massacre.

title: Mailer Takes on the Heavyweight Novel
description: There is a fancy wistfulness about writers in their 50's, Norman Mailer says. They wonder, Do I still have enough skill left to bring it off?

title: Police in New York Name First Woman As a Precinct Head
description: The first woman to head a police precinct in New York City was named yesterday by Police Commissioner Michael J. Codd.

title: NATO BARS REDS BID TO BAN ATOM STRIKE
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 9 The foreign ministers of the North Atlantic countries agreed today to reject a Warsaw Pact proposal for a mutual ban on the first use of nuclear weapons and for a freeze on membership in their opposing military alliances.

title: Front Page 1 No Title
Trial of Pressmen Is Postponed; Judge Cites Fear of Tainted Jury
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP) The trial of 15 former Washington Post pressmen on charges of rioting and destroying property was postponed today until Feb. 14.

title: FOUR STATES BACKED ON REDLINING APPEAL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 The Federal Reserve Board gave conditional approval today to applications by four states, including New York, to be exempted from provisions of Federal antiredlining legislation because they have substantially similar laws.

title: Art: Eagles, Eagles, Everywhere
description: IT IS NOT in the Belgian nature to do things by halves. Marcel Broodthaers (19241976) was probably the most thoroughgoing of all the European artists who set themselves to build complete environments around the time of the last Documenta exhibition in Kassel, Germany. Broodthaers v.anttd to recreate the whole world in relation to a single word. He chose aigle, or eagle, and he researched in its every possible implication, from the symbolio to the ornithological. He also ransacked the cheerless little town of Aigle. in Switzerland, for every scrap of documentation that somewhere incorporated the name of Aigle. By the time we were through the tour we were not so much eagleconscious as eagle crazy and ready to see Eagle as the brand name of every automobile in the streets and stewed eagle as the dish of the day in every restaurant.

title: Pressure to Tap Again
description: Any suggestion that Attorney General Edward H. Levi might be soft on the protection of the nation's security against foreign espionage sounds like a bad joke. Yet, such a charge is implicit in complaints by senior officials of the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Central Intelligence Agency that Mr. Levi, by refusing to approve requests for wiretaps, has hampered their efforts to combat hostile foreign intelligence activities.

title: It's Not Too Cold For Halston Fans To Think Spring
description: Halston fans came out of the cold and interrupted their Christmas shopping long enough yesterday afternoon to see what their hero had in mind for them for spring.

title: Broadway
description: HAPPY END, the Kurt WeillBertolt Brecht musical (some people may say it is a lyric piece for theater) has not been seen much in this country, but now it will. Michael Harvey will proauce Happy End, and he has signed Shirley Knight and Tony Lo Bianco to star in it, and Michael Posnick to direct it. Happy End will be at the Buffalo Studio Arena from Jan. 21 to Feb. 19, and after that, Mr. Harvey says, he would like to book it into two other cities before bringing it to Broadway in April. Happy End k the opposite of what you think of as Brecht, Mr. Harvey says. This is a warm, friendly, humorous show.

title: Adirondack Showdown
description: When the State of New York accepted the Adirondack Park Agency's plan for overseeing the uses of private lands within the park, it also created a Local Government Review Board to represent the communities. This board's function was to advise, assist and monitor the agency.

title: People in Sports
description: He's the greatest back I ever coached, said Bo Schemblechler of Michigan yesterday at a dinner in Southfield, Mich., where Rob Lytle received the Wiseman Trophy as the nation's outstanding college football player. The Wolverine running back, senior, set single season and career rushing records at Michigan. He completed the regular season with 1,405 yards on 203 carries.

title: Players Like Michaels For Next Coach of Jets
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Dec. 10There will be no change in the Jets ownership or in the general manager, the beleaguered club's president, Phil Iselin, said today.

title: Barnes Aids Pistons as Nets Lose
Chiang Ching's Dances Are Hints
description: The atmospheric turmoil attending Chiang Ching's dances suggests that there is more behind them than actually appears on stage. The hints, portents and symbolic gestures are like the tip on an iceberg of meaning that remains veiled for the most part. What there is to he seen is accomplished, tastefully designed. but less than what is hinted at. Miss Ching presented her work at the Theater of Riverside Church Thursday evening.

title: Report to Panel Urges No Baseball Immunity
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UPI)The staff of a Congressional committee recommended today that Congress end the 54yearold immunity major league baseball has enjoyed from antitrust laws.

title: John Barriger 3d, Was Key Executive Of Eight Railroads
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 10John W. Barriger 3d, former president of the Missouri, Kansas, Texas Railroad and once a top executive of seven other railroads, died here yesterday after surgery. He was 77 years old.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Dec. 10New Jersey has failed in its attempt to get $18 million in one lump sum from the Federal Government for the completion of Route 18,in Middlesex County and has decided.to try to obtain the money in stages.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: The inclusion of an aerosol can of Old Spice shave cream in a photograph published in The Times Nov. 20 illustrating an article on fluorocarbons may have created a mistaken impression.. While aerosol deodorants and hair sprays use fluorocarbons as propellants, shaving cream is propelled by hydros carbons.

title: ARMS CACHE IS FOUND IN CALIFORNIA DESERT
description: ONTARIO, Calif., Dec. 10 (AP)Hundreds of pounds of explosives, two machine guns, shotguns and pistols have been found hidden in the desert near here and the police said that a selfemployed 41yearold man was being questioned.

title: Harvester Is Studying Fees Paid by Foreign Unit
description: The International Harvester Company said yesterday that an investigation by The audit committee of its board had disclosed that one foreign subsidiary paid improper commissions amounting to $273,000 between 1972 and 1975 and that certain foreign units overcharged certain foreign customers by about $5 million over the last five years.

title: Quality Under Ground
description: Why does the New York subway have such a bad press? It is dirty, yes, but not nearly so dirty as the typital Manhattan residential street happily tenanted by New Yorkers complaining about dirt in the subway. The subway, in fact, is one of the few places in New York where dogs do not perform their necessities with insouciant abandon. This alone should qualify it as one of the more hygienic sanctuaries in town.

title: Langham and Winter's Tale': Identity
description: MINNEAPOLISMichael Langham talks about the plays he's doing at the Tyrone Guthrie Theater as if they were pieces of his autobiography. He has come to see himself in them.

title: Earthquake Hits Yellowstone
description: MAMMOTH SPRING JUNCTION, Wyo., Dec. 10 (UPI)Officials say the largest earthquake in a year and a half was recorded yesterday in a remote area of Yeellowstone National Park, but there was to damage. The National Earthquake Information Service at Golden, Colo., said the quake registered 5.0 on the Richter Scale.

title: Mahre First in World Cup Giant Slalom
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 10Phil Mahre, an exception, says skiing is not his whole life but just a sport that he's enjoying and that some day it will lead him somewhere. Today it brought him to glory.

title: Byrd's Rivals Discuss Joint Effort To Bar Him From Leadership Job
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 10Opponents of Senator Robert C. Byrd began discussions today of a possible joint effort to try to block the West Virginia Democrat from becoming Senate majority leader.

title: Around the Nation
description: Navy Skyhawk Is DownedBy Marine Jet's Missile

title: G.E., WESTINGHOUSE ACCEPT PRICE EDICT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UPI)The General Electric Company and the Westinghouse Electric Corporation have agreed to a court order requiring them to keep their prices for turbinegenerators more competitive, the Justice Department announced today.

title: Prices of Alloys Are Increased By Titanium Metals Division
description: The Timet division of the Titanium Metals Corporation of America announced yesterday an average 3 percent price increase, effective Dec. 29, for its alloy sheet and alloy plate.

title: Ponchos Recalled After Fire
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UPI)The Government announced today the recall of 16,000 cottonfringed acrylic ponchos after a girl was burned when she leaned over a gas stove and the fringe caught fire.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Abount 75 Columbia University students, many of them residents of dormitory where a fire a week ago forced the evacuation of nearly 1,000 students, demonstrated yesterday to dramatize demands for improved campus security and fire protection. Speakers charged that faulty fire alarms, inadequate fire exits and a lack of security guards had ;tampered the evacuation of Livingston Hall during a fire Dec. 4, which injured 15 students. Students at the rally further charged that university financial cutbacks had compromised the safety of students living in the dormitories.

title: ALL CHARGES WITHDRAWN IN QUEBEC ABORTION CASE
description: QUEBEC, Dec. 10 (UPI)Quebec's Justice Ministry today announced withdrawal of all charges against Dr. Henry Morgentaler, the crusading abortionist, and urged the national Government to change its abortion law because it cannot be enforced.

title: Congressional Study Sees Money Supply Explaining Course of the Economy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10A new Congressional staff study, the first of its kind, concluded today that variations in the growth of the nation's money supply explain most of what has happened in the economy over the last 30 years, particularly the varying rates of inflation.

title: Scott Toms Morgan Weds Miss Culman in Greenwich
description: Christine Montgomery Culman, daughter of Mrs. William Slater Barkentin cf Greenwich, Conn., and WilCulman cf Bridgeport, Conn., was married in Greenwich last night to Scott Toms Morgan, son of Mr. and Mrs. William It Morgan of Greenwich and St. Thomas, V.I.

title: Stars Tie Flames On Ericksson Goal
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 10 (AP)Roland Ericksson scored with 4 minutes 38 seconds to play, enabling the Minnesota North Stars to tie the Atlanta Flames. 33. tonight in a National Hockey League game.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Price Cuts, Rebates Lift Sales Of Small A.M.C. and G.M. Cars
description: DETROIT, Dec. 10Jay Perry is in the business of selling automobiles, the small cars made by the American Motors Corporation. But until recently, his business was so bad that talking about the weather was frequently the most important business of the day.

title: Railroad Gives a Strip to Enlarge Patriots Path Near Morristown
description: MORRISTOWN, Dec. 10A sevenmile strip of land along the edge of Morristown to East Hanover was donated today by the Morristown and Erie Railroad Company, and became part of a nature and recreation preserve known as Patriots Path.

title: West Point Cadets, by Close Vote, Bar Flexible HonorCode Penalty
description: WEST POINT, N.Y. Dec. 10The Corps of Cadets has voted to retain exptilsion as the single and automatic penalty for violation of the honor code of the United States Military Academy here.

title: Americans Who Swept 5 Nobels Get $160,000 Prizes
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 10 (AP)Seven Americans collected all five of this year's Nobel prizes from King Carl XVI Gustaf today.

title: Aide of Soviet Moldavia, Once Part of Rumania, Pays Visit to Bucharest
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania, Dec. 10 (AP)A Communist leader from neighboring Soviet Moldavia has paid a fiveday visit to Rumania less than three weeks after Leonid L Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist Party leader, was here for talks with Precident Nicolae Ceausescu.

title: Rear Adm. Harry Shoemaker, 93, Had Early Role in Navy Airships
description: Rear Adm. Harry E. Shoemaker, retired, who was closely associated with Navy airship operations in the late 1920's and early 1930's, died Thursday on the family farm in Bluffton, Ind. He was 93 years old.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Issue of New Car Policies Is Parred by Continental

title: Study Criticizes Hospital Agency And Asks Reform
description: A report drafted for the Mayor's Task Force on the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation is sharply critical of the corporation's leadership and the failings that have exacerbated the corporation's current fiscal crisis.

title: At Meadowlands...
description: Tarport Hap, the secondrichest active standardbred mare, has been switched to the Buddy Regan Stable by Alan Leavitt and William Rosenberg, owners of the Pacer. She will make her first start tonight for her new trainer in the $18,000 Meadow Skipper Open as the 52 morningline choice.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: 7 Busy Days in Jerusalem: 6 for Work, 3 for Weekend
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 10Chainsmoking rabbis are in a tizzy.

title: RETAIL SALES SPURT: NOVEMBER TOTAL UP 1.7% FROM OCTOBER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10Retail sales spurted in November and were stronger in October than earlier figures indicated. the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Burning Tree Golfers Win
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, Dec. 10A team from the Burning Tree Country Club of Greenwich, Conn., carded a finalround 10underpar 61 today to win the 24th annual Bermuda goodwill invitation golf tournament. Led by Rolland Nash, a professional, the Burning Tree foursome finished the fourday event with a 72hole total of 237, two strokes ahead of the Thomson Country Club of North Reading, Mass.

title: Official Tabulation Shows Carter Defeated Ford by 1,681,417 Votes
description: WASHTINGTON. Dcc. 10 (121,1)Iimmy Carter beat Gerald R. Ford by 1,681,417 votes with a record of more than 81 million ballots cast Nov. 2, official tabulation; showed today.

title: Cultural Center
description: There is good news for the little seraglio on Columbus Circle that started life as the abortive Gallery of Modern Art and has been empty and abandoned for over a year. Its nearneighbor, Gulf & Western Industries, is rescuing it from a fate worse than demolition by buying it for the city to use for the new Department of Cultural Affairs and an exhibition and tourist center.

title: Nino Martini Dead; Lyric Tenor at Met And in Movies, 72
description: Nino Martini, an opera, concert, radio and film tenor, died of a heart attack Thursday in his native Verona, Italy, where he was born. He was 72 years old.

title: Aide Says Carter Has Selected Team for Top Security Positions
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10Presidentelect Jimm Carter has selected the team of persons or the top national security positions in his Administration but is still sorting out which candidate will fill which job, a top aide said today.

title: 2 IN BRONFMAN TRIAL GUILTY OF EXTORTION BUT NOT KIDNAPPING
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 10Mel Patrick Lynch and Dominic P. Byrne were acquitted today of charges of kidnapping Samuel Bronfman 2d in August 1975. but were convicted of grand larceny for extorting a $2.3 million ransom from Mr. Bronfman's father, Edgar. who is chairman of the Seagram Company Ltd.

title: Spain Leads Over Three Golf Teams
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Dec. 10 (AP) Spain benefited from an overruled protest by the United States and swept into the team lead today and Kuo Chiehsuing of Taiwan took the lead in the individual competition after the second round of the World Cup international golf tournament.

title: About New York
description: Before there was Abraham Beanie and his daily phone calls in the life of Howard J. Rubenstein, there was Vito Battista and his rented elephant, rubber alligator and live monkeys on the steps of City Hall.

title: An Unusual Newsman
description: Peter Irvin Lisagor was described once by the senior official of the State Department as a strange phenomenon. That official continued: You write for a newspaper that virtually no one in Washington reads. Yet you are one of the most influential newsmen in the nation's capital. You never make heroes out of public officialsthat is perhaps an understatementyet they respect you, they seek your advice, and consider you their friend. You are the Renaissance man of the Washington pressequally adept at writing, reporting, television and commentary.

title: NEW BEIRUT CHIEF UNIFIES THE INFORMATION MEDIA
description: BEIRUT. Lebanon, Dec. 10The new Lebanese Cabinet, only a day old, went to work immediately today to deal with the country's mounting problems after more than a year and a half of civil war.

title: Holtz in Arkansas
description: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark., Dec. 10 (AP) Lou Holtz arrived today at the University of Arkansas to discuss becoming the next head football coach of the Razorbacks.

title: Cut in Prime Lifts Dow by 2.41; A.T.&T. Is at Best Level Since '65
description: A surprise cut. in the prime rate by a major New York bank helped the stock market extend its strong recovery yesterday, although the momentum was somewhat reduced. The Dow Jones industrial average, showing small changes throughbut the session, finished with a gain of 2.41 points at 973.15.

title: 17 Groups Seek a Labor Secretary Committed to Fight Discrimination
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10Seventeen organizations representing minorities and women joined today in urging Presidentelect Jimmy Carter to appoint as his Secretary of Labor someone with a proven and unshakable commitment to affirmative action programs that are aimed at overcoming the effects of discrimination.

title: 56,000Pupil School System Shut As Toledo Voters Bar Tax Rise
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Dec. 8Life had fled the place, but life's traces remained: n red sweater, left behind by it tiny owner. A sign imploring, Come out of your shell! Read! Untouched crayons and unopened pencil boxes. A lost cap and an unmatched glove tacked up on a bulletin board. Chairs built for small frames, empty now and piled on unused desks.

title: Inquiry by U.S. in Chicago Adding Monetary Market, Mercantile Exchange Unit
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 10 (AP)A Government investigation of possible fraudulent dealings at the nation's two largest futures markets has been expanded to include currency trading at the International Monetary Market, officials said today.

title: Remarks by Saul Bellow
description: There are not many things on which the world agrees, but everyone I think acknowledges the importanCe of a Nobel Prize. I myself take most seriously the Nobel Committee's recognition of the highest excellence in several fields. and I accept the honor of this award with profound gratitude.

title: Notes on People
description: Sir Douglas Nicholls yesterday became the first Australian aborigine to represent the British crown when he was sworn in as Governor of the state of South Australia. Sir Douglas, who is a clergyman, will serve as Governor of one of the six states in Australia that were original British colonies. Queen Elizabeth II is regarded as Queen of Australia and therefore constitutional head of state, and the British Government controls the machinery of nominating state governors.

title: Personal Investing
description: When they calculate this year's profit; and losses, some investors will have squeezed sizable capital gains out of two unlikely sourcesPenn Central and Boston & Maine railroad bonds.

title: Senior Leaders of Army in China Believed Gaining Decisive Power
description: HONG KONG. Dec, 10China's senior army commanders appear to be playing an increasingly important role in Peking and the country's provinces. analysts here believe, and may now form a key decisionmaking body inside the Chinese Communist Party.

title: Jack Bigel Holds Many Keys To City's Mansions
description: Jack Sigel. The name comes up with increasing frequency these days as he advises most of the municipal unions, speaks for them and shuttles back and forth as their representative, now trying to solve the $1 billion problem created by the court decision that the city's debt moratorium was illeaal.

title: Bullets 98, Pacers 88
description: LANDOVER, Md., Dec. 10 (AP)Wes Unseld returned to the game after spraining an ankle and scored 11 points in the fourth quarter to lead the Washington Bullets to a 988R victory over the Indiana Pacers tonight.

title: PROFIT TAKING HITS PRICES OF SOYBEANS
description: Profit taking in soybeans continued yesterday after a price rally earlier in the week that took the beans above $7 a bushel. The March delivery on the Chicago Board of Trade closed at about $7, down about 72 cents a bushel, after being as high as $7.09.

title: Head of Black Caucus Picked
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP)Representative Parren J, Mitchell, Democrat of Maryland, has been elected head of the 17member House Black Caucus for the new Congress, the caucus announced today. Mr. Mitchell suceeds Representative Yvonne B. Burke, Democrat of California. Representative Shirley Chisholm, Democrat of Brooklyn, was named vice chairman.

title: E.P.A. Faults 208,000 Cars
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10The Environmental Protection Agency ordered the Chrysler Corporation today to recall 208,000 of its 1975 model automobiles because of what the agency said were faulty design and maintenance problems producing excessive air pollution.

title: Outgoing Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY TransAtlantic

title: Gorman Beats Emerson
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 10 (AP)Tom Gormon of Seattle defeated Roy Emerson of Australia, 76, 62, in an overtime match to advance to the semifinals of the $20,000 Rainier Seattle Tennis Classic last night.

title: ExCompanion Is Silent on Source of Hughes's Drugs
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 10One of Howard R. Hughes's longtime aides and companions, John Holmes, invoked his right not to incriminate himself today when he was asked where the late recluse got drugs to treat a kidney ailment, according to sources present at the deposition in the Los Angeles County Courthouse.

title: Miss Fromholtz Wins
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 10 (AP) Topseeded Diane Fromholtz of Australia and. Sue Barker of England scored threeset victories today to move into the semifinals of an international women's tennis tournament.

title: With Nancy Walker Canceled, Norman Lear Is Still Pressing On
description: HOLLYWOODIt is 1:44 P.M. Wednesday, and The Nancy Walker Show has just been canceled by ABC. The corridors of television power have been awash in blood for the last two weeks, so if Norman Lear is not exactly happy, he is resigned. At least the telephone callsof which there have been 14 in the last hourare now over. And for the first time he has been told the bad news instead of reading it in the trade papers. Norman Lear has had a failure and read silverman, ABC's chief of programming, has already arranged for Nancy Walker to meet with the network's hottest producer, Gary Marshall ("Happy Days, Laverne and Shirley") to discuss a new showwithout Mr. Lear.

title: Jack Bigel Holds Many Keys To City's Mansions
description: Jack Bigel. The name comes up with increasing frequency these days as he advises most of the municipal unions, speaks for them and shuttles back and forth as their representative, now trying to solve the $1 billion problem created by the court decision that the city's debt moratorium was illegal.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Monroe Auto Equipment Holding Talks With Walker Manufacturing
description: The Monroe Auto Equipment Company of Monroe, Mich., said yesterday that it was in preliminary discussions with the walker Manufacturing Company of Racine, Wis., for the possible combination of Monroe and Walker through the exchange of stock valued at $165 million. Monroe is a manufacturer of automotive shock absorbers and Walker, a division of Tenneco, Inc., makes automotive exhaust systems.

title: Article 2 No Title
Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Knicks Tickets Hotter With McAdoo in City
description: Eddie Donovan paced nervously at La Guardia Airport yesterday morning awaiting the arrival of Bob McAdoo and Tom McMillen on the 9:30 flight from Buffalo. Meanwhile, the effect of the trade that brought the pair from the Braves to the Knicks was being felt at Madison Square Garden.

title: At Monticello . . .
description: Top drivers from eight northeastern harnessracing tracks will compete in five of the races at the Sullivan County track tomorrow. The reinsmen, all leaders at their respective meetings, are: John Chapman (Roosevelt), Nerve Filion (Freehold), Bud Gilmour (Meadowlands), Merrit Dokey (Yonkers), J.P. Morel (Saratoga), Ross Hayter (Brandywine), Eddie Davis (Liberty Bell) and Marvin Maker (Monticello).

title: Small Oil Refiners Wary of Port Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 10A Justice Department report made public today finds that small oil refiners have shied away from participation in two proposed Gulf of Mexico offshore oil ports because of financing arrangements devised by the big oil companies that control the ventures.

title: New Precinct Commander
description: When Capt. John Waters took over command of the 13th Precinct in Manhattan a few years ago, he was faced with an immediate discipline problem. Two officers had just committed minor infractions, and he had to decide how they should be punished. The officers came to see him on his first day at the precinct. They suggested he consult the precinct's executive officer.

title: Thousands Flee Gas in Louisiana
description: BATON ROUGE, Dec. 10 (UPI)A cloud of poisonous chlorine gas, leaking from an Allied Chemical Corporation plant, drifted westward across the Mississippi River today. Government officials ordered about 10.000 people to flee the area and called out the National Guard.

title: Dr. Paul G. Pearson Gets Rutgers Position
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Dec. 10 (UPI)Dr. Paul G. Pearson, an associate provost at Rutgers, has been named executive vice president of the university, officials announced today.

title: Talking Freely About a New Freedom: Women of Six Lands Compare Views
description: ANGERS, France Young women from six countries talked freely recently about some things their mothers would have only whispered about.

title: A Spanish Red Meets Press Secretly
description: MADRID, Dec.10 (AP)Santiago Carrillo, the head of Spain's stillillegal Communist Party, appeared at a clandestine news conference today to announce that the Communists would test the postFranco Government by running in elections next year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 2 DEFENSE WITNESSES TO BE INTERROGATED
description: PATERSON, N.J., Dec. 10The judge in the retrial of Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis on triplemurder charges ruled today that two witnesses for the defense would have to submit to questioning by the prosecution before they would be allowed to testify.

title: PRIME RATE IS CUT TO 6% BY MORGAN, AGAIN TAKING LEAD
description: The Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, the nation's fifth largest bank, upstaged the rest of the banking industry again yesterday by cutting its prime rate from 64 percent to 6 percent.

title: Voting Fraud Held Too Small to Alter Race for President
description: A Federal judge in Brooklyn ruled yesterday that there had been some fraudulent voting in the Nov. 2 election for President in New York State, but that it had not been pervasive esough to warrant nullifying the election and scheduling a new one.

title: State Must Act on Return Of Gay Head Indian Land
description: GAY HEA D, Mass., Dec. 10Voters in his Martha's Vineyard community have noved to give hack the picturesque Gay dead cliffs and other town lands to the Varnpanoag Indians. But the Massachuetts, legislature must act to make the testure final.

title: Yale 102, Clark 59
description: NEW HAVEN, Conn., Dec. 10Tim Jbnes, Yale captain, scored a careerhigh 30 points tonight as the Elis routed Clark, 10259. Jones scored 16 in the first half as Yale raced to a 4820 lead. The victory was Yale's second in six games. Clark is 13.

title: Survey Backs the Latest Oil Recovery Methods
description: Advanced methods of increasing recovery from United States oilfields, such as injecting steam or chemicals into oil formations, could add millions of barrels of oil to daily output after 1985, according to a petroleum industry study submitted to the Secretary of the Interior.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SILENT SOUVENIRS Last call, through tomorrow, to see the original manuscript of Silent Night and the instrument on which it was first performed at midnight mass on Christmas Eve, 1818, in the village church at Oberndorf in the Austrian Tyrol. The music sheet and a simple, oldfashioned guitar are on display in a lucite case near the French Painting Galleries on the second floor of the Metropolitan Museum.

title: Burch Leaves Rokeby After 15 Years in Post
description: J. Elliott Burch, trainer of Paul Mellon's Rokeby Stable, citing health reasons, announced yesterday he had terminated his working arrangement with the stable. Burch had been Rokeby's conditioner for 15 years. The 52yearold trainer, whose family's interest in horse racing can be traced back to the Civil War era, said he had been in a hospital from exhaustion for a month. I find myself still somewhat weak when I'm home, he told an official at Aqueduct. At this time have no idea when I'll return to training. I believe a month or so of rest will provide the foundation for my getting back to the races.

title: News Summary
description: International
