title: Florida: Escape To the Backbone
description: When our winter guestsa species of tourist known in Florida as snowbirds"tire ot sand and surf, turf and track and all the gloss and glitter of Gold Coast night life, we urge them to flee the concrete canyons and the crowds and head for the interior to Florida's green ridge country, out to the backbone of the peninsula. Out where rolling hills replace pool table flatlands, where row after row of trim, orderly clumps of green march up and down the slopes, refreshed by lakes and ponds. Where sleepy little towns and settlements dot the landscape. Lake Wales, for example, a town created 65 years ago out of a timber and turpentine camp.

title: William C. Decker Is Dead at 75, Retired Corning Glass Chairman
description: Will:am C. Decker, retired board chairman and chief execuLive officer of the Corning Glass Works, Corning, N. Y.. died Thursday. apparently of a heart attack, while visiting an eye doctor's office in New York City. He lived in Corning and was 75 years old.

title: Long Beach: Las VegasontheSea?
description: LONG BEACH is today at the crossroads of its future. As City Manager, I perceive that Long Beach can go in one of two directions: either continue its current existence as a bedroom community, or seek to reachieve its former status as one of the foremost resort areas on the Northeast Coast.

title: Smooth Skating for Russians
description: BERLIN, Dec. 11 (UPI) Vera Krasnova of the Soviet Union today won the womens 500meter race at an invitation sprint skating meet in West Berlin, The Russian was clocked in 42.88 seconds to the 44.19, Haitske PO!man cf the Netherlands was second at 44:10. Yevgenilikav of the Soviet Union, a MB gold medalist in the mens Son meters, tool: first place with a time of 34,04 seconds.

title: Dr. Herbert Kleinfield, 55, Is Dead; Taught American Studies at Post
description: Dr. Herbert L. KleinfieId, professor of American studies at C. W. Post College for the last 15 years and general editor of The Collective Works of Washington Irving, died Friday at Meadowbrook Hospital, East Meadow, L. I., after a long illness. He was 55 years old and lived at 90A Dosoris Lane: Glen Cove, L. I.

title: The Steinway Quintet
description: If writers got gold stars for the risks they took, Leslie Epstein would get a handful for the title story of this collection of short fiction. The Steinway Quintet belongs to that rare and difficult genre, the story that is in some sense about large intellectual and philosophical problems. Two gunway

title: INDIANS RUSH TO JOIN LEGAL FIGHT FOR LAND
description: OLD TOWN, Maine, Dec. 11 (AP)  Thousands of Indians across the nation are clamoring to join New England tribes who have begun separate legal fights to reeain lost tribal land.

title: Article 3  No Title
Knicks Win As McMillen, Bradley Star
Valerie A. Maloof Fiancee Of Richard Thomas Watson
description: Mr. and Mrs. Theodore S. Maloof of Tenafly, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Valerie Ann Maloof, to Richard Thomas Watson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Clarence Watson of Westfield, Mass. The couple plan to be married in the spring.

title: The case for Africa's white tribe
description: CAPE TOWN. It may be that, politically speaking, they are the loneliest people in the world todayAfrica's unique white tribe of Afrikaners, numbering only about two and a half million and currently at the center of an inordinate amount of international politics. Were they born to this fate, did they bring it down on their own heads, or was it thrust upon them?

title: Navajo Language Radio Station Begins Broadcasting Tomorrow
description: WINDOW ROCK, Ariz., Dec. 11 A Navajo radio network is to begin broadcasting daily news and information pro,grams in the Navajo language Monday to the tribe's 150,000 members on the 25,000 square mile reservation in Arizona, New Mexico and Utah.

title: Mexican Seizure of Land Annulled
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 11 (UPI)  A federal judge has overturned former President Luis Echeverria Alvarez's expropriation of 250,000 acres of farmlands for peasants in the state of Sonora and has ordered the land returned to its former owners, it was announced today.

title: The Worse Old Days
description: As New York and other major cities continue plunge toward what could become an acute national urban crisis, it is useful to be reminded once more that many of the problems that afflict cities today  crime. riots, lack of planning, pollution and traffic congestion  are not new: that urban conditions in the good old days of the last century were in many respects even worse than those confronting city dwellers today.

title: Opera or Sacred Action?
description: When the Metropolitan Opera soprano Renata Scotto was just launching her career 20 years ago she happened to meet and befriend the aging priestcomposer Licinio Refice, and that circumstance is leading at last to the American premiere of Refice's Cecilia tomorrow, Dec. 13, by the Sacred Music Society at Fisher Hall. Miss Scotto will sing the title role.

title: Redskins Have an Extra Incentive Against Cowboys
description: Although they generally despise one another, with the conservative and conventional Cowboy organization having special contempt for George Allen. the Redskin coach, the Dallas and Washington squads were virtually mute

title: If Talking Fails, the Potential For Violence Is Large and Growing
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Behind the confidence of the Rhodesian military spokesman there was a small but evident streak of doubt. Yes, he said at a military briefing in Salisbury, the Rhodesian forces were getting all the supplies they needed. They were intercepting infiltrating nationalist guerrillas almost as fast as the bands el young men crossed the border from assembly and training camps in Mozambique. The kill rate was highly in favor of the Rhodesians. At the present level of warfare, he said, the Rhodesians could hold their own. But then there was the flicker of doubt. Things, he said, could change drastically if there was to foreign intervention.

title: Lessons in Winging it: A Reporter's Journal Of a European Flight
description: Last August I paid a.visit to AM Travel Servicealso known as Amicusat 50 East 42d Street. I told a woman in the cramped office suite that I warned to leave for Europe on Sept. 5 and return about a month later. She said there was a flight to Brussels and back for $319$306 plus $3 airport tax plus $10 membership and administrative fee (I never did find out what that meant.)

title: Marijuana Laws Protested
description: SOUTH KINGSTOWN. R.L. Dec. II (AP)  About 100 persons smoked marijuana cigarettes on the University of Rhode Island campus yesterday in another protest against marijuana laws. The members of the High Noon Club also smoked the marijuana in celebration of the end of classes for the fall semester and in protest of the arrests of six club members last month. The police did not intervene.

title: Lovingly Cooked Food
description: NTONINO ZANGHI first set foot in a professional kitchen when he was 14 years old. At 68, with his children following in his footsteps, he shows no sign of slowing down. There is no generation gap in this family. The Zanghis are tied to one another's apron strings, running Restaurant Zanghi under Mr. Zanghi's direction in Glen Cove, and is one of the most esteemed on the Island.

title: ART
description: New Brunuswick

title: New York Has Collected No Rent On the Bronx Market Since June
description: The Arol Development Corporation has not paid its rent of nearly $25.000 month on the cityowned Bronx Terminal Market since last June and city officials acknowledge that they are making little headway in efforts to collect arrearages that they assert now total more than $450.000.

title: Two ExSoldiers Sentenced to Die For Murder of Texas Patrolman
description: ODESSA, Tex., Dec. 11 (UPI)  Two former Fort Sill, Okla. soldiers were sentenced yesterday to death in the electric chair for the murder of a Texas highway patrolman.

title: A Correction
description: In last Sunday's edition, the headquarters of the Adelphi Chamber Orchestra was listed incorrectly. The orchestra is based in New Milford, not West Milford.

title: Maybe Old Fibber Isn't Over the Hill After All
description: Los ANGELES

title: U.S. Seaman Wounded as Gunmen Attack Bus in the Philippines
description: MANILA, Dec. 11 (AP)  Unidentified gunmen opened fire on a bus taking three United States servicemen to work 60 miles north of Manila, wounding a seaman, authorities said today.

title: Mark Rascovich, Writer, Is Dead; Author of The Bedford Incident
description: Mark Rascovich, author of The Bedford Incident, a novel about an American destroyer's tense encounters with Soviet submarine near Greenland, died Friday of a heart attack at the Good Samaritan Hospital in West Palm Beach, Fla. He was 5S years old and lived in Palm Beach.

title: Members of Congress From New York City Got Favors From Koreans
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11  At least six of the 18 members cf the New York City Congressional delegation and several representatives of nearby districts have accepted the blandishments of the Korean lobby, whose alleged efforts to influence United States Congressmen are the subject of multiple investigations here.

title: Bomb in Irish Hotel Wounds 47 AL Reception in Portadown
description: BELFAST, Dec. 11 (AP)  bomb exploded today in the attic of a hotel in Portadown during a wedding reception, wounding at least 47 persons, one of them critically.

title: The OfficeHolders Find Flexibility Necessary
description: GENEVA  The Socialist International, descended directly from Karl Marx's first organization, heard from a number of prime ministers and presidents at its congress here last month. A gathering of Socialists is no longer a steamy session of ardent idealists and dreamers; it is also an occasion at which men who wield government power meet and talk about their problems, and not necessarily in Marxist terms.

title: Gilbert String To Reach 1,000 Tonight at Home
description: Rod Gilbert, who is as much a part of New York as Broadway, will be playing his 1,000th game as a New York Ranger tonight when the team meets the Montreal Canadiens at Madison Square Garden. No special observance is planned tonight, but the Rangers plan a Rod Gilbert Night on Wednesday, March 9, when they play the Minnesota North Stars.

title: Delay in College Grants Criticized
description: Administrators of colleges around the state appeared at a state legislative hearing and charged that both studenis and colleges have suffered because of delays in receiving grants under the state's Tuition Assistance Program.

title: Cigarette Study Finds Big Range in Nicotine
Michael Lydon is the author of two books on contemporary music, Rock Folk and Boogie Lightning.
description: These five books, from and about the world of rock n roll music are big, not too expensive, and loaded with photographsfine gifts if given to the right person. Aunt Ethel might not know what to make of Roy Carr's minutely detailed The Rolling Stones or John Lennon by Anthony Fawcett,

title: PAPERS OF OFFICIALS: QUESTION OF PRIVACY
description: You as a taxpayer write to your Congressman. You give him hell. Do you expect that to be public? Or is that private communication? What is a private letter of a President? That can be the most revealing part of a Presidency. Who is the God who is going to make these decisions?

title: ALL THAT CREATES A CELLBLOCK GUARD
description: VALHALLA. N.Y.  On the movie screen, a raving man in pajamas flailed an ax at a policeman, who shot him dead.

title: Dance: Ashley
description: Among the lushest of the variations in Act H of The Nutcracker is that of Dew Drop, who leads her squadron of flowers in a furious but liltingly paced waltz. Merrill Ashley's swiftness and warmth merged in the role to give it a gorgeously light caressing look Friday evening at the New York State Theater.

title: World . News Briefs
description: HANOI, Vietnam, Dec. 11 (Agence FrancePresse) more than 1,000 delegates from every province of Vietnam have gathered here for the fourth congress of the Vietnam Workers Party, which begins on Tuesday.

title: HARLEM VOTERS TURN AWAY FROM PARTIES
description: A sharp increase in the number of newly registered voters in Central Harlem failing to indicate a party preference could spell potential trouble for Democratic candidates relying heavily on black support in citywide elections, according to a new blackvoter registration study.

title: A Push for a Residential Midtown
description: Historically, the northward thrust of commercial and industrial expansion in Manhattan has swept aside many of the residential areas in the valley that now lies between the skyscrapers of the downtown and midtown business districts.

title: New and Noteworthy
description: FANTASY: The Golden Age of Fantastic Illustration,  by Brigid Peppin. (New American Library. 36.95.) More than 200 examples in color and black and white of the work of the artists who embellished British bookmaking 18601920.

title: Toward Curing the Epistemological Blahs
description: It was one of those weeks during which reality seems attenuated. The oxygen had thinned out of the reality, and it was a hard week to breathe in. The naked apes at my house sat around gasping for air, According to the doctor, we would pull through all right: the epistemological blahs aren't serious. But I wonder. What didn't we know and when didn't we know it? You have to wonder about a week during which Robert Craft in the New York Review of Books writes at length on Mary Hartman, Mary Hartman, a week during which Michael J. Arlen in The New Yorker writes at length on televisionwatching as a form of masturbation. Are they lowering their brows to raise our consciousness? My consciousness is raised, but I can't breathe.

title: What They Are Saying
description: Ted Turner, owner of the Atlanta Braves, who wants to get rid of Bowie Kuhn as commissioner: I want to make Stan Musial commissioner. He's qualified and he says he will take the job. Kuhn  to heck with Kuhn  he never smiles.

title: MAILBAG
description: To the Editor:

title: Etruscan Tombs: A Sense Of Joy
description: From Pisa I went south to Tarquinia to see the painted tombs of the Etruscans, a trip of three hours down the west coast of Italy alongside the Tyrrhenian Sea. It was a Sunday train, lazy and half empty, stopping often as we went deeper and deeper into the Tuscan sun. Sunflowers stood high in the fields. Tawny houses flashed by the window, houses made of golden bales of summer hay.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Slaying Suspect Held

title: The Region
description: By indirection, Governor Carey last week raised the possibility that when the New York State Legislatura convenes next month, one of its main topics of discussion will be whether, and by how much, to reduce spending for several important social programs.

title: Elizabeth Vincent Myers Is Bride of Derek Brown
description: Elizabeth Vincent Myers, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Theophilo Vincent of Greenlawn, L.I., was married yesterday to Derek B. Brown, vice president and general manager of Dartmouth Woolen Mills in Claremont, N.H. Associate Justice Richard J. Talbot of the Keene (N.H.) District Court performed the ceremony in the bridegroom's home in Stoddard. N.H.

title: Kinsella Is Honored By Swimming Group
description: John Kinsella, a silver medalist in the 1968 Olympics and a gold medal victor in 1972, has been named the top professional marathon swimmer for 1976 by the World Professional Marathon Swimming Federation.

title: Future Events
description: Tickets to the following events may he obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Home Clinic
description: In an effort to catch up on the backlog of unanswered questions, most of the Home Improvement column this week is again being devoted to Questions and Answers. Many of the letters published here pose questions similar to those asked by other readers whose actual letters may not appear here, but who will, nevertheless, find their answers printed below. Readers sending in questions about home repair problems should address them to: Home Improvement Department. The New York Times, Times Square, New York, N.Y. 10036. Only those questions of general interest will be answered here.

title: Now Is the Ideal Time for Theater
description: Arthur Penn, director of Bonnie and Clyde, that bloody film landmark of the 1960's, sat sipping a scotch and water on a New York  bound Metroliner, talking about why he was returning to Broadway after ten years away.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
A Tax on Big Families?
description: Considering that certain school districts have limited resources as compared to more prosperous districts, one gets the impression that an equitable alternative to the property tax must be devised to provide an equal opportunity for all our children to learn, regardless of economic background.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: It is recommended that the impending award of casino gambling licenses be granted exclusively to qualified institutions through competitive sealed bids. The State Attorney General should be charged with the responsibility for the qualification and approval of all bidders.

title: Taking Account of Henry Crown
description: CHICAGO.  At 7:30 A.M., on most weekdays, a slight, short, grayhaired man with a gray moustache steps out of his chauffeured Cadillac limousine on South Michigan Avenue and walks into the barber shop of the Conrad Hilton Hotel.

title: AUTHOR SEES SOVIET LASTING BEYOND 84
description: Andrei A. Amalrik, a dissident Soviet \vriter who caused a stir in the West in 1970 with a volume under the title Will the Soviet Union Survive Until 1984?, has reluctantly reached the conclusion that the answer is yes.

title: 4 Blacks Killed in South Africa Mine
description: JOHANNESBURG, Dec. 11 (Reuters)  Tour black miners were killed and 36 injured yesterday after a rock fall at the Buffelsfontein gold mine in Stilfontein, 100 miles from Welkom. The tremor was felt at nearby Klerksdorp.

title: POLITICS
description: WHILE attention has been focused on the impending struggle in Nassau Republican ranks over the County Executive nomination next year, Nassau Democrats have started their own squabbling.

title: ART VIEW
description: At a moment in our cultural life when the imperatives of formalism seem to be on the wane the discussion, if not in the actual practice, painting and sculpture, a vigorous restatement of the formalist position has come from a surprising quarter  from the world of photography. This is a development not only rich in irony  for the concept of the photographic has long been held to constitute the very antithesis of the formalist esthetic  but one that is certain to be a source of consternation and dismay for the many people who have lately turned to photography in the hope of more easily gratifying an appetite for more direct human expression in art.

title: Austria's Mint Caught in Scandal Over Coins Said to Be Made of Illegally Imported Gold
description: VIENNA, Dec. 11  When Austria issued Its first gold coins in 40 years a few weeks ago, people lined up outside banks to pick up at least one of the new 1,000schilling pieces, worth about $58.

title: 13 Die as Train Hits Truck
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 11 (Reuters)Thirteen persons were killed today when a train slammed Into the rear of a truck at a crossing near here. The police said that all the victims were aboard the truck, which was bringing back guests from wedding party. Apparently the truck slipped around the barrier in an attempt to beat the train through the crossing.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: THIS is the time of year when all that you've read and heard about concerning the family and how it has changed all seems to come true. The holiday season. The kids, those who are away in college, are coming home and the tempo in the house has speeded up.

title: Bettina Bryan, Michael Snyder Married on L.I.
description: St. John's of Lattingtown Episcopal Church in Locust Valley, L.I., was the setting yesterday for the marriage of ncttina Clara Bryan, who graduated iti January from Marymount Manhatte; College, to Michael Sheldon Snyder, a secondyear student at the Cornell Medical College. The Rev. James G. Munroe performed the ceremony, which was followed by a reception at the Piping Rock Club.

title: POINTS OF VIEW
description: Funds under management by the 50 largest bank trust departments amount to well over $200 billion. There are nearly 4,000 of these trust departments in the United States, and 10 New York banks currently direct the investment of more than $100 billion. The power of these institutions to invest funds of such magnitude carries with it social and economic consequences. Their power has an effect on the lives of beneficiaries as well as on the companies in which they make investments and on those that they reject or decline to consider.

title: DINING OUT
description: MENU without prices reveals more than omits. The custom of not bothering anyone in the party except the host with pecuniary concerns is European, practiced only in certain luxury restaurants. There, it is a gracious touch. **Boccaccio, 129 North Broadway, Hicksville. 1330516.

title: Walter Benedick, Mutuals Expert
MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: Stock prices raced higher last week as Wall Street's sentiment was buoyed by both tangible and intangible factors.

title: Property Owners on Coast Block Measure on Safety in Earthquakes
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 11  Property owners are winning a battle here against government efforts to make them reinforce more than 14,000 buildings, including many apartment buildings and about 300 theaters and churches, that experts say would collapse in a major earthauake.

title: Melissa Lamberton Bride of Thomas L. Carter
description: Melissa M. Lamberton and Thomas L. Carter were married yesterday afternoon in Christ Church and Holy Family (Episcopal) in Brooklyn by the Rev. Luis A. Quroga. The parents of the couple are Mr. and Mrs. James W. Lamberton of Brooklyn and Mr. and Mrs. Lee Carter of Kirlmaod. Mo.

title: 19 Years Later, Effort to Integrate Little Rock School Is Recalled
description: Nineteen years ago in Little Rock, Ark., Ernest G. Green walked with eight other black highschool students graduated by Federal troop,,.trough a mob of angry whites who wanted to keep the school system segregated

title: Birth of a Booksellers Row
description: To find the hottest bestseller from Peking, Jaws in Spanish, a book on learning Ukrainian or classic literature in just about any language, the place to go is lower Fifth Avenue. Long known for its discount men's clothing stores, the area between 14th and 23d Streetswith a oneblock detour to Union Squareis emerging as something of a booksellers row as well, especially for foreignlanguage and specialized titles.

title: Harvey Heinowitz, a Teacher, Weds Susan Tesher of Adelphi
description: Susan Irene Tesher, a member of the University College public relations staff at Ade1phi University, was anrried last evening to Harvey Jay Heinowitz, an instructor at Adelphi's School of Business. Rabbi Charles Agin performed the ceremony at the Roslyn (L.I.) Country Club.

title: Talking Turkey At Country Shoots
description: ANYONE of an age to bring to mind, without too much prompting of the memory, the squeak of corduroy knickers can doubtlessly also recall easily how Gary Cooper, playing a Tennessee backwoodsman in a classic film of the 30's, sharpened his shooting skill by practicing on turkeys.

title: DANCE VIEW
description: In dance, we do not have stars  officially. Look at the programs. So far as I can recall, there not a single dance company in the Western world that fails to identify its members alphabetical order. It is a fact of life. Admittedly, most companies make concessions. For example, New York City Ballet religiously lists its entire company in alphabetical order, and then offers a picture supplement of its principal dancers in its program book.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  The hardest part. of course, was losing the election. But the secondhardest thing for the lameduck Ford Administration is giving up the grand plans and pet projects with which it intended to save the Republic over the next four years.

title: Though Birds May Not Have Gourmet Tastes, They Certainly Do Like to Eat
description: At a time of Holiday planning and feasting, the birds appropriately should be included. Many homeowners are already engaged in this pastime one way or another. Those who are not contributing some sustenance to the winter bird population are in the minority approaching onethird of the households in this country.

title: INTELLECTUALS FRET OVER THEIR NEW YORK
description: A slice of cerebral New York got together this weekend to take a good look at itself and the city in which it lv. grown up.

title: For young readers
description: Imagine a Macy's Thanksgiving parade, an old world mummers pageant and an animals costume party staged as a threering circus  and you have an idea of Twentytwo, Twentythree, Ellen Raskin's new picture hook. It says Happy Christmas and Merry New Year on pages 22 and 23, which is the game of the title, and when you've unscrambled what's going on in the hellzapoppin picture spread across pages 2223, you find 33 properly dressed animals in 29 different costumes.

title: Israeli Police Use Clubs, Tear Gas To Quell West Bank Arab Protest
description: TEL AVIV. Dec. 10 (AP)  Policemen used clubs and tear gas today to disperse Arab youths demonstrating in the occupied West Bank town of Nablus against a new Israeli tax similar to a sales tax.

title: No Pardon for Draft Evaders
description: CHARLESTON, S. C.  If Presidentelect Carter is preparing to make good on an illconsidered campaign promise to pardon all who evaded the Vietnamera draft, he should pause and reflect soberly. Such an act would be without precedent in our history and a degradation of our national moral fiber and military posture.

title: Some Special Seasonal Cheer
description: A CERTAIN delight in discovering something new and different begins at the show window of The Party Roost, an unusual card shop at 337 Jackson Avenue in Syosset, where the visitor sees, among other things, wrapping paper framed and hung like masterpiece paintings. Now is the time to pick out a card For all those you feel kindly toward. Time to scour the greetingcard racks For friends afar or across the tracks. It can sometimes be a tiresome bore That makes feet ache and eyeballs

title: Yonkers Offers The $2 Bettor Clubhouse Seat
description: Yonker: Prcewsy will make its allwenther club house ovoilable 10 grandstand ticket holders when it nnens its 31night meeting tomorrow night. The clubhouse ticket price, normally a dollar, will he discontinued for the winter meeting

title: The Kong and I
description: Though a bunch of wise guys chanted, Biff, Boom, Bam/He dies for our sins in Vietnam, though one kook sought to tear a strip of Styrofoam skin from the great dead gorilla crumpled under the World Trade Center, those 5,000odd people who showed up in New York City last June for work as unpaid extras in Dino De Laurentiis's remake of King Kong impressed me with their essential solemnity and sweettempered patiencePunished by the dank heat, the ferocious smoky arc lights, they nevertheless endured a good two hours of running up and down, back and forth between chalk lines while roaring a concerted acclaim for imaginary helicopters come to blast Kong off the North Tower. And even at midnight, after the last tedious take of the shot which closes the movie ("Camera pulls away and up from the bleeding Kong, the weeping sequined girl"), hundreds lingered, congregating by the 40foot corpse to swap rumors.

title: Brooklyn Violent Crimes Bureau Registers 98 Percent Convictions
description: A specialized Violent Crimes Bureau, set up last April to deal with street at. tacks in Brooklyn, convicted 98 percent of the defendants it prosecuted in its first five months.

title: Toledo Women's Team Wins Pro Football Title
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Dec. 11 (AP)  Linda Jefferson scored all Toledo's points, leading the Troopers to a 1312 victory over the Oklahoma City Dolls for the championship of the National Women's Professional Football League.

title: Reasons Holtz Resigned Say Something About Jets
description: One of the Jets assistant coaches was trying to discern the other clay the real reason. why Lou Holtz suddenly quit his SWUMayear job as coach of the onceglamorous New Yorkers. What do you think it was? he asked.

title: KISSINGER AND BRITON SEEK A PLAN TO END RHODESIA DEADLOCK
Moderation: Increasingly, a NoWin View In South Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG The moderates. black and white, who are trying to dismantle South Africa's system of racial separation through peaceful means arc losing ground to extremists on both sides. Last week, a bomb exploded in popular restaurant in this city's whiteonly center. Whether the bomber, who was black, was expressing private or political grievance is not known. But if black militant;,, whose protests have been largely confined to the ghettos surrounding this country's major cities, bring their campaign for rights to white doorsteps, many moderates believe tf.e. white Government and supporters of its apartheid policies will become even more intransigent opponents racial reform.

title: Sports Today
description: City College at Brooklyn College, 5 P.M. (RadioWNYCAM, 5 P.M.)

title: Just Who Is Running Utica? Mayor and Police Slug It Out
description: UTICA, Dec. 12 When the Chief of Police had the Mayor of Utica arrested last week, the Mayor suspended the Chief, threatened to shut the Police Department entirely and call in the National Guard. All of which led The Utica ObserverDispatch to print a mortified frontpage erlitoria! this morning saying, in effect, Oh good grief, everybody's laughing at us again.

title: Businessman Guilty in 4 Deaths
description: GRAND JUNCTION, Colo., Dec. 12 (AP)  Kenneth Botham Jr., a 28yearold former electronics executive, was convicted of murder today in the deaths last year of his wife, a neighbor woman and her two small children. A Mesa County District Court jury found him guilty of firstdegree murder in his wife's death and of seconddegree murder hi the slayings of the three other victims.

title: Monument Dedicated To 3 Rights Workers
description: PHILADELPHIA, Miss., Dec. 12 (AP)  About 100 people stood through light rain today to dedicate a monument to three civil rights workers who were killed in June 1964.

title: The Labor Scene
description: Now that Presidentelect Jimmy Carter has eased union fears of wage ceilings by disavowing any form of mandatory antiinflation controls, his most ticklish problems with organized labor are likely to involve foreign trade and the development of Government policies affecting multinational corporations.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: RINGING IN Midtown office workers wanting a bit of live Christmas song and dance as a noontime lift can step into the lobby of the Grace Company building, 42d Street and Avenue of the Americas, today through Friday for hourlong entertainment by metropolitanarea high school groups. This season's series is again cosponsored by Town Hall.

title: Fresh Water Found Under Atlantic
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI) Scientists studying the Atlantic Ocean floor in preparation for oil drilling off the East Coast have discovered a zone of fresh water extending beneath the Continental Shelf much farther offshore than expected, the United States Geological Survey said recently.

title: Ties With Vietnam and Cambodia Are Supported by Senate Leader
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (Reuters) Senator Mike Mansfield, Democrat of Montana, said today the United States should establish diplomatic relations with the Communist Governments of Vietnam and Cambodia.

title: Carter's Aides Fear Tight Security May Cost Him Touch With Public
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 Direct personal contact with ordinary voters was a deliberate hallmark of Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's election campaign and even of his tenure as Governor of Georgia. But some of his own entourage fear that he is getting out of touch.

title: Melanie Beth Gordon Is Bride Of Michael Bennett Garfinkle
description: Melanie Beth Gordon, daughter of Mr, and Mrs. Gerald Gordon of Baldwin Harbor, L.I., was married at noon yesterday to Michael Bennett Garfinkle, son of Dr. and Mrs. Stuart Garfinkle of Rockville, Md. Rabbi A. David Arzt performed the ceremony at the Sands, Lido Beach, L. I.

title: AntiFascist Group in Spain Says It Seized Aide, Asks Release of 15
description: MADRID, Dec. 12 The identity of the kidnappers of the rightwing president of Spain's advisory Council of State, who was bundled out of his Madrid office by gunmen yesterday morning, remained in doubt today.

title: Perry Como a Soothing Respite From the Holiday Hubbub on TV
description: Trying to get beyond repeats of Rudolph, the Rednosed Reindeer or A Christmas Carol for the holiday season, the television schedule tends to become cluttered with assorted specialssome animated, some live productions, a few pleasant, most instantly forgettable. In the midst of this blur of squeaky voices and traditional songs, Perry Como annually emerges as a soothing tranquilizer. And that's meant as a compliment. The Como personality might be compared to a marvelous hot toddy on a cold and blustery evening. It doesn't impinge or disturb. It gently soothes. And the holiday season can demand an unusual amount of soothing.

title: RennertChagall Flute Back at Met
description: The first thing one must say about the Gnther RennertMarc Chagall production of Mozart's Die Zauberflte, which reentered the Metropolitan Opera repertory Saturday night after an absence of two seasons, is that it remains as charming and magical as ever.

title: Seejeh: New Game 2,350 Years Old
description: The newest game around is one of the oldest.

title: Coffee Concert: Strong Aplomb
description: Kazuko Hillyer's Coffee Concerts at Alice Tully Hall are supposed to be onehour affairs, but the installment late Saturday afternoon lasted closer to 90 minutes. In fact, had an intermission been inserted after the second of the three pieces, it would have been a program of customary duration.

title: The Cutting Edge
description: Under fire from students who charged that their education was irrelevant, many college faculties and administrations in the turbulent 1960's beat a hasty retreat and abandoned most course requirements. Viewed initially as a triumph of student freedom, the absence of a firm framework of study has begun to be recognized, even by many undergraduates, as an abdication of institutional responsibility and a detriment to effective education.

title: Simon Says Congress Calls Him Too Often
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI)Treasury Secretary William E. Simon says Congress demands too many timeconsuming appearances by Cabinet members, especially when they are coping with a crisis.

title: ForeignOwned Concerns Play a Minor Role in U.S.
description: In spite of widespread publicity about increased foreign investment in American industry in the last few years, foreignowned companies still play a relatively small role in the United States economy.

title: KENNETH R. SMITH, SERVED WITH NAVY IN TWO WARS
description: Kenneth R. Smith, a retired stockbroker who had been a naval aviator in both World Wars died yesterday in Community Hospital, Glen Cove, L.I. He was 82 years old and lived a 67 Wolver Hollow Road in Upper Brookville, L.I.

title: 2 DIE AS PLANE CRASHES AT CAPE MAY AIRPORT
description: MIDDLE TOWNSHIP, N. J., Monday, Dec. 13 (UPI)An Allegheny Airlines plane crashed and burned last night on the approaches to the Cape May County Airport, killing at least two of the 10 persons aboard, the police here reported today,

title: 423 Bengal Victory Darkens a Cloud Over Namath
description: With gloom as a backdrop, another Jet seasonand perhaps the Joe Namath eraended on a muddy Shea Stadium field yesterday.

title: The U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Joblessness Among Youths Is Raising Worry in Europe
description: PARIS, Dec. 12 The blight of jobless youth has fallen over Western Europe.

title: BROOKLYN MAN, 35, IS HELD IN DEATH OF HIS MOTHER, 72
description: A 35yearold Brooklyn man was being held by the police yesterday in the beating death of his elderly mother.

title: Bradley Hurt
description: Injuries continued to plague the Knicks and Bill Bradley in particular. Bradley, who had played only 44 minutes since Nov. 7 before scoring 20 points in Saturday night's 11296 Knick triumph over the Phoenix Suns, has been sidelined again. He came out of the Suns game with an injured muscle in his left hip and was expected to miss at least the next three games.

title: CUT BUSINESS TAXES, NEW YORK CITY URGED
description: Large cuts in city taxes on manufacturers to stop the economic erosion that has cost New York 500,000 factory jobs since 1950 were recommended yesterday by a commission appointed by Mayor Beame.

title: CrossCounty Road Being Rebuilt Slowly
description: On the CrossCounty Parkway construction job in Yonkers, it may be that drivers will be going bankers when they realize that it will take two more years to complete rebuilding of a 4,400foot stretch of this major artery.

title: Vessels Collide off San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 12 (AP)  A 660foot Swedish automobile carrier and a dredge of the United States Army Engineers collided in the San Francisco Bay in darkness early today, the Coast Guard said. No one was hurt, according to a spokesman, who said the bow of the 14.479ton Don Carlos had been damaged and the ship had been towed to Richmond for repairs.

title: 2 Held in Professor's Death
description: BOSTON, Dec. 12 (AP) Two young men from Boston's Roxbury section were arrested today on murder charges in the death of a Northeastern University professor, the police reported. They identified the two in custody as Anthony Blalock, 18 years old, and John Hammonds, 28. The professor, F. Andre Favat, was killed early yesterday in a sevenstory fall from an apartment building in Roxbury. His body was nude and bore several stab wounds.

title: Simenon Is Now Living His Own Life After Years of Identity With Maigret
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland When I turned 70 three years ago, I decided it was time to stop living in the skin of Inspector Maigret and my other characters. I said to myself, I have written 220 novels under my own name and 150 with pseudonyms. From now on, I am going to live only in my own skin.

title: 47 Men Ordained as Permanent Deacons
description: NEWARK, Dec. 12Fortyseven men, most of them married and some with grandchildren, were ordained as permanent deacons in the Roman Catholic Church this afternoon at Sacred Heart Cathedral here. More than 2,000 wives, relatives and friends jammed the church.

title: Today's Writers Failing Mankind, Bellow Contends
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 12Saul Bellow walked to a lectern at the Swedish Academy late this afternoon, smiling modestly at the wave of applause in the chandeliered chamber from Swedish officials, writers, diplomats, students and fellow Nobel Prize winners.

title: U.S. Intelligence Officials Apprehensive of New ShakeUps Under Carter
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 United States intelligence officials, who say they have largely recovered from the demoralizing shocks of Congressional investigation and disclosure of past misdeeds, are facing the accession of Presidentelect Jimmy Carter with apprehension about the possibility of new organizational shakeups.

title: Oil Consumers Await Price Rise As OPEC Nations Meet This Week
description: LONDON, Dec. 12 Three years ago, just before Christmas, six angry countries that surround the Persian Gulf net in Teheran and doubled the price of a barrel of light Arabian crude oil. On top of smaller Increases just a few months earlier,. that decision, in the view of many experts, probably changed the world as much as any event since World War II.

title: Labor's Protectionism
description: Jimmy Carter's main problems with organized labor now seem likely to involve its protectionist approach to foreign trade. Page 58.

title: 2dHalf Drive By Suns Beats Hawks, 10691
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 12 (AP)Paul Westphal and Ricky Sobers were standouts as the Phoenix Suns broke open a close game in the third quarter and scored a 10691 National Basketball Association victory over the Atlanta Hawks tonight.

title: Article 2  No Title
Article 1  No Title
Youth Held in Policeman's Death
description: MONTGOMERYVILLE, Pa., Dec. 12 (AP) A Philadelphia man is in jail without bond on charges of killing a Montgomery Township policeman. The police arrested Larry J. Phillips, 19 years old, at his North Philadelphia apartment yesterday in the murder of David Hancock, 41. The officer was killed early yesterday morning while investigating a silent burglar alarm at a new shopping mall.

title: Saturday's College Results
description: BASKETBALL

title: Was an Assistant U.S Attorney Told to Get Roy Cohn?
description: The meetinga footnote to historymay or may not have taken place 15 years ago.

title: Young Laotians Are Reeducated On Quiet Island
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 12 Two hours north of here by road, the Nam Ngtun River valley has been transformed into a vast lake studded with islands of submerged forest. The fishermen who work there sail between treetops stripped of leaves and branches jutting out a the blue water against a skyline of cloudcapped mountains.

title: Long Beach State Excels, As Does Other McMillian
description: While Jim McMillian sat on the Knick bench Saturday night, nursing a knee injury, his younger brother, Lloyd, was scoring 23 points and being named the most valuable player of the Trojan Classic in Los Angeles.

title: DONOR TO NEEDIEST CITES BROTHERHOOD
description: Man's obligation to other human beings was a theme touched upon by a donor yesterday to the 65th annual appeal of the New York Times Neediest Cases fund.

title: SovietLibyan Talks Hailed
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Dec. 12 (Reuters) Libya's Revolutionary Command Council today hailed the first visit of their leader, Col. Muammar elQaddafi, to Moscow last week as a significant event in the history of ArabSoviet relationships, the Libyan press agency reported.

title: Carter Said. to Pick Bendix Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP)Presidentelect Jimmy Carter plans to name W. Michael Blumenthal, chairman of the Bendix Corporation, to be Secretary of the Treasury, according to sources close to Mr. Carter.

title: Mexico Is Set to Enforce Ousting of 8,000 Peasants From Occupied Farmland
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 12 (UPI) Offidials concerned with agrarian reform said today that they were ready to enforce court ruling ordering 8,000 peasants off land that they had occupied in the state of Sonora.

title: PORTUGUESE VOTING FOR LOCAL OFFICIALS
description: LISBON, Dec. 12The Portuguese today selected local officials in an election that is generally being viewed as a referendum on the performance of the fourmonthold minority Socialist Government.

title: 6 Seized in Bookmaking Raids
description: BERLIN, Dec. 12 (UPI)  Six persons were arrested in southern New Jersey communities today on charges of illegal sports bookmaking, the state police announced. A spokesman said the arrests were made in coordinated raids conducted by the state police organized crime task force and members of the Camden County Proesecutor's Office.

title: Cards Triumph in Jersey, 1714, but Are Eliminated
Yonkers Racing
description: Horses listed In order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: Other Highway Projects in Metropolitan Area
description: Here are some of the other major highway projects underway, just completed, or about to start in the metropolitan area, according to the State Department of Transportation:

title: In Memoriam
description: CHARNEYGeorge. Radlant human being, cherished friend. We miss your wit, warmth and vlsdom.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Hemmi Takes Giant Slalom With Gros 2d and Mahre 3d
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 12Heini Hemmi, gold medal skier and a model for Swiss chocolate figures, continued to earn his living today and Phil Mahre, upstart, continued to earn his reputation.

title: Memorial Services
description: TROSTERNotice of Memorial service at 12:30 P.M. on Thursday, Dec. 16, 1976 at Federal Hall National Memorial Museum, 15 Pine St., entry to Great Rotunda, New York City. In memory and In honor of the late, Colonel Oliver J. Troster, Sydney Ray Meleen together with all those other fallen comrades of ours as veterans in the military service of our na. tion's wars. Wall Street Post ot the American Leglon.

title: Commodities
description: Starting this morning, commodity traders and speculators will be able to obtain domestic options to buy or sell silver bullion and copper bars through Federally licensed brokers and metals suppliers for the first time in more than 40 years.

title: Gilbert Leads the Philharmonic In Two Rarely Performed Pieces
description: David Gilbert, assistant conductor of the New York Philharmonic, led the orchestra in a subscription concert for the first time Saturday night. He did not make things easy for himself. The program he chose was Schumann's Second Symphony, which has builtin problems, and two rarely played pieces, Richard Strauss's Macbeth and Prokofiev's Scythian Suite. Macbeth had never been performed by the Philharmonic.

title: Jack Cassidy, Actor, Dies at 49 In Fire at Los Angeles Apartment
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 12 Jack Cassidy, whose career took him from Broadway musicals to film and television roles, died today in a fire that swept through his penthouse apartment.

title: Foghat, Rock Quartet, Appears at Palladium
description: Foghat, a threequarter English rock quartet (one is an American) that appeared at the Palladium on Saturday, is living proof that persistence pays off. The band's recent burst of popularitytop billing in stadium concerts, gold albumsis the result of almost five years of incessant touring. Foghat has yet to become a New York favorite, but in the heartland the group's following is enormous.

title: Warbeck, a Promising Drama
description: Historical drama is notoriously difficult to write, even though Shakespeare had his successes, as did Schiller. It is also difficult to stage, requiring the luxury of large casts and a director able to make apparent the complexities of histories long gone the way of schoolday memories. It was therefore particularly brave of the Colonnades Theater Lab, on Lafayette Street just opposite the Public Theater, to open its season with Warbeck, a new play by one of the company's two playwrightsinresidence, Louis Phillips. The present play had apparently been developed in association with the company's artistic director, Michael Lessac.

title: Islanders Rout Black Hawks, 6 to 2, for 4th Victory in Row
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 12 The Islanders buried the Chicago Black Hawks tonight with an avalanche of 53 shots, club record, as they won their fourth straight game, 62.

title: School Results
description: BASKETBALL

title: Police Hockey Team Beats Firemen, 42
description: Greg Terhune scored two goals and added an assist and Greg Cassim had a goal and two assists as the New York Police Department's hockey team defeated the New York Fire Department's team, 42, before 7,528 fans yesterday at Madison Square Garden.

title: BEAME VOWS FREEZE ON REALTY TAX RATE FOR NEXT FIVE YEARS
description: New York City's realestate tax rate will be capped for five years  right through the next mayoral term  Mayor Beame promised yesterday.

title: Riot Police Quell Clash in Jail
description: VENTURA, Calif., Dec. 12 (UPI) Riot police were called in last night to quell a disturbance at the Ventura County Jail that broke out when a prisoner tried to take the food of another prisoner and a fight involving some 15 inmates developed, the Sheriff's Department reported today. The fight led to a fivehour rampage in which the inmates, all in cellblock for prisoners not yet sentenced, broke windows, sinks and toilers and tore up plumbing. A team of 10 riot policemen quelled the disturbanbe about 9 P.M.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Police Report Art Forger, Facing Extradition Order, Killed Himself on Ibiza
description: IBIZA, Dec. 12 (Reuters) Elmyr de Hory, reputed to be the world's best art forger, committed suicide yesterday here at his villa on this island in the Balearics because he faced almost certain extradition to France, the police said today. They reported that the Hungarianborn painter had died of an overdose of sleeping pills.

title: Pushing for the Death Penalty
description: TRENTON, Dec. 12 The legislative push behind the death penalty represents an effort by some legislators to appease large segments of New Jersey's 3.8 million registered voters. The death penalty is part of a law and order mood in the Legislature that seems to feel that the public needs some soothing to ease the anger created last summer by the passage of the state income tax.

title: BEAME VOWS FREEZE ON REALTY TAX RATE FOR NEXT FIVE YEARS
description: New York City's realestate tax rate will be capped for five years  right through the next mayoral term  Mayor Beame promised yesterday.

description: Major projects scheduled for starts sometime in 1977 includes the following, according to the Transportation Department:

title: Around the Nation
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Dec. 12Delaware canceled this weekend's state football betting game as a result of what the state's lottery director termed pressure from the news media and ridicule over the state's official point spread.

title: Aegean Lands And U.S.Policy
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Dec. 9 A Turkish newspaper ran a headline this week saying, U.S. Should Treat Turkey Equally. The same day, a headline in a Greek daily reported, Greece Expects Balanced Policy from Washington. These headlines sum up the problem facing the United States as it tries to rebuild its relations with Greece and Turkey. As Jimmy Carter told the Senate Foreign Relations Commitee recently, American policies in the last few years have succeeded in alienating both countries. Accordingly, Greece has pulled its troops out of the military wing of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization. Turkey has suspended the operations of six important American bases here, and the two bulwarks of NATO's southern flank barely speak to each other.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: CUT BUSINESS TAXES, NEW YORK CITY URGED
description: Large cuts in city taxes on manufacturers to stop the economic erosion that has cost New York 500,000 factory jobs since 1950 were recommended yesterday by a commission appointed by Mayor Beame.

title: Three Killed by Black Guerrillas In Attacks on Rhodesia Townships
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec. 12 (Reuters) Black nationalist guerrillas shot and killed two black civilians and a Rhodesian soldier of mixed race in attacks in black townships in Bulawayo; a security force announcement said today.

title: CORRECTION
description: The obituary of Frederick T. Allen in Saturday's Times incorrectly identified Barr Brothers & Company as a law. firm. It is a company specializing in municipal bonds.

title: Takeover of Company Is Arranged by Qatar
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Dec. 12 (AP)Qatar completed preparations today for a complete takeover of the remaining 40 percent held by foreign participants in the Qatar Petroleum Company, the Persian Gulf emirate's radio reported.

title: F.C.C. GIVES ITS APPROVAL TO HEARINGAID CAPTIONS
description: The Federal Communications Commission has given its approval to an electronic system that would produce captions on television programs for viewers with hearing impairments whose sets are equipped with special decoding attachments. The captions would be invisible to other viewers.

title: CBSTV WINS RIGHTS TO BEAUTY PAGEANT
description: In what is considered a coup in network program competition, CBSTV has won the rights to next September's telecast of The Miss America Pageant, one of television's consistently highrating winners. The program traditionally marks the Opening of the fall television season and has been carried by NBC for the last 11 years.

title: Helms, Leaving as Envoy in Iran, Will Continue as a Consultant
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 12 (AP) Richard Helms, who is resigning as the United States Ambassador to Iran, said here today that he had no particular plans for retirement other than to act as a consultant on Iranian affairs.

title: Malik, at 70, Ends One Career, Embarks on Another
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 12Yakov A. Malik, for the last six years the Soviet Union's tough and often fiery tempered representative here, ended his United Nations career and headed home today.

title: Joyce Miller Is Wed To Jerrold Nadler
description: Josephine Langsdorr Miller, a doctoral candidate in political science at Columbia University, was married yesterday afternoon to Jerrold L. Nadler, Assemblymanelect from Manhattan's 69th Assembly District. Rabbi Alan Miller, assisted by Cantor Eliezer Kornreich, performed the ceremony in Temple B'nai Jeshurun.

title: Handicapped Campaign for Rights To Mobility, Jobs and Education
description: DETROIT, Dec. 12 (UPI)You have to understand that you are a cripple. You have a certain station in life, and you cannot rise above it.

title: JOBS IN BIG BANKS FOUND HARD TO GET FOR MINORITY MEN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12A new study of employment practices in banking showed that minority men were still encountering extreme difficulty in obtaining jobs at any level in large banks, although these same banks have improved considerably in the extent to which they employ women, including minority women, in all except the very top jobs.

title: New York City's Fiscal Experts Tempering Optimism With Caution.
description: The Beame administration, faced with a threeweek deadline to show how it will balance the city's budget next year, has now identified some potential new savings that may soften the need for the drastic cuts in services that have been feared for the last several months.

title: Randolph's Chorus in Messiah
description: Christmas, David Randolph's Masterwork Chorus and Handel's Messiah have become virtually synonymous for the last 20 years in New York City. If Mr. Randolph is becoming weary of presiding over this holiday ritual, he showed no signs of it Saturday night in Carnegie Hall.

title: James B. Turnbull, Artist, Is Dead in Florida at 67; Painted Warfare in Action
description: James Baare Turnbull, the artist, whose World War It combat paintings hang in the Pentagon, died last Friday at Memorial Hospital in Jacksonville, Fla., where he had lived for many years. He was 67 years old.

title: Perfection and Progress
description: WASHINGTONLast spring an unusual combination of liberals and conservatives in Congress joined the Attorney General, Edward H. Levi, in a new approach to an Intractable old problem. They introduced a jointly drafted bill to control wiretapping and electronic eavesdropping for foreign intelligence purposes.

title: Emery C. Kolb, 94, Photographer And Grand Canyon Explorer, Dies
description: GRAND CANYON, Ariz., Dec. 12 (AP)  Emery C. Kolb, an explorer, pioneer and photographer who made his living photographing tourists on mules at the Grand Canyon, died yesterday at the age of 94.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: A short while ago, we wrote an article detailing the menu offered by the proprietor of the Comme Chez Soi restaurant in Brussels on the occasion of that establishment's 50th birthday. The hors d'oeuvre on that evening was listed as la terrine de legumes puce cressonette, a vegetable loaf in aspic served with watercress mayonnaise,

title: Recital: Art of Martina Arroyo
description: Opera singers are traditionally presumed to make poor recitalists, but Martina Arroyo disproved if not actually reversed that theory yesterday afternoon at her Avery Fisher Hall concert by finding the recital stage even more suitable to her talents. Not that Miss Arroyo is Ineffective on the opera stageher large, bright, excellently schooled soprano is a natural instrument for the dramatic Italian roles.

title: U.S. Jets Join in Celebration Of Kenya's Independence Day
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Dec. 12 (UPI) United States Marine Corps jets flew over the capital today to celebrate the 13th anniversary of Kenya's independence and show America's growing commitment to this East African nation.

title: Product Names Get Longer and Wordier
description: Something is happening to product names as a number of marketers turn their backs on the traditional use of one or two catchy (and frequently mispelled) words in favor of unbelievably long descriptive phrases or sentences.

title: TopLevel Soviet Team Among Guests Arriving in Hanoi for First Vietnamese Party Congress in 16 Years
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 12 Toplevel delegations from some of the world's major Communist parties began arriving in Hanoi this weekend for the expected opening on Tuesday of the fourth congress of the Vietnam Workers Partythe biggest Communist spectacle in Indochina in nearly two decades.

title: Spain Beats U.S., Wins Golf Cup
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Dec. 12In a dramatic reversal on the nexttolast hole of the tournamentthe 214yard, par 3 at Mission Hills Country ClubSpain picked up three strokes and snatched the World Cup golf championship out of the hands of the United States team.

title: Horse Shows
description: AT MIDDLE ISLAND, L. I.

title: Chess:
description: If Bent Larsen can squeeze blood out of the Vienna Game, should we all follow his lead?

title: Painter, 80, Loses Studio in Eviction
description: For more than 30 years, members of royalty, captains of industry, pillars of society and just plain folks have sat in the comfortable clutter of apartment 406 in the Hotel des Artistes to pose for portraits by Michel Alexander Werboff.

title: Early Morning Fire Kills Five Of 25 Registered in Kansas Hotel
description: HOLTON, Kan., Dec. 12 (AP) An early morning hotel fire, believed to have started in a divan, claimed five lives here today.

title: Meadowlands
description: ENTRIES

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Transition: ForeignPolicy Idiocies . .

title: P.L.O. Leaders Gather in Damascus to Discuss Unity
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Dec. 12 (Reuters) The executive committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization today began a meeting, boycotted by three guerrilla organizations, to discuss the outcome of the Lebanese civil war and the strengthening of Palestinian unity.

title: The Injustices of PleaBargaining
description: Prison revolt is the product of felt injustice rather than physical hardship. It is now widely recognized that prison inmates grievances are fueled by unexplainedand sometimes inexplicable disparities in their sentences. But I believe that the pervasive practice of pleabargaining is a yet more profound cause of the disrespect prisoners feel for the criminal justice system.

title: CRITICS CIRCLE NOMINATES 20 BOOKS BY U.S. AUTHORS
description: Twenty books by living American authors published this year have been nominated for prizes in the second annual National Book Critics Circle Awards. Five books were seelcted in each of the four categories: fiction, nonfiction, poetry and criticism.

title: Chinese, Used to Bland News, Now Getting Sensations
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 12For the Chinese people, accustomed to a bland diet of politically correct news and entertainment, the last few months have brought a series of sensational press reports and radio broadcasts. Of all these, perhaps the most melodramatic are a stream of recent broadcasts from Hupeh Province in central China. There, the local radio asserts, supporters of Chiang Ching, Mao Tsetung's wife, and three other nowdisgraced members of the Chinese Communist Party Politburo carried out a concerted campaign over the last few years to topple the regular provincial leadership. If the broadcasts can be believed, the dissidents, who called themselves the rebels, set up their own opposition provincial party committeq, signed directives in its name, pasted up wall posters calling for attacks on the offices of their enemies, organized work stoppages in factories and even beat up peasants and killed workers who opposed them.

title: Tree's a Crowd In Somerset County
description: SOMERVILLE, Dec. 12 (AP) Potential tree thieves beware: There's going to be a real stink if you chop down a tree in Somerset County to decorate your home at Christmas.

title: Golf
description: WORLD CUP

title: Bus Crash in Brazil Kills 20
description: SALVADOR, Brazil, Dec. 12 (Reuters)A bus plunged into the Pardo River between Sao Paulo to Igautu, killing 20 people and injuring 16, the police said today. The bus went into the river after the driver tried to avoid hitting a group of pedestrians crossing the road, the police said.

title: Twin Italian Liners Are Sold to Iran
description: GENOA, Italy, Dec. 12 (AP) The twin luxury liners Michelangelo and Raffaello, once the pride of Italy's passenger fleet, have been sold to Iran, it was announced today by officials of the statecontrolled shinoine line.

title: Gentleman's Agreement Horse Show Winner
description: MIDDLE ISLAND, L.I., Dec. 12Gentleman's Agreement swept to victory in all four classes to capture the special working hunter championship today at the Middle Island Indoor Horse Show.

title: Capt. Renzullo Shuns Publicity on First Day
description: Capt. Vittoria Renzullo, the first woman to be appointed the commander of a New York City police precinct, fled from reporters on her first day of duty yesterday. She held her hands up to her face to avoid being photographed and then crouched on the floor of a patrol car as it sped away from the station house at 16 Ericsson Place.

title: A Little Weightlifting to Get Into Feminine Shape
description: LOS ANGELESTina Rocca has done it all. The 108pound brunette has raced two miles a day for four years, slammed tennis balls until her arm ached, and spent hours practicing modern dance. So it was not surprising that she started lifting weights at the MidValley Young Men's Christian Association in Van Nuys, Calif.

title: A Leading Lebanese Christian Hurt In Third Attempt on Life This Year
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 12 The third attempt this year has been made on the life of Raymond Edde, the prominent Lebanese Christian leader.

title: 5 HEALTH COMPANIES ARE TERMED FRONTS
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 12 Five nonprofit companies that provide prepaid care to California's Medicaid patients are, in fact, fronts for profitmaking companies, according to a report of the General Accounting Office.

title: World News Briefs
description: Tear Gas Used to Quell West Bank Protests

title: Blasts Rock Memphis Campus
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 12 (UPI) Two explosions caused by a leak of underground natural gas hurled chunks of concrete three stories high in a mall area on the campus of Memphis State University today. School officials said no one was hurt by the blasts, which went off about 12:15 A.M., blowing off two manhole covers and breaking more than a dozen windows. The damage was estimated at $20,000.

title: Of Kurds and Conscience
description: WASHINGTONAccording to some of our best doctors, Mustafa Barzani, 73, leader of the Kurdish people, should have died of cancer about six months ago. On the assumption that his illness was terminal, and with the tacit understanding that he would not try to enlist public support for the Kurds in his waning days, General Barzani was permitted to undergo treatment here at the Mayo Clinic.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Poultry Industry's Turkey Ham Enrages Pork Producers
description: A ham by any other name may taste as sweet, but the recent introduction of a turkey hamwhich looks and tastes like the real thing but is made from turkeyhas drawn squeals of protest from the nation's beef and pork producers.

title: Orantes Overcomes Fibak In 5 Sets for Masters Title
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 12Trailing two sets to one and 14 in the fourth set, Manuel Orantes of Spain staged another memorable comeback today and won the Grand Prix Masters tennis title.

title: Redskins Top Politics As Capital's No.1 Topic
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12Some say Washington is a onegame townpolitics. But it is really a twogame town. The other game is football, and it is much easier to understand. For the last several days, news of the Presidential transition has taken a back seat to that other local passion, the Washington Redskins, who barreled their way to a playoff berth today by defeating the Dallas Cowboys, 27 to 14. The victory came after a fretful weekend for local fans in which the team's aging and volatile quarterback, Billy Kilmer, was picked up for drunken driving, producing an article that was splashed across page 1 of The Washington Post today.

title: Erika Mosquin Married on L.I. to Dr. Anthony Bruno
description: Erika Mosquin and Dr. Anthony Bruno were married yesterday afternoon in the East Williston (L.I.) Community Church by the Rev. Kenneth Gruebel. The parents of the couple are Mr. and Mrs. George Mosquin of Cold Spring Harbor, L.I., and Mr. and Mrs. Frank Bruno of Margate, Fla., and Rosedale, Queens.

title: Academicians at Meeting in Capital Voice Resentment Over Federal Regulation of Higher Education
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The simmering resentment in the academic community over the growth of Federal regulation of higher education boiled over at a twoday conference at George Washington University that ended yesterday.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for week follows:

title: State Treasury Holding $260,000 For Localities in Race Track Taxes
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, Dec. 12More than $260,000 in admission taxes collected at four of New Jersey's five race tracks to help the local communities meet expenses is being held in the state treasury while the Legislature decides how the towns may spend the revenue.

title: Rangers Outclass Canadiens
description: A New York Range rs victory over the Montreal Canadiens is about as plausible as a New York City budget surplus, but the Rangers brought off that miracle last night as they outhustled and routed the Canadiens, 52, before a frenzied capacity house of 17,500 in Madison Square Garden.

title: Carlson Bowling Victor
description: CANTON, Ohio, Dec. 12 (AP)Glenn Carlson of Fresno, Calif., won the Magnum pro bowling tournament today with a 24game total pinfall of 6,267. He earned $2,500 and a berth in the 1977 Firestone Tournament of Champions at Akron. Charlie Venable of Brooklyn, New York, finished second with 6,164.

title: Basketball
description: EASTERN BASKETBALL ASS'N Scranton 111, Brooklyn 105.

title: A National Drawer for Dusty, Yellowing Diaries
description: I advocate the creation of an institution called the American Diary RePository.

title: Sunday Buyers Throng 5th Ave., Closedas a Mall
description: Thousands of affluent shoppers and notsoaffluent windowshoppers thronged Fifth Avenue and the Upper East Side in a holiday mood yesterday, turning the thoroughfare into a festive mall as four major stores opened for the first time on a Sunday.

title: Polisario Reports Sahara Attacks. On Moroccans and Mauritanians
description: ALGIERS, Dec. 12 (Agence FrancePresse) Guerrillas from the former Spanish Sahara, which is now divided between Morocco and Mauritania, raided Mauritanian forces at Aguerguer last week, putting scores of Mauritanian troops out of action, the Polisario independence front said today.

title: Arms Sales Momentum
description: There were few subjects on which Jimmy Carter spoke with greater feeling during the Presidential campaign than of the urgent need to curb the almost completely unrestricted sales of United States arms to other countries. Yet the Ford Administration in its final weeks is taking a number of actions in line with the policies that have established this country as the world's leading arms merchant, with annual sales over $10 billion.
