description: WORLD CUP

title: Steve Cady
description: It was high Noon, but the cars had their headlights on. Was this a funeral? No, just another caravan of Jet fans turning out at Shea Stadium for the final game of another football season. The analogy will do, though. What else but respect for the dead could bring 31,067 people out yesterday to see such a dismal team on such a dismal day of fog and rain? When it was over, after the Cincinnati Bengals had lowered the Jets into another 311 wonlost grave with a 423 mugging, even Joe Namath had to agree the occasion had mournful overtones. Namath, in what most of the experts figured would be his last game as a Jet, got intercepted four times in the first half. On the fourth one, with bedsheet signs such as Thanks for the Memories, Joe still hanging soggily from the stands, the crowd began booing him. Coming off the field after the game, though, the $500,000ayear quarterback waved to his fans. A youngster reached down and grabbed the green Jet ski cap from his hero's head. Namath pulled another from his pocket, and tossed it to the crowd. In the warmth of the Jet locker room, dejected Broadway Joe admitted he had a lot of thoughts but didn't think he could express them properly.

title: CONSERVATIYES VOTE TO SHUN PARTY LABELS
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 12 In the corridors and restaurants and In meetings at the Marriott Hotel here this weekend, some 400 conservatives debated the problems facing them and vowed to go home and get it all together for the future.

title: Long Roundtrip Flight Completed
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 12 (UPI) The longest scheduled nonstop passenger flight in airline history, a 7,500mile ran from Australia to San Francisco, completed its inaugural round trip today. A spokesman for Pan American Airways said that the airline's service, which had the first half of its inaugural run Wednesday from San Francisco to Sydney, will be offered, once a week each way.

title: Oil Consumers Await Price Rise As OPEC Nations Meet This Week
description: LONDON, Dec. 12Three years ago, just before Christmas, six angry countries that surround the Persian Gulf met in Teheran and doubled the price of a barrel of light Arabian crude oil. On top of smaller increases just a few months earlier, that decision, in the view of many experts, probably changed the world as much as any event since World War II.

title: Wave of Violent Crime Alarms WelltoDo San Franciscans and Has Politicians Fighting
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 12 Waves of fear are washing over many portions of this city. Oncesecure citizens say they are terrorized by the recent intrusion of violence into their formerly safe neighborhoods.

title: Today's Writers Failing Mankind, Bellow Contends
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 12Saul Bellow walked to a lectern at the Swedish Academy late this afternoon, smiling modestly at the wave of applause in the chandeliered chamber from Swedish officials, writers, diplomats, students and fellow Nobel Prize winners.

title: Deaths
description: ALLEGRETTISantlna (nee Sirna). Beloved wife of the late Sergio. Devoted mother of Victor, Ann Damiani, Lee Andreoll and Alfred. Also 11 grandchildren. Reposing at Scarped Chapels, 1401 86th St., Brooklyn, until Wednesday, 9 A.M. Mass St. Bernadette Shrine, 9:30 A.M. Entombment Holy Rood Cemetery, Westbury, L.I.

title: Ford Rests Before Budget Work
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI) President Ford attended church today and then relaxed at the White House, watching football games on television, before final week of work on his proposed Federal budget. The President is to leave next Sunday for a twoweek Christmas skiing vacation with his family in Vaii Colo.

title: Joblessness Among Youths Is Raising Worry in Europe
description: PARIS. Dec. 12The blight of jobless youth has fallen over Western Europe.

title: Bitterness and Alienation Grow For Unemployable, Overtrained
description: PARIS, Dec. 12 Unemployed or unemployable, Agim Likaj in Brussels, Klaus Ledwig in Nuremberg, Karen Patte in Paris, Gerard Jumel in the Paris suburb of Nanterre, and many, many others, don't quite know where to turn or how to react except in growing bitterness, alienation and depression.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Detroit Protecting Old Homes by Presale Inspections
description: DETROIT, Dec. 12 Eva M. McKellar's spacious home in this city's exclusive Palmer Woods area is not what most people would consider uninhabitable. But when she recently agreed to sell it for more than $62,000, the city sent an inspector who declared that her home did not meet local standards for livability.

title: EDUCATION CENTER IN ESSEX IS OPENED
description: EAST ORANGE, Dec. 12Rain did not dampen enthusiasm at the dedication of the Educational Improvement Center for northeast New Jersey here today. Neither did it halt a protest by 50 demonstrators against the state income tax outside the center.

title: Supplementary OverCounter Listings
description: The following is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: Official Presidential Vote Totals
An Octogenarian's Eclectic Sounds
Relief for Burn Victims
description: Repeatedly in recent years New Yorkers have been shocked by the gross inadequacy of local facilities to care for seriously burned patients. After disasters as diverse as a plane crash at Kennedy Airport or an explosion in a Bronx social club, there are reports of patients having to be flown to Pennsylvania, to Boston and even to Texas for treatment, forced journeys which inevitably impose greater risk of death or permanent injury. The situation is alleviated somewhat with the opening of New York Hospital's new 24bed burn center, but even this addition will fall far short of the need.

title: Steinhardt and Serkin Pair Up To Provide Musical Nourishment
description: A recital for violin and piano that puts Busoni and Bartok between slices of Mozart has a nourishing look to it. Under the hands of Arnold Steinhardt and Peter Serkin the program also had the sound of intellectual and musical nourishment yesterday at Alice Tully Hall. Mr. Steinhardt, who is the first violinist of the Guarneri String Quartet, found an excellent collaborator in Mr. Serkin in a recital of exceptional quality.

title: Widower New to L.I. Finds Neighbors Nice, but Busy
description: GLEN HEAD, L. I.  The people of North Shore Acres may not .see many of their neighbors from one month to the next, but they all see Franois Callec.

title: New York Reduces Costs of Running DayCare Centers
description: At a time of general cost inflation, New York City's spending on daycare programs has been reducedfrom an average of S74 a week a child last June 30 to $63 currently, according to the Agency for Child Development.

title: Sunday Buyers Throng 5th Ave., Closed as a Mall
description: Thousands of affluent shoppers and notsoaffluent windowshoppers thronged Fifth Avenue and the Upper East Side in a holiday mood yesterday, turning the thoroughfare into a festive mall as four major stores opened for the first time on a Sunday.

title: Waverly Consort in a Fine Recital
description: The Waverly Consort, its regular complement of six singers and four players expanded by five guest instrumentalists, upheld its reputation for performing excellence at a soldout Alice Tully Hall Saturday night.

title: CORRECTION
description: The obituary of Frederick T. Allen in Saturday's Times incorrectly identified Barr Brothers & Company as a law firm. It is a company specializing in municipal bonds.

title: Members of City Ballet Orchestra Strike for Pay Rise, Work Changes
description: Union musicians went on strike against the New York City Ballet this morning for more money and work changes in a walkout that could cause a shutdown of the company for the holiday season.

title: Bridge:
description: The start of knockout play in the Grand National Team Championship at the New York Hilton Hotel Saturday reduced 69 teams to 17 but produced no major upsets. However, there were two minor upsets and one narrow escape, and in all three cases, by coincidence, the margin of victory was 3 international match points.

title: Electoral College to Hold Its Quadrennial Sessions And Name Carter Today
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP)The Electoral College meets tomorrow in 50 states and the District of Columbia to elect Jimmy Carter of Georgia as President of the United States.

title: Books of The Times
description: It's as if Andr Malraux had left a taperecorder running while he walked around the Museum Without Walls inside his own skull. The transcript is this headcheese of a book, back and forth in the time of his life and in the tune of art, opening and shutting closetsinside this one, the Little Man from the Cyclades with his violinshaped idol, inside that one a black Aztec dbzth'sheadwith constant interruptions by Picasso, non sequiturs, clunky aphorisms, critical insights, jabs in the eye, moonings about the unknowable, essays on courage, gushes of Picasso's Mask, the third volume of his autobiography, after AntiMemoirs and Felled Oaks, is exasperating. But, like everything else he wrote, it is exciting too.

title: Rochdale Strike Continues
description: Roclidale Village in Jamaica, Queens, survived the weekend with no major problems reported because of a strike Friday by its maintenance workers and guards whose picket lines blocked oil delivery trucks. Harold Ireland, controller of the 5,860unit housing complex, met with the striking Local 80 of the Teamsters and James McCabe, a state mediator. The talks were unproductive and will continue this week, Mr. Ireland said. The Rochdale official said the complex had, sufficient fuel to last six or seven days.

title: Federal Study Hints Ratio Of Heroin Use in Detroit Is Highest in the Country
description: DETROIT, Dec. 12 (AP) A Federal study indicates that Detroit leads the nation in proportion of heroin users, with 30,000, or about one in every 41 residents, having a habit.

title: BLACK RHODESIAN LEADER IS WELCOMED BY 200,000
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec. 12 (Reuters) A black Rhodesian leader, Bishop Abel Muzorewa, was greeted by more than 200,000 cheering and chanting supporters today when he arrived in the black township of Highfield from the Rhodesia conference in Geneva.

title: Widower New to L.I. Finds Neighbors Nice, but Busy
description: GLEN HEAD, L. I.  The people of North Shore Acres may not see many of their neighbors from one month to the next, but they all see Francois Callee.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
Friends of Kagan Say He Used $11,000 Boomis Gave for Beame, but Matched It
description: Friends of Arnold H. Kagan said yesterday that the international builder and financier had used $11,000 that Christopher Boomis, the developer, gave secretly for Mayor Beame's 1973 campaign, but that, in exchange for it, Mr. Kagan contributed the same amount in his own name and through a relative.

title: A Man of Many Roles
description: An incarnation of dimpled, rugged IrishAmerican handsomeness and wit, Jack Cassidy made it his specialty to play leading men who caricatured leading men as preening, if crafty, fops.

title: Oil Experts Vexed By Power Failures In Qatar Meetings
description: DOHA, Qatar, Dec. 12Oil experts of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries, meeting today to prepare for this week's OPEC ministerial conclave, grappled with the problem of how to vary OPEC's standard oil price for varying grades of crude oil.

title: Little Heat Expected In Fire District Vote
description: Dozens of voters will go to the polls tomorrow in New York State's 920 independent fire districts to elect fire commissioners who will spend more than $50 million in tax monies next year.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

title: PORTUGUESE VOTING FOR LOCAL OFFICIALS
description: LISBON, Monday, Dec. 13 The Portuguese selected local officials in an election yesterday that was generally viewed as a referendum on the performance of the fourmonthold minority Socialist Government.

title: WaterMain Break Leaves 400 Homes in Jersey City High and Dry
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 12 (UPI)Water taps remained dry at about 400 Jersey City homes today as engineers worked to build up water pressure and repair a ruptured main. Originally the break left twothirds of the city's 250,000 residents without water.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
Sister of Farouk Is Killed; Husband is Held
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 12 (AP) Fathia Ghali, sister of Egypt's late King Farouk, has been shot to death in her apartment and her estranged husband has been booked for investigation of murder, the police said.

title: U.S. ADVISER, IN EARLY 49, SAW DEFEAT FOR CHIANG
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI)In testimony kept secret since early 1949. a United States military expert told Congress that the Communists would soon win China's civil war unless the United States invaded the mainland or armed a. million more Nationalist troops.

title: Market Place
description: Rohr Industries, which experienced such heavy losses producing cars for San Francisco and Washington, D.C.'s rapid transit systems that it pulled out of the rail car business, suddenly blossomed in last week's stock market.

title: 2D ABSOLUTION RITE HELD IN TENNESSEE
description: JACKSON, Tenn., Dec. 12 About 2,000 Roman Catholics, many of whom had been separated from the church for years, jammed into the Jackson Civic Center this afternoon for services offering general absolution for their sins, a sacrament traditionally reserved for those facing grave danger or death.

title: Town of 50 That Doesn't Have TV Isn't Certain That's a Bad Thing
description: ESSEX, Calif., Dec. 12 (AP) Nobody in Essex watches television. Nobody can. It's one of the very few communities left in America that cannot receive TV signals.

title: Four Die in Pennsylvania Fire
description: NEMACOLIN, Pa., Dec. 12 (UPI)  A mother and three children died this morning in a fire in a twostory frame duplex in this coal town in Greene County. The county coroner said Jackie Galatic, a daughter and two sons died of smoke inhalation. Mrs. Galatic's husband, Steven, escaped by jumping from a second floor bedroom.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Queens Man Kills One Intruder By Stabbing and Cuts a Second
description: A Queens waiter who was awakened early yesterday by two burglars in his father's house in Flushing, Queens, fatally stabbed one burglar and wounded the other during a struggle inside the house, according to the police.

title: Stimulating the Economy
description: A consensus is forming on the size, composition and timing of the fiscal stimulus needed to get the national economy moving ahead and thereby to reduce unemployment. Mr. Carter's transition staff and the chief executives of fifteen major corporations have offered the Presidentelect remarkably similar plans combining three basic elements:, personal tax cuts, tax incentives for business investment and Federal spending increases focused on the jobless.

title: West German Conservative Groups Agree to Continue Their Alliance for Four Years
description: BONN, Dec. 12 West Germany's two conservative opposition parties have agreed, after three weeks of fighting each other, to join forces against Chancellor Helmut Schmidt after all when parliament convenes for another fouryear term on Tuesday.

title: Painter, 80, Loses Studio in Eviction
description: For more than 30 years, members of royalty, captains of industry, pillars of society and just plain folks have sat in the comfortable clutter of apartment 406 in the Hotel des Artistes to pose for portraits by Michel Alexander Werboff.

title: Rhodesian Leaves Geneva Parley
description: GENEVA, Dec. 12 Prime Minister Ian D. Smith of Rhodesia left for home tonight, saying that he saw virtually no change in the deadlock at the conference on the future of his country despite the attention it was given in London over the weekend by highlevel British and American officials.

title: Kissinger's Log Gets Final Entry: 3,600 Quiet Miles
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger returned home today, bringing to an end his unique era of airborne diplomacy.

title: Doubts Stir as Portugal Builds Oil City
description: SINES, PortugalA few years back, honeymooners came to this isolated fishing village to sun on the deserted white sands, climb the dark rocky cliffs and see the house where Vasco da Gama was born.

title: Cordero Builds Lead In Purse Winnings
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Dec. 12Angel Cordero Jr. picked up $11,160 in purse money today at El Comandante race track to extend his lead over Sandy Hawley to $20,893 in total purse winnings by a Jockey for the year. Cordero's mounts have earned. $4,547,491, to $4,526,598 tor Hawley's.

title: TAXI UNION AND OWNERS CONTINUE NEGOTIATIONS
description: Contract negotiations between taxi fleet owners and union cab drivers continued early this morning, with the owners still threatening to charge each driver 5 cents for each gallon of gasoline used during his shift, beginning today, unless a settlement of the dispute was reached, or seemed to be near.

title: Excerpts From Bellow's Lecture
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 12 (AP) Following are excerpts from the text the Nobel lecture of Saul Bellow:

title: Colts Rout Bills, 5820, for Title
description: The rewards for excellence can sometimes be strange. For instance, the Baltimore Colts did almost everything perfectly yesterday in a 5820 victory over the Buffalo Bills that gave the Colts their second consecutive National Football League division championship.

title: Vietnam Reports Bomb Removal
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 12 (AP) A Vietnamese army engineering brigade has removed 70,000 unexploded mines and bombs from two major airports and railroad station compound in the Saigon area since April 1975, the official Vietnamese press agency reported today. In a dispatch received in Bangkok. the agency said that the munitions were removed from Saigon's Tan Son Nhut Airport, Bien Hoe Airport and the Di An railroad station compound in Saigon.

title: U.S.MICRONESIA STATUS HELD CLOUDED BY SPYING
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 The chief spokesman here for the people of Micronesia said today that reports of spying activities of the C.I.A. will in my judgment unquestionably cast a long shadow in future slatus negotiations between the U.S. and my people on the terms of its independence.

title: Nancy Oppenheimer Bride of David A. Laster
description: Nancy Oppenheimer and David Alan Laster were married yesterday in the chapel of Temple Mount Sinai in El Paso, Tex., by Rabbi Edward Cohn.

title: Advertising
description: Television is causing the upper and lower socioeconomic levels in American society to drift apartthat's the opinion of Dr. Herbert E. Krugman of the General Electric Company, a respected Psychologist and marketing researcher.

title: Study Shows Employees of 24 Cities Get Pay Comparable With Industry
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) Employees of the nation's 24 biggest cities are paid salaries comparable with those in private industry, a recent Government study says, with Government clerical. workers earning more and skilled trades workers less than the private industry average.

title: Legislature to Confront Same Old Problems Jan. 5
description: The New York State Legislature will return to Albany next month to find an agenda filled with the same problems it confrontedor, in some significant cases, failed to confrontduring the 1976 session, which ended five months ago.

title: COURT LETS STAND F.C.C. PHONE RULING ON PRIVATE SUPPLIES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 13 (UPI)The Suprerne Court rejected today an appeal by state utility commissions and telephone companies of a 1974 Federal Communications Commission ruling that allows use of privately owned telephone equipment.

title: Around the Nation
description: Delaware Official Voids Cancellation of Lottery

title: Issue and Debate
description: The proposal that Westchester County withdraw from the Consolidated Edison system and provide its own electricity has been greeted with about the same skepticism as past proposals that New York City secede from New York State.

title: OPPOSITION SUIT GRANTED ON MOBIL'S BID FOR IRVINE
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 13California State Superior Court Judge James Judge granted attorneys for Joan Irvine Smith and the California Attorney General who had joined her in a suit until Dec. 23 to oppose the determination that the Jr. vine Foundation should accept the Mobil Corporation's offer to purchase the Irvine Company, a large Southern California develoner. for S33.50 a share.

title: No Biz Like Sex Biz
description: Most of the problems created by New York City's booming sex industry result from the city's reluctance to treat it as an industry. Everybody concerned wants to deal with it as a problem in constitutional law or moral philosophy. This hightoned approach leads to some very elegant arguments and some splendid emotional speeches, some of them entertaining, some edifying and all useless.

title: World News Briefs Tito Is Said to Dismis  Recent Soviet Overturnes
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Dec. 13 (UPI) President Tito has dismissed a wide range of Soviet overtures for closer ties with Belgrade and rejected the Kremlin's request to increase servicing of its warships at Adriatic ports, Yugoslav sources have reported.

title: The Realty Tax: How It's Figured
description: New York City's realestate tax  its largest single source of revenueis calculated at a rate per $100 of the assessed value of taxable real estate. This year the rate is $8.795 per $100a jump of more than 60 cents from the year before.

title: U.S. DRUG AGENT IS KILLED BY AMERICAN IN COLOMBIA
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Dec. 13 (AP)A Cubanborn agent of the United States Drug Enforcement Administration was shot to death in his office here today by a gunman who then shot and killed himself, American officials said.

title: Queens Women Lose, 7268
description: Tennessee Tech defeated Queens College in women's basketball, 7268, at the loser's court last night. Tennessee Tech's Pam Teek scored with two foul shots to put the Golden Eaglettes up, 7068. Then, as Althea Gwyn inbounded for Queens, Tech's Gayle Burgess intercepted the pass and laid the ball in to seal the victory.

title: EUROPEANS CREATING JOBS FOR IDLE YOUTH
description: PARIS, Dec. 13The British have started a crash program in youth work experience. Belgium is hiring more young civil servants. Most European governments are giving subsidies to employers who hire and train teenagers. Many are creating jobs for them in land reclamation, canal cleaning and other public works.

title: GOVERNMENT PARTY EMERGES AS WINNER IN PORTUGAL VOTING
description: LISBON, Dec. 13Portugal's voters gave the minority Socialist Party Government a qualified vote of confidence in the local elections held yesterday, averting a crisis for this young democracy.

title: Arizona and Arizona State Asked To Join the Pacific8 Conference
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 13 (UPI)The Pacific8 Conference formally extended membership invitations today to Arizona and Arizona State, two longtime Western Athletic Conference powerhouses.

title: Taxes, Revenue . . .
description: With the important goal of trying to revive New York's declining economy, and thus to restore its shrinking fiscal base; Mayor Beame's Temporary Commission on City Finances has called for sweeping cuts in taxes on local manufacturers.

title: New Director Leads Youth Symphony
description: The Youth Symphony Orchestra of New York opened its 14th season on Saturday in Carnegie Hall with a concert conducted by its new music director, MytingWilun Chung. Mr. Chung, a 23yearold native of Korea, 1 is perhaps best known hereabouts as a pianist, having won a silver medal in the 1974 Moscow Tchaikovsky Competition followed by a solo New York recital and appearances with his sisters, KyungWha Chung, violinist. and MyungWha Chung, cellist.

title: Park Service Says Alien Animals Threaten Land and May Be Shot
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (AP)The National Park Service says that animals not native to their regions, ranging from wild burros to the mongoose, are destroying national park land to such a degree that the service may be forced to capture and shoot them.

title: Police Chiefs in Massachusetts Are Told to Enforce Blue Laws
description: BOSTON, Dec. 13 (AP)Attorney General Francis X. Bellotti urged local police today to enforce laws banning Sunday sales.

title: 3 SENATORS SUPPORT BYRD AS LEADER OF DEMOCRATS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (UPI)Three senators today formally endorsed Senator Robert C. Byrd of West Virginia for Senate Democratic leader.

title: Japanese Upset As Other Lands Cut Fish Quotas
description: TOKYO, Dec. 13Japan, a country that derives half its nonvegetable proteins from the sea, found much of these vital maritime resources jeopardized today as it entered a final phase of fishing negotiations with the United States.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: BRIGGS W. BUCHANAN
description: Briggs Wheeler Buchanan, a former member of the American Stock Exchange who became adviser in ancient Near Eastern art at Yale University, died Friday in a nursing home in Guilford, Conn. His age was 72.

title: DEATHPENALTY BILL SUPPORTED IN SENATE
description: TRENTON, Dec. 13The New Jersey State Senate voted tonight to support a return to capital punishment in New Jersey, but parliamentary requirements forced a final vote to be delayed until midJanuary.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HIS NIGHT Daniel Phillips. the 22yearold American violinist, is tonight's performer at 8 o'clock in the Young Concert Artists series, playing a program ranging from Bach to a chaconne composed this year by Eugene Phillips. The place is the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. at Lexington Avenue. Tickets are $1.50 to $3.50.

title: Recital: Zeitliri
description: Although primarily known as a specialist in contemporary music, Zvi Zeitlin managed to include a touch of just about everything at his violin recital in Alice Tully Hall Sunday night. The concert was the fourth in a series sponsored,by the Eastman School of Music, where Mr. Zeitlin has been a professor of violin since 1968.

title: Electoral College Picks President For 48th Time Amid Controversy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13Littlenoticed by most Americans and deplored by many who were aware, the Electoral College met today for the 48th time. If Congressional reformers have their way, it may be that institution's last session.

title: POLYXENIE KAMBOUROPOULO
description: Dr. Polyxenie Kambouropoulo, a retired professor of psychology at Vassar College, died in Athens, Nov. 27, according to word received here yesterday. Her age was 80.

title: BOTH OF TIANT'S PARENTS DIE OVER A 3DAY PERIOD
description: MILTON, Mass., Dec. 13 (AP)A double funeral was scheduled tomorraw for the parents of the Boston Red Sox pitching star, Luis Tiant.

title: Steel Output Rises 2d Straight Week; Increase Is 2.2%
description: Steel production for the week ended Saturday increased for the second consecutive week, rising by 2.2 percent to 2.14 million tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. This brought production back almost to the level of the Jan. 10, week when the nation's steelmakers poured 2.15 million tons.

title: Hughes Cousins Say Utah Man Forged Mormon Will; Service Station Operator Would Share in the Estate
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 13A lawyer for Howard Hughes's cousins today accused a 31yearold Utah service station operator of being involved in the forgery of a purported will of the late billionaire industrialist.

title: If Shoe Fits, Suspect May Feel the Pinch
description: If the shoe fits, then Wilfredo Ortiz may be one of three men who recently robbed a Manhattan jewelry store. One of them left behind a shoe.

title: Swiss AvalancheKills Four
description: ST. GALL, Switzerland, Dec. 13 (AP)Four young Swiss were killed and a fifth injured yesterday in Switzerland's first major avalanche accident of the prewinter season. The police said the avalanche, following heavy snowfalls, caught seven youths descending the 4,555foot Schwaegalp, in the northeast.

title: ALI YAVAR JUNG
description: BOMBAY, India, Dec. 13 (AP)Ali Yavar Jung, former Ambassador to the United States, died Saturday after suffering a heart attack. He was 71 years old.

title: How Twins Came to Prey on Aged
description: In 1964, when he was 7 years old and enrolled in the first grade at Public School 170 in Manhattan, Ronald Timmons was described as having never caused any troublegood, and fairly interested.

title: TV's Incursions Feared Affecting Sports Results
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 13It is the fourth quarter of Super Bowl XI, the Oakland Raiders lead the Dallas Cowboys, 143, and Don Meredith a roving television reporter, asks Jimmy Carter, a fan seated in the stands. Who's gonna win?

title: P. L. O. Council Meets in Damascus
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Dec. 13 (UPI)The central council of the Palestine Liberation Organization met here today in an effort to patch up differences and take a united stand on proposed ArabIsraeli negotiations. The interim parliament, according to conference sources, agreed to rely on democratic dialogue instead of violence for settling disputes.

title: Dave Anderson
description: To the Pittsburgh Steelers, their ninegame winning streak is merely a prelude.

title: SOUTH AFRICAN BLACK DIES WHILE IN PRISON
description: JOHANNESBURG, Dec. 13A black mining engineer who is believed to have been detained in an explosion in a Johannesburg restaurant last week has hanged himself in his cell at the police headquarters here, a police spokesman said today.

title: Paper Handlers Ratify Pact
description: Timothy Hunt, president of Local 1 of the Paper Handlers and Straighteners Union, said yesterday that members of his local had voted 122 to 65 to ratify a new contract with The Daily News and The New York Times. The agreement, he said, provided for an increase of $25 the first year, and $20 additional in both the second and third years. The agreement is retroactive to March 30, 1975, and is the ninth and final pact to be reached between the newspaper unions and the two newspapers in the current round of negotiations.

title: 4 Held as Cigarette Smugglers
description: MOUNT LAUREL TOWNSHIP, N. J., De,. 13 (AP)Four suspected New Yorkbound cigarette smugglers were arrested and almost 1,000 cartons of untaxed cigarettes were confiscated over the weekend, the state police said. The four are Edward Chan, 30 years old; Roberto Garcia, 29, and Sandy Knight, 55, of Brooklyn, and Orlando Fuentes, 28, of the Bronx.

title: Meet Marshall Goldberg: The Dorsett of '37
description: When University of Pittsburgh officials gathered at the Roosevelt Hotel Just Thursday to collect the Lambert rophy,?? one of their trim, 5foot11inch, 192pound allAmerican running backs explained how a team goes about winning this award as the outstanding major college football team in the East. After all, this athlete led the Panthers to two successive Lambert Trophies.

title: Spirit of Irish Today Evoked In New Drama Rallymurplzy
description: Michael Neville is a young American playwright who has written an Irish play, Ballymurphy, about a town in Northern Ireland that is torn by rebellion, internal as well as external. In the play, now running at thc Manhattan Theater Club, Mr. Neville succeeds in evoking not only the spirit of contemporary Ireland, but also the shade of Sean O'Casey.

title: Counsel for Legislature Clears I Feldman to Stay in State Senate
description: TRENTON, Dec. 13The chief counsel to the State Legislature and the State Attorney General agreed today that the Senate President, Matthew Feldman, Democrat of Teaneck, was innocent of any fraudulent, dishonest or corrupt conduct when he paid money to a restaurant chain executive in 1974 and 1975 to win an exclusive liquor contract for his family's business.

title: The Dunlop Signal
description: The Congressional Black Caucus, along with eight other groups representing women and minorities, has come out strongly against the appointment of John T. Dunlop as Secrotary of Labor in the Carter Administration. Aside from the specific question of Mr. Dunlop; however; the ralicile action signaled a certain sense of disquiet in the black community about the Presidentelect's priorities.

title: Fatal Blaze Laid to Carelessness
description: HUNTINGTON, Mass., Dec. 13 (AP)Careless disposal of smoking materials has been blamed for a fire that killed four persons and injured three others. Investigators for the state fire marshal's office issued the ruling concerning a blaze that destroyed a twostory house and connecting mobile home before dawn last Saturday. Killed were Nancy Wright, 22 years old, of Woronoco; Jerry Guilmet, 16, of Westfield; and Russell Fouli, 15, and Audrey Busey, 14, both of Huntington.

title: Canterbury Raises Quinlan Case Issue
description: LONDON, Dec. 13 (AP)Doctors should not administer extraordinary treatment to prolong the lives of the dying, the Archbishop of Canterbury told a medical audience today.

title: Basketball Player in Peril With a Severe Infection
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 13 (AP)A physician said today that a hospitalized basketball player of Memphis State University, John Gunn, was not out of danger from a rare combination of ailments. Gunn has been in the intensivecare unit of Baptist Hospital since Saturday, when he was admitted with a temperature of 105 degrees.

title: Jets Aides Backing Michaels for Coach
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Dec, 13It was as if the Jets season never happened.

title: Citibank Buying Buildings to Keep Sex Shops Away From Its Offices
description: For the last two years, Citibank has been buying up buildings on East 53d Street, across from its new $175 million headquarters, to eliminate massage parlors and prevent construction that might lessen the value of the building.

title: East German Chief in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 13 (UPI)Erich Honecker, the East German Communist leader, arrived in Moscow today. for a brief visit. Tass, the official press agency said the visitor was greeted by the Soviet Communist leader, Leonid I. Brezhnev, President Nikolai V. Podgorny and Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko.

title: OFFSHORE OIL SEEN CUTTING U.S. RELIANCE ON IMPORTS
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass,, Dec. 13 (AP)Recovering offshore oil that lies beneath the coasts of the United States could reduce the nation's dependence on imported petroleum by 30 percent over the next 10 years, a Federal study says. However, the report, released today, says that if developers run into difficulties, there may only be enough offshore oil to cut American dependence by 10 percent.

title: About New York
description: Even when he puts a pinch of tobacco behind his fuzzy cheek and refers expertly to the racing forms stacked neatly beside his high school history book, the bugboy doesnt look like a 16yearold jockey making one of the hottest debuts in Aqueduct history.

title: Talks in Ballet Musicians Strike Continuing With State Mediation
description: A twohour mediation session yesterday failed to end the strike by union musicians against the New York City Ballet that began Sunday midnight. The dance company has suspended its performances.

title: Market Place
description: At the beginning of this year, investors got what they had prayed for most of this decade: a roaring bull market that surpassed most rallies in modern stock market history.

title: CHRYSLER MAY DROP 2 FULLSIZE CARS
description: DETROIT, Dec. 13Eugene A. Cafiero, president of the Chrysler Corporation, said the auto company might drop its present fullsize Plymouth and Dodge cars after the 1977 model year because of fuel economy standards requiring 1978 models to average 18 miles per gallon.

title: Penn Central's Trading Suspended; 24 Related Stocks Also Halted
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (Reuters)The Securities and Exchange Commission today suspended trading in the Penn Central Transportation Company and 24 related railroad stocks for 10 days.

title: CONCORDE NOISE DECLINES, COMPLAINTS REMAIN HIGH
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (AP)The Concorde supersonic passenger plane protimed less noise than expected in November, but citizen complaints continued at a high level, the Federal Aviation Administration said today.

title: POVERTY AIDES DRAFT A PLAN FOR ECONOMY
description: A citywide conference of 1,500, antipoverty workers yesterday began drafting a master plan for New York City including a proposed state law to require banks to Invest a definite percentage of their funds in housing. It would also call for community corporations to put part of their money into revolving funds for housing rehabilitation.

title: Miracle of Brazil Makes a Staple Scarce
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec. 13Well before dawn the women begin to gather in front of the supermarkets to wait for black beans, a staple of the Brazilian diet that is now acutely scarce.

title: Rainbow Girls Calm After Racial Storm
LAWRENCE P. MARRON
description: Lawrence P. Marron, chairman of the board of the L. P. Marron & Company, a real estate holding concern in Upper Saddle River, N. J., and former president of the Home Oil Company of Passaic, died Sunday in his home in Ridgewood, N. J. He was 66 years old. Mr. Marron, who also had a home in Boca Raton, Fla., is survived by his wife; the former Dorothy Jamin; a brother and two sisters.

title: Notes on People
description: When the new First Family moves into the White House next month, about the only item of furniture from their home in Plains, Ga., that will be taken along is. Rosalynn Carter's sewing machine, according to the future First Lady. In an interview with Barbara Miters to be seen on ABCTV tonight, Mrs. Carter said: I make Amy some things. I don't have time to sew very much, but I always have to have my sewing machine because something always needs fixing. In the same interview, Presidentelect Jimmy Carter said that he and Mrs. Carter Would not move their double bed into the White House, as President and Mrs. Ford did, but would use whatever bed the staff furnished them. Asked whether Mr. Carter had any habits that irritated her, Mrs. Carter replied: He wakes up wide awake, and don't.

title: Bridge:
description: Among the victims of the littleknown young experts competing in the grand nationals at the New York Hilton Hotel Saturday were Marcel Friedmann, Alan Rich, Sudhakar Bhatt, Jay Mechutan and Jack Saltz. This experienced 11thseeded quintet lost by nine international match points in the second round of knockout play to Rick Goldstein, Mitchell Kahn, Peter Doubilet and Jay Colombo.

title: Amusement Park Proposed for W. 50th St.
description: A private developer has propsed to community groups on Manhattan's West Side that he be aliowed to put up a $30 million enclosed amusement park on the site of the old Madison Square Garden.

title: Dance: 7th Christmas Rappins
description: Christmas Rappings is the essential story of the Nativity bawled out by the counterculture, with all of the untidiness that was very likely attendant on the original before history began to tidy things up. Its triumph is in its innocence.

title: Cordero Clinches 1976 Purse MoneyWinning Crown
description: Angel Cordero Jr. who has been campaigning at a whirlwind pace in an effort to capture the year's purse moneywinning title, received just cause yesterday to pull up. The reason He has clinched his goal. The first championship for the Puerto Rican rider became a certainty when Sandy Hawley announced at Toronto's Greenwood track that he planned to hang up his tack for 1976 after the meeting ends today.

title: Proposed Bill Would Be Tougher On Juveniles Who Attack Elderly
description: A bill will be introduced in the next Legislature calling for juveniles as young as 13 years old who are charged with serious assaults on persons over 60 to be processed through the criminal justice system for adults, the chairmen of the New York State Senate's Committee on crime said yesterday.

title: Blast Derails Rhodesian Train
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec.13 (AP)Black nationalist guerrillas have blown up a Rhodesixn railroad track for the third time, derailing a train, security officials said today.

title: Montana Coach Rehired
description: HELENA, Mont., Dec. 13 (AP)Gene Carlson, acting head football coach of the University of Montana since July, will get another season to prove his worth. The State Board of Regents approved rehiring Carlson today for a oneyear contract of $20,000.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article in The Times Sunday reported incorrectly that Representative Bella S. Abzug failed to win a single white Assembly district in the city in the September senatorial primary. In fact, Mrs. Abzug did carry several predominantly white districts.

title: Jury Is Getting the Hochberg Case On Job Offer to Primary Opponent
description: ALBANY (AP) Dec 13The bribery and conspiracy trial of the chairman of the State Assembly Ethics Committee hangs on an ethical question: Did the chairman, Assemblyman Alan Hochberg, try to buy off a protential primary opponent or did he simply attempt to create a legitimate political alliance.

title: S. Carolina Routed by Kentucky
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Dec. 13 (AP)Jack Givens poured in 28 points and Mike Phillips added 23 to pace thirdranked Kentucky to a 9867 rout of South Carolina tonight.

title: Standoff in Portugal
description: Prime Minister Mrio Soares has claimed a Socialist victory in Portugal's local elections; and his party did lead the field comfortably for the fourth straight ballot test since the overthrow of authoritarian rule in 1974. But the Socialists dipped slightly under their showing in parliamentary elections of last April, while the Communists rebounded into third place, thus remaining a force capable of harassing a minority Government in a country buffeted by inflation and high unemployment.

title: JAMES A. KING
description: James A. King of Orleans, Mass., retired president of the Ames Shower Curtain Company of New York City, died suddenly, Dec. 4, in St. Petersburg, Fla., where he also had a home. His age was 65. He is survived by his wife, the former Virginia Rock; two sons, James A. and Stephen M; three grandchildren, and two brothers.

title: Giants Still Uncertain On McVav's Future
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., Dec. 13In John McVay's office, the once and possibly future coach was meeting with Giants officials. In the room were Andy Robustelli, the team's director of operations; Wellington Mara, the president, and Tim Mara, the vice president and with his mothers stock, 51 percent owner of the National Football League franchise.

title: SchwarzKrosnick Team Wins
description: Bob Schwarz and Andy Krosnick of Far Rockaway, Queens, have won the final of the American Paddleball AssociationSportscraft open national doubles, onewall paddleball championship at Queensboro Community College. They downed Howie Solomon of Brooklyn and John Faber of Cliffside Park, N.J., 2116, 1121, 2112, in the A division final Sunday.

title: DR. AUGUSTUS HARRIS
description: Dr. Augustus L. Harris, a former professor and president of the alumni association of the Long Island College of Medicine, died Sunday at his home on Hilltop Avenue in Essex, Cann. He was 86 years old.

title: SAMOANS IN DEBATE AS HOME RULE NEARS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. I2American Samoa is moving toward home rule on the strength of a plebiscite favoring election of a nativeborn governor next year. But the ghift causing some friction with United States officials.

title: Books of The Times
description: TALKING WOMAN. by Shana Alexander. 271 pages. Delacorte. $8.95.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article in The Times Sunday reported incorrectly that Representative Bella S. Abzug failed to win a single white Assembly district in the city in the September senatorial primary. In fact, Mrs. Abzug did carry several predominantly white districts.

title: Companies List Sales and Earnings Reports
description: COMPANY REPORTS

title: BENDIX CHIEF SEEN AS CARTER'S CHOICE TO HEAD TREASURY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13Presidentelect Jimmy Carter will name W. Michael Blumenthal, 50yearold chairman and chief executive officer of the Bendix Corporation, to be the next Secretary of the Treasury, according to sources in the Carter camp.

title: Building an Administration
description: The story is told that in November 1960, Presidentelect Kennedy held a long session with close aides in which they went over lists of names for various jobs and considered the pro's and con'smostly con's, it seemedof appointing particular persons. Mr. Kennedy concluded the meeting and, shaking his head wearily, said, I thought at least this part of it would be fun.

title: Troopers Hold 2 on Drug Charge
description: BORDENTOWN, N..J., Dec. 13 (AP) Two Missouri men were arrested here today when two pounds of marijuana were found in their car, the police said The two, Stanley Rowlison, 29 years old and James Dray, 24, both of Columbia Mo.. were held on charges of possessior of drugs. The state police stopped theit car on Route 206 to make a routine motor vehicle check and found the marijuana, some LSD and hashish, the police said.

title: 2 Top Rookies Honored
description: Jerry Pate, winner of the United States Open, was honored yesterday as rookie of the year in golf and Billy Martin as rookie of the year in tennis. The designations were announced by two sister publications, Golf Digest and Tennis, at a luncheon at the 21 Club.

title: Misconception Is Cited On Home Appraisals
description: According to Bernard Barnett of the Seidman & Seidman accounting firm, many homeowners have the misconception that they must have their property appraised by Dec. 31 because Of recent changes in estate tax law.

title: Rangers vs. Islanders: Pride, Points at Stake
description: The Rangers are coming! The Rangers are coming! ... to Nassau Coliseum tonight where ... the Islanders are waiting! The Islanders are waiting!

title: Executive CrashLands Airplane Near Apartments in Massachusetts
description: FRAMINCHAM. Mass., Dec. 13 (AP)A vice president of The New York Times Corporation crashlanded a small plane, on which his wife was a passenrer. in the recreation area of a large apartment complex here yesterday.

title: Garden Doubleheader Features Duke Five
description: Duke, which is off to a surprisingly strong start with five victories in six games, will play Connecticut in the first game of tonight's college basketball doubleheader at Madison Square Gerden. Fordham, which lost to Kansas last Thursday at the Garden, will play Brown in the second game.

title: Carter News Parley Live on TV and Radio
description: Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's news conference this afternoon will be broadcast live by two television networks, CBS and ABC, starting at 2:30 P.M.

title: FRIEDGOODTRIAL DEFENSE REBUTTED OVER PHONE CALL
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec. 13 (UPI).A New York Telephone Company representative testified today at the murder trial of Dr. Charles E. Friedgood that there was no record of a phone call said to have been placed to the physician's home hours befor his wife was found dead, allegedly of a drug injection,

title: HEAD OF OPEC CALLS TWOSTEP PRICE RISE POSSIBLE SCENARIO
description: DOHA, Qatar, Dec. 13As oil ministers of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries began arriving today for the crucial pricesetting conference to open here Wednesday, Mohammed Sadli, OPEC's president, said that one possible scenario for OPEC would be to declare a small price increase at the conference and a larger one later.

title: Bombay Stumbleson Leap Into 20th Century
description: BOMBAY, India, Dec. 9Residents of this rapidly growing tropical seaport are engaged in a public debate about the uncertain future of their city.

title: President Accepts the Resignation Of Four Administration Members
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (AP)President Ford announced today the resignation of four members of his Administration, including Frank G. Zarb, as head of the Federal Energy Administration.

title: 3 Dead as Shooting Flare's At CubanHaitian Soccer
description: PORTAUPRINCE, Haiti, Dec. 13 (AP) Authorities acknowledged today that at least three persons were killed near the end of a I1 soccer tie between Cuba and Haiti here two days ago.

title: 2 NursingHome Owners Indicted
description: The indictments of two nursinghome ownersone in Brooklyn and the other in Rochesteron charges that they defrauded thousands of dollars from New York State's Medicaid program were announced yesterday by the state's special nursinghome prosecutor, Charles J. Hynes.

title: Article 6  No Title
Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Arafat is Reportedly Advised To Win U.S.Over by Moderation
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 13The Palestine Liberation Organization has been advised by traditional allies in Eastern Europe to adopt a moderate policy to insure support and recognition by the United States.

title: Clinically Dead Child Dies
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 13 (UPI)  An 18monthold boy, declared clinically dead last Friday but kept breathing by a respirator pending a court hearing, died today at Loyola University's Medical Center. The hospital director, John Imirie Jr. said that the child, Andrew Michael Murphy, died at 8:45 A.M. in the pediatric intensive care unit. The case was believed to have been the first in Illinois in which a court had been asked to offer a legal definition of death beyond the interpretation that life stops when the heartbeat ceases.

title: 5 PLYWOOD MAKERS FOUND TO RIG PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (UPI)  A Federal Trade Commission judge ruled today that five big plywood manufacturers kept their prices artificially high, causing home builders to pay more than they should have for the products.

title: Most of Concerns Plan Appeals
description: All except one of the companies named in the plywood price ruling by an F.T.E. administrative law judge said yesterday that they planned to appeal the decision. The lone exception was Willamette Industries.

title: Nugget and Piston Coaches Engaged in a Family Fight
description: When the Detroit Pistons play at Denver against the Nuggets on Dec. 30, Larry Brown, who coaches the Nuggets, and his older brother, Herb, who coaches the Pistons, will make National Basketball Association history. The game will mark the first time that brothers have coached against each other in the N.B.A. The Nuggets are currently the Midwest Division leaders, and the Pistons are second, three games behind.

title: Court Papers Filed By Sindona in Fight To Bar Extradition
description: Michele Sindona, the Italian financier facing extradition, accused the Italian Government here yesterday of political persecution and argued in papers filed with the Manhattan Federal Court that his life would be in serious danger if he were forced to return to Italy.

title: COMPANY TAX DEDUCTIONS CLAIM MILLIONS IN STUDY
description: ALBANY, Dec. 13A yearold investigation into corporate tax deductions that were taken for illegal bribes and kickbacks to foreign officials has netted New York State millions of dollars, James H. Tully Jr., commissioner of taxation and finance, said today.

title: GEN. ALBERT D. COOLEY
description: CORONADO, Calif., Dec. 13 (AP)Marine Lieut. Gen. Albert D. Cooley, retired, who was commanding general of the First Marine Aircraft Wing in the Korean war, died Saturday. He was 76 years old.

title: Taxes &
description: If Presidentelect Jimmy Carter has any leftover job seekers, he might send them to Marshall S. Armstrong. Practicing public accountants would be preferred.

title: Customs Strike Speeds Up Orly
description: PARIS, Dec. 13, (UPI)  Passengers leaving or arriving at Orly Airport went through customs with their luggage un inspected today because of a 24hour strike of customs employes.

title: At Melba Moore's Met Concert, Show and Gospel Music Coexist
description: Melba Moore's concert at the Metropolitan Opera House on Sunday was a lavishly stylish affair, with animationlike visual effects on a screen and resourceful lighting changes complementing the music's moods. And it offered some hope that Miss Moore may yet overcome her schizoid musical personality and forge a really coherent style.

title: MANSFIELD ASKS REMOVAL OF ATOM ARMS IN KOREA
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (UPI)Mike Mansfield, who is retiring as the Senate Democratic leader, urged today that the United States withdraw its nuclear weapons from South Korea and reduce its forces there, and move toward diplomatic recognition of Vietnam, Cambodia and China.

title: City May Set Up Rules
description: New York City is considering possible regulations that would make menus more truthful in describing food served, according to Elinor C. Gueeenheimer. Commissioner of Consumer Affairs.

title: About New York
description: Even when he puts a pinch of tobacco behind his fuzzy cheek and refers expertly to the racing forms stacked neatly beside his high school history book, the bugboy doesn't look like a 16yearold jockey making one of the hottest debuts in Aqueduct history.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Monday.

title: Thomas E. Mullaney
description: MEXICO CITY  A young woman running the carrental desk in a luxury hotel here was writing a letter to pass the time one recent morning. It was quite obvious that business was not booming. I have not rented a single car today, and it is now after 11 o'clock, she lamented. This is crazy. Prices are too high for Mexicans, and there are not enough tourists. Our prices were raised four times since the first devaluation of the peso on Aug. 31. Before the price started to go up we charged 145 pesos a day basic rate for a Volkswagen, and now our rate is 217 a day.

title: WHITE HOUSE SAYS LAWYER CALLED ON AGNEW PARDON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (UPI)  The White House said today that a lawyer had called recently to talk about a pardon for former Vice President Spiro T. Agnew and had been told to get in touch with the Justice Department.

title: Mailer's Poetry Reading at the Y Rated A for Effort, X for Content
description: Norman Mailer, whose causes are celebrated and whose effects are sometimes deplored, treated an audience at the East 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. last night to an exhibition of himself.

title: King Says Ali Agrees to Fight Foreman Next
description: Herbert Muhammad, manager of Muhammad Ali, has given Don King, the promoter. 90 days to raise the money for an AliGeorge Foreman fight, and Ali has agreed to the fight as his next bout, King said yesterday.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Rite Scheduled for Mrs. Lytle Hull
description: A memorial service for Mrs. Lytle Hull, philanthropist and cultural figure who died Saturday at the age, of 83, will be held at 2:30 P.M. Sunday at the Episcopal Church of the Messiah in Rhinebeck, N.Y. Mrs. Hull, the former wire of Vincent Astor, son of John Jacob Astor 4th, was a founder and supporter of several of New York City's leading musical institutions.

title: HAIG AIDE IS NAMED CHIEF AT WEST POINT
description: WEST POINT, Dec. 13Brig. Gen. John C. Bard today was named today commandant of cadets at the United States Military Academy, where he once held the rank of first captain, or top cadet.

title: Parole Officer Slain In E. 42d St. Lobby
description: A parole officer was shot to death yesterday in the lobby of an office building on 42d Street, near Fifth Avenue, allegedly by a man he had tried to arrest for a parole violation.

title: Every U.N. Delegation Needs Poet, Poet Says
description: UNITED NATIONS, Dec. 13 (Reuters) Frederika Blankner, an American poet, proposed here today that every United Nations delegation include a poet.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Dec. 13Chilled but unbowed, small bands of demonstrators took their causes and concerns to the steps of the State House today, declaiming for and against the Equal Rights Amendment, for an antiabortion human life amendment and against capital punishmentall issues before the State Legislature.

title: Friedman, in Nobel Lecture, Challenges a Tradition
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 13Dr. Milton Friedman, the jaunty, pugnacious, Nobel Prizewinning economist, sought today to gently demolish a traditional economic theory by asserting that high inflation in the 1970's was tied to high unemployment rather than low unemolovment.

title: Go Civilian or Go Broke
description: There is no viable economic prospect for the United States with continued inflationunemployment stagnation. Only conversion of our finite technology and capital resources from military to civilian priorities can reverse this decay.
