description: Keeping warm and sexy at the same time takes knowhow. John Kloss knows how. His scqopy gown with drop waistline. Terra cotta or sage green brushed nylon.19.00. His fleecy cardigan coat to button high or plunge low. Terra cotta or aqua acetateand nylon. 46.00. John Kloss for Cira...sizes P.S.M. Designer Sleepwear, Lingerie Level. New York and all fashion branches.

title: Taxicab Fleets Want 13% Rise With Union Pact
description: The city's taxicab fleet owners said yesterday they would seek a 13 percent fare increase to meet higher operating expenses and increased labor costs resulting from a new union agreement.

title: Article 2  No Title
Article 4  No Title
Witness in the CarterArtis Trial Differs With Others
description: PATERSON, N.J., Dec. 13A young man who never testified before in any proceeding involving the triplemurder charges against Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis testified today that he saw two men running from the direction of the Lafayette Grill on the morning of the shootings there.

title: Buffalo to Be Site of Pageant
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 13 (AP)Buffalo will he the new home of the Miss New York .States Pageant beginning in 1977, William Califari, national field director for the Miss America Pageant, announced today.

title: A Jamaican Candidate Is Shot as a Violent Campaign Nears Its End
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, Dec.13 (AP)Onc candidate in Jamaica's national elections was shot and seriously wounded today and the campaign aide of another was critically injured in a machete attack, the police reported.

title: Saudi Asks Differential Accord
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 13 (AP)Saudi Arabia has threatened to stop supporting the pricing system of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries because other countries cut prices as they wish, the Middle East Economic Survey reported today.

title: SUPREME COURT BARS NEW HEARING ON RAY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (AP)The Supreme Court today refused to review James Earl Ray's unsuccessful attempts to withdraw his guilty plea in the assassination of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: Rhodesia Talks to Adjourn Today
description: GENEVA, Dec. 13The conference on the future of Rhodesia is due to adjourn tomorrow until late in January to give time for diplomatic efforts to resolve the deadlock between the white Rhodesian Government and four black nationalist factions.

title: Chris Evert Named Top Athlete of Year
description: Jugt eight days before her 22d birthday, Chris Evert was honored yesterday by Sports Illustrated magazine as its top athlete of the year. Miss Evert, who won $375,000 while dominating women's tennis, is only the second woman to receive the award. Billie Jean King shared it with Coach John Wooden of the University of California, Los Angeles, in 1972.

title: Jets Beat Czechoslovakia
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Dec. 13The Winnipeg Jets of the World Hockey Association overcame a 40 deficit with six goals in the third period yesterday and defeated an allstar Czechoslovak hockey team, 65. It was the first game of a sixcity tour of Canada and the United States for the Czechoslovaks.

title: Advertising
description: One of the things that advertisers and agencies are talking about these daysand they do do a lot of talkingis the practicability of a fourth television network.

title: EXNEW YORKERS AID NEEDIEST CASES FUND
description: Typical of many New Yorkers who have moved elsewhere after retiring, Robert Schwartz still recalls with a warm feeling his life in the Big Apple. Mr. Schwartz, now living with his wife, Janet, in Hallandale, Fla., sent a check for $15 that was received yesterday by the 65th annual appeai of the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Giving Mr. Scrooge A Chance
description: Quick before the annual imposition of universal good will toward all creatures, I rush to seize this last opportunity to offer the following selective compendium of people and practices toward whom or which I bear unmitigated ill will:

title: Israeli Minister Expects Progress With Arabs in 77
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13A top Israeli leader predicted today that there would be meaningful negotiations in the second half of next year between Israel and its Arab neighbors for agreements short of a comprehensive settlement.

title: Yields on Treasury Bills Decline
Big Board Seat Price Up $7,000
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday the sale of a membership seat for $75,000, up $7,000 from the last sale on Dec. 10. Seats are now, quoted at $62,000 bid and $85,000 asked.

title: Dollar, Pound Rise Moderately
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 13 (UPI)The dollar and the British pound staged a moderate recovery today on European money markets. Gold fell under the influence of selling from the Far East and some profit taking.

title: Louisville Teachers Accept Pact; TwoWeek Strike Ending Today
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 13 (AP)The Jefferson County Teachers Association voted today to end a strike that has closed schools for 118,000 students since Nov. 30. The teachers approved overwhelmingly by voice vote an agreement reached earlier in the day.

title: East Europe Also to Face Soviet Oil Price Rise
description: VIENNA, Dec. 13The Soviet Union has indicated it may increase the price for its oil supplies to its allies at the latest one year after the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries has made a decision on its price policy.

title: People and Business
description: Eberle Is Resigning as President Of Vehicle Manufacturers Group

title: Housewarming, Too Big for the House, Overflows at the Carlyle
description: A lot of people have housewarmings and there is no reason for the rich to be penalized just because some of them live in hotels. So, the other night, Joanne Toor Cummings had a hotel warming.

title: Deaths
description: ACHAnna Dorothea, on Dec. 13, 1976, loving cousin of Elizabeth Mooyer and Evelyn Hylton. Reposing al Leo F. Kearns Funeral Home, 10333 Lefferts Blvd., Richmond Hill. Service Wed. 1 P.M. Funeral to follow with interment at Lutheran Cemetery.

title: No Reaction From Gilmore
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 13 (UPI)Gary Gilmore showed no real reaction when informed of the high court's decision by the Utah State Prison Warden, Sam Smith. However, Mr. Gilmore's lawyer, Robert Moody, said It's what he wanted. I think hel'll be happy about it.

title: Museum for Pershing Planned in Missouri
description: LACLEDE, Mo., Dec. 13 (AP)A $3 million museum honoring General of the Armies John J. Pershing, World War I hero, will be built in this sixstar general, will be built in this nortbcentral Missouri community where he was born.

title: Carter to Name 2 Appointees Today And Probably 2 More on Thursday
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 13After meeting with several potential appointees, including a Federal judge who has played a major role in the Southern civil rights movement, Presidentelect Jimmy Carter made plans here today to disclose this week the names of four members of his Cabinet.

title: Council Committee Votes 4 Bills to Clean Up Lots And Streets in New York
description: Four bills aimed at cleaning up city streets and empty lots by increasing penalties were voted out yesterday by the New York City Council's Environmental Protection Committee.

title: Cocoa Futures Drop Sharply on Rumors On Ghana Purchase
description: Amid rumors that Ghana purchased more cocoa beans last week than antici pated from its farmers, cocoa futures dropped sharply yesterday on the New York Cocoa Exchange. The March 1977 contract. closed at $1.37 85/100 a pound, down 4 cents a pound from Friday's close. This is the maximum allowable drop for a session.

title: PATRICK J. LINEHAN
description: Patrick J. Linehan, an aide to City Council President Paul O'Dwyer, died yesterday on his way to City Hall from his home, 1 105th Street, Rockaway Park, Queens. His age was 77.

title: HIGH COURT ENDS STAY ON GILMORE'S APPEAL
Barry Gray Resigns From WMCA; Failure to Reveal Free Trips Cited
description: Barry Gray, who had become a fixture of late night radio in New York with a talk show on WMCA that began in 1950, resigned from the station yesterday. He had been suspended three weeks ago amid unclear circumstances.

title: GOVERNMENT PARTY EMERGES AS WINNER IN PORTUGAL VOTING
description: LISBON, Dec. 13Portugal's voters gave the minority Socialist Party Government a qualified vote of confidence in the local elections held yesterday, averting a crisis for this young democracy.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: New Jersey will receive $57.1 million In Federal grants to help reduce the state's high unemployment, Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., Democrat of Bedminster, disclosed yesterday. Senator Williams said the Labor Department would announce the grants officially today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The chief counsel to the New Jersey State Legislature and the State Attorney General agreed today that Senate president Matthew Feldman was innocent of any frnudulent, dishonest or corrupt conduct when he paid money to a restaurantchain executive in 1974 and 1975 to wIn an exclusive liquor contract for his family's business.

title: Supreme Court: Actions Taken
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Finding a Job for Schlesinger
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13In the game of musical chairs that Presidentelect Jimmy Carter sometimes seems to be playing in forming his Cabinet, no one is proving harder to seat than James R. Schlesinger, the former Secretary of Defense in a Republican Administration. Mr. Carter has left no doubt that he has been greatly impressed by the professorial, pipesmoking Mr. Schlesinger and would like him in the Cabinet.

title: Reactor Engineer Says Nuclear Agency Violated Public's Trust on Safety
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (UPI)The Nuclear Regulatory Commission has violated its public trust and covered up potentially dangerous nuclear ,plant conditions, a former employee said today.

title: Quebec Chief and Trudeau Clash Over Independence for Province
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 13Premier Rend Levesque of Quebec declared here today that the trend toward independence of his Frenchspeaking province appears to be irreversible but Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau rejected such a development.

title: Article 1  No Title
Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Grumman Corporation announced a new sevenyear $160 million financing agreement with a group of nine United States banks that will replace the Bethpage. LI., company's $200 million line of commercial credit established in October 1974.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

title: MORE COMMERCIAL BANKS CUT PRIME RATES TO 6%
description: Several more major coMmercial banks lowered their prime rates yesterday to 6 percent, and the First National Bank of Chicago, which had moved to that level on Nov. 23, kept its rate unchanged. As a result, the Morgan Guaranty Trust Com pany continued as the only large bank posting a 6 percent minimum borrowing rate.

title: Amina Myers Offers Some Original Songs
description: Amina Claudine Myers played piano solos that were more than creditable on one or two albums from the Chicago jazz avantgarde of the early 1970's, but these solos left the listener absolutely unprepared for the music she brought to New York Sunday. in an afternoon performance at Jazzmania, Miss Myers sang original songs with strong, gripping bides in a substantial. absolutely unaffected voice, and she played in a manner that fused the gospelrelated neobop of pianists such as Horace Silver with a more contemporary rumbleandcrash approach.

title: Consumer Agency Warns of Sales Of Candles With LeadCore Wicks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (UPI)The Consumer Product Safety Commission issued a warning today that some candles were being sold with leadcore wicks, primarily in votive lights used in churches.

title: Hempstead Presiding Supervisor To Seek County Executive Post
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec. 13Francis T. Purcell, the Presiding Supervisor of the Town of Hempstead, announced today that he would seek the nomination as the Republican candidate for Nassau County Executive next year.

title: Catholic Agency Linked to U.S. Military in Vietnam
description: A prominent Roman Catholic newspaper has renewed charges that the United States military entered into widespread collusion with Catholic Relief Services during the Vietnam war.

title: California Seeks Second Suspect In Discovery of Weapons Caches
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 13 (UPI)A second suspect was sought today in an investigation of illegal arsenals found at several places in Los Angeles and San Bernardino Counties.

title: Coast Detective Sniffs Out Fraud On Finest Menus
description: LOS ANGELESDale Reeves crosses the starstudded sidewalk and passes through the portals of a worldfamous Hollywood restaurant where the maitre d'hotel seats him in one of the comfortable padded booths. The light is subdued, but Mr. Reeves notes that across the room a wellknown, local newscaster, accompanied by two very attractive women, is paying his bill. Upon questioning, the waiter casually mentions that Dick Clark, Lorne Greene and Rock Hudson have recently enjoyed dinners at the restaurant.

title: Taxicab Fleets Want 13% Rise With Union Pact
description: The city's taxicab fleet owners said yesterday they would seek a 13 percent fare increase to meet higher operating expenses and increased labor costs resulting from a new union agreement.

title: Panama Canal Talks Resuming
description: PANAMA, Dec. 13 (Reuters)United States special envoy Ellsworth Bunker arrived here today to renew negotiations on the Panama Canal treaty. Officials said his talks with Foreign Minister Aquilino Boyd, which open tomorrow on the island of Contadora, 50 miles south of Panama, were expected to last about a week.

title: U.S. Bars Linking of Concessions At Paris to Moderation by OPEC
description: PARIS, Dec. 13 A State Department cablegram leaked to the press in the Netherlands apparently explains some of the background behind changing positions of industrialized countries in global economic negotiations with developing countries and the relationship between the socalled richpoor dialogue and impending oil price increases.

title: How Twins Came to Prey on Aged
description: In 1964, when he was 7 years old and enrolled in the first grade at Public School 170 in Manhattan, Ronald Timmons was described as having never caused any troublegood, and fairly interested.

title: BENDIX CHIEF SEEN AS CARTER'S CHOICE TO HEAD TREASURY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13Presidenterect Jimmy Carter will name W. Michael Blumenthal, 50yearold chairman and chief executive officer of the Bendix Corporation, to be the next Secretary of the Treasury, according to sources in the Carter camp.

title: The U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: WIDENING DECREASE IN PRIME RATE AIDS DOW'S RISE OF 1.09
description: The stock market advanced for the fourth session in a row yesterday as investors, encouraged by a spreading reduction in the prime lending rate, stepped up buying.

title: But Why Am I Telling You All This? Or, Playwrights Hobble on Crutches
description: I keep a little notebookoh, why do I lie about it? I keep a mess of yellow sheets buried under old programs in a file drawer and I've just cracked a fingernail trying to wrench a handful of them loosehaving to do with language in the theater. That is to say, wnenever i near something spoken on stage that unsettles my ear and sets me to wondering what on earth an actor could possibly do with it short of mailing it back to the author, I jot it clown. The practice of jotting it down enables me to empty my head of it and refocus my attention on the play proper, often a serious mistake.

title: Parole Officer Slain In E. 42d St. Lobby
description: A parole officer was shot to death yesterday in the lobby of an office building on 42d Street, near Fifth Avenue, allegedly by a man he had tried to arrest for a parole violation.

title: FRANCESCO MERLI
description: MILAN, Italy, Dec. 13 (UPI)Francesco Merli, 90, a tenor who sang in Italian operatic productions until the age of 84, died Saturday night. Mr. Merli, who sang at Milan's La Scala, in Verona, and at Rome's Baths of Caracalla, last was on stage in a production of Othello in Rome six years ago.

title: Playoff Berth Wasn't in the Cards For a Most Deserving N.F.L. Team
description: Within the terms of comparative players at a majority of positions and every important statistic save one, the St. Louis Cardinals had a football team this season superior to the Washington Redskins. But the Redskins are in the playoffs. and the Cardinals are not. How come? Although both had identical won  lost records, 10  4, Washington beat St. Louis twice and that statistic broke the tie. Simple.

title: Belgrade Asked to Clarify Aide's Charge That Nixon Bathed Croatian Dissent
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13The State Department has demanded an explanation from Yugoslavia of accusations by a senior Belgrade official against former President Richard M. Nixon, a department spokesman said today.

title: Labor Leader Says Economy Needs Permanent Tax Cut of $25 Billion
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13Lane Kirk. land, the secretarytreasurer of the A.F.L.C.I.O., said today that the economy needs a permanent tax cut of at least $25 billion, plus additional Government spending to deal with problems such as unemployment in construction and among urban black youths.

title: New York Port Getting a Cruise To Lima, Peru
description: The port of New York got a vote of confidence yesterday from a West Coast steamship line when Sitmar Cruises announced that it would begin cruise service from New York harbor to South America.

title: Masonic Club Girls Calm in Bias Victory
description: INDIANOLA, Iowa, Dec. 12Things were back as close to normal today as they are likely to be for the Rainbow girls in Indianola.

title: Ballet Theater Joins Met Booking
description: The Metropolitan Opera and American Ballet Theater will jointly present Ballet Theater eightweek spring season April 18June 4 at the Metropolitan Opera House under a new arrangement that begins the opera associations attempt to book its own house without an outside impresario as a middleman.

title: Friedman, in Nobel Lecture, Challenges a Tradition
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 13Dr. Milton Friedman, the jaunty, pugnacious, Nobel Prizewinning economist, sought today to gently demolish a traditional economic theory by asserting that high inflation in the 1970's was tied to high unemployment rather than low unemployment.

title: Israeli Once Nominated For High Bank Position Is Indicted on Bribery
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 13The man who was nominated in September to head the state Bank of Israel was  indicted here today on eight counts of bribery and fraud.

title: TV: Barbra Streisand, Jon Peters and the Carters Are on the Barbara Walters Special Tonight
description: If the contemporary addiction to trivia and gossip tend to leave you feeling left out of the bustling mainstream, watch tonights The Barbara Walters Special on ABC at 10 and experience the thrill of total isolation. Smartly produced by Lucy Jarvis and elegantly presided over by Miss Walters, the hour offers an updated version of Edward R. Murrow' s Person to Person format in which celebrities are interviewed in their natural habitats. This evening the prominent couples are, in order of appearance, Barbra Streisand and Jon Peters, her hairdressesproducerlover, and Presidentelect Jimmy Carter and his wife, Rosalynn. In between, Miss Walters allows viewers a glimpse of her own Manhattan digs (I don't own this apartment, I rent it.

title: Wood, Field &
description: A lively, historical approach to Izaak Walton, the 17thcentury English businessmananglerauthor, will be found in izaak WaltonThe Comp!eat Angier and His Turbulent Times, by J. Lawrence Pool and Angeline J. Pool (Stinehour Press).

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: New York Schools Urged to Cut Rents For Community Use
description: An ad hoc committee composed of four New York City Councilmen and two New York State Assemblymen urged the City Board of Education yesterday to let cornmunity groups and nonprofit youth organizations rent space in publicschool buildings at sharply reduced fees.

title: Grace &
description: W. R. Grace & Company announced yesterday that it had acquired Handy City Inc., a privately owned retailer of home improvements, for an undisclosed number of Grace shores. The New York Stock Exchange weekly bulletin of Dec. 3 disclosed, however, that there was a transfer of 440,852 Grade shares for the business of Handy City Inc. At yesterday's closing price of 27 these shares .would have a value of $12.17 million.

title: 33 Years After Allie Sherman, Brooklyn College Surrenders Second Player to Pro Football Ranks
description: Big schools, the socalled football factories like Notre Dame, Texas, Alabama and Ohio State, turn out players who become pros as regularly as McDonald's turns out hamburgers. But it has been 33 years between signings with a pro team by Brooklyn College players.

title: Coast Inmates Riot After Dispute
description: VENTURA, Calif., Dec. 13 (UPI)Fifteen inmates at Ventura County Jail went on a rampage yesterday when two prisoners got into an argument over food, breaking windows, sinks; toilets and tearing up plumbing fixtures. Two prisoners suffered minor bruises and a third was cut on the foot from broken glass. A team of riot police was called in to quell the disturbance that started as the prisoners were being served their meals in a cellblock occupied by about 28 inmates, No force was necessary, a sheriff's spokesman said. Just the presence of the riot squad there was all that was needed.

title: Lebanon Christians Try to Heal Rift
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 13Leaders of the rightwing Christian parties that together battled the leftists and Palestinians in the Lebanese civil war sought today to end the clashes between members of their private militia forces that appeared to threaten their alliance.

title: Princeton Author Is Going South On a 3Month Trip to Antarctic
description: PRINCETON, Dec. 13Charles Neider is the kind of man Robert Benchley would have hated. He gets lots of exercise, which includes riding his threespeed bicycle 20 miles a day, is in excellent physical trim and watches his diet with the dedication of a ballerina.

title: John R. Wilkins, Professor of Law And Former A.I.D. Counsel, Dies
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Dec. 13John R. Wilkins, former general counsel for the United States Agency for International Development and professor emeritus at the University of California's Boalt Hall School of Law, died of cancer here yesterday after a long illness. He was 51 years old.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Court Rules Social Security Aid Need Not Go to Divorced Mothers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13The Supreme Court unanimously ruled today that divorced women can be excluded from a Social Security wife's insurance benefits program for mothers caring for young or disabled children.

title: Longet Evidence Suppressed
description: DENVER, Dec. 13 (AP)The Colorado Supreme Court upheld today the decision of a district court judge to suppress) evidence in the Claudine Longet manslaughter case. Miss Longet, 35 years old, is charged in the shooting death of Vladimir Sabich, a professional skier, last March 21 at the home the two shared at Aspen.

title: Theater: Jean Genet's Balcony Impressively Staged by the CSC
description: The Classic Stage Company, now in its 10th year, came up with something very special at its home, the Abbey Theater, on East 13th Street, on Sunday night. It was the first professional production of Jean Genet's The Balcony in New York for more than a decade. It was last performed in New York by the CircleintheSouere.

title: TRANSATLANTIC AIR FARES TO INCREASE AGAIN IN APRIL
description: GENEVA, Dec. 13 (AP)Passenger fares for most flights across the North Atlantic will increase by 1 to 9 percent starting April 1, 1977, the International Air Transport Association said today.

title: GROUP OF BROOKLYN FIRES RESULT IN DEATH OF BOY, 3
description: A 3yearold boy was burned to death and his mother critically injured from one of nine fires that broke out in Brooklyn between 2 and 4 P.M. yesterday.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Music: Abbey Simon Plays Perfect Chopin
description: Abbey Simon's performances of the 12 Etudes of Chopin's Opus 25 at Carnegie Hall on Monday night were so deft, so subtly inflected with the light and shade of dynamics and tone color, that they alone would have made attendance at Mr. Simon's piano recital rewarding.

title: OilPrice Optimism Lifts Market
description: Investor optimism that oil prices will rise only moderately enabled the stock market to register another gain yesterday. The Dow Jones industrial average climbed 6.39 points to 980.63.

title: Triangles Withdrawn From Team Tennis
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 14 (AP)  Frank Fuhrer, owner of the Pittsburgh Triangles, said today he would dissolve the World Team Tennis franchise for at least a year, not because of financial losses but because he couldn't take the controversies.

title: Poor Visibility May Have Caused Crash Near Cape May Airport
description: LOWER TOWNSHIP, N.J., Dec. 14 (AP)  Poor visibility may have been the cause of the crash of a twinengine commuter airplane Sunday, according to Federal investigators. Two persons died and eight were injured in the crash.

title: Ashe Seems Over Foot Problems
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Dec. 14  How does it feel, Arthur? Dr. Omar Fareed, the physician for the United States Davis Cup team, asked Arthur Ashe today.

title: Hanoi Leaders Vow A Rebuilding Drive
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 14  The first Vietnamese Communist Party congress since 1960 was opened in Hanoi today with the nation's leaders pledging a new direction of development and reconstruction.

title: Credit Lyonnais: New Flight of Francs?
description: PARIS, Dec. 14  One recent morning at dawn, French customs inspectors descended unannounced on the homes of three middlelevel executives of Credit Lyonnais, France's second biggest bank and one that belongs to the state, as do most of the country's other big commercial banks.

title: HalfSpeed Ahead'
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14  During the London blitz in the last World War. there were signs around the nave of Westminster Cathedral that read: In the event of trouble, parishioners will descend to the crypts with all due reverent speed. This also seems to be Jimmy Carter's signpost as he prepares for the troubled future.

title: Study Finds Danger in Surgery Varies Greatly Among Hospitals
description: The quality of hospital care varies so widely that a surgery patient's chances of dying or suffering severe complications can be two and a half times as great at one hospital as at another, according to a major study.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Flu Program in Doubt as Only 15 to 20% of New Yorkers Get Short
description: The head of the New York City's swine flu immunization program said yesterday that if the current low public response to the program continued, as widely predicted, the effort to avert a possible epidemic in the area can be judged as a failure.

title: Intermedia Fun House'
description: Rhys Chatham turned the Experimental Intermedia Foundation, at 224 Centre Street, into something he called a Fun House on Monday evening. It wasn't all fun, but at least it was mtermedia. While Many events at the foundation are in a single medium  music, for the most part, with some video and improvisational theater  Mr. Chatham used lights, recorded sounds, pantomime, dance, video, film, and musicians in the course of the five pieces that made up his Fun House.

title: Wine Talk
description: WHEN WINE people talk of horizontal tasting they mean a tasting of various wines of one vintage: ten 1967 bordeaux, for example, or a dozen 1974 zinfandels. When they speak of vertical tasting, they mean several vintages of the same wine.

title: Burch to Be Ford's Counsel
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP)  President Ford has asked Dean Burch to serve as his private counsel after he leaves office, a White House announcement said today. Mr. Burch will receive and process any offers Mr. Ford receives for jobs or other activities after Jan. 20, the announcement said. Mr. Burch is a cornier chairman of the Republican Party. He served as a White House political adviser to Mr. Ford until December 1974 and later was active in his election campaign.

title: ROBERT A. NUBEL
description: Robert A. Nubel, a stockbroker, died Monday at Pascack Valley (N.J.) Hospital. He was 46 years old and lived Washington Township, N.J.

title: LIEUT. GEN. IVAN BARYSHPOLETS
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 14 (UPI)  The Soviet military paper Krasnaya Zvezdn today announced the death of retired Lieut. Gen. Ivan Baryshpolets.

title: McVay, Parseghian and Nolan
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N. Y., Dec. 14  In retrospect, it's clear now that the New York Giants' front office was hoping that John McVay would convince them he deserved return next season. It was never, Andy Robustelli was saying, a question of let's look for another coach, it was always a question of let's hope John can return. Wellington Mara. the Giants' president, said, Changing coaches the last thing you want to do. But as soon as John McVay was named to succeed Bill Arnsparger when the Giants had a 07 wonlost record, Andy Robustelli's Sports phones started ringing. The call was never of from the guy interested in the job, the Giants' director of operations recalled. It The Times was always from somebody making the call for him, that's the way its done. Even when somebody phoned on behalf of Ara Parseghian, the former Notre Dame coach, Andy Robustelli told him, If it's in reference to the coaching situation, I won't talk about that until after the season. Dick Nolan, once a Giant defensive back and the coach of the San Francisco 49ers for eight seasons until he was dismissed a year ago, phoned Wellington' Mara, but the Giants' president told him the same thing Andy Robustelli told the other applicants.

title: NEWYORK PENALIZED ON FEDERAL PROGRAM
description: New York State was assessed a $2,597,169 Federal penalty yesterday for allegedly slow progress on a program of preventive health care for poor children.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: $30 Million Cuts Proposed to Meet New Y orkTransit Agency Shortage
description: The New York City Transit Authority last evening proposed a new package of cuts in subway and bus services, particulady in the early morning hours, to make up for what it said was an anticipated budget shortfall of $30 million.

title: Chess:
description: International Master Norman Weinstein of Allston, Mass., shared third place in the Lanzarote International Tournament. He and his fellow thirdplace winners, Arturo Pomar, Orestes Rodriguez and Garcia Padron, tallied 65. Second place was taken by the West German grandmaster Klaus Darga, with 71A31,4, and top honors went to Bent Larsen, the Danish grandmaster, who racked up a score of 83.

title: Personal Finance: The I.R.S. and You
description: AS THE tax year draws to close, accountants are trying to read between the lines of Government report that provides new insight into the way the Internal Revenue Service earmarks individual tax returns for audit.

title: TWO SALESMEN SUSPENDED AT SHEARSON HAYDEN FIRM
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission said yesterday that two securities salesmen employed by the brokerage firm of Shearson Hayden Stone, accused of accepting payments to promote the sale of unregistered stock, had agreed to 60day suspension from their firm starting Dec. 27.

title: Firearms Bring Conviction
description: MOUNT HOLLY, N. J., Dec. 14 (AP)  John Tell of Crosswicks, N. J., counselor in Burlington County's methadone program for four and a half years, has been convicted of possessing firearms without a permit and possession of firearms in motor vehicle without a permit. Mr. Tell, 29 years old, faces a maximum sentence of 10 years imprisonment and a fine of $3,000.

title: U.N. Presses Chile To Conduct Inquiry Into Official's Death
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 14  United Nations authorities are pressing the Chilean Government for an investigation into the death of a United Nations official in Santiago last July under what appear to have been suspicious circumstances.

title: Dodge of Dartmouth Wins Vermont 65Gate Slalom
description: KILLINGTON, Vt., Dec. 14 (AP) Peter Dodge of Dartmouth College vlaced first with a time of 111.32 seconds in the 65gate slalom today as the Western Holiday Classic series, major Federation Internationale de Ski competition, opened here. Originally, the event was to have been held at Sun Valley, Idaho, but was moved to Vermont because there wasn't enough snow in Idaho.

title: Columbia Five Is Victor Over Manhattan, 9062
description: Alton Byrd, at 5 feet 8 inches the smallest man on the court for either team, turned out to be the biggest factor in Columbia's 9062 rout of Manhattan before a crowd of 1,750 in the Lions Levien gymnasium last night.

title: That Legendary Christmas Meal
description: THE MOST famous legendary dinner in the world had nothing whatsoever to do with Belshazzar, Trimalchio, Henry VIII or Tom Jones. It is a feast about which one  meaning me  may have two minds, and it is the Christmas dinner indulged in by the Cratchit family in Dickens' A Christmas Carol.

title: Private Lives
description: AND NOW for something completely different. Once upon a time I was a technical public relations man. This means I wrote articles about the products of my clients and placed those articles in trade magazines. Trade magazines couldn't survive without free articles, and a technical public relations man couldn't survive without a book of clippings  cheap publicity  to show his client, and we were all as solvent as we were unnecessary.

title: 3 More New York Investigators To Join Assassination Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP)  Three more homicide investigators from New York City have been selected to participate in the House investigation of the slayings of President Kennedy and the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: Dynamite Leads to Evacuation
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 14 (AP)  The police detoured traffic at several intersections and evacuated 20 homes yesterday after 15 sticks of dynamite and 400 blasting caps were discovered in an unused garage. The explosives were found by the owner of the garage, John Walton, 67 years old, as he was cleaning out three buildings he had rented to Robert Tyler, 60, an explosives expert. Mr. Walton said he had not seen Mr. Tyler for more than two years and decided to clean out his belongings.

title: Pope Paul Denounces Arms Race
description: ROME, Dec. 14Pope Paul VI denounced the arms race today as false and dangerous and said it drained resources for schools, culture, health and civic welfare.

title: Harlem Grocer Charged With Slaying a Customer Who Smashed a Window
description: A Harlem grocer was charged with Murder last night after he allegedly shot and killed a disgruntled customer who had kicked in the store's front window after the grocer refused to sell him beer.

title: PLR'S LEADERSHIP ENDORSES A STATE
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Dec. 14The leaders of the Palestine Liberation Organization for the first time today listed the creation of an independent Palestinian state as one of the legitimate rights of the Palestinian people and hence, by implication, a goal to be attained by the organization.

title: Second Tremor Strikes in Italy
description: RIVA DEL GARDA, Italy, Dec. 14 (AP)  Another tremor, the second in 24 hours. struck the northeast side of Lake Garda today, sending hundreds of people fleeing in panic from their homes. No injuries were reported. Some roofs collapsed in this lake resort and in nearby villages. Walls of some old buildings in Molino di Ledro were cracked. Lake Garda 125 miles southwest of the Friuli region where about 1,000 persons were killed by a strong quake last May.

title: Carey Will Propose Cuts Of Close to $200 Million In Welfare and Medicaid
description: Governor Carey's new budget will propose cuts in state spending for welfare and Medicaid of .between $150 million and .$200 million, Philip L. Toia, the State Social Services Commissioner, said yesterday.

title: Careers
description: Selling business equipment formerly was a man's game but not any more.

title: Saudi Arabia's Oil Minister Urges A 6Month Price Freeze for OPEC
description: DOHA, Qatar, Dec. 14Sheik Ahmed Zaki Yamani of Saudi Arabia arrived here tonight and urged a new sixmonth freeze on oil prices for tomorrow's meeting of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries.

title: Forego Chosen Top Horse 3d Straight Year
description: Mrs. Martha Gerry's Forego, called the greatest horse I have ever ridden by Bill Shoemaker, was named thoroughbred Horse of the Year yesterday for the third straight year in the Eclipse Award poll. The 6yearold gelding won six of eight starts in 1976, despite conceding his handicap rivals huge weight advantages, to become the thirdleading moneywinner in thoroughbred racing history.

title: Rhodesia Parley Off Until Jan. 17; Briton Will Visit Southern Africa
description: GENEVA, Dec. 14Britain adjourned the conference on Rhodesia today to pursue a joint effort with the United States to end the deadlock. Ivor Richard, the presiding officer, scheduled its resumption for Jan. 17.

title: Judge Orders Mayor of Utica To Reinstate Suspended Chief
description: UTICA, N. Y., Dec. 14 (AP)  Mayor Edward Hanna was ordered by a Sate Supreme Court justice today to reinstate, pending a court hearing Dec. 22, Polic,e Chief Bennie Rotunda and five other officers whom the Mayor had suspended.

title: PRESIDENT SUGGESTS FEDERAL PAY RAISES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14  President Ford indicated to Congressional leaders today that he would recommend substaniial pay raises for top Federal officials including members of Congress, provided the raises were coupled with a tighter code of ethics for all branches of Government.

title: TV: An Hour of Beautiful Ballet Tonight
description: WNET/13'S Dance In America series does some peculiar turns of its own tonight at 9 in an hour featuring American Ballet Theater. For one thing, the company's repertory demands more than a single hour for representative sampling. Eugene Loring's Billy the Kid and Frederick Ashton's Les Patineurs, the two ballets chosen for this evening's showcase, are respectable works, but they don't begin to suggest the scope of the company. On top of this, the artistic powers that be decided to impose pointless and thoroughly annoying narration over the performance of Billy the Kid.

title: Patterned Sheets: Where Will It All End?
description: Some years ago, a few avantgarde . decorators and a few creative real people took a second look at patterned sheets  and their prices  and a new decorating concept was born.

title: About Education
description: There was a time when college students looked forward to the semester break in January as a period to get away from campus and books and to head South for a little sun or at least to get home and lounge around the house.

title: Rep. Andrew Young Is Expected To Head U.S. Delegation at U.N.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14Presidentelect Jimmy Carter will nominate Representative Andrew Young, a 44yearold black leader from Georgia, as the chief delegate of the United States to the United Nations, according to authoritative sources.

title: Britain's Trade Deficit Up Sharply
description: LONDON, Dec. 14 (Reuters)  Britain reported a sharp worsening in its monthly trade deficit figures today, providing a grim background for the Government's latest economic austerity package, to be presented in Parliament tomorrow.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: LAST CALL The popular, weekly Interlude hours at 5:45 P.M. end today at Town Hall with a program of exotic heritage from the Middle East, performed by the Ibrahim Farrah Near East Dance Group. Admission is $3 and early arrivals can enjoy a final, preshow drink in the bar  of the lobby at 123 West 43d Street (between Seventh Avenue and Avenue of the Americas).

title: New Classical Records: A Fine Crop
description: New classical records appear in profuse quantities at this time of yearevery label, it seems, reserves its most distinctive issues for the holiday season to tempt collectors and giftgivers alike. The following list surveys a selection from the most notable new releases, some of them valuable works never recorded before, others excellent fresh versions of old favorites. All are highly recommended for giving or receiving.

title: Ford Donates Papers For Michigan Display
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP) President Ford has donated the papers and historical material of his 28 years in public life to the Federal Government for preservation in the state of Michigan, the White House announced today.

title: Application for Increase in Rates By Phone Company Is Rejected
description: The Public Service Commission yesterday rejected the application by the New York Telephone Company for a $393 million rate increase.

title: Dr. Donald H. Menzel of Harvard, Authority on the Sun and Its Corona
description: Dr. Donald H. Menzel, former director of the Harvard College Observatory and one of the world's leading authorities on the sun and its corona, died yesterday at Massachusetts General Hospital after long illness. He was 75 years old and lived in Cambridge.

title: Child's World
description: WE were two 10yearolds, sprawled out on the floor of a cold attic, trying with all the concentration we Could muster to put together that crystal radio: It seemed simple enough, although the instructions were difficult. Finally, after much fumbling and bickering, we were done! But, except for some flickering static, the thing was silent. Our confidence seeped away. We . started over.

title: In Defense'of Rich Foods:The Claiborne Formula
description: ANYONE WHO can afford it can dine well  eat off the fat of the land, to put it another way  without special diets, without feelings of anxiety and guilt and without the artificial concoctions promoted by fright merchants who inveigh against the foods that have nourished this country for two centuries.

title: Argentine Labor Benefits Voided
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 13 (UPI) The military Government moved to weaken Argentina's powerful labor unions today by nullifying a wide range of benefits for more than 400,000 workers in stateowned enterprises granted by the ousted administration of President Isabel Martinez de Peron.

title: Which Reds Under Whose Beds?; FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: LONDON In Britain's complicated but curiously workable democracy wide spectrum of opinion is represented although two major parties, Labor (which runs the present Government by the skin of its teeth) and Conservative, dominate. And even these two represent coalitions of political opinion ranging from center to far left among Laborites and from far right to center among Tories.

title: Queens Residents Block the Shift of Fire Rescue Unit
Hillcrest, a Rural Care Center, Its Children Gone, s Up for Sale
description: BEDFORD, N.Y. The 18 buildings on the 169acre Hillcrest campus that was school and home for neglected children from New York City are empty.

title: New Cabinet Choices . .
description: In selecting W. Michael Blumenthal, chairman of the Bendix Corporation, as his Secretary of the Treasury, Presidentelect Carter has made an interesting and somewhat unconventional choice.

title: Recital: Tazaki Piano Does Rochberg Proud
description: THE PROBLEM of any artist how to embrace tradition without being crushed to death by it. George Rochberg .is a composer who has been snuggling up to the past with considerable success in the last decade, trying to avoid the romance that most of his contemporaries have been carrying on with doctrinaire Serialism and other styles that stress the break betwen this century and previous ones.

He replaces Yakov A. Malik, who has returned to Moscow to serve as a Deputy Foreign Minister.

title: Notes on People
description: John Portman, probably the nation's bestknown designer of spectacular hotels, has been chosen as architect for the $50 million first phase of hotel development plans on Atlantic City property acquired by Resorts International Inc. His appointment to the project will be formally announced tomorrow. Mr. Portman, who has been hailed for his complex, often stunning use of spaces in hotel design, was the architect for two muchadmired Atlanta hotels, the Peachtree Plaza, and the Hyatt Regency, which has a central atrium and glass elevators. The hotel he'll be worklog on in Atlantic City is expected to be the first to be built there since New Jersey voted in the November election to legalize casino gambling in the resort city.

title: A Wig, A Wig, For Mary Hartman
description: I don't know if you, uh, know but the people at Alvah Hair Creations have come out with a new wig that reminds me of myself, Mary Hartman. It's made of Monsanto modacrylic fiber and it's incredible, I mean, it is really incredible how much like real hair looks. I am saving a lock of it for Heather's kids so that they'll know what real modacrylic is, in case we're using the synthetic by then.

title: Truce Group Meets In Lebanon on Issue Of Heavy Weapons
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 14A special Arab truce supervisory committee held its first meeting today under President Elia's Sarkis and took up a dispute over the collection of heavy weapons from the rival Lebanese factions and from Palestinian guerrillas.

title: Bunker in Panama
description: PANAMA. Dec. 14 (UPI)  Ellsworth Bunker, a special United States Ambassador, arrived late last night for the latest round in 12 years of talks on new Panama Canal treaty. The talks were scheduled to begin today on Contadora Island, 38 miles from here.

title: Reporters and the Subpoena
description: In recent years there have been a number of publicized cases in which reporters have gone to jail rather than reveal in court the names of people who gave them confidential information. They have argued that such information is vital to an effective press, and that it can be obtained only if informants are certain that a reporter will honor his pledge of confidence.

title: Dividends
Film: 'Apparition' a Dream Haunting, but Also Dull
description: A DREAM CAN BE RIGGED, but the results are uncertain. Children do it sometimes: perching a teddy bear near the bed, or focusing on the notion of ice cream or a picnic, in the hope that it will be dreamed. Often it is, but not necessarily as hoped. The teddy bear attacks, the ice cream becomes icebergs, the picnic turns into a wake."The Apparition," by the experimental film maker Larry Jordan, is something of a rigged dream. It is erratic, sometimes haunting, sometimes comic, and a lot of it dull; dull in the way somebody else's dreamreal or riggedis dull.In "The Apparition," which is being shown at the Whitney Museum's New American Filmmakers series, Mr. Jordan sets up a central figure to whom the dream belongs, and the figure simultaneously constructs it and dreams it. The figure is Paul, a maker of experimental films and commercials, and seemingly Mr. Jordan's alter ego.Paul lives with Sue, a free spirit just beginning to age. The relationship is uncertain, but deepening, a mixture of hope, guilt and rebellion. He has a casual affair with a younger woman, after their filmed roles as orgiasts in a grape commercial turn real. He visits a California hill family in one of those houses where everything, even the haircuts and eyeglass frames, is handicraft.Paul films everything, obsessively. He films his two women, a young son of the family, the son's drawing of a sacrifice in a Greek temple, a stuffed owl on a bureau. Gradually, jogged by Paul's tensions and depressions, these real things begin to move in and out of a dream state.An outdoor festival held by the family and friends begins with singing, wine drinking and a beautiful moment in which the children ride up on horses and lead the participants in a circle dance. Paul is in the middle of the circle, shooting frenziedly; and drifting away. He sees a figure in a toga and follows her into the woods.At another point he is driving alone in his car when a hand reaches from the back seat and touches him on the neck. The figure in the toga reappears, dies, comes to life, tries to talk, dies again. There are columns, the owl, sacrifices.Hallucination and reality shift back and forth. We see Paul experiencing his visions, telling about them afterward, andhe is a film maker, after allsetting them up.There is a charming openness in the way Mr. Jordan blurs the lines between fantasy and reality, and between fantasy and fraud. This openness, however, doesn't do much to relieve the ponderousness of some of the visions. In a way, it undercuts the visions.Along with "Apparition" the museum is showing an earlier, more abstract short work by Mr. Jordan, "Triptych in Four Parts." It is pretty much a film about Mr. Jordan's desire to express something by making a film.

The people immediately concerned are obviously the professionals  individuals and organizations deeply involved in the business of realestate investment and development. But even those marginally involved with real estate through ownership of a house or vacation home will be affected..

title: Brockman Adams
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14  If the members of the House of Representatives were polled on which of their colleagues they most respected, Brock Adams of Washington would surely finish near the top of the list. Exhibiting a powerful intellect and a thorough grasp of political. realities, he was the driving force in the House behind the institutionalization of the Congressional budget procedures, a development that members of both parties agree was the most' important innovation in Congress in the last decade.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 Senator Ernest F. Hollings of South Caroline withdrew today from the race for Senate majority leader, leaving Senator Robert C. Byrd of West Virginia in what appeared to be a commanding lead for the post.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Prudential Insurance Company of America yesterday announced the purchase for $9 million of the Dodge estate in Madison. Prudential's chairman, Donald S. MacNaughton, reaffirmed the company's commitment' to keep its corporate headquarters in downtown Newark, where it employs more workers than any other single company in the city. Mr. MacNaughton said the company had bought the 384acre Dodge estate in Morris County as an investment and to develop the property at a future date.

Yesterday, in announcing adjournment of the Geneva conference until midJanuary, Mr. Crosland said, We have, in my view, a good chance of achieving a peaceful settlement in Rhodesia.

Mrs. Carver said th:t candidates' discussions about solutions to New York's urban crisis will help cities throughout the .ountry in meeting their own difficulties.

Commissioner Philip Ross of the Labor Department said the increase resulted from seasonal filings in the construction, landscaping and food processing industry. In the corresponding week of 1975, there were 45,918 new claims.

title: Music: Operatic Curios

Instead of performing the expected things, such as a cycle of Haydn masses, or exploring 17thcentury liturgical works, the society led off last year with Massenet's operaoratorio MarieMagdaleine, and on Monday night in Avery Fisher Hall it presented the American premiere of Licinio Refice's Cecilia, an opera first staged in Rome in 1934.

title: Republican Ironies
description: The Big Four of the Republican Party met a few days ago to discuss the problem of achieving unity and, as President Ford put it, insuring that the twoparty system remains viable. To the extent that they advance those objectives they will be serving the country as well as the Republican Party. For all their lack of ideology, the two major parties, moderating and monitoring each other, have kept the American Government as accountable to the people as any government has ever been, and free, as well, of the violence that periodically marks changes of regime in most other nations of the world.

title: 20,234 Students Win Regents Scholarships, 800 of Them in Nursing

title: CARTER SPEEDS PLAN TO AID THE ECONOMY

description: ATLANTA, Dec. 14  President  elect Jimmy Carter said today that he would unveil a program to stimulate the economy before taking office next month, but that he had not decided how much of the program would be in the form of tax reduction and how much in increased spending.

title: Personal Health
description: TONIGHT tens of millions of Americans will lie awake for hours wondering and worrying whether they'll be able to get good night's sleep. They are the victims of insomnia, which afflicts some 25 million Americans all the time and millions of others some of the time.

title: NewAuto Sales Advanced by 1% for 10day spam
description: DETROIT, Dec. 14  American newcar sales were essentially flat in the first 10 days of December, gaining only one percent from the corresponding period a year ago. The Ford Motor Company finally pulled out of the slump caused by the United Auto Workers Union strike. Ford said sales were up 5.3 percent from last year. Bennett E. Bidwell, Ford sales group Ivice president, noted that this is the first time we have run ahead of the yearago period since the U.A.W. strike.

title: Hanoi Leaders Vow A Rebuilding Drive
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 14  The first Vietnamese Communist Party congress since 1960 vvas.opened in Hanoi today with the nation's leaders pledging new direction of development and reconstruction.

description: The 12round heavyweight fight between unbeaten Duane Bobick and Ken Norton in Madison Square Garden next March 2 will be televised live by the National Broadcasting Company (WNBCTV. Channel 4 in New York).

title: Spain's Premier Says That Referendum Today Will Buoy Democracy
description: MADRID, Dec. 14 Prime Minister 1 Adolfo Suarez appealed tonight to Span iards to vote yes in a national referendum tomorrow and turn the nation into a fully democratic society without risks and without fears.

title: Barazzutti on W.C.T. Tour
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Dec. 14 (UPI)  Corrado Barazzutti, the No. 2ranked player in Italy, signed yesterday to compete in a World Championship Tennis tournament here next month, completing a 16man field for the $100,000 event. The tournament at the Civic Center Coliseum, Jan. 1216, is the first stop on the W.C.T. circuit in 1977.

title: Times Reporter at CarterArtis Trial Describes Bello's Recantations

title: Priscilla Kerley van der Laan, Social Service Volunteer, 69
description: Priscilla Kerley van der Laan, who was active as a social service volunteer in New York City, died yesterday at Lenox Hill Hospital. She was 69 wars old and lived at 10 East 81st Street:.

title: Theaters to Ban Smoking

The American Lung Association presented a special award to the General Cinema Corporation yesterday for the action. which will affect its theaters in 39 stat.cs. By Evans, vice president of the chain, said smoking would be allowed only in the lobbies and lounges of theaiers in cities where local regulations permit smoking in those areas.

title: LUDWIG ROSENSTEIN
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 14 (UPI)  Ludwig Rosenstein, a chemist, scientist and educator who invented a new process or the desalination of sea water, died Yesterday. He was 90 years old.

title: Leadership in Sri Lanka Shaken By Outbreak of Student Protests
description: KANDY, Sri Lanka, Dec.10The Red Cross Hall in this picturesque tourist town usually serves as an auditorium for the performing arts. But for the last several days, a large audience of students, police officials, teachers, parents and politicians have been witnessing a different spectacle.

title: 5 Boys Die in North Dakota Fire
description: LEEDS, N. D., Dec. 14 (UPI) Five boys, 5 to 15 years old, died early today in a fire that destroyed a onestory wooden farm home near here. Their parents, Mr. and Mrs. Dalbert Bigham, and five other children escaped and were taken to Mercy Hospital in Devils Lake, N. D., for treatment for smoke inhalation, cuts and bruises and firstdegree burns. The Benson County coroner said that the fire started about 5 A.M., apparently from a faulty furnace, and the house burned down in about an hour.

title: U.S. Reports Inventories Rose by 0.5% in October
description: Businessmen saw their stocks of unsold merchandise rise $1.54 billion, or 0.5 pe.rcent during October, reflecting weaker than anticipated demand and offering further evidence of the slowdown in the nation's economic recovery.

title: GEN. FRIEDRICH FOERTSCH
