title: A Touch of Comfort Comes to Penn Station
Sutton Seeks Revamping Of City. Housing Offices And a New Department
description: The Borough President of Manhattan. Percy E. Sutton called yesterday for the reorganization of the New York City housing and development offices and the creation of a new Department of Housing and Neighborhood Preservation to eliminate the red tape that often hinders the upgrading of housing and neighborhoods.

title: Violence Is Jamaica Election Issue
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, Dec. 14 (Reuters) Political violence, an economy in deep recession and the question of closer ties with Cuba dominate tomorrow's general elections in Jamaica.

title: Professional Football
Walter Kidde Agrees in Principle To Sell U.S. Lines for $97 Million
description: Walter Kidde & Company announced yesterday an agreement in principle to sell United States Lines to WUI Inc. for cash and notes totaling $97 million. The agreement calls for Kidde to receive $70 million In cash and a subordinate note of $27 million bearing interest at 10 percent annually. At the closing, Kidde will also own a new United States Lines voting preferred stock convertible into 20 percent of United States Lines common stock and paying dividends equal to 20 percent of the net income of United States Lines.

title: Q&A
description: Q. I have tasted delicious oysters in the Les Holies district of Paris. The oysters were accompanied by a subtle sauce in a separate dish, which tasted of shallots. Do you know this sauce?

title: Buche de Noel: Enticing Centerpiece Rich Dessert
description: A sweet and decorative reminder of the Yule logs burned by ancient north Europeans to honor the winter solstice, the Christmas log cake is a favorite in many countries. The most enticing and richest by far is the French bche de Nol, a dessert that also serves as centerpiece.

title: Nader's Group Says Safety Agency Allows Illegal Labeling on Product
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 14Ralph Nader's Health Research Group charged today that the Occupational Safety and Health Administration, the Federal agency  charged with enforcing safe working conditions. had granted an illegal, special exemption to a Connecticut company that produces industrial talc, a substance known to contain cancercausing asbestos.

title: Ridgewood Residents Fighting Construction of Offices
description: RIDGEWOOD, Dec. 14  Angry residents of a pocket of this Bergen County community have banded together to fight the proposed construction of two twostory office buildings on 7.5 acres of wooded, 21acre triangular plot near their homes.

title: Connors in Rich Tourney
description: BOCA WEST, Fla.. Dec. 14 (AP) Jimmy Connors, Bjorn Borg, Adriano Panatta and Manuel Orantes will make up the field in the $200,000 Grand Slam of Tennis Jan. 21 to 23 here. PepsiCola is the sponsor. The matches will be televised.

title: Senate Panel Approves Bill for State Energy Office
description: TRENTON, Dec. 14  The State Senate Committee on Energy and the Environtrea released today its longawaited bill to create a permanent state energy office with the power to develop a comprehensive energy plan and attract up to $2 million in Federal funds.

title: Arts in America: Minneapolis
description: SIX DEGREES BELOW and the wind is calm, the operator says as a wakeup call. It sounds nautical, but In Minneapolis people maneuver themselves and their cars through the fierce winter air as if they were small boats in a strong sea_

title: Best Buys
description: ANYONE who knows how to cut up a chicken can cut down on food bills this week by taking advantage of the ubiquitous sales on whole broilers and fryers.

title: Altering the NorthSouth Collision Course'
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Can the ties between northern industrialized powers and southern developing countries withstand the tests of the near future? I fear that the unthinkablea negative answer to that questionnow appears as likely as any other.

title: McVay Is Rehired as Giants' Coach for Two Years
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N. Y., Dec. 14  John McVay, who provided a happy ending to a season that began with nine straight losses, has been rehired as coach of the football Giants for two years.

title: Rep. Andrew Young Is Expected To Head U.S. Delegation at U.N.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14  Presidentelect Jimmy Carter will nominate Representative Andrew Young, a 44yearold black leader from Georgia, as the chief delegate of the United States to the United Nations, according to authoritative sources.

title: Stage: Searing Ashes'
description: IN ASHES (at the Manhattan Theater Club), by David Rudkin, a young English playwright, a married couple are trying, with urgency and, finally, in desperation, to conceive a child. The play takes the couple from gynecologist to semenologist to bedroom and shows in vivid detail the humiliationspsychological as well as physicalthat each is forced to suffer in the quest for parenthood. Each begins to long for the nights when sex meant love and not a feat of clockwork engineering.

title: William Crawford Dead at 60; Former Executive of Radio Stations
description: William Crawford, a sales manager for 15 years for radio station WOR in New York City, died in New London, Conn. He was 60 years old and lived in Old Lyme, Conn.

title: BORMAN PANEL URGES CADETS' READMISSION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14  A select commission headed by a former astronaut, Frank Boman, has urged a speedy readmission of all cadets who left the United States Military Academy at West Point, N.Y., under the cloud of the worst cheating scandal in its history, sources in the Defense Department said today.

title: 6 SEIZED AS SUSPECTS IN QUEENS BANK THEFTS
description: Six men accused of being members of a gang that robbed seven bank offices in Queens of more than $100,000 in the last year were arrested yesteday by agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation and detectives of the Police Department's maiorease sound.

title: Drop in Lawsuits Under NoFault , Less Than Legislature Expected
description: The number of pain and injury lawsuits, which was expected to drop by Itbout 80 percent under New York State's nofault auto insurance law, has been reduced by only about 20 percent, witpesses told a hearing of the Senate Insurance Committee yesterday.

title: Potato Futures Off Again, In Reaction to U.S. Report; Soybean Prices Jump 10c
description: Potato futures dropped again sharply yesterday on the New York Mercantile Exchange, where the active May contract closed at 9.4 cents a pound, down the daily limit from 9.9 cents on Monday.

title: ACCOUNTING BOARD ORDERS BREAKDOWN BY COMPANY PARTS
description: The Financial Accounting Standards Board, moving to give investors more financial information, directed businessmen yesterday to provide a sales and profit breakdown for each significant industry segment of their operations.

title: Technology
description: In an unusually frank afterlunch talk to an audience of fellow innovators in New York last week, Dr. Robert Noyce, a physicistinventor who helped organize some of the basic innovations in the semiconductor industry, recounted how his career had turned on a succession of dissatisfactions.

title: ABRAHAM GLASSER, 61, EXPROFESSOR OF LAW
description: Abraham Glasser, who resigned in 1953 as a professor at Rutgers Law School in Newark after refusing the year before to tell a House tinAmerican Activities Committee about possible Communist ties, died Sunday of cancer at Nantucket (Mass.) Cottage Hospital. He was 61 years old and a resident of Edgartown, Mass.

title: New York Loses Control Of Third Naval District As Command Is Shifted
description: In a military ceremony at the old Brooklyn Navy Yard yesterday, control cf New York's Third Naval District was transferred to the commandant of the Fourth Naval District in Philadelphia, bringing to an end the 73yearold command autonomy of the New York Citybased disttict. cstablishcd in 1903.

title: MICRONESIA AIDE BIDS FORD HALT C.I.A.'S SURVEILLANCE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP)  Micronesia's chief spokesman here has asked President Ford to order an immediate halt to what he termed the Central Intelligence Agency's spying on the people of Micronesia.

title: Living Abroad.. Madrid
description: Adelighted shopper on the lookout for political antiques stumbled upon a children's game, dating from the 1940's called The Life of a Christian. The player goes forward two spaces after his first communion, tumbles into hell after sinning, is rescued by archangels, skirts the dreaded Red Menace and, finally, makes it into heaven.

title: Two Teenaged West Germans Jailed in Turkey on Drugs Charge
description: IZMIR, Turkey, Dec. 14 (UPI) A court sentenced a 17yearold West German and his 15yearold sister to death today on smuggling charges involving 79 pou13d4 of hashish, then commuted the boy's sentence to life in prison and ordered the girl to serve 16 years and eight months in jail.

title: Delaware Will Pay Off on Lottery ThatW as Canceled and Reinstated
description: DOVER, Del., Dec. 14 Delaware prepared today to make good on a weekend pool that was canceled Saturday because the State Lottery Commission's easygoing odds seemed likely to cost the state heavily.

title: Books of The Times
description: THIS PLACE wasn't always concrete and it wasn't always crowded. It just grew faster than any other city in history, is how the late reporter Meyer Berger explained New York in 1956, and indeed, the notion of growth has always been crucial to the city's identity. New York has traditionally been perceived as not merely the biggest of our nation's cities, but as the place that is constantly in flux, the city as much in love with the process of expansion as with any sort of end product its growth might yield.

title: Carter's Rush To the Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14  Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's slow, methodical. twobytwo process of selecting his Cabinet has now fallen behind the timetable of his predecessors, but he has shown no hesitancy about making unprecedented use of the transition period to begin dealing with issues News of substance. For along with Analysis the disclosure of two new Establishment liberal appointments to his Cabinet, he revealed today that he was already in action on matters of diplomacy and the economy.

title: Indonesian Truck Plunge Kills
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Dec. 14 (Reuters)  Six people were killed and 34 injured' when a truck carrying more than 80 passengers plunged into a river after hitting a bridge in East Java. The Jakarta Daily Kompas reported today.

title: COUNCIL EXTENDS MANDATE FOR U.N. FORCE ON CYPRUS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 14 The Security Council today approved a sixmonth extension of the United Nations peace force on Cyprus and appealed to I the Greek and Turkish communities on the island to settle their differences.

title: Banker Tells of $300,000 Robbery After Being Abducted on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 14 (AP)A banker has told the police that he was kidnapped, drugged and robbed of $300,000 of his bank's money.

title: Suspect Is Stuck in Chimney
description: LOS ANGELES (UPI)  Customers leaing a restaurant before dawn one dayl were mystified by cries for* help. They could not determine where the voice was coming from. Finally, the police checked! the roof of a bar next door. The voice' was coming out of the chimney. Richard: Hauck, 31 years old, was yanked loose: by a rope lowered by firemen and arrested on suspicion of burglary.

title: Knicks Routed by 11198; Van Breda Kolff Dropped
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 14 (AP)  San Antonio's Larry Kenon and Billy Paultz scored 28 points apiece in pacing the Spurs to a 11198 victory over the injuryhampered New York Knicks in a National Basketball Association game tonight.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Psychics Are Flourishing in Southern California, Gaining Social Acceptance Among Middle Class
description: CHAPSWORTH, Calif., Dec. 12When her husband was thinking about buying a new business, Carol McGrail, who lives in this San Fernando Valley community, had a few mIsgivings and consulted a woman named Kabrina Kinkade.

title: 60 Minute Gourmet
description: THERE seems to be a common assumption among the restaurantgoing public that all the dishes that emerge from a professional kitchen are, of necessity, intricate and complex in their preparation. There are, of course, some dishes that require various stocks and bases which may require a day or more to simmer and reduce to a proper or desired consistency. And there are various creations that do require a highly specialized if not to say arcane knowledge to produce successful results.

title: Dispute onTenantRepreserztative On Appeals Board Poses Problem
description: A public challenge by a landlordlawyer to the reappointment of a tenant representative on New York City's Conciliation and Appeals Board yesterday created vexing problems for the City Council's Rules Committee.

title: NEWSPAPER ANNOUNCES IT WILL PUBLISH DEC. 31
description: The News World, a 24  page daily and Sunday newspaper being financed by the Unification Church International, whose chairman is the Rev. Sun Myung Moon, will begin publication in New York City on Dec. 31, the paper's business agent announced yesterday.

title: 16 Injured in Fire in Miami
description: MIAMI, Dec. 14 (AP)  Sixteen persons, including 13 Miami firemen, were injured early today in a fire and a blast that ripped the front wall out ot a burning building. The police arrested Gilberto Verona, an 18 year old, and charged him with setting the fire.

title: China Says Dissidents Kidnapped Provincial Aides
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 14The first secretary of the Chinese Communist Party in Shansi Province and several other top leaders there were apparently kidnapped and beaten last summer by local supporters of Chiang Ching and three other nowdisgraced Politburo members.

title: Werner Michael Blumenthal
description: Werner Michael BlumenthalMen in the News,. the 50yearOld chairman, president and chief executive officer of the Bendix Cor poration, has not been one to sit back and wait for the good things in life to drop into his lap. He has instead, pursued them with directness and passion. In his teenage years and early 20's he scratched to stay alive with his parents in Shanghai after they had left Germany in 1938 to escape Nazi persecution. He recalled buying food by the ounce and cleaning laboratory equipment for $1 a week.

title: Music: Dvorak's Fifth With Exuberance
description: THE National Orchestral Association, ??? as its activities may12e from its great days before the war, is still fortunately a fixture of New York musical life. Last night this training orchestra which through the years has sent so many players to orchestras throughout the countrygave the first of three Carnegie Hall concerts.

title: Books of The Times
description: OF ALL THE AUTHORS, the biographer indepth is the most optimistic, and the most surely doomed to failure. Who can ever know another human being? The biographer's selfimposed duty, however, is to do the impossible, to dive deep beneath the surface of appearances and return with another person in tow. It is enough to give one the bends just to think about the presumptuousness of such a mission.

title: NEW DATE TO BE SET FOR GILMORE'S DEATH
description: PROVO, Utah, Dec. 14 (AP) Gary Mark Gilmore was ordered today to appear in court tomorrow morning for the setting of a new date for his thricedelayed execution by firing squad.

title: Young Women Players Are Told To Go on Tour by Julie Heldman
description: Julie Heldman is in town putting the finishing shots on something her mother started.

title: The Tombs, Cont'd
description: The City of New York is back knocking on the door of the Federal court again with a new plan to reopen the Tombs. As those familiar with this seemingly endless saga will recall, the prison closed because the United States District Court for the Southern District held that conditions in this jail were so bad as to violate the constitutional rights of the men detained there. The city's new plan doesn't come close to remedying the basic problems that caused the closing in the first place.

title: Evidence of a Possible Forgery In a Hughes Will to Be Produced
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 14Nevada Attorney General Robert List and Nevada District Judge Keith Hayes agreed today that evidence pointing to forgery in purported will of Howard R. Hughes would be produced in court on Dec. 28.

title: In Memoriam
description: AUGERRechel. Your second birthday In eternity Is lust a whisper In time, but neither time nor the reality of this cold world can rob us of past

title: Study Finds Danger in Surgery Varies GreatlyAmong Hospitals
description: The quality of hospital care varies so widely that a surgery patient's chances of dying or suffering severe complications can be two and a half times as great at one hospital as at another, according to a major study.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The police fired at a robbery suspect, then cornered him in tire basement e a parochial school in midtown Manhattan. The suspeet, Gregory Freeman. 21 years old, had the proceeds of a $50 robbery and a .22caliber gun in his possession, the police said. He was spotted shortly after 5 A.M. leaving coffee shop on Eighth Avenue near 43d Street by two Transit Authority officers who had been alerted by woman who said she had just been robbed. The police said the man ran, turning once to point a gun at the pursuing officers, John McGrath and Robert Mitchell. They said that the officers fired three times but did not hit the suspect. They said Mr. Freeman then scrambled over rooftops to the Holy Cross School on 43d Street near Ninth Avenue and entered the building through a broken window.

title: Consulting Firm Set On Impact of Highway
description: Alan Sagner, the New Jersey State Transportation Commissioner, announced yesterday the selection of the consulting firm of Louis Burger & Associates of East Orange to draw up the required final environmental impact statement for construction of an uncompleted 19.8mile section of Interstate Route 287.

title: Adieu, 60's Dreams, Adieu
description: These young people I have to compete against are incisive, analytical, mathematical. They size a problem up, cut it down to size, and put the pieces back in just the right order. They don't brood about the meaning of all; they just get the job done. Absurdity and selfdoubt are out for them; they contemplate no journeys to the end of the night.

title: Panel Urges Moves to Shore Up Family and Protect Poor Children
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP)  A National Academy of Sciences panel recommended today an expensive new commitment to shore up the American family and protect children from poverty and neglect.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: Quilts by the Inch

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: THERE CAN'T BE many fraternal organizations in this country celebrating their 220th anniversary, but that's what the St. Andrew's Society of the State of New York did with appropriate Highland and Lowland pomp and ceremony last week at the WaldorfAstoria.

title: BLUMENTHAL NAMED TREASURY SECRETARY; ADAMS ALSO CHOSEN
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 14  Presidentelect Jimmy Carter today designated W. Michael Blumenthal, the chief executive of the Bendix Corporation, to be Secretary of the Treasury and Representative Brock Adams, Democrat of Washington, to be Secretary of Transporation.

title: Teacher Agreement Is Reported at Hand
description: The New York City Board of Education and the United Federation of Teachers are near an agreement that would give teachers some longdeferred wage increases and an extension of the current school contract for another year.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 44 (AP) A civil suit against former Attorney . General, John N. Mitchell and other Federal officials has been dismissed in a case stemming from the 1971 Mayday demonstrations.

title: Environmental Group Contends Fluorocarbon Refrigerant Poses Wide Threat
description: A leading environmental public interest law nrm here contended yesterday in petition to the Federal Government that a fluorocarbon refrigerant used in many old airconditioning units posed a widespread threat to public health.

title: Leading Black Editor Is Detained 8 Hours by South African Police
description: JOHANNESBURG, Dec, 14The South African security police today detained Percy Qoboza, the country's foremost black editor, but released him after eight hours of questioning on the situation in the black township of Soweto, focus of protests against apartheid.

title: Electoral Vote Given To Reagan as Protest
description: OLYMPIA, Wash., Dec. 14 (AP) A Spokane lawyer, Mike Padden, said that he cast one of the state's electoral votes for Ronald Reagan as an exercise of personal conscience.

title: Critic's Notebook: Find Ibsen's Name And Win $100
description: HOLLYWOOD PEOPLE are fond of grand gestures, and one of their favorites is the tradepa per ad in which, say, a producer of a film thanks the director of the same film for doing such smashing job. No matter that the two probably lunch together every day or, just as probably, are suing each other. Hollywood people like to hang their clean linen in public.

title: Steelers to Present Severe Test For Colts' HighPowered Offense
description: I wish I was in your shoes. The Jets are on the way up and we're on the way down.

title: Stage: Sly Fox,' A Tireless Farce
description: BE WARNED. A man might die laughing at Sly Fox. What Larry Geibart once helped do for Plautus in A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum. he has now done for Ben Jonson in Sly Fox, which opened at the Broadhurst Theater last night. Mr. Gelbart has resuscitated the great Elizabethan, modernized him, given him a new set of clothes and married him off to the old traditions of American vaudeville.

title: G.M.'s Chief Still Expects Industry To Sell I 1.25 MillionCars in 1977
description: DETROIT, Dec. 14  Thomas A. Murphy. the chairman of the General Motors Corporation, said today he still expected United States car sales in 1977 of about 11.25 million units.

title: Bridge :
description: A familiar figure passed from the New York City tournament scene last week when Jonas Cornberg d:ed of heart attack at the age of 53. He had long been noted for imaginative and clever play, in bdth duplicate and rubber bridge, and was also an expert backgammon player.

title: A Cache of Dynamite Is Found; Two South African Blacks Held
description: JOHANNESBURG, Dec. 14The police announced today the arrest of two black mine workers in the discovery of a cache of dynamite in an abandoned gold mine shaft in Booysens, a suburb that lies between Johannesburg and the black township of Soweto. The arrests, on Friday, came two days after an explosion in a Johannesbur2 restaurant.

title: Too Intelligent to Be a Movie Star?
description: Back in 1973, Jill Clayburgh desperately wanted the leading role of the gogo dancer in Joseph Papp's first production at Lincoln Center, Boom Boom Room. When she didn't get it, she was so disappointed that she decided to move to Hollywood.

title: Carter Seems Optimistic as OPEC Gathers for Meeting on Price of Oil
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14  Presidentelect Jimmy Carter said today that most of the 13 members of the oil cartel had come to the view that a price increase might be counterproductive to their own welfare and benefit.

title: McAdoo's First Drill Today With Knicks Raises Doubts
description: The facelifting of the Knicks front line begins today when Bob McAdoo engages in his rust workout with his new teammates at Pace University.

title: Freddie Laker NoFrill Flights Over Atlantic Win Court Test
description: LONDON, Dec. 15 (Reuters)The British Government today lost an appeal against a court decision allowing Skytrain, a nofull travel program of an airline operator, Freddie Laker, to operate as a cutprice service to the United States.

title: U.S. CAR OUTPUT EXPECTED TO SET A WEEKLY RECORD
description: DETROIT, Dec. 15The American auto industry is scheduled to build a yearly high of 212,779 cars this week, up 2.7 percent from 207,133 last week, and 20.9 percent ahead of the 175,998 units built in the comparable yearago week.

title: NorthSouth Economic Conflict Feared by Politicians, Business
description: BOCA RATON, FLA., Dec. 15Many of the South's leading politicians and businessmen fear that the entire nation will suffer if the South and the North become embroiled in an economic war over markets, fobs and Federal funds.

title: 100,000 Worthless 1923 Marks Exchanged for a $40,000 Spree
description: TRAVERSE CITY, Mich., Dec. 1$ (AP)Last September, Stephen Holcomb walked into a bank with a 100,000mark note that was printed in Germany in 1923 and exchanged it for nearly $40,000. According to a banking expert in Detroit, the note was worth less than a United States penny even in 1923, a year of extreme inflation in Germany.

title: Political Violence Soaring in Italy; 5 Men Are Shot to Death in 2 Days
description: ROME, Dec. 15  Five men have been shot to death in Italy in the last two days in a rising tide of political violence from the extreme left wing.

title: Reforming West Point
description: The cheating scandal that led to the expulsion of 139 cadets from the United States Military Academy has from its very start told more about West Point's deficiencies as an academic institution than about alleged flaws in the character of the cadets. By rigidly standing behind an honor code that seemed blind to human behavior, the traditionalists, including many of the cadets, have demonstrated an unfortunate lack of understanding of pedagogy, justice and honor itself.

title: A Closer Look At Phone Fees
description: The New York State Public Service Commission's outright rejection on Tuesday of the New York Telephone Company's rateincrease application was the most dramatic  evidence to date of the quiet evolution that has taken place at the commission under its economistchairman, Alfred E. Kahn. The commission rejected the proposed $393 million rate increase with the explanation that the request had substantial and fundamental deficiencies.

title: Talking With the P.L.O.
description: WASHINGTONOn Nov. 15, five American Jews met with two leaders of the Palestine Liberation Organization here, through the American Friends Service Committee.

title: New York State Is Asked to Pay For Moving CityBoarder Babies
description: Hospitals and voluntary childcare agencies in New York City said yesterday that they would ask the state to finance the swift removal of socalled boarder babies from acutecare hospitals and to approve their placement in institutions and programs designed to provide the less costly care they require.

title: In Mentortam
description: DAVISJudee Abraham H. His memoty Is precious, never to be torgottpn.

title: Incumbent Premier Appears the Clear Victor in Jamaican, Election
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, Dec. 15 (AP)  Prime Minister Michael Manley won an overwhelming victory in parliamentary elections today, gaining a clear mandate to move ahead with his Socialist policies.

title: Gilmore Execution Set for Jan. 17
description: PROVO, Utah, Dec. 15  Gary Mark Gilmore was sentenced today to be executed by a Utah firing squad on Jan. 17. Putting the execution date 33 days away displeased Mr. Gilmore, who after vainly trying to persuade Judge J. Robert Bullock to set next Monday for the execution, called the judge a moral coward. The convicted murderer said Judge Bullock lacked the guts to carry out the law.

title: Manila Easing Curfew
description: MANILA, Dec. 15 (UPI)President Ferdinand E. Marcos today lifted the martiallaw curfew for 11 days, starting tomorrow, for the Christmas season. A Government announcement said the curfew would be lifted everywhere but in areas considered critical.

title: Spaniards Give a Resounding Yes In Referendum on Free Elections
description: MADRID, Thursday, Dec. 16  Spaniards voted overwhelmingly yesterday in favor of a Government program to hold free elections next spring for a parliament that will have the power to rewrite the laws of the Franco period.

title: Singer Barbara McNair's Husband Found Shot to Death in Their Home
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 15 (AP)  The husband of entertainer Barbara McNair, the singer, was found shot to death in the couple's home here early today, the police said.

title: Murdoch Scores 3 Goals As Barons Top Wings, 73
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 15 (AP)Bob Murdoch scored three goals to spark the Cleveland Barons to their third straight National Hockey League victory, a 73 triumph over the Detroit Red Wings tonight.

title: Britain's Labor in a Box
description: The speech delivered in the House of Commons yesterday by Chancellor of the Exchequer Denis Healey, announcing spending cuts and high'er taxes, does not look like the decisive event in the struggle to stem Britain's economic decline. On the contrary, financial markets at home and abroad received the speech with. skepticism; the British stock market fell and the pound plunged still further.

title: Privacy Violations Of Medical Records Found Widespread
description: A Denverbased concern that was recently indicted for stealing medical records and selling the information they contained to life insurance companies represents only the tip of a nationwide iceberg, according to the head of the recently formed National Commission on Confidentiality of Health Records.

title: A Little Bank Just Six Inches High Has Been Doing Its Job for 70 Years
description: For 70 years, through recession, depression, boom and bust, Americans have placed their trust in one bank above all others.

title: Hearst Magazines Names a Chairman
description: The Hearst Corporation announced yesterday that Richard E. Deems, president since 1960 of Hearst Magazines, has been named chairman and chief executive of that unit, while Gilbert C. Maurer, for two years its executive vice president, has been named president and chief operating officer. The division is made up of 10 consumer magazines, special publications, a trade magazine and Avon Books.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: Philip Morris Inc. disclosed yesterday that internal investigations of transactions by the company and its majorityowned subsidiaries had disclosed questionable payments of about $2.36 million for the years 19711974. Findings of the inquiries, which were reported to the Securities and Ex. change Commission, showed no evidence of unlawful political contributions in the United States or other countries, the company said.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Hofstra Beats St. Francis In Overtime
description: Rich Laurel scored 43 points, including the tiehreaking basket in overtime, to help Hofstra beat St. Francis. 9594, last night at the loser's court. Hofstra led, 4643: at the half and the game was tied at 83 at the end of regulation time.

title: Artis Goes on Stand But Carter Decides He Will Not Testify
description: PATERSON, N.J., Dec. 15  John Artis took the witness stand today in his second trial for tripe murder and told the jury, as he had in his first trial in 1967, that he was innocent of the Lafayette Grill shootings.

title: Notre Dame and Army Fives Off to Rousing Starts
description: Notre Dame's undefeated basketball team, which has surprised even its coach, Digger Phelps, completed an unusual feat in the last six days by beating the University of California, Los Angeles, 6663, last Saturday and then Indiana, 7865, Tuesday night. This is apparently the first time in regularseason play that a team has gained successive victories over the two most recent National Collegiate champions.

title: U.S. VIOLATION RULED OUT IN BROCHURE FOR FORD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (UPI)The Civil Service Commission has cleared everyone under its jurisdiction of any violation of the Hatch Act in connection with use of photographs of highranking blacks in a President Ford Campaign brochure.

title: Open Interest
One Killed as Jets Collide
description: ENOCHS, Tex., Dec. 15 (UPI)Two Air Force jets on a routine training flight crashed yesterday, killing one officer and critically injtring another. A spokesman at Reese Air Force Base near Lubbock said that two other crewmen parachuted safely. The critically injured man also ejected and was taken to a Lubbock hospital. The man who was killed was not immediately identified by the Air Force.

title: Carter's Mother Has Arm in Sling
description: PLAINS, Ga., Dec. 15 (UPI)  Lillian Carter is going around with her arm in a fancy scarf sling, Too many autographs, she explained to reporters. The mother of Presidentelect Jimmy Carter holds forth every day at the depot on aMin Street here, his former campaign headquarters, and is swamped by visitors wanting to shake her hand and get her autograph.

title: Schmidt, Under Attack From Own Party, Wins Reelection by 2 Votes
description: BONN, Dec. 15 (AP)  Helmut Schmidt, under fire from his own Social Democratic Party over financing of social security programs, was reelected Chancellor of West Germany today by two votes.

title: Al Kooper Combines Soul and Rock Styles
description: Al Kooper, who performed at the Bottom Line through last night, is not the Alice Cooper who used to play with live boa constrictors and mutilate baby dolls on stage. He is the Al Kooper who played electric organ on key recordings by Bob Dylan and the Rolling Stones, was a leader of the Blues Project group and founder of the original Blood, Sweat and Tears, and went on to produce several successful Southern bands. Be is on the road with a new band for the first time in several years, supporting a new album.

title: Deaths
description: AHRENSErlc, beloved husband of Therese, devoted father of Thomas, cherished grandfather of Earl, Eric and Dawn, dear brother of BOY Salfold. Services Thursday, Dec. 16, P.M. at The Riverside, 76th St. and Amsterdam Ave. .

title: IpiTombi to Open At Harkness Jan. 12
description: IpiTombi, the black African musical that has been playing at Her Majesty's Theater in London for more than a year, will make its New York debut at the Harkness Theater, Broadway and 63d Street, on Jan. 12, after a series of previews beginning Dec. 28. IpiTombi was conceived by Bertha Egnos, who also composed the music. The lyrics are by Gail Lakier and the choreography by Sheila Wartski, Neil McKay and members of the cast.

title: SECRETARY OF ARMY WILL ACT ON CADETS

description: LA PAZ, BoliviaBolivia, which has had five years of political stability under a military Government, has achieved some economic growth and brought new optimism to people here who have money to invest and a choice of staying or leaving.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (UPI)The Federal Trade Commission announced today an investigation into the $29billionayear life insurance industry to determine whether consumers are not being properly informed on the costs of Icoverage.

title: Bridge:

In the last two decades, working at a slower pace but with equal efficiency, the Goren organization has probably exceeded the Culbertson output.

title: The Coat That You Can Really Feel In In
description: The bus passenger in the red Calvin Klein coat exchanged looks with the identically dressed woman across the aisle. At first, there was a whatareyoudoinginmyCoat? glare. Then, with faint smiles, the strangers accepted each other as sisters in good taste.

title: Pink Panther Team Unflappable In Fourth High-Spirited Caper
description: Though "The Pink Panther Strikes Again" is the fourth Inspector Clouseau comedy to come from the collaboration of Peter Sellers, the star, and Blake Edwards, the director-producer and co-author, there are no signs that anyone's spirits are flagging or that sanity is in any way imminent.Ineptitude again triumphsgloriously. Bungling is rewarded, and Clouseau goes blithely on demonstrating that what he doesn't know, which is everything, can't possibly do him permanent damage.To be near Clouseau is to be at the edge of the hurricane's eye, to risk annihilation, which is pretty much what actually happens to Clouseau's former superior in the French Sret, the once-sane Chief Inspector Dreyfus (Herbert Lom), in "The Pink Panther Strikes Again," which opened at Broadway and neighborhood theaters yesterday.The new film, written by Mr. Edwards and Frank Waldman, picks up Clouseau and Dreyfus several years after we left them in "The Return of the Pink Panther," with Dreyfus, apparently cured after a nervous breakdown brought on by Clouseau, preparing to leave his psychiatric clinic near Paris. One get-well-visit by Clouseau, though, and Dreyfus is pushed over the brink forever, turning into a mad, Goldfinger-like supercrook whose gift for ultimate failure is as certain a law of metaphysics as Clouseau's for success.They were made for each other, Clouseau and Dreyfus, and I can't believe that a little matter like Dreyfus's having been rendered forever invisible at the end of the new film will prevent Mr. Edwards from reuniting the two sometime in the future.I'm not sure why Mr. Sellers and Mr. Lom are such a hilarious team, though it may be because each is a fine comic actor with a special talent for portraying the sort of all-consuming, epic self-absorption that makes slapstick farce initially acceptableinstead of alarmingand finally so funny.There is, too, something most winningly seedy about Mr. Sellers' Clouseau, a fellow who, when he attempts to tear off his clothes in the heat of passion, gets tangled up in his necktie, and who, when he masqueradesfor reasons never gone intoas Quasimodo, overinflates his hump with helium.Both Mr. Sellers and Mr. Edwards delight in old gags, and part of the joy of "The Pink Panther Strikes Again" is watching the way they spin out what is essentially a single routine, such as one fellow's trying, unsuccessfully, to help another fellow out of a lake. And how long has it been since you've seen a crazy dentist routine involving laughing gas and the wrong tooth? For me, too long.I'm also partial to the Sellers-Clouseau French accent that is always discovering new words, such as "bimp" (as in "You have a nasty bimp on your head"), "rust" (as in "You can rust assured") and "rheuem" (as in "I would like to have a rheuem for the night")."The Pink Panther Strikes Again," which is more or less about Clouseau's seach for archfiend Dreyfus, moves all over the map, from Paris to London and Bavariawhere Dreyfus lives in a neo-Dracula castle  and back again, with a couple of detours to Washington, and a White House inhabited by a President who stumbles on rugs' edges.It's not, I suspect, a movie to attend looking for reason. It has arid patches, but I couldn't care less. The film is free-form comedy that goes where its gags lead it. That's not to say that it's formless, only that its structure has less to do with narrative than with the comic exuberance of the collaborators, which, after four films, is undiminished."The Pink Panther Strikes Again," which has been rated PG ("Parental Guidance Suggested"), contains a couple of bedroom scenes that have less to do with sex than with the confusion that can be caused by unexpected visitors.

title: BRITAIN AGAIN CURBS SPENDING IN EFFORT TO REVIVE ECONOMY

title: Background of OPEC at a Glance
description: The Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries is in the midst of its regular semiannual meeting at which it has traditionally set prices. OPEC countries export nearly 30 million barrels of oil each day and the prices they charge consuming countries have had, particularly in ttimultuous recent years, a major effect on whether the world's economic fortunes turn toward boom or bust.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15Victor A. Knox, who represented Michigan's 11th Congressional District from 1952 to 1964, died yesterday in Petoskey, Mich. A resi;dent of Sault Ste. Marie, Mich., he was 77 years old.

Vance, Jimmy Carter's nominee for the post, will be provided by the less elaborate State Department security section.

title: FED MOVES FURTHER TO SUPPLY RESERVES
description: The Federal Reserve again yesterday moved actively to supply reserves to the nation's banking system, and its action, were followed by a moderate rise in fixedincome prices and slight declines in interest rates. At the same time, another heavy volume of newissue financing was done in one of the final active days of 1976. In the early afternoon, the Federal Reserve came into the money market when Federal funds were trading at 4 percent and it negotiated overnight repurchase agreements for its own account, a move that temporarily provides more reserves that banks must hold.

description: Elinor Deutsch Uhry, daughter of the last president of New York City's Board of Aldermen and widow of a prominent orthopedic surgeon, died yesterday at Lenox Hill Hospital after a long illness.

title: Squirrel Cuts T.V.A. Power
description: UNION CITY, Tenn., Dec. 15 (UPI)  A fox squirrel tripped off a circuit breaker in a section of Northwest Tennessee yesterday, cutting power for about 45 minutes. Electric company officials said the squirrel somehow got into a Tennessee Valley Authority substation and touched the bushings on a circuit breaker.

title: Meat Inspector Indicted

The indictment, returned Tuesday in Federal Court, charged the Agriculture Department inspector, Henry Kramer. with accepting the bribe from Liberty Provisions Inc. He was assigned to the plant from February to July 1976 to enforce quality, sanitation and production standards. The company was charged as a corporate violator and faces fines of to $200,000, United States Attorney Jonathan L. Goldstein said.

The guard boxes, locked gates, special passes, and other security measures that began with World War II have increasingly tended to seal off the White House grounds from the rest of the world.

I., Dec. 15  Four American scholars, chosen last month by the Association for Jewish Studies to attend an international symposium sponsored by Soviet Jews in Moscow, said today that they had been informed on. Now he believes that day is near.

They made their latest appearance on Tuesday night at Alice Tully Hall, with a thoroughly engaging program.

title: Notes on People

The cards bear a reproduction of a painting entitled Going to Church, completed in the 19th century by a New England artist, George Durrie. The original of the painting, which depicts worshipers trudging through the snow to a church in Connecticut, is part of the White House collection. The cards are being sent to heads of state and other foreign dignitaries, selected state and Federal officials and friends of the Ford family.

The general feeling was that snowproducing plants were too expensive and unnecessary. Who neeas artificial snow, Fred Pabst Jr., then the major domo of Bromley Mountain in Vermont, said more than once. We're in the Green Mountains. We get plenty of snowthe least expensive kindfrom the skies.

description: TRENTON, Dec. 15State Attorney General William F. Hyland testified today that laws covering gambling casinos in Atlantic Citywhich are expected to open in six or eight monthsshould be as strict as possible.

title: Argentine Leftists Reported Suicides
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 15 (UPI)  Surrounded by an army patrol, a young couple who belonged to a leftist guerrilla organization committed suicide rather than surrender, security. sources said today. The man and woman, who have not been identified yet, were surrounded in a house in San Fernando, a northern suburb of Buenos Aires.

title: Carter Expected To Give Schultze Economics Post
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15  Presidentelect Jimmy Carter is prepared to announce three major appointments tomorrow  Charles L. Schultze as chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers, Zbigniew Brzezinski as Special Assistant to die President for National Security Affairs, and Representative Andrew Young as the chief United States delegate to the United Nations, according to wellplaced Carter sources.

title: Bar Examination May Be Changed to Expand Federal Law Questions
description: The waiting Is over, and the results of the New York State Bar Examination are out. Anxiety has been replaced by euphoria for those who passed and by shattered hopes for those who did not.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Lebanese Editor Is in U.S. to Seek Help for Rebuilding His Country
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15  Lebanon has sent a special envoy to Washington to discuss future American and international economic assistance to help the country recover from a year and a half of civil war.

title: $5 Million Fund to Honor Dr. Margaret Mead at 75
description: One day away from her 75th birthday, Margaret Mead picked up her famous walking stick yesterday, went downstairs from her private tower in the American Museum of Natural History and held court in the Hall of the Peoples of the Pacificthe most visible monument to her 50 years with the museum.

title: A Former Leader of J.D.L. Is Sentenced to 3 Years In ViolentHarassing Plot
description: Russel Kelner, who was a leader of the Jewish Defense League, was sentenced yesterday to three years in prison. for illegally transporting a rifle in a scheme involving the violent harassment of foreign officials in this country.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Oil Heating Pact Reached

title: Gibson, Saying He'll Stay, Discloses a Plan to Raise Minorities Job Prospects
description: NEWARK, Dec. 15Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson disclosed today an affirmative action plan aimed at ending municipal hiring discrimination and upgrading minority employees working in dead end city jobs.

title: MEMORIAL SERVICE HELD IN CAPITAL FOR LISAGOR
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15More than 700 persons, led by Vice President Rockefeller and Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger, went to the National Cathedral this morning for a memorial service for Peter Lisagor, the veteran Washington newspaper correspondent who died last Friday.

title: Shofner 49ers Aide
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 15 (AP) Jim Shofner, who resigned recently as head football coach at Texas Christian University, is returning to the San .Francisco 49ers as an assistant coach. Monte Clark, the head coach, announced the hiring of Shofner today. Three 49ers assistants, Dick Enright, Jim Spavital and Ed Alsman, were released.

title: Minorities Petition Rejected
description: ALBANY, Dec. 15 (UPI)The New York Court of Appeals has rejected a twoyear old request that a special commission be set up to investigate allegations that a disproportionate number of minorities had been denied admission to practice law.

title: Princess Grace to Narrate Film On Kirov School and Its Students
description: Princess Grace of Monaco will appear as narrator in The Children of Theater Street, a featurelength film documentary concerning Russia's famous Kirov School of Ballet, it has been announced by the American producer Earle Mack. According to the producer, it is the first major film to be shot behind the scenes of the worldrenowned Vaganova Institute of Choreography (the Kirov School), which is on Theater Street in Leningrad.

title: EDITH MORRIS DUNCAN
description: Edith Morris Duncan, former dean of girls at Morris High School in the Bronx, from which she retired in 1953 as assistant principal, died Tuesday in her home at Meadow Lakes, Hightstown, N.J. She was 85 years old.

title: Lebanese Editor Is in U.S. to Seek Help for Rebuilding His Country
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15Lebanon has sent a special envoy to Washington to discuss future American and international economic assistance to help the country recover from a year and a half of civil war.

title: A New Kind Of Court Integration
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 14When Jill Wed dick left her hometown of Napa, Calif., for her freshman year at college, she told friends she was excited about playing women's basketball at Texas Southern University.

title: BAGHDAD ACCUSES SYRIANS IN EXPLOSION AT AIRPORT
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 15  Iraq accused Syrian authorities today of responsibility for an explosion last night at the Baghdad airport terminal.

title: Coast Doctors Facing MedicareFraud Indictments
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 15  Federal indictments against 13 San Diego doctors will be announced here Friday, according to Government sources, an action that may lead to a nationwide crackdown against physicians accused of falsifying Medicare charges for blood tests obtained at low cost from production line laboratories.

title: No Bids Are Offered For Hillcrest Center
description: There was no bidder yesterday for the New York City property in Bedford, N.Y., that was formerly the Hillcrest Center for Children, according to the Municipal Services Administration.

title: OILSTORAGE PLAN TO PROTECT NATION DISCLOSED BY ZARB
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15The Administration made public today a detailed, longrange oilstorage plan to protect the United States against future losses of supply from embargo, war or other events.

title: Article 1    No Title
SECRETARY TO HASTINGS TESTIFIES TO A KICKBACK
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (AP)  A secretary for former Representative James Hastings testified today that she agreed to give the Congressman part of her salary after he told her it was done all the time between members of Congress and their employees.

title: Consumer Leader Says He Expects Carter to Be Most Sympathetic
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Dec. 15David Pittle, vice chairman of the United States Consumer Product Safety Commission, said here yesterday that the White House under Jimmy Carter will be the most sympathetic [to consumers] in modem American history.

title: Gurkhas Band Is Victor In Berlo at Aqueduct
description: There was a Canadian flavor to the second running of the $37,675 Berlo Handicap at Aqueduct yesterday. With the frozen lakes in the infield filling out the background, Gurkhas Band, 4yearold filly owned and trained by Canadians, scored a neck victory over the latecharging Pacific Princess in the field of 11. The margin of victory was deceptive. Gurkhas Band, notching her seventh success in 12 starts this season, apparently likes to loaf when she gets comfortably in front. Her jockey, the 27yearold Robin Platts, confirmed his filly's irksome habit after the race.

title: U.S. Antitrust Unit Studies Steel Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15Justice Department antitrust lawyers are examining the Dec. 1 price increase by nine steel producers to determine whether the antitrust laws may have been violated, according to the acting head of the antitrust division, Hugh P. Morrison Jr.

title: S.I.C. Should Consider Urging Ouster of Sheriff, Its Chief Says
description: POUGHKEE:PSIE, N.Y., Dec. 15 (AP)The chairman of the New York State Investigation Commission said today that the commission must strongly consider recommending that the Dutchess County sheriff, Lawrence Quinlan, be removed from office.

title: Southerners Talk Back to Yanks About Accents
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 15Alfred E. Smith would have said, The woim has toined.

title: OPEC Talks Show Signs of Split On Saudi Bid to Freeze Oil Price
description: DOHA, Qatar, Dec. 15  The Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries opened its crucial pricesetting meeting today with signs of a confrontation developing between those who insist on an immediate increase and those who are willing to freeze oil rates for perhaps half a year.

title: Dr. Friedgood Guilty In Killing of His Wife And Theft of Jewels
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec. 15  Dr. Charles E. Friedgood, the Long Island physician who had been accused of injecting his wife With a fatal dose of a painkilling drug and of looting her estate so that he could join his mistress in Denmark, was found guilty here tonight of seconddegree murder.

title: Mortality Rate for New TV Shows Is Increasing
description: The television season is 12 weeks old, and already more than half the primetime series introduced by the networks in September are gone or going. The mortality rate of new television shows has always been high, but this season the firstyear contenders have disappeared faster and in greater numbers than usual.

title: Article 3  No Title
ERNEST CLAY
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Dec. 15 (AP)Ernest Clay, vice president of a Washingtonbased consulting concern, died here Sunday after suffering a heart attack. He was 49 years old.

title: The Hagues Sing at Ballroom
description: Albert Hague, the composer of the scores of Redhead and Plain and Fancy, Who is this week's entry in the Broadway at the Ballroom series at the Ballroom, 458 West Broadway, is not the ideal singer for most of the songs he has written. He was born in Germany and still has strong traces of an accent, Which he uses primarily for comedy effect, coming on like a cheerful Lawrence Welk

title: Two Cosmos Satellites Launched
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 15 (UPI)  The Soviet Union put two satellites into orbit today in a shotgun launch from a single rocket. Tass, the Soviet press agency, said that the satellites, numbers 881 and 882 in the Cosmos program, were put into orbit ranging from. about 150 to 200 miles high.

title: Newspaper Official Elected.
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Dec. 15 (AP)  Charles T. Brumback has been elected president and chief executive officer of the Sentinel Star Company, publishers of The Orlando Sentinel Star newspaper.

title: CORRECTION
description: A report in The Times yesterday on economic aspects of Jimmy Carter's news conference contained some errors in its reference to statistics on national growth. A corrective article appears on Page 54.

title: Steelers Strongest Playoff Team, Analyst Predicts
description: From a statistical standpoint, the Pittsburgh Steelers are the strongest of the eight teams in the National Football League playoffs, according to computer analyst, and he believes they will defeat the Colts by more than the betting margin. 3 points. at Baltimore on Sunday.

title: Washington &
description: WASHINGTONAlmost overlooked in all the attention being paid to Jimmy Carter's selections for his Administration and the fighting over the top Congressional leadership posts is a littlenoticed reshuffling that could alter the workings of the 95th Congress.

title: Prices of Soybeans Drop In Light Trading Volume, Halting FourWeek Rally
description: Soybean prices tumbled yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. The January contract closed at $6.86 a bushel, off 14 cents.

title: MISSILES CONTRACT BY NAVY PROTESTED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15  The Navy recently awarded an $82.1 million contract to buy an airplane missile in apparent defiance of a Congressional edict that the Secretary of Defense should first certify that the weapon was ready for production.

title: Cowens Sees Celtics Win, 129 to 125
description: BOSTON, Dec. 15 (AP)The Boston Celtics, cheered on by Dave Cowens seated high in a rooftop box, rallied in the fourth period tonight for a 129125 National Basketball Association victory over the Milwaukee Bucks.

title: 2,946 Pass the Bar Examination in New York State
PRIEST, BACK FROM SAIGON SPEAKS OF MASS SUICIDES
description: PARIS, Dec. 15 (AP)A Canadian Jesuit priest recently expelled from Saigon after 19 years of missionary work says 15,000 to 20,000 Vietnamese have committed suicide rather than live under Communism.

title: Work and Commerce In West Bank Halted By Arab Tax Strike
description: NABLUS, IsraeliOccupied West Bank, Dec. 15  Commercial activity in the major towns of the West Bank of the Jordan came to a halt today as thousands of Palestinians staged a silent protest against the imposition of a new Israeli tax.

title: Anesthesia Errors Linked to Deaths
description: Preventable errors in administering general and local anesthetics have resulted in the deaths of otherwise healthy patients undergoing relatively minor operations and may endanger the health and lives of many others, according to three medical reports published this week.

title: Sadowsky to Head Finance Panel In Shifts on New York City Council
description: Changes were made yesterday in chairmanships of major New York City Council standing committees, including the appointment of Edward L. Sadowsky, Democrat of Queens, as chairman of the powerful Finance Committee. The vote by the full Council was 35 to 3.

title: Court Upholds Stuyvesant Student On Distributing Sex Questionnaire
description: A Federal judge ruled yesterday that New York City school authorities could not prevent a student editor at Stuyvesant High School from distributing a questionnaire about sex to junior and senior students at the school.

title: Congregation on S.I. Celebrates First Holiday in Its Own Home
description: One year the Jewish migrants to Staten Island, most of them from Brooklyn, worshiped in an empty flea market. Another year they held services in a circus tent. They prayed in Lutheran and Episcopalian churches. They carried their Torahs in a handmade closet on wooden legs.

title: LISBON PREMIER'S PLANE DELAYED BY BOMB THREAT
description: LISBON, Dec. 15 (AP)  A chartered Portuguese airliner carrying Prime Minister Mrio Soares to Brazil made an unscheduled stop in the Canary Islands today after officials received a telephoned. warning that a bomb was on board.

title: Books of The Times
description: We have savored questions about MaoAmerican civilizations before and we shall savor them again because they are as delicious as they are seemingly imponderable. And if Peter Tompkins doesn't prove anything conclusively to diehard pragmatists in Mysteries of the Mexican Pyramids, it is perhaps because he did not really seek to prove anything, only make us consider the questions again, this time as a historymystery, the clues found in a panoply of respected scientists, mystics, adventurers, Spanish friars, corrupt politicians, thieves, engineers, astrologers, archeologists, artists and, yes, even crackpots, the last not always distinguishable from the former.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: THE SOUND OF TUCKER Tonight's tribute to Richard Tucker honors both the long career of the late Metropolitan Opera tenor and his devotion and commitment to the heritage of Jewish liturgy. Starting at 8:30 P.M., the Admissionfree session is a salute in word and song by colleagues and friends of Mr. Tucker. The place is Temple B'nal Jeshurun, 88th Street west of Broadway; the program ends this season's Dialogue 76 series.

title: Susan Meyer Is Married to Michael Bloomberg
description: Susan Elizabeth Barbara Meyer, daughter of Wing Comdr. Donald W. J. Brown, R.A.F., retired, and Mrs. Brown of Malta, was married yesterday to Michael Rubens Bloomberg, general partner in charge of equity trading and sales for Salomon Brothers, a New York brokerage company. Rabbi David M. Posner performed the ceremony in Temple EmanuEL

title: People in Sports
description: Who better to coach the Longhorns than a Cowboy? Obviously, the University of Texas bought that logic, because yesterday Fred Akers, the head football coach at Wyoming, , was named head football coach at Texas, succeeding Darrell Royal, who resigned two weeks ago after 20 years in the job. Akers, who was a top assistant to Royal for eight years, thus rejoins the Longhorns after two years with the Cowboys.

title: Koreans Linked To Bid to Use U.S. Educators
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 15  In the spring of 1973, as the 20th anniversary of the end of the Korean War drew close, a South Korean dropped in on a faculty member of a leading Eastern university to chat. In the course of a seemingly casual conversation, the Korean offered the professor $50,000 if he could arrange to have Time magazine or Newsweek run a picture of President Park Chung Hee on the cover with a commemorative story in the magazine.

title: PROTEST TO SOUTH AFRICA BY FORD AND CARTER URGED
description: President Ford and Presidentelect Jimmy Carter were urged yesterday by an organization of professionals and businessmen to protest vigorously the detention of black journalists by the Government of South Africa.

title: New York State Cuts Ineligibles On Welfare Roll
description: A 30month federally sponsored drive has helped to halve the proportion of families on welfare who do not legally belong on the rolls in New York State, saving millions of dollars, Federal and city officials reported yesterday.

title: A.T. &T. Profit In Quarter Tops $1 Billion Again
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company continued its strong earnings pace by announcing yesterday the second consecutive quarter in which it had a profit of more than $1 billion.

title: Zoo Destroys a Sick Elephant That Attacked Keeper
description: The Central Park Zoo's 30yearold elephant, Julia, was destroyed yesterday in her cage near Fifth Avenue and 65th Street by the zoo's veterinarian for a variety of reasons including the fact that she had attacked a keeper.

title: Senator Bateman Announces Candidacy for Governor
description: NEWARK, Dec. 15 Senator Raymond H. Bateman, Republican of Somerville, announced his candidacy for Governor today and foresaw a hotly contested primary next June.

title: G.E.Utah International Merger, A $2.17 Billion Deal, Is Approved
description: The $2.17 billion merger of Utah International Inc. into the General Electric Companythe nation's largest mergerwas approved yesterday by shareholders of both companies. The merger, involving the exchange of General Electric shares for those of Utah International on the basis of 1.3 shares of General Electric for each of the 31.5 million Utah International shares outstanding, will become effective Monday, when Utah International, an international mining company, will become a wholly owned subsidiary of General Electric.

title: About New York
description: The shoppingbag women get even more mysterious in winter, for they don layers of the rags they have been packing all year like heirlooms and turn into fibrous wraiths. The rag swathing spares us their facial expressions.

title: Talks Canceled As Ballet Strike Enters 4th Day
description: The musicians strike against the Mw York City Ballet begins its fourth dry today and negotiations have been canceled as both sides contend they will not be moved.

title: Antarctic Ice Defeats Its Drillers
description: ROSS ICE SHELF, Antarctica, Dec. 14The bold effort to drill more than a guarter of a mile through this apron of floating ice into the lost world sea beneath it has been choked to death.

title: CHIEF LAME DEER, SIOUX; AUTHOR ON INDIAN LIFE
description: DENVER, Dec. 15 (UPI)A Sioux medicine man, Chief Lame Deer, who described attempts to adjust traditional Indian beliefs with the modern world in a book entitled Lame Deer, Seeker of Visions, died of an apparent cardiac arrest yesterday. He was 81 years old.

title: A Bomb in Buenos Aires Kills 15 In a Theater at Defense Ministry
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 15 (AP)  A powerful bomb exploded tonight at a Defense Ministry building in downtown Buenos Aires, killing at least 15 persons and injuring 30 or more, police sources report

title: Carter Inviting 50,000 to Parties For Inaugural on Recycled Paper
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (AP)An estimated 50,000 persons across the country this week will receive printed invitations to attend one of the six inaugural parties honoring Presidentelect Jimmy Carter.

title: DOW ADVANCES 3.16 ON 6TH GAIN IN ROW
description: The stock market continued to advance yesterday in steppedup trading, the Dow Jones industrial average posting its sixth gain in a row.

title: OPEC Conference: Board Meeting and Bazaar
description: DOHA, Qatar, Dec. 15Saudi Arabia's Sheik Ahmed Zaki Yemeni, Iran's Jamshid Amuzegar and other veteran negotiators at the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries were suave and smiling as the OPEC pricesetting meeting began here todaydespite the eeriness of the meeting site, which is a banquet hall, partly bulletproofed, in a hotel here in the capital of this isolated Arab emirate.

title: Times Expands In Westchester And Connecticut
description: The New York Times will put out two new regional Sunday sectionsthe Westchester Weekly and the Connecticut Weeklybeginning Feb. 6.

title: Top BlackCollege Stars Are Honored
description: Doug Williams, the Grambling quarterback, and Robert (Mickey) Sims, South Carolina State defensive tackle, last night joined a growing list of Mutual Black Network offensive and defensive players of the year who hoped to make it in the pros.

title: Books of The Times
description: New England is the parent of the United States, says Hal Borland in A Place to Begin, with all that the word implies timeworn values, discipline, continuity, nostalgia, ambivalence, identity, origins. New England may be America's Sunday self: starchy, still looking for God or an equivalent, a historical museum of American attitudes. For some who have moved there from big cities, it is a charade or costume party, a place where they can escape what Sandor Ferenzci called Sunday neurosis by trying to put down roots in a flower pot like Greenwich or Westport.

title: CasoVows Fight for Renomination As the Nassau County Executive
description: MINEOLA, LI., Dec. 15Brushing off suggestions by Republican leaders that he step aside and accept a judgeship, Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso reiterated today his Intention to fight for renomination next year against two G.O.P. challengers and over the opposition of the Nassau County Republican chairman, Joseph M. Margiotta.

title: Carter Finding Few Outsiders
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15  Presidentelect Jimmy Carter promised new faces in his Cabinet, and there is a great deal of grumbling that he is not delivering. But the issue is complicated because talk of new faces generally brings expectations of people who are not Washington insiders or someone from one field to head a department in another, or, as Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, put it in an interview, someone not in the pocket of a power bloc.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Connecticut Five Wins, 6551
description: DURHAM, N. H., Dec. 16 (AP)Behind the 23point scoring of Tony Hansen, a senior, Connecticut downed New Hampshire 6551, tonight in college basketball.

title: Coaches Leaving Jobs Amid P.S.A.L. Cuts
description: After years of wandering in the wasteland of football failure, Monroe and Flushing found enthusastic young coaches and success. Now, as a result of the city's fiscal woes the young coachesJerry Horowitz of Monroe and Jim maugeri of Flushing have lost their teaching jobs and the two schools have lost their young coaches. A year after New York began cutting back to close its budget gaps, the Public Schools Athletic League is really feeling the crunch. Coaches, many of them young, have been excessed out of their teaching jobs at their schools, or out of the Board of Education altogether.. Some have stayed to coach, but in many cases teams have been dropped because a qualified coach wasn't available and some schools have lost successful coaches.

title: Lockheed Bribes Denied in Italy By ExPremier and 2 Colleagues
description: ROME, Dec. 16 (Reuters)Former Prime Minister Mariano Rumor and two former defense ministers tonight denied having received bribes from the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation.

title: Schultze, Brzezinski and Young Are Named by Carter
11 OTHERS ADDING 10%
description: DOHA, Qatar, Friday, Dec. 17Oilproducing countries agreed early this morning to disagree on prices for the next six months, with the giant Saudi Arabian output and that of the United Arab Emirates to increase in price by 5 percent, while the 11 other member countries raise their prices 10 percent.

title: Schlitz Discharges 3 Executives In Reaction to Kickback Inquiry
description: The Jos. Schlitz Brewing Company announced yesterday a major shakeup in its marketing department resulting from an investigation begun more than a year ago by the Securities and Exchange Commission into questionable trade practices.

title: Housing Development in Brooklyn Is Approved by Board of Estimate
description: The SchermerhornPacific middleincome housing development in downtown Brooklyn narrowly won final approval by the New York City Board of Estimate yesterday after four hours of debate over its merits among community residents, housing organizations and elected officials.

title: NOTEHOLDERS PRESS NEW YORK FOR CASH
description: The attorney for aggrieved holders of New York City's shortterm notes petitioned the State Court of Appeals yesterday for redemption of the notes in cash by November 1977, while city and state officials pondered various alternatives on how to meet his demands.

title: Rangers Fall, 7 to 2, To Rugged Sabres
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 16The New York Rangers, innocently hoping to extend their nonlosing streak, happened to get in the way of the inspired Sabres tonight and took a severe drubbing, 72, before a capacity house of 16,433 in Memorial Auditorium.

title: Rhodesian Leader Rejects Role For Britain in Interim Regime
description: QUE QUE, Rhodesia, Dec. 16 (Reuters) Prime Minister Ian D. Smith today rejected a British role in an interim government leading to black majority rule in Rhodesia.

title: The Drug Markets
description: One day last week The Times reported that after a secret visit by Mayor Beame and Police Commissioner Codd ta some of the major street drug markets in Harlem, a 140man police task force was put into operation and shortly arrested more than 400 people for the possession or the sale of drugs. Two days later, a Post reporter described how easy it had been for him to purchase heroin from his car at two different uptown locations despite the crackdown.

title: FARMING IS INCLUDED IN RESEARCH PLANS
description: TRENTON, DEC. 16If New Jersey gets $6 million in requested Federal cancer research grants, scientists will investigate the state's agriculture business as well as chemical industries in search of the reason for New Jersey's having the nation's highest cancer death rate.

title: India Bars an American
description: A study tour of India by a group of American specialists in economic development has been canceled because the Indian Government said the organizer would be unwelcome.

title: The Theater: Iguana, Effectively Revised
description: WE SOMETIMES forget that Tennessee Williams is a comic writer. An ironic comic writer musing on the lonely tragedy of separateness, but musing with some humor. Most of his playsnot The Glass Menagerie, perhaps, and certainly not Outcry"might be justifiably termed moral comedies.

title: For Children
description: Plays

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

title: Owners of FosterCare Homes Reportedly Triple Investments
description: A small group of investors, operating through a chain of related corporations, has been able to get a threefold return on its capital by mortgaging foster homes for substantially more than they cost to acquire. The banks that granted the mortgages apparently did so because repayment was guaranteed by longterm city leases of the facilities.

title: Ford to Ask Acceleration Of Earthquake Research In the Forthcoming Budget
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (UPI)President Ford will propose in next year's Federal budget accelerated earthquake research,three new space projects and new agricultural research,the President's science adviser said today.

title: . . . Ambassador to U.N. . .
description: Presidentelect Carter's appointment of Representative Andrew J. Young to be United States Ambassador to the United Nations may well turn out to be a great boon for everyone but the appointee himself. In naming Mr. Young, Governor Carter has indeed departed from predictability and has got himself a firstclass envoy to boot. Whether as an aide to Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., as an effective young Congressman or as a key and steadfast supporter of the Carter candidacy, Mr. Young has displayed an engaging combination of intellect, independence and good judgment, which he couples with a talent for mediation.

title: Yugoslav Seeks U.N. Assembly Post
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 16Deputy Foreign Minister Jazar Mojsov of Yugoslavia has declared his candidacy for president of next year's United Nations General Assmbly, His election is expected in view of the regional rotation system that nuts an East European in line for the job,

title: News Summary
description: International

title: A Look at a Small Southern Town
description: What with the daily bulletins from Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's transition headquarters in Plains, Ga., a Southern small town has become imprinted in our consciousness through television. As I take my daily pan down Main Street, though, I sometimes wonder what the town is really like behind its blank facade of brick storefronts and arcades. All we see is a video villagea sort of stage set in which the Carters, visiting jobseekers and newsmen act out. their rituals, like actors in a Noh play. Yet the reality of Plains might tell us something about the man who will be running the country.

title: Economic Adviser...
description: In naming Charles L. Schultze as chairman of his Council of Economic Adviser...Presidentelect Carter has chosen an able and experienced economist whose personal qualities of humility and dedication to human values are as worthy of notice as his intellectual ability.

title: HaggeMorgan Lead by Stroke In Mixed Golf
description: MIAMI, Dec. 16  Strategy readied new heights today as Marlene Hagge and Dr. Gil Morgan took a onestroke lead in professional golf's most unusual tournament, the $200,000 PepsiCola mixed team championship.

title: Stage: Gemini, Exuberant Cartoon
description: THE COMIC VISION of Albert Innaurato is fiendishly demonstrated in Gemini, at Playwrights Horizon, as it was in the author's earlier The Transfiguration of Benno Blimpie. Mr. Innaurato's instrument is not a needle, but a cleaver. There is a savagery in his humor that is, in a strange way, refreshing at the same time that it is terrifying.

title: Ashton B. Collins Sr., 91, Reddy Kilowatt Creator And Publicity Executive
description: Ashton B. Collins Sr., a retired public relations executive who 40 years ago created the electrical industry trademark figure Reddy Kilowatt, died Tuesday at his Cincinnati home. He was 91 years old.

title: Advertising
description: Back in 1969 a newspaper said that National Student Marketing may be the first major American corporation based almost exclusively on the spending power of the young.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates fa Thursday:

title: Madrid Rejoices Over Poll Victory
description: MADRID, Dec. 16The Government today savored its overwhelming victory in yesterday's national referendum on its political reform programa victory that seemed to be at once a formal rejection of the Franco past and a sign of a certain docility in the electorate.

title: Musical Meeting Of East and West
description: What promises to be a most interesting concert of presentday Japanese music will take place Sunday night in Alice Tully Hall. The interest derives not only from hearing a program devoted entirely to New York, American or world premieres, but also from what it Suggests about the whole fascinating phenomenon of contemporary music in Japan.

title: 6 Arrested in Britain On Currency Fraud; $1.6 Million Involved
description: LONDON, Dec. 16 (AP)A senior official of the Bank of England and five others were arrested today on charges linked to an alleged $1.6 million fraud, Scotland Yard announced.

title: Vietnam Premier Says Population Redistribution Will Start Early in 77
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 16Vietnam's Prime Minister, Pham Van Dong, announced today that the projected largescale redistribution of the nation's population would begin early next year with the shifting of surplus labor from densely settled areas.

title: Article 4  No Title
S.E.C. Clashes With Boeing Co. Over Payments
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission says it has traced large suspicious payments by the Boeing Company to some foreign officials and other agents who have helped the company sell its planes to governments and airlines overseas.

title: OTHERS OPT FOR 10%
description: DOHA, Qatar, Friday, Dec. 17Oilproducing countries agreed early this morning to disagree on prices for the next six months, with the giant Saudi Arabian output and that of the United Arab Emirates to increase in price by 5 percent, while the 11 other member countries raise their prices 10 percent.

title: ChoateRosemary Hall Boys and Girls Apart
description: WALLINGFORD, Conn., Dec. 16In McComb, Miss., today, Greg Wells will be hunting squirrels. George Zeller's plane will just be touching down in Ghana. Allison Lee is probably adjusting her ski bindings on a mountain in Switzerland, and Paul Castroberti is revving up his Corvette.

title: Girl Gets $57,000 in Bear Attack
description: KURAYOSHI, Japan, Dec, 16 (Reuters) A 7yearold girl whose arm was bitten off by a bear in a zoo here three years ago was awarded $57,000 by a district court today. The girl, Setsuko Kotani, was attacked by the bear when sheatried to feed it.

title: Two Guys Stores Is in Contempt For Violating Sunday Sales Pact
description: HACKENSACK, Dec. 16 Vornado Inc., the parent company of Two Guys department stores, was held in contempt of court today for violating a court agreement not to defy the state's Sunday blue laws.

title: Luis Tiant's Reunion Ends
description: He is a paunchy, glowering 36yearold man with a black mustache and the looks of a Mexican bandit and, when he strides to the mound in Fenway Park to pitch for the Boston Red Sox, the other team often complains that he also has the ethics of a Mexican bandit.

title: Schultze, Brzezinski and Young Are Named by Carter
description: PLAINS, Ga. Dec. 16Presidentelect Jimmy Carter added three new names to his incoming administration today, including its first black member, Representative Andrew Young, chosen to become the chief United States delegate to the United Nations.

title: Broadway
description: FRED GWYNNE and Frances Sternhagen will star in the musical version of Look Homeward, Angel when it arrives here in April after opening at the Shubert Theater in Boston in March. Philip Rose is both producing and directing Angel, which has music by Gary Geld, lyrics by Peter Udell and a book by Mr. Udell and Ketti Frings. It is based, of course, on the novel by Thomas Wolfe.

title: Speer Expects Rise For Steel to Stand
description: Edgar B. Speer; the, chairman of the United States Steel Corporation, said in New York yesterday that he expected the industry's recent 6 percent price increase for certain products to be sustained. *Mr. Speer said he had detected no discounting from the new price for flatrolled products, which are used to make automobiles and appliances such as refrigerators.

title: Article 3  No Title
3D BUSINESS GROUP IN FAVOR OF TAX CUT
