description: A third business group has come out in favor of a prompt tax cut next year, reflecting the business community's broad support for a tax reduction preferably permanent.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: 4 Indicted in Bribery Case

title: Citibank Retail Unit Assigned to W.RG.
description: Citibank, the state's largest bank, having carefully looked at four agencies, has decided to assign its retail banking division to Wells, Rich, Greene. The billings are expected to be $3.5 million to $4 million.

title: FUNDS TO BE SOUGHT: FOR FORD BUILDINGS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16A nationwide drive will be started early next year to raise money for a library to house President Fold's papers and a museum. in which to display his memorabilia, Philip W. Buchen, the President's counsel, said today.

title: A Threat in Guidelines
description: WASHINGTON  Several recent actions taken by the bureaucracy in Washington make it abundantly clear that the executive branch of Government is involved in a farreaching effort to reinterpret legislative and judicial mandates on equal opportunity to the detriment of minorities and women. These actions can only be interpreted as a Federal retreat from the national commitment to equal opportunity.

title: Optimism and Hope on Outlook in Mexico
description: MEXICO CITYIf the visitor did not know that the tall, softspoken executive discussing Mexico's economy in a midtown office here was a United States citizen and the president of the American Chamber of Commerce, there would be an inclination to suspect the speaker was Government minister of trade and tourism or an enthusiastic Mexican national.

title: 1,000 at Rites for Parole Officer Slain Trying to Arrest ExConvict
description: A thousand parole officers from New York and nearby states last night attended the funeral of Barry Sutherland, the 32yearold parole officer who was shot to death Monday afternoon when he sought to arrest a former convict.

title: Miss Morerod Captures Slalom And Takes Lead for World Cup
description: CORTINA d'AMPEZZO, Italy, Dec. 16 (AP)LiseMarie Morerod of Switzerland won the women's special slalom today and took the lead in the World Cup standing from Annemarie Proell Moser of Austria ,who was best in the combined.

title: Smaller Takeout By Tracks Urged
description: How can horse racing's diverse elements cut themselves bigger slices of pie when the pie itself continues to shrink?

title: Pound Is Down, And the Dollar Falls Sharply
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 16 (UPI) The pound sterling weakened further on European money markets today, reflecting widespread disappointment in the British Government's latest economic measures. The dollar fell sharply against the West German mark and weakened against other Euroman currencies.

title: Olga Korbut, Still the One They Like to Watch
description: You remember ner at Munich four years ago. On the uneven bars, her ponytails flapping like flags. On the balance beam, bending like a pretzel. In the floor exercise, prancing like a thoroughbred, going for best in show. She was a star there.

title: A Duo That Draws the Crowd
description: Millsenblum, the eccentric duo that has been attracting a rabid following at Tramp's 125 East 15th Street, was having a rough night. Galen Blum, the group's vocalist, was recovering from the flu, and David Mills, her guitar accompanist and songwriting partner, looked apprehensive. The timing of their act seemed, a little off and when they sat down to talk after the show, Miss Blum nursing a pot of hot tea, they had to be reassured that the applause they had received was genuine.

title: Federal Reserve Statement
description: (millions of dollars) Daily Averages for the weeks ended: (Dec. 15, 76) (Dec. 8, 76) (Dec.17, 75)

title: Jazz: Deodato's jamming
description: Eumir Deodato, a Brazilian arranger and pianist, was the culprit resporsiblefor converting The Theme From 2001 Thus Spake Zarathustra) into a jazzflavored disco number a few years ago. He has been performing in Latin America for the last two years, but he has continued to release records, and they have followed a similar formula. Light classical numbers, pop kitsch and original compositions, enveloped in pretentiously glossy orchestrations, frameextended jazzrock solos that range from good to excellent.

title: Damage to Pine Barrens Feared From Cities, Suburbs and the Sea
description: WARREN GROVE, Dec. 16Environmentalists expressed fresh fears today that the New Jersey Pine Barrens, a millionacre nearwilderness stretching across. six counties in the southeastern part of the state, would be destroyed unless the state acted to forestall development brought by suburbanization, offshore oil drilling and casino gambling in Atlantic City.

title: HOUSING PERMITS UP BY 6% IN NOVEMBER WHILE STARTS FELL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (UPI) Housing starts fell 6 percent in November, but permits for new home construction climbed an encouraging 6 percent, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: When a Patient's Dreams Put Him to Sleep, He May Defy Analysis
description: When the patient on his couch fell asleep, Dr. David M. Hurst, a New York psychoanalyst, knew that it meant something. In life, and certainly in psychoanalysis, everything means something.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Rises 3%
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 15.8 billion tonmiles, 3 percent above the yearearlier level. Carloadings in the same period totaled 454,707 cars, off 2 percent from last year. The American Trucking Associations Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage rose 6.9 percent from last year.

title: Just a Minute, Jimmy
description: It was good to hear Presidentelect Carter say the other day that he had conducted his Presidential campaign so that no one and no group has any veto power or authority over his appointments. That meant he had made no specific commitments to get specific votes, which is reassuring as to the essential independence and integrity of the new President.

title: Zbigniew Brzezinski
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16For the last three years, Zbigniew Brzezinski has been giving free advice on foreign affairs to Jimmy Carter. More than anyone, he introduced the former Georgia Governor to the world of international relations and kept him abreast of current issues through a steady stream of articles, clippings and phone calls. Today, Mr. Carter acknowledged a debt to his tutor by naming him to the critical job of national security adviser to the White House.

title: A Time for Carols And Cantatas
description: So RICH is the number of Christmas musical events in the metropolitan region that a swiftmoving music lover could map out a way to attend 42 concerts, most of them free, during the next two weeks by racing back and forth across town to churches and concert halls.

title: Rutgers Five Beats Drexel
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., Dec. 16 (AP)Ed Jordan paced a balanced Rutgers attack tonight with 19 points as the Scarlet Knights defeated Drexel, 9368, in basketball. The loss was the first of the season for the Dragons.

title: Notes on People
description: Never mind her wellknown fondness for diamonds, these days the Baltimore police are a girl named Carol Channing's best friends. A $30,000 fulllength white mink coat disappeared from Miss Channing's hotel suite last Monday, but the police have picked up two men who were allegedly trying to sell the coat on the street. They were charged with burglary. Miss Charming was full of praise for Baltimore's finest, and she recalled that in an alltoosimilar theft six years ago inLondon, Scotland Yard unable to recover her coat.

title: Lear Siegler Bids $13.50 Per Share Of Royal Industries
description: Lear Siegler Inc., of Santa Monica, Calif., announced yesterday that it planned to offer $13.50 a share for any and all shares of Royal Industries of Pasadena. The offer, which will be in competition with one by Monogram Industries, would total $77.3 million if all of the 5.726,749 outstanding shares are ten dered.

title: Reserve Board Supports A Cut to 25% From 50% On Stock Margin Options
description: The Federal Reserve Board proposed yesterday that option specialists be permitted to obtain stock on a 25 percent margin when buying it in their option operations. The regu.lar margin requirement is 50 percent.

title: Survey Says That NBCTV Is Leader of All Networks In Violence in Prime Time
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (UPI)The National Citizens Committee for Broadcasting said today that NBCTV led all the networks in primetime violence in the fall season, and that General Motor? Chevrolet division sponsored the greatest number of violent programs.

title: People and Business
description: Richard E. Bell, an American Agriculture Department official, said yesterday that he did not expect the Soviet Union to buy any more American grain anytime soon. Mr. Bell told reporters after conferring with Soviet foreign trade officials that the Russians had already purchased 251.8 million bushels of wheat and corn trom the 1976 United States crop. This amounts to 6.6 metric tons, more than the minimum of 6 million tons required under a United StatesSoviet agreement. A metric ton is. 2,200 pounds, compared with 2,000 pounds in the United States ton.

title: Squash Tourney Opens Today
description: The first New York Metropolitan women's open squash tournament will be held at the Manhattan Squash Club, through Sunday. Matches start at 5 P.M. today and it 10 A.M. tomorrow and Sunday. more than double the record $25 million ABC paid for the rights to last summer's Olympic Games in Montreal. Despite high ratings, the network reported only a small profit from that venture.

title: ROSEMARY LEVI
description: Rosemary Levi, a teacher in Lindgren Nursery School, Closter, N. J., and from 1955 to 1957 assistant personnel director of Radio Free Europe in New York City, died Monday in Roosevelt Hospital, Manhattan, after a long illness. She lived on Irving Avenue, Closter, and was 48 years old.

title: Pilate by Bentley At Actors Studio
description: Now In the Nativity season, Eric Bentley, scholar of the stage, teacher and playwright, is dealing with the other end of the Gospel story. His play. From the Memoirs of Pontius Pilate, being shown today through. Sunday at The Actors Studio, is the story of the passion of Jesus seen through the cool, bemused and rational eyes of Pilate, very much as an officer of the British army in India might recount the history and fate of Mahatma Gandhi.

title: Miki Will Resign As Japan's Leader
description: TOKYO, Friday, Dec. 17Prime Minister Takeo Miki announced today his intention to resign the leadership of the governing Liberal Democratic Party next week once a successor has been chosen.

title: Boone Star As Kings Top Nets
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 16 (AP) Ron Boone scored 21 of his gamehigh 29 points in the second half tonight as the Kansas City Kings posted a 10090 National Basketball Association victory over the New York Nets.

title: Tips on Tickets
description: Tickets to tonight's concert are priced at $5, $6, $7 and $8. They can be bought at the Avery Fisher box office, which is open today from 10. A.M. to 8 P.M. For information call 8742424.

title: Talks Planned Today In City Ballet Strike
description: Negotiations between the New York City Ballet and the striking members of its orchestra are scheduled to resume today at 10 A.M. in the World Trade Center offices of Vincent D. McDonnell, the chairman of the State Mediation Board.

title: Consultants Back a Disputed Hospital in Westchester
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. I6A managementconsulting firm retained by the Westchester County administration estimated today that the muchdisputed 500bed hospital that the county plans to open at its medical center in Valhalla in April could have an 85 percent occupancy rate in four or five years.

title: Market Declines On Profit Taking After 6 Advances
description: Profittaking sent the stock market moderately lower yesterday after six consecutive sessions of advances.

title: Sword of Charles X Stolen From the Louvre
description: PARIS, Dec. 16 (UPI)Three masked burglars broke into the Louvre museum at dawn today and stole the priceless diamond  studded sword of King Charles X from a showcase.

title: Carter Says Many Have Declined Posts; Mentions 3 Blacks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16Presidentelect Jimmy Carter disclosed today that a number of prominent Americans, several of them black, had declined highlevel positions in his administration.

title: NIXON IS RULED LIABLE IN HALPERIN WIRETAP
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 A Federal District Court judge ruled here today that former President Richard M. Nixon and two members of his Administration had deprived Morton Halperin and his family of their constitutional rights by having their home telephone tapped for 21 months.

title: Holiday Concert Set By Somers Chorale
description: The Somers (N.Y.) Chorale will present a holiday concert this Sunday at 2:30 P.M. in the Somers High School auditorium. The program will include traditional Christmas and Hanukkah songs as well as highlights from Amahl and the Night Visitors and The Saint of Bleecker Street.

title: Finley Opens Attack on Kuhn As Trial Starts
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 16 (AP)Charles O. Finley's $3.5 million lawsuit against Bowie Kuhn, the baseball commissioner, opened in Federal court today with Finley's attorney charging that Kuhn took actions to punish an old enemy.

title: COURT ACTION SLOW AGAINST LANDLORDS
description: Two weeks after two landlords were arrested and charged with willful failure to provide heat and hot water in three Harlem tenements, their cases have barely begun to creep through the criminaljustice system.

title: Metropolitan Baedeker
description: ORCHARD STREET is a narrow, unprepossessing Lower East Side thoroughfare that is eight blocks long and is probably the nation's oldest shopping center still in business. jt has no cultural institutions (except one school), no historical shrines and is devoid of places to eat (except for one coffee shop). Yet on Sundays it is the place to be, crowded with the many faces of New York and, in its upper reaches, devoid of motor traffic. Weekends and during the week, the license plates that visit Orchard number many from New Jersey and Connecticut and many cars come from New York's outer reaches. Orchard Street is where the canny bargain hunter always returns, in good times and bad.

title: Around the Nation
description: SPRINGFIELD, III., Dec: 16 (AP)?? Illinois Senate today rejected ratitication of the equal rights amendment to thu United States Constitution, despite an appeal for passage from Presidentelect Jimmy Carter.

title: Guerrillas in Argentina Assert They Planted Bomb Fatal to 9
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 16 (Reuters)Leftwing Montonero guerrillas claimed responsibility today for a bomb explosion inside an Argentine Defense Ministry building that authorities said killed nine people and injured 19.

title: Pop Life
description: TODAY'S SUBJECT is noise. Specifically, the excessive noise levels at rock concerts. The whole issue struck us once again the other day during a radio interview. The interviewer, a kindly man whose taste in music and in volume levels was formed during the 1930's and 1940's, asked the obvious question: Why do rock concerts have to be so loud? And once again, this observer was unable to come up with a ready answer.

title: Artis, on Stand in Trial With Carter, Denies Firing Any Gun at Anyone
description: PATERSON, N.J., Dec. 16Under tense cross  examination today, John Ards again declared his innocence in the Lafayette Grill triple murders, for which he and Rubin (Hurricane) Carter have been standing trial a second time.

title: U.S. Aides Say 2Tier Pricing of Oil Reflects Sign of Cartel's Crumbling
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16United States officials said tonight that the reported twoprice outcome of the oil cartelmember negotiations, if officially confirmed tomorrow, would be a longawaited and eagerly sought sign that the cartel's tight pricing discipline was finally starting to crumble.

title: CONCORDE PROVIDING DATA ON ATMOSPHERE
description: Sonic waves from the Concorde supersonic airliner, which are being monitored daily by Columbia University researchers, are providing new clues to the nature of temperatures and winds in the Earth's upper atmosphere.

title: 25YearstoLife Terms Are Given to 2 for Killing A Good Samaritan in 75
description: Two men convicted of killing a Good Samaritan while holding up a Brooklyn candy store on Dec. 17, 1975, were sentenced yesterday to serve 25 years to life in prison for seconddegree murder.

title: KISSINGER AND WALDHEIM DISCUSS MIDEAST PARLEY
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 16 Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger met here today with Secretary General Kurt Waldheim to discuss efforts to reconvene the Geneva Conference on the Middle East early next year.

title: Holiday Shopping Sluggish With PriceCutting Heavy
description: New York's Christmas shopping season, now entering its final week, has been marked by sluggish customer response, heavy pricecutting by stores and Sunday openings that have drawn some new customers but offended others.

title: Brzezinski Says He'll Give Advice To Carter Only When He Asks for It
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16  Zbigniew Brzezinski, Jimmy Carter's choice to be his White House national security adviser, said today that his duties would be to help the President integrate policy and faciliate decisions, and that he would give policy advice only if asked.

title: Soybean Futures Gain; Wheat Unchanged
description: Soybean futures contracts gained a few cents a bushel yesterday, with the January delivery closing at $6.91 a bushel, up from $6.86 on the Chicago Board of trade. The firmness in the beans was Atributable to good commercial buying, ?? by experters, amid news that Europeans were aggressively seeking both beans and soybean oil.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Dec. 16 John J. Horn, State Commissioner of Labor and Industry, outlined today plans for restructuring the department, including establishing an Office of Industrial Hygiene and Occupational Safety, extending a computer system for paying unemployment benefits and stepping up efforts to curb the employment of aliens.

title: Article 2  No Title
World News Briefs
description: Palestinians in Lebanon Resist Yielding Arms

title: TWO FOREIGN DIPLOMATS SCORE BAN ON CONCORDE
description: New York's continued ban on landings of the supersonic Concorde jet jeopardizes the city's position as a business capital and national gateway, the consuls general of Britain and France contended in New York yesterday.

title: Post at U.N. Brings Prestige to Holder but Little Power
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 16Shuttling uneasily between the Cabinet Room of the White House and the hall of the General Assembly, the United States representative to the United Nations is a hybrid personagepart politician, part diplomat, but also part decoration on the outer wrappings of policy.

title: Article 1  No Title
TELEVISION TODAY
description: Morning

title: Antiques
description: E TEND TO forget how vigorous such themes as hearts and flowers and trumpeting angels can beespecially at this time of year when mawkish greeting cards flood our mailboxes.

title: Tips on Tickets
description: The Boys Choir of Harlem. St. Paul's Chapel, 117th Street and Amsterdam Avenue. Saturday at 7:30. Reservations may be made by calling 2349377 between 10 and 3; ticket information may be obtained by calling 2839792 or 7815644. Tickets are $5 for adults and $3 for the elderly and children.

title: Highs and Lows
description: NEW HIGHS106

title: Market Place
description: These days, institutions commonly dump shares of any corporation that issues a disappointing earnings report. The selling often involves big blocks of 10,000 or more shares at a clip.

title: Fire Ruins Four Coast Buildings
description: ONTARIO, Calif., Dec. 16 (AP)  A winddriven blaze touched off by a fireplace spark destroyed four townhouse apartment buildings and extensively damaged a dozen others in this Los Angeles suburb last night.

title: Jamaica Chief, Landslide Victor, Warns of Difficult Times Ahead
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, Dec. 16 (Reuters) Within an hour of his landslide election victory, Prime Minister Michael Manley told Jamaicans today that tough times lay ahead.

title: SWINE FLU PROGRAM SUSPENDED IN NATION; DISEASE LINK FEARED
description: Federal officials suspended the troubled nationwide swine flu immunization program yesterday because of concern that the shots were possibly linked to recently reported cases of pararysis.

title: Charles Louis Schultze
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 16Charles L. Schultze has wound up with the job as chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers in the Carter administration, but it is a measure of the man that he was also seriously considered for Secretary of Defense, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare and Secretary of the Treasury. With his background as director of the allencompassing Bureau of the Budget in the Johnson Administration and his studies during the past eight years of the cost and relative value of virtually every Federal program, it is possible that he may know more about more different aspects of the Government than anyone in the country.

title: Amedeo L. Lauritano Dies at 66, A Former New York Magistrate
description: Amedeo L. Lauritano, a former New York City magistrate and a former Assistant United States attorney in the Southern District of New York, died yesterday at his home. He was 66 years old and lived at 415 East 52d Street.

title: Miki Will Resign As Japan's Leader
description: TOKYO, Friday, Dec. 17Prime Minister Takeo Miki announced today his intention to resign the leadership of the governing Liberal Democratic Party next week once a successor has been chosen.

title: BOND PRICES LOWER AFTER A YOYO DAY
description: The credit markets declined yesterday, but their downward path from the close Wednesday to the close last night was not direct. Bond prices dropped sharply at the opening in reaction to the substantial November increase in industrial production, then recovered as the Federal Reserve purchased Treasury securities and finally drifted lower after the nation's money supply was reported to have increased $800 million for the week ended Dec. 8.

title: SWINE FLU PROGRAM SUSPENDED IN NATION; DISEASE LINK FEARED
description: Federal officials suspended the troubled nationwide swine flu immunization program yesterday because of concern that the shots were possibly linked to recently reported cases of paralysis.

title: Inquiry Hints a Victim of Crash Left Four Widows in Two Nations
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 16 (AP)Helen Sharp went to Minnesota yesterday to bury her husband. When she arrived, investigators were waiting with news that her husband may have left behind three other widows.

title: Lisbon Socialists Get a Go Signal but Road Has Pitfalls
description: LISBON, Dec. 16The big surprise in Portugal's local elections Sunday was the relative stability of the electorate. Above all, the elections demonstrated a certain fidelity to the ruling Socialist Party in spite of a series of unpopular measures taken by Prime Minister Mrio Soares's fourmonth old Government after two years of revolutionary extravagance, which brought the country to the brink of social and economic collapse.

title: Transcript of Carter's News Conference Introducing His Three New Appointees
description: I have great pleasure this afternoon in announcing to the nation three appointments that I have made to positions of major importance. The first one is Ambassador to the United Nations and I've been fortunate enough to convince Congressman Andrew Young to accept this appointment

title: Commodity Price Index Declines 0.6 From the WeekEarlier Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials fell to 199.6 from 200.2 last week.

title: CHARLES W. KERWOOD, 79; COMBAT PILOT IN 4 WARS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16Charles W. Kerwood, a retired Air Force colonel and a combat pilot in four wars, died here yesterday in Sibley Hospital after a long illness. He was 79 years old.

title: CARTER AIDES WIDEN A DRAFT PARDON PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (AP)Presidontelect Jimmy Carter's advisers have reached substantial agreement on a plan that could extend Mr. Carter's promise of clemency for draft violators to 250,000 Vietnamera servicemen with tarnished military records.

title: Board of Estimate Orders a Hearing on Transit Cuts
description: The Board of Estimate yesterday ordered the New York City Transit Authority to hold a public hearing on the implementation of the authority's proposed cuts in bus and subway services. But the authority, which had intended to put the cuts into effect Jan. 1 to save $30 million, refused to say whether it would comply with the order. A hearing would force a delay in implementation, probably until Jan. 15.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: Friday

title: Publishing: Writing On the Berlin Wall
description: GOVERNMENT SENSIBILITIES play a part in the flow of books across the Atlantic and across Europe's sensitive borders, too. What occurs in volatile bureaucratic officescall it the winds of chancellerycan often determine what writers write and licensed publishing houses publish.

title: A Show Where Literary Forms Imbue Crafts With Another Dimension
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15Craftsmen make things with their hands, yes. But they also make things with their minds.

title: Three Major Art Shows Open
description: AFEAST for the eyethis is how William Rubin, director of the Museum of Modern Art's Department of Painting and Sculpture, describes the extraordinary show of European Master Paintings from Swiss Collections that has just opened in the museum's main firstfloor galleries, and the show itself fully lives up to this promise of special pleasures. For this is, in the sheer quality and genius of the pictures on view, one of the most delectable exhibitions of modern painting ever mounted in a museum.

title: Book Describing Ordinary Soviet Trial Causes Stir in Paris
description: PARIS, Dec. 13A book describing itself as a transcript of an ordinary trial in the Soviet Union has just been published here with the announced aim of trying to win the release of the accused, a Soviet Jewish physician.

title: STEEL AIDE CRITICIZES CANDIDATES IN UNION
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 16The steel industry's chief negotiator in talks on a new contract with the United Steelworkers of America chided both candidates for the union presidency today, saying that they had not addressed themselves to the major problems besetting the industry.

title: Paris Will Embargo AtomicFuel Plants
description: PARIS, Dec. 16The French Government announced today that it would ban further exports of nuclear fuelreprocessing plants, which have the potential to produce plutonium for use in weapons.

title: PORTUGUESE EXPOLICEMAN DENIES CHARGE OF TORTURE
description: LISBON, Dec. 16One of the most prominent figures of the ousted Portuguese dictatorship's political police went on trial today and strongly denied accusations of maltreating prisoners.

title: Schultze, Brzezinski and Young Are Named by Carter
description: PLAINS, Ga. Dec. I6Presidentelect Jimmy Carter added three new names to his incoming administration today, including its first black member, Representative Andrew Young, chosen to become the chief United States delegate to the United Nations.

title: RADIO
description: Music

title: New Plan to Cut Time the Police Spend in Courts
description: A new arraignment system that will free police officers from longand what is regarded as unnecessaryovertime waiting at Criminal Court proceedings will begin Monday in Manhattan and Brooklyn, Mayor Beame announced yesterday.

title: . . . Security Adviser
description: In appointing Zbigniew Brzezinski to be his adviser for National Security Affairs, the Presidentelect has again turned to a known and trusted supporter. This is a selection that will place long experience and high competence in the White House.

title: Montrealers Beat Winter In an Underground World
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 16 It has been minus 15 degrees in Montreal for days but on the sidewalk terrace of the Salammbo Cafe one can drink comfortably in shirtsleeves. The cafe is on a Parisian street that has just opened here indoors as the latest manifestation of the weatherprotected way of life that this northern city has pioneered and continues to push into an everwidening network.

title: BRITAIN SETS REFERENDUM FOR SCOTLAND AND WALES
description: LONDON, Dec. 16 (Reuters)The British Government announced today that it would hold referendums in Scotland and Wales on its plans for limited home rule.

title: F.P.C. IS EXHORTED TO RAISE AMOUNT OF INTERSTATE GAS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16  The Federal Power Commission was told repeatedly today by naturalgas sellers and industrial tierq that unless the agency found ways within weeks to make more gas available for interstate sales, there could be production and job losses before the end ?? what has begun as an unusually cold heating season.

title: 2 Accused of Giving Medicaid Money To a Synagogue
description: Two partners in a nowdefunct Manhattan nursing home were charged yesterday by the state's special nursinghome prosecutor with having stolen about $50,000 in Medicaid funds, most of which they allegedly donated to a Brooklyn synagogue.

title: Tito Receives Nahum Goldmann
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Dec. 16 (UPI) President Tito met today with Nahum Goldmann, chairman of the World Jewish Congress, for talks about the Midale East. Mr. Goldmann arrived yesterday and left shortly after the meeting.

title: Closed Doors Cloud Reception of the Sunshine Law
description: The Emergency Financial Control Board met behind closed doors yesterday and considered, among other things, how to behave when the doors must be opened next month.

title: Intelligence Panel Is Investigating Friendly Governments Acts in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16The Senate Select Committee on Intelligence has begun an investigation into clandestine activities that have reportedly been conducted in the United States by the intelligence agencies of friendly foreign governments committee sources said today.

title: At the Movies
description: EXCUSE me, but are you Mr. Columbo? whispered the frail, saucereyed child as he approached the unshaven, impeccably rumpled man moodily gazing into his scrambled eggs in the Oak Room of the Plaza.

title: Turkish Troops in Nicosia Set Up Observation Post in a Greek Area
description: NICOSI, Cyprus,,Dec. 16 (AP)Turkish occupation troops moved about 25 yards into a Greek Cypricit area of Nicosia today and set. up an observation post atop an ancient wall.

title: FORD AIDES GLOOMY ON SOUTHERN AFRICA
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16A behindthescenes effort by the Ford Administration to bring about a Geneva conference on independence for SouthWest Africa has atalled and probably cannot be revived before Jimmy Carter takes office next month.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Andrew Jackson Young Jr.
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 16  Before he agreed to accept the job as chief United States delegate to the United Nations, Representative Andrew Young said that he made it clear to Cyrus R. Vance, the Secretary of Statedesignate, that he did not want a job simply selling United States policy to the rest of the world. I wanted Cyrus Vance to understand my kind of independent style, Mr. Young said in an interview here. And I wanted him to see that as a positive asset.

title: Events and Openings
description: Friday

title: New Plan to Cut Time the Police Spend in Courts
description: A new arraignment system that will free police officers from longand what is regarded as unnecessaryovertime waiting at Criminal Court proceedings will begin Monday in Manhittan and Brooklyn, Mayor Beame announced yesterday.

title: Carter's Amiable Computers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16The young Carter transition team is not only scouring the country for talent but is bubbling with ideas, some new and some old, and some borrowed from the parliamentary democracies, about how the new Administration will deal with its policy and political problems after Jan. 20.

title: Management
description: One of the jollier aspects of the Christmas season used to be bonuses, but it seems that they have become somewhat less generous in recent years.

title: About Real Estate
description: The group that is proposing an enclosed amusement park at the site of the former Madison Square Garden on Eighth Avenue is also putting forward plans for a major housing development in the metropolitan area.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Art: Pictures That Lead a Double Life
description: A NAMORPHOSES is not the easiest of words to pronounce, but it stands for an experience that a great many peopie find very easy to enjoy. Anamorphosis is, in fact, the name that we give to images that, when looked at from the right angle, change their meaning in ways that we cannot predict.

title: Books of The Times
description: REMEMBER the Paris Review interview, which has been the mainstay of George Plimpton's literary quarterly ever since he founded it 67 issues ago? In the old dayswhen the subjects of interviews were the likes of Forster, Faulkner, Frost and Eliot, and they were collected in volumes called Writers at Work, with introductions by such eminences as Malcolm Cowley, Van Wyck Brooks and Alfred Kazinwe used to read them to learn how good literary work was done. Do you typewrite in the nude? we sought to know, like movie fans trying to identify with their idols. Perhaps there was a knack to screwing the pencil into the fingers, and if we only knew it our genius would be tapped and refined like so much maple syrup.

title: Fiery Orator Entranced Crowds
description: Real Caouette, the outspoken leader of Cariada's Social Credit Party, was a fiery. orator whose armwaving delivery entranced crowds and brought him forcefully to national attention.

title: Eleanor Steber Concert May Be a Family Affair
description: Since this is the season for singers to trot out their families on television specials, Eleanor Steber seas nothing unusual in trying to persuade her brother and her 92yearold mother to sing at her Christmas Songfest with Friends at the Church of St. Paul and St. Andrew, 86th Street and West End Avenue. tonight (Dec. 17) at 8 P.M.

title: Navy Is Said to Have Monitored Soviet Subs Talks With Bases
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (AP)United States N,avy experts have been able to monitor communications between Soviet submarines at sea and their home bases because of the Central Intelligence Agency's retrieval of part of a sunken Soviet submarine, according to The Washington Post.

title: Cepeda Gets 5 Years For Smuggling Marijuana
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Dec. 16 (AP)Orlando Cepeda, a former major league baseball player, was sentenced to five years in prison today and fined $10,000 after being convicted of smuggling marijuana into Puerto Rico.

title: Barnes Pleads Guilty To Lesser Gun Charges
description: DETROIT, Dec. 16 (AP)Marvin Barnes, a forward for the Detroit Pistons of the National Basketball Association, pleaded guilty yesterday in Wayne County Circuit Court to charges of attempting to conceal a weapon. Barnes, scheduled to be sentenced Feb. 1, faces a maximum penalty of 2 years in jail and a $1,250 fine for the felony.

title: Sets Change to a Juicier Nickname
description: Reaching down to the bottom of the barrel, the New York Sets have come up with a new nickname.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Master Drawings At the Morgan
description: ONE of the more permanent pleasures of English life is a visit to the museums of Oxford and Cambridge. Not everyone knows about them. They are not on the standard sightseeing routes. It is possible to graduate from either of the great universities in questionand, indeed, to do summa cum laudewithout ever setting foot in either the Ashmolean Museum in Oxford or the Fitzwilliam Museum in Cambridge.

title: Ramirez,U.S. Thorn, to Play Tanner in Davis Cup Opener
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Dec. 16Even at a Davis Cup draw, Raul Ramirez remained No. 1 today.

title: On Going to Church
description: The events listed here are free unless otherwise indicated. On Christmas Eve particularly, many concerts draw overflow crowds and it is advisable to arrive early.

title: L.I. Judge Guilty of TicketFixing
description: RIVERHEAD, LI., Dec. 16 (AP)An all male jury in State Supreme Court here today found Judge Gioanna I. Lacarrubba guilty of misconduct in office for fixing the traffic ticket of a friend, Loretta Leone. on Christmas Eve in 1974.

title: DONORS TO NEEDIEST PASS THE 1,000 MARK
description: Is there anything more touching than a child's thoughts as Christmas approaches?

title: Skiers Find IllDirected Winds Blow Not Good Snowfalls Their Way,
description: Because of the absence of anything resembling a sizable snowstorm this seasoneven in the high Rockies and Sierra NevadasJoel Myers, the meteorologist from State College, Pa., was called on yesterday for an explanation. Myers, whose ACCIIWeattler Bureau services 55 ski areascoast to coastwith daily pinpolnted weather forecasts, attributed, the snow shortage to the winds. He said they continually had been coming from the wrong direction.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Corporation Affairs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16The Foster Wheeler Corporation has uncovered questionable payments of about $2.38 million, most of which apparently went to employees of several customers overseas to obtain contracts, a company filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission disclosed today.

title: From ?? to Motets A Profusion of Christmas Music
description: Following is a list of some ?? is special musical presentations and other events vitarktng the Christmas holiday planned hurches and concert halls in the metropolitan area.

title: Bernstein Conducts
description: LEONARD BERNSTEIN has always liked Haydn's music, and even his detractors admit that he approaches this composer with extraordinary affinity. So when he conducted Haydn's Nelson Mass last night in Fisher Hall, it was a performance out of the ordinary.

title: Weekend Gardening: Aquatic Plants, a New Frontier
description: The Leiden tank is stirring up as much static in the aquarium world as the Leiden jar did in the world of physics several centuries ago. Plants, although not completely replacing fish, are beginning to dominate the tanks of the avantgarde aquaculturists. Perhaps it is a natural offshoot of the terrarium cult, or just a reaction against the plastic flowers and Japanese; bridges that threatened to engulf the aquariums of the 1950's and 60's. Whatever so, a new world has opened up not only for the aquarist, but also for the plant lover,

title: Destroy or Restore?
description: The threat of an environmental disaster has been revived five years after President Nixon suspended work on the CrossFlorida Barge Canal by executive order. The state cabinet of Florida's Governor Askew is now holding hearings on that projecta 107mile commercial waterway that would lay waste the dark and primitive course of the Oklawaha River, long recognized as one of America's most beautiful freeflowing streams.

title: Schmidt Concedes Government Loses Touch With the People
description: BONN, Dec. 16Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany began a second term today with an unusual admission that he and his Government had fallen dangerously out of touch with ordinary voters and their problems.

title: TV WEEKEND
RED DYE 40 CALLED A HAZARD TO HEALTH
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (AP)A panel of Government scientists was told today that Red No. 40, the last generalpurpose red dye used in American foods, drugs and cosmetics, is a public health hazard.

title: Canada to Halt Program
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 16 (UPI)  Health Minister Marc Lalonde announced today that the swine flu immunization program would be halted in Canada on Jan. 1 as result of deaths and paralysis of some vaccinated persons in the United States.

title: Wife Slayer Pleads Guilty
description: TOMS RIVER, N.J., Dec. 16(AP) WilHam Livingston, 39 years old, of Lakewood, N.J., has pleaded., guilty to manslaughter in the shooting death of his wife last year. He told Judge Mark Addi son, of Ocean County Court that he had not intended to kill his wife, Aretba, 37 but that the gun had gone off accidentty in their home on Dec. 6, 1975 during an argument over his wife's forgetting to pick up his suit from the cleaners.

title: Gilmore Is Hospitalized in a Coma; Second Drug Overdose Suspected
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 16 (AP)Gary Gllmore, the convicted killer, was rushed unconscious to a hospital today after an apparent drug overdose. He was in critical condition but was expected to survive, a Hospital spokesman said.

title: REAL CAOUETTE DIES, SOCIAL CREDIT HEAD
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 16 (AP)  Ral Caouette, former leader of the Social Credit Party, died today in a hospital two wekes aftr openheart surgery. He was 59 years old.

title: Reds Trade Perez to Expos For Fryman
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 16 (UPI)Tony Perez, on the trading block more than two years, was dealt by the Cincinnati Reds to the Montreal Expos today along with Will McEnaney, a relief pitcher, in exchange for Woodie Fryman and Dale Murray, both pitchers.

title: Kentucky Five's Coach Suspends Three Players
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Dec. 16 (AP)Two starters and a reserve with the University of Kentucky's unbeaten basketball team were suspended indefinitely, today by Coach Joe Hall.

title: King Kong's New Girl in Town
description: Back in the days when she was a New York model, Jessica Lange never had to contend with pinched nerves, pulled muscles and contusions and abrasions. Or sharks, for that matter. But then, that was before she was chosen as the latest actress to drive King Kong bananas.

title: Carter Says Many Have Declined Posts; Mentions 3 Blacks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16Presidentelect Jimmy Carter disclosed today that a number of prominent Americans, several of them black, had declined highlevel positions in his administration.

title: Week's Store Sales Show Increase
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 16The Departmeat of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $2.47 billion, up 15 percent from the yearearlier $2.15 billion. Total retail store sales were about $12.75 billion, up 10 percent from last year's $11.63 billion.

title: SteelerColt Game Sold Out
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 16 (AP)Sunday's National Football League playoff game between the Pittsburgh Stealers and the Baltimore Colts became a sellout today when a company purchased the last 1,010 tickets. In becoming a sellout 72 hours before game time, the contest will be televised in the BaltimoreWashington area. A representative of the Amoco Oil Company waited until just before the 2 P.M. deadline, then purchased the final block of tickets as a civic gesture. The tickets will be given to charitable institutions.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M. on disarmament and decolonization.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: It is customary when talking about parents and children to have only one set of generations in mindthe middleaged or younger adults and the children in their charge. The role of grandparents is often ignored.

title: DISMISSED OFFICER CHALLENGES CONOCO
description: Willard H. Burnap, dismissed as vice chairman of the Continental Oil Company, yesterday challenged the company's contention that he had been involved in improper corporate payments and left open the possibility of refusing to resign as a company director.

title: Networks Eye TV Pool For Moscow Olympics
description: The three major networks announced last night that they were seeking a suspension of the negotiations in Moscow for the United States television rights to the 1980 Summer Olympics, and were considering covering the Games jointly.

title: Music: Soprano Who Turns A Work's Difficulties Into Fun
description: The idea that fragmented vocal sounds, no less than conventional words, phrases and sentences, can be used as legitimate composing material is probably as old as music itself. A pair of works performed at Carnegie Recital Hall on Wednesday night by the youthful newmusic group called Parnassus showed how two modern composers have experimented with the notion.

title: NIXON IS RULED LIABLE IN HALPERIN WIRETAP
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16A Federal District Court judge ruled here today that former President Richard M. Nixon and two members of his Administration had deprived Morton Halperin and his family of their constitutional rights by having their home telephone tapped for 21 months.

title: An Oomphatic Christmas Salute by 500 Tubas
description: Primarily, I wanted to demonstrate to the general public that the tuba is a very noble instrument, says Harvey Phillips. You have to do something to get people's attention.

title: McVay's Ax Falls: Wietecha Is Dropped
description: Ray Wietecha, one of the heroes of the Giants good old days, has become the first assistant coach released by John McVay.

title: 5 Indicted in Louisiana Vote Fraud
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 16 (AP)Five voting commissioners of St. Bernard Parish were indicted on seven counts of vote fraud by a Federal grand jury today on charges. growing out of the October runoff between Representativeelect Richard A. Tonry and James Moreau, the United States Attorney's office said. Mr. Moreau charged after the Oct. 2 election in Louisiana First Congressional District that Mr. Tonry's victory by 184 votes stemmed from massive voting fraud.

title: Bilingual Issue, Cont'd
description: In a recent editorial on bilingual education, we expressed. concern over a growing tendency to misuse an essentially sound pedagogical tool toward the wrong educational and political ends. Specifically, we argued that the maintenance of nonEnglishspeaking enclaves points the road to cultural, economic and political divisiveness.

title: For P.S. 198, Happy Birthday Is Beethoven's 206th
description: Ol Ludwig now is 205, ol Ludwig now is 206, sang 33 thirdgrade students. accompanied by piano and violin at Public School 198 on East 96th Street yesterday.

title: ChoateRosemary Hall Boys and Girls Apart
description: WALLINGFORD, Corm., Dec. 16In McComb, Miss., today, Greg Wells will be hunting squirrels. George Zeller's plane will just be touching down in Ghana. Allison Lee is probablp adjusting her ski bindings on a mountain in Switzerland, and Paul Castroberti is revving up his Corvette.

title: Article 5  No Title
Britons Reaction to Budget Cut: Sympathy Mingled With Dismay
description: LONDON, Dec. 16 Britain's ninth budget in the last 30 months, the latest in a series of attempts to restore confidence in the country's economy among outsiders and ordinary Britons, received a mixed reaction today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: East Asia: Our Questionable Presence

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Imperiale Case Delayed

title: Electrical Short Starts Fire at White House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16An emergency power generator in the north wing of the White House shorted out tonight, causing a small fire and spreading toxic fumes as a result of chemical insulation in the wiring.

title: In Memoriam
description: GOULEDPeter. On his 100th birthday. You are held forever dear in our hearts.

title: The Big Ten Penalizes Michigan State Football
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 16 (AP)Michigan State University's football program, already put on probation by the National Collegiate Athletic Association until January 1979 because of recruiting violations, today was placed on three years probation by the Big Ten Conference.

title: FireBrigade Duty For Brezhnev
description: WASHINGTONHaving spent the autumn in crisisridden Eastern Europe especially in Poland, Rumania and YugoslaviaI think I understand why the Soviet Communist Party leader, Leonid I. Brezhnev, had to devote so much of his time last month to a series of defensive operations there.

title: Bridge:
description: The last major tournament of the Bicentennial year begins this afternoon at the New York Hilton Hotel.

title: Young Voices Bring Joy to the Season
description: One of the most potent of all holiday associations is the sound of children's voices, from excited whisperings to the chanting of seasonal songs. This weekend the young voices will be professional ones and the music more ratified than Frosty the Snowman. The Boys Choir of Harlem and the Obernkirchen Children's Choir have come to town.

title: Ohio Speeders Credit Cards Save the Day
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec.15You're speeding, beyond the legal limit, on the Ohio Turnpike and suddenly the familiar red light begins to dominate the view in your rearview mirror.

title: Miss Curtin Goes Gershwin
description: Squeaking in under the Bicentennial wire, the aptly named National Chorale has concocted what may tura into one Of the most rollicking American salutes Of the season. It's an allGershwin concert tonight at 8, at Avery Fisher Hall, with Martin Josman on the podium to strike up the chorus (no band this time) and Phyllis Curtin the distinguished someone to watch over the solo numbers.

title: BUSINESS CREDIT UP AT NEW YORK BANKS
description: Shortterm credit demand continues to pick up, data reported by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York yesterday indicated.

title: Winnipeg of W.H.A. Falls To Czechoslovakia, 32
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 16 (UPI)The Winnipeg Jets of the World Hockey Association lost their opening match and cofavorites Czechoslovakia and the Soviet Union each won today in the first day of the fivenation Izvestia ice hockey tournament.

title: Council Rejects Request By Beame for Revisions InBudgetMakingProcess
description: Two suggestions by the Beame administration to change revisions in the City Charter affecting the budgetmaking process were rejected yesterday by the City Council's Charter and Government Operations Committee. The new Charter goes into effect Jan.1.

title: Restaurants
description: THE 411 Bleecker Street Restaurant is the sort of place a reviewer might well consider keeping a secret. It's that kind of find. The settingbrick walls, open fireplace, decorative wall hangings, red tablecloths and colored glass lampshadesis stylish and inviting. The service is prompt, efficient and genuinely considerate and polite.

title: Art People
description: ARCHEOLOGISTS 3,000 years from now should look for art on the sites of American airports, to which the best of painterly talents were often dispatched in the 1930's by the Fine Art Project of the Works Progress Administration. In fact, by dint of some recent digging, two panels from a longlost mural by the late Arshile Gorky, one of the most important avantgarde artists in America, have recently surfaced in the old terminal building at Newark's International Airport.

title: Knapp, Pitcher, Has Surgery
description: CHICAGO, Dee. 16 (AP)Chris Knapp, a righthanded pitcher for the Chicago White Sox, underwent minor surgery today at Illinois Masonic Medical Center. Doctors said the surgery had apparently corrected a condition that had been causing tenderness in Knapp's pitching arm. He is expected to be ready to start spring training March 1.

title: Paris Will Embargo AtomicFuel Plants
description: PARIS, Dec. 16 The French Government announced today that it would ban further exports of nuclear fuelreprocessing plants, which have the potential to produce plutonium for use in weapons.

title: Charges Against Four Police Protesters Are Dropped
description: At the suggestion of the Police Department, charges were dropped in Criminal Court yesterday in the case of four police officers who were arrested during a demonstration by offduty policemen last Oct. 6 outside Madison Square Garden.

title: A Stripper Hurt While Doing Act Given a Benefit
description: It was billed as Strippers Bare Their Hearts, and it was a benefit to raise money for a stripper who was out of work because she was injured when a patron pushed her off balance during a key part of her act.

title: TAX WRITEDOWNS SET BY AETNA AND KAISER
description: Two corporate partners in a real estate development venture, Aetna Life & Casualty and the Kaiser Aluminum & Chemical Corporation, yesterday separately announced that they were taking onetime, aftertax charges after writing down property values and related adjustments.

title: Santa Cuite
description: Christmas came early to City Hall the other day when the Council majority leader, Thomas J. Cuite, acting after hasty private consultations with borough delegations, redistributed lulurich committee chairmanships.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In an article in The Times Friday the Ideal Corporation was incorrectly identified as the Ideal Toy Corporation.

title: Emperor Bokassa Forms a Court For Central African ExRepublic
description: NDJAMENA, Chad, Dec. 17 (Agence FrancePresse)Emperor Bokassa I, who renamed the Central African Republic the Central African Empire on Dec. 4, has formed his imperial court, Bangui radio said today. Former Cabinet ministers have been given almost identical posts in the court, the radio said.

title: Children of African Dissident Live With Rep. Young Family
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 17For nearly two years now, a daughter and son of one of South Africa's staunchest black advocates of majority rule have been living as members of the household here of the newly designated United States delegate to the United Nations, Representative Andrew Young.

title: Dollar and Sterling Close Slightly Higher in Europe; Gold Trading Is Sluggish
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 17 (UPI)The dollar and sterling closed slightly higher on European foreign exchanges today and dealers said news of the oil price rise apparently had little effect on trading.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Works by Gideon And Perle Heard In League Series
description: Works by Miriam Gideon and George Perle were performed at Carnegie Recital Hall Thursday night in the series of concerts being presented there this season by the League of Composers and the International Society for Contemporary Music.

title: People in Sports
description: Olga Korbut was reunited with her bridal veil and wedding dress here yesterdayending the tale of three cities, St. Louis, Indianapolis and New York.

title: Soviet to FreeLeading Dissident In Trade for Chilean Communist
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 17The Soviet Union's most prominent imprisoned dissident, Vladimir K. Bukovsky, is being freed in exchange for the release by Chile of the jailed chief of the Chilean Communist Party, Mr. Bukovsky's mother reported today.

title: Perjury Indictment of De Sapio Dismissed for Lack of Evidence
description: A State Supreme Court justice yesteaay dismissed a perjury indictment against Carmine G. De Sapio, the former leader of Tammany Hall.

title: Muted Tension Marked Meeting Of OPEC as Price Crisis Grew
description: DOHA, Qatar, Dec. 17At about 2 o'clock yesterday afternoon Sheik Ahmed Zaki Yamani strode briskly through the lobby of the Gulf Hotel here and out into the hazy sunlight of an Arabian winter's day. Asked where he was going, he said softly, Jiddah.

title: Southern Leaders Form Group to Support Stevens Textile Workers
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 17A committee of Southern leaders, including the Mayor of Atlanta, a state senator and several veterans of the civil right struggles of the 1960's, today pledged their support to J. P. Stevens textile workers who are currently locked in a bitter labor dispute with the company.

title: SAUDIS WARN THE WEST TO SHOW APPRECIATION OF OILPRICE RESTRAINT
description: DOHA, Qatar, Dec. 17Saudia Arabia warned today that it was prepared to increase production to hold down the world price of oil, which other producers decided to raise to 15 percent in two stages next year. But it also warned the West, and especially the United States, that it expected a show of appreciation with responsive measures in both the ArabIsraeli conflict and the northsouth negotiations between industrialized and developing countries.

title: About New York
description: It is not easy being good for goodness' sake. You should forgive my language, said Santa Claus. But I think the Mayor should get those Krishna Santas the hell off the streets.

title: Fire Destroys Coast Buildings
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 17 (UPI)A fire lit up the San Francisco waterfront early today, destroying a twostory United Story Customs warehouse and two adjacent import concerns. Some 150 firemen poured tons of water into the Mission District blaze, flooding the adjacent streets with water

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: AT CHICAGO

title: SYRIA TALKS OF PLANS FOR PEACE OFFENSIVE
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Dec. 17 (AP)President Hafez alAssad said today that he and President Anwar elSadat of Egypt were coordinating efforts to launch a peace offensive for a settlement with Israel.

title: Vikings' Big Weapon Is Aerial Attack
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn, Dec. 17In every important statistic, the Minnesota Vikings lead the Washington Redskins. Therefore, the alleged genius of George Allen, the Redskin coach, will be put to test once more here tomorrow when these two meet in the first of four National Football League divisional playoff games

title: Yonkers Races Friday For OTB Patrons Only
description: A ninerace program, for the benefit of offtrack betting patrons only, is to be staged next Friday afternoon at Yonkers Raceway. Originally, the harnessracing oval was scheduled to be dark on Christmas Eve and Christmas night. The unusual plan, announced by Paul R. Screvane, chairman and president of New York City's Offtrack Betting Corporation, calls for the raceway to remain closed to spectators while races are conducted at approximately 10minute intervals. Post time for the first event will be 2:30.

title: Saudis Linking Oil and Peace
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17The diplomatic consequences of Saudi Arabia's decision to hold down an increase in the price of oil seem at least to equal, if not outweigh, the economic importance of the move. The Saudis have now publicly linked the oil issue with the need for the United States to bring about an overall ArabIsraeli settlement. This has added a dramatic new element in the complicated diplomacy of the Middle East. It has raised all sorts of possibilities for future American diplomacy, but it also carries with it the possibility of tragic misunderstandings if the anticipated moves by the Carter administration next year fail to produce significant results.

title: Vladimir K. Bukovsky
description: Born in 1942, has spent most of the last 13 yearsmore than a third of his lifein Soviet prisons and mental hospitals . . . Broke with father, a Communist Party member, over official policy . . . A biology student at Moscow University . . . Expelled in 1961 for distributing the book The New Class by Milovan Djilas, the Yugoslav dissident, which criticized party bureaucrats . . . Active in publishing clandestine news letters circulated through Soviet literary underground . . . Arrested in 1963, spent next 18 months in psychiatric ward . . .

title: WORLD OIL BUSINESS THROWN INTO CHAOS
description: The international oil business was thrown into chaos yesterday by the announcement from the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries of a twotiered pricing system that is expected to cost the world an additional $10 billion annually for crude oil.

title: FORD PRAISES SAUDIS FOR OIL PRICE STAND
description: WASHINGTON, Dec: 17  President Ford praised Saudi Arabia today for international responsibility in refusing to raise oil prices more than 5 percent.

title: Calder Stabile Takes Shape As His Monument for Jerusalem
description: TOURS, FranceThe creative genius of Alexander Calder, who died last Nov. 11 in New York, still inspires work here on what could become his most monumental achievement, a sculpture for Jerusalem.

title: O'Hagan and 11 Get Bonuses Up to $6,014
description: Fire Commissioner John T. O'Hagan and 11 top managers in his department have been given bonuses ranging from $4,298 to $6,014 for their superior managerial performance, Mayor Beame announced yesterday.

title: Treasury Bill Yields Fell in 3 and 6 Months
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17Yields declined on Treasury bills auctioned in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A mother who was coerced into allowing her child to be adopted cannot automatically regain custody if the child may suffer emotionally, the New Jersey Supreme Court ruled. The court said that in order to regain custody, the mother must prove that a return would not have any negative emotional impact on the child.

title: International Paper Cut
description: The International Paper Company announced a oneweek shutdown of its mill at Ticonderoga, N. Y., next week because of a lack of orders. The move will idle about 850 production employees. The mill, which manufactures highgrade business and printing papers, will resume regular production Dec. 27.

title: BYRNE PLANS ACTIONS TO SAVE PINE BARRENS
description: PRINCETON, Dec. 17Governor Byrneannounced today a series of actions designed to protect the New Jersey Pine Barrens from overdevelopment.

title: You Have to Be a Little Bit Crazy To Try to Define What's Normal
description: Who's normal? What's normal? At a meeting of the American Psychoanalytic Association in New York yesterday, those questions had an incongruous sound, as though one were asking whether to eat peas with a spoon or a knife.

title: U.S. Approves 2 Ports on Gulf For Supertankers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17Transportation Secretary William T. Coleman Jr. today approved construction of the nation's first two deepwater ports, to be built in the Gulf of Mexico, overriding the objections of environmentalists and some antitrust experts.

title: Waiting for Carter
description: The attorney for city noteholders has rejected an elaborate plan for paying off $1 billion in notes as being too contingent, which it certainly is. But Arthur Richenthal, who successfully fought a stateimposed moratorium on the notes, has accepted a key element of the plan, a time frame that gives the city until next November to pay the noteholdersand that could make all the difference.

title: CARTER TO APPOINT IDAHO'S GOV. ANDRUS INTERIOR SECRETARY
description: PLAINS, Ga., Dec. 17Presidentelect Jimmy Carter will name Gov. Cecil D. Andrus of Idaho as his Secretary of the Interior tomorrow and has all but decided to ask Congress to create a new Cabinetlevel energy department, to be headed by James R. Schlesinger.

title: ExSouthwestern Bell Aide Wins $1 Million in Wiretapping Case
description: SAN ANTONIO, Dec. 17A former executive of the Southwestern Bell Telephone Company who contended that his former employers had intercepted his private conversations won a $1 million judgment against the company today in a decision that the company said was without known precedent in the company.

title: New York City and U.F.T. Agree On a $650 Minimum Pay Rise
description: The New York City Board of Education and the United Federation of Teachers announced an agreement yesterday that will give all teachers at least $650 in added pay and substantially more for those who qualify because of their length of service or level of education.

title: Wm. Peyton Marin, Counsel to Family Of Joseph Kennedy
description: Wm. Peyton Marin, for more than 25 years general counsel to the family of the late Joseph P. Kennedy, died Thursday in his home, at 11 Montague Terrace in Brooklyn Heights. He was 68 years old.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Horses listed in order of post positions

title: Smuggler of Heroin Given 10 Years
description: A 54yearold Corsican accused of having headed an international ring that smuggled a ton of heroin and cocaine into this country from 1968 to 1972 was sentenced yesterday to 10 years in jail.

title: Big Board Seat Up $10,000
description: A membership seat on the New York Stock Exchange was sold today at $72,000, up $10,000 from the previous sale on Wednesday, the Exchange reported yesterday. Seats are now being quoted at $65,000 bid and $80,000 asked.

title: Pick It Lottery Drawing To Be Televised Daily
description: TRENTON, Dec. 17Beginning Jan. 3, New Jersey Public Television will televise live the nightly drawing of the state's Pick It lottery.

title: Notes on People
description: The Roman Catholic Archbishop of Boston, Humberto Cardinal Medeiros, has taken what is considered a step toward reconciliation with the Catholics of South Boston. He plans to celebrate Christmas mass at Gate of Heaven parish in South Boston, which has been wracked by troubles over courtordered busing to integrate the public schools. Cardinal Medeiros was criticized last spring for saying he wouldn't go to South Boston, the center of the city's antibusing activity, to play a leadership role in resolving the problems. I've been turned off in South Boston, anyhow, he said then. No one there is listening to me. A spokesman for the South Boston Information Center said that the Cardinal's Christmas mass indicated that he is trying to make amends to the community.

title: Radio
description: 6 A.M., WNYCAM: Morning Solitude. Sancta et immaculata Virginitas; O Magnum Mysterium; Nunc Dimittis; Angelus ad Pastoras; O Jesu Mi Dulcissime, Gabrieli; Crucifixus, Lotti; Beata es Virgo Maria, Gabrieli; Exsultate Deo, Hassler, Mass for Three Voices, Byrd.

title: Nora Finnegan Married in Rye to Donn Dolce
description: Nora Finnegan, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. John G. Finnegan of Rye, N. Y., was married there last evening to Donn C. Dolce, son of Dr. and Mrs. John J. Dolce, of Rye and Wolfeboro, N. H.

title: Frazier Scores 32 in 123109 Game
description: BOSTON, Dec. 17The Knicks' new era began tonight with the old faces.

title: Islanders 42 Victors Over Flames
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 17Denis Potvin scored within the first four minutes of the first period. Clark Gillies scored after 3 minutes of the second. Garry Howatt and Bob Nystrom scored goals in the first 2 minutes of the final period.

title: Klammer Takes Opener In Cup Downhill Series
description: VAL GARDENA, Italy, Dec.17 (AP)Franz Klammer won a World Cup downhill race today with his usual display of daring and speed. The Austrian flashed down the 3,750meter Saslonch track in 2 minutes 3.83 seconds, more than one second faster than Herbert Plank of Italy, the runnerup.

title: Bank of England Cuts Rate
description: LONDON, Dec. 17 (UPI)In a widely expected move, the Bank of England today cut its Minimum Lending Rate by a quarter of 1 percent to 14 percent.

title: 'King Kong' Bigger, Not Better, In a Return to Screen of Crime
description: When it is played as a straight adventure-fantasy, Dino De Laurentiis's $25-million remake of "King Kong" is inoffensive, uncomplicated fun, as well as a dazzling display of what the special-effects people can do when commissioned to construct a 40-foot-tall ape who can walk, make fondling gestures, is slightly cross-eyed, and smiles a lot.It's something to make you cringe with embarrassment, though, when it attempts to disarm all criticism by kidding itself (proclaim the ads, "the most exciting original motion picture event of all time") in lines of dialogue that are intended as instant camp ("You goddamned male chauvinist ape!"). I suppose that when you spend as much as Mr. De Laurentiis did on this, you've got to have something for everybody, including the witless.The nicest thing about the 1933 "King Kong," made by Merian C. Cooper and Ernest B. Schoedsack, was that it was no big deal. One could marvel at the wizardly special effects created by Willis O'Brien and not be overwhelmed by an awareness of the terrific time and expense that went into them. Its heart was genuinely light. Not this time.Why, I think we have a right to ask, would anyone want to remake it? "King Kong" is a classic, but it's not "Hamlet." There's only one way to do it, and that's been done. Having acknowledged these biases, one might as well relax and let it happen.John Guillermin, the director, and Lorenzo Semple Jr., the writer, display real affection for old-time movie magic and nonsense that come through in spite of a physical production only slightly less elaborate than that of Elizabeth Taylor's "Cleopatra."Especially effective are the opening sections of the film that lay outwith a respectful gravity that is truly comicthe scientific mumbo jumbo that softens us for the make-believe to come: a team of oil experts from a cartel named Petrox sets out to find a mysterious uncharted South Pacific island that is perpetually enclosed in a cloud of carbon dioxide, indicating that the earth beneath is a virtually bottomless reservoir of petroleum.There's talk about the worldwide energy crisis, and we are shown satellite photographs meant to allay suspicions that even if such an island could have remained undiscovered throughout all of World War II, our spy-in-the-sky system, which can apparently read the fine print on Kremlin documents, would certainly have chanced upon it long before this.It may well be that we don't need such explanations. Part of the appeal of "King Kong" today, as it was in 1933, is based on the wish to believe that there may still be places in this world unpenetrated by Petrox, Pepsico, General Motors, Sony and the Clubs Mediterranee.The film builds well to Kong's initial appearance, after we are almost an hour into the story, when he comes clomping out of the jungle to claim his monthly sacrifice, who is not, of course, Fay Wray, but Jessica Lange, a beautiful New York model who plays a would-be actress named Dwan. Though Dwan sets Kong's heart aflame, she's more likely to set everyone else's teeth on edge.This is no reflection on Miss Lange. It's the script. In their attempt to update a fairy tale, the film makers have turned a conventional heroine into a pseudo-Marilyn Monroe character who seems less dizzy than certifiably daft, aggressively unpleasant and out of place in this sort of movie.What sort, exactly, is this movie? It's a series of big, foolish but entertaining spectacle scenes, such as the natives of that uncharted Pacific island prancing around, doing pagan fertility dances that suggest 1950's Broadway musicals. It's the sight of the mighty Kong picking up Dwan in the palm of his hand and washing her off under a jungle waterfall, then fiddling curiously with her bra. It's Kong going amok in New York City, looking for Dwan, grabbing up a subway car and rattling it like a gourd, then trudging south to the World Trade Center, where he ultimately meets his fate.One of my objections to the film is the substitution of the twin towers of the Trade Center for the Empire State Building, used in the original film. The World Trade Center is a very boring piece of architecture. The Empire State Building is not. Though Kong's last fight with Army helicopters is beautifully (and bloodily) done, the setting trivializes it.There are other actors in the film beside Miss Lange. They include very good actors such as Jeff Bridges (as a professor of primate paleontology from Princeton) and Charles Grodin (as a vicious, ambitious Petrox executive), but they are supporting characters to the various pieces of machinery (and one man in an ape suit) that portray Kong in his changing moods.The real auteurs of this "King Kong" are not the producers, the director or the writer, but Carlo Rambaldi, Glen Robinson and Rick Baker, who are credited with having been responsible for designing, constructing and engineering the mechanisms."King Kong," which has been rated PG ("parental guidance suggested"), includes some vulgar language, some partial nudity, some violence at the end, and some intimations of unrealizable bestiality that small children everywhere will recognize as simple friendliness.

title: Canada Acts to Bar Illegal Deals by Agencies Abroad
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 17The Government has issued new guidelines for overseas dealings by Canada's 43 publicly owned crown corporations to prevent any illegal practices. The action follows an investigation into mysterious payments to promote the sale of nuclear reactors abroad.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: IDEAS IN MICE

title: South Beats North, 240, In College Shrine Game
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Dec. 17 (UPI)The South used a smothering defense and the running of its fullback, David Sims, to defeat the North, 244, tonight in a Shrine allstar college football game at the Pontiac Silverdome.

title: Italy Goes Up, 20, Over Chile In '76 Cup Final
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 17 (Reuters)Italy won both singles matches today and took a 20 lead over Chile in their 1976 Davis Cup final.

title: Deaths
description: ALTMANMilton. Moving Picture Machine Operators Union Local 306 announces with sorrow the death of Brother Milton Buddy Altman on Dec. 15. Funeral Dec. 19 at 3 P.M. from Davis Funeral Home 14 LeCount Place, New Rochelle. Ernest Lang, SecretaryTreasurer

title: Capacity Utilization Declines in Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (Reuters)manufacturing capacity utilization fell two percentage points to 80 percent in the third quarter ended Sept. 30, the first decline since the quarter ended March 1975, the Commerce Department said.

title: U.S. Approves 2 Ports on Gulf For Supertankers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17Transportation Secretary William T. Coleman Jr. today approved construction of the nation's first two deepwater ports, to be built in the Gulf of Mexico, overriding the objections of environmentalists and some antitrust experts.

title: Appeal for Neediest Ends 2d Week
description: One donor to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund said the appeal should be a conscience to everybody.

title: Personal Investing
description: Manbitesdog stories are rare in the investment company field, but there is one in the 16,000 shares of the Baker, Fentress Company owned by the Acorn Fund.

title: McGuire to Quit Marquette Job After Season
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 17 (AP)Al McGuire of Marquette, who has won more games than any other college basketball coach over the last decade, announced today that he would resign at the end of the current season.

title: CARLTON E. SCHAAD
description: Carlton E. Schaad, who retired last year as secretary of the New York Board of Fire Underwriters, died Thursday at the Hershey (Pa.) Medical Center. He was 66 years old and a resident of Hershey.

title: Bridge:
description: In three notrump a declarer must often choose between developing dummy's long suit or trying to make use of his own. Occasionally he can have the best of both worlds, as in the diagramed deal. It was played in the last New York sectional open pairs, and the declarer was Alan Greenberg, the most successful newcomer on the tournament scene this year.

title: Byrne Studying Plan to Establish A State Auto Reinsurance Facility
description: TRENTON, Dec. 17A plan to create a state reinsurance facility that could guarantee every motorist an opportunity to buy automobile insurance is under study by the Byrne administration and could be introduced in the State Legislature within a month.

title: Three Killed Over Accusation
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 17 (UPI)A North Philadelphia man, angered over accusations that he was a narcotics informant for the police, shot and killed two men last night and shot himself to death, the authorities said. The victims were identified as Victor Garcia, 35, the gunman; Gilbert Rosa, 21, and Dennis Torres, 24.

title: OPEC's Price Power Has Grown Over Last 16 Years
description: In August 1960, the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey)  now the Exxon Corporationmasterminded an attempt by the oil producers to reduce the official price of oil by 4 to 14 cents. Outraged, the oil producing countries, then quite tentative in their goals, quickly convened in Baghdad on Sept. 14 and forced a retraction of the decreases. Since then, OPEC has become an economic force to be reckoned with and the world has never been quite the same. Following is a synopsis of past meetings:

title: Gimbels Shows Loss For Fourth Quarter
description: Gimbel Brothers reported yesterday a loss in the fourth fiscal quarter in contrast to a profit a year earlier.

title: U.S. Aided Negotiations
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17The exchange of Mr. Corvaln for Mr. Bukovsky, was arranged in secret threeway negotiations through the good offices of the United States over the last six weeks.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: DorrOliver Reports to the S.E.C. $452,000 Sales Payments Abroad
description: DorrOliver Inc., a unit of the Curtiss Wright Corporation, reported to the Securities and Exchange Commission that some of the $452,000 in commissions it paid its foreign sales representatives since 1970 might have been improperly deposited in foreign bank accounts.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: LAST CALL In the extended engagement of the surprise hit of the local dance season, there are still four more performances to go for The Spirit of Denishawn, with seats available in the $6.95 ticket category at the Roundabout Theater/Stage One, 333 West 23d Street (between Eighth and Ninth Avenues).

title: MAD IS INDICTED IN BIKERS BREAKOUT
description: A prison guard has been indicted on charges that he provided hacksaws used in the escape of seven prisoners from Rikers Island last summer, it was announced yesterday by John F. Keenan, the special state prosecutor.

title: Dozen County Leaders Challenge Rockefeller Control of State Party
description: A dozen Republican county chairmen yesterday challenged Vice President Rockefeller's domination of the state's Republican Party and agreed to propose the setting up of a steering committee of county chairmen to consider all major party decisions.

title: Excerpts From Sheik Yamani's News Conference at OPEC Meeting
description: Q. Can you tell us why you have decided to go ahead with your break from the rest of your colleagues?

title: Abortion Conviction of Boston Doctor Upset
description: BOSTON, Dec. 17The manslaughter conviction of Dr. Kenneth C. Edelin in one of the nation's most famous abortion cases was overturned unanimously today by the Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court.

title: But Loss to Patriots Haunts Oakland
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 17Can the Oakland Raiders play the New England Patriots 32 points better on Dec. 18 here than they did on Oct. 3 at Foxboro, Mass.? That's the basic question in the American Football Conference's firstround playoff game that is scheduled for the Oakland Coliseum tomorrow at 4 P.M., New York time (televised on Channel 4).

title: Dividends
description: FRIDAY, DECEMBER 17, 1976
