description: A mayoral task force yesterday recommended the reorganization of New York City's Department of Purchase to make it more aggressive in its efforts to save taxpayers' money.

title: David Lamb Fiance Of Mary L. C. Deans, A Banking Trainee
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert Barr Deans Jr. of Mill Neck, L. 1., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Mary Lucy Colson Deans, to David Robinson Lamb, son of Carol Lamb of Oyster Bay, L. I., and Stephen B. Lamb of Port Villa, New Hebrides.

title: Ann Ferrell Is the Bride of Jonathan Rinehart
description: Ann Ferrell, Bloomingdale's advertising copy chief, was married yesterday afternoon to Jonathan Rinehart, founder and head of the Jonathan Rinehart Group Inc., publicrelationscounseling concern.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: WELL, we've done it again. The holiday shopping season, which is to shopping what the World Series is to baseball, is just about over. It is almost time to rip open those millions of packages that have been wrapped with such loving care these last few weeks.

title: Orange County Preps For Suburb's Role
description: GOSHEN, N.Y.The term suburb is a dirty word these days in Orange County.

title: Fashion
description: Freestyle skiing makes more demands on clothes than regular skiing does. Its acrobatic and balletlike movements require suits that stretch, hold their shape and are warm without being bulky. A new fabric that provides all these qualities, plus easy care, is Neoprene. It's the same artificial rubber used for deepdiving suits, and makes ski clothes that are sleek and functional. Freestylers express their individuality with their headgear. Anything goes.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Dec. 19, 1976 GENERAL ASSEMBLY Administrative and Budgetary Committee10:30 A.M.

title: Big M Is Luring Big Bettors
description: EAST RUTHERFORD YONKERS MORTY and Detroit Charlie have moved their operations to the Meadowlands Race Track. The presence of these characters and other big bettors has helped the new harnessracing track to raise its per capita wagering figure from $70 on opening night, Sept. 1, when 42,000 people attended, to more than $100 now.

title: A Rarity in the Basque Country, a Town Where the People Like the Captain in Charge of the Civil Guard
description: TOLOSA, SpainIn the mistdraped hills of the Basque country it is hard to find a place where the stern Civil Guard is considered anything but an occupation force imposed by hostile authorities in Madrid. But this homely factory town likes Capt. Luis Alonso Valles of the Civil Guard, who just got out of prison.

title: Lord Peter Wimsey Returns,
description: This evening at 9, the terribly urbane, witty and brilliant amateur detective Lord Peter Wimsey leaves his expensively decorated London flat for a holiday in the hills of Scotland. Of course, no holiday for Lord Peter and his righthand man, Bunter, would be complete without a corpse, and one turns up almost immediately. The dead man is Sandy Campbell, the most hated man in the district. Wimsey, the glint of justice flashing behind his monocle, follows a trail of elusive clues. Among the six suspects are Five Red Herrings, which provides the title for the new fourpart Wimsey series that begins on Channel 13 tonight.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in the Arts and Leisure Section:

title: Hackensack to Hear
description: HEATHER and Patrick McDermott say they are creating what is essentially a new theatrical experience, a performing arts genre that brings a combination of traditional story lines and fables to life with song, dance, mime, music and the spoken word. They have named their enterprisewhich has attracted the prestigious support of the National Endowment for the Artsthe Cartoon Opera Minstrel Theater.

title: The Bloom Is Off the Potted Plant
description: If it is true that house plants react to the mood of their environment, as some farout experiments have suggested, the next philodendron you buy may need comforting. It will be uneasy if it has acquired a sense of its business future.

title: Majors and Douds Voted East's Coaches of Year
description: Johnny Majors of the University of Pittsburgh and Dennis Douds of East Stroudsburg State College were named coaches of the year in the East in their respective divisions yesterday by the New York Football Writers Association.

title: Minstrelsy With a Message
description: HEATHER and Patrick McDermott say they are creating what Is essentially a new theatrical experience, a performingarts genre that enlivens a combination of traditional story lines and fables with song, dance, mime, music and the spoken word. They have named their enterprisewhich has attracted the prestigious support of the National Endowment for the Artsthe Cartoon Opera Minstrel Theater.

title: A psychiatrist analyzed and a theologian canonized
description: The Power and Limits of a Vision. By Paul Roazen. 233 pp. New York: The Free Press. $8.95.

title: Senator Dugan Has a Message for Byrne
description: SENATOR JAMES P. DUGAN of Hudson County, the state Democratic chairman, recently envisioned a threeway primary contest for the Democratic gubernatorial nomination next year and said he could support any of the three he felt might run  State Senator Frank J. Dodd of Essex County, Mayor Paul Jordan of Jersey City or Joseph A. Hoffman, the former State Commissioner of Labor and Industry.

title: New York Acts To Gain Funds For Ailing Poor
description: New York State health officials have agreed to ask the Legislature next month to include New York City's municipal hospitals in the state's $14 million Ghetto Medicine program.

title: Tankers in Trouble on Both Coasts
description: Explosion in Los Angeles Port

title: Correction
description: An article in The Review of Dec. 5, 1976, incorrectly stated that during the Korean war, forces under Gen. Douglas MacArthur crossed the Yalu River. They did not.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: Under the leadership of the old Office of Scientific Research and Development, the combined scientific and technical resources of our governmental, industrial and academic communities were rapidly and effectively mobilized to win World War II. New management mechanisms with fast reaction times were evolved. Authority and responsibility were clearly delegated for specific technical programs, usually without political constraints at the Federal or local level.

title: Inns and Outs of A Welsh Ramble
description: I can't say I wasn't warned about a trip to Wales in October. Certain attractions enticingly pictured and poetically described in Wales Tourist Board literature were indeed closedas were many tourist information centers. Two days of intermittent rain threatened to open one of the gloomier chapters in The Perygls of Pauline (marvelous language, Welsh). Of course it didn't turn out that way.

title: Ideas &Trends
description: In two new decisions involving women's rights, the United States Supreme Court has ruled against the claims of women, as it did a week ago in a more important case involving compensation pay during illneses connected with pregnancy.

title: Education
description: Nineyearold Kathy Liriano is in the third grade at P.S. 156 in the South Bronx and is two years behind in her reading. In order to help her improve, the school arranged for Ana Celia Torres to meet with her five times a week and give her individualized tutoring.

title: Sunday Observer
description: Notes on Christmas trees:

title: Paul Tillich
description: It is perhaps appropriate nowadays to begin a discussion of Paul Tillich by identifying him, so quickly has his fame declined since his death 11 years ago. He was born in 1886, the son of a Prussian Lutheran minister, trained in theology and philosophy, served as a military chaplain during World War I, became a professor of theology at Marburg and Frankfort universities, came to America when Hitler took power, and taught at Union Theological Seminary and at Harvard. He was a liberal theologian, treating Christ as a symbol rather than a fact, but a tragic philosopher, preoccupied with the tragic meaning of modernist art, which he more or less identified with Christianity.

title: Viola Seff Wed to Broker
description: Viola Seff, widow of Manuel Seff, the playwright, was married last evening to Henry L. Goldberg, a widower and senior partner in the New York brokerage firm of Henry L. Goldberg & Company, specialists on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange. Rabbi Philip Hiat performed the ceremony at the home of the bride, who is a cousin of State Comptroller Arthur Levitt.

title: Worry About Threats to Press Freedom
description: I wish that, in focusing attention on the First Amendment, we could be celebrating increased freedom of the presshere and all over the world. But we cannot. Freedom of the press is under attack here at home. Around the rest of the free world, it is seriously eroding.

title: Vinnette Carroll Is Still In There Swinging
description: Vinnette Carroll, a multitalented woman of the theater who was nominated for a Tony in 1972, has a striking number of credits. She has trained scores of actors who have gone on to become successes in their own right (Cicely Tyson, Sherman Hemsley, Calvin Lockhart, Jonelle Allen). She's kept her Urban Arts Corps alive for nine years with a patchwork of meager grants. She's been successful as a developer of dozens of scripts. And this Wednesday, Your Arms Too Short to Box With God, which will open at the Lyceum Theater, will become her second Broadway show in four years, Indeed, the show could earn more than a million dollars, like its predecessor, Don't Bother Me, I Can't Cope. But still Miss Carroll has trouble paying the rent for her theater, and still she does not feel free to pursue the theatrical projects which interest her most.

title: We want peace. Just peace.
description: BELFAST. The air is wet and chilly today, and it is saturated with blue coal smoke, smoke that lowers down over the blackened houses, blurring light and shadow, as though this were some lost valley across the River Styx. From the bottom of the hill, it appears that a great long centipede is inching down the Falls Road, a rough body of umbrellas hugging together, moving slowly over the shards of glass and broken pavement. The centipede seems to have no end; the women keep coming, thousands of them. On the stone walls lining the street, they are watched by young boys in choppedoff bellbottoms, boys with deep swampy eyes and hollow cheeks. They are angry and take stones from their pockets and hurl them at the creature. The women raise their umbrellas to shield themselves; they smile at the boysunsteady, tightly pressed smiles. As the stories hit their arms, legs, heads, the line does not break, the march continues.

title: Rhodesia Says 10 Black Guerrillas And 5 Soldiers Have Died in 2 Days
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec. 18 (Reuters)Ten black nationalist guerrillas and five Rhodesian soldiers have been killed during the past two days, a security forces announcement said here today.

title: A Loving Gentleman
description: As everybody knows. William Faulkner had an extraordinary passion for privacy. I'm oldfashioned and probably a little mad too, he wrote me in January 1946. I dont like having my private life and affairs available to just any and everyone who has the price of the vehicle it's printed in. Five years later he wrote to his friend and publisher Robert K. Haas, I still contend that my printed works are in the public domain and anyone can bat them around. But my private life and I photographed face are my own and will defend them as such to the end.

title: Oil Conference Brought Qatar Brief Grandeur
description: DOHA, Qatar, Dec. 18A sportsloving Qatar prince has been worrying about his image in Washington. Desertbred Qatari officers have gained experience in crowd control. Party hosts in this unsophistricated capital have encountered a servant problem.

title: Boy, 12, Dies in Family's House In a TwoAlarm Blaze in Brooklyn
description: A 12yearold boy died last night in a twoalarm fire in his family's any family house in the Flatbush section of Brooklyn. The dead boy was identified by the police as Richard Guzowski of 1325 Albany Avenue, near Avenue D.

title: List of Deaths of Outstanding Figures in World of Sports During the Year 1976
description: Auto Racing

title: PEOPLE
description: A former Montclair State College student, Steven Keats, has been cast in a potential starmaking role in Seventh Avenue, a sixhour drama to be televised on NBC's Best Seller series early next year. Mr. Keats, who spent three years at Montclair State beginning in 1966, when he returned from Army duty in Vietnam, plays Jay Blackman, a young man who works his way up from poverty on New York's Lower East Side to a position of wealth and power in the garment district. He is now being seen in The Moneychangers on NBCTV, and has appeared in the movies Death Wish and Hester Street. Now filming Garment Districton locations in Manhattan and in his native Brooklyn, Mr. Keats said he had very pleasant memories of his drama studies at Montclair.

title: China Since Mao, the Peninsula Since the Vietnam War Ended
description: BANGKOK, ThailandThailand, Laos and Cambodia share a common frontier of 1,500 miles and, though their political philosophies and world outlooks differ sharply, for the last eighteen months, they have also shared a concern: How to accontmodate themselves to a reunified and powerful Vietnam

title: Criminals At Large
description: Two lighthearted and amusing crime books should make a lot of people happy come Christmas  THE CHICAGO GIRL by Tony Kenrick (Putnam's, $7.95) and THE BRICABRAC MAN by Russell H. Greenan (Random House, $7.95). Kenrick is a specialist in the comic caper. Greenan calls his book an extravaganza. Both authors see the absurdities of life and have the skill to keep the reader giggling while their characters pursue their outrageous ways.

title: Picture credits
description: 1PHOTOGRAPHERS INTERNATIONALNYT PICTURES/TERRY FINCHER

title: SYRIAN LEADER MEETS WITH SADAT IN CAIRO
description: CAIRO, Dec. 18President Hafez alAssad of Syria arrived here today for talks with President Anwar elSadat on an Arab strategy for the possible resumption of the Geneva conference with Israel.

title: COMMISSION FAVORS NEW PANAMA TREATY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18A highlevel private commission has prepared a policy blueprint urging that the administration of Presidentelect Jimmy Carter break new ground in relations with Latin America.

title: More Oil Revenue for Caracas
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Dec. 18 (Reuters)Venezuela is likely to earn an extra $900 million in oil revenue in 1977 because of the 10 percent price rise agreed to by most members of OPEC, according to initial estimates by government experts today. Venezuela is the world's fourth biggest oil producer with 2,200,000 barrels a day.

title: CORRECTION
description: The Weekly News Quiz in yesterday's Times erroneously said that Saks Fifth Avenue and Bloomingdale's, in response to competition, were offering discounts to cash customers. The correct answer to the question was that the two stores, like others in the city, decided to remain open last Sunday and today.

title: East Side Center to Gain
description: The East Side International Community Center will benefit from a gala holiday dinner dance at the St. RegisSheraton Roof tomorrow, to be sponsored by the Society of Foreign Consuls, the official organization open to all accredited foreign consular representatives. At the invitational event the society's awards of distinction will be presented to Mayor Beame, Mrs. John L. Loeb, New York City Commissioner for the United Nations and for the Consular Corps, and Marcia L. Dawkins, deputy commissioner, director of consular affairs.

title: Lisa Beth Rutstein Married
description: The marriage of Lisa Beth Rutstein, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alan Rutstein of Harrington Park, N.J., to Jack Langer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Moritz Langer of Fort Lee, N.J., took place yesterday at Tarrytown House in Tarrytown, N.Y. Rabbi Andr Ungar performed the ceremony.

title: IRAQI AIDE CONDEMNS SAUDIS ON OIL PRICE
description: DOHA, Qatar, Dec. 18An expected war of nerves between Saudi Arabia and other oil producers opened today, immediately after their Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries finished a meeting here with a split over oil prices.

title: Apartment Fire on West 55th St. Kills Woman and Injures 2 Others
description: A woman resident of 150 West 55th Street, near Seventh Avenue, was fatally injured in a fire that caused heavy damage to her living room Friday evening, the Fire and Police Departments reported. The victim, age unknown, died at Roosevelt Hospital, officials said.

title: Memorial Services
description: PEARSONKathleen. 15 Dec., 1961. A low mass of requiem was offered in Latin by a Father of the Society of Jesus.

title: Kings Point and Lilco:
description: KINGS POINT ELECTRICAL power to this welltodo North Shore residential community had been cut off by storms once too often last September when local officials decided that a survey of homeowners might help clarify the situation. It did.

title: Ert Recalls the Glamour of His Art
description: PARISWhen Romain de Tirtoff arrived in Paris at age 18, despite his family's outraged objections, he managed to get a designer's job at what he now calls a thoroughly secondrate fashion house named Caroline.

title: New Biographies to Explore Princeton's Role in the Revolution
description: PRINCETON WHEN George Washington was daring and dancing his way across New Jersey battlefields, when tea parties and tempestuous politics compelled even reluctant citizens to endorse revolution, the College of New Jersey was the hotbed of academic support for American independence. More than Harvard or Yale, the College of New Jersey (now Princeton University) produced partisan graduates who helped forge the new nation before, during and after the 10 crucial days during which the Redcoats were caught by surprise at Nassau Hall, which had been seized for use as a British barracks.

title: Albert E. Weis, Marketing Aide With Editor and Publisher, 65
description: Albert E. Weis, marketing and research manager for Editor and Publisher, the newspaper trade magazine, died at his home yesterday after a long illness. He was 65 years old and lived in Bellerose, Oueens.

title: Carolyn A. Kenmore Married to Dentist
description: Carolyn Ann Kenmore, a model and author, was married at noon yesterday to Dr. George D. Lynch, a dentist of Sharon, Mass. The Rev. Joseph O'Rourke, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony in the Cottage on the Park at Hampshire House.

title: Why humor is tricky in balletand in operais that much of the stylization in the lyric theater is extremely fragile.
College Boards: Are They Needed?
description: FOR many of New Jersey's high school students, the end of the year means football championships, basketball warmups and Christmas vacations. But for others, it means the last chance they have to take their college boards. It would seem that of all these events the last and most controversial one gets the least amount of applause.

title: Margaret Smith Plans Wedding To Clergyman
description: Margaret Davey Smith, of Hartsdale, N.Y., managing editor of The Daily News in Tarrytown, N.Y., and the Rev. Richard Unsworth Larom Jr., rector of the 150yearold St. George's Episcopal Church in Astoria, Queens. plan to be married Feb. 5 at St. George's.

title: Before Superstar, There Was Joseph
description: LONDON Will Eva Peron be the next superstar? An unlikely choice, but Tim Rice and Andrew Lloyd Webber, the creators of Jesus Christ Superstar, the most successful British musical of the 70's, are counting on it.

title: Argentina Decrees Increases In Public Transportation Fares
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 18 (AP)The military Government has decreed fare increases for city buses, subways, trains and airlines one day after raising the price of gasoline.

title: Judge and Prosecutor Are Accused of a Ruse to Convict a Suspect
description: An acting State Supreme Court justice and the city's special narcotics prosecutor have been accused of conspiring to supply false information to a grand jury to obtain an indictment that would make a government informer appear to be a criminal and thereby insure his safety.

title: Highs and Lows of a California Wine Tour
description: The Gray Line of San Francisco offers a tour of the Napa Valley Wine Country, but Gray Line was on strike. So we rented a car and, armed with a free guidebook to California's Wine Wonderland from the Wine Institute, we did it ourselves: seven wineries in nine hours, with tastings at five of them, all of which took some doing, some driving and some drinking.

title: 2 Men Convicted Of 3 RapeKillings Of Elderly Women
description: Two men were convicted by a jury in State Supreme Court in the Bronx yesterday of raping, robbing and murdering three elderly women.

title: Robert Finlayson Jr., Diane Scott Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert Leslie Scott of Lloyd Harbor, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Diane Elizabeth Scott, to Robert Murray Finlayson Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Finlayson of Huntington Bay, L. I.

title: Celtics Return to Glory And A.B.A. Fades Away
description: Stability came to pro basketball in 1976 with the consolidation of the National and American Basketball Associations. After a nineyear struggle for survival, 22 franchises, countless lawsuits and $40 million in losses, the A.B.A. went out of business. Four of its seven franchises  the Nets, the 197576 champions; Denver Nuggets, San Antonio Spurs and Indiana Pacersjoined the N.B.A. as the league grew to 22 teams for the 197677 season. Each A.B.A. team paid a $3.2 million entrance fee.

title: U.S. Steel Is Laying Off 6,100
description: GARY, Ind., Dec. 18 (UPI)The United States Steel Company has announced a series of temporary layoffs involving some 6,100 workers at the company's Gary Works in the next two weeks. A spokesman said 5,000 workers would be laid off beginning tomorrow and 1,167 more in the following week.

title: Diamond Quits Gaters
description: OAKLAND. Calif., Dec. 18 (UPI)The Golden Gaters of World Team Tennis announced today the resignation of General Manager Jerry Diamond. He said he was stepping down to devote full time to his executive dierctor's role in the Women's Tennis Association.

title: Deaths
description: ADLERBelle G. Wife of the late Richard. Mother of Robert and Larry. Grandmother of Joanna Beth, Sister of Berlie Reiter and Marilyn Seltzer. Services 10 A.M. today at Norman L. Jeffers Community Chapel, 47th St. and Fort Hamilton Parkway, Brooklyn, New York.

title: CB OPERATORS ASSISTING POLICE SAFETY PROGRAM
description: ALBANY (AP)Approximately 6,000 citizenband radio operators are cooperating with the New York state police in a 15month experiment aimed at greater public involvement in highway safety.

title: Music in Review
description: At the age of 21, Robelyn Schrade is entitled to display some excesses of youth, especially when they come surrounded by so many solid musical attainments. The New Yorkborn pianist, a scholarship student of the late Rosina Lhevinne and Martin Canin at the Juilliard School, has already won a number of local competitions, including the Young Musicians Auditions of Artists International, under whose auspices she made her Carnegie Recital Hall debut last Sunday afternoon.

title: Vietnam to Stress Human Needs
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 18Gen. Vo Nguyen Giap, Vietnam's Defense Minister and the nation's senior military tactician, said in Hanoi today that its leaders still intended to emphasize human needs despite the vast plans for the overall economic and political development of the country already presented by the leadership.

title: STONY BROOK WORK IS HALTED BY ALBANY
description: The State University Board of Trustees in Albany has decided to halt further construction of the university center at Stony Brook, leaving it twothirds completed, according to angry campus leaders, and concentrate the rest of their construction money on finishing the new Buffalo campus.

title: Gershwin by the National Chorale
description: Martin Josman and his National Chorale were apparently nervous that their Gershwin! concert Friday night at Avery Fisher Hall would damage their reputation for seriousness. No need to worry about that; we've long since passed the point where inflexible demarcations between serious and popular music need be taken very seriously and in any event Gershwin himself was a composer caught between those two worlds.

title: Brezhnev, 70 Today, Receives Top Decorations From Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 18 (AP)The Soviet Union today awarded Leonid I. Brezhnev, Communist Party Chief, its highest decorations on the eve of his 70th birthday.

title: The World
description: The leaders of the Palestine Liberation Organization have, for the first time, officially said they would accept creation of a Palestinian state, a departure to what has been their essential demand until now: the return of the Palestinians to the land on which Israel was created and, implicitly, the end of the Jewish state.

title: Indians Accused in Salmon Sales
description: EUREKA., Calif. Dec. 18 (UPI)Seven Indians have been charged with engaging in a commercial conspiracy to sell salmon they caught with gill nets in the Klamath River. Indians are allowed to use gill nets to catch salmon only if they use the fish for subsistence. The selling charge is a felony.

title: She Grrrs for the Monarch
description: She could sell me both ends of the Brooklyn bridge, said one fan. That's nice. Because the subject, Catherine Deneuve, who has been advertising Chanel Inc.'s fine fragrances for six years, is now also associated with LinColnMercury. More precisely, she is associated with the car company's classy compact, the Monarch.

title: Kennedy Home Is Reopened
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Dec. 18 (AP)The wicker bassinet used by John F. Kennedy as an infant, and other family artifacts, were back in place today for the reopening of the late President's birthplace. The only sign of the firebombing that damaged the house extensively last year was a charred kitchen breadboard. The house will be open to the public from 9:30 A.M. to 4:30 P.M.

title: J. B. Hughes, a Student, Marries Michele D. Fezza
description: Michele Desine Fezza, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Michael L. Fezza of North Haven, Conn., was married yesterday in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church in New Haven to John B. Hughes, son of Andrew L. Hughes of Huntington, L. I., and the late Mary Ellen Hughes. The Rev. William Hughes, a cousin of the bridegroom, performed the ceremony.

title: The Games Go On Despite Some Olympian Problems
description: The greatest miracle of the Games of the XXI Olympiad is that they were held.

title: If You Go . . .
description: ... to the Napa Valley wine country, and the Gray line of San Francisco is working, its ninehour Tour No. 6 leaves First and Mission Streets at 9 A.M. on Mondays, Wednesdays and Saturdays from March 1 through Nov. 15 only. Th tour includes a visit to one winery, either the Hurd Beeswax Candle Factory or the Vintage 1870 wine boutiques, as well as lunch. The cost is $17 per adult and $11.35 per child age 5 to 11. Advance reservations are required (Tel: 4157714000). AC Transit, 508 16th Street, Oakland, runs sporadic sixhour trips to the Inglenook Winery and Vintage 1870 (adults $7, children $5) and sevenhour trips to Sterling Vineyard and Hurd Candles (adults $8, children $6); neither includes lunch, but the latter includes the aerial tram fare at Sterling. Call 4156547878, ext. 314, between 8 A.M. and 6 P.M. for dates and reservations.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: DENVER, Dec. 18 (AP)John Ralston has relinquished his duties as general manager of the Denver Broncos to Fred Gehrke, but Ralston will remain as head coach, Gerald Phipps, owner of the National Football League team, announced today. Gehrke, who has been with the Broncos since 1965, currently is assistant general manager.

title: Letters: An Excess Of Auld Lang Syne?
description: To the Editor.

title: If You Go . . .
description: . . . on a flydrive trip to Europe, try to book a package tour in advance and you'll save money. Our basic flydrive package added up to $530 per person, as follows:

title: FILM VIEW
description: King Kong is something special and he knows it, so what he comes to New York to promote King Kong, the $25,000,000 remake of his 1933 picture, that opened this week, he asks for and gets the star treatment. He lays down rules. His press representative, a slight, nervous man, has at first demanded that I submit a list of questions to Kong in advance as well as allow Kong the right to check my copy. Both requests were turned down, though I compromised to the extent of telling the spokesperson some of the general topics I'd like to cover. Just don't go into his private life, said the spokesperson. He won't talk about Christian Science, Mae. West, Doris Day or politics. He's a very private ape.

title: Paperbacks
description: BODYGUARD OF LIES, by Anthony Cave Brown. (Bantam. $7.95.) How Allied Intelligence tricked and misled Hitler's forces while laying the groundwork for the DDay invasion: a big book containing enough material for 20 espionage stories.

title: 5 Collegians Win Awards For Swimming, Football
description: SHAWNEE MISSION, Kan.. Dec. 18 (UPI)A pair of Olympic swimmers and three football players were named today for the National Collegiate Athletic Association's Today's Top Five Award. They were: John Hencken, an Olympic gold medalist and fivetime N.C.A.A. champion from Stanford and Steve Furniss of Southern California, swimmers: and Jeff Dankworth, quarterback of the University of California, Los Angeles, Randy Dean, quarterback of Northwestern and Gerald Huesken, offensive tackle of Susquehanna. They will he presented the awards at an honors luncheon Jan. 11 in Miami.

title: Innovative Network Aids Burn Victims
description: THE recent explosion at a chicle factory in New York City turned out to be a successful baptism of fire for an innovative burntreatment network devised by a former electronics company executive. The network, which was established just five months earlier by the National Burn Victim Foundation in Orange, was able to quickly place 27 of the 52 New York blast victims in hospitals in New Jersey and Pennsylvania.

title: GALLERY VIEW
description: For the greater part of this century the reputation of JeanBaptiste Greuze (17251805) stood way below zero. Of the immoderate fame which once surrounded him, not a trace remained. Where Diderot, most eloquent of all writers on art, had gone overboard in Greuze's favor, critics looked away in embarrassment. Whereas Catherine the Great had sent to Paris for his paintings and would gladly have had him come to St. Petersburg, our tyrants of taste said Greuze? Forget it!

title: Police Conference of New York Lobbies for Binding Arbitration
description: ALBANY, Dec. 18 (UPI)Loss of binding arbitration as a negotiating tool could adversely affect the cause of labor peace between policemen and municipalities, a state policemen's group said today.

title: Letters
description: Our future selves?

title: Top Dog of 1976: Bouvier, Sheepdog or Greyhound
description: Terriers marched to the drums of competition, toys made strides, an Irish water spaniel made history but at the close of the nation's Bicentennial year of 1976 knowledgeable scorekeepers from coast to coast predict that the close contest for Top Dog of 1976 is really between a Bouvier, an Old English sheepdog and a greyhound. Chi. Taquin du Posty Arlequin, the 6yearold Bouvier des Flandres owned by Chet Collier of IrvingtononHudson, N.Y., has been the foremost representative of his breed for three years. Handled by D. Roy Holloway of Paradise, Pa., the 95pounder has won 112 working groups and 40 bestinshow awards including the national specially this year at Devon, Pa.

title: William Harrington Jr. Weds Katherine Lane
description: Katherine Penney Lane, daughter of the Rev. Dr. and Mrs. Warren Wilson Lane of Buffalo, was married there yesterday to William Wallace Harrington Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Harrington of Newark, Del. The ceremony was performed in Christ Chapel of Trinity Episcopal Church by the bride's father, an Episcopal priest, and the Rev. Thomas Penney Stewart, a cousin of the bride and senior minister of the Westminster Presbyterian Church in Buffalo.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: INSTALLING decorative Christmas lighting around the inside or outside of the house is a traditional part of the holiday season for a great many New Jersey homeowners, but it also can pose safety hazards and other problems if not done with reasonable care.

title: BigPower Rivalry in South Pacific Helped Impel Samoans to Join U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS N.Y., Dec. 18After 14 years of independence, the Pacific island state of Western Samoa has joined the United Nations, in part because it senses with some uneasiness that the big powers are showing increased interest in the South Seas.

title: Home Clinic
description: Q: I have a painted wooden deck made of 2x8 planks. These have developed small cracks which I feel will increase in size because of melting and freezing snow in the winter. Is there something I can finish the surface with that will fill in these cracks and stop them from getting largersuch as a polyurethane?R.L.B., Washington, D.C.

title: The Subtle Scenes
description: The headlines melt into history, but behind the headlines are the subtle scenes. And in 1976, as in every year, those are the memories that remain.

title: Getting a kick from champagne
description: Though we tend to think of it as one thingthe bubbly stuff that goes pop on New Year's Eve and at weddings  champagne has many tastes. There are about 150 producers in the Champagne district of northcentral France, where true champagne comes from, some 20 of which arc major houses that export to the United States, and each one creates a distinct house style.

title: Paying Respects
description: The famous old places are grown quite obscure. For some time I have been trying to ferret them out. Kaemon, the painter, said that to Basho, the poet, in OkuNoHosomichi ('Back Roads to Far Towns'). If you are quite lucky, you can still find the way to Emily Dickinson's grave behind Burger Chef and the Gulf Station in Amherst.

title: Article 9  No Title
Steder Defense Matched With Colt Offense Today
description: When the Colts meet the hottest team in the National Football League today, the Pittsburgh Steelers, will they be seeing dark images of last year's game?

title: National League
description: 1976 FINAL STANDING

title: Mary Calderbank Affianced
description: Mr. and Mrs. Thomas G. Calderbank of Stamford, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Mary Joy Calderbank, to William Buckley Cookson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert E. Cookson of Darien, Conn. Miss Calderbank, who graduated from the Sacred Heart Academy in Stamford, is a student at the University of Connecticut. Mr. Cookson has a B.S. degree in electrical engineering from the University of Hartford. He is an, associate engineer at ITT Communications Systems in Hartford.

title: Amateurs
description: In the past twelve years Donald Barthelme has written two novelsSnow White (1967) and The Dead Father (1975)five collections of short stories, a children's book that won a National Book Award in 1972, and a volume of parodies, political satire and fables that are nearly indistinguishable from his stories. He possesses the most distinctive and influential literary style in the avantgarde (or formalistic) branch of contemporary American fiction. Barthelme has managed to place him self in the center of modern consciousness, wrote William H. Gass. He is one of the handful of American writers who are working to replenish and extend the art of fiction, wrote Richard Gilman. If he has not attained the stature or public recognition of Nabokov or Pynchon or John Barthhis books have never been belt sellers, and his resistance to storytelling probably insures they never will beBarthelme at 45 enjoys a secure reputation as a genuine original, a technician nonpareil. He is a miniaturist not unlike Joseph Cornell, a pop artist like Warhol or Rauschenberg, whose camp extravaganzas and ironic murals first filled the galleries when Barthelme began to publish back in the early 1960's. (Before coming to New York, he'd been a museum director in Houston.)

title: Births
description: Black

title: U.S. Role in African Fair Imperiled
description: A shortage of funds is threatening to cut American participation in the Second World Black and African Festival of Arts and Culture in Lagos, Nigeria, next month from 800 participants to fewer than 200.

title: Program Of Rent Aid To Poor Is Insecure
description: Two years after it was created as the nation's major housing subsidy program, the socalled Section 8 rentsupplement system faces a highly uncertain future. And its ultimate fate could foreshadow the direction that Federal housing policy will take in Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's new Administration.

title: GARDENING
description: AMERICAN holly (Ilex opaca) grows wild all along the Eastern Seaboard from Massachusetts to Florida, but the popularity of holly for Christmas decorations has resulted in vandalized and broken trees and the disappearance of many wild stands in woodlands throughout the eastern and southern portions of New Jersey.

title: Italy Victor Over Chile In 1976 Davis Cup Final
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 18 (AP)Adriano Panatta and Paolo Bertolucci teamed for a 36, 62, 97, 63 vctory over Jaime Fillol and Patricio Cornejo of Chile today, clinching the 1976 Davis Cup for Italy.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: TOMORROW, DEC. 20

title: Contamination From a Health Purveyor
description: THE Health Sciences Center at the State University Center at Stony Brook, the most modern healthcare delivery facility now under construction in the country, contradicts its very reason for existence by contributing to the pollution of North Shore waters.

title: Anne L. Ferguson And Harry R. Leach, Architect, Married
description: Anne Lane Ferguson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Troy Ferguson Jr., was married yesterday to Harry Randall Leach, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ralph F. Leach. Both families are of Bronxville, N. Y., where the Rev. Charles L. Copenhaver performed the ceremony in the Reformed Church.

title: Pate's Memorable Shot Wins the Open
description: Over the years there are many great golf shots, but how many memorable ones are there, like the pressure shots that helped Gene Sarazen, Ben Hogan, Arnold Palmer and Jack Nicklaus win major championships? Last June, Jerry Pate added one: A No. 5 icon approach on the last hole of the United States Open at the Atlanta Athletic Club. Facing a threeway or fourway tie, Pate needed a par 4 to win, and his drive lay in light rough on the right. The approach had to carry a lake to a twotier green. Pate slashed his shot 190 yards stiff to the pin, perhaps 2 feet away. He sank the putt for a birdie and won by two strokes.

title: 56 Vietnamese Reach Australia
description: DARWIN, Australia, Dec. 18 (UPI)A motor launch with 56 South Vietnamese refugees on board arrived here today after a 2,200mile voyage lasting two months. Their arrival brings to 106 the number of refugees to reach Darwin by sea in the lats six weeks.

title: CHARLES SCHUMANN
description: Charles Schumann, a member of the financial and national advertising staffs of The New York Times for more than 40 years, died yesterday at his home in Union, N. J. He was 83 years old.

title: He Is Good at a Little Of Almost Everything
description: SPRINGFIELD SUCCESS hasn't spoiled Sidney Frank. It has merely bemused him slightly. I know I'm good at what I do, but whenever I make a couple of dollars, it's always a surprise, says the onetime businessman turned playwright, historian, author, humorist, songwriter and New Jersey trivia specialist.

title: Horton Signs Year Pact
description: DETROIT, Dec. 18 (UPI)  Willie Horton, the Detroit Tigers' 33yearold slugger, signed a oneyear contract with the team today. Fernando Arroyo, a rookie, also signed, leaving Vern Ruhles, pitcher, as the only unsigned player on the 36man winter roster

title: A Vote for Politicians
description: THE most interesting of all officeseekers is the nonpolitician. Nonpolitician candidates are marvelously varied in experience, ability, education, ideology, demeanor and motivation. The one thing they have in common is a frequently expressed contempt for that most loathsome of creatures, the politician.

title: Fallout From a Glut of Bars
description: WANTAGH SOPHIE BOQUIST was speaking in a quiet, calm voice that belied her anger and dismay. I've lived in this community since 1926 and I've always been happy here, she said, But latelywell, what can I say when I see my Cyclone fencing bent and twisted like a pretzel?

title: Nairobi Daily Hails Carter's Choice Of Young to Be U.N. Representative
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Dec. 18 (Reuters)The appointment of Representative Andrew Young of Georgia as the United States delegate to the United Nations has, for the first time, given blacks a voice in the formulation of American foreign policy at the highest level, the Nairobi newspaper, Daily Nation, said today.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: An Explanation or Two By a Mensa Official

title: Portuguese Feel the Pinch of Revolution in Food Shortages, Especially of Meat and Staple Codfish
description: LISBON, Dec. 18Portuguese housewives are beginning to feel the pinch of the revolution.

title: The Philharmonic A Troubled Giant Facing Change
description: Between now and next May, reads a recent Stagebill of the New York Philharmonic, the orchestra in well over 100 subscription and nonsubscription concerts, will resent (sic!) an imposing array of conductors, not to mention music covering a Ohronological span of three centuries....

title: The Taxpayers: Rumblings of Revolt
description: THE SPIRIT of revolt among New Jersey taxpayer groups may have given way, for the time being, to the spirit of Christmas, but all of that will change after the first of the year. Several score splinter groupsthe exact number is not knownhave been formed to defeat either the state income tax or those legislators who voted for it earlier this year.

title: Article 5  No Title
Edith Jackson Engaged
description: Edith Allen Jackson and Thomas Winship Richardson Jr. plan to be married Jan. 1. Dr. and Mrs. James Higginson Jackson of Brookline, Mass., have announced their daughter's engagement to the son of Mr. and Mrs. Richardson of Shreveport, La.

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: THE ISLAND may have voted to send the same six men to represent it in the 95th Congress as it did in the 94th but there is a significant difference: This year's delegation is two years older than 1974's. In the seniority game on Capitol Hill, that means several of the players will get to move up a notch or two.

title: Connecticut Loses $15 Million
description: HARTFORD (AP)Cigarette smuggling will cost Connecticut $15 million this year, according to state officials. They said taxevasion operations would reduce the S90.7 million the state should receive in cigarette taxes to $75.6 million, Connecticut's 21centapack cigarette tax is the nation's highest.

title: German Shoppers Stranded at Sea
description: NORDEN, West Germany, Dec. 18 (UPI) About 150 Christmas shoppers had to spend the night aboard the coastal ship Frisia VI when it ran aground off the North Sea island of Juist, the water police said today. The vessel, which was later refloated, had been carrying the shoppers from Juist to the town of Norddeich.

title: Weddings
description: WaldmanCantor

title: An original and abrasive novelist
description: By James Hanley. 368 pp. New York: Horizon Press. $8.95.

title: Pick yourself up, dust yourself off
description: BOSTON. The late afternoon sun slanting into the countryclub ballroom was strong enough to make the lighted chandeliers look slightly absurd, like candles at lunch. In chairs ringing the dance floor, a few dozen small Bostoniansfourth, fifth and sixth graders, and members of the first dance class of the seasonsat waiting quietly.

title: BuyingandSelling Only Is a Myth
description: DOHA, QatarThe split that occurred last week was not the first in the usually monolithic ranks of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries. Once before, in 1974, the Saudi Arabians held back over a minimal price increase, though they quickly rejoined the organization majority.

title: Article 7  No Title
UNCERTAINTY DELAYS BOLLES MURDER TRIAL
description: PHOENIX, Dec. 16Once again, a date has been scheduled for the trial of a man accused of murdering Don Bolles, the Phoenix newspaper reporter; but once again there is uncertainty over when the trial will begin.

title: SID PAYNE, 46, REPORTER AND HOCKEY EXPERT, DIES
description: Sid Payne, a sports reporter and hockey expert for the Long Island Press, died early Saturday morning of a heart attack at the Georgia Baptist Hospital in Atlanta shortly after filing his story on the Islanders' 4to2 victory over the Flames. He was 46 years old and lived at 1882 Cynthia Lane, Merrick, L. I.

title: POLLUTION IS TERMED LONGRUN CHALLENGE
description: WASHINGTONWhile the nation is making good progress in reducing pollution, the Carter administration faces a formidable array of environmental problems, according to the man who has had chief responsibility, for grappling with them.

title: New HowTo Books for Santa's Pack
description: The easiest way for the doityourself home handyman or handywomanincluding those who think they are not so handyto learn more about almost any phase of home building, maintenance and improvement is to study some of the many howto books that are available on these subjects in most well stocked libraries and book stores. To keep readers of this column abreast of the newest of these publications, here are some recently published books which should prove of interesteither as an addition to one's personal library, or as an excellent gift for relatives of friend who are interested in doityourself activities.

title: Stage: Colonnade Lab's Zesty Flea in Her Ear
description: Why did Georg Feydeau write better farces than anyone else? Wherein lies their eternal charm? Certainly they are perfectly made machines, and, in fact, they do not so much end as rundown. When all the complications are over, the final door slammed, the last wronged lover seemingly righted, we feel a certain letdown. The fireworks display is over, the champagne bottles lie desolate, marooned in cold water and a scattering of melting ice cubes. And there is an aftertaste of sadness.

title: Allen Future Uncertain After Lopsided Defeat
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 18For six seasons as the Washington Redskins' coach, George Allen always said, The future is now. But today, following a 3520 loss to the Minnesota Vikings in the National. Conference playoffs, his future is uncertain.

title: Long Island/This Week
description: ART

title: ART
description: MONTCLAIR THAT lopsided, unfair old saw, If you can't create, teach, is disproved by the Montclair State College exhibition in the school's Gallery One. This is a display made up of a rich diversity of objects certifying the imagination, experimentation and skills of teacher artists. Indeed, if some of the teachers teach as well as they create, Montclair State College has its share of talented professor.

title: Smith, Lutz Win Doubles As U.S. Defeats Mexico
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Dec. 18Welcome back Smith and Lutz, it's so nice to have you back where you belong.

title: Manhattan Notches First Victory, 7769; Tennessee Pins First Loss on St. John's
description: Manhattan College's basketball team, off to its worst start since the 197172 season, finally got into the victory column last night after four defeats. However, the Jaspers did it the hard way, going through a second fiveminute overtime period before defeating St. Peter's College of Jersey City, 7769.

title: Events Today
description: Fifth Avenue Holiday Mall: pedestrian mall and entertainment; 11 A.M. to 3 P.M., Fifth Avenue from 34th to 57th Street.

title: Hans Kng: Embattled teacher and priest
description: The controversial Swiss theologian Hans Kng has written the best defense of traditional Catholic Christianity to appear in this century. Christ Sein sold several hundred thousand copies in its German edition and was on the best seller lists in Germany for several months. It is unlikely, however, that so many American Catholies have the intellectual discipline to plow through a 720page book on their faith, and more's the pity. They will miss what may well become a religious and spiritual classic.

title: Attorneys for Cadets Draft New Proposal On Return to Classes
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Dec. 17Lawyers for cadets ousted in the recent cheating scandal at West Point have drafted a plan showing how the cadets can be returned to the academy in time for normal graduation next summer.

title: Radio
description: 7:308 A.M., WABC: Message of Israel. The Maccabees.

title: The OPEC Price Rise...
description: The split decision of the OPEC nations on next year's oil price increase presents the world with a hope and a certainty. The hope is that Saudi Arabia's five percent price rise and promise of greatly enlarged production will force 11 other OPEC members to rescind part of their twostage 15 percent price increase. The certainty is that the world oil price will go up significantly January 1.

title: Upper Volta's Finance Minister Asks Steps to Stimulate Economy
description: OUAGADOUGOU, Upper Volta, Dec. 18 (Agence FrancePresse)Finance Minister Leonard Kalmogo has called for shortterm measures to stimulate Upper Volta's economy.

title: Ashby Gore Planning Marriage in England
description: Mrs. Donald Thomas Oakes of Onteora Park, Tannersville, N.Y., and Henry Gore Jr. of Washington and Potomac, Md., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Beverly Ashby Gore, to David Charles GodfreyThomas, son of the Rev. and Mrs. Cecil Stephens Godfrey GodfreyThomas of Maldon, England.

description: Bold Forbes in the spring, Forego in the falland controversy before, after and in between.

description: KILL DEVIL HILLS, N. C.Planning a oneday duck hunt weeks in advance is a blind date promising only that some sort of an encounter will ensue.

title: World News Briefs
description: WARSAW, Dec. 18 (AP)The Polish Parliament today approved a law to promote and protect private businesses.

title: PEOPLE
description: Just after everyone else rings in the New Year, Clother H. Vaughn of Sag Harbor will be ringing down the curtain on a 50yearcareer in the Suffolk County Court System. Now the Chief Clerk of the County Court, Mr. Vaughn, who will turn 70 on Feb. 28, can look back on vast changes in the system he became associated with on Nov. 11, 1926. In those days, he says, we had one judge, a typist and myself. Mr. Vaughn, who began work in the court system as general cierk, says: We had stricter discipline in the old days. Coming into court was like going to church. Lawyers were highly respectful of the bench and judges were equally respectful. Litigants received every consideration. Now we do the Lest we can. And judges spend much more time in chambers because of all the plea bargaining so popular today. In the old days, too, he notes, a small population meant loss crime. The county frequently went an entire year without o murder case. Now we have 10 or 15.

title: Andrus Built Reputation on Environmental and LandUse Stands
description: BOISE, Idaho, Dec. 18Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's choice for Secretary of the Interior is probably best known to most Americans as the man who promotes Idaho potatoes in television commercials.

title: The World
description: The quadrupling of oil prices in 1974 brought prosperity to the producing nations but aggravated inflation, unemployment and debt difficulties in industrial, developing and underdeveloped countries. The charts on this page reflect the situation of nations typical in their category.

title: Richard Landry Experiments in Saxophone
description: The saxophone was invented around 1845, but its possibilties have only begun to be examined systematically during this century, principally by jazz musicians and more recently by composerperformers such as La Monte Young, Terry Riley and Richard Landry. Although jazz techniques seem to have had a profound effect on these saxophonists, their music has developd in a different direction, one more concerned with sound and resonance than with traditional melodic and harmonic values.

title: Konig Captures Run
description: Mike Konig of the Central Park Track Club won the Metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union 50kilometer championship run yesterday in Central Park. Konig was timed in 3 hours 4 minutes 50 seconds, breaking the course record of 3:06.12 set by Paul Fetscher of the Long Island Athletic Club in 1974. Pat Burke of the Millrose Athletic Association was second in the field of 20 starters.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: MOST homeowners still consider Christmas lighting very much a part of the holiday seasonin spite of increasingly higher costs for electricity. However, all too often people put up strings of lights, or add floodlights to the outside, without adequate regard for the potential safety hazards involved.

title: Ford Meets on Budget Before Trip To Vail, Colo., for 2Week Holiday
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 (AP)President Ford held his final meeting on the 1978 budget today and prepared to fly to Vail, Colo., tomorrow with his family for a twoweek skiing vacation.

title: American League
description: 1976 FINAL STANDING

title: For the love of God, boys, girls, lay off these Christmas stories about supersensitive kids, won't you?
description: You're going to like this story, I think, even though it never happened, never could and never will. But what do we care about that, you and I? Or is it you and me?

title: Beame Adviser Presses for Establishment Of Post of Deputy Mayor for Operations
description: It has been nine months since Mayor Beame's office first acknowledged it was considering the creation of the post of deputy mayor for operations. There have been plenty of new deputy mayors since thenOsborn Elliott for economic development, John C. Burton for finance and Nicholas Scoppetta for criminal justicebut no one for the operations post. The chief reason for the delay is said to be Mr. Beame's extraordinary sensitivity to charges that he is creating a gigantic superstructure at City Hall at a time of slashing personnel cuts in the city at large. When the Mayor entered office, there were three deputy Mayors. He now has six, although the criminaljustice position was mandated by the new City Charter.

title: Champagne survival kit
description: To open: Don't force the cork from the bottle, or let it richochet wildly off the walls. There are 85 to 90 pounds of pressure per square inch behind that cork, and if you catch it in the eye, you can seriously damage yourself. Instead, hold the bottle at an angle up and away from your face, and case the cork out. If you hold the bottle firmly in one hand, and slowly rotate the cork with the other, the cork will slide out, safely, and still give you a symbolic pop.

title: Harry, a Fox Terrier, Takes Best at Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 18Harry, the really hot fox terrier winner during the second half of 1976, did it again by taking his ninth bestinshow award tonight at the Philadelphia Kennel Club's Std show in the Civic Center Exhibition Hall. There were 3,331 canines in competition. Earlier in the day Harry added a 23d terriergroup triumph to his laurels.

title: Hanoi's Is a Flexible Brand of Socialism
description: HONG KONGWhen the Communists ruling North Vietnam held their last party congress 16 years ago, they approved plans to fight for control of the South while at the same time building socialism in the North. With the divided nation now one after a protracted and devastating war, the Vietnam Workers Party met again in Hanoi last week to make final a new socialist course for North and South.

title: Pandora Biddle to Be the Bride In March of John du Pont Irving Jr.
description: The engagement of Pandora Biddle to John E. du Pont Irving Jr. has been announced by Nicholas Duke Biddle of New York and Paula Denckla Watriss of Sparks, Md., parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Irving of Unionville, Pa. A March wedding is planned.

title: Henry Hudson Parkway From 72d to 81st St. to Be Reopened to 6 Lanes
description: The Henry Hudson Parkway between 72d and 81st Streets will be reopened to six lanes of traffic next Tuesday, after a 15month, $10.67 million reconstruction.

title: EarlyParole Plan In Effect for 3,000 In New York State
description: Prison officials in New York State are giving early parole consideration to 3,000 inmates in an effort to reduce overcrowding and make room for the many new prisoners coming into the prison system each month.

title: The Festival of
description: WASHINGTON'S twoweek retreat across New Jersey and the Delaware River 200 years ago left his army depleted and dispirited, ailing, underfed and underarmed. However, the British elected not to chase Washington across the river into Pennsylvania and perhaps deal a fatal blow to the revolutionary forces; their supply lines were already strung thinly across New Jersey, and they decided instead to settle into winter quarters. At the same time, the British general, Lord Cornwallis, made preparations to return to London to visit his ailing wife.

title: In Memoriam
description: BIRNHerman. Dec. 19, 1967. In loving memory of a dear and devoted husband, father and grandfather. Remembered with love today and every day.

description: Compiled by Elias Sports Bureau

description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 18 (AP)The President of India today signed into law a sweeping constitutional amendment giving the Government of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi farreaching new powers.

description: I'd like to comment on the election, and the performance of the press,

title: STAGE VIEW
description: Someone should devise a set of exercises for clearing our heads of echoes before entering a theater, particularly  nowadays  before entering a theater housing yet one more revival of a Tennessee Williams play. Mr. Williams's work has been so much with us these past few years that it has sometimes seemed impossible to set foot in the city without straying into Cat or Sweet Bird or Streetcar or one or another variation on Summer and Smoke, and our constant exposure and reexposure to the playwright's rhythms, people and themes has given us a good bit of excess baggage to carry about with us.

title: Television This Week
description: Today

title: TV VIEW
description: What is a Tom Snyder? Probably not even his hairdresser knows for sure, but the search for an answer provides a revealing tour of TV's news and entertainment maze. The outspoken Snyder doesn't hesitate to call some aspects of his business an impossibility or a con job. He is not what most of his colleagues would call discreet. His boredom threshold is extremely low, and when he begins to get itchy on a dull news day, program executives reach for their highpotency nerve pills. For better or worse, he establishes a defined presence. Unlike most other TV newsmen, he refuses to fade into slick processing. The result, of course, represents something of a gamble. While some viewers may be attracted to his irreverence, others will be turned off by his abrasiveness. Snyder is aware of this, but he is addicted to risktaking.

title: Suffolk Draws Up a Christmas List
description: HAUPPAUGE SUFFOLK COUNTY'S delegation to Albany got a Christmas list of legislative priorities from John V.N. Klein and Floyd M. Linton last week, most of them aimed, predictably, at easing Suffolk's budget problems.

title: Doctors and Malpractice Insurance
description: THE New Jersey Legislature has before it several sets of bills pertaining to medical malpractice. All of them seek to reduce the premiums that physicians and hospitals will have to pay by taking away the right of some New Jersey citizens to sue physicians and hospitals when they have committed malpractice. If the cause of the present situation were better understood, doctors and hospitals would be more enthusiastic about plans for malpractice insurance by the medical society without the assistance of the insurance industry.

title: Juantorena, Viren Feats Amaze the Track World
description: In a track year marked by stunning Olympic performances, the brightest star was a 24yearold Cuban who once failed at basketball and looked big enough and strong enough to succeed in football.

title: Boulez
description: If history is a guillotine, as Pierre Boulez has said, then during the decade following World War II he was one of those controlling the blade. In 1945, at the age of 20, he led his fellow students of composer Olivier Messiaen in booing Stravinsky's backward neoclassicism. Schoenberg is Dead, he later wrote, and with ?? polemic he discarded teachers and composers who could be of no help in the new musical age. Boulez, in his transformation of the musical language, was the acknowledged leader of the European avantgarde. It is not remarkable, then, that a few years ago in an interview with Joan Peyser, Boulez said, Creators must look straight ahead. It is not enough to deface the Mona Lisa because that does not kill the Mona Lisa. All the art of the past must be destroyed.

title: Bridging the Gulf Between Indiana and Brooklyn
description: A humorist looks outward and sees the world. observed Jean Shepherd. A comic looks inward and sees himself. lt was a practiced reply, but then Shepherd is a practiced humorist, not a comic; he's been perfonning and writing in his highly individualistic way for two decades. Thursday night at 9, on Channel 13, viewers will see what is perhaps his most ambitious project to date, a fulllength play entitled Phantom of the Open Hearth on the PBS Visions series.

title: DANCE VIEW
description: Two recent cult dance items in New York were The Spirit of Denishawn at the Roundabout Theater and Les Ballets Trockadero de Monte Carlo at the Brooklyn Academy of Music. The cultist fervor of their audiencesboth proved hot dance ticketsis almost all the two shows have in common, for the Trock is totally ridiculous and the Denishawn is approaching the sublime.

description: Princeton plays at Rutgers at 8 P.M. tomorow, and the game will start Channel 9's second season of telecasting local competition. Other games include Catholic University at Hofstra at 8 P.M. tomorrow and Fairfield at Seton Hall at 8:15 P.M. Wednesday.

title: Study on Korean InfluenceBuying Is Turning to Possible Prosecution
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18Justice Department investigators concluded at a meeting this week that their inquiry into alleged influencebuying by the South Korean Government had reached the point where they should end their vacuum cleanertype gathering of information and begin focusing on possible prosecutions, according to sources close to the case.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONBusiness and industry, operating for the first time under a new set of ground rules for campaign financing, played a significant role in helping elect favored Congressional candidates in 1976, but had much less influence in the Presidential selection process than in past years.

title: Some Proposals In Latin Report
description: The new administration should promptly pledge its full respect for the sovereignty of each Latin American nation and should commit itself not to undertake unilateral military intervention or covert intervention in their internal affairs.

title: Toying With a Name
description: In the aisles of a suburban toy store last Saturday night, there was more celebrity namedropping going on than at a fashionable East Side cocktail party. Where's Cher? one middleaged woman asked. Over there, another shopper answered, with Muhammed Ali.

title: Rangers Tie Hawks, 33, On 3 Goals in 2d Period
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 18The New York Rangers, rallying with hustle and a bit of luck, came back from a threegoal deficit tonight and tied the Chicago Black Hawks, 33, before a crowd of 13,500 in Chicago Stadium. Pat Hickey's goal gained the tie for the Rangers.

title: Weapons Systems Are Described
description: The F16 has been described as the first jet fighter to incorporate spaceage technology. It is lightweight22,000 poundsand highly maneuverable, and has a combat radius of 500 miles. The plane's Pratt & Whitney turbofan engine produces 25 percent more thrust per pound of engine than previous fighter engines.

title: Baryshnikov Tries His Hand At Choreography
description: When American Ballet Theater unveils its new, fulllength production of Mikhail Baryshnikov's The Nutcracker next Tuesday evening at Kennedy Center, in Washington, D. C., it will mark the dancer's debut as a choreographer and director. Baryshnikov's Nutcracker, with sets by Boris Aronson and 131 costumes created by Frank Thompson, will be radically different in concept from more familiar versions, including George Balanchine's hugely popular production given annually by The New York City Ballet. Although New Yorkers will not see this new version of the Tchaikovsky classic until American Ballet Theater's spring when the work will receive its New York premiere at the Metropolitan Opera, watching Baryshnikov rehearsing his very first choreographic effort provided an unusual and fascinating glimpse into the dancer's working methods.

title: Another Way to Celebrate
description: FOR Joe Lemieux, a 28yearold Hempstead civil servant, the expensive, elaborate gifts of a conventional Christmas weren't good enough. So this year, he put together a series of workshops, Alternate Celebrations: A Homemade Christmas at St. Bernard's Roman Catholic Church in Levittown.

title: Around the Nation
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 18 (AP)The California Supreme Court has upheld a law that prohibits construction of new I homes in the San Francisco. Bay area community of Livermore until additional educational, sewage disposal and water supply facilities are built.

description: ONCE upon a time, in the land of Albanork. there Iived a king who believed that his words created fact. that he could erase facts by merely restating them in different terms, and that all the people in this kingdom recognized, respected and accepted his extraordi??ry ability.

description: IN the Long Islandbased GermanAmerican Soccer League, which is dominated by clubs with such hyphenated names as the TurkishAmericans and the New York HotaBavarians, minority groups comprise the majority and Little Three Manhattan is a minority of one.

description: Franco Harris, the Steelers' back, on how Pittsburgh got into the playoffs: After we lost to Cleveland and were 14, we didn't say we couldn't lose another game, we said we wouldn't lose another.

description: Despite the currently sluggish pace of the economic recovery, business, failures have been fewer this year than last, according to the business economics division of Dun & Bradstreet, which keeps tabs on bankruptcies.

description: With the hockey season here, let me be the first to call for a needed reform.

description: VAL GARDENA Italy, Dec. 18 (AP)Franz Klammer of Austria today scored his second downhill skiing victory in two days and grabbed the lead in the World Cup standing from Phil Mahre of White Pass, Wash.

description: Sing a song of Mother Goose, she can't go far astray. Maybe she was political, upon a distant day; could be she's psychological, that's for a Bettelheim to say. Nonsense fun she surely is, perennial as May. But Granfa' Grig's a picture book, the illustrator's king I'd gladly do Tripp justice, but paper and ink don't sing.

description: LEONIA FOR eight weeks, we were possessed by a dybbuk in North Jersey. Not by any old dybbuk, but by The Dybbuk as presented by the Pearl Lang Dance Company at the Y.M.H.A. of North Jersey in Wayne.

Michael Blumenthal, the Secretary of the Treasurydesignate, hopes to win the backing of the business community for the economic programs of the Carter administration, partly by advocating policies that business approves and also by explaining to businessmen why the new administration may feel forced to do some things that many of them will not like.

title: Legislative Hearing Scheduled This Week
description: The following public hearing will be meld in the New York metropolitan area by a state legislative committee this week:

title: CAMERA VIEW
description: Anyone interested in photography is bound to be interested in books on the subject, and in recent years there has been a virtual outpouring of volumes in this area. Many of these will serve as welcome additions to any photographer's librarywhether he or she goes out and buys the book for himself, or whether it is received as a gift.

title: Pro Musicca Productions Of 12thCentury Dramas to Be Revived
description: Some of the most magical moments in music have been provided by the church performances of The Play of Daniel and The Play of Herod, two 12thcentury liturgical plays which were first produced here by the New York Pro Musica. The simple beautiful purity of the dramas and the music never failed to touch audiences. When their annual presentations  usually in the Christmas holidaysceased after 1969, it seemed as if something was missing. The good news Is that they are being revived by people closely associated with the original productions, even though Pro Musica no longer exists as an organization.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: Last week we played the IfIWereManager operatic game, suggesting neglected or forgotten repertory that deserves to be heard. Now let's take a look at the symphonic repertory, confining ourselves to the 19th century. For, despite the romantic revival, surprisingly little effort has been made by conductors and program committees to break out of the BeethovenBrahmsTchaikovsky handcuffs.

title: A Troupe That Travels
description: ROBERT GEMSON, an English teacher at East Meadow High School, took one last look around the lobby at his students, who were dressed like Chubby Checker, the Andrews sisters, Groucho Marx and Fanny Brice.

title: Happy Easter Shout Jails Woman 5 Days
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 18 (UPI)A woman who violated a court order and shouted Happy Easter, Connie to her 28yearold daughter last April to serving a fiveday jail sentence for contempt of court this weekend.

title: A world where suffering is unavoidable and pleasure a delusion
description: The world's first proper novel remains one of the few great ones, and in Edward Seidensticker's fine new translation, it looks astonishingly spry for its age. On its face a romance of the Japanese Heian court, Genji's central theme is the love of the shining Prince Genji for his favorite con sort; its sideromances, subplots (or halfplots), seductions, assignations and dawn getaways proliferate, but never quite get out of control. The author's second sight into her people's moods and motivations have led modern critics to label her work the first psychological novel. It is more than that. It is deeply religious, rooted in the Buddhist sense of the tragic impermanence of thingsalthough in later centuries Japanese Buddhist commentators confidently announced that Murasaki had gone to hell for writing such a dirty book. Murasaki's 54 chapters rival Proust in length, as well as in their wondrous subtlety of mood. Yet this sophisticated and extraordinarily modern book was finished before A.D. 1020, only a century after Beowulf and almost two centuries before the Chanson de Roland and the Nibelungenlied, at a time when the ancestors of the Prousts, Tolstoys, Melvilles and Cervantes were running around the forests of Europe in crude chain mail, clouting each other with battleaxes.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE ORGANIZATION OF PETROLEUM EXPORTING COUNTRIES, meeting in Qatar, was badly split on extent of price hikes. Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates will raise the price of their crude oil by 5 percent on Jan. 1. The 11 other OPEC nations will go up by 10 percent and, after six months, by another 5 percent.... The Federal Energy Agency disclosed a $6 billion plan for oil storage to insure against supply losses from foreign sources. It envisions storing 500 million barrels in underground Gulf Coast caverns close to pipelines... The Federal Power Commission was urged to make available larger supplies of natural gas to assist industry and prevent loss of jobs.

title: Austria Presses the U.N. on Moving More Activities to New Office Being Built in Vienna
description: VIENNA, Dec. 18Mayor Leopold Gratz recently called on Secretary General Kurt Waldheim at the United Nations in New York, handed him a new 1,000schilling gold piece and suggested that the coin be used to pay rent for the United Nations office center here for the next 1,000 years.

title: Ups and Downs of A FlyDrive
description: Meet a compulsive flydrive freaksomeone so hopelessly hooked that he crosses the Atlantic several times each year just to spin off for a week into some as yet unexplored portion of the European hinterland. For around $500 at this time of year one can get inclusive flydrive packages to Europe that provide roundtrip fare on regularly scheduled flights, a small car with unlimited mileage for seven days and accommodations for one night in a good hotel at the gateway city. Admittedly, it's a long way to go for a week of motorized wandering, but I can think of nothing more satisfying to body and soul than to travel the provincial roads of France or Italy or Spain in the offseason, with the green and red Michelin guides pointing the way to seductive sights, choice restaurants and quiet hotels.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: Georgia is on the rise in more ways than onethe American Numismatic Association will meet in Atlanta next year. Collectors who have attended any of the huge A.N.A. conventions in recent years know how convenient it is to be housed in the convention headquarters hotel, and the only practical way to insure this kind of conveniencewith attendance booming each yearis by making advance (far in advance) room reservations.

title: Jewish Music Is Inspiration For a Concert
description: In the second of two concerts called American Variations on Jewish Themes at the 92d Street YMYWHA, Charlie Morrow's Violin Concerto on Jewish Themes was the work that made the strongest impression Thursday night. This was not because it was better composed than the rest of the pieces in the program; its greater length made it seem more substantial. Its use of finger cymbals, drums and the chanting voice; its constant repetitions and the violin's melismatic music evoked the Middle East directly and powerfully.

title: Poll Finds Division on Price Curbs
description: Fortyfour percent of the American public would like the Government to reimpose wage and price controls, according to the latest Gallup poll. Fortyone percent of those questioned said they opposed such controls and 15 percent had no opinion.

title: Oklahoma State Trounces B.Y.U. in Tangerine Bowl
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Dec. 18 (AP)Terry Miller ran for four touchdowns, including a tacklebreaking 78yard burst through the line, and led Oklahoma State to a 4921 Tangerine Bowl victory over Brigham Young tonight.

title: Social Scientists Examining the Changing Character of Brooklyn
description: Brooklyn, once home to a predominantly white population, is in the midst of a vast shift in color and character.

title: Diane McCarthy Bride Of John Tobey Devlin
description: At the Episcopal Church of the Advent in Westbury, L. I., yesterday, Diane McCarthy, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William McCarthy 2d of Westbury, was married to John Tobey Devlin, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Joseph Devlin of Ramsey, N. J. The Rev. Herbert H. Beardsley performed the ceremony. He was assisted by the Rev. John Mallone, a Roman Catholic priest.

title: ART VIEW
description: Between the paintings that an artist produces in his lifetime and the way they come to be characterized and seen by posterity there are often  perhaps more often than notsome remarkable discrepancies. Take the case of Ernest Lawson (18731939), whose paintings are currently the subject of a comprehensive exhibition at the A.C.A. Galleries, 25 East 73d Street. For years Lawson's art was consigned, permanently it seemed, to the socalled Ash Can School that caused such a disturbance among the genteel minds responsible for determining the official taste of the American art world at the turn of the century. That Lawson was never drawn to Ash Can subjects, that the colorful realism of city life was never of much interest to him, somehow was overlooked. He had exhibited his pictures with The Eight? Some members of this group, John Sloan especially, were indeed drawn to such ugly subjects, and that was enough. Through a kind of guilt by association, the Ash Can label was attached to Lawson, and it stuck. No one seemed to notice that the man was obsessed, even when he painted the city, with a quite different imagerywith the light and space and loneliness of the pastoral landscape.

title: Article 4  No Title
SPOTLIGHT
description: At about 6 P.M., lines begin forming in the carpeted lobby of the north tower of the World Trade Center in lower Manhattana part of New York where, it is said, few people tarry after the end of the business day.

title: Dog Shows
description: AT PHILADELPHIA

title: Threat to Kill Madrid Aide Dropped
description: MADRID, Dec. 18The kidnappers of the rightist president of the edvirery Council of State disclosed tonight that they had canceled their decision to kill him in light of the Government's vague promise of an amnesty for political prisoners.

title: Merry Christmases
description: DR. J will be on the court. Pietro di Donato will be at his desk. The Rev. Robert F. Capon will spend part of the day in church and part in the kitchen. But for all of them it will be good to be home on the Island for Christmas.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: 1976, by Triangle Publications, Inc. (The Daily Racing Form)

title: Denis Dillon, 2 Years Later
description: TWO years after he was elected as Nassau County District Attorney in a campaign in which he depicted the Republican incumbent as soft on political corruption, Denis E. Dillon says such talk is exaggerated. The attitude of the 42yearold prosecutor, whose victory over William Cahn in November 1974 made him the first Democrat in more than 60 years to become Nassau District Attorney, has bitterly disappointed some of his fellow Democrats and supporters.

title: Syrian Troops in Lebanon Seize Control of Another Critical Paper
