description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 18The editorial offices and printing facilities of another Lebanese newspaper were occupied last night by Syrian troops in the Arab League's peacekeeping force.

title: RETIRING DETECTIVE CHIEF GETS CITY HALL SENDOFF
description: After 35 years on the police force, Louis C. Cottell, the Police Department's 62yearold chief of detectives, retired Friday.

title: When Hutton Talks ...
description: If you have a blind or illiterate friend who has a suppressed desire to learn about investments, E. F. Hutton & Company has a Christmas suggestionits new, tworecord L.P. Microgroove 33 R.P.M. mono album, Learn a New Language: Money. It sells for $9.95 and is the brainchild, of William Clayton, vice president mil portfolio manager.

title: Operation Sail Is Top Event of '76
description: This was a year for adventureand misadventure. It was a time for competitionfrom the Olympics and the Bermuda Race to the first professional yacht race. It also was a time for growth. Some 1.8 million persons joined the ranks of recreational boating, bringing the total to a record 50.5 million.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: AT INDIANA

title: The Peripatetic
description: MONTCLAIR WHEN Betty Turock was a corporatenomad wife and mother, her husband and two sons, she says, just handed me their lists and she did all the Christmas shopping and cooking and most of the cardwriting and decorating. She also stirred up a lot of holiday entertaining and was, she says, like so many women, a frazzled wreck by Christmas.

title: The Men Who Get the Ducks
description: THE rollcall of the Island's bays Shinnecock, Peconic, Gardiners, Napeague, Moriches, Great South, Smithtownevokes images of ducks wheeling down from tattered winter skies to land among deceitful decoys.

title: CHESS
description: My idea of the perfect brilliancyPrize game is one that contains a surprising and profound heavy sacrifice of material leading to a tremendous mating attack. The sacrifice must not be technicalmating in a constricted series of moves to a flat decisionbut should, rather, exhibit the imagination of longrange speculation.

title: A Meat Grinder Named Indiana Conquers All
description: Tome called Indiana's 8668 victory over Michigan for the national championship a war. Lou Carnesecca, whose St. John's team was beaten twice by the Hoosiers, had a better description for Indiana, winner of its 32 games. They put you through a meat grinder, he said. Bobby Knight, the demanding Indiana coach, had a different view of his team a day before the National Collegiate Athletic Association final at Philadelphia paired Big Ten rivals for this first time.

title: Bukovsky Gets British Asylum
description: LONDON, Dec. 18 (Reuters)Mr. Bukovsky has been given permission to live in Britain, a Home Office spokesman said today. He completed application papers some time ago, the spokesman added.

title: Stabler Goes Over for Oakland With 10 Seconds Left
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 18In a game that will be remembered in three entirely different ways by those of differing viewpoints, the Oakland Raiders eliminated the New England Patriots from the National Football League playoffs today with a 2421 victory. The triumph came on Ken Stabler's 1yard rollout run with only 10 seconds left to play in the game.

title: Paul Volcker Speaks Out
description: Paul A. Volcker, the lanky, cigarsmoking President of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, is one of the most experienced players left on the pitted and muddy playing fields of international finance.

title: Food
description: There is something about mountain air which whets the appetite. After a long clay of skiing, one is ready for substantial fare such as heavy soups, stews, potaufeu and the like. However, such dishes require hours preparation, which is more than the hungry skier is will ing to endure. An easy, satisfying and fast dinner prepare is the cheese fondue or the raclette. These wonderful cheese dishes are ideal for parties and great fun to share with friends. When more guests stop after dinner, warm them up with a yin chaud (hot wine).

title: A Christmas Appeal: Give to the Neediest Cases Fund
description: Nothing you do in your life prepares you for blindness, and the reality of daylight dimming inexorably to neverending night can be terrifying and frustrating and heartbreaking. It can strip you of your independence and plunge you into helplessness.

title: Schedule of Hearings To Be Held by Council
Bowdoin Honors Black Graduate
description: BRUNSWICK, Me., Dec. 18 (AP)A lecture series on the legacy and status of black Americans, named for a founder of the nation's first black newspaper, will begin next month at Bowdoin College, the school announced yesterday. The John Brown Russworm Distinguished Lectures series is named for the first black graduate of Bowdoin, who after his graduation in 1826, helped found Freedom's Journal.

title: Canadiens Regain Title, Europeans Leave Mark
description: The Stanley Cup and Avco World Trophy, emblematic of professional hockey superiority in North America, had to share their accustomed monopoly of the game last year with the invasion of top European teams. First of the foreign entries to challenge the dominance of the National Hockey League was the Soviet Union, whose two touring clubsCentral Army and Wingscaptured five of their eight games in a DecemberJanuary series against N.H.L. teams. The only clubs to defeat the Russians were the Buffalo Sabres and the Philadelphia Flyers. The Montreal Canadiens, though on their way to regaining the Stanley Cup, could only tie the Soviet Army squad.

title: A Frenchman Sells Doors by Day And a New Catholicism by Nigh
description: BOBIGNY, France, Dec. 16For 40 hours a week Rene Santraine sells windows and doors, hustling around the Paris I suburbs and earning $175 a week.

title: Town of 1,200 Votes Restrictions On Real Estate Tax Exemptions
description: ANCRAM, N.Y., Dec. 18This small Columbia County town has voted to bar real estate tax exemptions for 13 categories of nonprofit organizations that heretofore were eligible for tax relief.

title: Patricia Mulry Has Nuptials
description: St. Ignatius Loyola Church was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Patricia Maureen Mulry, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Donald E. Mulry of Tenafly, N.J., and Robert R. Dillon, son of Mr. and Mrs. Martin Dillon of Bayside, Queens. The Rev. William Carr, the Rev. Robert Haskins and the Rev. Eugene Prior officiated. Mrs. Dillon is an editorial assistant with House Beautiful magazine.

title: Specialty Buildings Thrive
description: The city's best shopping facilities are not necessarily its famous department stores or fashionable boutiques.

title: Raiders and Vikings Win
description: The Oakland Raiders defeated the New England Patriots, 2421, at Oakland, Calif., and the Minnesota Vikings beat the Washington Redskins, 3520, at Bloomington, Minn., yesterday in the opening games of the National Football League playoffs. Firstround competition ends today and the two conference championship games will be played next weekend, with those two winners meeting in the Super Bowl on Jan. 9 at Pasadena, Calif. Details in Section 5.

title: The New Mencken Letters
description: Since H. L. Mencken has hardly been a fashionable journalist during the 20 years following his death in 1956, it is unlikely that the publication of his correspondence will inspire massive interest. Nevertheless, this new volume of Mencken letters  affectionately edited with an excellent biographical commentary by Carl Bode, professor of American literature at the University of Marylandis something of a minor event in American cultural history, and a major one in the history of the American personality.

title: British Troops Kill I.R.A. Suspect
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 18 (Reuters)One man died and two others were seriously injured when British troops opened fire here today on a stolen car that crashed through a military roadblock and then refused to stop at another checkpoint. The security authorities believe the men were members of the Provisional Irish Republican Army who were planning to carry out a raid later in the day.

title: This Trick Was No Treat
description: THE APPROACH of Christmas returns to mind another holiday that was religious in origin and that brought sadness, not joy, to my home. That day was Halloween.

title: The Hidden Beauty Of East Northport
description: WITH each new season we are treated to paeans, rhapsodies about the East End. In the summer we read about the influx of visitors to the North Fork. On Labor Day we read that Greenport is celebrating because the tourists have gone home. In the winter we find out what famous writers are baking bread and stalking the empty beaches of East Hampton. We read about the bar where the writers gather, but it's no use our going there because nobody will point them out.

title: A Correction
description: In an article on the Huntington Y.M.C.A.'s back program in this section last week, Dr. Noah Finkel was incorrectly identified as a chiropractor. Dr. Finkel is an orthopedic surgeon.

title: T.L.C. Will Keep Christmas Gift Plants Blooming
description: Flowering plants are delightful gifts to receive. They are bright and cheery and extend their greeting by living on for many months. Most of the florists and greenhouses get high marks these days for including little tags with gift plants that tell how each plant is to be cared for. These tips have saved many a beautiful plant from a tooearly demise as the result of poor care.

title: CARTER CONSIDERING SPLITTING C.I.A. POST BETWEEN 2 PERSONS
description: PLAINS, Ga., Dec. 18Presidentelect Jimmy Carter is considering a realignent of White House intelligence procedures, he said here today, suggesting that someone other than the head of the Central Intelligence Agency could serve as his primary source of intelligence information.

title: Panel of New York Council Votes Longer HomeForeclosure Time
description: One and twofamily homes and condominiums occupied by owners or their immediate families would be exempted from foreclosure by New York City for tax arrears for three years under a bill voted out Friday by the City Council's Finance Committee.

title: Mary Elizabeth McDade Wed to George Anderson
description: Mary Elizabeth McDade, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Hardinge McDade Jr. of Mamaroneck, N.Y., was married last evening in Scarsdale, N.Y., to George Leonard Anderson, son of Mr. and Mrs. George Anderson of Chicago. The Rev. Francis T. O'Malley performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in St. Pius X Roman Catholic Church.

title: Catherine Murray Fiancee of Hilton Smith Jr.
description: Catherine Peronneau Murray and Hilton Charles Smith Jr., who are with the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development in Washington, plan to be married Jan. 8 in the Grand Choir at the Washington Cathedral (Episcopal Cathedral of SS. Peter and Paul).

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox: Winning Isn't Everything
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: The Year in Sports: Free Agents, Reds
description: In the Bicentennial year of the nation, the 100th year of the National League, the 75th of the American League and the first of the millionaire free agents, the Cincinnati Reds won all the money games and Marvin Miller, executive director of the players association, won all the money wars. But it would have been a long summer in baseball if not for The Bird, a 21yearold flake from Massachusetts with Harpo Marx hair, who talked to the ball before pitching, flapped his arms on the mound and drew 40,000 customers every time he did his number for the Detroit Tigers.

title: U.M.W. IS EMBROILED IN BITTER VOTE FIGHT
description: ST. CLAIRSVILLE, Ohio, Dec. 18Your years after it generated one of the most remarkable rankandfile upheavals in American labor history to end half a century of autocratic rule, the United Mine Workers is embroiled in an atmosphere of fear and reprisal similar to the one that stirred the rebellion.

title: South African Blacks' Patience Running Out
description: JOHANNESBURG, Dec. 18All across South Africa this week, Afrikaners have been celebrating the Day of the Covenant, commemorating the Boers' defeat of the Zulu Kingdom in 1838. The day, Thursday, was a public holiday in Soweto, too, but the mood there was scarcely one of celebration.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: (OTB payoffs subject to 5% State tax.)

title: U.S. Spurs Safety Inquiry Into Miami Plane Leases
description: MIAMIThe Federal Government has embarked on a stringent safety crackdown on largeplane leasing operations out of the Miami area, prompted largely by, the recent crash in Bolivia of a Miamibased Boeing 707 that killed 101 on the ground.

title: GARDENING
description: EVERGREEN boughs have long been associated with the winter festivals of man. Their evergreen leaves represented a continuing thread of life during the dreary, dead days of winter and gave assurance that nature would again come alive in the spring.

title: Thomasina Anne Sciales Wed
description: Thomasina Anne Sciales, a teacher at Public School 140 on the Lower East Side, was married yesterday morning to Salvatore Anthony Fiorella, law secretary to State Supreme Court Justice George Postel. The Rev. John Rowan performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of St. Ignatius Loyola. Mr. and Mrs. Basil William Sciales and Mr. and Mrs. Anthony Fiorella, all of New York, are the parents of the couple.

title: Ali Is Still the Champion But His Age Is Showing
description: Muhammad Ali likes to say, I am boxing. He also is controversy. And for a change, the world heavyweight champion was involved in as much controversy in the ring in 1976 as out of it. At 34 years old, Ali was beginning to show his age. But he retained the title with controversial 15round decisions over Ken Norton and Jimmy Youngand knockouts of two foreigners, and he tarnished the title with a controversial 15round exhibition draw with Antonio Inoki, a Japanese wrestler.

title: Rahway Struggles
description: OFFICIALS at Rahway State Prison have established an internal investigation unit and have stepped up a campaign to search visitors and inmates in an attempt to stein the flow of marijuana, narcotics and other contraband into the maximumsecurity prison.

title: New Hampshire Scofflaws Resist New York City Effort to Get Fines Paid
description: New York City is trying to collect $70,000 from New Hampshire scofflaws as a first payment on unpaid tickets, and the flinty New Englanders have got their backs up.

title: The World/Continued
description: HONG KONGA Western diplomat travelling in China was surprised recently when his guide in Nanking confided, The day we learned Chiang Ching had been arrested, not a bottle of alcohol was left in the city.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Two Teams Tied for Lead With 204's in Mixed Golf
description: MIAMI, Dec. 18Sandra Post and Tom Watson managed one birdie down the stretch today to gain a tie for the lead with Chi Chi Rodriguez and Joann Washam in the $200,000 PepsiCola mixed team championship at the Doral Country Club.

title: Regina Boudreault, Teacher, Bride of John David Pitcher
description: St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church, Woodsville, N. H., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Regina Marie Boudreault, daughter of Mrs. H. Edward Moses of North Haverhill, N. H., and the late Patrick Boudreault, to John David Pitcher, son of Mr. and Mrs. David E. Pitcher Jr. of East Norwich, N. Y. The Rev. Roger P. Bilodeau performed the ceremony.

title: FOOD
description: THERE was a murmur of conversation in the group watching Claire Wagner line a charlotte mold. Mrs. Wagner looked up, a frown crossing her brow beneath stern blond bangs, and admonished sharply: Mesdames, it faut parler frangais. Ne trichezpas! One of the students, Mildred Netreba, whispered; I wasn't cheating: to her, my French sounds like English.

title: Bull Market for Soccer Is Continuing
description: Although another year went by without an American championship for Pel, the 36yearold Brazilian superstar proved in 1976 that he was still soccer's biggest attraction. Besides the huge crowds he lured to see him and his New York Cosmos play in Tampa, Tokyo and Paris, Ple attracted close to 50,000 in Bloomington, Minn., an area virgin to pro soccer until last spring.

title: McRae, Carty Excel Among A.L.'s dh's
description: Hal McRae of Kansas City and Rico Carty of Cleveland led most designated hitting departments, according to figures released by the American League.

title: Elena Prohaska Wed To Philip R. Mengel
description: In St. Thomas Episcopal Church yesterday, Elena Prohaska, who teaches arts and crafts at the Town School, was married to Philip R. Mengel, president of the Fiduciary Investment Corporation. The Rev. John Andrew performed the ceremony.

title: Commodity Surpluses
description: Consumers are facing higher prices despite the mounting surpluses of key commodities throughout the world. Page D9.

title: Argentine Military Buries Juan Peron 2 Years After Death
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 19 (AP)The body of Juan D. Pern was finally buried today in a local cemetery, almost two and a half years after his death. The military Government apparently hopes that the Peronist movement, which dominated the country's political life for more than 30 years, has also been buried.

title: The Voice of Food
Plane Crashes Into Stands
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 19A singleengine plane that had buzzed Memorial Stadium in the closing moments of the Pittsburgh Steelers' 4014 playoff victory over the Baltimore Colts today crashed into the almostempty upperdeck stands 15 minutes after the game.

title: Africa's Churches, Long Scorned As Colonialist, Now Preach Change
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Dec. 19Christian churches once depicted as paternalistic agents of colonialism in Africa are now being applauded by black Africans for their role in challenging white supremacy and their contributions to the development of existing black states.

title: Yonkers
description: ENTRIES

title: Exchange of Research Teams With Soviet Is Canceled
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19An agreement to exchange soil research teams this year has collapsed because of Soviet limitations on travel by American soil scientists, according to government officials and researchers here.

title: Bukovsky Tells of Harsh Soviet Prison Conditions
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, Dec. 19 (AP)Vladimir K. Bukovsky, the Soviet human rights activist freed in an international exchange of political prisoners, said today that prison life had become much more difficult after the Helsinki accord on EastWest cooperation was signed.

title: Gifted With Indecision
description: It's late in the season and I have not yet bought a single gift. This is not because of scruple or parsimony; it's the result of sheer indecision.

title: Lockheed ExOfficial Says Initiative In Bribe Cases Came From Japanese
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19The former vice chairman of the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation, A. Carl Kotchian, who was a central figure in the Lockheed scandal in Japan, has asserted that the bribes his company paid In that country were all requested by Japanese, not offered by Lockheed.

title: In Memoriam
description: WERTHAMERIris Melita. To our dearest flower. THE INDELMANS.

title: Late Drive Following Blocked Punt Fails
description: IRVING, Tex., Dec. 19The 52,436 fans at Texas Stadium today waited and waited at the RamsCowboys game for something exciting to happen. When something did happen, in the last two minutes of play, it was not quite exciting enough as the home team failed once more to score the winning points. So Los Angeles won, 1412, and the victory projected the Rams into the National Football Conference championship game against the Vikings in Minnesota next Sunday.

title: Bliss Inui Married to Peter Rand, Novelist
description: The marriage of M. Bliss Inui, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Frank K. Inui of Talihina, Okla., to Peter Rand of New York took place yesterday in St. Luke in the Fields Episcopal Church. The Rev. Ledlie Laughlin performed the ceremony. The bridegroom is the son of Mrs. Byron DeMott of Nairobi, Kenya, and the late Christopher Rand, who was an author and staff writer for The New Yorker.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: AT CLEVELAND

title: Anne Hebald, Writer, Is Married To Michael Ezra Mandelbaum
description: Anne Hebald and Michael Ezra Mandelbaum were married yesterday afternoon in the Faculty Club of Harvard University by Rabbi Maurice L. Zigmond. The bride is a writer with the Harvard University News Office and Mr. Mandelbaum is an assistant professor of government at Harvard.

title: Mining Company Happy With Subsidiary Role
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 19On the eve of the largest merger in American corporate history, executives and employees of Utah International Inc. are saying that its merger with the General Electric Company, which becomes final tomorrow, is generally a good thing for the San Franciscobased mining company, though questions remain about Utah International's future.

title: Ideologies Are Splitting East African Union
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  The East African Community the Common Market and Customs Union of Kenya, Tanzania and Uganda, is in an advanced stage of disintegration, its member states refusing to pool revenues and accusing each other of sabotaging what was once widely acclaimed as a model of regional development and economic coordination.

title: Music: Miss Dickinson, Pianist
description: Some instrumentalists shape their interpretations to conform to their technical abilities and others just plow ahead, leaving the audience to glimpse a fully realized conception through a veil of digital betravals

title: An American Comes Home From Paris
description: NOAH HOWARD a 33yearold jazz saxophonist from New Orleans who has been living in Paris since 1972, sat back in his chair in a friend's midtown apartment and sipped from a glass of Prench wine. There's a definite reason why I left America, he said. In Europe I can play on the radio, on television, in clubs and at large festivals. There's a very large and loyal audience for the kind of new jazz I play; it's an established art form there. A festival devoted entirely to new jazz, like the Moers festival in Holland, can attract at least 10,000 people. Here, new jazz is still an underground phenomenon.

title: Officials and Raiders Anger Patriots
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 19Their 1976 football season over, the New England Patriots headed home after yesterday's lastminute 2421 loss to the Oakland Raiders complaining bitterly about the officials and Oakland's dirty play.

title: 2 Black Mayors Not Disappointed In Carter Appointments So Far
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (AP)Two black mayors said today they were not disappointed that Jimmy Carter had not appointed any blacks to the Cabinet so far.

title: Italian Skiers 1, 2, 3 In Special Slalom
description: MADONNA Di CAMPIGLIO, Italy, Dec. 19 (AP)Fausto Radici, blind in one eye, competed in a heavy snowfall today and won the men's World Cup ski special slalom, leading the Italian team to a 1, 2, 3 sweep.

title: Slight Drop in Reading Level Found in New York Schools
description: Reading performances by pupils in New York City's public schools declined slightly last year during the first year of massive spending cuts throughout the school system.

title: Cocoa Exchange Plans To Join Options Trend
description: The New York Cocoa Exchange is planning to join the trend toward offering trading in options based on futures contracts, it announced last week. However, the Cocoa Exchange's proposed options would be traded alongside futures on the trading floor through open auction and not by bidandask quotations, as is the case with the new silver and copper options.

title: Carter Nominee Faults Kissinger On Foreign Economic Policy
description: Henry A. Kissinger, the outgoing Secretary of State, doesn't know very much about foreign economic policy, W. Michael Blumenthal, who will be Secretary of the Treasury in the Carter administration, said in an interview published today.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: The LastMinute Dilemma

title: Community Boards Are Still Not Named 2 Weeks From Changeover
description: With less than two weeks remaining before substantial portions of the revised New York City Charter go into effect, the 50odd community boards, whose more than 2,000 members will constitute a new grassroots level of municipal government, have yet to be designated.

title: Coast Guard Acts To Pump Out the Oil On Grounded Vessel
description: BOSTON, Dec. 19 (AP)Up to 1.5 million gallons of oil that spilled from a grounded tanker moved in globs as large as 1,000 square feet toward the rich Georges Bank fishing grounds today. The Coast Guard moved in equipment to unload millions of gallons of heavy industrial oil that remained aboard the vessel.

title: Market Place
description: Avon Products, a glamour issue using lipstick and powder to force a spectacular performance in the stock market, peaked in 1973 when it became clear that there was a limit to the amount of cosmetics the Avon Lady could sell door to door.

title: $200 in Coins Bails Out a Santa
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Dec. 19 (UPI)A Santa Claus was arrested by the police for illegal soliciting near a shopping center, but he stayed out of jail. The police said that 22yearold Michael Kern, a Hare Krishna disciple from Buffalo, N.Y., was wearing a Santa Claus outfit when arrested yesterday. He was released when he posted bond of $200, all in coins.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Indirect Evidence Used to Link Wendy Yoshimura to Arms Cache
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 19The prosecution in the trial of Wendy Yoshimura shifted its attention last week to evidence found at the San Francisco apartment where Miss Yoshimura and Patricia Hearst were arrested last year. The evidence included pistols and ammunition discovered in the purses of the two women.

title: Plains, Ga., Presents 2 Contrasting Faces Typical of the South
description: PLAINS, Ga., Dec. 19A young couple from Indianapolis spent a rather disappointing hour here last week, browsing through cluttered shops crammed with Jimmy Carter souvenirs and finally buying an overpriced pair of children's Tshirts emblazoned with a grinning caricature of the Presidentelect before hurrying back to their car to continue their vacation trip to Florida.

title: The Cabinet Problem...
description: Presidentelect Carter has a thorny and unusual problem in selecting his Cabinet. The problem is whether appoint two menJames R. Schlesinger and John Dunlop who were dismissed from the Cabinet of his predecessor. President Ford.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (UPI)A $713 million program to upgrade the nation's air traffic control system was begun by the Federal Aviation Administration without adequate assurance that it would improve safety, Congressional auditors said today.

title: NASA Reports a Perfect Record Of 16 Successful Launchings in '76
description: The United States had a perfect record of 16 successful civilian space launchings in 1976 and plans about 18 to 20 attempts in 1977, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration reports.

title: TELEVISION TODAY
description: Morning

title: Article 1  No Title
description: STATUS IS A BULOVA LED

title: Smugglers Fight on Kenya Border
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Dec. 19 (AP)Rioting broke out over a load of smuggled coffee at a market on the KenyaUganda border today, leaving at least three persons dead and 40 injured, the police said. The fighting, with machetetype knives, clubs and stones, was between two rival groups over coffee smuggled in from Uganda, a police spokesman said.

title: Assembly Vote Scheduled for Today on 81 Bills; One Allows Publication of Voters' Party Preference
description: TRENTON, Dec. 19The Assembly will vote tomorrow on an election bill that is hotly contested by goodgovernment groups.

title: The U.N. Today
Chocolate Cake Kid: A Drama
description: HAD YOU peeled away the roof of a rambling onestory residence on St. Armand's Key in Sarasota in the manner of Le Sage's The Devil on Two Sticks a couple of winters ago, you might have beheld an oddly assorted quartet seated in a blue funk in the living room. Burnished like driftwood from long exposure to the crosswinds of Hollywood and Broadway, hair silvered by the exigencies of their common profession, the four nevertheless retained a dignity and sweetness such as is often found in Italian pizza bakers on Carmine Street.

title: $10,000 to Decorate Or Is $1,000 Enough?
description: What's the difference between $1,000 and $10,000?

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Federal Reserve Shows It Means To Accommodate Credit Markets
description: The Federal Reserve last Friday permitted the Federalfunds rate, the basic interest rate of the money market, to trade at 4 9/16 percent, and it took no action to keep it from drifting that low. Later it announced a reduction in the volume of reserves that banks are required to hold against checking account deposits.

title: SUTTON COMES CLOSE TO MAYORAL DECISION
description: Percy E. Sutton, the Borough President of Manhattan, came within an inch of formally announcing his candidacy for the Democratic nomination for Mayor of New York City yesterday.

title: BUSINESS SWINDLES BY MAFIA REPORTED
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 19Detectives in six Western states say they have uncovered a Mafiadirected, nationwide economic crime organization that they say has swindled businessmen out of millions of dollars and then moved in to take over and control some of the businesses that borrowed money from the group.

title: Issue and Debate
description: Residents of 86th Street near Central Park West, on Manhattan's West Side, are fighting to keep a socialrehabilitation program for former patients of mental institutions from moving its facilities into the 16story Brewster Hotel, a faded, elegant but stillstable building on that middleand uppermiddleclass block.

title: Golf
description: AT MIAMI

title: Lost Weekend for Kentucky Is Felt on Court and Off
description: ThursdayJoe Hall, the Kentucky coach, suspends three players, including two key starters, for curfew violations.

title: Russian Music Raises the Roof
description: A proclamation by Mayor Beame declared Saturday Russian American Day, and the Congress of RussianAmericans celebrated the occasion by sponsoring a concert on a grand scale in Avery Fisber Hall that afternoon.

title: 5th Ave. Cash Registers Jingle All the Day
description: Shoppers mingled with sightseers yesterday and brought tidings of comfort and joy to department stores and the many smaller shops that were open for the second Sunday of Fifth Avenue's holiday mall.

title: Acquisition Set Today of Utah International
description: The new General Electric Company that officially begins its operations at 4 P.M. today will, from outward appearances, be little changed from the giant electricalelectronics manufacturer of old.

title: East German Olympic System a Success
description: EAST BERLINEast Germany, Communist country of 17 million people, has perfected an allencompassing system for turning out Olympic champions in every discipline of sport. This year, for the first time, some of its secrets have been revealed to the Western public.

title: Storm Damage Heavy In 2 Australia Towns
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Monday, Dec, 20 (AP)A cyclone with winds of up to 120 miles an hour ripped through northern Queensland last night, severely damaging two towns and leaving several hundred persons homeless. There were no reports of injuries.

title: The Thin One
description: I am very thin, certainly too thin. I have not weighed myself in eight years. People do not take kindly to this revelation, especially those like the desperate dieters who recently wrote of their ordeals in these very pages (one woman wrote how she even swallowed cotton balls).

title: Personal Finance: Forgotten Gains
description: BACK in the early days of World War H, when G.I.'s were being paid $21 a day (but only once a month). F. N. Clapper somehow managed to scrape together $1,800. Just before being shipped overseas, he tucked the money into an account at the North River Savings Bank in Manhattan.

title: Shirley Strong Wed To Edward Wes Jr.
description: Shirley Warner Strong, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Strong of Saratoga, Calif., formerly of Rye, N. Y., was married yesterday to Edward Jules Wes Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Wes of San Diego.

title: Company's Plans for Power Plant Spark Controversy in WoodRidge
description: WOODRIDGE, Dec. 19Residents of this Bergen County community of 8,500 people and officials of the CurtissWright Corporation, its largest taxpayer, are in a dispute over the company's plan to build a coalburning power plant here.

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: NEW YORK'S fashionable armies of the night swept across the shimmering East River last week and invaded Brooklyn Heights. They arrived in big limousines, nondescript cars and uncertain taxis, causing a traffic jam in the narrow streets. Attaining their objective, they overran it, storming the preserved quiet of the town house where Norman Mailer lives.

title: JUDGE LETS F.T.C. CHECK RETAIL PRICEFIXING DATA
description: Federal Judge Henry F. Werker has approved a request by the New York office of th Federal Trade Commission to examine exhibiis submitted by companies subpoenaed within the last two years in connection with the Justice Department investigation of pricefixing by three major Fifth Avenue retailers.

title: The Winter Nights
description: Now the year balances its accounts. The short days and long nights are upon us. The winter solstice, the technical beginning of winter, does not occur until tomorrow, but the daylight, sunrise to sunset, will shorten only another minute or so. We are already at the year's nadir. We have passed the year's earliest sunset. Sunrise will continue to lag through the year's end.

title: World Wheat and Rice Output Keeps Ahead of Population
description: LONDON, Dec. 19 (Reuters) World wheat and rice production has kept well ahead of the population explosion since World War II, according to figures released by the International Wheat Council.

title: HERBERT A. DINGWALL
description: Herbert A. Dingwall, a member of the advertising staff of the Curtis Publishing Company in New York City from 1928 to 1954, died Thursday at the Veterans Hospital in White River Junction, Vt. He was 85 years old and until recently had lived at 5 Tudor Place in Manhattan.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: A GALLERY IS BORN Several months ago, thirdfloor space was converted into an art showcase at the historic Arsenal Building, 64th Street west of Fifth Avenue, by the Parks and Recreation Administration, which has offices in the landmark structure.

title: HOPES RISE FOR RELEASE OF ABDUCTED MADRID AIDE
description: MADRID, Dec. 19 (UPI)  Official sources today expressed hope that the leftwing kidnappers of a high government official would free him in exchange for a possible release of political prisoners.

title: Reading Scores in City's Public Schools
description: The following tables summarize some of the key findings of the reading achievement tests given in March 1976, as reported by the New York City Board of Education.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for week follows:

title: Rangers Edge Barons by 32 After 30 Lead
description: The Rangers served up a meatandpotatoes triumph last night with a touch of au Gratton. Tasting defeat by a 32 score were the Cleveland Barons, who were shut out by Gilles Gratton, the Ranger goaltender, for 50 minutes.

title: Gilmour Takes Title In Harness Racing
description: MONTICELLO, N.Y., Dec. 19William (Buddy) Gilmour, with a high ranking of four secondplace finishes in five championship races, won the first Eastern Harness Driving title today with 32 pointsdefeating the leading reinsmen of seven other seaboard tracks. Gilmour, representing the Meadowlands in New Jersey, was fifth in one race on today's matinee card at Monticello Raceway.

title: How Sweet It Was! The Potato Cart of Yore
description: In these days, when the sweet potato must be candied or served up with marshmallows, or, at the very least, laced with butter to be considered edible, it may seem inconceivable to the young that to their grandparents the most unforgettable of all sweet potatoes came without embellishment.

title: Business Bribes Abroad: A Deeply Etched Pattern
description: Although the Arab boycott office in Damascus denies it, a company can have its name removed from the boycott list by a payment in the $25,000to$40,000 rangeprovided its contacts with Israel are not too visibleaccording to a study on questionable corporate payments abroad recently completed by Business International, a private publishing, research and advisory oreanization.

title: Opera: Bumbry's Tosca
description: THERE WAS NOTHING very subtle about the Metropolitan Opera's Tosca Saturday night, the first performance of the season. It was sung to the hilt by the three principals, who took a broad, sockitto'em approach to the opera that left the fans cheering.

title: There's a Plane in the Upper Deck'
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 19 Many of the 60,020 spectators had departed long before the Pittsburgh Steelers completed their 4014 victory.

title: HOME OF ALLAN JONES IS DAMAGED BY A FIRE
description: A smoky electrical fire yesterday destroyed one room in the Dorchester Towers apartment of Allan Jones, the actorsinger, at 155 West 68th Street.

title: EXU.S. APPEALS JUDGE IS REPORTED CHOSEN AS ATTORNEY GENERAL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19Presidentelect Carter has decided to nominate a fellow Georgian, Griffin B. Bell, a former Federal appellate judge, to be Attorney General, sources close to Mr. Carter said today.

title: Books of The Times
description: WHEN THEY BROUGHT out the children's picture books this year, we found that some of our oldest friends, such as Arnold Lobel's gentle Frog and Toad and James Marshall's hippopotami, George and Martha, seemed tiresome and predictable. Was it then the end of Western civilization as we have known and admired it? Not at all. Frog and Toad and George and Martha are simply running out of acts. There are plenty of fresh children's books this year, one or two of them even sequels. The following, in no special order except maybe degree of sophistication, seemed to me the most entertaining.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: I HAVE NOTED that there is great deal of mystique in the public mind about the complexity of preparation of some of the most widely ordered dishes in French restaurants. There are numerous dishes, excellent creations, which, made at home or in a professional kitchen, do not demand longsimmered sauces, a complicated series of steps and legerdemain on the part of a chef.

title: Opera: A Likable Sachs
description: The Metropolitan Opera has given what seemed like an unprecedented number of performances of Wagner's Die Meistersinger this season. By the 11th and final one, on Saturday afternoon, it apparentlyhad run out of Hans Sachses, because it brought in for single appearance the German bass Karl Ridderbusch, who had sung in some of Wagner's Ring operas here in the late 1960's.

title: John S. Van E. Kohn, 70; Book Collector Coowned Shop on 46th St. 30 Years
description: John S. Van E. Kohn, a coproprietor for the last 30 years of the Seven Gables Bookshop at 3 West 46th Street, died Saturday at White Plains Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived at 10 Sound View Circle in White Plains.

title: Coalition Decries Cutbacks Made in HealthCare Services for the Poor in New York City
description: A coalition of community activist groups and several city and state politicians decried cutbacks in city healthcare services as an insufferable burden on the poor and said that concerted political pressure and street demonstrations may be necessary to block further cuts.

title: SIMON SEES EFFECT OF OPEC PRICE RISE FOR U.S AS SLIGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (AP)William E. Simon, Secretary of the Treasury, cautioned today against tax cuts without balancing reductions in Federal spending.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO OXFORD 53311 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY: NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33900; WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300; NASSAU CO. (516) 7470500; SUFFOLK CO. (516) 6691800: CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: Two Grocers Slain by Holdup Men
description: Two grocers in New York City were killed by holdup men in separate incidents Saturday night and early yesterday morning, the police said.

title: Background of Religious Party
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 19The National Religious Party has been part of every Israeli government since 1948, except for brief periods in opposition to protest specific policies.

title: Gettysburg Tower Owner Seeks to Avoid a Local Tax
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa., Dec. 19  The owner of the Gettysburg battlefield tower is back in court, this time with a petition to have his controversial 307foothigh classroom in the sky declared an educational facility exempt from local amusement taxes.

title: Chess:
description: The United States Chess Federation this year instituted a program of 10man roundrobin competitions to train and encourage promising players. Six entrants in each of these tournaments already have an official International Chess Federation rating, thus enabling the remaining four to acquire rated status.

title: Bridge:
description: A famous bridge personality was among the competitors at the Greater New York Bridge Association's Winter Regionals at the New York Hilton Hotel during the weekend. Competing as an honored guest of the organizers was Lou Gurvich of New Orleans, who was recently elected president of the American Contract Bridge League for 1977.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: THE SONS OF THE DESERT is a society of devotees of Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy. It has a small but discriminating membership and a memorable motto, Two Minds Without a Single Thought.

title: College Results
description: BASKETBALL

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, DECEMBER 20, 1976

title: Samuel Davis 3d Weds Susan Louise Brown
description: Susan Louise Brown, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Ernest M. Brown of Merion Station, Pa., was married yesterday to Samuel Davis 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Davis of Clarksville, Va. The ceremony was performed in the chapel of the Episcopal Academy in Merion Station by the Rev. James A. Trimble and the Rev. John E. Midwood.

title: Confessions of a Salmon Slicer
description: A surgeon I'm not. A psychiatrist I'm not. A movie star I'm not.

title: Article 2  No Title
BUSINESS SWINDLES BY MAFIA REPORTED
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 19Detectives in six Western states say they have uncovered a Mafiadirected, nationwide economic crime organization that they say has swindled businessmen out of millions of dollars and then moved in to take over and control some of the businesses that borrowed money from the group.

title: Recipes to Get the Holidays Off to an Appetizing Start
description: AWELLMADE appetizer is as irresistible as sin, yet marvelously lawful. And with the holidays on us, it's an excellent time to take this form of the law into one's own hands, to fend off the hordes of the hungry who arrive to extend their greetings, drop off a present, drink a cup of cheer or two and go on their way before the next wave arrives to admire the Christmas tree, show off their presents and leave an invitation to spend New Year's Eve at their place where more appetizers are in order.

title: ZAMBIANS SUSPEND TIES WITH MUZOREWA GROUP
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Dec. 19 (AP)Zambia announced today that it had suspended relations with the wing of Rhodesia's African National Council led by Bishop Abel Muzorewa.

title: Music: Skilled Canticum Novum
description: Saturday night's concert by the Canticum Novum Singers at Carnegie Recital Hall was so intelligently programmed and so well prepared that it managed to create greater expectations than it could fulfill. The 21member chorus, now in its fourth season, is a responsive ensemble skillfully led by Harold Rosenbaum. Its attacks and cutoffs, treacherously exposed by the hall's intimate acoustics, were accurate and unanimous.

title: The Challenges Ahead in Asia For Carter's Administration
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 19When Jimmy Carter assumes office next month, he will not be caught up in directing an American war in Asia.

title: Stage: Weaver as Multimedia Lincoln
description: SAUL LEVITT'S LINCOLN, which the Chelsea Theater Center opened last night at Theater Four as its second production of the season, is a halfhearted attempt at crossbreeding monodrama with multidrama. Apparently not relying on Lincoln and his words to carry the eveningand is there any more dramatic character in American history?Mr. Levitt, in collaboration with his director, Carl Weber, has surrounded Lincoln with projection and distraction.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHTS GAMES

title: Plains, Ga., Presents 2 Contrasting Faces Typical of the South
description: PLAINS, Ga., Dec. 19A young couple from Indianapolis spent a rather disappointing hour here last week, browsing through cluttered shops crammed with Jimmy Carter souvenirs and finally buying an overpriced pair of children's Tshirts emblazoned with a grinning caricature of the Presidentelect before hurrying back to their car to continue their vacation trip to Florida.

title: Swedish Six Tops Czechs Jets Bow to Russians
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 19 (AP)Sweden defeated Czechoslovakia, 21, in the Izvestia hockey tournament today on Lars Lundberg's goal with 1 minute 51 seconds remaining.

title: Ghosts
description: BOSTON, Dec. 19Four years ago this weekend there began the most destructive single episode of international violence in recent history: The Christmas bombing of North Vietnam.

title: G.E. to Build $200 Million Plant For Nuclear Power in Spain
description: The General Electric Company announced today that it had been chosen to build a $200 million nuclear energy steampower plant at Santander in northern Spain. The plant is to provide 970,000 kilowatts of electricity for the region.

title: Ford Flies to Colorado for Skiing After Wife Gets Michigan Degree
description: VAIL, Colo., Dec. 19President Ford flew to the Rocky Mountains today for a last Christmas vacation as President, pausing on the way while his wife, Betty, received an honorary Doctor of Laws degree from the University of Michigan.

title: Korea Pushes Investment in Stocks to Spur Economy
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 19Lee Jae Do is a 37yearold office worker. Kim Ki Sang is 41 and unemployed. But they have something in common: Both men own stock in Korean companies.

title: Gilmore Recuperating in a Cell
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 19 (UPI)Gary Gilmore, who tried to advance the date of his death by a suicide attempt by drug overdose, recuperated today in closely watched prison hospital cell. Mr. Gilmore, who is waiting to face execution by a firing squad 29 days from now, was returned to the prison from the University of Utah Medical Center where he was taken Thursday after swallowing a lethal dose of barbiturates. A prison spokesman said the 36yearold convict had settled back into a seduced cell in the prison infirmary and was eating.

title: Aspin Will Renew Fight for Curbs On Commercial Output of Plutonium
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (AP)Representative Les Aspin announced today that he would try again to block any commercial production of plutonium without the approval of Congress. The Wisconsin Democrat said that his bill would prohibit the commercial production of the fuel for nuclear power plants until Congress was convinced the safeguards against its being stolen and used to make bombs were adequate.

title: U.S. Project to Spur 15,000 New York Building Jobs
description: The Ford Administration yesterday announced a program under which housingrehabilitation jobs would be created in New York City for at least 15,000 unionized buildingtrades workers who would be paid 25 percent less than their contracts normally called for.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: AT BUFFALO

title: This Year, the LookAlike Look Is Chic
description: The ladies (always they are known as the ladies, even among themselves) are chic. Sometimes, they are beautiful. Usually, they are rich. Mostly, they know one another, and what is more important, you may know them, too. The ladies do not shop just anywhere, or buy just anything, although frequently they go to the same place and buy the same dress. This does not bother the ladies; it may even comfort them, even when they all show up at the same dinner party in the same dress.

title: Mammoth Truck Plant Slowly Comes to Life in Plains of Soviet Union
description: NABWREZHNYE CHELNY, U.S.S.R.The newest Soviet industrial giant, an immense truck plant armed with complex American and West European technology, is slowly coming to life on a vast, desolate plain beside the Kama River.

title: NEW YORK CITY PRESSING JERSEYSCOFFLAW CURB
description: New York City is determined to win the war against motorists from New Jersey who owe more than $35 million in city parking tickets.

title: CowboysRams Scoring
City of OldWorld Elegance Carries the Basque Banner
description: SAN SEBASTIAN, SpainAt the soccer match with Bilbao, a San Sebastin player suddenly unfolded the ikurruniathe outlawed red, white and green Basque flagand the stands erupted in jubilation.

title: The Labor Scene
description: Two years ago they weren't even talking to each other, but last week Robert S. Strauss, the Democratic national chairman, came to a Maryland meeting of top union votemobilizers to laud Alexander E. Barkan and the A.F.L.C.I.O. political action machine he heads.

title: British Football
description: SCOTTISH LEAGUE Association CupFirst Round

title: School Results
description: BASKETBALL

title: Letters
description: TO THE LIVING SECTION:

title: Supplementary OverCounter Listings
description: The following is a supplementary weekly, list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: Work Safety Agency, Under Fire, Has Little Impact but Big Potential
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19Committees of Congress criticize it. The Council of Economic Advisers questions it. The General Accounting Office faults it. Businessmen fight it. Labor leaders dispute it.

title: N.C.A.A. Places Kentucky On Probation for 2 Years
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 19 (AP)The National Collegiate Athletic Association placed the University of Kentucky on a twoyear probation today, citing numerous violations in the conduct of its football and basketball programs. The announcement of the action from the N.C.A.A, headquarters here said the sanctions had been tempered by the Southeastern Conference school's cooperation in the investigation.

title: Miss Heyns Wed on Coast
description: Barbara Lee Heyns, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Ernest Heyns of Palm Springs, Calif., was married yesterday to Jeffrey Alan Weintraub, son of Prot and Mrs. Sidney Weintraub of Austin, Tex.

title: Continental Army Marches Again as Reenactment Ends
description: TRENTON, Dec. 19The Continental Army marched again this weekend, and several thousand spectators lined Route 206 from Princeton to Trenton to view the final leg of the reenactment of Gen. George Washington's historic retreat through the state.

title: Cabaret: Vita Sings of Love
description: Michael Vita, who has been singing this weekend at Barbarann, 349 West 46th Street, has a performing manner that seems more related to the musical theater than to a nightclub. He is, in fact, doubling into the club from Chicago, although, as he ruefully admits, he only says two words in the musical.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, DECEMBER 20, 1976

title: ... Andrus to Interior
description: Presidentelect Carter has made a relatively noncontroversial move in choosing Gov. Cecil D. Andrus of Idaho as Secretary of Interior. Now serving as chairman of the National Governor's Conference and endorsed for the secretaryship by his fellow Western governors, Mr. Andrus has from the outset been the leading candidate for the post.

title: Church in Brooklyn Rededicates Its 22 Bells
description: More than 1,000 people packed Our Lady of Good Counsel Roman Catholic Church at 915 Putnam Avenue in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn yesterday afternoon to hear Bishop Francis J. Mugavero rededicate the church's 22 bells. The first concert in which all the bells were played since the end of World War II also marked the ceremony.

title: Ballet: Beauty By Helpmann
description: WASHINGTON AMERICAN BALLET THEATER, in the midst of a completely soldout month's season at the Kennedy Center, is featuring, in addition to Mikhail Baryshnikov's new version of The Nutcracker, to have its premiere tomorrow, a slightly revised version of its production at The Sleeping Beauty. This production, staged by Mary Skeaping and based on the 1946 presentation by Britain's Royal Ballet, was first seen at the Metropolitan Opera House this past summer. The entire production is now described as being supervised by Sir Robert Helpmann. Sir Robert, by the way, played both Carabosse and Prince Florimund, a notable double, in the original British production.

title: Nets Lose 7th in Row At Coliseum
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Dec. 19Connecting on only onethird of their fieldgoal attempts in the second half, the New York Nets suffered an almost complete offensive collapse and bowed to the Boston Celtics tonight, 9487, at Nassau Coliseum before a crowd of 7,380.

title: Living Abroad: London
description: HAS BRITAIN Become Europe's Bargain Basement? asks a British magazine. A Glasgow professor of English writes to The Times bitterly complaining about all those foreigners who are systematically pillaging, what remains of the nation's art and furniture collections. A saleswoman on Oxford Street says that some of the foreign customers actually troop through stores with pocket calculators, taking the price in sterling, then converting it to their own currency to see if it's worth it. Cheeky, she says. Bloody cheeky.

title: Meadowlands Drivers
Shanker Says New Teacher Contract Will Cut Cost To Board of Education by $23 Million in First Year
description: The new teachers' contract will cut firstyear costs to the New York City Board of Education from an originally negotiated $43 million to $20 million, Albert Shanker, president of the United Federation of Teachers, said yesterday.

title: JAMES LIPSIG, EXECUTIVE WITH GARMENT UNION, 66
description: James Lipsig, assistant executive secretary of the International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union for 30 years and former secretary of the Socialist Party in New York State, died Saturday of cancer at Mt. Sinai Hospital. He was 66 years old and lived at 320 Central Park West

title: Steelers Trounce Colts, 4014, in Playoff; Rams Hold Off Cowboys for 1412 Victory
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 19  The Pittsburgh Steelers, who helped clear Memorial Stadium early, routed the Baltimore Colts, 4014, today in an American Football Conference playoff game that almost ended in tragedy.

title: Recipes to Get the Holidays Off to an Appetizing Start
description: 1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.

title: Dr. Lynn Whisnant Wed To Dr. Morton F. Riser
description: Dr. Lynn Whisnant, a lecturer in the Yale School of Medicine's department of psychiatry, was married yesterday to Dr. Morton F. Reiser, professor and chairman of the department. The Rev. John Vannorsdall performed the nondenominational ceremony in the Branford Chapel on the Yale campus.

title: Cynthia S. Corl Is Married to George B. Whitaker Jr.
description: The marriage of Cynthia Stephanie Corl, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William T. Corl of New Canaan, Conn., to George Barker Whitaker Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Whitaker of Tucson, Ariz., took place yesterday in New Canaan. The Rev. Alfred H. Whisler, assisted by the Rev. Dudley J. Stroup, performed the ceremony in St. Mark's Episcopal Church.

title: Deaths
description: AWNLouise. On Dec. 19, 1976, beloved wife of John, dear mother of John, Jr., Christopher and Linda Funeral Wednesday, 9:15 A.M. from the McLaughlin & Sons Colonial Home, Third Ave. at 97th St., Brooklyn. Mass of the Resurrection 10 A.M. Our Lady of Lebanon Church.

title: Wine Talk
description: SOMETIME AFTER the first of the year, the Italian Trade Commissioner here plans to announce an Italian wine list contest. The idea, obviously is to smoke out the best restaurant wine lists, vis  vis the wirres of Italy, of course.

title: Meadowlands
Advertising
description: Ted Bates & Company, the country's sixth largest advertising agency, has quietly established a new autonomous subsidiary called Custom Marketing that is designed to give national advertisers more punch on the local level through advertising and promotion.

title: Plumb, Giant Assistant, Is Discharged by McVay
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 19Ted Plumb, a Giant assistant coach, will not be rehired by John McVay. Plumb, who helped coach the offensive backfield and the receivers for three years, has been told by McVay he did not fit into plans for next year.

title: Gap Unbridged By Rhodesians
description: PARIS, Dec. 19A modest success Was the way Ivor Richard, the Briton who is chairman of the Geneva conference on Rhodesia, characterized the two months of meetings, which he adjourned Tuesday, hoping for a resumption Jan. 17. That is one way of looking at it, and perhaps the only way for the man whose task it is to keep the four black delegations and the Government of Prime Minister Ian D. Smith talking about a transition to majority rule from control by representatives of the 270,000 whites over the 6.5 million Rhodesians, most of them disenfranchised.

title: Christmas: A Good Time To Try a Medieval Wassail
description: SWINGING or otherwise, a wassail of spiced hot ale has been a part of the English Christmas since medieval times. The name itself is derived from the AngloSaxon was hal, meaning be hale. Not originally a serving bowl, the wassail was a large drinking cup passed around to the assembled guests.

title: Gifts to Buy When You Buy Something Else
description: There's a simple way to knock off two friends this Christmas. Not literally, of course. Since they're on your gift list, it's presumed you're fond of them.

title: South Looking to Carter Appointments To a Crucial Federal Court of Appeals
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 19The United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit, the Federal judicial body that broke the back of official segregation in the Deep South before growing less assertive on civil rights issues, is approaching a critical point.

title: Work Safety Inspector Can Enter Plants but Usually Isn't Welcome
description: ST. LOUISWith his black bag of equipment at his side, Robert T. Dwyer resembled a doctor making a house call as he made his way from the parking lot to the front door of Argo Products, a metal fabricating company.

title: American Servicemen and Turks Share Tense, Uncertain Relations
description: ADANA, Turkey, Dec. 19Two American servicemen stationed at the Incirlik air base near here were arrested recently for possession of hashish. The Turkish commander of the vast installation ordered them turned over to civilian authorities for presecution. American officials objected strenuously, and the case remains unresolved.

title: SteelersColts Scoring
Landmark Hotel in the Capital to Be Replaced
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19One of the grandest of Washington's grand old hotels, the Sheraton Park, will be torn down and a new and larger convention hotel will be built nearby, the owners have announced.

title: ADRAIN R. FISHER, 81; COMPANY EXECUTIVE
description: Adrain R. Fisher, former chairman, chief executive officer and president of the JohnsManville Corporation, died Saturday at the Morton F. Plant Hospital in Clearwater, Fla. He was 81 years old and lived at 100 Sarasota Road, Belleair, Fla.

title: REGENTS PLAN CODE FOR PROFESSIONALS
description: ALBANY, Dec. 19The New York Board of Regents is planning the state's first uniform code of conduct to apply to members of virtually all professions, from accountants and architects to physicians and speech pathologists, but not including lawyers.

title: Private Lives
description: LETS SAY that Eric is a friend of the novelist Reynolds Price. For Christmas 1976, Reynolds Price has given his friends a handsomely printed, privately published little book called The Good News According to Mark. It is a new translation by Mr. Price, from the ancient Greek manuscripts, of The Gospel According to Mark. It could not have come to Eric's house at a better time.

title: Child's World
description: THIS CHRISTMAS morning there will be lots pets showing up near the fir tree; a great many of them will have to be housebroken and more than a few will be housewreckers. Almost invariably the animals will be faits accompli, presented children who will have had little say in the choice.

title: U.S. Orders Most Extensive Tests On Workers Exposed to Pesticide
description: HOUSTON, Dec, 19Workers exposed to a nerveattacking pesticide produced at a chemical plant near here will undergo the most extensive physical examinations ever arranged by the National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health.

title: RELIGIOUS PARTY BLOC IN ISRAEL'S CABINET IS DISMISSED BY RABIN
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 19Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin ousted the National Religious Party from his shaky coalition Government today and thereby gave up his tenuous majority control of Parliament.

title: Not Bargaining Issues
description: The decision of the Police Department to drop criminal charges against four officers arrested during a riotous demonstration of offduty policemen outside Madison Square Garden last October represents an ignominious retreat from discipline that could pose a longterm threat to the peace and security of this city.

title: Young Stresses Independence, As Delegate to United Nations
description: Representative Andrew Young says that he does not plan to read speeches prepared for him by the State Department in his post as United States delegate to the United Nations.

title: Article 3  No Title
Slight Drop in Reading Level Found in New York Schools
description: Reading performances by pupils in New York City's public schools declined slightly last year during the first year of massive spending cuts throughout the school system.

title: MRS. LYTLE HULL HAILED AT RHINEBECK SERVICES
description: RHINEBECK, N.Y., Dec. 19More than 250 people attended a memorial service here today for Mrs. Lytle Hull, the philanthropist and social leader who died on Dec. 11.

title: New Corporate Bonds
description: (for week ended Dec. 17, 1976)

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: BROOKLYN CRIME UNIT GETS NEW U.S. HEAD
description: Thomas P. Puccio will be sworn in today as head of the Organized Crime Strike Force in Brooklyn, one of the largest Federal anticrime units in the country.

title: Commodities
description: Just two years ago, consumers were confronted by the specter of global shortages of basic foodstuffs and industrial raw materials. Many commodity traders at the time expected Government regulation of their industry because of the shortages.

title: Strong Subject, Weak Drama
description: THE SUBJECT of The Loneliest Runner, a 90minute drama on NBC tonight at 9, is bedwetting, a subject that automatically seems to prompt joking and derision. When Tom Snyder, host of NBC's Tomorrow show, found out about the project, he made a crack on the air about the network's programming department being obviously desperate for new ideas. But Mr. Snyder was given some information about the subject and he now concedes that he was too flippant about a matter of serious concern to many people.

title: MEMORIAL CONTRIBUTIONS
description: are gratefully acknowledged by the New York Heart Association (A?? of America Heart Association) HEART FUND MEMORIALS 2 East 64th Street Dept. 1M New York, N.Y. 10021 Tel. 8388800

title: Antarctic Mysteries
description: Nearly 20 years ago, the orbiting of Sputnik I began the space age. Since then, men have visited the moon and returned safely; the dark side of the moon eternally turned away from Earth has been fully photographed; manmade instruments report regularly from their stations on the surface of Mars; similar reports have come from instruments landed on Venus; and scientists now have excellent pictures of Mercury and Jupiter taken from cameras flown to the neighborhoods of those planets.

title: Wine Cellar on Corsica Bombed
description: BASTIA, Corsica, Dec. 19 (AP)Seven masked Corsican nationalists dynamited a French wine cellar today, causing an estimated $400.000 in damage, the police said. The attack was believed to be part of a growing campaign by Corsican nationalists to gain a greater degree of autonomy from the French.

title: Cathleen Dale Medwick Wed to Jeffrey P. Silberman
description: Cathleen Dale Medwick and Jeffrey P. Silberman were married yesterday afternoon in the Larchmont (N.Y.) Temple by the bridegroom's cousin, Rabbi Barry Hewitt Greene, and Rabbi Leonard Poller.

title: Personal Health
description: THE Union Army Camp, several miles from Appomattox Court House, April 8, 1865: I was suffering very severely with a sick headache, Ulysses S. Grant wrote in his memoirs. I spent the night in bathing my feet in hot water and mustard and putting mustard plasters on my wrists and the back part of my neck, hoping to be cured by morning.

title: Neediest Cases to Benefit From a Birthday Party
description: A family gathering to honor the 62d birthday of James R. Clarke was held recently and instead of giving gifts those attending chipped in a total of $20 that was sent to the 65th annual appeal of The New York.Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: A First for the Rhodes Scholars: 13 Women Are Among the Winners
description: The names of 32 American winners of Rhodes Scholarships, including 13 women, who were eligible to participate in the competition for the first time since it was established in 1902, were announced yesterday.

title: WellDone Cookbooks For Young
description: Perhaps the most encouraging culinary sign this year is the apparent change in the approach to writing cookbooks for young people.

title: World News Briefs
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 19 (AP)Syrian troops tightened their hold on Lebanon's press today, closing down the offices and seizing the printing presses of three more newspapers.

title: Some Red Tape Is Cut for Doctors In Countries of Common Market
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 19 (AP)Beginning tomorrow a physician in any of the nine European Common Market countries can set up practice in any of the other eight without years of red tape that differing regulations once produced.

title: All About: The Heat Of the Matter
description: THERE are few things more romantic or reassuring than a fire crackling on a hearth. As the flames devour a stack of hardwood logs, there is an atavistic tug that transcends the novelty of being able to watch what is warming you.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: EXU.S. APPEALS JUDGE IS REPORTED CHOSEN AS ATTORNEY GENERAL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19Presidentelect Carter has decided to nominate a fellow Georgian, Griffin B. Bell, a former Federal appellate judge, to be Attorney General, sources close to Mr. Carter said today.

title: Readers' Comments on an Article on the Virgin Mary
description: To the Editor:

title: Victorian Mansion Offers Choice: Viewing Art or Buying Insurance
description: YORK, Pa.Visitors to the Victorian mansion in downtown York opposite City Hall have a choice  to conduct business with the Kling brothers who operate an insurance agency, or to view what is described as the largest private Collection of Currier & Ives prints in the country.

title: JET LOST, FLIERS SAFE, IN ACCIDENT IN PACIFIC
description: MANILA, Dec. 19 (AP)An F14 Tomcatthe most advanced type of American fighter planeplunged into the South China Sea today after missing a landing aboard the carrier Enterprise, a Navy spokesman here reported.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Governor Byrne said the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey should consider the feasibility of constructing another Hudson River bridge or tunnel. Speaking in a radio interview, Mr. Byrne said that, while mass transit had been encouraged as an alternative to the automobile, now the buses are backed up.

title: U.S., After Beating Mexico, Seeks Connors and Solomon
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Dec. 19Tony Trabert, captain of the United States team, has official Davis Cup uniforms for Jimmy Connors and Harold Solomon, complete with blazers and warmup suits that have their names on the back.

title: The Honeymooners
description: WASHINGTON  Kingdoms have their honeymoon, wrote Thomas Fuller in 1655, when new Princes are married unto them. The English divine and historian was using the word honeymoon in the knowledge of its ironic, now archaic, meaning: that a honey, or full, moon, begins to wane the moment it is full.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE DECORATIVE ARTS specialties that publishers have added to their lists this year are, perhaps, a shade less esoteric than in years past. There continue to be, however, far too many cataloguetype books on such collectibles as Amish quilts, hooked rugs, wicker furniture, Royal Crown Derby china and madeinoccupied Japan gewgaws. The following are some of the most unusual studies that may, or may not, prove of interest to decoraative arts and antiques collectors. In most cases the information and coverage go beyond the conventional picturebook volumes in which listings of the contents sometimes form the entire text.

title: The Story of a Dish or why the pear tree's branches are bare
description: Why are the pear tree's branches bare? Good grief, alas, alack!

title: 19 U.S. Judges Study Economics To Help Them in Work on Bench
description: KEY LARGO, Fla., Dec. 18For three weeks, 19 Federal judges from around the country took a grueling, sixdayaweek course in economics that ended here yesterday.

title: Miss Washam, Rodriguez Win In Mixed Golf
description: MIAMI, Dec. 19Chi Chi Rodriquez and Joann Washam carded three birdies down the stretch today and captured the $200,000 PepsiCola mixed team golf tournament by four shots. The late birdie binge by the victors gave them a finalround 71 and a 13underpar total of 275 at the Doral Country Club.

title: U.S. Project to Spur 15,000 New York Building Jobs
description: The Ford Administration yesterday announced a program under which housingrehabilitation jobs would be created in New York City for at least 15,000 unionized buildingtrades workers who would be paid 25 percent less than their contracts normally called for.

title: Notes on People
description: AT ITS Bicentennial Awards Dinner tomorrow, the National Arts Club will present Alistair Cooke with its medal of honor. Mr. Cooke, the writer and television personality, will be honored for his matchless interpretation of the American scene. The Britishborn Mr. Cooke, who became an American citizen in 1941 is the last of four persons to receive the Arts Club's medal of honor this year.

title: RhodesiaBotswana Clash Reported
description: JOHANNESBURG, Dec. 19 (Reuters)Botswana policemen yesterday fought a gun battle with Rhodesian security forces who opened fire on a police barracks just across the border, the South African Press Association reported here today.

title: Saturday's Late College Basketball and Hockey Results
description: BASKETBALL

title: RADIO
description: Music

title: Is She the Only Wife of Serge Prokofiev?
description: Lina Prokofiev sat in front of the picture window overlooking Chicago's wintry lakefront and fingered through more than half a century of memories, selecting one now and then to share with her visitor. Now 79 years old, she spoke about the first time she, a young Spanish singer living in New York, saw Serge Prokofiev, a virtually unknown young composer from the Ukraine. It was at Carnegie Hall in December 1919. I heard him play his First Piano Concerto. Altschuler was the conductor, I think. Four years later they were married.

title: Gingerbread, Candle Wax, a Yorkville Christmas
description: Sing a song of Christmas, or trim a tree much of what we do to prepare for the American holiday season is drawn from the traditions of Central Europe, traditions that are still alive in Manhattan's Yorkville, right down to the last nutcracker and Pfeffernss.

title: Mother Held in Slaying
description: A Long Branch woman, charged with the stabbing murder of her sixweekold son, was held in $25,000 bail at the Monmouth County Jail, the police said. The woman, Elizabeth Bertram, 24. was arrested Saturday and charged with the killing.

title: Alice Edmunds, Writer, Is Bride of Henry R. Kaufman
description: Alice Chase Edmunds, a freelance writer, was married yesterday at her home in Greenwich Village to Henry Richard Kaufman, legal counsel to the Association of American Publishers. Rabbi Dennis Math performed the ceremony.

title: East German Olympic System a Success
description: EAST BERLINEast Germany, a Communist country of 17 million people, has perfected an allencompassing system for turning out Olympic champions in every discipline of sport. This year, for the first time, some of its secrets have been revealed to the Western public.

title: New Swedish Government Is Beset By Conflict on Atom Energy Policy
description: STOCKHOLM. Dec. 16Nearly three months after being swept into power by Swedish voters, the nation's first nonSocialist Government in more than four decades is beset by uncertainty and by open conflict over nuclear energy policy.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Governor Byrne assured New Jersey motorists that they have a right to continued insurance coverage.

title: Glittering Burst of Adulation Marks Brezhnev's Birthday
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 19Leonid I. Brezhnev turned 70 years old today and basked in the most glittering display of adulation and birthday honors extended any Soviet leader since Stalin.

title: Train Strikes Stalled Car
description: GLENDALE, Calif., Dec. 20 (UPI)An Amtrak train traveling at least 50 miles an hour struck a stalled car and dragged the vehicle 500 feet down the Southern Pacific tracks in this Los Angeles suburb last night. A passenger in the car suffered a broken arm and cuts and bruises.

title: BLACK CAUCUS UNEASY OVER CARTER CABINET
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20The Congressional Black Caucus warned Presidentelect Jimmy Carter today of growing uneasiness and frustrations among blacks with some of Mr. Carter's preinauguration moves and asked for some serious manifestations of his commitment to blacks.

title: Montreal May Be Told to Assume $214 Million Debt for the Olympics
description: MONTREAL. Dec. 20A $214 million debt for the Olympic Games that Mayor Jean Drapeau of Montreal had insisted his city would never pay may be imposed upon it by legislation just introduced in the Quebec Assembly.

title: BALANCES PROBLEM IN POUND STUDIED BY EXPERT PANEL
description: PARIS, Dec. 20 (Reuters)International experts today tackled a potentially dangerous economic problem for Britainthe sterling balances held by foreigners and the threat they pose for the currency's stability.

title: Books of The Times
description: When we left off yesterday, Christopher LehmannHaupt had just given his selection of the children's picture books most likely to succeed. Here, now, are 10 books worth the attention or teenagers, or slightly younger children. These 10 titles have not been easy to find. Too many books for this age group are merely consumables, bread and potatoes to be taken in without much thought. Acceptable but not memorable. Where a feast fit for a prince or princess is needed, there is instead advice on acne, how to handle grief should ma, pa or the pet pup depart this life, ephemeral sports biographies, let's visit a divorce court or trips beyond the wall, over the hedge, through the door where there's another world that still smacks suspiciously of grandmother's.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Guerrillas Accuse Rhodesians
description: MAPUTU, Mozambique, Dec. 20 (Reuters)The Zimbabwe People's Army, a Mozambique  based force of Rhodesian guerrillas, said tonight that Rhodesian forces were to blame for the killings of the tea workers.

title: W.H.A. Teams Dominate Series With Czechoslovaks
description: The touring Czechoslovak national hockey team played the fifth game of its sixgame series against World Hockey Association clubs last night in Hartford's Civic Arena. Sunday in Moscow, the Winnipeg Jets of the W.H.A. skaters in the Izvestia tournament. Next Monday the Soviet national team will begin its tour of eight W.H.A. cities. If this overlapping international play is befudling, here's a rundown of what has happened and has yet to happen:

title: Compton Sets Up A Retailing Group
description: Compton Advertising, the country's 25th largest agency, is joining some of the bigger shops that have already set up retail advertising.

title: 4 Top Spots In Skiing Go To Austrians
description: ZELL AM SEE, Austria, Dec. 20 (AP) Brigitte Totschnig Haberstatter beat her Austrian compatriot, Annemarie Proell Moser, for the first time today when she won the first of two World Cup downhill races scheduled here. Mrs. Moser finished second as Austrians took the top four places. She moved into the overall lead in the cup standing.

title: 51 Make Their Debuts At International Ball
description: Fiftyone young women representing 15 countries and 13 states made their formal bows at the 22d annual International Debutante Ball in the Grand Ballroom at the WaldorfAstoria last night.

title: Flood Hits New Zealand City
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand, Dec. 20 (UPI)Flood waters caused by torrential rains rampaged through large areas of suburban Wellington today, flooding homes and factories and stranding 35,000 commuters in the city. At least two persons were known to be dead as authorities declared a state of emergency.

title: Bank Unearths Works of Byron And of Shelley
description: LONDON, Dec. 20A treasure chest of 19thcentury literary papers, including manuscripts, letters and poems by Byron and Shelley, has been discovered in a bank vault in the center of London.

title: South Africa Frees 13 Detainees, First of 81 Held in Black Uprisings
