description: David Kass, an official of the Western Electric Company, died Sunday at Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center. He was 57 years old and lived at 155 West 68th Street.

title: CARTER NOW TERMS ECONOMY IMPROVED; LEAVES PLAN IN DOUBT
description: ST. SIMONS ISLAND, Ga., Dec. 27Presidentelect Carter said today that the national economy seemed to be improving, and he cast renewed doubt on what form his plans for economic stimulation might take.

title: Irish Take Gator Bowl, Beating Penn State, 209
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 27Notre Dame's football team of the future proved to be better than Penn State's team of the future tonight as the Irish scored all their points in the first half and whipped the Nittany Lions, 209, in the 32d annual Gator Bowl game.

title: Jersey Said to Be Losing Ground Despite Some Economic Recovery
description: TRENTON, Dec. 17Although there are some signs of recovery from the economic recession that reached its low in March 1975, New Jersey's economy has been found to have stubborn unemployment problems and to be falling farther behind the national economy's recovery.

title: J. V. Cunningham To Receive Award Of Poets Academy
description: The 1976 Fellowship of the Academy of American Poets, carrying with it a stipend of $10,000, has been awarded to J. V. Cunningham, it has been announced by Mrs. Hugh Bullock, president of the organization. Robert Fitzgerald, a chancellor of the academy, said, His excellence has not been recognized enough. The poet, Richard Wilbur, another chancellor, called him our best epigrammatic poet.

title: Georgetown and Manhattan Capture Openers in Festival
description: The Eastern College Athletic Conference's 25th Holiday Festival at Madison Square Garden did not prove much of a lure for fans last night as an announced crowd of only 5,112 turned out to see Georgetown and Manhattan score openinground victories.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Notes on People
description: In the privacy of her Fourrroom apilil ment on Avenue Montaigne in Paris, Marlene Dietrich yesterday observed what she sad was her 72d birthday, but authorities in Germany. the country of her birth, say was her 75th. Now a semirecluse and in poor health because of hip injuries suffered in a fall from a stage in 1974, Miss Dietrich was Garbolike in dealing with newsmen. To callers she said only. If you want to ask me any questions, you should write me a letter and I may answer.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Goose Down Industry Is Flying High on Demand for Natural Products
description: A great resurgence in demand for natural products that will maintain body head has lifted the down industry to a new high level. Demand for downfilled comforters, pillows, sleeping bags, jackets, vests and other items is placing a strain on stocks of down both here and abroad and is also forcing up the price.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: THE WHOLE TOOTH Yes, Virginia, there was a Dracula, long before Hollywood's Bela Lugosi flapped around in a Transylvanian cape with bared fangs. Most scholars agree that the factual source of the chilling but magnetic legend of Dracula can be historically pinpointed to an awesome, depraved 15thcentury prince, a Rumanian tyrant known as Vlad the Impaler also called Dracula.

title: FYODOR A. SURGANOV
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 27 (AP)Fyodor A. Surganov, president of Byelorussia, died yesterday in an automobile accident. Mr. Surganov, who was 65, was the second party secretary of Byelorussia from 1959 to 1971 before becoming president of the republic.

title: Dollar Advances Against the Lira; Gold Is Steady
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 27 (UPI)The dollat rose sharply against the Italian lira today) in spite of substantial central bank inter: yention to offset the effect of lowered taxes on foreign currency purchases, but it fell slightly on other markets.

title: About Newyork; A Christmas Sermon: Brooklyn Redistricting
description: Facing his black congregation, the Rev. Herbert Daughtry cited the Christmas Gospel of Luke as a timeless message of how the powerless were finally favored in a place called Bethlehem. Then he went directly to a more immediate message about power the bitter dispute in central Brooklyn between blacks and Jewsand told of the timely lesson delivered to blacks last week by the Hasidim.

title: DR. SAMSON WEINGEIST, 66, DIES AFTER FALL IN IOWA
description: Dr. Samson Weingeist, associate professor of ophthalmology at Albert Einstein College of Medicine, died Sunday in Iowa City, Iowa, after an accidental fall while visiting his son. He was 66 years old and lived at 18033 80th Drive, Jamaica Queens_

title: Monkeys and the Superpsyche Bowl
description: It should be known as the Superpsyche Bowl this time. With the Minnesota Vikings and the Oakland Raiders in it, one team finally will win the big one and the other team will lose the big one again. As the monkey leaves one team's back, it will jump and double the future burden on the other team's back.

title: New Year Calendars Tell You Much More Than Just the Date
description: When you begin scribbling lunch appointments in the margins of your old engagement book and look vainly on the wall for what day of the week Jan. 6 is, it's time to get your 1977 calendar.

title: Television
Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Nat'l Hockey League
Ford to Reconsider Amnesty
description: VAIL, Colo., Dec. 27President Ford agreed today to look into the possibility of granting a general amnesty to the Vietnam warera draft resisters and deserters.

title: Deputy Chancellor Says Goldin Tally Undercounts Cuts in School Personnel
description: The deputy chancellor of New York City's schools charged yesterday that figures on dismissals of school personnel assembled by City Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin were seriously under the actual number of people laid off by the Board of Education.

title: Chain Store Sales Show 12% Rise
description: The naticn's chain stores, benefiting from early Christmas shopping and cool, seasonable weather, showed a 12 percent increase in sales in November, one of the better gains for the year. For the first 11 months of 1976, the chains went ahead of the level of the corresponding period of 1975 by 11.9 percent.

title: Radio
description: 69 AM, WNCNFM. Die Zwillingsbruder Overture, Schubert; Flute Fantasia No. 11; Telemann; Deus Tuorum Militum, Tall* Caprice No. 24, Paganini; A Night in Venice OvertUre, Strauss; Harpsichord Sonatas, Scarlatti; A Song Before Sunrise, Delius.

title: Springfield Changes Pilots
description: WEST SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Dec. 27 (AP)The Springfield Indians, have discharged John Hanna as coach and named Gary Dineen to pilot the American Hockey League club for the rest of the season.

title: SimilarType Sealant Available in Stores
description: A reporter visited a suburban naraware store last week and asked for a sealant suitable for mending aquariums.

title: Wheat Prices Advance About 6 Cents a Bushel; Corn Also Shows Gain
description: Weather dominated the thinking of wheat traders yesterday, and as a result they bought. Prices moved up about 6 cents a bushel on the Chicago Board of Trade, where the March delivery closed at $2.781/4, up from $2.721/4 a bushel.

title: SAMUEL Z. WORMSER
description: Samuel Z. Wormser, a partner in the New York Stock Exchange firm of Neuberger & Berman, died Sunday of a heart attack while skiing in. Dorset, Vt. He was 70 years old and lived lin Rye, N.Y.

title: Existence of Bribe Scandal in U.S. Acknowledged Publicly in Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Tuesday, Dec. 28 The South Korean Government for the first time today commented domestically on the scandal in which Korean agents are reported to have attempted to bribe United States Congressmen to favor Korean interests. A formal Government report on the case was submitted to the National Assetribly this morning.

title: Cowens Gets Racing Job; To Rejoin Celtics in 77'78
description: Any hope that Dave Cowens would return to the Boston Celtics this season seemed to have ended yesterday with the announcement that the once overpowering Boston Celtics center had taken a job as assistant general manager at the New England Raceway in Foxboro, Mass. Cowens is scheduled to begin work on Jan. 11.

title: Book Calling French Society Sick Provokes National SelfAnalysis
description: PARIS, Dec. 27French society is sick, asserts a former Gaullist minister in a new, fastselling book, and his diagnosis is provoking a wave of national selfanalysis.

title: Saban New Head Coach For the University of Miami
description: MIAMI, Dec. 27 (AP)Louis Saban, a former coach of the Buffalo Bills of the National Football League, was named today as head football coach of the University of Miami. He replaces Carl Selmer, who was dismissed early this month.

title: Colorado Loses a Back, Ohio State to Start Pacenta
description: MIAMI, Dec. 27 (AP)Colorado apparently has lost its No. 2 tailback for the Orange Bowl Saturday night against Ohio which has weathered injury problems of its own.

title: ANNETTE CHASE ALEXANDER
description: Annette Chase Alexander of Hannacroix, N.Y., who retired in 1972 as director of psychiatric social work for the New York State Department of Mental Hygiene, died Friday in Albany Medical Center after a lingering illness. Her age was 69.

title: Judge Bars Bridge Blockade
description: MEDIA, Pa., Dec. 27 (UPI)Judge . Louis Bloom of Delaware County issued an injunction today preventing truckers., from blocking the Commodore Barry Bridge across the Delaware River and , access ramps to it. He handed down the order four days after truckers blocked Interstate 95 and highway ramps to the bridge for five hours in protest of the closing of one access ramp by the state Department of Transportation.

title: Tito to Visit Libya and Egypt
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia. Dec, 27 (UP1) President Tito will visit Libya and Egypt next month, going to Libya on Jan. 13 and five days later traveling to Egypt for an eightday visit, diplomatic sources said today.

title: Hungary Urges Easing of Tariffs In Move to Widen Exports to U.S.
description: BUDAPESTNo member of the Soviet bloc is as dependent on foreign trade as Hungary, and few countries elsewhere are. This creates special problems for this landlocked nation of 10 million population and causes great sensitivity to international recession and other world economic trends.

title: Travel in Soviet Bloc Is a Journey To Linked but Disparate Worlds
description: EAST BERLINThe greencapped East German guard held the open passport up to the traveler's face, his eyes darting quickly from one to the other. Satisfied, he shoved the passport methodically into an adjacent booth where another border guard scrutinized it before stamping it and handing it back.

title: Beal Succeeds Deutch as President. Of The New York Times Music Corp.
description: The New York Times Company announced yesterday that Ira F. Beal has been named president and chief operating officer of The New York Times Music Corporation, an affiliate. He succeeds, Murray Deutch, who resigned as president to form his own music concern.

title: The New York Times COLD, BUT FUN: Not daunted by an arm in a sling, a youngster yesterday swung out over a creek near Oceanport as his companion prepared to join him. The ropes were suspended from a branch of a tree.
World News Briefs
description: HONG KONG, Tuesday, Dec. 28 (UPI) The purge of the gang of four, led by Chiang Ching, averted a major civil war in China in which the Soviet Union would have been involved, according to a new and more detailed version of a speech by Chairman Hua Kuofeng transmitted by the press agency Hsinhua today.

title: Ballet: Suburbia
description: Despite the sad cancellation of the New York City Ballet's performances of The Nutcracker because of the musicians strike, the ballet is still being given across the country this Christmas season. Probably the nearest production to the city is that being given at the Nassau Coliseum in Uniondale, L.I., by the Eglevsky Ballet Company.

title: Broths
description: ABELSONJoseph Jacob. On December 25, 1976. Or 320 South Harrison Street, East Orange, N.J., Apartment 6H. Beloved husband of Lillian 0. Devoted father of June A. Herman, Florence A. Goltarb and Elaine A. Stalford. Dear brother of Fannie Rabinowitz, Anne Schiffman, Dora Levine, Evelyn Abelson and Frieda Green. Also survived by seven grandchildren and three greatgrandchildren. Funeral services will be held from Temple Israel, 432 Scotland Road, South Orange, on Tuesday, December 28, 1976 at 2:00 P.M. Interment Oheb Sholom Cemetery, Hillside, N.J. The family will receive friends at the family residence. The family would appreciate the, omission of flowers. AGATONEWilllam Charles. Of Yonkers, N.Y. On December 27, 1976. Beloved husband of Kathleen Boyce. Devoted father of Ellen, Dawn Marie and William Charles, Jr. Dear son of William and the late Barbara Schadt Agatone. Loving brother of Susan Strahl. The family will be present at the Fred H. McGrath and Son Funeral Home, Bronxville, from 7 P.M. until 9 P.M. Tuesday and 2 P.M. until P.M. and 7 P.M. until 9 P.M. Wednesday. Mass of Christian Burial at St. Eugene's Church on Thursday, December 30, 10 A.M. Please omit flowers. Those who wish may make contributions to American Cancer Society, 107 Lake Avenue, Tuckahoe,

title: but in Pakistan, Costly. Effort Has Brought Little Progress
description: KARACHI, PakistanAfter an intensive program of education, at a cost of more than $50 million, Pakistan is scarcely any closer to solving its population problem than it was 10 years ago, according to an official survey.

title: Black Committee Urges Boycott Of Ipi Tombi,
description: An ad hoc black group called for a boycott of the allblack South African musical, Ipi Tombi, that starts previews tonight at the Harkness Theater, Broadway and 63rd Street, after critical acclaim and financially successful appearances in Europe, Canada, Australia, Africa and Israel.

title: Company Reports
Savard, Lafleur Goals Pace Canadien Victory
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 27 (AP)Serge Savard and Guy Lafleur scored goals in a 68second span of the third period tonight, sparking the Montreal Canadiens to a 42 National Hockey League victory over the Cleveland Barons.

title: DEATHS CAUSED BY FIRE UP 200 IN YEAR IN U.S.
description: BOSTON, Dec. 27 (AP)The number of firecaused deaths increased by 200 in the United States last year to 11,800, according to the National Fire Protection Association.

title: Greyhound Bus Plunges 70 Feet
description: UPPER MARLBORO, Md., Dec. 27 (AP)A Greyhound bus traveling from New York to Richmond skidded off the road and plunged down a 70foot embankment today, but the driver and all 16 passengers on the bus escaped safely, according to the Prince George's County police.

title: The Economic Scene
description: Pricing actions by the OPEC countries underscore the need for the United States to develop alternative sources of energy. Page 37.

title: Market Place
description: Though Christmas Day has past, some individuals will be wrapping their biggest presents this week.

title: Suffolk Liquor Official Is Arrested on Charge of Taking $100 Bribe
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Dec. 27Citing evidence of pervasive corruption in the processing of liquor license applications in the county, the Suffolk County District Attorney's office announced today the arrest of the county's top Alcoholic Beverage Control Board official for allegedly shaking down an applicant in exchange for speeding the processing of his licensing.

title: L. Stanley Glarum, 68, Dies
description: CANNON BEACH, Ore., Dec. 27 (AP) L. Stanley Glarum, 68, former music director and choral director at Lewis and Clark College in Portland, and a nationally known composer and arranger, died Friday. Mr. Glarum, a professor at the college for 28 years, wrote and published more than 200 works. He also served as a guest conductor for many choral groups in the United States. Survirors include his wife, a son and two daughters.

title: India Enthusiastic About Progress of Its BirthControl Pro firams
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 27India is coming to the end of 1976 with a record of decidedly the most significant progress in birth control that it has made in any year in its history.

title: HIS PLATFORM, TENNIS: Governor Byrne getting ready to smash a return as he helped to inaugurate the Oceanport ??. His partner, Jim Gordon, backed him
description: The New York Times/William E. Sauro up. Platform, or paddle tennis, was invented in 1928 and is now played by over a half million people playing on about 3,500 courts. Mr. Byrne is also a tennis buff.

title: Captain of Tanker Says Gyrocompass Was Malfunctioning
description: Georgios Papadopoulos, the captain of the oil carrier Argo Merchant, testified_ yesterday that the tanker's gyrocompass was not working properly when the ship went aground on Dec. 15, spilling millions of gallons of oil into the Atlantic off Nanticket Island.

title: Poll of Fans Favors Free Agents.
description: Baseball fans favor the sport's freeagent rule by a 5432 percent margin, according to a recent Harris poll. The remaining 14 percent 718 fans in the nationwide poll were not sure whether it was right a player who has played out his option to sign with another club for large sum of money.

title: Heroin Traffic In Mexican City Brings Violence
description: CULIACAN, MexicoPeople carry a submachine gun here as calmly as they might carry an umbrella anywhere else, a local businessman said. Almost everyone in Culiacan is armed. We get shootouts every day, people are assaulted, it's all normal for us.

title: Patients to Be Moved If Strike Continues
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 27 (UPI)More than 600 patients will be transferred out of Meadowview Hospital within 72 hours if no settlement is reached by then in a sixday walkout by nurses, Hudson County officials said today.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Some years ago, Dr. Bernard Cinherg, of Manhattan was kind enough to take me to his favorite stretch of the Neversink River, one of New York State's hallowed trout streams, made famous by the thin, frail Theodore Gordon, who, more than anyone else, must be considered the father of American flyfishing.

title: Events Today
description: FIDDLER ON THE ROOF, the Joseph SteinJerry BcktSheidon Harnirk.Sholom Aleichem.Ar. nold Peri musical revival. Staged by Ruth Mitchell. Starrino Zero Mostel. At the Winter Garden, 163.4 Broadway, at 8:30.

title: U.S. Ambassador Leaves Israel
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 27 (Reuters)Malcolm Toon, the outgoing United States Ambassador, left Israel today on completion of his tour of duty. Mr. Toon, who has been appointed American Ambassador to the Soviet Union, was seen off here by Foreign Ministry officials and members of the United States Embassy staff.

title: French Are Piqued About Foie Gras: It's Not Always What It Claims to Be
description: PARIS, Dec. 27 Most consumers are unaware that 60 percent of the foie gras packaged in France and sold here and abroad is imported from Communist countries and Israel.

title: DOW CLIMBS 10.47 ON POSSIBILITY OPEC WILL BAR JULY RISE
description: The possibility that the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries may suspend a price increase set for July 1 sent stock prices sharply higher yesterday in slower trading.

title: Suffolk County Reports 6 Cases Of the GullainBarre Paralysis
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Dec. 27 (UPI)Dr. David Harris, the Suffolk County deputy health commissioner, today ;aid there were six known cases of GullaineBarre paralysis in the county, all occurring since last Sept. 1.

title: Horse Shows
description: AT NORTH SALEM, N.Y.

title: Rentals Halted by Judge In Project Where Balance Of Races Is in Dispute
description: Federal District Judge Charles H. Tenney ordered a temporary halt yesterday tp the renting of apartments in the newly opened Roberto Clemente Plaza housing development in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn, and told both sides in the rental dispute between Hasidic Jews and black and Puerto. Rican groups to try to resolve their differences.

title: OPEC Moves Stress Need For Fresh Energy Sources
description: The dust has settled a bit now after the surprising disunity shown by the oilproducing nations 10 days ago, when they could not agree on a figure for a Jan. 1 price increase and had to fall

title: Electoral Note Plea For State Is Denied
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP)Supreme Court Justice Thurgood Marshall today denied the application of the United States Labor Party and others to block temporarily the award of New York State's 41 electoral votes to Jimmy Carter.

title: Mediator Will Seek to Settle Strike Against Seven Miami Beach Hotels
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 28  A Federal mediator will attempt tomorrow to end the threeday strike of about 4,000 hotel workers that has affected seven of the largest hotels in this resort city.

title: Ford to Reconsider Amnesty
description: VAIL, Colo., Dec. 27President Ford agreed today to look into the possibility of granting a general amnesty to the Vietnam warera draft resisters and deserters.

title: Meyer Liebowitz of Times Is Dead; An AwardWinning Photographer
description: Meyer Liebowitz, an awardwinning sports and news photographer who retired this month after 49 years on the staff of The New York Times, died yesterday in Mineola, L. I. He was 70 and lived at 11 Argo Avenue, Elmont, L.I.

title: C. Leslie Avery, ExSportswriter And Public Relations Man, Dead
description: C. Leslie Avery, a former reporter and public relations man, died of a heart attack on Saturday at his home, 731 King Street, Port Chester, N.Y. He was 69 years old.

title: How to Clean Up Oil
description: NANTUCKET, Mass. Dec. 27 (AP)Scientists, unable to harness the vast ribbon of oil stretching about 100 miles from the wreckage of the Argo Merchant, are still looking for a wey to clean it up.

title: Carter, and Morality in Foreign Policy
description: Jimmy Carter has spoken often and eloquently of the need to restore morality to the conduct of United Stateg foreign policy. One can only wish him luckwhile wondering if he may not find it easier to make good even his rash pledge to balance the Federal budget by the end of his term in 1981.

title: Coffee Prices Spur a Boycott to Cut .Use by 50%
description: Elinor Guggenheimer, New York City's Commissioner of Consumer Affairs and for the last five days a reformed coffee addict, began a campaign yesterday for a 50 percent reduction in coffee consumption by American consumers to force producers to cut prices.

title: Jessie Owens Wed in Nyack
description: Jessie Ann Owens, a candidate for doctorate in musicology at Princeton University, was married yesterday to Alan Hetherington Durfee, a member of the faculty of the University of Washington in Seattle. The ceremony was performed in Grace Episcopal Church in Nyack, N. Y., by the Rev, Charles R. Greene.

title: Israel Is Discounting Reports of P.L.O. Moderation
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 27Reports from various corners of the Arab world in recent weeks that the Palestine Liberation Organization is softening its opposition to Israel's existence are being dismissed by Israeli officials and Foreign Ministry analysts as propaganda that is part of an overall Arab diplomatic strategy to project a more moderate image to the international community.

title: Beame and Carey Travel to Georgia To See Carter About Financial Aid
description: Mayor Beame, Governor Carey and their top advisers are due in Sea Island, Ga., this morning for a longpromised meeting with Presidentelect Jimmy Carter to discuss the city and state financial situations.

title: 2 Men Kill a Bald Eagle in Suffolk
description: A bald eagle with an 84inch wingspan, one of possibly fewer than 100 of its species in the Northeast, was shot and killed on a rural byway in Suffolk County two weeks ago, the United States Fish and Wildlife Service renorted yesterday.

title: What Price Auld Lang Syne?
description: What are you doing New Year's, New Year's Eve?

title: JAMES J. HEALION
description: James J. Healion of Lindenhurst, L.I., father of James V. Healion, Connecticut manager for United Press International, died Sunday in Good Samaritan Hospital, West Islip, LI., after a brief illness. His age was 81.

title: Inquiry on Others Weighed After Trial Of Carter and Artis
description: The prosecutor in the CarterArtis trial that resulted in murder convictions last week in Paterson, N.J., said yesterday that he was preparing a report for the New Jersey State Attorney General's office concerning possible criminal coa1 duct on the part of various people other than the defendants. Passaic County Prosecutor Burrell I. Eumphreys said that the report would oe accompanied by transcripts of pertinent testimony at the trial. After their transmission to Trenton, Mr. Humphreys added, he will conr with the Attorney General's office on the advisibility of further criminal investigation or prosecution.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Saudis Reported Planning Big Increase in Oil Output
description: In an attempt to hold the raise in the world price of crude oil on Jan. 1 to 5 percent, Saudi Arabia plans a major increase in production in two steps over the next year, according to a highly placed Washington official.

title: 55 Management Officials Are Given Merit Raises By the Transit. Authority
description: The New York City Transit. Authority yesterday approved merit increases ranging from $1,000 to $2,500 a year, for 55 transit authority management officials.

title: Ski Area in Berkshires Has Artificial Success
description: HILLSDALE, N. Y., Dec. 27Three seasons ago Bill Gilbert and his brother, Sandy, joined Don Edwards in taking over the operation of the Pioneer Catamount Ski Area in this rolling Berkshire country. And although the resort was financially shaky when they News of Skiing took command, they've already made it financially sound. It's not surprising. The three men are well versed in snow  making knowledge, acquired while they were operating Bear Mountain, Fahnestock Park and Sterling Forest as a partnership for more than 15 years. Snow made by machines this season has given Catamount its best preChristmas business in its history.

title: PUPILS RAISE MONEY TO AID THE NEEDIEST
description: Hold Cupcake and Popcorn Sales and Make Items for Fair

title: Marquette Uses Strong Defense To Defeat Clemson Five, 6749
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 27 (AP)Marquette shut off Clemson's 7footlinch center, Tree Rollins, with a sagging defense and used 17 points by Butch Lee to whip the 10thranked Tigers, 6749, tonight, gaining the final of the Milwaukee Classic tournament.

title: Around the Nation
description: SAN JUAN. P. R., Dec. 27 (UPI)An official investigation has concluded that no charge:, should be filed over the alleged wiretapping of political dissidents.

title: A WANTED
description: A 21yearold Bronx man was arrested for bank robbery yesterday as he was telling the police on the telephone about his wife's having seen his picture in a newspaper wanted ad and threatening to leave him unless he gave himself up, the nolice reported.

title: Munson to Be Cited
description: BOSTON, Dec. 27 (AP)Thurman Munson, who became the American League's most valuable player while leading the New York Yankees to the pennant this year, will be honored at the Boston Baseball Writers 38th annual dinner on Jan. 27 at the Sheraton Boston Hotel.

title: Energy From Waters
description: Everyone talks about energy these days. We pontificate endlessly about the need for an energy policy. We debate the hazards of nuclear energy. We protest skyrocketing electricity rates. We shudder over the poisoning of the air from coalburning power plants and the gutting of the landscape from strip mining. We dream of energy from the sun some day.

title: Japan Is Expected to Export 5 Million Color TV Sets in Year
description: TOKYO, Dec. 27 (AP)Japan is expected to export a record 5 million color television sets this year, the Finance Ministry said today.

title: FED APPROVES REVISIONS tO REPORTING REGULATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (Reuters)The Federal Reserve Board said it approved revisions to regulations covering reporting by bank holding companies.

title: Half of Declaration of Independence In Its Final Draft Believed Found
description: BOSTON, Dec. 27 (AP)The first two pages of what may be the longlost final draft of the Declaration of Independence, handwritten by Thomas Jefferson with quilt pan and ink, have been found in a Boston attic.

title: Brooklyn Navy Yard Astir With Burst of New Activity
description: After a decade of decay, the piers, drydocks and building ways at the Brooklyn Navy Yard, where ships with names that tell the nation's history were built, equipped, repaired and converted are again astir with activity.

title: ISRAEL STILL SEEKS TALKS WITH ARABS, ALLON SAYS
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 27Foreign Minister Yigal Allan of Israel said today the Government would continue to explore possibilities of negotiating endofwar agreements with Egypt, Syria and Jordan although it no longer represents a majority in Parliament.

title: CARTER NOW TERMS ECONOMY IMPROVED; LEAVES PLAN IN DOBBT
description: ST. SIMONS ISLAND, Ga., Dec. 27Presidentelect Carter said today that the national economy seemed to be improv. ing, and he cast renewed doubt on what form his plans for economic stimulation might take.

title: Carter Aides Seek to Cut Turnover In Regulatory Agencies
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27  Presidentelect Carter's transition team is exploring new ways to deal with the increasingly rapid turnover in personnel at regulatory agencies, a situation that critics charge leads to stalemate, loss of morale, an inability to handle big cases, uninformed deliberations, conflicts of interest and disrespect for public service.

title: Julilly Kohler, Author
description: Julilly H. Kohler, author of several books for children and widow of John M. Kohler, an executive of the Kohler Company, plumbing fixture manufacturers, died Friday in Memorial Hospital, Sheboygan, Wis. She was 68 years old and lived at Riverbend in nearby Kohler, Wis.

title: State Birth Rate Off
description: The birth rate in the state dropped to a record low in 1976, falling more than 2 percent below the national birth rate this year, the State Health Department reported. By the end of the year, there will have been a maximum of 90,000 births recorded in all 21 counties, a department spokesman said, adding: That's a drop of about 1,500 from 1975.

title: Angela Lansbury Will Head Cast Of Albee's Double Bill in Hartford
description: Angela Lansbury will head the cast of Edward Albee's Counting the Ways and Listening when the double bill is given its American stage premiere at the Hartford Stage Company on Jan. 28. Joining Miss Lansbury for the engagement at the Connecticut playhouse will be William Prince and Maureen Anderman.

title: R. B. WILLIAMSON, EXHEAD OF AMINE SUPREME COURT
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Dec. 27Robert B. Williamson, retired chief justice of the Supreme Judicial Court of Maine, died today in the Augusta General Hospital, four days after he was admitted to the hospital's coronary care unit. He was 77 years old.

title: British Football
Choosing a Friend for Attorney General; Carter Follows Precedent in Naming Person Whose Judgment He Trusts
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27By selecting a personal friend and confidant to be Attorney General. Presidentelect Cartei followed the practice of almost all recent Presidents. President Nixon chose John N

title: . . . and Space
description: Space exploration has become so relatively noncontroversial that it played practically no role in last fail's Presidential campaign. But the national consensus that this activity is worthwhile and should be continued does not mean that it presents no problems or opportunities for the new Carter Administration.

title: McIntyre Says Ford Plans Slash In Funds for Energy Conservation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (UPI)Senator Thomas J. McIntyre, Democrat of New Hampshire, said today that he had learned that President Ford's budget for the 1977 fiscal year would slash funds for energy conservation.

title: Marcos Sets Final Talks With Moslems
description: MANILA, Dec. 27President Ferdinand E. Marcos said today that a final round of talks aimed at ending all Moslem dissidence in the Philippines would start in Libya Feb. 3 now that an agreement in principle had been reached with those grin rebelling

title: A Skirting of the Issue: Mini Makes Comeback
description: Bonwit Teller picked up the ball recently and ran with it. The look that turned Paris upside down, it said in an.ad that was run upside down. The ad :depicted three versions, in striped, plaid or foulardprinted cotton, of what the store called le minisack, priced from $21 to $32 each, and sketched onfittres wearing tights, leg warmers and boots.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Dec. 27Available technology is not sufficient to clean up an oil spill in the North Atlantic, and drilling in the ocean off Atlantic City may pose special dangers for the State, according to the State Department of Environmental Protection.

title: Oil Spills Into Delaware
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 27 (UPI)The Liberian tanker Olympic Games ran aground in the Delaware River today rupturing her hull below the waterline and spilling part of her cargo of crude oil into the water.

title: Meadowlands
description: ENTRIES

title: BEAME NAMES LAWYER TO WASHINGTON JOB
description: Mayor Beame yesterday appointed Lawrence J. O'Brien Jr., a Washington lawyer and legislative counsel, as director of New York City's Washington office. Mr. O'Brien, a 30yearold native New Yorker who was legislative counsel to Representative John M. Murphy of the 17th Congressional District, will replace Bruce Kirschenbaum, who resigned from the city's Washington office to join the staff of Presidentelect Carter.

title: World News Briefs
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec. 28 (UPI)Rhodesian troops have killed 33 blacks In the last six days, a Government communique said today.

title: Harold Rosner, 75, Dies; Robert Hall CoFounder And Former President
description: Harold Rosner, cofounder and retired president of Robert Hall Clothes, died yesterday at Doctors Hospital in Manhattan. He was 75 years old and lived at 50 Sutton Place.

title: Deficit in Trade Weakens Dollar; Gold Price Up
description: LONDON, Dec. 28 (AP) The dollar weakened in Europe today following the announcement of a record United States foreign trade deficit for November. The price of gold rose in Zurich to $134.02 an ounce.

title: Events Today
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Lincoln Center, Strauss. Salome, 8

title: Fine Guards Command Spotlight In Holiday Festival at Garden
description: By now it has been sufficiently docu mented that the Holiday Festival, the grand old college basketball tourna ment at the Garden, is not what it used to be.

title: Around the Nation
description: MIAMI, Dec. 28A Dade County judge ordered the striking union members at the Fontainebleau Hotel on Miami Beach to return to work and referred their wage dispute with the hotel management to binding arbitration.

title: Tax Reform Act To Make Dec. 31 Landmark Date
description: The 1976 Tax Reform Act has conferred a measure of immortality on this New Year's Eve. For decades to come, stock market prices on Dec. 31, 1976, will be used to figure the income taxes owed on sales of inherited stocks.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Dec. 28The New Jersey state income tax forms, which already are in the mail, are accompanied by two envelopesone printed in red ink and the other in black ink.

title: Group Relives Life Style And the Ordeals of 1776
description: WASHINGTON CROSSING STATE PARK, Dec. 28Joan Dwyer was sitting on an old log next to the crackling campfire, sewing for her husband, John, some new bluewoolen short leggings that Revolutionary War militiamen wore above their boots. On each side of Mrs. Dwyer were two rows of four flimsy, floorless tents of white cotton drill, a material thinner than canvas. A reproduction of a Colonialera American flag flapped in the breeze.

title: Play: Marco Polo Too Childish
description: Frankly, I suspect what is known as Children's Theater will always be a mystery to me. As a child, fortunately, I was never exposed to its childish excesses. I had the good fortune to grow up on adultor what is laughingly known as adulttheater. At least my raw and callow brain was never patronized. The first play I happened to see was King Lear. Gielgud was Lear and he never gave me the occasion to look back.

title: Chess:
description: The 1976 GoldwaterMarshall Tournament was won by Grandmaster Arthur Bisguier of Rock Hill, N.Y. The event was held at the Marshall Chess Club, which cosponsored the event. Bisguier won three games and drew two for a 41 score in the sixplayer roundrobin.

title: Suit on Fed's Group By Reuss Dismissed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28A suit by Representative Henry S. Reuss, the chairman of the House Banking Com mittee, challenging the composition of the Federal Open Market Committee has been thrown out of court. A Federal District Court judge ruled that the Wisconsin Democrat had failed to prove injury to himself and therefore had no standing to sue either as a lator or as a bondholder affected by changes in monetary policy.

title: Cronan Picked for Award
description: BOSTON, Dec. 28 (AP)Peter Cronan, a Boston College linebacker, was nominated as the 31st winner of the Nils V. (Swede) Nelson Award for sportsmanship as a football player. Cronan, a resident of Framingham, Mass., was selected from many nominees from around the country for his play on the field and his work in community and youth activities.

title: Hua Predicts Purge Across China in'77
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 28Hua Kuofeng, the chairman of the Communist Party, has disclosed that China will purge party and government officials who won their positions through connections with Chiang Ching and three other disgraced members of the Politburo.

title: $906 MILLION DEFICIT IN NOVEMBER TRADE SETS RECORD FOR U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28United States imports exceeded exports by a record $906 million in November, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: A Literary Gathering on a Professional Level: What Does It All Mean?
description: Herds of doctors philosophic wind slowly o'er the sea of carpet, hoping for a room assignment. Friend greets imperfect stranger did they meet at the Modern Language Association convention in San, Francisco last year? Was it Denver in 69?

title: Reduction of 40% in Student Body, Feared if City U. Budget Is Slashed
description: The Chancellor of the City University said yesterday that if the Beame administration put into effect its proposed cuts of nearly $100 million next year from the budgets of the four senior colleges and the Graduate Center, the student body of the system would have to be trimmed by 80.000 or almost 40 percent.

title: Kissinger, in a Reversal, Decides To Donate His Phone Transcripts
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 28Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger has reversed himself and decided to donate to the Library of Congress the transcripts of his telephone calls along with his other papers, the State Department said today.

title: Cold Raises Fears Of a Gas Shortage
description: Although natural gas has been rationed in recent years and industry officials repeatedly warned of cutoffs, mild winters and use of alternative fuels have helped avoid serious economic effects. This year, stockpiles of gas are being rapidly depleted and some industry experts suggest that if the cold weather persists substantial plant closings and job losses could result.

title: Up to 3 Inches of Snow Fluff Region's Wintry Mantle
description: Up to three inches of snow fell on the New York metropolitan area yesterday, causing traffic delays, two fatalities and many small traffic accidents before the snowfall tapered off around noon. There were light flurries last night, and the National Weather Service foresaw cold, blustery weather for today and a chance of some more light snow tonight.

title: 76ers, Erving Will Visit Nets Sunday Afternoon
description: The Seattle SuperSoncics, Buffalo Braves and Philadelphia 76ers will be the next three opponents for the Nets. The Sonics play at the Nassau Coli seum, Uniondale, L.I., tonight, after which New York will travel to Buffalo to oppose the Braves Saturday night.

title: Acquisition of Skyline Oil By Texas Eastern Corp. Is Tentatively Approved
description: The Texas Eastern Corporation of Houston, the holding company for the Texas Eastern Transmission Corporation, an 8,860milelong naturalgas transmission pipeline, is getting ready to dip into the oil shale business through the acquisition of the Skyline Oil Company of Salt Lake City. Texas Eastern said it had reached a conditional understanding on a proposed merger of Skyline into Texas Eastern through a taxfree reorganization involving the exchange of 473,900 shares Of Texas Eastern common shares worth about $18.42 million for all of Skyline's 1.24 million outstanding shares.

title: Ferkauf, Discount Veteran, Now Doctor for Companies
description: Eugene Ferkauf, a discount store veteran who hung out his shingle this fall as a consultant, is currently serving as a sort of retailing guru to such varied clients at Citibank, the Southland Corporation and Playboy, Enterprises.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor; The Dec. 10 news article about school appropriations reflects our nation's hostility toward children. Preliminary national statistics for 1976 school appropriations indicate a budget mortality in excess of the 29 percent so far established in New York State, justified only in part by a reduction in the kindergarten and earlygrade populations.

title: The Artificial Snow Begins to Fall at Gore
description: NORTH CREEK, N.Y., Dec. 28The large stateowned Gore Mountain ski center at last officially entered the snowmaking race today. Delayed from installing snowproducing machines for three years because of objections by some operators of privately owned resorts, Gore's crews had four big Hedco engines spouting flakes all day. New York State's en vironmental conservation commissioner, Peter A. A. Berle, su pervised a dedication ceremony held in temperatures just above zero at this Adirondack Mountain resort. He touched a switch and within moments swirls of snow began emitting from one of the machines.

title: New York's Political Leaders Laud Rose in Tributes
description: Following are tributes made to Alex Rose, the key architect of the Liberal Party, who died yesterday:

title: Sun Myung Moon Is Criticized by Religious Leaders
description: A panel of Roman Catholic, Protestant and Jewish leaders met yesterday and issued a stern statement that the writings of the Rev. Sun Myung Moon and the principles of his Unification Church were antiJewish, antiChristian and antidemocratic.

title: A New Beginning the Social Crisis...
description: When the Nixon Administration took office, civil rights, poverty and welfare reform were frontburner issues for the nation generally and for White House officials particularly. Now, as the Administration that is its temporal and ideological successor packs to leave, those concerns are far from the center of national consciousness; but because of the social erosion in the United States during the last seven years, they are hardly less urgent now than they were in 1969.

title: 1,400 WILL BE LAID OFF AT QUEENS CHICLE PLANT
description: The American Chicle Division of the WarnerLambert Company announced last night that it would temporarily lay off 1,400 of the 1,600 employees at its Long Island City, Queens, plant, which has been closed since an explosion there on Nov. 21.

title: Single Politicians: Public Life Without the Family Photograph
description: One day a man phoned State Senator Carol Bellamy, and she assumed, because of the organization he was associated with, that he was calling about garbage pickups.

title: 1976 Irish Finale Induces Sweeter Dreams for 1977
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 28Notre Dame football players, coaches and fans went to bed well after midnight last night to dream of big things for 1977 because the young Irish team had just defeated Penn State, 209, in the Gator Bowl.

title: CARTER BIDS CABINET FULFILL HIS PLEDGES
description: ST. SIMONS ISLAND, Ga., Dec. 28Presidentelect Carter met with his prospective Cabinet today and exhorted its members to carry out his campaign promises, but one adviser and his spokesman told reporters that an assured reduction in defense spending could not be listed among thcoia commitments.

title: Kings Beat Cavaliers By 113106
description: RICHFIELD, Ohio, Dec. 28 (AP)Brian Taylor and Richard Washington led a fourthquarter rally as the Kansas City Kings tonight handed the Cleve land Cavaliers their third straight Na tional Basketball Association loss,113106.

title: Market Place
description: The shares of the Technicare Corporation have seesawed in the last few trading sessions because of nervousness over competition in the market for medical scanners, the company's chief product, and caution by regulatory authorities regarding the effectiveness of the scanners.

title: Alex Rose of Liberal Party, A Power in Politics, Is Dead
description: Alex Rose, leader of a tiny millinery union, who built the Liberal Party into a significant and oftendecisive force in New York City, State and national politics, died yesterday at his home in Washington Heights. The 78yearold confidant of Presidents, governors and mayors had been ill for nearly a year, first with septicemia, a blood infection, and in recent weeks with viral bronchitis, but cancer was the cause of death.

title: L.I. Gets $11.3 Million for Transit
description: ALBANY, Dec. 28The State Department of Transportation announced today the transfer of $11.3 million of Federal highway trust funds for public transportation improvements in Nassau and Suffolk Counties.

title: MOSHE RIVLIN DIES AT 80; WITH N.Y. YIDDISH PAPER
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 28 (UPI)Moshe Rivlin of New York, a wellknown Yiddishlanguage journalist has died at age of 80.

title: Copters Hunt Antarctic Uranium
description: IN FLIGHT OVER VICTORIA LAND, AntarcticaLieut. Comdr. Mike Brinck files his helicopter directly at the towering rock wall of Tabular Mountain. Then, just as a crash seems inevitable, he banks and turns to parallel the wall 100 feet from its craggy sandstone face.

title: Tax Cuts and Jobs Programs: Both Likely
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28The long public argument over what ought to go into Presidentelect Carter's plan for stimulating the economy has made the issues appear to be much more a matter of eitheror than they actually are in the minds of most of the parties to the dispute. As the discussion has progressed, has often appeared, quite incorrectly, that the decision that has to be made is between concentrating exclusively, or almost exclusively, on tax reduction or, conversely, concentrating exclusively, or almost exclusively, on spending programs that will directly create jobs.

title: CARTER GIVES PLEDGE TO BEAME AND CAREY TO BAR BANKRUPTCY
description: ST. SIMONS ISLAND, Ga., Dec. 28Presidentelect Carter pledged to Mayor Beame and Governor Carey today to work to keep New York City out of bankruptcy, to assure that all its borrowing needs were met in the future and to review systematically the actions he could take by himself to help the city overcome its budget deficit next year.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

title: Rock Music, Loud and Public, Is Barometer of Relaxation in Parts of Eastern Europe
description: BUDAPESTOh, the marvelous meld of guitars and drums, and somewhere a Moog synthesizer, jacked up through the formidable stereophonic amplifiers to a deafening decibel intensity! The recording overflowed the snug room and seemed to melt into the red plush draperies.

title: CARTER BIDS CABINET FULFILL HIS PLEDGES
description: ST. SIMONS ISLAND, Ga., Dec. 28Presidentelect Carter met with his prospective Cabinet today and exhorted its members to carry out his campaign promises, but one adviser and his spokesman told reporters that an assured reduction in defense spending could not be listed among those commitments.

title: KATHERINE EDGAR BYRON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (AP)Katherine Edgar Byron, the first woman to represent Maryland in Congress, died at her home here today of a heart attack. She was 78 years old.

title: BLUE CROSS SEEKING 19.1% RATE INCREASE
description: TRENTON, Dec.28Saying that it can no longer make ends meet, New Jersey Blue Cross today applied for rate increases of up to 34 percent on hospital contracts covering individuals and small groups.

title: Killanin Sees Politics Peril For Olympics
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland, Dec. 28 (Reuters)Lord Killanin, International Olympic Committee president, today warned all countries wanting to com pete in the Olympic Games that they must obey the rules and resist political interference from Governments.

title: Cold Raises Fears Of a Gas Shortage
description: Colder  than  normal weather across much of the country this winter80 percent colder than a year ago in sonic placeshas raised new fears of severe shortages of natural gas before spring.

title: People in Sports
description: Sammy White, a wide receiver who caught 51 passes, and Mike Haynes,a cornerback who intercepted eight, were named pro football's rookies of the year yesterday in the annual Associated Press Poll.

title: ALSTON HARRIS
description: Alston Harris, for 30 years a stationary fireman at the Convent Avenue campus of City College, died at his Manhattan home on Sunday. He was 61 years old and lived at 328 Convent Avenue.

title: Alice Liberman, Teacher, Married to Jeffrey Nintzel
description: Alice Liberman, a teacher at the West Terrace School in Claremont, N.H., was married yesterday afternoon to Jeffrey Scott Nintzel, a photographer on the staff of the art department at Dartmouth College.

title: Many European Teachers Jobless As Economies Lag, Birthrates Dip
description: ROME, Dec. 23  Maria Caterinia Colonna, a 33yearold Roman, recently became so pessimistic in her search for a teaching job that she began answering advertisements for maids.

title: Bridge:
description: In the past decade, since the formation of the Dallas Aces in 1968, Texas has been a major center of bridge expertise. But much earlier, a group of Texans spearheaded by John Gerber and Paul Hodge were a powerful force on the national scene, winning many maior tittitles.

title: DOROTHY BRECKER
description: Dorothy Brecker, wife of Louis Brecker, founder of Roseland, the famous ballroom, died Monday at Doctors Hospital. She was 76 years old.

title: Hess's Raises Dividend
description: Hess's Inc., a department store chain in Pennsylvania, announced yesterday that directors voied to increase the quarterly dividend to 12 cents a share from 7 cents. It is payable Feb. 21 to holders of record Jan. 27.

title: DAYCARE CUT FEARED IN ALBANY PROPOSAL
description: New York City officials said yesterday that if the Carey administration went ahead with its proposed cuts of $200 million from the state's contribution to Medicaid and welfare, nearly a third of the city's 335 group daycare centers would have to be closed, resulting in the removal of up to 11,000 children from the, program.

title: Careers
description: The Class of 1976 at the Wharton School, the University of Pennsylvania's graduate school of business, is faring well in terms of jobs and money. That is indicated by the more than 70 percent of the 463 class members who responded to a work questionnaire.

title: Technology
description: One of the holy grails of industry, pursued with more fervor than ever as pressure keeps increasing to conserve energy and scarce materials, is to reduce the weight of a structuresuch as a space shuttle, an airplane, an automobile, a bicycle or a golf club while retaining its strength.

title: Studies of Bell's Record as Judge Not Expected to Bar Confirmation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28  Although more than a halfdozen organizations are investigating the judicial background of Attorney Generaldesignate Griffin B. Bell, Congressional staff members and spokesmen for some of the investigating groups said today that opposition to his nomination had begun to fade and a serious effort to block his confirmation now seemed unlikely.

title: Vikings Relax While Coach Views Films of Unfamiliar Raider Team
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 28 (UPI) The Minnesota Vikings won't reassemble for practice until Friday, but Coach Bud Grant and his staff were busy today reviewing films of Oakland Raider games.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Long Island Trust Company Bank at 12 Henry Street, Freeport, L.I., was robbed of $3,250 by a man who handed a teller a note saying a bomb was in a bag he had placed on a counter, the Nassau County police said. The bomb disposal squad found only garbage in the bag. Lieut. Shaun Spillane said that the robber apparently was the same man who last Friday stole $250 from the National Bank of North America, 60 North Main Street, three blocks away, after using a similar ruse.

title: Books of The Times
description: Early in 1926, a young lyricist named Lorenz Hart wrote another young lyricist named Ira Gershwin to tell him how much he liked the lyrics in the Gershwins show TipToes. After apologizing for not conveying his feelings personally at a partyI had imbibed more cocktails than is my wont.

title: Tax Reform Act To Make Dec. 31 Landmark Date
description: The 1976 Tax Reform Act has conferred a measure of immortality on this New Year's Eve. For decades to come, stock market prices on Dec. 31, 1976, will be used to figure the income taxes owed on sales of inherited stocks.

title: Score Three Goals in Final Period
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 28The New York Islanders pulled the neatest trick of the week tonight. Trailing the St. Louis Blues, 40, with about 25 minutes left, they turned 17,103 happy faces into incredulous frowns by scoring four goals, two in the final 2 minutes, to salvage a 44 tie.

title: A Soviet Defector Says Radiation Hospitalized 70% of a Rifle Regiment
description: LONDON, Dec. 28 (AP)A man who says he served in the Soviet security police, Aleksei Myagkov, asserts in a book released today that a regiment of Soviet troops was ordered, into a radioactive area after a nuclear explosion and that 70 percent of the soldiers were seriously affected by the radiation.

title: Barter Deal Means Soviet Oil for India
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 28 (AP)The Soviet. Union offered formally today to provide India with 5.5 million tons of crude oil over the next four years in a barter exchange for Indian exports, the Indian Government announced today. It said the Soviet Union would provide one million tons of crude in 1977 and 1.5 million tons in each of the following three years.

title: Knicks Roll, 11199; McMillen (31) Stars
description: Bob McAdoo, who came to the Knicks in the Tom McMillen deal, didn't play again last night. But the 6foot11inch McMillen, who finds starting a tonic, scored a career high of 31 points as the Knicks overwhelmed the Houston Rockets, 11199, before a capacity crowd of 19,694 at Madison Square Garden.

title: DOW, UP BY 3.99, TOPS 1,000 FOR FIRST TIME SINCE SEPT. 27 CLOSE
description: The stock market registered a broad advance yesterday with the Dow Jones industrial average finishing above the 1,000 level for the first time in three months.

title: PRICE AGENCY FINDS NO SHORTAGES NEAR FOR PAPER INDUSTRY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (AP)Prices are currently high enough in most of the paper industry to justify any new investments and there should not be any serious shortage of paper products through 1978 at least, a government study said today.

title: Ancient Sanctuary Found in Rome
description: ROME, Dec. 28 (AP)Archeologists announced today the discovery of one of the oldest sanctuaries of ancient Rome, perhaps dating back to the founding of the city about 27 centuries ago.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY TransAtlantic

title: 61MONTH U.S. NOTES SOLD AT 6:19% YIELD
description: The Treasury sold $2.5 billion of new 61month notes yesterday at an average yield of 6.19 percent that reflected a surprising surge in bidding interest.

title: Mainbocher, Fashion Designer for Notables Since the 1930's, Is Dead in Munich at 85.
description: Main Rousseau Bocher, the fashion designer from Chicago who, under the name of Mainbocher, was a dominant figure in the Paris couture in the 1930's, died in Munich Monday night. He was 85 years old.

title: Women Pictured as Facing Conflict In Favoring Pacifism and Feminism
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28A group of women scholars contended today that modern women activists faced a conflict of values in advocating pacifism and feminism identical to that of their antecedants at the beginning of the ecentury.

title: M.B.A.'s Faring Well
description: A survey of 463 Wharton graduates of the class of 76 who have staked their careers on M.B.A.'s shows that more than 70 percent of them are faring well in terms of jobs and money. Page 43.

title: Report Says Civil Service Agency Failed to Enforce Hiring Rules
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28A House committee report to be released soon says that the United States Civil Service Commission has irreparably damaged its credibility by failing to enforce Federal hiring rules in the Nixon years and by breaking its own regulations.

title: Philip E. Iselin, President of Jets And Monmouth Park, Dies at 74
description: Philip E. Iselin, president of the New York Jets, died of an apparent heart attack yesterday in the football team's Manhattan office. He was 74 years old.

title: Sports Today
description: Nets vs. Seattle Super Sonics at Nassau Coliseum, Uniondale, L.I., 8 P.M. (TelevisionChannel 10 (Cable, 8 P.M.) (RadioWMCA, WGBB, 8 P.M.

title: Without Rose, the Liberals May Face a Test
description: For years, Democratic and Republican politicians have described the Liberal Party as a oneman operation. That one man, Alex Rose, died yesterday, and so the theory will be put to the test. We'll see whether this remarkable man's monument can endure, whether the institution can transcend the person, said City Councilman Henry Stern of Manhattan, the only elected Liberal legislator in the state.

title: Holography Takes Root in SoHo In a Museum Devoted to Future
description: There's a new museum for a new art in SoHo. Unlike most museums, which are repositories of the past, the Museum of Holography is devoted to presenting visions of the future.

title: GROUNDING OF TANKER LINKED TO NAVIGATION
description: Capt. Georgios Papadopoulos of the oil tanker Argo Merchant indicated yesterday that faulty navigational equipment or the way it was used might have caused the ship to go aground on shoals off Nantucket Island two weeks ago.

title: Guerrilla Buildup In South Lebanon Worries Christians
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 28Lebanese rightwing Christian leaders have expressed concern over reports that Palestinian guerrillas have built up their forces in southern Lebanon.

title: HelpWanted Ad Index Climbed By 3 Points to 99 in November
description: The helpwanted advertising index rose to 99 in November (1967 100), an increase of three points from the October index and five points above September, the Conference Board reported yesterday. Th index stands 12 points above the level of November 1975.

title: Song Moods of Glen Covington Shift in Rapid Fire at Weston's
description: For several years, Glen Covington, a pianist and singer who is now appearing at Jimmy Weston's, 131 East 54th Street, has been publicized as a performer in the tradition of Fats Waller. This is hardly fair to either Mr. Waller or Mr. Covington.

title: Coffee Futures Decline 3c a Pound, Daily Limit; Cocoa Prices Advance
description: Coffee futures dropped the daily limit yesterday on the New Coffee and Sugar Exchange.

title: NEGLIGENCE CHARGED TO NASSAU OFFICIALS
description: Two New York State Assemblymen charged the Nassau County Health Department yesterday with extraordinary negligence for allegedly failing to act on the knowledge that cancercausing chemicals had been found in Long Island drinking water.

title: About Real Estate
description: The need of a major office tenant to expand can set in motion a game of musical chairs for its fellow tenants in a building. If the building is fully occupied, or otherwise unable to accommodate the expansion, the consequences of the move can ripple beyond it through the office market.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A Middlesex County housewife active in consumer affairs called for a boycott of coffee in New Jersey to head off further increases in the nation's favorite drink. Joan Gullo who is Sayreville's unsalaried consumer affairs specialist, urged people to drink tea or hot chocolate rather than coffee between Monday and Feb. 3. If enough people do it, we can be successful, said Mrs. Gullo, who crganized a payment boycott against Public Service Electric & Gas Company last spring, which resulted in a rebate by the utility.

title: Nigerians Elect Local Councils As a Step Toward Civilian Rule
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Dec. 28 (UPI)Nigerians voted today in localgovernment elections, the first to be held in Africa's most populous country.

title: Steve Turner Travels the World In Search of His Tennis Dream
description: No, Steve Turner isn't lookdng for a job. But that would be an appropriate classified ad if he were. He's back in New York, after 35 weeks on the road, mostly in Europe, to play in the $5,000 Dodge Classic at the Rallye Club in East Orange, N.J., where he's seeded third behind Pete Fishbach and Joel Ross.

title: Battle of Lines Called Key to Orange Bowl
description: MIAMI, Dec. 28 (AP)George Hill, Ohio State's defensive coordinator, predicted today that the Orange Bowl football game with Colorado Saturday night would be settled in the line.

title: ASSETS MADE PUBLIC BY TEAMSTERS FUND
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 28The Teamsters major pension fund, under continuing pressure from Government investigations into its past practices, released today a complete list of all outstanding loans and gave new details on efforts to clean up the operation of the fund.

title: Aides Say Carter May Leave Some Top Positions Vacant
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25Presidentelect Carter and his Cabinet may leave some subCabinet positions vacant to set the stage for government reorganization and to set an Immediate example of reducing the Federal bureaucracy, aides to Mr. Carter disclosed today.

title: Libyans Stung in Fake Arms Deal
description: PARIS, Dec. 28Shady munitions dealers, Libyan agents in Spain, a Swiss bank account and 3,000 pairs of fake nightviion binoculars are some of the elements of a $15million international arms swindle under investigation here.

title: Junior Orange Bowl Soccer Ends With Seven Title Contests Today
description: The hotel strike in Miami hasn't af fec'ted the 1,800 boys and girls who required the use of 26 soccer fields fiont dawn to dusk Monday and yesterday. They played more than 175 games in the Junior Orange Bowl soccer tournament, which will culminate today with the championship games in seven divisions.

title: Print Tied to Man in Hughes Will
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 28 (UP1)A thumbprint on the envelope enclosing the socalled Mormon will of Howard R. Hughes has been definitely identified as that of a Utah service station operator who was named a major beneficiary, Attorney General Robert List of Nevada told a District Court today.

title: Robert Duvall and Ulu Grosbard Team Up for American Buffalo
description: Robert Duvall's who played major roles in such films as The Godfather and the current Seven Percent Solution and Network, and Ula Grosbard, the director, will join forces on Broadway early next year in American Buffalo, a play by David Mamet. They last worked together in an OffBroadway revival of Arthur Miller's A View From the Bridge, at the New York Theater in 1965.

title: Bilandic, Lawyer and Daley Friend, Named Acting Mayor of Chicago
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 28Alderman Michael A. Bilandic, an intimate friend and neighbor of the late Richard J. Daley, was chosen Acting Mayor of Chicago today by a nearunanimous vote of the City Council.

title: Artpatron's New Bronze is a Scientific One
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Dec. 28Joseph H. Hirshhorn stood in front of the crackling log fire today and could be certain he knew his precise place in the world. Not as a wealthy financier and art collector, but his place there on the living room hearth 41 degrees 6 minutes 12.75657 seconds latitude and 73 degrees 40 minutes 25.88079 seconds longitude.

title: The New York Times/Robert Walker
description: Main Rousseau Bocher, the fashion designer from Chicago who, under the name of Mainbocher, was a dominant figure in the Paris couture in the 1930's, died in Munich Monday night. He was 85 years old.

title: Copters Hunt Antarctic Uranium
description: IN FLIGHT OVER VICTORIA LAND, AntarcticaLieut. Comdr. Mike Brinck files his helicopter directly at the towering rock wall of Tabular Mountain. Then, just as a crash seems inevitable, he banks and turns to parallel the wall 100 feet from its craggy sandstone face.

title: Poison Control Center Receiving Calls on Taking Tests for Arsenic
description: The city's Poison Control Center reported yesterday that it had received a number of telephone calls from people concerned about the possibility of arsenic poisoning from a silicone sealant manufactured by General Electric.

title: Ford Rejects Plan by C.A.B. to Add Atlantic Air Routes and Entry Cities
description: President Ford has rejected a farreaching plan to significantly expand transAtlantic airline routes and open 11 additional metropolitan areas around the country to direct air service to Europe, Government officials announced yesterday.

title: Libyans Stung in Fake Arms Deal
description: PARIS, Dec. 28Shady munitions dealers, Libyan agents in Spain, a Swiss bank account and 3,000 pairs of fake nightvision binoculars are some of the elements of a $15million, international arms swindle under investigation here.

title: News Summary
description: A major shakeup in China of party members and local government officials was announced by the new Communist party chairman, Hua Kuofeng, as the main task for 1977. The aim is to get rid of all who won their positions through connection With Chiang Ching, widow of Mao Tsetung, and her three associates in disgrace. Plans for rapid economic growth were also outlined. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: Paulo Pontes, Playwright, Dies In Rio de Janeiro at Age 35
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec 28 (UPI)The Brazilian playwright Paulo Pontes died today of cancer at the age of 35.

title: General Ousted From West Point Charges He Was Treated Unfairly
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Dec. 28 (AP)Brig. Gen. Walter F. Ulmer Jr., ousted commandant of cadets at the United StatesMilitary Academy, says he was unfairly treated in the Academy's cheating scandal.

title: South Africa Puts Deaths at 70 In 3 Days as Black Rioting Spreads
description: JOHANNESBURG, Dec. 28 (AP)The announced death toll in fighting among black factions over the last three days rose today to 70 as South African officials reported that clashes had erupted in two more areas. Two other blacks were reported killed last night by police bullets.

title: News Summary
description: A major shakeup in China of party members and local government officials Was announced by the new Communist party chairman, Hua Kuofeng, as the main task for 1977. The aim is to get rid of all who won their positions through connection with Chiang Ching, widow of Mao Tsetung, and her three associates in disgrace. Plans for rapid economic growth were also outlined. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: Soviet Concedes Disrupting Radios
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (AP)The Sbviet Union, has said it was probably responsible for powerful broadcast signals that have been interfering with international radio communications. Moscow has added that it would try to alleviate the problems.

title: A Guide to Caviar If You So Resolve
description: No single food is more synonymous with the New Year's Eve celebra tion than caviar. Many people who find those rare and precious sturgeon eggs too rich for their budgets during the year are willing to splurge now. If prices alone were an indication of quality, the choice would be simple, but such is not the case.

title: Pakistanis Finish 2MileWide Dam and See it as Boon for Farming
description: TARBELA, PakistanIn a brown, dusty ravine here at the southwestrn edge of the Himalayas, Pakistan has just finished building the world's largest dam, which carries important hopes for the future of the country's aariculture.

title: Men in Yonkers And Passaic Win Irish Sweepstakes
description: PASSAIC, Dec. 28Rafael Martinez, who lives here at 4 Donald Avene and Al Davis, of 76 Gordon Street, Yonkers, N.Y., may regard Tuesday from now on as a lucky day. Each won $127,500 in the Irish Sweepstakes today.

title: LESLIE KOZMA
description: Leslie (Laszlo) Kozma, a former executive of wine and liquordistributing companies who was a consultant to Schenley Distributors on French wines, died Monday in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived at 2675 Henry Hudson Parkway West in the Riverdale section of the Bronx.

title: Obituary 9  No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO OXFORD 53311 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY: NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33900; WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300; NASSAU CO (316) 7470500; SUFFOLK CO. (516)6691800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: STEEL OUTPUT CUT 6.7%; USE OF CAPACITY ALSO OFF
description: Steel production totaled two million net tons in the week ended Saturday, a decrease of 6.7 percent over the preceding week's 2.14 million net tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: A Literary Gathering on a Professional Level: What Does It All Mean?
description: Herds of doctors philosophic wind slowly o'er the sea of carpet, hoping for a room assignment. Friend greets imperfect stranger did they meet at the Modern Language Association convention in San Francisco last year? Was it Denver in '69?

title: Court Bars Review on Rizzo
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 28 (AP)The State Supreme Court, in a oneline, unsigned opinion, has refused to review its decision that killed efforts to recall Mayor Frank L. Rizzo. The opinion, issued yesterday apparently closed off the last legal avenue open to those who sought to have the recall measure placed on the Nov. 2 general election ballot.

title: in Urban America
description: Just over one year ago, after Congress had adopted a program of limited emergency aid for New York Citysharply scaled down at President Ford's insistenceHouse Banking Committee Chairman Henry S. Reuss of Wisconsin warned: Today's action is a stopgap. We can be sure that the problem will come back to haunt us. Representative Stewart B. McKinney of Connecticut added: Sooner or later New York's problem will haunt every city in the United States of America.

title: Michigan and Providence Advance in Tournament
description: PROVIDENCE, Dec. 28 (AP)Michi gan, the nation's topranked college basketball power, built a 19point first half lead on the shooting of a sopho more, Phil Hubbard, and held off ro peated challenges tonight for a 9585 victory over previously unbeaten Rhode Island in the opening round of the Friar Classic.

title: PORTUGAL IS WORRIED BY DELAY IN U.S. LOAN
description: LISBON, Wednesday, Dec. 29The Portuguese Government has expressed concern over the delay in receiving the financial assistance from the United States that was requested last March and approved in principle last month by the Ford Administration.

title: Notes on People
description: Alexander P. Butterfield has at last found a new job. Mr. Butterfield, who at the time was head of the Federal Aviation Administration, first revealed to the Senate Watergate committee, on July 16, 1973, that President Nixon's Oval Office conversations had been taped. The information helped set in motion a chain of events that led to the President's resignation. Mr. Butterfield, who had formerly been a White House aide, continued as F.A.A. chief until March 1975 when he left the agency, reportedly at the request of President Ford. Some months ago he complained that although he had sent resumes to dozens of companies, he had been unable to find employment. But yesterday, it was announced that Mr. Butterfield had been named executive vice president of the International Air Service Company Ltd., a Californiabased concern that leases flight crew services and air charter services, and is engaged in aircraft sales and maintenance.

title: Advertising
description: The official car of the United States ski team is made in Japan. The Subaru, more specifically the Subaru fourwheeldrive station wagonswith red, white and blue paint job and an official sealwill be hauling around our intrepid skiers and their coaches here and abroad.

title: Hua Predicts Purge Across China in ' 77
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 28Hua Kuofeng, the chairman of the Communist Party, has disclosed that China will purge party and government officials who won their positions through connections with Chiang Ching and three other disgraced members of the Politburo.

title: Ford Rejects Plan by C.A.B. to Add Atlantic Air Routes and Entry Cities
description: President Ford has rejected, a farreaching plan to significantly expand transAtlantic airline routes and open 11 additional metropolitan areas around the country to direct air service to Europe, Government officials announced yesterday.

title: Mondale As Chief Of Staff
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 28Most new administrations come to Washington proclaiming great changes, and leave regretting the stubborn resistance of the human race to all their noble plans; but as the Carterization of Washington proceeds, the idea is getting around that it may really be a New Year after all.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP)The Matsushita Electric Corporation of America has agreed to a Federal order barring it from misrepresenting the results of tests on its Panasonic television sets and other products.

title: 251 Shot Wins Irish Sweeps On Wet Course
description: LEOPARDSTOWN, Ireland, Dec. 28 (AP)  Master Monday, a 251 shot, splashed home the winner of the Irish Sweeps hurdle race today, bringing payoff of $127,500 to lucky ticket holders. Master Monday finished 2 lengths in front on a soggy track in the final of the four annual races associated with the Irish Sweepstakes.

title: Bear Fund Hopes to Benefit as Stocks Fall
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28  Some promoter with a genius for capturing the mood of a disenchanted investing public was bound to dream it up. Now it's here a mutual fund for losers.

title: New Instant Lottery Starts Next Tuesday
description: New York State will begin its second instant lotery next Tuesday with more prizes, more ways to win, better odds and hopes of selling more of the $1 scratchoff tickets than the first instant lottery game, its director said yesterday.

title: Esposito Leads Effort With 2 Goals
description: LANDOVER, Md., Dec. 28Gleeful were the New York Rangers tonight and the reason was a 52 victory over the Washington Capitals, the Rangers first victory in the snappy red, white and blue Capital Centre.

title: The Graying of America
description: NEW HAVEN  Before we fold up the Bicentennial year and lay it away mothballs, we might spare a moment's reflection on what we made of the occasion.

title: Claridge in Paris Closing This Week
description: PARIS, Dec. 28The Claridge, one of the French capital's few remaining oldtime luxury hotels, is closing its doors New Year's Eve to make room for a shopping center.

title: Dr. James Troupin, Leader in Education For Public Health
description: Dr. James L. Troupin, director of health for New Britain, Conn., and an expert on publichealth education, died Sunday at Memorial Hospital for Cancer and Allied Diseases in New York. He was 68 years old and lived in New Britain.

title: COMATOSE BOY PLACED IN ST. CLARE RESPIRATOR
description: DENVILLE, Dec. 28 (UPI)A 12yearold boy in a coma since Christmas Day has been placed on a respirator at the same hospital where Karen Anne Quinlan was treated in a coma for more than a year, officials said today.

title: 25Mile Oil Slick on the Delaware Endangers Wintering Waterfowl
description: GLOUCESTER CITY, NJ., Dec. 28A slick 25 miles long spread south in the Delaware River today after the Liberian tanker Olympic Games went aground off Marcus Hook, Pa., late yesterday, spilling 134,000 gallons of oil and posing a threat to the 60,000 ducks, geese and other waterfowl wintering in the estuary.

title: Parking Rule Stayed Because of Snowfall
description: Because of snow conditions, Traffic Commissioner Theodore Karagheuzoff suspended alternatesideofthestreet parking regulations for today, effective at 2 A.M.

title: 25Mile Oil Slick on the Delaware Endangers Wintering Waterfowl
description: GLOUCESTER CITY, NJ., Dec. 28A slick 25 miles long spread south in the Delaware River today after the Liberian tanker Olympic Games went aground off Marcus Hook, Pa., late yesterday, spilling 134,000 gallons of oil and posing a threat to the 60,000 ducks, geese and other waterfowl wintering in the estuary.

title: Shoe Producers Hurt by Imports, U.S. Panel Says
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28The United States International Trade Commission voted unanimously today for the second time this year that the domestic industry producing nonrubber footwear was being injured by competition from imports.

title: Korean Envoy Says Bribe Scandal Must Yield to National Interests
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28South Korea's Ambassador to the United States, Hahm yang Choon said today that the damage caused by allegations of Korean bribery of American Congressmen has been rather serious and it can become even more serious if we do not do more to preserve and protect our basic bilateral relations.

title: Survey on Building In New York City Termed Positive
description: Mayor Beanie expressed cautious optimism yesterday about a resurgence of private construction in the city as he unveiled a list of 89 major new private construction projects totaling $1.5 billion in projected costs.

title: Some New Approaches to a Neglected Craft
description: GREENWICH, Conn.Enameling, that rich and ancient combining of precious metals with beautiful colors, has for some time been a neglected craft.
