description: TOP10 LISTS require no justification. The following is a list of the 10 best longplaying pop records of 1976. What that means is, first, poprockfolkcountrysoul of the sort likely to make the main sales charts. It does not include classical, jazz, purist folk or anything else, however worthy, that didn't at least have shot at commercial success.

title: Reserve Report
description: In Billions

title: Fighting Saints 4, Bulls 2
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Dec. 30 (AP)John McKenzie's goal and an emptynet goal by Mike Antonovich in the third period gave the Minnesota Fighting Saints a 42 victory over the Birmingham Bulls tonight in a World Hockey Association game.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Thursday. Prime rata 66.

title: Art: Quality and Acrobatics in Print
description: RINT BOOMS come and go. Your kindly neighborhood centenarian can tell you of the time when in England a mezzotint engraving after an 18thcentury English portrait could have cost you almost as much as the portrait itself. Prints were up, family portraits were down.

title: The National Economy
description: The Presidentelect himself seems to feel that the national economy, with its twin plagues of continued inflation and continued unemployment, requires the most immediate attention of his new Administration. He can hardly be faulted on this judgment; for on a further steady slowdown of the rate of inflation and a sharp rothiction in the unemployment rolls, the efficacy of virtually all other social loction programs will depend.

title: South Korean Poet Doing Life Is Sentenced to 7 Years More
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Friday, Dec. 31Kim Chi Ha. a dissident poet known for his satirization of the Government of President Park Chung Hee, was sentenced yesterday to seven years in prison for praising and encouraging what the court characterized as an antistate organization.

title: ExC.I.A. Agent Jailed in Spy Case Is Denied Release
description: BETHESDA, Md., Dec. 30 (UPI)A Federal magistrate refused today to release a former agent of the Central Intelligence Agency who is being held on charges of trying to sell Government secrets to the Soviet Union.

title: Friday
description: Ringing out the old and ringing in the new is a particularly resounding event at the Riverside Church. At the stroke of 12, the largest of the carillon's 74 bellsand, at 20 tons, the largest tuned carillon bell in the world will be unleashed for five minutes to herald the arrival of 1977. Earlier, beginning with dessert and coffee at 10, there will be other kinds of New Year's Eve observances at the interdenominational church at 10:30, a carillon recital featuring an unconventional version of Auld Lang Syne at 10:45, an organ recital of hell and trumpetlike music in the nave; at 11:30, the Watch Night Service in honor of the New Year. (And if you want to make sure that your watch hits midnight at the precise moment, take a tip from James Lawson, the Riverside carillonneur: Pick up the phone and dial NERVOUS.)

title: Warriors 124, Bulls 106
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 30 (AP)Rick Barry snapped out of a scoring slump with 37 points as the Golden State Warriors defeated the Chicago Bulls, 124106, tonight.

title: If You Wondered About Thaddeus Stevens
description: PRINCETON, N. J.Amy Carter to Attend Thaddeus Stevens School in Washington. What made this story newsworthy was the fact that no President since Theodore Roosevelt has sent his children to public school. To the historian, however, the name Thaddeus Stevens suggests some unusual ironies. For to generations of Americans, Stevens was the scourge of the South, the evil genius of radical Reconstruction.

title: GOVERNOR PARDONS 7 TO CLOSE THE BOOK ON ATTICA EPISODE
description: Governor Carey moved yesterday to firmly and finally close the book on the 1971 prison uprising at Attica as he pardoned seven former Attica inmates and commuted the sentence of an eighth who participated in the riot.

title: Taft Five Wins Tourney
description: Taft High School defeated DeWitt Clinton, 9771, yesterday in the final of the fifth annual Elmcor Christmas basketball tournament at Brandeis High School. It was the third time the Bronx schools had met in the event's final and the second time Taft had won. Curtis Phauls led Taft with 31 points.

title: Whalers 6. Stingers 4
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 30 (AP)  The New England Whalers handed the Cincinnati Stingers their sixth straight, World Hockey Association loss tonight, 64, on thirdperiod goals by Danny Bolduc and Brett Callighen.

title: American in Austria Says Work for C.I.A. Ruined Her Life
description: SALZBURG, AustriaFrom 1969 to 1973, Martha Schneider provided cover for American Intelligence agents in Vienna and Salzburg by taking leases on apartments so that they could be used for secret meetings. She has since suffered a nervous breakdown and nearbankruptcy. Perhaps it would have happened anyway. But she believes her life was ruined by her involvement with the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Two Police Unions Assail Proposal By Scoppetta on Officer Evaluation
description: Officials of two New York City police unions yesterday assailed proposals by Nicholas Scoppetta, the new Deputy Mayor for Criminal Justice, for closer evaluation of police officers and detectives.

title: At the Movies
description: HE QUESTION, I found, wasn't how I was going to make a movie out of Equus, but how John Dexter made a play out of it. Sidney Lumet sat in his basement living room, with ankles of different shapes, velocities and dispositions going by the window. New York feet have a lot of expression; maybe more than faces. Mr. Lumet's back was turned to them, but they provided a quietly discursive backdrop as he talked.

title: In Providence, Victory and Bedlam
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Dec. 30Coach John Orr of previously unbeaten Michigan called it a bitter defeat, and Coach Dave Gavitt of Providence College described it as a very emotional victory.

title: Consumer Notes
description: The deadline for filing 1975 claims under the Pharmaceutical Assistance for the Aged program has been extended a second time, from today to Jan. 31.

title: Aeros Absorb A 101 Defeat By Soviet Six
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 30 (AP)Vladimir Petrov scored twice as the Soviet Union's Selecta team unleased an eightgoal barrage in the second period and trounced the Houston Aeros, 101, in a World Hockey Association challenge series exhibition game tonight.

title: Schedule for Civilian Rule
description: LIMA, Dec. 30 (AP)President Morales Bermudez said today that civilian rule might return to this nation in three to four years under a new political plan. The military took power in Peru in 1968.

title: Panel Warns Industries
description: TRENTON, Dec. 30A New Jersey State Senate committee recommended today that the Legislature ban 16 cancercausing chemicals from the state as part of a farreaching program to cut the high rate of cancer in the state. It also urged a 1cent increase in the cigarette tax to finance prevention efforts.

title: Dividends
Soccer
description: GoatDragon Radovich, St. Francis BacksGres Makowski, SIGEdwardsville; Greg Gorleku, Lasiern Illinois; Paul Hunter, Connecticut; Carl Christensec. Vermont, and Glenn Myernick, Hardwick.

title: Chinese Say Unrest Ebbs in Paoting, South of Peking
description: PEKING, Dec. 30The situation in the North China city of Paoting, where political feudtlg erupted into armed conflict, is gradually improving, a Chinese official said tonight.

title: But U.S.C., Michigan Discount Effect
description: PASADENA, Calif., Dec. 30It rained for a while here today, two days before the Rose Bowl encounter between Michigan and Southern California, and such was the response one might have thought that the San Andreas Fault had let go. Would the rain change the practice plans of the teams? Would the prospects of rain on Saturday change the coaching strategies? Would the world ever be the same again?

title: Historic Status Given To Newark Cathedral
description: WASHINGTON Dec. 30 (AP)The Cathedral of the Sacred Heart in Newark has been placed on the National Register of Historic Places. Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., Democrat of New Jersey, made the announcement yesterday.

title: Dow, Up 4.16, Closes at 999.09; Turnover Rises
description: The stock market, apparently encouraged by signs that the economy is contir; uing to improve, staged a broad advance yesterday in accelerated trading.

title: State Reports Bankruptcy Near For a Water Company in Queens
description: The company that supplies water to 600,000 residents of Queens and Nassau Counties is near bankruptcy after years of having its earnings drained away by its major stockholders, according to the New York State Public Service Commission.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: Minnesota 4, Birmingham 2. New England 6. Cincinnati 4. San Diego 4, Winnipeg 3.

title: TV WEEKEND
description: New Year's Evr can be spent with lively propriety in the company of Arthur Fiedler and the Boston Pops (Channel 13 at 11 P.M.) or with poprock nostalgia with Frankie Valli as host (Channel 7 at 11:30). Purists, however, will find New Year's Eve With Guy Lombardo on Channel 2. Auld Lang Syne just doesn't sound the same without the benefit of Mr. Lombardo's orchestration. And viewers at home may get some small measure of satisfaction watching couples who have paid between $90 and $125 per person for the privilege of craning their necks at the television cameras on a painfully crowded dance floor.

title: White Resort Fashions, to Contrast With the Light of a Fiery Tropical Sun
description: The lacquered red walls of the new Krizia boutique on Bergdorf Goodman's third floor form a dramatic backdrop for the Italian company's creamy white collection of separates. They also provide an idea of how the white styles will look against the fiery southern sun. Cool'and collected.

title: Peru Is Buying Arms From Soviet
description: LIMA, Peru, Dec. 30 (Reuters)Peru's Air Force has bought equipment from the Soviet Union in what is believed to be the first arms deal of its kind in Latin America outside Cuba.

title: Campaign Financing Regulations Become Effective in Michigan
description: LANSING, Mich., Dec. 30 (AP)  A landmark bill to regulate campaign financing in Michigan became law yesterday.

title: Music: Master Eclectician Ifn the Kitchen
description: David Mahler's concert at the Kitchen on Wednesday kept one guessing through most of its duration. Mr. Mahler, who is music director of the and/orgallery in Seattle, ran the gamut from theatrical or performance pieces to piano solos to electronic music to folksonglike vocal compositions to unabashed countryandwestern and popular music.

title: News Summary
description: A court order released Santiago Carrillo, secretary general of Spain's Communist Party, his personal secretary and six members of the party's executive committee from a Madrid prison. They had been arrested earlier this month. All were released on bail. Soon after Mr. Carrillo was released, the Government announced that it was abolishing the special Court of Public Order that reviewed political cases. The Government also decreed that terrorism cases would no longer be considered by the Supreme Court of Military Justice but instead by ordinary civilian courts. [Page A1, Columns 12.]

title: Rampant Use of Firearms Is Problem in South Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG. Dec. 27 When a group of black street sweepers entered a downtown store here the other day soliciting a Christmas tip, the white owner pulled out a revolver and fired, wounding one in the leg. I was sure they had come in to rob me, said Samuel Shevak, proprietor of the Merrythought Gift Boutique.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Because of an error in editing, a Washington dispatch yesterday said that a dispute over contacts with the Palestine Liberation Organization had broken out among the leaders of American Jewish organizations. The article should have said that the dispute had arisen among some members of the American Jewish community. The accepted leaders of the community, who make up the Conference of Presidents of Major American Jewish Organizations, as cited in the body of the article, oppose contacts with the P.L.O.

title: ARMED FORCES WILL CURB UNDESIRABLE DISCHARGES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP)The armed forces will stop giving undesirable discharges to enlisted personnel dismissed for misconduct, security reasons or other causes, the Pentagon announced today.

title: Court to Use Credit Cards
description: ERIE, Pa., Dec. 30 (UPI)  Credit card machines are going to be installed early next year at the Clerk of Court's office in Erie County. People will be able to put court costs and fines on their credit card accounts if they have Bank Americard or Master Charge.

title: Text of Statement by Gov. Carey On Inquiries Into Attica Uprising
description: The Governor of the State of New York has the constitutional responsibility to take care that the laws are faithfully executed. That responsibility places a constitutional imperative upon the Governor to insure equal justice for all citizens of the state. No government can command the confidence and respect of its people without a firm commitment to the principle and practice of evenhanded justice.

title: Custer in the DockWhere the Witness Stand is the Last One
description: The game of what if is one of those parlor games historians play that never interested me. What if the South had won the war? What if the Visigoths had not sacked Rome? What if Marco Polo had brought egg rolls instead of pasta back to Italy would Sophia Loren be the fine figure of a woman she is today? The events served up by real history have a sufficiently weighty inevitability about them, like cold cuts in the college dining hall on Sunday nights; one finds it hard to imagine roast duck instead.

title: Opera: Leinsdorf Conducts Salome
description: THE EXCITEMENT in Wednesday night's performance of Salome at the Metropolitan Opera was mainly in the orchestra pit. Erich Leinsdorf, conducting with the company for the first time since 197374, unleashed all the power in the Richard Strauss score without sacrificing any of the meticulous control for which he is famous.

title: A Flower Calendar
description: Until you have completed your first year of plant records, this calendar should help you have timely flowers.

title: Brooklyn Women's Five Defeats Mercy by 7266
description: The Brooklyn College women's basketball team defeated Mercy College of Dobbs Ferry, 7266, yesterday at St. John's University gym, in the opening round of the Manufacturers Hanover tournament for New York State women's college teams. Brooklyn will next meet Queens College at the latter's court in a quarterfinal on Jan. 19.

title: Upsala [Sweden] 77, Hunter 70
description: Porbjorn Taxen, a member of the Swedish Olympic team, and Larry Robinson, a player at the University of Texas, combined for 40 points to lead Upsala of Sweden to a 7770 victory over Hunter College yesterday. The touring Swedish team broke to a 3721 halftime lead behind Taxen's 14 firsthalf points. But Hunter went on a 198 streak to start the second half and closed the score to 4540.

title: Ginffa Lee, a Sculptor, Diplomat And Poet, Dies in Long Island City
description: Ginffa Lee, a Chineseborn sculptor, poet and diplomat, died of a heart attack last Saturday in Boulevard Hospital, Long Island City, Queens.. He lived at 3220 41st Street in Long Island City and was 76 years old.

Dr. David Gottlieb, dean of the college of arts and sciqnces, said that each semesterlong course carries three hours of regular academic credit.

description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec. 30 (UPI)Rhodesia said today that it expected the chairman of the Geneva conference to present Prime Minister Ian D. Smith with a take itorleaveit proposal on black majority rule when the two men meet Saturday.

description: DETROIT, Dec. 30For a city that has been the victim of severe economic troubles in recent years, similar to those of New York City and other urban areas, Detroit is closing the year on a highly optimistic note.

title: Defect in Police Cars Feared
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (UPI)The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said today 1969 Ford and Mercury cars built for police use have a possible safety defect in the front wheel spindles. An agency hearing has been scheduled for Feb. 3 on the possible defect.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30Disgruntled city officials around the country are protesting the distribution of $2 billion in public works funds by the Commerce Department, and a move was begun today to soothe them with the prospect of additional funds.

description: All that agency and advertiser talk about finding alternative media to highpriced television is not just idle chatter.

title: World News Briefs
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 30 (AP)A wave of labor unrest was expected today after Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin's weakened Government failed to block legislation that would make arbitration compulsory in some strikes.

title: A Classic Cup for a Special Brew
description: When the intelligentsia of the day foregathered at the Caffe Greco in Rome in the early 1800's their steaming espresso was served in fine porcelain cups commissioned from the house of Ginori. Today the 225yearold factory at Sesto Fiorentino, Italy, is still turning out the elegant footed cups for the popular cafe on the Via Condotti and has added a dinner service to match.

description: Bassadors hotel. Team is staying at the hotel as it prepares for Orange Bowl. Yesterday, the Sheraton and Dupont Plaza were added to list of hotels being picketed.

description: The New York City Housing Authority and the union representing 5,500 of its employees reached agreement yesterday on a new twoyear labor contract, but the accord appears to violate the guidelines of the State Emergency Financial Control Board, which must approve it.

title: PROF. CAROLINE E. BOCK
description: Prof. Caroline E. Bock, retired chairman of the classics department at Montclair (N.J.) State College, died Wednesday at Mountainside Hospital in Montclair. She was 58 years old and resided in Montclair.

title: Allegiance to Britain Is Proposed To Speed Rhodesian Transition
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Dec. 30 (Reuters)Ivor Richard, chairman of the stalled conference on the future of Rhodesia, suggested today that the territory's blacks and whites swear allegiance to the British crown to insure a peaceful transfer to majority rule.

title: Doremus Issues Checklist To Aid Annual Reports
description: With the year end, corporation financial executives think in terms of the annual reportthose colorful descriptive publications covering company financial and operational activities. Stockholders and many of the nation's analysts find them useful.

title: Gold
description: Selected world gold prices Thursday. London: Morning fixing $134.65, up $.45 afternoon fixing $131.75, up $50.

title: NANTUCKET OIL SPIEL STIRS FEAR OF DELAY ON SALE OF LEASES
description: The 7.5milliongallon oil spill off Nantucket Island has raised fears among both industry and Government officials that the sale of oil leases in the same areanow scheduled for next May or Junemay be postponed because of environmental pressures.

title: Attica: Tragic Drama of Many Acts
description: The bloodiest episode in American prison history erupted on Sept. 9, 1971, when more than 1,000 inmates at Attica seized 43 hostages and the D yard of the correction facility and began a fourday siege of knifeedge tensions and negotiations that failed.

description: A court order released Santiago Carrillo, secretary general of Spain's Communist Party, his personal secretary and six members of the party's executive committee from a Madrid prison. They had been arrested earlier this month. All were released on bail. Soon after Mr. Carrillo was released, the Government announced that it was abolishing the special Court of Public Order that reviewed political cases. The Government also decreed that terrorism cases would no longer be considered by the Supreme Court of Military Justice but instead by ordinary civilian courts. [Page A1, Columns 12.]

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A Federal judge in Newark yesterday refused a request to delay distribution of $100 million in emergency publicworks money in New Jersey, but he agreed to hear arguments on it next month. The request vas made by Hudson County, which aid not get any of the Federal money a nd asserted that it deserved some.

title: WARNING ON SEALANT REVISED BY NEW YORK
description: The State Consumer Protection Board yesterday revised a warning it had issued 24 hours earlier on a silicone caulking sealing compound made by General Electric.

description: Article 5  No Title

title: Restaurants
description: HEN APPROACHING a restaurant that has La Grenouille's reputation as a meeting place for the fashionable and the famous, anyone with the slightest tendency toward skepticism might well be braced for disappointment. Can it really be what it is cracked up to be? Can an unknown diner expect to receive the same tender, loving care and impeccably prepared food as the illustrious regulars? After three recent visits, all with our incognito intact, as far as we could tell, it is pleasant to be able to end the year on a positive note and report that La Grenouille continues to maintain its high standards of service and food, the only real difference in the treatment accorded to the known and the unknown is the seating rangement. Unknowns sit in the big, relatively spacious back dining room. The faces you know you ()light to recognize appear in the front dining room, really somewhat like a narrow passageway that serves as an entrance to the larger back room. Although this front area is the more visible, it proved far less comfortable, precisely because it was smaller, more crowded and more hectically trafficked by waiters dashing from the front bar to the back room.

title: Municipal Employees Urge Banks To Cooperate on New York Notes
description: Municipal employee unions sought yesterday to break an impasse on the redemption of nearly $1 billion in New York City shortterm notes by challeng irig banks to follow their lead and accept a key part of the note payment plan now under discussion.

title: Stage: Technicolor Dreamcoat
description: EING WRONG is never funny. When I saw Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat in London a couple of years or so ago, I thought it was pretty good. Modestly good. Not incredible, but viable. Last night it came to the Brooklyn Academy of Music, where it is described as the new musical hit by Tim Rice and Andrew Lloyd Webber. Their last musical hit was Jesus Christ, Superstar. And probably enough has already been said. They are still, it will be noted, sticking with the Bible.

title: Foreign Policy
description: In the cram course on foreign affairs to which he subjected himself the past two or three years, former Governor Carter learned that the foundation of this country's international relationships lies in the firmness of association with our traditional allies of Western Europe, together with Canada and now, Japan. This in no sense means that there should be any weakening of efforts to achieve a realistic detente with the Soviet Union as symbolized by successful completion of the strategic arms limitation talks. This, in turn, could readily induce a practicable reduction in the swollen military budget that is already surfeited with several billion dollars worth of fat.

title: 100 Catholics With Disrupted Marriages at Jersey Mass
description: LINDEN, N.J., Dec. 30In a deviation from traditional church practice, more than a hundred divorced, separated or remarried Roman Catholics received Holy Communion tonight from Bishop Dominic A. Marconi of the Newark Archdiocese at a special mass for those whose marriages had been disrupted.

title: Companies Report Their Earnings
description: For periods ended November 30 unless otherwise indicated. (N) indlcates stock is traded on the New Ybrk Stock Exchange, (A) American Stock Exchange and (0) over the counter.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: An amateur sports car driver from Brooklyn who lost his left leg in an accident at a Long Island track 21 years ago, shot two alleged armed rcbbers with their own gun after he knocked it from the hand of one of them with one of his crutches.

title: Where to Go and Ring In The New
description: NETHER YOUR New Year's observance tonight is intended to be a celebration of your survival of 1976 or simply of the advent of your 1977, its a sure bet that you will mark the change of years in some fashion.

title: Berle Sure Lake Placid Will Succeed
description: WILMINGTON, N.Y., Dec. 30  New York State's Commissioner of Environmental Conservation, Peter A. A. Berle, said today that despite all rumors, he was positive the 1980 Olympic Winter Games, scheduled for Lake Placid. would be held. I see no reason why the competition will be put in jeopardy, said Berle, despite some of the problems presented by environmentalists. I see such protestations as healthy and I am certain that the Lake Placid organizing committee will be able to meet a construction schedule in keeping with the Olympic timetable.

title: Bids on New York Magazine Stock Laid to Murdoch, Washington Post
description: Rupert Murdoch, the Australian publisher, and the Washington Post Company were reported yesterday to be making competing bids for a sizable block of stock that could mean control of New York magazine and The Village Voice.

title: U.S. Investigating Shipments
description: The Justice Department has for five months been conducting a broad grand jury investigation into illegal shipments of arms and ammunition by United States manufacturers to South Africa.

title: Associated Press
description: A former mental patient, who was later shot and killed by police sharpshooters. At the time he was shot he was holding seven persons, some of whom had replaced the women and children as hostages earlier in the day.

title: School Football Grows Despite Cuts,Opposition
description: Despite cries that football at the interscholastic level is too dangerous and too expensive the sport shows the largest increase in participants over the last two years, according to a survey conducted by the National Federation of State High School Associations. The federation, which is made up of the state athletic associations of the 50 states and the District of Columbia also has released figures that show basketball the most popular boys and girls sport as far as schools sponsoring teams. The real surprise is that football appears to be overcoming obstacles to keep its place in scholastic athletic programs.

title: Madrid Frees Red Leader on Bail And  bolishes. FrancoEra Court
description: MADRID, Dec. 30Santiago Carrillo, the secretary, general of the Communist Party of Spain, emerged this afternoon from Carabanchel Prison on $4,400 bail, effectively gaining the right to reside legally in his own ciauntry.

title: Mills's Congressional Career Coming to a Quiet Conclusion
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Dec. 30 (UPI)The phone does not ring in the chairman's office in the Federal Building here any more. The typewriters are tent and the seats before them are empty.

title: Liberia's Park Avenue Ship Office Is Still Busy With Tanker Business
description: At the center of the controversy that has grown around the recent accidents resulting in oil spills by Liberian tankers is the office of the Liberian Deputy Commissioner of Maritime Affairs, at 103 Park Avenue.

title: WALLACE WERBLE SR.
description: Wallace Werble Sr., a newspaperman who founded FDC Reports, known nationally as the Pink Sheet, a weekly newsletter of the pharmaceutical industry, died Wednesday in his home in Bethesda, Md., of a cerebral hemorrhage. His age was 64.

title: For Marcia Lewis Big Is Beautiful
description: Marcia Lewis, a short, round woman who looks so much like a Muppet that she hopes to do a show as a member of Jim Henson's troupe, is back at Brothers and Sisters, 355 West 46th Street, this weekend (shows at 9:30 P.M. and 11:30 P.M. through Sunday) with the wild collection of talking and singing characters that she introduced there this month.

title: Mime: Chip Off Old Munk For the Young
description: A Chip off the Old Munk is an amusing children's entertainment that the Richard Morse Mime Theater is presenting through Sunday at St. John's Episcopal Church at 224 Waverly Place. Under its quietly friendly influence, the lion does not quite lie down with the lamb, but natural antagonists like the fisherman and the fish learn to live with each other.

title: Walton Hurt As Blazers Lose By 20
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 30 (AP)The Milwaukee Bucks parlayed scoring balance, led by Junior Bridgeman's 24 points, to their fifth National Basketball Association victory in six starts, 127107, over crippled Portland tonight.

title: While Guy Lombardo Rims Out the Old
description: As the glittering ball that signals the New Year starts sliding down the side of No. 1 Times Square tonight and the seconds until midnight are counted off, Guy Lombardo and his Royal Canadians will, for the 48th consecutive year, play out the old year and play in the new from coast to coast. Mr. Lombardo will be seen tonight on Channel 2 and the CBS television network as well as the entire Canadian Broadcasting Corporation network from 11:30 P.M. until 1 A.M. His band will be playing in the Grand Ballroom of the WaldorfAstoria Hotel to an audience that will pay up to $125 a person for dinners, balloons and noisemakersa far cry from the $15 a person charged in 1929, when Mr. Lombardo and his musicians sent their first New Year's Eve program out over the national airwaves from the Grill of the Roosevelt Hotel.

title: When the Fed is in the Counting House, Counting Up the Nation's Money (Supply)
description: Every Thursday afternoon at 4 o'clock, financial news wires flash the report: M1 is up $2 billion, Mis down $1 billion, M1 is unchanged. Bond dealers, who have been dawdling through the midafternoon, spring into action, making bond proces rise or fall. The next day the stock market may react. Congressmen become vexed when they think M1 is rising too slowly.

title: The Outlook on Solar Energy
description: An economic analysis finds that despite advances in technology and more Federal support, optimism among experts on the future role of solar energy is still restrained. Page D3.

title: Frank W. Jenks Dies in Florida; Headed International Harvester
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Dec. 30(UPI)Frank W. Jenks, former president of the International Harvester Company, died here Monday. He was 79 years old.

title: Carey Appoints Santucci as ueens District Attorney
description: Senator Santucci, who is 45 years old, succeeds District Attorney Nicholas Ferraro, who was elected to the State Supreme Court last month. Mr. Santucci is regarded as almost certain to be the Democratic candidate for a full fouryear term next November.

title: New York Sets Rules of House In Legal Games
description: The house rules in New York State for legally conducted games of chance for the benefit of religious, charitable and certain nonprofit organizations such as veterans groups were promulgated yesterday by the State Racing and Wagering Board.

title: 350 on Train Stranded Overnight By Cold and Wheel Problems
description: GALESBURG, Ill., Dec. 30 (UPI)Nearly 350 Amtrak passengers aboard the westbound San Francisco Zephyr were stranded overnight on a railroad siding because of frigid weather and flat spots on locomotive wheels, an Amtrak spokesman said today.

title: Memphis Slim Returns
description: In 1939, Peter Chatman, a lanky foot 4 inch blues pianist, composer and singer from Memphis, arrived in Chicago to break into the recording business. He had tried the same thing some years earlier, but bad luck and the lack of a winter coat forced him to hop freight back home. This time he had already made a successful record of Beer Drinking Woman, and he was on the verge of moving on to another record company that had made a better offer. But there was a legal problem arising from one company's poaching on another's talent.

title: The Donor, Too, Finds Joy in Gift To the Neediest
description: Peter M. Mott, a sophomore at Ursinus College in Collegeville, Pa., gave to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund for the first time this year.

title: Sadat Foresees Final Settlement Of the Mideast Conflict at Geneva
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 30President Anwar elSadat of Egypt was quoted here today as having said the Arabs were getting ready to go to the Middle East peace conference at Geneva for what he called the final settlement of the ArabIsraeli conflict.

title: In Memoriam
description: Fighting for every job. In 1965 we realized our victory had been undone and we were delighted to join in a fusion campaign to make John Lindsay mayor.

title: House Chiefs Plan Energy Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30Representative Jim Wright disclosed today that the House Democratic leadership hoped to create a special energy committee to draft a longrange, comprehensive program.

title: Broadway
description: IDDLER ON THE ROOF opened last Tuesday night, and while it was understood that the opening would belong to Zero Mostel, in a real way it belonged to Jerome Robbins, too. The new production of Fiddler faithfully reproduced Mr. Robbins's original direction and choreography, and this was a reminder that although Mr. Robbins now spends most of his time at the New York City Ballet, he is still Broadway's resident genius of the musical theater. Here is Mr. Robbins, talking about Fiddler, and about why he is not on Broadway more often:I saw this Fiddler in Boston, and I was very proud. It Ifas a subject that's very strong, that'swhat's the word?universal. Did you like the show? Did you like the script? The other shows that come along and are offered to me just aren't that good. I'm not against doing shows on Broadway. I'm a great fan of Chorus Line, for instance. But to do a show nowI'd have to inaugurate it myself.

title: Market Place
description: Options traders are wondering whether the recent gains in both stocks and options foretell a repeat of the vigorous stock markets of the last two Januaries.

title: Libya May Alter System of Rule and Name
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Dec. 30 (AP)Col, Muommar elQaddafi, the Libyan revolutionary leader, has announced plans for gatherings of people throughout the oilproducing desert country to decide whether to replace the form of government and to change the country's name, the official Libyan press agency said today.

title: Around the Nation
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 30 (AP) The United States Steel Corporation formally signed a $600million, sevenyear agreement today to eliminate pollution from its massive Clairton Coke Works. Representatives of Federal, state and local environmental agencies also signed the accord.

title: Peach Bowl Set for 2:30 Today
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 30The North Carolina Tar Heels, underdogs to Kentucky for tomorrow's Peach Bowl contest, say they are determined to prove those who call them the worst 92 team in major college football wrong. The Peach Bowl will be televised nationally, and can be viewed locally starting at 2:30 P.M. on Channel 11.

title: School Finance Law Upset in California; Spur to Reform Seen
description: The California Supreme Court ruled yesterday that the system of relying on local property wealth to finance public schools was unconstitutional because it results in unequal educational opportunities. The ruling provided the biggest boost so far to the movement to change the method by which most of the nation's public schools are supported.

title: The Decline Of Dogmatism
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30At the beginning of the New Year, maybe the most promising aspect of politics in Washington is the decline of dogmatism. It would be too much to say that everybody has suddenly acquired a chivalrous respect for the opinions of others, but almost everybody seems to be listening a little more and shouting less.

title: Antarctica: Glitter, Rays and Shifting Pole
description: SOUTH POLE STATION, AntarcticaThe most striking sight when one steps out of an aircraft here on a typically sunny day is not the endless white plain of the South Polar Plateau or the high, snowdusted dome covering the American outpost. It is the glitter of the air.

title: Article 12  No Title
description: Because of an error in editing, a Washington dispatch yesterday said that a dispute over contacts with the Palestine Liberation Organization had broken out among the leaders of American Jewish organizations. The article should have said that the dispute had arisen among some members of the American Jewish community. The accepted leaders of the community, who make up the Conference of Presidents of Major American Jewish Organizations, as cited in the body of the article, oppose contacts with the P.L.O.

title: Book Closed on Dispute Involving Crabiel
description: TRENTON, Dec. 30  The settlement this week of a civil suit against Secretary of State J. Edward Crabiel and others accused of a highway bidrigging conspiracy appears to write the final chapter to a controvery that has dogged the Byrne administration since it took office in 1974. Mr. Byrne, who ran for Governor on his image as a incorruptible county prosecutor and a judge, was in office only a month when reports of a twoyearold investigation into the highway conspiracy in North Jersey began to reach print.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Dec. 30David J. Bardin, the State Environmental Protection Commissioner, said today that his agency was proposing to expand antipollution regulations to include gasolinepowered trucks and buses.

title: 2 TOP NASSAU AIDES DISCHARGED BY CASO
description: MINEOLA, LI., Dec. 30Two top Nassau County officials were dismissed today by County Executive Ralph G. Caso as political rivalries intensified in the threeway race for the Republican nomination for the county's highest post.

title: A Modern Inquisition
description: Patty Hearst is out of prison and Phil Shinnick is in, and thereby hangs a tale of American justice.

title: Rededication to Freedom
description: What this means, further, is that wePresident, legislatures, courts and peopleneed to rededicate ourselves to the principles of human freedom and individual liberty, to equality of all persons before the law, to protection of weak from strong, to the continued development among ourselves of a social conscience, and to a broad toleration of the differences among us not only of race, creed and color, but also of personal mores and political beliefs. To this end, it is necessary to rebuild that spirit of mutual trust and confidence of Americans in each other and in themselves that has been so severely shaken during these past two decades of McCarthyism, of Vietnam, of Watergate and of the public and private lawbreaking, cynicism, suspicion and corruption that have pervaded too much of American society.

title: Kepone Worker Suits Are Settled Out of Court With Judge's Backing
description: RICHMOND, Va., Dec. 30 (UPI)A Federal district judge approved outofcourt settlements today in three suits brought by Hopewell chemical workers and their families who were sickened by the pesticide Kepone.

title: Prices to Farmers Up by 3% in Month, But 4% Below 75
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP)After declining in four of the five previous months, prices farmers get for raw products rose 3 percent between Nov. 15 and Dec. 15, the Agriculture Department said today.

Mitchell Dana; sound by Abe Jacob; original setting by Nadine Baylis; musical direction by Steve Margoshes. Presented by The Brooklyn Academy of Music. title: AstroBluebonnet Bowl Tonight
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 30 (AP)Texas Tech and Nebraska meet tomorrow night in the 18th annual AstroBluebonnet Bowl. Kickoff is at 7, central standard time, in the Astrodome.

title: Blizzards Strike Scotland
description: LONDON, Dec. 30 (UPI) The worst blizzards in years blocked roads with snowdrifts and caused dozens of traffic accidents today in parts of Scotland and northern England. No fatalities were reported. Scotland's main highways lirlkitig Perth and Inverness and Carlisle and Glasgow were closed for more than eight hours.

title: Duke 87, Rice 77

title: A New Beginning, A New Year
description: The election to the Presidency last month of an almost totally unknown newcomer to the national scene gives to the Administration that takes office on Jan. 20 an unprecedented opportunity both to unite the country and in John F. Kennedy's stillapplicable phrase, to get it moving again. Free of binding obligations to any specialinterest sector of American society, Presidentelect Carter, with the support of a friendly if quizzical Congress, can if he chooses provide the kind of highminded progressiveand pragmaticleadership whose promise won him the election. The American people yearn, we believe, for a President of moralbut not moralistic: conviction, and courageous  but not doctrinaireliberalism to set the tone of the nation's domestic as well as foreign policy for the next four or more years.

title: Artist Portrays All 56 Signers Of Declaration
description: TRENTON, Dec. 30About seven years ago, the portraitist Michael Werboff and a friend were discussing the nation's forthcoming Bicentennial. They agreed that the pictorial record of the signing of the Declaration of Independence and of the 56 men who had signed the document was woefully inadequate.

title: St. Francis (Pa.) 88. Iona 62
description: LORETTO, Pa., Dec. 30 (AP)Nick Leasure hit on 15 of 19 shots from the floor tonight to lead St. Francis to an 8862 victory over Iona. St. Francis scored on 66 percent of its fieldgoal attempts.

title: Troy Is Falling Again, This Time at La Mama
description: We are present at the fall of Troy, as witnesses and as helpless participants, swept up by the melee. The words are in a barrage of alien tongues ancient Greek, Latin, African and Asian dialects but the events, communicated through sound, action, emotion and music, are as close to us as contemporary wars. The director Andrei Serban, together with Elizabeth Swados as composer, has blasted his way into the heart of The Trojan Women.

title: Carter Is Seeking Ways to Keep in Touch With Public
description: PLAINS, Ga., Dec. 30Jimmy Carter believes it is unhealthy for a President to be isolated from the people and is seeking methods and ideas that will permit him to have facetoface meetings with more than columnists and bureaucrats, a spokesman indicated today.

And one of Britain's toughest union officials, the militant president of the powerful Boilermakers Union, is now Sir Daniel MeGarvey.

title: Weekend Gardening: Keeping Track
description: All right This time I'm going to keep it up the whole year. What I mean is that I will keep a green book, a plant record. For both indoor and outdoor gardening it's one of the most useful single tools the plant enthusiast has; it is also one of the least expensive and easiest to maintain. All it takes is a little willpower.

title: Pacers 104, Jazz 97
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 30 (AP)Danny Roundfield hit two straight baskets late in the fourth quarter tonight to snap a 9292 tie and send the Indiana Pacers on their way to a 10497 N.B.A. victory over the New Orleans Jazz at the Market Square Arena.

title: New Face: Delores Hall, Fervent Star
description: Every night at the Lyceum Theater a young woman called Delores Hall stops the show dead. Dead it is pretty lively dead, but it is dead. You hear about this on Broadway, but very rarely encounter it. A performer taking a show, twisting it around a little finger, smiling, and stopping. While the audience applauds. And applauds.

title: Yonkers Drivers
Store Sales Up in Week
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $2.809 billion, up 32 percent from the yearearlier $2.136 billion. Totai retail store sales were about $12.731 billion, up 8 percent from last year's $11.748 billion.

title: Robbery Victim Dies

The grocer was David Budovky, 57 years old, who was wounded in his store at 624 Wilson Avenue in the Bushwick section. He and his wife lived at 2775 East 65th Street in the Mill Basin lrea.

description: TOKYO, Dec. 30  Konosukai Hanawa and his son, Takeshi, are busy these chilly winter days, changing people's floors.

title: A Time for Decision
description: But the needs of the American people as they enter their third century under a new Administration go far beyond mere competence in government, though obviously that is something greatly to be desired. This country is beset by some very fundamental problems that have in no sense been dissipated by the end of the Vietnam nightmare, the exorcism of Watergate, the slowdown of inflation and the apparent beginnings of economic recovery.

title: Tropical Products Stirring Hopes Of Poor Nations for Export Rise
description: GENEVA, Dec. 30Developing countries hope to see their export earnings expand in the aftermath of the first concrete results achieved at the world trade talks since their formal launching by ministers in Tokyo in September 1973.

description: Commodity exchanges throughout hte nation will be closed today in observance of the New Year's holiday. However, United States securities markets will be open, as will most banks.

description: The Governor of the State of New York has the constitutional responsibility to take care that the laws are faithfully executed. That responsibility places a constitutional imperative upon the Governor to insure equal justice for all citizens of the state. No government can command the confidence and respect of its people without a firm commitment to the principle and practice of evenhanded iustice.

title: Cavaliers 105, Sonics 100
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 30 (AP)The Cleveland Cavaliers overcame a 42point performance by Fred Brown as they ended a threegame losing streak with a 105100 victory over the Seattle Suner Soncs tonight.

description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 30 (AP)Israeli's Foreign Minister, Yigal Allon, today welcomed a statement by President Sadat that a Palestinian state on the West Bank of the Jordan must be linked with Jordan.

description: Sears Roebuck and Company, the nation's largest retailer, said yesterday in Chicago that its December sales are running stronger than it had expected.

description: A former official of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, the world's largest brokerage firm, has been barred by the New York Stock Exchange from employment by any member organization for taking almost $6,000 from the Securities Industry Association.

title: Pitt and Georgia Still Expecting to Play
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 30The University of Pittsburgh's undefeated and untied football team would probably be playing in the Orange Bowl against Colorado Saturday night instead of in the Sugar Bowl against Georgia Saturday morning if Sugar Bowl officials had not come up with an additional $300,000 to increase the take from the game.

title: Spill Averted Near Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Dec. 30 (AP)A Liberian oil tanker that ran aground two days ago on the southern coast of Puerto Rico was refloated today, the Coast Guard said. No oil was spilled from the 735foot, 31,389ton Daphne, which hit soft coral Tuesday night near the entrance of Guayanilia Bay, the authorities said.

description: There are those for whom one page of Gertrude Stein is too much of a muchness, and there are those for whom 50 continuous hours of Gertrude Stein is a buoyant and rewarding event. That adageor at least its second half will be demonstrated today at the Paula Cooper Gallery, 155 Wooster Street (south of Houston Street), when the third annual marathon reading of Miss Stein's mammoth The Making of Americans begins at noon and continues into Sunday afternoon without interruption.

title: Books of The Times
description: N HIS EXCELLENT introduction to this long, important and rather depressing book, Charles S. Maier, an associate professor of history at Duke University, speaks of the scientists who went to Washington in the late 1950'sjust after Sputnik gave us a technological inferiority complexas averaging about 50 A SCIENTIST IN THE WHITE HOUSE. The Private Diary of President. Eisenhower's Special Assistant for Science and Technology. By George B. Kistiakowshy. Introduction by Charles S. Maier. 448 pages. Harvard University Press. $15. years of age and having moved beyond the traditionally brief decades as creative researchers to serve more as intermediaries and administrators. He continues: A certain camaraderie united many a common participation in the hermetic ambience of the Manhattan Project or the M.I.T. Radiation Laboratory, then service on one of the military summer studies.  If the Oppenheimer experience had deeply hurt many participants, they were still ready to presume that the alliance between their longterm research efforts and the aspirations of the United States as a world power was logical, defensible and meritorious.

title: Cause For Celebration

title: Copley Service Names Editor
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 30 (UPI)Charles Ohl has been named editor and general manager of Copley News Service. Effective Saturday; he will assume the duties of Lieut. Gen. Victor H. Krulahk, Helen K. Copley, board chairman of the news service, announced yesterday. Mr. Ohl, with United Press International in New York for eight years before joining CNS in 1965, was named editor of the news service last July after six years as executive news editor.

title: PRICES CONTINUE UP ON FIXED INCOMES
description: Prices of fixedincome securities continued higher in light trading yesterday as some institutions added to their portlotto positions. In the Government securities sector, prices edged upward following Wednesday's move by the Federal Reserve to inject permanent reserves into the banking system. A better tone also prevailed in the taxexempt market. One standout group here has been the bonds of the Municipal Acceptance Corporation. This reflected the statement earlier this week by Presidentelect Carter that he would work to kep New York City out of bankruptcy.

description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 27As Jimmy Carter prepares to take office, the middle East, more than any other region of the World, clamors for his attention. From the start, he will be under tremendous pressure to begin a major initiative.

title: Religious Services Gained Attendance In 76, Study Finds
description: For the first time in nearly 20 years, church and synagogue attendance went up in 1976. according to the Gallup Poll. At the same time, the Gallup organization indicated that the proportion of persons who believed religion was increasing its influence on American life tripled since 1970.

title: Solar Energy's Future: Optimism Is Restrained
description: Optimism among experts about the future role of solar energy is still restrained, despite costcutting advances in technology and sharply increased Federal Government support for work toward harnessing sunshine. Attacked as pessimistic by such critics as the Congressional Office of Technology Assessment, the United States Energy Research and Development Administration's plan for solar work, published in June 1975, predicts that various methods of tapping the sun's rays will contribute 6 percent of the nation's energy supply in the year 2000.

title: Rocking the New Year in at the Joffrey
description: Rocking the New Year in at the Joffrey

title: North Stars, on Late Goal, Tie the Canadiens, 5 to 5.
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 30 (AP)  Ernie Hicke's second goal of the game with 56 seconds left gave the Minnesota North Stars a 55 National Hockey League tic with the Montreal Canadiens tonight. The left wing's shot from 35 feet went between the legs of the Montreal netminder, Ken Dryden, den, giving the North Stars the tie in a game that Minnesota had led, 31, after two periods.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Thomas E. Mullaney
description: In the weeks immediately before new year, business, Government and other institutions customarily give considerable thought to resolutions and goals for the period ahead. This policysetting process is never easy, and it has been particularly difficult this time because of somewhat uncertain economic climate in the United States and in many other parts of the Western world and because there are so many unknowns in the program that Presidentelect Carter will offer the nation after his inauguration three weeks hence.

title: Justin Thannhauser Dead at 84; Dealer in Art's Modern Masters
description: GSTAAD, Switzerland, Dec. 30 (AP) Justin Thannhauser, a Germanborn United States art dealer whose landmark exhibitions spread the fame of modern masters such as Pablo Picasso, Edvard Munch and Paul Klee, died here last Sunday, a personal friend said today. He was 84 years old.

title: Tankers Use of Liberian Registry Aids Ship Concerns on Tax and Pay
description: BOSTON, Dec. 30In less than 30 years, the African nation of Liberia, which has no natural harbor, has become the possessor, on paper, of the largest merchant fleet in the world.

title: Political Leaders Pay Last Tribute In Eulogies at Services for Rose
description: Alex Rose, the Liberal Party leader who worked behind the scenes rather than at mass meetings, was given a final tribute 4 as a master politician at a mass gatherVk ing of 1,000 friends and colleagues yesterday.

title: School Results
description: GIRLS BASKETBALL

title: Attica: Tragic Drama of Many Acts
description: The bloodiest episode in American prison history erupted on Sept. 9, 1971, when more than 1,000 inmates at Attica seized 43 hostages and the D yard of the correction facility and began a fourday siege of knifecdge tensions and negotiations that failed.

title: Soybean Prices Stage Advance; Silver Steady
description: Soybean futures prices advanced on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday. There was no fresh news but the memory of the Department of Agriculture's statement about a poorer than expected Brazilian soybean crop lingered in traders minds. The revised estimate, released earlier in the week, led to a rally on Wednesday followed by some heavy selling of beans by farmers. The farmers had been holding beans for a futures contract price above the $7 a bushel level.

title: Grant for Canadian Studies
description: Columbia University has announced the receipt of a $236,000 grant from the William H. Donner Foundation to develop a Canadian studies program in the university's School of International Affairs. The university said the grant Would make possible new courses for both graduate and undergraduate students in history and the social sciences focusing on Canada.

title: WRIGHT SAYS ACCORD ON WORKS IS REACHED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30The Demo cratic leadership of the }louse of Representatives and Presidentelect Carter have agreed that an additional public works program costing $2 billion to $4 billion should be part of the new program to stimulate the economy, according to Representative Jim Wright of Texas.

title: Women's Tennis Faces Challenge By Transsexuals
description: MIAMI, Dec. 30Michelle Nordberg, a 28yearold transsexual said today that she would try out for the women's tennis team at the University of Utah next week.

title: Madrid Frees Red Leader on Bail And Abolishes FrancoEra Court.
description: MADRID, Dec. 30Santiago Carrillo, the secretary general of the Communist Party of Spain, emerged this afternoon from Carabanchel Prison on $4,400 bail, effectively gaining the right to reside legally in his own country.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: My husband and I will be legally separated in two weeks, the middleaged woman exultantly told a visitor as, her 10yearold son listened. Oh, it's something I've wanted for so long.

title: Music: Don Tabor at the Drake
description: Bobby Short has created such compelling image as a supper club singer and pianist that few performers in that category can avoid being drawn into some aspect of the Short approach. But Don Tabor, who is singing and playing piano in the After Ten Room of the Drake Hotel, 56th Street at Park Avenue, has managed to avoid almost all comparisons with Mr. Short, aside from what must be a universal tendency to press harder when the room becomes noisy.

title: Prices of Commodity Futures
description: GRAINS & FEEDS

title: Letters to the Editor
description: From what one reads in the newspapers, Presidentelect Carter is fathoming some simple, blanket, acrosstheboard prescription to be applicable to all those involved in the amnesty problem. This would, of course, be a facile way for Mr. Carter to dispose of a thorny enigma, but the difficulty is that the reasons and the motives which caused or prompted the failures to serve were so many, and so diverse, that the cases are not all,. or even in the main, susceptible of omnibus treatment. For example: Is the man who ran away only because he was too cowardly to serve, or because he would find it more profitable, financially, to sneak off than to serve, to be treated in the same way as the man who would not serve because of conscience, or religious scruples honestly and sincerely held? Between these two extremes there were myriad other reasons and motivessome good, some bad, some debatable, some not. Are they all to be treated alike by an omnibus prescription applicable to everyone?

title: Purdue Takes Garden Final From Manhattan Five, 7060
description: The Manhattan Jaspers, pleased to find themselves in the final of the Holiday Festival, gave the Boilermakers of Purdue all they could handle for 20 minutes last night at Madison Square Garden. Then, an 185 burst by Purdue in the first 7 minutes of the second half lifted the Boilermakers to 7060 triumph in the tournament sponsored by the Eastern College Athletic Conference.

title: Panel Warns Industries
description: TRENTON, Dec. 30A New Jersey State Senate committee recommended today that the Legislature ban 16 cancercausing chemicals from the state as part of a farreaching program to cut the high rate of cancer in the state. It also urged a 1cent increase n the cigarette tax to finance prevention efforts.

title: Gregory Hornig Marries Miss Goddard in Florida
description: Elizabeth Goddard, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ned Goddard of West Palm Beach, Fla., was married yesterday to Gregory W. Hornig, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ernest Hornig of Ridgewood, N.J. The ceremony was performed in the nondenominational Royal Ponciana Chapel in Palm Beach, Fla., by the Rev. Dr. Samuel Lindsay.

title: Cynthia Simpson is a Bride
description: The marriage of Cynthia Maurine Simpson, a musicalcomedy actress, to Richard Anthony Hayes, assistant banquet manager of the New York Hilton took place yesterday in the chapel of the Central Presbyterian Church in Summit, N. I. The Rev. Robert T. Kelsty performed the ceremony. The bride's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Charles Hammond Simpson of Summit. Mr. Hayes is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Hartkoff Hayes Jr., also of Summit.

title: Laser Weapon Development Described
description: LONDON, Dec. 30 (Reuters)In a section of Jane's Weapon Systems dealing with naval weapons, Captain G. R, Villar, a former director of British naval intelligence, says that it is quite possible that missiles will be developed for firing from shore against ships hundreds or thousands of miles away which have been detected and identified by satellite.

title: Vietnamese at U.N. Denies Allegations On Human Rights
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 30Vietnam's chief spokesman here protested today that his Government had been falsely accused of detaining 200,000 to 300,000 people because of religious or political convictions and called the charges groundless accusations.

title: Money Supply Rose $700 Million In Week of Dec. 22 After a Decline
description: The nation's basic money supply rose a seasonally adjusted average of $700 million, to $311.8 billion, in the week ended Dec. 22, in contrast to a decline of $100 million the week before, according to figures furnished by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York yesterday.

title: Big Board Seat Up $5,000
description: A membership seat on the New York Stock Exchange was sold yesterday for $80,000, up $5,000 from the previous sale of Wednesday, the exchange reported.

title: TV Bowl Fans Await Kickoffs
description: Until television came along. Carl Haverlin used to drive to Pasadena from the San Fernando Valley each year for the Rose Bowl game. Now he watches it at home, along with 73 million other Americans, settling in also for the Cotton, Sugar and Orange. Bowl collegiate football games deliyeredelectronically on New Year's Day..1

title: U.S. to Seek Indictment in Delaware River Oil Spill
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 30  United States Attorhey David W. Marston said today that he would seek the indictment next week of Capt. Vasilios Vlismas of the tanker Olympic Games on Federal charges of polluting the Delaware River. Mr. Marston said he would also sue the owner of the Liberianflag vessel.

title: CHRONIC CREDIT CRISES ARE SAID TO FACE ALBANY
description: State Comptroller Arthur Levitt warned yesterday that the state would be vulnerable to recurring credit crises as Jong as it had to borrow most of the money it channeled to local govermtents every year. He urged a major effort to rearrange the state budget so that money was spent as it was received from thetaxpayers, instead of months in advance.

title: Shutdown Is Threatened
description: A Federal judge has barred the operation of an incinerator on Long Island, whenever the wind blows from the east, to prevent pollutants from moving into populated areas of Queens and Westchester.

title: Innauer Wins First of 4 Hills Ski Jumps
description: OBERSTDORF, West Germany, Dec. 30 (AP)Toni Innauer, an 18yearold Austrian ski jumper, won the opening event today of the GermanAustrian Four Hills tournament with 255.6 points. Jochen Danneberg of East Germany, last year's overall winner, was second with 253.7.

title: Antiques
description: N WESTERN culture, keys but not locks have always had great significance. References abound from Shakespeare to Dickens's Scrooge; and then there is the practice of presenting keys of the city to honored guests. In the middle East, however, locksnot keysare potent with meaning.

title: Students Surpass 10 Psychics in a Test on Predictions
description: Ten Harvard undergraduates, cooperating in a test of psychic powers to tell the future, did slightly better than 10 nationally prominent psychics whose predictions were published in The National Enquirer.

title: Jane's Says Soviet May Be Matching Tomahawk, Advanced U.S. Missile
description: LONDON, Dec. 30 (AP)The 1977 edition of Jane's Weapon Systems says that the Soviet Union may have a missile to match the United States Navy's Tomahawk, which the Russians have said threatens the international balance in longrange missiles.

title: RADIO
description: 69 A.M WNCNFM, Acis and Galatea Overture, Haydn; Perpetu.um mobile, Strauss; Sinfonia in D, Portugal; Slavonic Dance, Dvorak; Eja Mater from Stabat Mater, Boccherini; Rondeau, Schilbert; Troika from Lt. Kije, Psokofiev, Violin Sonata in A, Handel; Lobet den Herrn, Bach. 7:308:55, WNYCFM. Airs for Trffmpets, Drums and Oboes, Lully; Sonata for Strings, Albinoni; Preludes and Fugues Nos. 1316, Book 11, Bach; Chaconne, Vitali; Nocturne in G. Haydn; Xert ttre to a Picaresque Come 9:0610, WQXR: Plano Personalities. Rondo in A minor, Mozart; Four Mazurkas, Szymanowski. 10.11, WNCNFM. Variations on Bach's Weinen, Klagen, Liszt; 10106Noon, WQXR: The Listening Room. Robert Sherman, host. (Live).AmorningofNewYear'sVisit with My Fair Lady Guests: Christine Andreas, lan Richardson, George Rose and Herman Levin.

title: Art People
description: T'S NOT EVERY DAY that a dissident Soviet artist arrives to roost in SoHo, but Ernst Neizvestny, the sculptor who made it out of Rassia last March after some 50 tries for an exit visa, has acquired a studio at 78 Grand Street.

title: Events and Openings
description: Friday

title: European Masters, A Show and an Era
description: FOR WELL OVER a quarter of a century, one of the special pleasures of the New York art scene has been the seasonal survey of modern European masters at the Sidney Janis Gallery. These exhibitions have been distinguished by the exceptional quality of the works displayed. Their focus of interest is not only on the greatest names associated with the modern movement  though great names always abound in thembut also on particular paintings and sculptures, drawings and collages that represent these classic artists in moments of glory.

title: Irish Bow to Kentucky for First Loss
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.,. Dec. 30 (AP)Kentucky's basketball team knocked secondranked Notre Dame from the ranks of the unbeaten tonight, 10278, behind brilliant shooting performances by Jack Givens and Rick Robey.

title: Disruption in Honan Alleged
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 30 (Reuters)The official Chinese press agency, Hsinhua, accused the gang of four today of creating disturbances in the central province of Honan. Quoting a delegate from Honan to a national agricultural conference, it said they had attempted to cause agricultural sabotage.

title: 5Day Paris Trip Listed For Museum Opening
description: The latest date for the art world event of the year, the opening of the Centre Beaubourg in Paris officially known as the Centre Georges Pompjdou and Musee d'Art Moderne), is Jan, 31 for the occasion, a special fiveday trip, is planned by Experiments in Art and Technology, a New Yorkbased nonprofit group that promotes the mating of art and sciences.

title: French Left Jockeys for Position I In Municipal Elections in Spring
description: PARIS, Dec. 29The alliance between French Socialists and Communists, the base on which the two parties hope to win power in 1978, is being strained by efforts to prepare for municipal elections next sorine.

title: Guggenheim Raises Admission to $1.50
description: The admission charge to the Guggenheim Museum, Fifth Avenue and 89th Street, will go up from $1 to $1.50 tomorrow. The step was taken Guggenheim officials say, out of growing concern over mounting annual deficits. They point out this is only the second price increase since the museum was opened in 1959 (with an admission charge of 50 cents).

title: Rgcord Grain Crop Reported by Peking; No Figures Given
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 30China reported today that its 1976 grain harvest set a record, with a majority of provinces equaling or surpassing last year's totals.

title: Bridge:
description: In North America, the introduction of transfer bids at the level of two in responding to one notrump is rightly credited to Oswald Jacoby. But they were independently devised in Sweden at about the same time, and are extensively used there.

title: Soviet Launches Interceptor
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP)The Russians have staged their fourth test of a satellite interceptor this year but it tentatively is being classified as a failure by United States intelligence sources.

title: Vance Hears South Africa's Views In Meeting With Its Ambassador
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30Cyrus R. Vance conferred with Ambassador R. F. Botha of South Africa today, his first publicly announced meeting with a foreign envoy since being designated as Secretary of State.

title: Two Taxi Fleets to Cease Operations
description: Two of New York City's taxicab fleets disclosed yesterday that they were ceasing operations and two other fleets reported that they were sharply reducing the number of cabs that they would operate.

title: Accounting Proposal Ends BankWritedown Specter
description: The Financial Accounting Standards Board yesterday lifted the specter of multibilliondollar writedowns by the nation's banks by proposing a conventional and relatively mild accounting treatment for the restructuring of troubled loans.
